description_en: Lie down on the floor placing your feet flat on the ground with your knees bent. Place your hands behind your head slightly above your neck. Lift your upper body keeping your neck in straight line with your spine. Lower yourself back down to the starting position. Repeat this movement for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground. Place your hands behind your head without clasping them together, elbows out to the sides. Engage your abdominal muscles and lift your upper body towards your knees, maintain a constant tension in your abs. Stop at approximately three-quarters of your maximal inclination. Slowly return to start position, without releasing your abdominal tension.

Start in a plank position with your palms under your shoulders Lift your right leg off the floor Lower your body to the floor while keeping your elbows close to your body Press back up to plank position Repeat with the left leg off the floor

Begin on all fours with your palms directly under your shoulders and knees under your hips. Lift your right leg towards the ceiling, keeping it bent at a 90 degree angle. Keep your head down with your eyes focusing on the ground to maintain balance. Return to the initial position and repeat the process with your left leg. Alternate the leg for the desired number of repetitions.

Find a clear space and stand in a ready position Hop in one direction, then the other two forming a triangle Control your landing by bending your knees and engaging your core Once landed, immediately hop again to start your next point Repeat this for your set number of repetitions

Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointed outwards Lower your body by bending knees and pushing hips back Hold the squat position for 3 seconds Push your body back up to the starting position Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps

Lie flat on your back with your hands behind your head Lift your upper body and draw one knee to the opposite elbow Lower your upper body and straighten your leg in one fluid motion Repeat on the other side Alternate sides with each repetition

Lie flat on your back with your hands behind your head Lift your legs at a 45 degree angle Simultaneously twist your upper body to one side while pulling the opposite knee in towards your chest Lower back down and repeat with the other side Continue this alternating pattern for the duration of your set

Start by kneeling on the floor or mat Lower your upper body while keeping a 45-degree bend at the waist Raise your upper body back to the starting position by squeezing your glutes Hold this position for a couple of seconds Repeat the exercise aligning it with your workout routine

Stand on a hyperextension bench with the pad adjusted to fit your hips. Ensure your feet are firmly secured, heels against the plate. Cross your arms over your chest and slightly bend your knees. Bend forward at the hips, lowering your upper body until it's nearly perpendicular to the floor. Begin to raise your torso, keeping your back flat, until your body is back at 45 degrees. Repeat these steps for the prescribed number of repetitions.

Fix your feet to the footrests and press your thighs against the padded platform. Place your arms across your chest and lean forward. Raise yourself by leaning backward and forming an upright position. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Position yourself on the hyperextension bench with your waist on the pad and your feet securely on the foot platform Cross your arms in front of your chest Bend at the waist until your upper body is roughly at a 45-degree angle Raise your upper body until it's in line with your lower body Repeat for the desired number of reps

Position yourself on a hyperextension bench with your pelvis against the pad Your legs should be straight, and your body should form a 45-degree angle with the floor Cross your arms in front of your chest Bend at your waist while keeping your back straight until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings Return to the starting position by contracting your glutes and hamstrings

Place your feet one after the other onto the footrests and support your thigh against the platform. Place your hands behind your head and assume an upright position with a straight back. Crunch your torso toward the platform and then to the other side. Repeat while keeping yourself stable.

Stand tall with your feet shoulder width apart Lean your torso to one side, trying to reach your hand towards the same side foot Return to the starting position Repeat the movement on the other side Complete the desired number of repetitions on each side

Lie face down on a bench, with your waist at the end of the bench Extend your legs so that they are angled about 45 degrees to the floor Lower your legs slowly and maintain control Lift your legs back to the starting position Repeat this for your desired number of repetitions

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Place your hands on your hips Tilt your upper body to one side at a 45-degree angle, keeping your chest facing forward Return to the center position Repeat on the other side

Position yourself on a hyperextension bench, making sure one leg is securely positioned and the other one is hanging off the side Lower your free leg as far down as you can without causing discomfort Raise your free leg as high as you can while maintaining good form Lower your leg back down in a controlled fashion Switch legs and repeat the movement

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Step out at a 45-degree angle with your right foot and lower your body into a lunge Return to your original position Repeat the movement with your left foot Continue to alternate sides for a set amount of time

Fix your feet to the footrests and press your thighs against the padded platform. Place your hands behind your head and lean forward. Raise yourself by leaning backward and twisting your torso to a side. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Position your hips and legs on a hyperextension bench, feet firmly on the steps Cross your arms in front of you or hold your hands at either side of your head Bend forward at the hips while rotating your upper body towards one side Slowly raise your body as far as you comfortably can until you're nearly standing Repeat with your body rotating towards the opposite side

Start by positioning yourself on the hyperextension bench with your hips aligned to the edge of the bench Keep your body straight and bend down at a 45 degree angle Twist your upper body to the left, then right, while maintaining the bend Use your lower back, glutes, and hamstring muscles to pull your body back up Repeat the motion for your desired amount of repetitions

Start by standing upright and imagine the floor as a square Step sideways to the right corner of the square using your right foot Follow it with your left foot, maintaining a squat-like position Repeat the steps moving to the left

Start by standing upright with your feet shoulder-width apart. Step your right leg diagonally behind you and to the left, so your thighs cross, bending both knees as if you were curtsying. Return to the starting position and repeat the move on the opposite side. Do this movement in all four directions. Continue alternating between all corners for chosen set of reps

Stand straight, feet hip-width apart, hands in a boxing stance Perform a side squat to your right, simultaneously throw four punches in front Return to the starting position Repeat the same on your left side Alternate between the sides for the desired reps

Stand straight with your feet hip width apart Step back with your right foot, dropping your knee toward the floor while keeping your left knee over your left ankle Push off with your right foot to bring yourself back to the starting position Repeat with the left foot then perform 4 side taps alternately right and left Repeat the sequence alternating the starting foot
Make a fist and hold it against your chin Push your chin into your fist without allowing your head to move Hold this position for 5 seconds Relax and then repeat the exercise

Lie down on your back with your hips and knees bent to 90 degrees and your arms extended overhead. Raise your upper back and bring your arms forward to touch your heels. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie down on your back with your feet flat and knees at a 90 degree angle Keep your arms by your side with palms facing the floor Crunch up and touch your right heel with your right hand, then return to starting position Repeat on the left side with your left hand to your left heel Alternate between both sides for the desired amount of reps

Start lying on your back with your legs raised and knees bent at a 90-degree angle. Place your arms at your sides, then crunch up and touch your right heel with your right hand. Alternate and touch your left heel with your left hand. Keep going, taking turns to touch each heel. Make sure your movements are controlled and not too fast.

Start by lying on your back with your feet flat on the ground and your arms extended to your sides. Raise your upper body just slightly off the ground. Now twist your torso and try to touch your right heel with your right hand, and then your left heel with your left hand. Repeat this motion alternating between the right and left sides.

Stand with your back against a wall Raise your feet and touch your heels to the wall at a 90-degree angle Hold this position while engaging your abdominals Lower your legs without touching the ground Repeat this movement

Lie on your back with one knee bent, and the other leg extended straight in the air Place your hands gently behind your ears Crunch up, lifting both your shoulder blades and the extended leg off the ground Lower yourself back down in a controlled fashion Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch legs

Find a clear open space and lie down on your back. Bend your knees to raise the feet off the ground and create a 90 degree angle with your hips and knees. Maintain this position and thrust one knee towards your chest without moving the other. Switch and repeat with the other knee. Continue to alternate in a controlled manner.

Start by lying flat on your back with your legs up, bent at a 90 degree angle Rotate your hips to one side until your knees touch the ground, keep your shoulders on the ground Hold this position for about 2 seconds Rotate your hips back to the starting position Repeat the steps on the opposite side

Lie down on the floor with your arms extended out to your sides at shoulder height. Bend your knees and hips at a 90-degree angle. Slowly rotate your hips to one side, dropping your knees to the floor. Hold the stretch for a few seconds. Repeat on the other side.

Sit on the ground with one leg bent in front of you at a 90-degree angle and the other bent behind you in the same angle Keeping your chest upright, push your front knee down towards the ground Hold the stretch for 30 seconds to a minute Repeat the stretch on the other side

Lie on your back with knees slightly bent, feet placed on the ground and arms raised to the shoulder height. Squeeze your abdominals and lift your upper back off the ground, reaching forward with your arms Hold for few seconds and slowly return to the starting position.

Sit on a crunch machine with your lower back supported and feet fixed. With your arms bent, grab the handles of the machine behind you. Inhale and move your elbows and knees towards each other Exhale and return to the starting position slowly.

Lie on your back with knees slightly bent and feet placed on the ground. Inhale and try reaching forward with straight arms while lifting your upper back off the ground. Hold the end position for few seconds and slowly return to the starting position.

Sit down on your hips with your back straight, your knee bent, and your feet on the floor. Clasp your hands around your knees and press your chest against the thighs to stretch your abdominals. Hold this stretch for a while then relax.

Stand upright and keep your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms above your head Lean to one side while keeping your hips stationary Hold the stretch for about 20-30 seconds Repeat the stretch on the other side

name_en: Abduction Of One Leg Flexion Stretch
description_en: Stand upright with feet together. Extend one leg to the side while keeping your other foot firmly planted. Keep your back straight and bend at the waist toward the extended leg. Reach your hands toward your extended foot. Hold the stretch for 10-30 seconds and then repeat with the other leg.

Lie down on the mat with knees bent and feet firmly on the ground Place your hands behind your head or across your chest Curl your body up to your knees using your abdominal muscles Hold for a moment and slowly return back to starting position

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Bring your index fingers and thumbs together over your head while bending your arms. Open your elbows and take them back to put a stretch on your chest. Hold for some seconds and relax.

Stand or sit upright, extend your arms above your head Clasp your hands together Gently push your hands upward, stretching your chest and arm muscles Hold this position for 15-30 seconds Release and repeat

Stand up tall and interlock your fingers behind your head Gently push your elbows back as far as is comfortable Hold the stretch for 15 to 30 seconds Relax and return to the starting position Repeat 3-5 times

Kneel on the floor and hold the Ab Roller with both hands. While keeping your back straight and your abs tight, push the roller forward until your body is in a straight line. Hold this position for a moment and then slowly roll back to your starting position. The movements should be controlled, not using momentum but the strength of your abdominals. Perform the desired number of repetitions.

Begin in a seated position on the floor, legs extended out, and hands on the floor behind you for support Bring your knees into your chest, leaning slightly back as you do so Tighten your abs and hold this position for a couple of seconds Slowly return to the starting position, keeping your abs tight Repeat the exercise for the number of sets and reps you're aiming for

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Spread your arms wide at shoulder level with your palms forward. Take your arm towards the opposite shoulder without bending it and stretch it with your other hand. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Extend your right arm straight out in front of you Bring your right arm across your body Hold your right arm gently with your left hand just above the elbow Pull your right arm towards your chest and hold for a few seconds Repeat the steps with your left arm
Lie down on your back and raise your legs straight up to your maximum range. Keep your arms resting by your sides and open your legs wide apart. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Begin standing straight with feet hip-width apart Slowly widen your stance, while keeping your toes pointed forward Gently push your hips back and lean towards one side until you feel a stretch in your adductors Hold for 20-30 seconds Repeat for the other side

Stand tall with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart Bend your left knee slightly and shift your weight to the left side Keep your right leg straight and toes pointed forward You should feel a stretch in the inside of your right thigh Hold for 20-30 seconds then switch sides

Stand upright with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart Keep one leg straight while bending the other, shifting your weight onto that side Lean over to the bent leg side while keeping your back straight Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds Switch sides and repeat the same steps

Lie down on your back with your arms resting on the floor by your side. Raise your legs straight in the air making a 90-degree angle with your torso. Open your legs apart to your maximum range. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Stand with your feet wide apart, pointing straight ahead. Lean to one side, bending the corresponding knee while keeping the other leg straight. Hold this position for 20-30 seconds, feeling a stretch in your inner thigh of the straight leg. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side. Perform 2-3 sets per side.
Stand with feet wide apart Bend your right knee pushing your hip to the right Feel the stretch in your left inner thigh Hold for 30 seconds Repeat on the other side

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart while keeping your hands together in front of your chest. Take a step to the left while keeping your right foot in place. Bend the left knee unless your right thigh becomes parallel to the floor. Hold for a few seconds, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie flat on the floor with your lower back pressed to the ground. Place your hands behind your head. Do not use your hands for lifting your head. Elevate your legs at a 90-degree angle and move your legs as if you are pedalling a bicycle. Elbow should come to the opposite knee by lifting your shoulder and upper back. Alternate between the right and left sides in a pedalling motion.

Lie flat on the floor with your lower back pressed to the ground Place your hands lightly on either side of your head Lift your knees to about a 45-degree angle Slowly go through a bicycle pedal motion, elbow to opposite knee Rotate your torso so you can touch your elbow to the opposite knee, as your legs pedal.

Lie down on your back with your hips and knees bent to 90 degrees and your arms extended overhead. Place your hands behind your head and bring one knee and opposite elbow towards each other. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat by switching sides.

Sit on the edge of a sturdy chair, hands beside your hips Lean backwards slightly while lifting both your feet off the ground Start cycling in the air by extending one leg out while bringing the other one towards your chest and alternate Increase the pace for a more challenging workout Remember to engage your core throughout

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Make fists of your hands, fold one arm at your side and extend the other arm overhead. Raise one of your thighs while bending your knee, and lower your arm while extending the other arm overhead. Return to the initial position and repeat by raising your other thigh.

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Raise your fists at shoulder level Begin to march in place and simultaneously throw punches in the air Switch hands and maintain a brisk pace for the desired time Keep your movements quick and light

Lie down on your back with your knees bent and heels on the floor. Place your hands behind your head. Raise your chest and twist your torso to one side while bringing the opposite knee close. Return to the initial position and repeat by twisting towards the other side.

Lie on your back with your knees bent and hands behind your head Lift your shoulder blades off the ground and twist your body to one side Return to the center and twist to the other side Lower your shoulder blades back to the ground Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Start by lying on your back with your legs bent at the knees. Lift up your head and shoulders off the ground while turning your torso to one side. Twist your torso and bring your opposite elbow towards your opposite knee. Lower your body and twist to the other side to complete one rep. Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions.

Lie flat on the floor with your lower back pressed to the ground. Place your hands beside your head. Lift your shoulders into a crunch position while twisting your torso from side to side. Continue this alternating twisting movement for the desired amount of repetitions. Lower yourself back down to the starting position.

Get down on all fours and straighten your back. Keep your arms under the shoulders and your hips above your knees. Raise one of your knees, grab the raised foot with your corresponding hand, and pull it. Hold the stretch for a few seconds, return to the initial position and repeat.

Start on your hands and knees in a tabletop position Lift your hips, arch your back and look upwards, feeling a stretch through your quad muscles Hold the stretch for a count of 15-30 seconds Lower your body back to the tabletop position Repeat for 3-5 rounds

Start on your hands and knees in a tabletop position Shift your hips back towards your heels, keeping knees wide apart Extend your arms forward on the floor, palms facing down Hold this stretch for about 20-30 seconds Return to the starting position and repeat

Get down to floor on your palms  and toes with your arms, legs and back straight. Maintain a stable position and raise one of your arms forward and lift the opposite leg in the air simultaneously. Hold for few seconds and return to the initial position. Perform the same exercise with opposite arm and hand.

name_en: Alternate arm leg plank rest pause
description_en: Get down to floor on your elbows and toes while keeping your back and legs straight Maintain a stable position and raise one of your arms forward and lift the opposite leg in the air simultaneously. Return to the initial position and repeat the same with the opposite arm and leg.

Lie flat on your back with your hands by your sides Raise your legs off the ground, bending them 45 degrees at the knees Hold for a moment before lowering your legs Switch to the other leg and repeat Do this alternately for a set number of repetitions

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, a resistance band underneath your feet, and arms by your sides Grab the ends of band in your hands and bend your one elbow, moving the band towards your shoulder. Take your hand back to the initial position while straightening your arm and repeat the same with your opposite hand.

Get on all fours with your knees hip-width apart Keep your right knee at a 90-degree angle as you slowly raise your leg behind you until your thigh is almost parallel with the floor. Pulse your flexed foot toward the ceiling by squeezing your glutes. Slowly lower your leg back down to the starting position. Repeat with the other leg.

Lie flat on your back with your arms extended by your sides Bring one knee and the opposite elbow together with a crunch, flexing the abs Lower back to the starting position Repeat with the other knee and elbow Continue alternating sides for the duration of your set

Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart Lift one knee to your waist level and kick forward Lower your leg back to the initial position Repeat the same with your other leg Continue the same alternate kicking

name_en: Alternate Front Kick in Place with Arm Circles
description_en: Start by standing straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend one leg straight out in front of you while keeping your other foot firm on the ground Simultaneously perform arm circles with both hands Return your leg to the starting position and then repeat the same motion with your other leg Keep alternating the motion with both legs

Sit on a bench with your back straight, arms hanging by sides, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Hold the dumbbells in your hands with your palms facing inward. Raise one of the dumbbells towards the shoulder by folding your arm. As it reaches near the shoulder, return to the initial position and repeat by folding your other arm.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the dumbbells near the thighs with straight arms and your palms facing inward. Raise one of the dumbbells towards the shoulder by folding your arm. As it reaches near the shoulder, return to the initial position and repeat by folding the other arm.

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and your arms on your sides Lift your head and shoulders slightly off the ground Reach your right hand to the right heel and then return Repeat the same for the left heel Alternate between both sides, acting as if you're touching your ankles with each reach

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet on the ground Raise your head and shoulders off the ground slightly while keeping back in contact with the floor Extend your right arm and move it towards your right heel Return to the starting position and then extend your left arm towards your left heel Continue to alternate right and left

Lie down on your back with your arms resting by your side, knees bent, feet on the floor. Raise your torso slightly off the floor and try to touch one of your heels with your hand. Return to the initial position and touch the other heel with the opposite hand.

name_en: Alternate Heel Touch Side Kick Squat
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight, arms by your side, and feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your hips by bending one of your knees while sliding the opposite leg outward on the floor, and grab your heel with your hands. Return to the initial position, and do the same while bending your other knee and sliding the opposite leg.

name_en: Alternate Heel Touch Side Kick Squat
description_en: Stand with your feet hip-width apart, hands on hips Perform a squat by bending your hips and knees until your thighs are parallel to the floor Stand up and kick your right leg out to the side, reaching your left hand to touch your right heel Return to your standing position Repeat the movements, alternating sides each time

name_en: Alternate Heel Touch Side Kick Squat
description_en: Start by standing straight with your feet shoulder-width apart. Squat down while simultaneously performing a side kick with one leg. Return to the original position and touch your heel with the opposite hand. Repeat the movement with the opposite leg and alternate each side.

Lie down on your back with your arms resting on the floor by your side. Raise your legs off the floor making a 45-degree angle with your torso. Raise your upper back off the floor, extend your arms forward and bring one of your knees towards your chest. Return to the initial position, and do the same with your other knee.

Lie on your back with your legs extended and your hands either side of your body Bend your right knee and pull it towards your chest using your abs Lower the right leg back down to starting position Repeat the same procedure with your left knee Alternate between both legs for the required number of reps

Lie down on your back with your arms resting on the floor by your side. Raise your legs straight in the air, making a 90-degree angle with your torso. Lower one of your legs and bring it back just before touching the floor. Do the same with your other leg, and repeat.

Lie flat on your back on the floor with your hands under your rear Bring one leg straight up until it is pointed towards the ceiling Lower this leg back down in a controlled manner while raising the other leg The motion should be as if you are pedaling a bike in slow motion Switch between legs in a continuous motion

Lie flat on your back with legs extended straight out Raise one leg off the ground while keeping the other flat Slowly lower the raised leg back to the ground Repeat the sequence with the other leg Continue alternating legs for the duration of the exercise

name_en: Alternate leg raise from reverse plank position
description_en: Lie down on your back with your arms resting on the floor by your side and your legs extended forward. Raise your upper back, bring your elbows under the shoulders, and bear weight on your forearms with your palms down. Alternately raise and lower your legs to your maximum range.

name_en: Alternate Leg Raise from Reverse Plank Position
description_en: Start in a reverse plank position with your hands slightly behind your hips, fingers pointing towards your feet Keep your body straight and lift your right leg off the floor as high as you can Lower your leg back down in a controlled manner Repeat with your left leg Continue alternating legs

Lie flat on your back with your arms by your sides Raise one leg while keeping the other flat on the ground Simultaneously, lift your head and upper body off the ground Lower your leg and head back down Repeat the exercise with the alternate leg

Start by laying on the ground and placing your hands under your glutes While keeping your legs straight, raise one leg up to the ceiling Lower your leg back down in a controlled manner Alternate legs and repeat the process Perform this while holding your head and shoulders slightly off the ground

Lie on your back with your arms at your side. Raise your right leg and lift your head off the ground simultaneously. Keep your leg as straight as possible. Lower your leg and head back to the ground. Repeat the same movement with your left leg.

Lie flat on your back on the floor with knees bent and feet flat on the ground Extend your arms beside your head Lift your upper body off the floor and simultaneously raise one leg Attempt to touch the raised knee with the opposite elbow Lower yourself back to the starting position and switch sides
Lie down on your back with your legs straight and arms by your side. Raise your legs straight up unless your feet reach past your hips and then lower them again. Repeat this for suitable time.

Lie flat on your back on the floor with your palms facing down Keep one leg straight as you slowly lift the other leg Hold it in air for few seconds Slowly lower it back to the floor Repeat with the other leg

Lie flat on your back on the floor with your legs straight Place your hands under your lower back for support Raise one leg off the ground toward your chest, keeping the other leg straight and flat on the ground Lower your leg back to the floor Switch legs and repeat the process with the other leg

Lie down on your back and fold your knees while keeping your feet on the floor. Place your right hand behind your head. Raise and twist your chest to your left and bring your right elbow towards the opposite knee. Return to the starting position and repeat.

Lie flat on your back on the floor, knees bent and feet flat Place your hands lightly on the sides of your head, fingers around your ears Lift your shoulder blades off the floor, twisting your upper body to the left while bringing your right elbow towards your left knee Repeat the movement on the opposite side, bringing your left elbow towards your right knee Continue alternating sides each rep

Lie on your back on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat Place your hands on your ears, avoid clasping them behind your head Rotate your body and lift your shoulder and elbow towards the opposing knee Lower back down slowly Repeat and alternate with the other side

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Fold your arms at your sides and make fists with your hands near your chest. Start punching alternately by extending and folding your arms.

Stand in a boxing stance, left foot forward if right-handed, right foot forward if left-handed Punch straight forward with your leading hand, then retract it quickly Next, punch straight forward with the rear hand, then retract quickly Continue to alternate the punches quickly Always maintain your guard up when not punching

Start in a plank position, with your body forming a straight line from your head to your heels Lift your right leg off the ground and bend your knee to the side, bringing your knee towards your elbow Return your right leg back to the plank position Repeat on the left side to complete one rep Perform this exercise alternately on both sides

Lie flat on your back with your arms at your sides, palms facing down Bend your knees so your feet are flat on the floor Raise one leg in the air, extending it straight and keeping the opposite leg bent Push through the heel of your bent leg and lift your hip off the ground Slowly lower your hip to the ground and repeat, then switch legs

Get into a plank position with your wrists aligned under your shoulders Lift one leg off the floor, keeping it straight and not bending at the knee Lower the leg back to the starting position Alternate and perform with the other leg Maintain a straight body alignment throughout the exercise

Get down on your hands and toes while extending your back and legs straight. Your arms should be straight with your hands right under the shoulders. Lift one of your legs straight in the air and hold for a while. Return to the starting position and repeat by raising your other leg.

Start by standing a few steps away from a wall Lean back and place your back flat against the wall Slide down until your thighs are parallel to the ground Extend one leg out in front of you, keeping the other bent Hold the position for a couple of seconds before switching to the other leg

Stand tall with your back straight, arms by your side, and feet shoulder-width apart. Bend your knees, extend one of your legs backward, and lower your hands towards the floor while leaning forward. Return to the initial position and do the same while extending your other leg.

Stand with your feet hip-width apart Move one leg back, bending both knees at a 90-degree angle, as if you are in sprinting position Push from the front foot to return to the standing position Repeat the action with the alternate leg Remain engaged and swift throughout

Stand straight keeping your feet shoulder-width apart. Move your right leg forward, and lower your body into a lunge positioning your knee at 90 degrees. Switch legs, moving the left leg forward and recreating the same position. Make sure that the rear knee hovers above the ground. Repeat the alternating movements with each leg.

Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet on the floor. Raise your torso off the floor by placing your elbows on the floor and raise one of your knees toward the chest while keeping your knee bent. Lower your foot back to the floor while raising your other knee towards your chest. Keep repeating by alternately moving your knees towards and away from the chest.

Lay flat on the ground with your back and palms facing down Lift your legs straight up into the air Lower one leg down towards the ground As you lift that leg back up, lower your other leg Repeat this alternation

Lie flat on your back with arms spread out horizontally Lift one arm straight up, then gently lower it back down Then lift the other arm and lower it back Make sure to lift until your hand is directly over your shoulder Keep the arm straight while raising and lowering

Start in an upright standing position, feet shoulder-width apart Jump slightly and bring your right knee up towards your chest Simultaneously swing your left arm forward to touch your right knee Jump again, switching legs and arms Continue alternating between each side for the duration of the exercise

Stand straight with your hands on your sides Raise one knee and touch it with the opposite hand's elbow Now bring your knee back down and touch your other knee with the opposite elbow Repeat the action for desired repetitions Remember to keep your core engaged throughout

Sit on a bench with your back straight, arms hanging straight at the sides, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Hold the dumbbells in your hands with your palms facing forward. Raise one of the dumbbells towards the shoulder by folding your arm. Return to the initial position and repeat by folding your other arm.

Sit on the edge of a bench with your back straight, arms hanging straight at the sides, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Hold the dumbbells in your hands with your palms facing inward. Raise one of the dumbbells towards the shoulder by folding your arm. Return to the initial position and repeat by folding your other arm.

Start standing with your feet hip-width apart Kick your right foot up towards your glutes, then quickly switch and kick up your left foot Immediately after your left foot lands, kick up your right foot again Then kick up your left foot twice in quick succession Repeat these alternating double kick cycles for your desired duration

Begin by standing upright and engaging your core Lift your leg behind you while bending at the knee, similar to a kick but controlled Gradually lower the leg back to starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the motion with the other leg Alternate between both legs for the duration of the exercise

Start by standing upright with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise your left knee and try to reach it with your right hand Lower your left leg while raising and reaching your right knee with your left hand Continue to alternate your legs and arms in a running motion Keep your movements controlled and do the exercise for a set amount of time

Stand tall with your back straight and your feet wider than your shoulder. Fold your arms, open your elbows a little wide, and make fists near your chest. Punch by extending your one arm while curling your opposite leg back. Return to the initial position and repeat by switching sides.

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Drive your right knee up to chest level and simultaneously punch with your left hand across your body Lower your right leg and left arm back to the start position Repeat the motion with your left knee and right hand Continue to alternate sides for the designated amount of repetitions

Begin in a standing position with feet shoulder-width apart Lift one knee up and then kick your foot behind you towards your glutes At the same time, extend the same side arm in a punching motion Alternate sides and repeat for desired reps or time Ensure to keep a brisk, steady pace

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise your right knee up towards your chest as you extend your left arm forward Lower your right knee and return to starting position Repeat the movement with your left knee and right arm Continue alternating for the duration of the exercise

Get down on your fours and raise your hips while keeping your arms and legs straight to form an inverted V-shape. Bend one of your knees and take it towards the chest by lifting your heel off the floor. Return to the starting position and repeat the same with your other knee.

Start in a high plank position Push your hips back into a downward dog position Lift one leg as high as you can and hold Lower the leg back down with control and then lift the other one Continue to alternate legs

Begin in a standard downward dog position, with your hands and feet on the ground Raise one leg up towards the sky, keeping it as straight as possible Lower the lifted leg down to the original position Repeat the process alternating between legs

Lie down on your back with your legs straight and hands behind your head. Raise one of your legs straight towards the ceiling without bending your knee. Slowly lower your leg back towards the floor and simultaneously raise the other leg.

Get down to floor on your palms and toes with your arms and legs straight.. Bend your left knee and place your foot near the hand then, rotate your torso towards your left while raising your arm straight overhead. Return to the starting position and perform same set of movements with opposite side.

Lie on your back with knees slightly bent, feet placed on the ground and hands behind your head. Inhale, lift your upper back  off the ground and twist your torso towards the right side Exhale and return to the starting position Lift your upper back again and twist your torso to the left side.

Get down to floor on your palms  and toes with your arms, legs and back straight. Lift your one foot off the ground and bring the knee towards your arm by bending it. Place the foot back on the ground and do the same movement with your opposite leg.

Stand tall with your back straight and your feet shoulder-width apart. Bend your knees slightly and clasp your hands in front of your chest. Lift one of your feet off the floor and step to your side. Return to the initial position and do the same with your other foot.
Stand upright with your feet together Step out to your right, bending your right knee into a side lunge Push off your right foot to return to standing Repeat the step-out motion with your left leg

Lie down on your stomach with your legs extended and your arms resting on the floor overhead. Raise your one arm and the opposite leg off the floor and hold for a while. Return to the initial position and raise your other arm and opposite leg this time.

Lie on your stomach, extend your arms straight above your head Simultaneously raise your left arm and right leg Hold for a few seconds, then lower your arm and leg Repeat with your right arm and left leg

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Lift your right knee as high as you can while rising onto your left tip-toe Lower your right foot and immediately lift your left knee as high as you can while rising onto your right tip-toe Continue alternating between right and left knee lifts for your desired amount of reps/time Keep your core tight and arms moving in rhythm with your steps

Lie down on your back with your legs straight and arm resting at the sides. Raise your torso and right leg simultaneously and tap your right toe with lefth hand. Return to the starting position and do the same with your opposite hand and leg.

Stand tall with your back straight and your feet shoulder-width apart. Place your hands at your waist. Raise one foot a few inches off the floor without bending your leg and start making circles with it. Continue this for desired duration.
Sit down and extend your leg Rotate your foot in a circular motion Do this for a set number of rotations, then switch directions Repeat this with your other foot

Sit or lie down on a flat surface Extend one leg straight out in front of you Rotate your ankle clockwise for a few seconds Rotate your ankle counter-clockwise for a few seconds Repeat on the other leg

Stand tall with your back straight, arms hanging by your side, and feet shoulder-width apart. Shift your weight on heels and raise your toes off the floor. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Sit down on the floor with your legs straight in front of you Extend your right foot forward and flex it towards you Hold the top position for a couple of seconds Slowly return to the starting position Repeat for the other foot

Stand tall with your back straight, arms hanging by your side, and feet shoulder-width apart. Shift your weight on your toes and raise your heels off the floor. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Slowly rise up onto your toes, lifting your heels off the ground Hold the position for a moment Slowly lower your heels back down to the floor Repeat the movement

Start on all fours with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart Jump side to side, landing with feet wider than hip-width apart After jumping to the side, jump forward while returning the feet inside shoulder-width Repeat the same movement, but jumping to the opposite side

Get down on your hands and toes with your back straight. Straighten your arms and legs, and lower your chest towards your left hand by bending your left arm while keeping the other arm straight. Hold for a while, raise your chest by straightening your arm, and repeat by lowering towards the other hand.

Start in a basic pull-up position As you lift your body, shift your weight to one side and extend the other arm Try to keep your extending arm as straight as possible Lower your body and return to the starting position Repeat on the other side

Get down on your hands and toes with your back straight. Straighten your arms and legs, and lower your chest towards your left hand by bending your left arm while keeping the other arm straight. Hold for a while, raise your chest by straightening your arm, and repeat by lowering towards the other hand.

Place your hands slightly wider than shoulder width Lower your body towards one hand, keeping the other arm straight Push through the opposite hand to return to the starting position Repeat the push-ups, alternating sides each time Ensure your body is straight throughout the exercise

Stand upright with feet hip-width apart and your arms extended straight in front of you Take a big step back with one foot as if you're doing a lunge As you step back, reach your opposite arm forward as your back foot lands Return to the starting position by pushing off with your back foot and returning your arms to the initial position Repeat the movement with the other foot and opposite arm

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms forward while keeping your palms inward. Take a step backward by extending your left leg behind you while taking your elbow past your back like an archer. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat by taking your right leg backward.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Spread your arms wide at shoulder level with your palms downward. Move your arms up and down in circles while keeping them straight. Perform this activity for a suitable duration.

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms out to the sides at shoulder height Move your arms in a circular motion, ensuring full range of motion Reverse direction after a set Keep your torso stable throughout the exercise

Stand tall with your back straight, arms by your sides, and feet shoulder-width apart. Raise your arms overhead, then spread them wide and move them up and down in circles while keeping them straight. Perform this activity for a suitable duration.

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms out to your sides, parallel to the ground Move your arms in forward circular motion while stepping back Then switch direction of arm movement and step forward Repeat the steps with alternate feet stepback

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and extend your arms to your sides at shoulder height Begin rotating your arms in small circles, keeping them at shoulder height While maintaining the arm circles, take a step back with your right foot into a reverse lunge position Return to the starting position and repeat on the left side Continue alternating sides for the duration of the set

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Spread your arms at shoulder level to your sides while keeping your palms down. Bring your arms close unless they crossover each other. Return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall and open your arms wide Cross your arms over one another in front of your chest Return to the starting position by opening your arms wide again Repeat this cross and open movement for the desired number of reps

Stand with your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms to the sides, parallel to the floor Cross your arms in front of your body Return to the starting position by opening your arms back to the sides Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight, chest out, and feet shoulder-width apart. Spread your arms at shoulder level to your sides while keeping your palms down. Bring your arms close unless they crossover each other. Return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand upright and extend your arms out to the sides Cross your arms over your chest as if you are giving yourself a big hug Once your arms have crisscrossed, open them wide again without letting them droop Repeat the movement fluidly for the specified reps

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms out to sides, palms facing forward Consciously engage your core and keep your chest lifted Start crossing your arms forward and then slowly pull it back Repeat this process for the desired number of repetitions

Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart Cross your right leg behind your left Bend your knees and lower your hips into a curtsy Return to your starting position Repeat with your left leg crossing behind your right

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Cross your right leg behind your left leg as though doing a curtsy, bending both knees Simultaneously, extend your arms out in front of you Push back to the starting position and repeat with the other leg Keep alternating legs for the duration of your workout

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Spread your arms at shoulder level to your sides while keeping your palms down and forearms bent. Bring your arms close as they crossover, take them slightly away, and bring them over each other again. Return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms out to the sides, parallel to the floor Bring your arms forward, crossing them over each other Reverse the movement to return to the starting position Repeat this motion for desired number of repetitions

name_en: Arm Leg Lift to Split Squat
description_en: Stand tall, feet shoulder-width apart Lift your right arm and left leg simultaneously Lower your raised arm and leg to return to stand Step back with the right foot, lowering into a split squat Return to standing and repeat with the opposite limbs

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Bring your hands together, palm to palm, in a prayer position Push your palms together while raising your elbows and stretching your hands down Hold this position for 10-30 seconds, maintaining the pressure between your palms Repeat this exercise 3-5 times

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Bend your arms to make a 90-degree angle with the elbows while keeping your palms facing inward. Tighten your upper arms and move your arms forward and backward in a pulse-like fashion. Keep doing this activity for a suitable time.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Bring your forearms forward with your palms facing the floor and make a 90-degree angle with your upper arms. Tighten your upper arms and move your hands towards each other. As your one hand comes over the other one, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Bend your arms to make a 90-degree angle with the elbows while keeping your palms side down. Tighten your upper arms and move your arms forward and backward in a pulse-like fashion. Keep doing this activity for a suitable time.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Bend your arms to make a 90-degree angle with the elbows while keeping your palms side up. Tighten your upper arms and move your arms forward and backward in a pulse-like fashion. Keep doing this activity for a suitable time.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise one arm and opposite knee at the same time Lower your arm and legs back Repeat with the other arm and opposite knee Continue this rhythm for a set amount of time

Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart Raise your arms to shoulder level while stepping one foot forward Lower your arms while stepping back and then repeat the process with the other foot Make sure your arms are straight throughout the raises Continue the exercise for your desired amount of time or repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Fold your arms at your sides and make fists with your hands near your chest. Raise one of your knees while rotating your torso to your sides. Return to the initial position, and repeat by raising your other knee.

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Stretch your arms out to your sides at shoulder height Lift your left knee as you rotate your upper torso to the left Return to your initial position Repeat this process for your opposite side

Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart, raise your arms to the sides at shoulder level Bend at your waist and try to touch your left hand to your right foot Return to the starting position Now bend to touch your right hand to your left foot Return to the starting position and repeat the sequence

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms out to your sides at shoulder level Slowly make large circles with your arms, moving forward While circling your arms, step forward alternately with your feet Switch the direction, and repeat

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Raise your knees up to waist level, one at a time, circling your arms at the same time Continue to alternate knees and rotating your arms for the duration of the exercise Keep your core engaged during the movement Remember to breathe regularly throughout the exercise

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Start swinging your arms in circles while marching on the spot Make sure your circles are wide and controlled Keep your abs engaged throughout the exercise Switch the direction of your arm circles every 30 seconds

Stand up straight with your feet hip width apart Bend your elbows to curl your arms while simultaneously lifting one knee Lower your arms and knee back to the starting position Repeat with the other knee and continue alternating legs

name_en: Arms Forward and Behind the Neck
description_en: Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms in front of you at shoulder level Moving only your shoulders, move your arms back until they are behind your neck Return your arms to the original position Repeat this move for the desired amount of repetitions

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms straight in front of you at shoulder level Start running in place by lifting your heels to your buttock When your right foot kicks your buttock, your left arm should be straight out When your left foot kicks your buttock, your right arm should be straight out Do this exercise continuously for your desired time

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms to your sides and make large circles as you lower into a squat Push back up to standing whilst continuing the large circles Repeat this motion keeping a steady rhythm Make sure to keep your torso upright

Start in a standing position with your arms straight in front of you at shoulder height Lift your right leg and kick it back while keeping it straight Hold this position for a few seconds before returning to the starting position Repeat the same movement with your left leg Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions

Hang from a horizontal bar keeping your body straight Lift your legs up, bending at the waist, until your waist is parallel to the floor Lower your legs back down while keeping your abs contracted Repeat for desired reps Keep your body and legs straight throughout

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your right arm overhead and bring your left arm forward. Then lower your right arm while extending your left arm overhead. Repeat alternately.

Stand upright and keep your feet shoulder-width apart Raise your arms straight up above your head Slowly lower your arms back down to your sides Repeat these movements in a steady rhythm Maintain a flat back and engaged core throughout

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and extend your arms out to the sides Step out to the right while swinging your left arm towards your right foot Step your right foot back to the starting position while swinging your arms back to their initial position Repeat the action on the left side, swinging your right arm towards your left foot

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Spread your arms wide at shoulder level with your palms forward. Take your arms toward the opposite sides as if hugging yourself. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Place your hands on your hips Bend your torso to one side, keeping your hips stationary Return to the start position then repeat on the other side Keep alternating sides

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Extend one arm straight out to the side at shoulder height Slowly rotate your arm in large circles Repeat this movement for a set number of repetitions Switch arms and repeat on the other side

name_en: Around the World Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie flat on your back with your arms extended straight above your head Keeping your arms straight, move them in a circular motion going down to your sides, then down to your feet, then back above your head Keep your back flat on the floor and your abdominal muscles engaged throughout the entire movement Repeat the circular motion for a set number of repetitions Always move your arms in a controlled and steady manner

Lie down on your stomach with your legs extended and your arms resting on the floor by your side. Raise your torso and legs off the floor, open your arms wide, and then extend them overhead. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Lay flat on your stomach with your arms and legs extended Lift your arms, chest, and legs off the floor Move your arms in a circular motion, as if you're flying Keep holding this position Lower your body back down to the floor

Lay flat on your stomach, extending your arms and legs outward Lift your arms, chest, and legs off the ground by arching your back Hold this position for a few seconds before returning to the initial position Repeat this motion in a controlled manner

Position yourself on the bike, with your feet securely on the pedals. Hold onto the handles on either side of the bike. Start pedaling at a moderate pace, while moving your arms back and forth. Continue for the desired amount of time or distance. Rest briefly and then repeat.

Start the exercise by standing on the machine. Hold onto the handles for balance. Begin by pushing off with one leg and start to "run" or "jog" on the machine. Keep a steady tempo that will get your heart rate up but won't tire you out too quickly. Try to maintain this tempo for the desired amount of time. Cool down by slowing your pace until you come to a stop.

Stand upright with one foot slightly forward, the other foot resting on a bench behind you Begin to lower your body by flexing the knee and hip of your front leg until the knee of your rear leg almost touches the floor Push up through the heel of the front foot to the start position Repeat the movement with the other leg

Start with your hands placed on the parallel bars, keeping your elbows close to your body Lower your body by bending your knees and arms until they reach a 90-degree angle Push your body back up until your arms are fully extended Keep your knees bent throughout the routine Repeat the process for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Assisted chin up normal width reverse grip
description_en: Place your knees on the platform and grab the bar above you with your palms facing your body. Take a deep breath and raise your body, moving your shoulders up in upward in straight line. Exhale and return to the starting position by straightening your arms slowly.

Position a bench under a chin-up bar Stand on the bench and grab the bar with an underhand grip Bend your knees and let your body hang Pull yourself up until your chin is over the bar Lower yourself back down in a slow, controlled manner until your arms are fully extended

name_en: Assisted chin up reverse close grip
description_en: Get your knees on the platform of the pull-up machine and grab the bar with your hands placed close to each other and palms facing toward you Take a deep breath and pull yourself up by bending your arms while bringing your chin towards the bar Exhale and return to the starting position by straightening your arms slowly

name_en: Assisted chin up reverse wide grip
description_en: Get your knees on the platform of the pull-up machine and grab the bar with your hands placed wider than your shoulder width and palms facing toward you Take a deep breath and pull yourself up by bending your arms while bringing your chin towards the bar Exhale and return to the starting position by straightening your arms slowly

name_en: Assisted close grip underhand chin up
description_en: Get your knees on the platform and grab the bar with your hands placed shoulder-width apart and palms facing backward. Take a deep breath and pull yourself up by folding your arms while bringing your chin towards the bar. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand on the platform of the machine and grasp the handles with an underhand grip With your hands close together, pull yourself up until your chin is above the bar Hold for a brief moment and then lower yourself back down Continue with the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Lie flat on your stomach with your ankles under something heavy or hooked onto a rod Place your hands on the floor next to your shoulders Engage your hamstrings and lift your body up until you're in a kneeling position Lower yourself back down, using your hands to control your descent Repeat for desired number of reps

name_en: Assisted parallel close grip pull up
description_en: Get your knees on the platform and grab the bar with your hands placed shoulder-width apart and palms facing inward. Take a deep breath and pull yourself up by folding your arms while bringing your chin towards the bar. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand underneath the pull-up bar position Grasp the handles of the pull-up bar with a close grip Bend your knees and slowly pull yourself up towards the bar Hold this position for a moment before slowly lowering yourself back to the starting position Repeat for desired number of reps

name_en: Assisted Partial Range Inverse Leg Curl
description_en: Lie on your back and place your heels on a significantly elevated surface Bend your knees and pull your heels towards your buttocks Slowly release your heels back on the elevated surface, while resisting gravity Repeat for the specified number of repetitions

Get your knees on the platform and grab the bar with your hands placed shoulder-width apart and palms facing forward. Take a deep breath and pull yourself up by folding your arms while bringing your chin towards the bar. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Position yourself on the pull-up machine with your knees on the pad Grab the pull-up bar with a shoulder-width grip Lower your body in a controlled manner until your arms are fully extended Pull yourself up until your chin is just above the bar Lower yourself back down slowly

Stand on the assisted pull-up machine, place your knees on the pad and grasp the handles above you. Keep your torso upright as you pull your body up until your chin is above the bar. Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your body back to the starting position. Avoid swinging or using momentum to pull your body up. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Get your knees on the platform and grab the bar with your hands placed close to each other  and palms facing forward. Take a deep breath and pull yourself up by folding your arms while bringing your chin towards the bar. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Get your knees on the platform of the pull-up machine and grab the bar with your hands placed shoulder-width apart and palms facing forward Take a deep breath and pull yourself up by bending your arms while bringing your chest towards the bar Exhale and return to the starting position by straightening your arms slowly

Get your knees on the platform of the pull-up machine and grab the bar with your hands placed wider than your shoulder-width and palms facing forward Take a deep breath and pull yourself up by folding your arms while bringing your chest towards the bar Exhale and return to the starting position by straightening your arms slowly

Stand on a sturdy box or bench. Reach up and grab the bar with one hand, palm facing towards you. Engage your core and pull your elbow down to your side. Keep your body as straight as possible as you lift your body up towards the bar. Pull until your chin is above the bar. Lower yourself back down to the starting position in controlled fashion. Repeat the exercise with your other arm.

Sit on the machine with your back firmly against the backrest Place one foot on the footplate making sure your knee is in line with your toes Press your foot into the footplate until your leg is fully extended but not locked Slowly lower your foot until your knee is at about a 90-degree angle Repeat the movement for the designated number of repetitions then switch to the other leg

Lie down on your back with your knees bent and ankle held by another person to keep your feet on the floor. Clasp your hands on your chest and raise your chest towards your knees. As you reach near the knees, return to the floor, and repeat.

Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Position arms across your chest Use your core to pull your upper body off the floor Slowly lower yourself back down Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Kneel on the pad and grasp the handles with your palms facing inward Lower your body by bending at the elbows until they are at about a 90 degree angle Extend your arms while pushing yourself back up to the start position Repeat this motion for the suggested number of reps

Adjust the machine to match your height and preferred resistance Kneel on the platform, and firmly grip the handles Lower your body by bending at the elbows until they are at a 90-degree angle Push your body back up to the starting position Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Get down on your hands and toes with your back straight. Straighten your arms and legs while another person places a weighted plate on your back. Lower your chest to the floor by bending your arms. 4.. Hold for a while, raise your chest by straightening your arms and taking assistance from the person holding the plate, and repeat.

Get in the standard push-up position, with your hands a little wider than shoulder-width apart. Have a partner add weight on your back, making sure it is balanced. Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor. Push your body back up till your arms are fully extended. Repeat for the desired number of sets and repetitions

Start in a squatting position with your feet shoulder width apart Explosively jump into the air, spreading your legs wide Once you're in the air, pull your legs back together Land in the squatting position Continue this motion without pause for your designated repetitions/time

Stand with feet hip-width apart, with the axle barbell on the ground in front of you. Bend your knees and hips to lower down and grip the bar. Keep your back straight and pull the bar up, extending your hips and knees. Hold briefly at the top then slowly lower the bar back to the ground. Repeat this motion for desired amount of repetitions.

Start in a standard push-up position, hands and feet on the ground supporting your body weight Lower your body towards the ground like a standard push-up As you push up, jump and kick your legs forward to your hands simultaneously Kick your legs back out and land with your hands back on the floor again in push-up position Repeat the process

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Roll your shoulders back and down Extend your arms out to your sides and rotate them so your thumbs are facing upward Reach your arms back as far as you can, keeping your chest lifted Hold this stretch for 30 seconds

Sit on a block with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Raise your arms overhead and bend your elbows. Pull your right elbow towards the opposite shoulder with your left hand. Maintain this stretch for some seconds and relax.

Begin standing with your feet shoulder-width apart Shift your weight onto your left foot and lift your right foot off the ground Cross your right foot behind your left leg and tap your right foot to the ground Return to the starting position Repeat on the other side and continue switching sides

Get on the machine and lock your feet into the place and bring your thighs forward against the pads Straighten your back along with your legs and rest your hands on your chest Lower your torso towards the floor as far as you can Return to the initial position and repeat

Place your stomach on an exercise ball and lean forward while extending your legs back and placing your toes on the floor. Place your hands behind your head and raise your chest by leaning backward. As your back becomes fully straight, return to the initial position, and repeat.
Place your chest on top of the exercise ball and feet firmly on the ground Place your hands behind your head Raise the upper body until your body forms a straight line Lower the upper body and repeat

Stand straight and hold onto a wall or chair for balance. Swing one leg forward and back in a pendulum motion. Keep the core engaged and the leg straight. Repeat the movement with the other leg. Continue to alternate legs for the duration of the exercise.

Stand straight and hold onto a sturdy object for balance. Swing one leg forward and backward in a controlled manner. Keep your core engaged and move the leg as high as you comfortably can. Lower the leg and then repeat the movement with the other leg. Do multiple repetitions on each side.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Bend your knees slightly and lean forward a bit while keeping your arms by your side. Raise your arms backward with your palms side up. Hold for a while, return to the starting position, and repeat.
Stand with your feet shoulder width apart Extend your arms to the side with your palms facing backward Raise your arms till they are in line with your shoulders Lower your arms in a controlled manner

Start by standing straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Shift your weight to your right leg and kick your left leg behind your body, touching your right heel with your left hand Return to the starting position and repeat the exercise on the other side Keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the exercise Continue alternating sides for the desired amount of reps or time

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and your arms holding an imaginary bar at shoulder height Simultaneously kick one leg back and press the imaginary bar overhead Lower the bar to shoulder height as you bring your leg back to starting position Repeat on the other side Alternate sides with each repetition

Start in a standing position with your feet hip-width apart and hands by your sides Perform a single leg back kick with one foot and simultaneously lift your hands above your head Return to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat this with the other leg Do this for your desired number of reps

Start standing straight with your feet hip-width apart. Jump out with your feet and simultaneously lift your back leg upwards. While jumping back to the original position, lower your back leg. Make sure to alternate your legs with each repetition. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise.

Begin in a standing position with your feet hip-width apart Go into a squat position while maintaining a straight back As you push back up to a standing position, extend one leg out behind you and kick into the air Repeat on the other side Continue to alternate between both legs

Start by hanging on a bar with your arms extended overhead, hands placed shoulder-width apart, and your palms facing forward. Pull yourself up until your head is facing the floor and your legs are overhead. Pass your legs under the bar and align your body in a straight line from head to toe and parallel to the floor. Hold this position for a suitable duration.

Attach a wide bar to the top pulley of a machine and sit down, grabbing it with an overhand grip With your elbows slightly bent, pull down the bar till it reaches your upper chest Return the bar back up until your arms and shoulders are fully extended Repeat the movement for the prescribed number of repetitions

Stand tall 3-4 feet from an incline bench and place your hands on it by leaning forward and extending your arms overhead. Stretch your back by lowering your chest towards the floor. Maintain this stretch for a suitable duration.

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms out to the sides parallel to the ground Gently push your chest forward while slightly arching your back until a stretch is felt Hold for a count of 20 to 30 seconds Return to the starting position and repeat

Stand with arms extended at shoulder height. Move your arms backwards until you feel a slight stretch in your pecs and upper back. Hold this position for up to 30 seconds. Relax and then repeat the process for 2-3 sets. Breathe normally while holding the stretch.

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms out to your sides, elbows bent at a 90-degree angle Rotate your arms in small backward circles Gradually increase the size of the circles After a minute, reverse the direction of the circles

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Hop backwards in a shuffling motion During the shuffle, kick out one leg to the side Alternate the kicking leg with each shuffle Maintain a rhythmic pace for a set duration or number of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Open your arms wide and take them past your back to stretch your chest muscles. Hold momentarily, bring your arms forward, and curl them over each other. Repeat.

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder width apart Extend your arms straight out in front of you at shoulder level Sweep your arms back as far as possible, opening your chest Wrap arms around your body as if you are hugging yourself Hold and repeat the movement

Sit on a block with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Extend your arms forward to shoulder height and bring your elbows behind your back to stretch your shoulder and back muscles. Maintain this stretch for some seconds, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Move your shoulder blades towards each other as if you're trying to hold a pencil between them Hold this squeeze for 3-5 seconds then release Repeat the process for the recommended number of reps Ensure your movements are slow and controlled

Start in a high plank position with your hands under your shoulders and your body in a straight line Lift your right foot and step it back behind your left foot Return to the high plank position Repeat with the other foot Alternate sides for the duration of the exercise

Stand tall near an incline bench with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms overhead and reach the bench by leaning forward. Hold the bench and extend your back while lowering your chest towards the floor. Repeat this by alternatingly moving your chest down and up in a rhythm.

Stand tall near an incline bench with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms overhead and reach the bench by leaning forward. Hold the bench and extend your back while lowering your chest towards the floor. Maintain this stretch for some seconds, then release the stretch, and repeat.

Get down on your knees with your back straight, thighs extended, and legs resting on the floor. Lean backward and hold your feet by extending your arms to stretch your abdominal muscles. Maintain this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Stand straight with feet shoulder-width apart Cross your arms over your chest Slowly bend backwards while maintaining control Hold the stretch for a few seconds Return to starting position in a controlled manner

Stand straight and then slowly bend backward Place your palms on the lower back or hips for support Stretch as far back as you feel comfortable Hold the position for a few seconds Return to the starting position

name_en: Backward Forward Turn to Side Neck Stretch
description_en: Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Turn your head to one side until your chin is over the shoulder Then, slowly tilt your head backwards Hold for 10-30 seconds Repeat it to the other side

name_en: Backward Forward Turn To Side Neck Stretch
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight, arms by your side, and feet shoulder-width apart. Bend your neck by taking your head backwards and then forward. Return to the initial position and rotate your neck towards the left and right. Repeat the whole sequence.

Stand tall or sit on a chair, maintaining good posture. Gently tilt your head back until you're looking up towards the ceiling. Hold for a 20 -30 seconds, breathing normally. Slowly release and return your head to the original position. Repeat this 3-5 times.

Stand straight and prepare yourself to start running Start running backwards. Maintain a steady pace Move your arms in sync with your legs Make sure your back is straight and your abs are drawn in Continue the movement for your desired amount of time or distance

Stand on the balance board with your feet hip-width apart Bend your knees slightly and keep your core engaged Try to keep the board level without touching the ground Balance for as long as possible, focus on tensing your abs Release and repeat the process

Stand on the board with your feet hip-width apart. Ensure your knees are slightly flexed. Attempt to maintain balance on the board, preventing either side of the board from touching the ground. Hold this position, engaging your core, hip flexors and quadriceps. Slowly dismount from the board once completed.

Stand tall on a balance board with your back straight and feet placed wider than your shoulders. Tilt towards your right while bending your right knee and lowering the left end of the board to the floor. Return to the center and do the same by tilting towards your left. Repeat.

Stand straight and keep your feet hip-width apart Step your right foot as far back as you can and drop into a lunge Keep your left knee directly over your ankle Push off your right foot to return to start, maintaining your balance Repeat with the left leg and continue alternating

Stand next to a wall with a stability ball between your ankles and the wall Lean slightly into the wall for support and lift your inside leg off the ground Squeeze the ball with your ankles as you lift your inside leg as high as you can Slowly lower your leg, releasing some of the pressure on the ball Repeat on the other side

Stand tall with your legs hip-width apart and hold a stability ball between your knees Bend your knees a little and engage your glutes and quads Try to adduct your hips by squeezing the ball between your knees Release the squeeze slowly

Sit tall on a stability ball with feet flat on the floor Tighten your abdominal muscles and lean to one side as far as comfortable Hold the position for a moment Return to center and repeat the movement on the other side Perform the required number of repetitions on each side

Lie on your back with your legs straight. Place the stability ball between your ankles. Lift the stability ball up towards the ceiling using your hips and glutes. Lower the ball back down towards the floor in a controlled manner. Repeat this motion for your desired amount of reps.
