Sit on the stability ball with your feet flat on the floor Lean back to a supine position, allowing your back to conform to the curve of the ball Contract your abs and elevate your upper body towards your knees Lower yourself back down in a controlled manner

Stand on the band with your feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the ends of the band with your hands, arms extended and palms facing forward. Bend your elbows and curl the band towards your shoulders. Pause at the top, then slowly lower your hands back to the start position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width apart Hold the band with your hands, elbows forming an angle of 45 degrees with your sides Curl your hands towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows stationary Hold the position for a couple seconds Slowly lower your hands back down

name_en: Band 45 degrees One Arm Biceps Curl
description_en: Stand upright and step your foot on one end of the band Hold the other end with one hand and fully extend your arm towards the ground Curl the band up towards your shoulder, keeping your elbow fixed at your side Pause at the top of the curl Return to the starting position and repeat

Anchor the band at shoulder height Hold one end of the band in each hand, arms extended out to your sides Bring your arms together in front of your chest Return to the starting position in a controlled manner Switch hands and repeat the movement with the opposite hand leading

Attach resistance bands to a high anchor point Stand between the anchor points and face forward Grab each handle and step forward, so there is tension in the bands Pull the bands downward and across your body, meeting at waist level Return to the starting position and repeat

Stand on the center of your resistance band with feet hip-width apart, holding the ends in each hand. With your palms facing forward, curl up one hand towards your shoulder while keeping your upper arm stationary. Hold this position briefly, then lower your hand in a controlled manner. Repeat the same motion with the other hand. This is one rep. Continue alternating hands for the desired number of sets and reps.

Kneel on the floor and loop the band around your knee for support Grasp the pull-up bar with your hands facing towards you Pull yourself up until your chin is over the bar Lower yourself back down in a controlled manner Repeat for the specified amount of repetitions

Secure a band around the dip bars and step onto it Hold your body at arm's length above the bars Lower your body slowly until your shoulders are below your elbows Push yourself back up to the starting position using your triceps

Stand under a pull-up bar and loop a resistance band around it Step or kneel on the band, ensuring it's secure under your foot or knee Grasp the bar with an overhand grip Pull yourself up until your chin is above the bar Lower yourself back down slowly and controlled

Secure a band to a pull-up bar and place your knee into the loop of the band Pull your body up until your chin is over the bar Lower yourself down with a controlled motion Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions Switch the band to the other knee and repeat

Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the ends of the band, palms facing forwards, with hands slightly wider than shoulder width. Push the band upwards above your head until your arms are fully extended. Lower the band back to your shoulders in a slow and controlled manner. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Attach the resistance band down low behind you.  Stand between the attachment point and the bench. Hold the ends of the band. Lie back onto the bench with your knees bent, feet on the floor. Press the band up and out in front of you until your arms are straight. Slowly lower the band back towards your chest and repeat.

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart and the band around your ankles Bend your torso forward at the hips, keeping your back straight Extend one leg behind you against the band's resistance, keeping your knee straight Return your leg to the start position in a controlled manner Repeat with the other leg

Stand erect and step on the band with both feet shoulder-width apart Bend at the waist with your torso almost parallel to the floor Hold the other end of the band with both hands, keeping your arms straight and closer to your knees Extend your hip and stand tall while pulling the band upwards, without changing the angle of your knees Slowly return to the starting position and repeat

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart with the band under your feet Hold the band with your palms facing downwards, raise your arms up and bend over from your waist Pull the band down to your chest while keeping your elbows close to your body Hold this position for a moment Slowly extend your arms and return to the starting position

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, place the band under your feet Bend your body to a 45-degree angle, keeping your back straight Pull the band up to your chest, squeezing your back muscles Slowly return the band to the starting position

name_en: Band Bent over One Arm Kickback
description_en: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, with one end of the band under your foot and the other in your hand Bend over at the waist, maintain a slight bend in your knees and keep your back straight Start with your arm at a 90-degree angle, then extend your forearm back and up until it is straight Slowly lower your arm back down to the 90-degree starting position Repeat for your desired number of reps, then switch to the other arm

Stand on the resistance band with your feet hip-width apart. Bend at the waist until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor, holding one end of the band in each hand. With arms extended, raise your arms laterally to the side until they are shoulder height. Lower your arms in a slow and controlled manner to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Stand over the band with feet shoulder-width apart Bend over at your waist, keep your back straight Grab the band with hands, palms facing each other Raise your arms out to the sides until they're parallel to the floor Lower the bands back down and repeat

name_en: Band Bent over Rear Lateral Raise
description_en: Stand on one end of a band and hold the other end with your hand. Bend your upper body until it's parallel to the floor. Raise your arm to the side until it's in line with your body. Pause at the top, then slowly lower your arm.

Stand tall with your back straight and a resistance band under your feet. Lean forward and grab the band's handles near your knees while keeping your arms straight. Pull the band by folding your arms and taking your elbows past your back. Return to the initial position by releasing the band, and repeat.

Stand on the middle of the resistance band and grasp the ends in each hand. Bend over, maintaining a straight back, with your torso almost parallel to the floor. Pull both ends of the band towards your torso, while keeping your elbows close to your body. Hold the peak position for a second, contracting your back muscles. Slowly return to the starting position.

Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width apart, hold the ends of the band Bend at the hips while keeping your back straight Pull the band up towards your waist Pause for a moment and then lower the band back down Repeat the movement

Stand on the center of the band with feet shoulder-width apart. Hold both ends of the band and keep your elbows close to your torso. Curl the wrists towards the shoulders, whilst keeping the upper arm stationary. Hold for a moment, then lower the bands back to the initial position.

Lay on the floor with legs extended and loop the band around your feet Simultaneously bring one knee towards your chest and the opposite elbow to meet it in a twist motion Return to the starting position Repeat on another side Perform desired number of repetitions before switching.

Lie down on your back with your legs straight, arms resting at your sides, and your toes held in the resistance band's handles. Place your hands behind your head while folding your arms. Raise your chest and stretch the band by bringing one of your elbows and the opposite knee towards each other. Go back to the initial position and do the same with your opposite elbow and knee, and then repeat.

Lay down on the floor with your workout band looped around your feet. Pull your knees up to your chest, then extend your legs straight out. As you pull your knees back to your chest, rotate your core so your opposite elbow comes toward the knee that is pulling in. Alternate sides for a cycling crunch motion. Continue the motion, alternating legs and elbows.

Stand in a split stance with a band attached to a sturdy anchor behind you Extend your arms out to the sides and pull forward until your hands come toward each other in front of your chest Slowly let your arms go back to the initial position, controlling the movement Repeat for the desired amount of reps

Stand on the band and hold the other end in both hands Keep your elbows close to your body Curl upwards until your hands are at chest level Lower your hands in a controlled manner until they reach a fully extended position

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and a resistance band under your feet. Hold the ends of the bands in your hands while keeping your arms straight and palms on the front side. Stretch the band by folding your arms to a 90 angle while taking your hands close to each other. Then return to the starting position and repeat.

Stand upright and hold the band with both hands, palms facing each other Pull the band towards your abdomen keeping your elbows close to the body Squeeze your shoulder blades together as you pull Slowly return to the starting position and repeat

Stand on the band, feet hip-width apart Hold the band with both hands close to each other Pull your hands up to your belly button, squeezing your shoulder blades together Slowly lower your hands back down

Sit on a bench and spread your legs Place the band under your foot and hold the other end with your hand Lower your arm fully and then curl it toward your chest Hold this position for a few seconds and contract your bicep Return to the original position in a slow and controlled manner

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and loop the band around your ankles Keep your core engaged and maintain a slight bend in the knees Lift one foot off the ground and move it outward as far as possible Hold for a second, then slowly bring your foot back to the starting position Switch legs and repeat for desired reps

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and make sure the resistance band is anchored slightly above your ankles Start by standing straight, then step out to one side against the resistance band Simultaneously engage your core and maintain a narrow stance with your other leg Return your leg to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat these motions on the other leg

Stand tall on a resistance band with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the ends of the band in your opposite hands near your thighs with your arms straight. Stretch the band by raising one of your legs to your side, and hold for a while. Return to the initial position and do the same with your other leg.

name_en: Band Cross Body One Arm Chest Press
description_en: Stand perpendicular to the anchor point with your feet hip-width apart and hold the band with one hand Rotate your body as you press the band diagonally across your body until your arm is fully extended Pause for a moment, then slowly return to the starting position Repeat the same with another hand Make sure to complete equal reps on both sides

name_en: Band Cross Body One Arm Chest Press
description_en: Stand upright and place the band under your foot on the side you are going to be working Hold the end of the band in the hand of the same side, then bring the hand up to your shoulder Extend the arm, pushing away from your body Return your hand back to the starting position Repeat

Stand upright and hold the band at waist height with your palms facing up Pull the ends of the band up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body Slowly lower your hands back to the starting position Make sure you fully extend your arms at the bottom of each repetition Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the band with both hands. Extend your arms out straight and at chest level. Slowly bend your elbows and pull the band towards your shoulders. Pause for a moment, then slowly extend your arms and return to the start position. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

Stand on the resistance band with your feet hip-width apart Hold the ends of the band in each hand, your palms facing your body Keep your back flat and bend at your hips and knees to lower your body Press your feet into the ground to stand up straight Lower your body back down to complete one rep

Stand over the band and ensure that the band is beneath the arches of your feet. While keeping your back straight, bend at the hips and knees to grab the band. Extend your hips and knees to lift the band up. Lower the band back to the floor by bending your hips and knees. Repeat this movement for the respective number of sets and repetitions.

Stand tall on a resistance band with your back straight, and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward, lower your hips, bend your knees, and hold the band's handles. Stretch the band by extending your back and straightening your legs. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Secure the band to a sturdy post and lie on an incline bench with the band directly behind you Grip band with both hands and pull overhead With a controlled motion, engage your abs and pull your torso towards your knees Slowly lower back down to the starting position

Securely attach the band to a solid post or object behind you Lie back on the decline bench with your feet down and the band across your chest Engage your abs and bring your torso towards your knees Slowly lower back down towards the start position Repeat for the recommended repetitions

Loop the resistance band around your ankles, and position yourself on your knees Begin by slowly lowering yourself towards the ground, using your hamstrings not your bodyweight to control the movement Lower your upper body until it's almost parallel to the ground While maintaining the tension in your hamstrings, gradually raise your body back up to the starting position Repeat this for the desired set of repetitions
Anchor your band at about chest height Hold the band with both hands, arms extended Pull the band towards your face while keeping elbows high Return to start position in controlled fashion

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and grab the band with an overhand grip Pull the band towards your face while keeping your elbows raised Pinch your shoulder blades together at the end of the pull Return to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the process for the desired amount of reps

Stand facing the band, feet shoulder-width apart Grasp the band with palms facing toward you Pull the band down until your hands are at shoulder height Hold for a second, feeling the contraction in the latissimus dorsi Release and return to the initial position

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart while holding the band Lift your arms straight in front of you until they are parallel to the floor Gradually lower your arms back to the starting position Ensure your arms remain straight throughout the exercise Repeat this movement for the required reps and sets

Stand on the center of your resistance band with feet hip-width apart Hold the ends of the band in each hand with your arms resting at your sides, palms facing in Raise your arms up and out to your sides until they are shoulder height Pause for a second and then slowly lower your arms back down to your sides Repeat this movement for your desired number of repetitions

Stand on the center of the band with feet hip-width apart, holding the ends in each hand Maintain a slight bend in your elbows and raise your arms straight in front of you until they're at shoulder level Pause for a moment at the top before slowly lower your hands back to the starting position Keep the movement controlled throughout the exercise Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand on the band with your feet shoulder-width apart. With your knees slightly bent, hinge at the hips to lower your torso forward. Keep your back flat and neck neutral. Push your hips forward and raise your torso back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Start in a half kneeling position with the band anchored to your side Hold the band with both hands, fully extend your arms while maintaining a neutral wrist position Rotate your torso, pulling the band diagonally upwards reaching towards the opposite side Return to the starting position and repeat for the desired reps Switch to the other side and repeat the exercise

name_en: Band Hammer Grip Incline Bench Two Arm Row
description_en: Attach the band to a sturdy low anchor point. Stand facing the anchor with a slight bend in your knees, lean forward slightly from your hips. Grab the band with palms facing each other, bend your elbows and pull it towards your chest. Slowly extend your arms back out to the start position. Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions.

Stand up straight with a band under your feet and ends in each hand Raise your arms out to your sides until they're at shoulder level Lower your arms back down in a controlled manner Repeat the movement for the suggested number of repetitions Keep your elbows slightly bent throughout

Stand up straight with feet shoulder width apart and hold the band with both hands Extend your arms out on each side at shoulder level Pull both hands towards each other in front of your chest while keeping your arms extended Slowly return your hands to the original position Repeat the movement for the desired number of sets and reps

name_en: Band High Pulley Overhead Triceps Extension
description_en: Attach the band to a high pulley or secure object Stand with feet shoulder-width apart Grasp the band overhead with both hands. Extend your arms fully, focusing on the triceps Slowly return to the starting position in a controlled motion

Fasten the band around your lower legs above the ankles Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, keep your back straight and your hands on your hips or in front of you Raise one leg to the side, keeping the other foot flat on the ground Bring your leg back to the initial position in a controlled motion Repeat for desired reps, then switch to the other leg

Stand on one leg with a band looped around your ankles. Maintaining balance, slowly move your free leg to the side and upward. Hold the motion when you feel tension in your hip and glutes. Slowly return your leg to the starting position. Repeat the process for a set number of repetitions, then switch legs.

Secure the band around your ankle and an anchor point Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Pull your secured leg inward towards your other leg Slowly return your leg back to the start position Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps, then switch legs

Attach a band to a sturdy post or piece of furniture at ankle level Stand next to the post and attach the other end of the band to your ankle Move your working leg inward, in front of your standing leg Control the band as you return your leg to the starting position Repeat for the desired amount of reps before switching sides

Stand tall and tie a band around your ankle. Secure the other end of the band to a low, sturdy object. Move your banded leg forward, maintaining control. Return your leg back to the starting position. Continue the movement for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs.

Stand on the band with your feet shoulder-width apart Hold each end of the band, arms extended in front, palms facing up Bend your elbows and pull the band upward until your hands reach shoulder level Pause at the top and squeeze your biceps Slowly lower your arms to the starting position

Stand on the band, shoulder width apart Hold the band handles with arms fully extended at your sides Bend your elbows and curl the band up towards your shoulder Pause, then slowly return to the starting position Repeat for the desired amount of repetitions

Stand to the side of your anchor point with your feet hip width apart Hold the band with both hands and extend them in front of you, keeping your hands at your chest level Press the band straight out away from your chest and hold for a few seconds Slowly bring your hands back to your chest Repeat the process for your target number of reps

Stand tall with feet split while holding handles of resistance band, palms facing each other Raise one arm, flexing the bicep until the hand is at shoulder level Resist the band as you slowly lower your hand back to starting position Repeat this with the other arm Continue alternating arms, maintaining body stability throughout

Attach the ends of a resistance band to the bottom of a sturdy object like a bench, make sure it's secured Lie on an incline bench and grasp the band with a shoulder-width apart Press upwards until your arms are fully extended Lower your arms slowly back towards your chest in a controlled motion Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Attach a band to a low anchor point, facing the anchor point hold the handles with an underhand grip Step back until tension begins in the band, lean forward leaving your hips stationary and bend your elbows bringing your hands toward your shoulders Pause briefly, then slowly extend your elbows and return to the starting position

Position yourself between two poles with a band attached on each side Grip each band and step forward to create tension With your elbows slightly bent, pull both bands together in front of your chest Hold for a second then slowly return to the starting position Repeat for desired amount of reps

Anchor the band at chest height behind you Hold the ends of the band in each hand with your arms extended Slowly bend your elbows and press forward until arms are completely straight Hold for 1-2 seconds then return to the starting position Continue the movement for desired reps

Secure the band to a sturdy post at a high position Stand away from the post with feet hip-width apart, gripping the band with both hands Extend your arms upward at an angle, pulling the band away from the post Move your hands in a semi-circle motion, meeting above your chest Slowly return your hands to the start position, allowing the band to pull your arms back

Start by securing the band at a low position and then take a step back to create tension Hold the ends of the band, with your palms facing each other Curl upwards while keeping your elbows fixed Pause at the top, then slowly lower your arms back down

Attach bands to a low anchor point. Grab the ends of the bands, step forward with feet shoulder-width apart, and lean slightly forward. Push your arms straight up in a hammer (neutral) grip, keeping your elbows slightly bent. Lower your arms back down to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Secure the band under your feet and stand with a slight bend in your knees. With palms facing each other, hold the bands near your shoulders. Press your arms upward until they are extended. Pause at the top, then slowly return to the starting position. Repeat the motion.

Attach the band at a height above your head. Stand facing the band, grab it with both hands. Pull the band towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body. Hold for a second and then return to the initial position. Repeat this movement for your desired number of repetitions.

Attach the band to a low anchor point Hold the handles and step back, creating tension in the band Keep your torso upright and raise your arms to form a 'T' shape Hold for a moment, and then lower back to the starting position Repeat this motion for the desired number of repetitions

Secure a band under the bottom of a sturdy bench. Lie on the bench on your back and grasp the ends of the band with your hands, keeping your upper arms perpendicular to your body. Keeping your upper arms still, extend your elbows until your arms are fully extended. Return to the initial position by slowly bending your elbows and lowering your hands towards the back of your head.

Stand, feet hip-width apart, holding a band with both hands shoulder-width apart Lean forward until your torso is nearly parallel with the floor Raise your arms in front of you forming a 'Y' shape Lower your arms in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Securely anchor the band at your feet Lie flat on your back on the floor with your knees bent and the resistance band around your ankles Breathe out as you use your abs to bring your hips and knees towards your chest Pause for a moment and slowly return to the starting position as you breathe in Repeat the movement for as many reps as required

Kneel down and secure the band at a point above your head. Grasp the band handles firmly with your hands. Lower your torso toward your knees using your waist muscles to perform the crunch. Return to the starting position and repeat the movement. Increase tension on the band for more resistance. Ensure you keep your hips stationary throughout.

Position the band overhead Kneel down with your back straight and your core engaged Pull the band towards you while bending at the waist Pause at the bottom of the movement, then slowly return to the start position

Secure the band to an anchor at a point higher than your head Kneel down and grab the band with one hand, keeping your arm fully extended Pull the band down to your chest while keeping your elbow close to your body Slowly reverse the movement and return to the starting position Repeat the same for the other arm

Kneel down and secure the band overhead. Grasp the band with one hand. Pull the band down towards your body until your elbow is at your side. Pause for a moment and feel the contraction in your back muscle. Slowly return your arm to the starting position. Repeat the process with the other arm.

Start by kneeling down and tying your band at a low anchor point Place your arms over bent knees in a praying position with the band in your hands Pull the band towards you by bending your elbows After reaching the top, slowly return to the starting position Repeat the movement for desired number of repetitions

Kneel in front of a band that is anchored at medium height. Hold the band with both hands, palms facing upwards. Curl your hands towards your shoulders while keeping your back straight and your upper arms stationary. Return to the starting position, maintaining controlled movement throughout the motion. Repeat the exercise for the desired amount of reps

Kneel on a mat and attach the band around your ankle Keep your arms stationed on the ground as you extend your leg straight back Pull the band by kicking your leg straight back until your hip is fully extended Slowly return to the starting position Repeat this movement with the other leg

Kneel down and hold the band overhead with both hands Pull the band down until your arms are fully extended at your sides Return to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the movement for the desired amount of repetitions Ensure your back remains straight throughout the exercise

Stand up straight with a band under one foot and a handle in each hand. Raise your arms out to the sides until they're at shoulder height. Lower your arms back down to your sides. Repeat the movement for the recommended number of repetitions. Switch sides and repeat the exercise with the other arm.

Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the resistance band underhand at chest level Push one hand away from your chest, extending your arm straight out Pause briefly then return the hand to your chest Repeat on the other side. This is one rep Perform prescribed number of repetitions

Stand with your feet shoulder width apart, step on the center area of the band. Hold the ends of the band at chest level, elbows bent and parallel to the ground. Extend one arm forward, pressing the band away from your chest. Return to the start position and repeat with the other arm. Alternate reps between arms for the set.

Attach the band to a high anchor point and hold an end in each hand Step forward to create tension in the band Keep your arms slightly bent and pull them down and toward each other Squeeze your chest muscles at the point of maximum tension Slowly return to the starting position while maintaining control

Stand upright and hold the bands, one in each hand at shoulder height Press the band outward and slightly downward in front of you until your arms are fully extended Slowly bring the band back to the starting position Control your movements to really engage your chest Repeat this for your desired amount of repetitions

Stand on the center of the band and grasp each end in your hands. Bend your knees slightly and lean forward about 45 degrees. Press your hands forward and together until your arms fully extend. Return your hands to starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat the process for desired number of reps.

Lie down on the floor with the band behind your back Hold the band with both hands using a reverse grip Extend your arms downward to bring your hands towards the floor Pause at the bottom and squeeze your triceps Slowly return to the starting position

Lie on the ground, your feet hip-width apart and loop the band under your back Hold the other ends of the band with both hands extending your arms towards the ceiling Bend your elbows and lower the band towards your forehead Pause and then extend your arms back towards the ceiling Repeat the process for the desired number of reps

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Hold the band handles, palms facing your feet With elbows bent, pull the band towards your chest Lower the band back down in a controlled fashion Repeat for desired number of reps

Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding the ends of the band Extend your arms out to the sides at shoulder level, palms facing forwards Slowly bring your arms towards each other in front of your chest Pause, then slowly return to the starting position

Stand on the band and hold it at waist level Bend your knees slightly and maintain a straight back Pull the band up towards your chest Hold for a moment, then slowly return to the starting position Repeat the movement

Stand on the band with feet shoulder width apart Hold the band handles with palms facing inward Pull your elbows up and back Squeeze your back muscles at the top Slowly lower your arms back to the starting position

Stand on the band with your feet shoulder-width apart Hold the handles of the band with your palms facing each other Pull the band towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body Pause, then slowly lower back to your starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

name_en: Band One Arm Overhead Biceps Curl
description_en: Stand straight and step on the band, holding its end with your right hand Keep your elbow close to your ear as you curl your hand towards the shoulder Pause at the top and then gradually lower your hand Complete your set and then switch arms Maintain a tight core throughout

name_en: Band One Arm Twisting Seated Row
description_en: Start seated, feet shoulder-width apart with the band wrapped around your feet, holding one end in each hand. Keeping your back straight, pull one arm back, twisting your upper body as you do. Pull the band until your arm is fully extended behind you. Slowly return to the starting position and repeat with the other arm. Continue alternating arms for each rep.

name_en: Band One Arm Twisting Seated Row
description_en: Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you, holding the band in one hand Pull the band to your waist level, rotating your torso as you do so Keep your elbows close to your body during the pull Slowly return to the starting position and repeat the exercise with the other hand Mimic the movement of rowing a boat

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold one end of the band in your right hand Lift the band up and overhead, keeping your arm straight and the band tight Bend sideways to the left, keeping your body in a straight line Return to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat on the other side

Stand straight with feet hip-width apart and hold the band with both hands overhead Take the tension of the band by pulling it slightly apart Bend your torso to the side as far as you can while keeping your arms straight Hold the position at your furthest bend, then return to the start position Repeat on the other side and complete the desired repetitions

name_en: Band Overhead Single Arm Triceps Extension
description_en: Stand on a resistance band and hold the other end with one hand Raise your arm overhead, keeping your elbow close to your head Lower your forearm behind your head until it's parallel to the floor Extend your arm overhead Switch arms and repeat

name_en: Band Overhead Single Arm Triceps Extension
description_en: Stand on one end of the band with one foot and grasp the other end with the hand on the same side Extend your arm straight up above your head Bend your elbow and lower the band behind your head Extend your elbow, raising the band back up Repeat the movement for your desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm

name_en: Band Overhead Single Arm Triceps Extension
description_en: Stand on the band with one foot and hold the other end with your hand Extend your arm upward until it is fully straight Lower the band in a controlled fashion until your forearm is near horizontal Repeat the movement with the alternate arm

name_en: Band Overhead Single Arm Triceps Extension
description_en: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, securely step on one end of the band Hold the other end of the band with one hand and extend it above your head Bend your elbow, lowering the band behind your head Straighten your arm upwards, contracting the triceps Repeat the movement for the specified number of repetitions, then switch arms

Stand tall and hold the band behind your back, hands shoulder-width apart Extend your arms overhead, keeping your elbows static Slowly lower your hands behind your head, bending at the elbows Stretch your arms back to the starting position, keeping your elbows in place Repeat the movement for the desired amount of reps

Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the other end of the band with both hands above your head. Keeping your elbows close to your head, extend your arms until they are fully stretched out. Slowly lower your hands back to the starting position behind your head. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Stand on the band, ensuring it's beneath the arch of both feet Hold the other end of the band behind your head with both hands Raise your hands to extend your arms fully above your head Lower your hands behind the head in a controlled motion Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps

Stand on one end of the band, holding the other end with both hands Extend your arms straight up towards the ceiling Keeping your elbows stationary, bend your arms and lower the band behind your head Extend your arms back to the starting position Repeat for desired number of repetitions

Position yourself face down on an incline bench Hold the band at full extension, shoulder width apart Curl your hands towards your shoulders by flexing the elbows Maintain this position for a moment then extend your arms to return to the start position Repeat the exercise according to your training schedule

Secure a band under your feet and place your chest on a bench set at an inclined position. With palms facing each other, hold the band. Slowly curl your hands towards your shoulders. Hold the position at tension peak for a second. Slowly lower the band back to the starting position.

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and grasp the resistance band with both hands. Stretch your arms out directly in front of you, band in hand. Slowly pull the band apart, moving your hands outward and squeezing your shoulder blades together. Hold this position briefly. Return to the starting position, letting the tension on the band guide you back.

Stand facing away from the band with feet shoulder-width apart, band should be at knee level Bend over and grab the band between your legs Give the band a good pull forward, keeping your back straight and your core strong Drive your hips forward to standing position and squeeze your glutes Return to the starting position slowly and under control

Stand with your feet shoulder width apart with the band between your legs and the ends secured tightly behind you Bend forward at the hips, reaching back through your legs for the band Retaining a slight bend in the knees, stand up straight by extending your hips Pull the band up and through your legs until your body forms a straight line Lower the band back down and repeat

Stand in an upright position and anchor the band overhead Maintain a slightly less than shoulder-width grip with both hands Keeping your elbows stationary, press the band down straight by extending your arms Lower the band back up to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart. Securely anchor the band overhead Grasp the band with both hands above your head, arms fully extended Keeping your upper arms stationary, bend your elbows to pull the band down until your arms are fully extended Pause at the bottom of the movement, then slowly return to the starting position Repeat for the prescribed number of repetitions

Place the band around your back below your shoulder blades Get into standard push-up position with the band under your hands Lower your body to the floor while keeping your core engaged Push your body back to the original position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand on the middle of the band, feet shoulder-width apart Hold the band handles with palms facing in Bend slightly at the waist, keeping your back straight Pull the bands up towards your chest, while pinching your shoulder blades together Slowly return to the start position

Secure the band at the bottom of a door or with a door anchor Lie with your back flat on the floor and grab the band with both hands, stretching it over your head Place your feet in the middle of the band and extend your legs out away from your body in a 'V' shape Keeping your back pressed against the floor, bring your knees towards your chest and then lower them back down Repeat the movement for your desired amount of reps

Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Loop the resistance band around your feet and hold it with both hands by your sides With your core engaged and back flat on the floor, pull your knees towards your chest Pause at the top, then gently lower your feet back towards the floor Repeat the process maintaining tension on the band throughout the whole exercise

Stand upright with a band in both hands in front of your stomach With arms extended, pull the band apart out to the sides Keep the arms extended and the movement controlled Return your hands to the start position slowly, maintaining tension in the band Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand upright and hold the band with both hands out in front Pull your arms apart and back until they're extented on each side of your body Hold that position for a moment Slowly return to the starting position Repeat this movement for the desired amount of repetitions

Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width apart, holding one end in each hand With palms facing toward you, curl your hands towards your shoulders When your hands are near your shoulders, hold for 1-2 seconds Release the curl in a controlled manner, extending your arms fully Repeat the movement

Hold the resistance band at shoulder width with your palms facing down Curl your wrists up toward the ceiling while keeping your arms still Pause at the top for a moment before returning back to the starting position Ensure your forearms stay parallel to the floor throughout the movement Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions

Sit with your legs slightly bent, with the band looped around your ankles Rotate your leg outward while keeping your knee still Hold this position at maximum for a few seconds Return your leg to its original position Repeat with the other leg

Sit down and fix a band around your foot on the side you wish to work Secure the other end of the band to a stationary object With your knee bent to 90 degrees, rotate your hip from your knee, pulling your foot outward Hold this position for a short while, then slowly rotate your hip back, guiding your foot inward

Sit on a chair or bench with your feet firmly on the ground With the band under your feet, hold one end in each hand With a slight bend in your elbows, raise your arms to the sides until they're level with your shoulders Lower your arms back down in a controlled manner Repeat the movement for your recommended sets and reps

Sit on the edge of a chair with one loop of the band placed around an ankle and the other around the chair's foot Extend your leg so it's in line with the rest of your body Ensure you're focusing on squeezing your quadriceps Slowly lower your leg back to the starting position Repeat this movement for the desired amount of repetitions, then switch legs

Secure the resistance band around a sturdy pole or similar object Sit on the floor with your legs stretched out and wrap the resistance band around your ankles Keep your back straight, pull your ankles back towards your upper leg Extend your leg forward again in a slow and controlled manner Repeat this process for your desired amount of repetitions

name_en: Band Seated Neutral Grip Shoulders Press
description_en: Sit upright on a bench and hold the band with both hands at shoulder level Keep your back flat against the bench Press the band upwards until your arms are fully extended Hold for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your hands to the starting position Repeat this for the required amount of reps

Sit on the floor with your legs extended, place the band around your feet Hold the band with an overhand grip, sitting up straight Pull the band towards your abdomen, with your elbows bent and close to your body Hold this position for a moment before slowly releasing back to the starting position Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions

Sit on the ground and extend your legs in front of you, keeping them slightly bent Anchor your band around something stable at your feet level and hold the ends of the band with each hand Pull the band towards your waist by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together Hold the contraction for a second Return slowly to the starting position by extending your arms

Sit down with band wrapped around your foot Hold the other end of the band with palms facing away from you Press the band until your arms are fully extended Lower the band back to your starting position Repeat this for the required amount of repetitions

Sit on the floor with your legs extended, place the center of the band around the soles of your feet Hold onto the ends of the band with outstretched arms Pull the band towards you while keeping your back straight until hands reach your abdomen Pause for a moment, then slowly release the band back to starting position Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Stand on the middle of the band, hold its ends in your hands With a straight back, raise your shoulders towards your ears as high as possible Hold for a brief moment at the top Lower your shoulders back to the initial position

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, band under one foot and hold the other end with the hand on the same side Bend to the side opposite of the band, keeping your body straight Hold for a moment at the point of tension Return to the starting position Repeat for a set of reps, and switch side

Stand on one end of the band, with feet hip-width apart. Hold the other end of the band with one hand, your arm should be fully extended. Bend your upper body to the side, away from the band, and then return to the starting position. Repeat desired amount of repetitions. Switch sides after set is complete.

Stand on your resistance band with your feet hip width apart Hold one end of the band in the hand of your working arm, keeping the other hand at your waist Raise your hand upwards towards the ceiling while keeping your elbow slightly bent Lower your hand to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the movement with the other arm

Place the band under your back foot while holding the ends of the band with both hands Lower your body into a split squat position by bending your front knee Push up through the front heel to return to the starting position Repeat the movement on the other leg Keep alternating between the two legs for a set amount of time

name_en: Band Single Leg Split Squat with Low Box
description_en: Stand with your back to a low box, with a resistance band looped around your thighs. Extend one leg and place the top of your foot on the box behind you. Bend your standing leg, lowering yourself into a split squat. Your front knee should be in line with your front foot. Squeeze your glutes and push through your front heel to return to the starting position. Repeat the process with the other leg.

name_en: Band Single Leg Split Squat with the Ring
description_en: Secure the resistance band at ankle level and stand facing away from its anchor point Step one foot forward into a split stance, keeping the other foot's toe looped in the band Lower yourself down into a squat, keeping your chest up and core engaged Push back up to the start position by extending your front leg Repeat for the other leg after completing the desired number of reps

Lie down on a flat bench and extend your arms directly above Hold the band taut, elbows locked Lower the band behind your head, keeping your elbows stationary Contract your triceps to return your arms to the starting position Repeat the motion for desired number of repetitions

Stand on a resistance band with your feet positioned shoulder-width apart. Hold the other end of the band in your hands and raise your hands to shoulder height. Lower your body into a squat position as if sitting back into a chair. Pause for a moment, then push back up to the starting position, maintaining tension on the band. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Stand on the band, feet shoulder-width apart and hold the band at shoulder height Lower your body until your front thigh is parallel to the ground Push yourself back up to the starting position Repeat the action with the other leg Continue alternating legs for the full number of reps

Stand on a resistance band with your feet shoulder-width apart, with the band under your arches and handles by your sides Lower your body into a squat, pushing your hips back and bending your knees Pause at the bottom of the movement, maintaining tension in the band Push back through your heels to stand, keeping your chest lifted Repeat the exercise for your targeted number of reps

Stand on the resistance band with your feet shoulder-width apart Hold the other end of the band at your shoulder level Bend your knees and lower your hips down into a squat position Hold the squat briefly, then push back up to your starting position

Stand on resistance band with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the handles at chest height Perform a squat by bending at your knees and lower body As you rise up, rotate upper body at waist to one side Perform another squat and this time rotating to the opposite side Repeat sequence for recommended reps

Stand on a resistance band and grasp the handles with the hands. Drop into a squat, keeping your back straight and chest out. As you stand back up, rotate your torso to one side. Repeat the squat, this time rotating your torso to the opposite side. Continue alternating sides with each squat.

Stand on the band, feet shoulder-width apart With your palms facing upward, hold the ends of the band Bend your elbows and pull the band up until your hands reach shoulder height Pause briefly then slowly lower the band back to the starting position Repeat this process for a desired number of reps

Stand on the center of the band with feet shoulder-width apart Grasp handles with palms facing forward Curl the handles up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows steady Hold for a moment to contract the biceps Slowly lower the handles back to start position

Stand on the center of the band, feet shoulder-width apart. Hold an end of the band in each hand, arms fully extended, palms facing forward. Curl one arm, bringing the band up to your shoulder. Slowly release and lower the band, then repeat with the other arm. Continue to alternate curls between each arm.

Stand on the middle of the band with one foot and the other foot a step behind Hold the band, one end in each hand, at chest level Press one hand forward, fully extending your arm Return hand to chest level and switch to the other hand Repeat this, alternating between hands

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and band looped around your back Hold the ends of the band so your hands are parallel to the floor Extend one arm out in front of you Slowly return your arm back to the starting position Repeat the action with the other arm

Stand on the center of the resistance band with feet shoulder width apart, holding the ends of the band in each hand, arms fully extended and palms facing forward Slowly bend your elbows and curl your hands towards your shoulders, while keeping your upper arms still Pause at the top of the curl, focusing on the contraction in your biceps Slowly lower your hands back down to the starting position Repeat

Stand on the center of the band with feet shoulder-width apart, with the band handles in each hand Extend your hands forward and press the band straight out in front of your chest Keep your core tight and bend your knees slightly Slowly return your hands to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand on the middle of the band, hold the end of the band in each hand Extend your arms in front of you at chest level, palms down Push your hands forward, keeping your arms parallel to the floor until they are fully extended Slowly return your hands to the starting position Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Attach the band at high level on a secure point, turn your back to it Grasp the ends of the band with both hands and bring your hands near your ears Crunch your torso forward while slightly bending at your waist Pause for a moment, then slowly return to the starting position Repeat the movement for a set number of reps

Stand upright and step on the band so that it's under your feet Bring the other end of the band behind your head Bend at the waist and pull the band downwards in a crunching motion Straighten your waist to return to standing position Repeat the motion

Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart Hold onto the ends of the band, palms facing inward Curl your arms upward, maintaining the inward palm position Squeeze your biceps at the top Lower your arms back down in a controlled motion

Secure the band around your ankles Stand up straight with a slight bend in the knee Extend one leg back and up while keeping the torso straight and hips square Hold for a moment at the top of the extension Return to the starting position and repeat with other leg

Stand on the band with one foot and wrap the other end around your raised ankle Keep your knees straight and slowly push your raised leg back until it is extended straight behind you Pause briefly and then slowly return your leg to the starting position Keep your core tight and your back straight during this exercise Switch legs and repeat

Start by securing the band at ankle height, then attach the band to your ankle Stand up straight, hold onto a sturdy object for balance if needed Keep your body still and bend one knee, pulling your heel up towards your glute Slowly lower your foot back down to the initial position Repeat this on both legs for the set amount of repetitions

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and loop the band around your ankle Secure the other end of the band under your other foot Starting from an upright position, pull your heel back towards your buttocks using the band Slowly extend your leg back to the starting position Repeat for the desired reps and then switch legs

Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a band firmly in each hand Begin with your arms extended in front of you at shoulder height Pull the band apart, drawing your hands outwards and back, keeping your arms at shoulder height Squeeze the shoulder blades together for a moment before returning to the initial position Control the return movement, maintaining resistance in the band

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart and the band firmly under your feet Hold the band handles tightly with your palms facing down Pull the handles up towards your chest in a rowing motion Lower the handles back down to your thighs in a controlled motion Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width apart. Using an underhand grip, hold the ends of the band. Curl your hands toward your shoulders, keeping your upper arms still. Slowly lower your hands back to the starting position. Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps.

name_en: Band Standing Single Arm Biceps Curl
description_en: Stand on the centre of the resistance band with feet hip width apart. Hold one end of the band with your palms facing forward. Bend your elbow and curl your hand towards your shoulder. Pause and contract your biceps at the top of the curl. Slowly lower your hand back to the starting position.

name_en: Band Standing Single Arm Twist Row
description_en: Stand on the band with your feet shoulder-width apart Hold one end of the band on your opposite hand Rotate your torso and pull the band to your side, as though you're rowing Pause for a moment, and return to the starting position Repeat the movement with the other arm

Stand in front of a raised platform or step, with a resistance band looped around your ankles With your chest upright, step forward and up onto the platform with one foot ensuring good tension on the band Push through the foot on the platform until standing upright Reverse the movement and step carefully back to starting position Repeat this motion, alternating between legs.

While seated, straddle your band and reach forward to grab the ends With your back straight and chest lifted, pull the band towards your torso Slowly extend your arms back out, controlling the movement Repeat the pull and release for several repetitions Please take a break after a set and switch to the next when ready

Sit on the floor with your legs extended forward, place the band around the soles of your feet Keep your back straight and pull the band towards your waist Squeeze your shoulder blades together when you reach the end Slowly return to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

name_en: Band straight back stiff leg deadlift
description_en: Stand on the resistance band with feet shoulder-width apart Hold the band handles at hip level Hinge at your hips, keeping your back straight and knees slightly bent, go as far as comfortable Slowly return to the starting position, squeezing the glutes at top Repeat the exercise for the desired number of sets and reps

name_en: Band Straight Back Stiff Leg Deadlift
description_en: Stand on the resistance band with feet hip-width apart Hold the other end of the band with both hands Lower your upper body while keeping your back straight and legs stiff, until you feel a stretch in the back of your legs Raise your upper body back to the original position Repeat the movement

Stand on the band with your feet shoulder width apart Hold the bands at shoulder level with palms facing each other Descend into a half squat Quickly extend your hips and legs while pressing your arms straight up Return to the starting position in a controlled manner

Stand on a resistance band with feet shoulder width apart, holding the band at shoulder level Perform a squat, keeping your knees over your toes Stand back up to full extension and press your arms straight up overhead Slowly lower your arms down and repeat the process

Stand on the band while holding an end in each hand Bend at the waist and keep your back straight until your torso is almost parallel to the floor Keep your upper arms close to your body and at 90 degrees to your torso Extend your arms back until they are fully extended Slowly return your arms to the starting position

Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold the ends of the band in each hand. Bend forward at your waist so that your torso is almost parallel to the floor. Pull your elbow up to your side, keeping your arm bent at 90 degrees. Extend your arm behind you until it's straight, contracting the triceps. Slowly return to the start position and repeat the movement.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the band with both hands extended in front of you Twist your upper body to one side, while keeping your lower body stationary Hold this position for a few seconds Return to the start position Repeat the twist to the other side

Stand upright and secure the band at waist level Hold the ends of the band with both hands and turn your torso to one side while pushing your arms forward Return to the starting position Repeat the same movement on the other side Perform the desired number of repetitions on each side

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart, holding the band with both hands in front of you at chest height Keeping your arms straight, rotate your torso to the right as far as you can Hold the position for a second, then return to the starting position Repeat the movement on the left side Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, band under your feet Hold the band with both hands, extend your arms in front of your chest Twist your upper body to the right, keeping your legs and hips stable Return to the starting position Repeat the movement to the other side
Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Hold the band with both hands, extending arms straight out in front Turn your torso to the right, then to the left, keeping your arms straight

name_en: Band Two Legs Calf Raise - VERSION 2
description_en: Stand on the resistance band with your feet shoulder-width apart Hold the ends of the band in your hands at waist level Raise your body as high as you can on your tiptoes Pause at the top, squeezing your calf muscles Slowly lower your body back down

name_en: Band Two Legs Calf Raise - VERSION 2
description_en: Position the band under both of your feet Rise onto the balls of your feet while lifting your heels as high as possible Hold the position for a second Slowly lower your heel back to the ground Repeat the assigned number of reps

Securely attach the resistance band at a high point. Sit on the ground a few feet away, grabbing the band handles with your hands straight above your head. While keeping your arms straight, pull down on the band using your upper body, bending at the waist. Engage your core to crunch upwards, feeling the tension in your abdomen. Slowly return to the start position, maintaining the tension in the band.

Attach the band above your head and kneel down. Hold the band behind your neck with both hands. Curl your body downward and attempt to touch your elbows to your thighs. Hold the position for a few seconds. Slowly return to the starting position.

Stand on a resistance band with feet shoulder-width apart Hold the ends of the band with palms facing your body Pull the band upwards towards your chin, keeping your elbows high and at shoulder height Pause at the top and then lower your hands back down to start position Perform your desired amount of repetitions

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the band with both hands Extend the arms out and rotate them back, stretching the band Keep your arms straight and slow to ensure a good stretch Try to pull the band apart as you do the exercise Return to the starting position and repeat

Stand upright while holding one end of the band in each hand Stretch your arms out in front of you with elbows slightly bent Slowly pull the band apart to the sides and across your chest Hold the stretch for a few seconds Return to the starting position slowly

Sit on a flat bench with your feet firmly on the floor. Hold the resistance band in both hands with palms facing upward Rest your forearms on your upper thighs to support them, with your wrists and hands hanging over your knees Simultaneously curl both wrists upward towards your body, flexing your wrist as much as possible Slowly lower your hands back to the starting position Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart on the center of the resistance band. Hold the ends in each hand. Raise your arms up and out to form a 'Y' shape. Hold for a second then slowly lower your arms back down. Repeat the movement for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Stand up straight with a barbell in each hand at arm's length. Keep your elbows close to your torso While holding the upper arm stationary, curl the right weight while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Continue the movement until your biceps is fully contracted and the barbell is at shoulder level Hold the contracted position for a brief moment as you squeeze the biceps Slowly begin to bring the barbell back to original position as your breathe in Repeat the movement with the left hand

Stand upright and hold a barbell in front of you at waist level with a wide grip Keep your shoulders relaxed and raise your shoulders up towards your ears Gently lower your shoulders back down to your starting position Repeat this motion without rolling your shoulders or using your arms
Lie back on a flat bench holding a barbell Lower the barbell until it touches your chest Press the barbell back up to the starting position Repeat for the recommended amount of reps

name_en: Barbell Behind the Back Push Press
description_en: Stand upright and hold the barbell behind your back shoulder-width apart Bend your knees slightly and then explosively push upwards While pushing upwards, extend your arms raising the barbell over your head Lower the barbell down to the starting position in a controlled manner

Stand up straight with a barbell behind your back, hand shoulder width apart. Raise your shoulders up as far as you can go as you breathe out. Hold the contraction at the top for a second, the slowly return to the initial position as you breathe in. These constitute one rep. Repeat for advised amount.

Stand up straight while holding a barbell on your upper back. Step up onto a bench or platform with one leg. Push through the heel of your raised foot to lift your other foot off the floor. Lower your body back onto the floor in a controlled manner.

Lie down on a bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet resting on the floor. Grab a barbell over your chest with your elbows dipped under the bench, hands placed wider than the shoulder width, and palms facing forward. Raise the barbell by straightening your arms. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Lie flat on your back on the bench. Hold the bar at a distance greater than shoulder width. Lower the bar to your middle chest while inhaling. Press the bar back to the starting position while exhaling. Repeat the process for the number of sets and reps you're performing. Ensure your feet remain flat on the ground throughout the exercise.

Lie flat on your back on a bench, feet firmly on the floor. Grip the barbell with hands slightly wider than shoulder width. Lower the barbell to your middle chest. Push the bar back up to the starting position. Repeat the movement for your intended number of repetitions.

Lie down on a decline bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet fixed against the padded bars. Grab a barbell over the chest with your elbows dipped under the bench, hands placed wider than the shoulder width, and palms facing forward. Raise the barbell by straightening your arms.

Lie down on an incline bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet resting on the floor. Grab a barbell over your upper chest with your elbows dipped under the bench, hands placed wider than the shoulder width, and palms facing forward. Raise the barbell by straightening your arms. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Lie down on a flat bench with your feet comfortably planted on the ground Hold the barbell above your chest with your palms facing away from you Lower the barbell to your chest in a controlled movement Press the barbell back up until your arms are straight but not locked Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and the barbell resting across your upper back Bend at your hips and knees to lower down into a squat Ensure your back remains flat and torso upright Continue down until your thighs are parallel to the floor Push through your heels to stand and return to the starting position

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and the barbell resting across your shoulder blades Lower your body by bending at the hips and knees until your thighs are parallel to the floor Ensure that your knees don't pass over your toes Pause briefly at the bottom before pushing back up to the starting position Repeat the movement for the desired number of sets and reps

Stand tall near a bench with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a barbell at your shoulders behind your neck with your palms facing forward. Lower your hips on the bench while bending your knees and keeping your feet fixed. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie back on a bench, gripping the barbell with your hands shoulder width apart Bend the elbows slightly and lower the bar behind your head Pull the barbell back over your head without bending your elbows further Extend your arms fully at the end of the movement, then lower the barbell down in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Hold a barbell with an overhand grip and stand with feet shoulder-width apart Bend at your hips and knees, maintaining a straight back Raise the barbell until your arms are parallel to the floor Lower the barbell in a controlled manner back to starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand straight and hold the barbell at hip level Bend over until your body is nearly parallel to the ground Pull the barbell towards your chest Hold the position briefly, then lower the barbell back to start position

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the barbell with a double overhand grip Lean forward from your hips, not your waist, until your torso is almost parallel with the floor Pull the barbell toward your torso, keeping your elbows tucked in Lower the barbell in a controlled manner until your arms are fully extended Repeat the motion

name_en: Barbell bent over row pronated grip
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and your feet shoulder-width apart Lean forward and grab a barbell in front of your thigh with your arms straight, hands placed shoulder-width apart, and palms facing forward. Maintain this position and bring the barbell towards your belly by bending your arms and taking your elbows backwards Return to the starting position slowly and repeat

name_en: Barbell bent over row supinated grip
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and your feet shoulder-width apart Lean forward and grab a barbell in front of your thigh with your arms straight, hands placed shoulder-width apart, and palm facing your body. Maintain this position and bring the barbell towards your belly by bending your arms and taking your elbows backwards

name_en: Barbell Bent Over Wide Grip Row
description_en: Stand and hold the barbell with a wide, overhand grip Bend over at your hips with your knees slightly bent Pull the barbell towards your upper waist Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the barbell near your thighs with an underhand grip, straight arms, and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell towards the shoulders by folding your arms. As it reaches shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall near a knee-high box with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a barbell at your shoulders behind your neck with your palms facing forward. Lower your hips on the box while bending your knees and keeping your feet fixed.

Place the barbell on your shoulders just below the neck Stand in front of a sturdy box or bench that is about knee height Slowly squat down until your glutes touch the box Pause for a moment before pushing back up to standing position Repeat the movement for your desired number of repetitions

Stand 2-3 feet in front of a bench, extend one of your legs backward, and rest your toes on it. Stand upright in this position and hold a barbell on your shoulders just behind your neck. Lower your bent knee to the floor while bending your front knee. As your front thigh nearly comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position, and repeat.

name_en: Barbell Bulgarian Split Squat Left Front-Back View
description_en: Stand 2-3 feet in front of a knee-high platform, extend one of your legs backward, and rest your toes on it. Stand upright in this position and hold a barbell on your shoulders just behind your neck. Lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. Return to the initial position, and repeat.

name_en: Barbell Bulgarian Split Squat Left Side View
description_en: Stand 2-3 feet in front of a knee-high platform, extend one of your legs backward, and rest your toes on it. Stand upright in this position and hold a barbell on your shoulders just behind your neck. Lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. Return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie on your back on a bench with a barbell rack Place your hands on the barbell shoulder-width apart Lift the bar from the rack until your arms are fully extended above your chest Lower the barbell to your chest in a controlled manner Push the bar back up to the start position

Lie back on a flat bench holding a barbell in the rack above you with a shoulder-width grip. Lower the bar straight down to your chest. Push the bar back to the starting position. Keep your wrists straight and your elbows slightly bent at all times. Repeat this pattern for the remainder of the exercise.

name_en: Barbell Chest Bench Press - Grip Width
description_en: Lie down on your back on the flat bench. Hold the barbell over your chest with arms fully extended. Lower the barbell to your chest in a controlled manner. Press the barbell back up until your arms are straight. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and grip the barbell Raise the barbell to your thighs, then lift it to your chest in a fluid movement In a swift move, press the barbell over your head until your arms are fully extended Lower the barbell back to your front and repeat

name_en: Barbell Clean And Jerk Split Squat
description_en: Stand near a barbell and hold it by leaning forward and bending your knees with your hands wider than your shoulders. Raise the barbell to your knees while raising your hips, then take the barbell to your chest while coming under it. Straighten your legs and raise the barbell while extending your arms overhead, taking a step back with your knees bent, and finally, stand tall. Return to the starting position step by step and repeat.

Start with feet hip-width apart, holding the barbell at your shins Use your hips, glutes and thighs to power the barbell upwards, catching it at your shoulders Dip your knees slightly and push the barbell overhead Hold for a moment, then lower the barbell back to your shoulders and finally down to your shins

Stand with the barbell on the floor in front of you, feet shoulder-width apart Bend your knees and hips, gripping the bar just wider than your knees In one smooth motion, stand erect and pull the barbell up to your shoulders Dip slightly at your knees, then in another smooth motion, push the barbell overhead by extending your arms Lower the barbell back down to your shoulders, and then return it to the floor

Stand near a barbell and hold it by leaning forward and bending your knees with your hands wider than your shoulders. Raise the barbell to your knees while raising your hips, then take the barbell to your chest by bringing your elbows under it and straightening your legs. As your legs become straight, take the barbell overhead by extending your arms. Return to the starting position step by step and repeat.

Stand near a barbell and hold it by leaning forward, lowering your hips, and bending your knees with your hands shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell by lifting your hips and forming a standing position. Return to the starting position and repeat.

Stand over the barbell so that it is aligned with the balls of your feet. Bend your knees and hips so that you can grab the bar. Keep your back straight and look forward as you lift the barbell off the ground to a standing position. Lower the barbell back down to the ground under control. Repeat this movement for the desired amount of reps.

Stand up straight with a barbell positioned over the front of your shoulders, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart Bend your knees and hips to lower your body, as if sitting back into a chair Go down until your thighs are parallel to the floor Push back up to the starting position through your quadriceps and glutes Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the barbell on your front shoulders. Bend your knees and lower your body into a squat position. Keep going down until your thighs are parallel with the floor. Push through your heel to stand up again to the start position. Repeat the squats for your desired number of reps.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a barbell over your chest just under your chin, arms folded, elbows close to your torso, and palms facing the ceiling. Lower the barbell by taking your hips to the floor while bending your knees. As your thighs come nearly parallel to the floor, return to the starting position, and repeat.

Stand tall with feet hip-width apart, holding the barbell in an overhand grip Bend your knees and hips to lower the barbell towards your shins Explosively stand up, pulling the barbell upwards to chest level with elbows high Return to the starting position and repeat the movement

Stand near a barbell and hold it by leaning forward and bending your knees with your hands shoulder-width apart. Pull the barbell to your chest by raising your hips and bringing your chest out. As the barbell reaches the mid of the torso, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, with the barbell resting just above your shins Bend at the knees and hips to grip the barbell Lift the bar by extending your hips and knees Once the bar reaches knee height, explosively extend your hips and shrug your shoulders Lower the barbell back to the floor in a controlled manner

Lie down on a bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Hold a barbell over your chest with your hands placed close, palms facing forward, and elbows opened wide to your sides. Raise the barbell while extending your arms. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Lie back on a flat bench with a barbell in your hands at shoulder width Lower the barbell to your chest while keeping your elbows close to your body Push the barbell back up until your arms are fully extended Pause at the top then lower the barbell back down in a slow, controlled motion Repeat for the prescribed number of repetitions

Lie down on your back on a flat bench and grip the barbell a little closer than shoulder width Lower the barbell until it is about an inch from your chest Press the barbell back up until your arms are completely extended Hold for a moment at the top, then lower the barbell back down Repeat this process for the desired number of repetitions

Lie on a flat bench with your feet up on the bench Hold the barbell with a close grip, lower it to lower chest Push the bar up in a straight line until your elbows are locked out Return the bar to the starting position near your lower chest by bending the elbows Push bar back up to the starting position, locking out the elbows

Lie down on a bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Hold a barbell over your chest with your hands placed close, palms facing forward, and arms folded at your sides. Raise the barbell while extending your arms. As your arms become straight, slowly return to the initial position and repeat.

Position a barbell across your shoulders, standing with feet wider than hip-width apart. Turn one foot outwards and squat on that leg while keeping the other leg straight. Maintain your heels on the ground as much as possible. Push up to return to the starting position. Repeat on the other side.

Stand up straight with a barbell at arms length. This will be your starting position. While keeping the upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the barbell is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position while squeezing the biceps for a brief pause. Then inhale and slowly begin to lower the barbell back to the starting position.

Stand up straight with a barbell, palms facing forward Keeping the elbows close to the torso, curl the weights while contracting your biceps Raise the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the barbell is at shoulder level Hold this position for a short pause, then slowly bring back the barbell to starting position

Start with standing upright and holding the barbell at your thighs Curl the barbell up to your chest, bending at the elbows Press the barbell up overhead, extending your arms fully Lower the bar back down to chest level Return the barbell back to your thighs in a controlled manner
