Position the barbell across your upper back, securing it with your hands shoulder-width apart Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Take a step back with your right foot and cross it behind your left Bend your knees to lower your body as far down as comfortable Push back up to the starting position and repeat with the opposite leg

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a barbell behind your neck. Take a step back with your right foot and place it behind your left leg. Bend your knees and lower down unless your left thigh is parallel to the floor. Return to the initial position and repeat by stepping back with your other foot.

Stand tall near a barbell with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward and grab the barbell with an overhand grip and hands shoulder-width apart while bending your knees and lowering your hips. Raise the barbell by straightening your knees and bringing your chest out.

Stand with feet hip-width apart, toes under barbell Bend at your hips and knees and grasp the bar with an overhand grip Keep your chest up, pull shoulders back, and look straight ahead as you lift the bar Hold for a second at the top and then lower the bar back to the ground

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and the barbell over your mid-foot Bend at your hips and knees while grabbing the bar Keep your back straight and lift the bar by standing up Hold this position, then return the bar to the floor

Stand with your feet hip-width apart, with the barbell in front of your feet Bend at your hips and knees, grasp the barbell with an overhand grip Lift the barbell by straightening your hips and knees, keep your chest up and shoulders back Lower the barbell by bending your hips and knees until it reaches the floor Keep your back straight during the duration of the exercise

Stand with feet hip-width apart with the barbell over midfoot Bend at your hips and knees to grab the bar with a shoulder-width grip Lift the barbell by straightening your hips and knees until you're standing upright Lower the bar by bending at the hips first, and then at the knees

Stand tall near a barbell with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward and grab the barbell with an overhand grip and hands shoulder-width apart while bending your knees and lowering your hips. Raise the barbell by straightening your knees and bringing your chest out.

Position yourself standing over the barbell so it's directly over your midfoot Bend at the hips and knees to grab the barbell with a shoulder width grip Lift the barbell by extending your hips and knees until you're standing upright Lower the barbell back to the blocks in a controlled manner Reset your position and prepare yourself for the next lift

Place the barbell on elevated surface Stand in front of the barbell, feet hip-width apart Bend at your hips and knees, reach down and grab the bar Keeping your back straight, rise to standing using your hips, pulling the barbell along with you Reverse the movement to place the barbell back down, maintaining the straightness of the back throughout

Lie down on a decline bench with your feet secured at the top. Hold the barbell with an overhand grip, straight above your chest. Lower the bar down to your chest in a controlled manner. Press the bar back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Position yourself on a decline bench, making sure your feet are secure Hold the barbell above your chest with a grip slightly wider than shoulder width Lower the barbell to your mid-chest in a controlled manner Press the barbell back up to the starting position without locking your elbows Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Lie on a decline bench with your feet secured at the top of the bench. Extend your arms forward holding a barbell above your chest with a shoulder width, overhand grip. Keeping your arms straight, lower the barbell backward over your head until you feel your chest muscles being stretched. Pull the barbell back over you to the starting position by contracting the chest muscles. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Lie down on a decline bench making sure your head is lower than your hip. Hold the barbell with an overhand grip and extend your arms straight over your chest. Lower the barbell in an arching motion behind your head until you feel a stretch in your chest. Return the barbell in the same arching motion to the starting position. Repeat the movements for your desired sets and repetitions

Position the barbell in line with your legs on a decline bench Bend slightly forward and grasp the barbell with an overhand grip Raise your shoulders as high as possible Pause for a moment at the top Slowly lower back to the initial position

Stand tall with feet hip width apart and grip the barbell Hinge at your hips and slightly bend your knees, lowering the barbell towards your knees Securely straighten your hips and knees, bringing the barbell back to stand position Repeat the movement as many times as necessary

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the barbell near your thighs with an underhand grip, straight arms, and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell towards the chest by folding your arms and taking your elbows past your back. As the barbell reaches near your chest, slowly return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the barbell near the thighs with an underhand grip, straight arms, and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell by folding your arms and taking your elbows past your back. As it reaches near the chest, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand up straight holding a barbell in both hands at your thighs. While keeping your elbows close to your body, slowly lift the barbell to your chest. Make sure to keep the barbell as close to your body as possible during the lift. Pause at the top when the barbell is at chest level. Slowly lower the barbell back down to your thighs.

Stand upright with your feet shoulder width apart and hold a barbell with palms facing up Keep your elbows tucked into your sides Raise the barbell to your chest, keeping it against your body Hold for a moment, then slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Lie on your back on a bench with your feet flat on the floor Grip the barbell with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart Lower the barbell to your chest in a controlled manner Push the barbell up until your arms are fully extended Pause for a moment and then repeat the movement

Place the barbell across your upper thighs while sitting on the floor with legs stretched out Raise your heels off the floor while keeping your toes touching the floor Hold for a while at the top when calves are fully contracted Lower your heels back to the floor slowly Repeat the process

Lie down on the floor with your face up and legs extended. Hold a barbell over your chest with your hands double shoulder-width apart, palms facing up, and elbows opened wide to your sides. Raise the barbell while extending your arms. As your arms become straight, slowly return to the initial position and repeat.

Lay flat on the floor, holding the barbell above your chest with an overhand grip Lower the barbell to your chest in a controlled motion Press the barbell back up until your arms are fully extended Hold for a moment, then start the next repetition Repeat the exercise for the number of repetitions in your set

Stand upright with a barbell resting on your front shoulders Bend at your hips and knees to lower your body as if you're sitting down Pause at the bottom, ensuring your thighs are at least parallel to the ground Press through your heels to stand back up and return to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall near a bench with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a barbell over your chest just under your chin, with your arms folded, hands wider than shoulders, and palms facing the ceiling. Lower your hips on the bench while bending your knees and keeping your feet fixed. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a barbell over your shoulders just under your chin. Take a step forward and lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart with the barbell across your upper chest Lower your body by bending at the knees and hips Keep your back and chest upright Push your body up to the starting position Repeat the process for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a barbell over your shoulders just under your chin. Lower your hips to the floor while bending your knees. As your thighs come parallel to the floor, return to the initial position, and repeat.

name_en: Barbell Front Lunges With Small Pause
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a barbell over your shoulders behind your neck. Take a step forward and lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. Take a pause as your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position and repeat.

Position the barbell on your shoulders with your elbows pointing forward Lunge forward using one leg while maintaining your balance Go as deep as you can without your knee touching the ground Push back to the starting position using the heel of your front foot Repeat the process with your other leg

Place the barbell on your front shoulders and hold it steady Take a step forward with your right foot and lower your body until your right knee is at a 90-degree angle Using your right foot, push back up into the starting position Repeat the process with your left foot Continue alternating between legs for the desired number of reps

Stand with a barbell resting on your front deltoids, the heels of your feet should be shoulder-width apart Take a step forward with one foot, rear foot pivot on the ball Lower your body by bending the knee and hip of your front leg until the knee of your rear leg is almost in contact with the floor Return to the original standing position by extending the hip and knee of the forward leg Repeat the exercise with the other foot stepping forward

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the barbell at your thighs Raise the barbell straight in front of you until your arms are parallel to the floor Lower the barbell back down to your thighs in a controlled motion Repeat this movement for a set of reps

Stand up straight with a barbell, palms facing your torso Lift the barbell forward and up until your arms are slightly above parallel with the floor Pause at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back down Keep your torso stationary throughout this movement Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart holding the barbell across your chest Bed your knees and lower your body into a squat Keep your back straight and your chest up Push back up to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Position the barbell above your chest at shoulder height, with your palms facing forward. Lower your body by bending your knees until they are at a 90-degree angle. Keep your upper body straight and lower back slightly arched. Push up through your heels to a standing position, while keeping the weight on the front part of your feet. Repeat this for your desired number of reps.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a barbell over your shoulders while placing your hands across them. Lower your hips to the floor while bending your knees. As your thighs come parallel to the floor, return to the initial position and repeat.

Start with the barbell on the floor and stand over it with feet approximately shoulder-width apart Bending at the hips and knees, pull the barbell up to the chest in one swift, fluid motion At peak position, 'catch' the weight in a full squat position and stand back up Lower the bar to the thighs, then to the floor, maintaining a flat back and engaged core throughout

Stand tall near a barbell with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward and grab the barbell with an overhand grip and hands shoulder-width apart while bending your knees. Raise the barbell to your chest while coming under it by lowering your hips and then standing upright.

Unrack the barbell onto your upper back, shoulder width apart Slowly bend at the knees and hips, lowering your body until your thighs are parallel to the floor Push back up through your heels, straightening your legs and returning to the starting position Repeat the motion for the desired number of repetitions Rerack the barbell safely

Place the barbell on your upper back, slightly below the neck Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Lower your body by bending at your knees and hips Continue until your thighs are parallel to the floor Return to the starting position, pushing through your heels

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a barbell over your shoulders behind your neck. Lower your hips to the floor while bending your knees. As your hips and knees level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Position the barbell on your upper back slightly below the neck With feet shoulder-width apart, bend at the hips and knees to lower your body Lower until your thighs are parallel to the floor Push through the heels to return to the starting position Repeat for the desired reps

Place the barbell on your upper back just below your neck Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Lower down into a squat position by bending your knees and pushing your hips back Continue until your thighs are parallel to the floor Push up to return to the standing position

Stand tall with a barbell resting on your shoulder blades, and your feet shoulder-width apart Bend at your knees and hips, lowering your body as far as possible Keep the movement controlled, don't rush Push back up through your heels to your starting position Engage your core throughout the movement

Position the barbell in a squat rack at about chest height. Bend your elbows and nestle the barbell in the crook of your arms. Dismount the barbell from the rack and take a few steps back to establish your stance. Lower yourself into a deep squat, keeping your back straight and your shoulders squared. Once your hips are below your knees, push back up to the starting position.

Stand up and hold the barbell at your chest level Lower your body by bending your knees until your thighs are parallel to the ground Keep your back straight while lowering your body Pause for a second Push your body back to the initial/top position

Get down on your back with your knees bent and feet on the floor. Hold a barbell on your waist and raise your hips off the floor to straighten your thighs with your back. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the ground Place the barbell over your hips Drive through your heels lifting your hips off the ground Keep your upper back and shoulders on the ground Lower your hips back down

Lie on the floor with a barbell over your hips, your hands holding the bar. Bend your knees and have your feet flat on the floor. Push through your heels to lift your hips upwards as high as possible, while keeping your upper body still. Hold the position briefly then lower your hips back to the starting position. Repeat the exercise for the recommended repetitions.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a barbell behind your neck just over your shoulders. Lean forward almost parallel to the floor while pushing your hips back and bending your knees slightly. Hold for a while, return to the starting position, and repeat.

Place a barbell on your shoulders behind your neck Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Bend your hips forward while keeping your back straight Lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the floor Lift your torso back up to the starting position

Position a barbell on your shoulders and grip it comfortably Stand with your feet hip-width apart, maintaining a slight bend in your knees Bend forward at the hips while keeping your back straight Pause when you reach a horizontal position, then slowly return to the starting position Keep your eyes forward and avoid rounding your back throughout the movement

Lie on your back on a flat bench, grasping a barbell with your hands wider than shoulder width apart Lower the barbell towards your neck, keeping the elbows flared out Press the barbell back up until your arms are extended Briefly pause at the top before repeating the movement Remember to control the weight throughout the entire motion

Stand up straight while holding a barbell behind you at arm's length and your feet shoulder-width apart Lower your body by bending at the knees while keeping your torso straight Continue down until the angle between the upper leg and the calves becomes slightly less than 90-degrees Push the floor with the heel or middle of your foot while straightening your legs again and going back to the starting position

Start with feet hip-width apart and barbell on the ground Bend at your hips and knees, and grab the bar with an overhand grip Stand up and shrug your shoulders to lift the bar As the bar raises to chest height, flip your wrists over so your palms face upwards Lower the barbell back to the ground

Stand upright and grasp the barbell at shoulder-width with an overhand grip Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, letting the barbell hang at knee level In a swift movement, extend your hips and knees while lifting the barbell upward As the barbell approaches chest level, bend your knees and drop your body under the bar, catching it at arm's length overhead in a squat position Stand up by extending your legs and maintain the bar overhead for a moment before lowering it to the starting position

Position the barbell on your upper back, not your neck. Keep your chest up and your lower back slightly arched. Squat down by bending your knees and sitting back with your butt. Go down until your thighs are at least parallel to the floor. Push back up to the starting position, driving through your heels.

Get down on a step with your back supported against a bench, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in your lap while placing your elbows on the bench. Raise your hips off the step while leaning backward on the bench. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Position the barbell over your hips, laying down Bend your knees and keep your feet flat on the floor Push through your heels to lift your hips off the floor, bringing the barbell upwards Squeeze your glutes at the top, then slowly lower yourself back down

Sit on the ground with a loaded barbell over your legs. Using a fat pad or towel to reduce pressure, position the barbell over your hips. Lean back onto a sturdy bench so that your shoulder blades sit just over the edge. Drive through your heels to lift the barbell by extending your hips. Continue until they are in line with your torso. Control the descent to slowly bring the barbell back down to the start position. Repeat the movement for your recommended number of reps.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, facing the barbell on the floor. Bend at the hips and grab the barbell using a hook grip. Your arms should be straight and outside your knees. Keeping your back straight, lift the barbell by extending your hips and knees to full extension. At the top, pull your shoulders back without bending your back. Lower the barbell back to the floor by bending your hips and knees.

Lie down on an incline bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet resting on the floor. Grab a barbell over your upper chest with your elbows dipped under the bench, hands placed wider than the shoulder width, and palms facing forward. Raise the barbell by straightening your arms. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Sit down on incline bench with a barbell racked above you. Grab the barbell with palms facing forward, wider than shoulder-width apart. Unrack the barbell and lower it to your upper chest. Push the barbell upwards, extending arms fully. Lower the barbell back to your chest in a slow, controlled manner.

Sit on an incline bench with your feet flat on the floor Grasp the barbell with your hands a little wider than shoulder-width apart Lift the barbell off the rack and lower it to your upper chest Press the barbell up until your arms are fully extended Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position

name_en: Barbell Incline Close Grip Bench Press
description_en: Sit down on an incline bench with a barbell in your hands at shoulder width Lower the barbell to your chest in a controlled manner Press the barbell back up to the starting position without locking your elbows Keep your elbows close to your body throughout the movement Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Barbell Incline Lying Rear Delt Raise
description_en: Lie face down on an incline bench holding a barbell with an overhand grip Keep your arms fully extended with a slight bend in your elbows Raise the barbell upwards in a smooth arc until your arms are level with your shoulders Pause briefly at the top of the motion Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position

Position yourself on an incline bench with your chest and stomach pressed against the incline. Hold the barbell with both hands positioned slightly wider than shoulder width. Lift the barbell up towards your upper chest, keep your elbows out to your sides. Lower the barbell back down to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat the movement for your desired number of repetitions.

Place a barbell at an incline bench position Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, bend over and grasp the bar Pull the bar to your upper body keeping your elbows close Reverse the movement back to the starting position

Bend at your waist to slightly more than 45 degrees while keeping your feet shoulder-width apart Hold the bar slightly wider than shoulder-width, letting it hang in front of you Pull the bar towards your chest Lower the bar back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Set the bar up in a squat cage for security, it should be slightly above shoulder level Get under the bar with a shoulder-width grip and lift it off the rack Lower the bar to your shoulder line Push the bar back up until your arms are fully extended Repeat the movement for a number of repetitions

Sit on an incline bench set at 45-degrees and grip the barbell with palms facing forward Lift the bar off the rack, holding it at shoulder level Press the bar upward until your arms are fully extended Hold the top position for a moment, and then lower the bar slowly to the starting position

name_en: Barbell Incline Triceps Extension Skull Crusher
description_en: Lie on an incline bench and hold the barbell overhead, arms fully extended Lower the barbell towards your forehead by bending your elbows Keep your upper arms stationary during this movement Raise the barbell back to the starting position by extending your elbows Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Step over a barbell, hold it between your legs with your arms straight, and form an upright position. Lower your rear knee unless your front thigh comes parallel to the floor. Hold for a while, return to the upright position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and your feet open wide with their toes pointing outward. Hold a barbell between your legs with straight arms and a mixed grip of your hands. Lower your hips to the floor while bending your knees. As your hips and knees level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand over the barbell so that it is between your legs Bend at your hips and knees and grip the barbell Keep your back straight, lift the bar by standing up Lower the barbell by bending your hips and knees until your thighs are parallel to the floor Stand up completely, repeat the movements

Lie down on a bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Hold a barbell over your shoulders with your arms extended, hands shoulder-width apart, and palms facing forward. Lower the barbell towards your upper chest while folding your arms, then take your hands towards your face.

Sit on the bench with your feet firmly on the ground Hold the barbell with an overhand grip Lower the barbell to your chest in a controlled manner Push the barbell back up, extending your arm fully Return to the starting position

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the barbell across your upper back with an overhand grip Begin the exercise by performing a regular squat, pushing your hips back and bending at the knees Explosively jump up as high as you can, straightening your legs Upon landing, immediately squat down again, absorbing the impact with your legs Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a barbell over your shoulders behind your neck. Lower your hips to the floor while bending your knees. As your hips and knees level, raise them again and jump. Land while bending your knees slightly, then form an upright position, and repeat.

Sit down on your hips with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Hold a barbell in your lap, lean against a block, and place your elbows on it. Raise your hips off the floor to straighten your thighs with your back. Perform 2-3 thrusts by moving your hips up and down, then return to the initial position and repeat.

Place a barbell across your hips, make sure it's padded to avoid discomfort Lie flat on your back with your feet planted firmly on the ground Drive your hips upward, pushing through your heels Pause at the top for a second and then lower back down in a controlled manner Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions

Kneel on the floor with your back straight and let your hips rest on your calves. Hold a barbell over your shoulders behind your neck. Raise your hips and straighten your thighs. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Sit at the edge of a bench with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab a barbell over your thighs with an underhand grip and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell towards the shoulders by folding your arms. As it reaches shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Lay down on a bench with a rack and position the barbell to align with your chest Grasp the barbell with a shoulder-width grip Lower the bar to mid-chest while keeping your elbows flared out Press the weight back up until your arms are fully extended Pause, then lower the barbell back to the starting position

Stand tall with a barbell on your back, feet shoulder-width apart. Step to the side with one foot, bending your knee and pushing your hips back. Keep your other leg straight. Push back up and return to the center. Repeat on the opposite side.

Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a barbell across your upper back Step to the side with your right foot, bending your knee and lowering your body into a lunge Push through your right heel to return to the starting position Repeat the lunge with your left foot Switch sides for your desired amount of reps

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a barbell over your shoulders behind your neck. Take a step towards your left and lower your hips to the floor while folding your knee. As your thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position and repeat by stepping on your other side.

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and the loaded barbell on your shoulders. Twist your torso and press the barbell upwards until your arms are fully extended. Hold for a moment, then lower the barbell while rotating to the opposite side, repeating the press. Alternate between each side for your desired number of reps. Remember to engage your core and keep your back straight throughout the movement.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a barbell over your shoulders behind your neck. Lower your hips to the floor while bending your knees. As your hips come under the knee level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Position the barbell on your lower traps Stand shoulder width apart and brace your core Begin the squat by bending your knees and sitting back Lower your body until your hips are below your knees Push back up to standing position

Position the barbell below the base of your neck, across your shoulder blades Keep your feet shoulder-width apart, bend your knees, and lower your hips back as if sitting in a chair Push your knees out, keeping them over your toes Rise back up to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Barbell Low Bar Squat with Rack
description_en: Stand in front of the rack holding the barbell. Place the barbell on your lower back across your shoulder blades making sure to balance it. Slowly bend your knees and lower your body as if sitting back into a chair until your thighs are parallel to the floor. Drive through your heels, engage your core and keep your back straight as you stand back up. Repeat this for the desired number of reps and sets before putting the barbell back on the rack.

Stand with your legs split and the front foot far enough in front to lower into a squat Hold the barbell on your upper back, not your neck Lower your body until your thigh is parallel to the ground, then push back up The front knee should not go past your toes when you squat Alternate your legs after a set

Place the barbell on your shoulders behind your neck Step forward with your right foot, drop your left knee towards the ground Push through your right foot to stand back up Repeat the movement with your left foot Continue alternating legs throughout

Hold the barbell on your upper back with an overhand grip Step forward with one foot and lower your body until your rear knee nearly touches the floor Push yourself back up to starting position Repeat with the other foot Alternate between both feet for the desired reps

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a barbell over your shoulders behind your neck. Take a step forward and lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a barbell over your shoulders just behind your neck. Take a step forward and lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand holding a barbell on your shoulders just below the neck Step forward with one leg into a lunge position Twist your torso to the same side as the forward leg Return to your initial position by untwisting and standing up, then repeat with your other leg

Lie down on a flat bench and take hold of the barbell with a close grip Lower the bar slowly in a controlled motion to your chest Pause and then push the bar directly upward, extending your arms fully Slowly return to the starting position

Lie down on a bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet resting on the floor. Grab a barbell over your chest with your arms folded, elbows opened wide to the sides, hands placed shoulder-width apart, and palms facing forward. Raise the barbell by straightening your arms. As your arms become straight, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Barbell Lying Close Grip Underhand Row on Rack
description_en: Lie with your back on a flat bench positioned beneath a barbell rack Reach up and grip the barbell with an underhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart Pull the barbell down towards your chest in a controlled manner Hold for a moment before slowly releasing upward Repeat for a given number of repetitions

Lie down on a bench with your feet flat on the ground Hold the barbell at a shoulder width apart directly above your chest Lower the barbell towards your forehead by bending your elbows Pause for a second then push the barbell back up until your arms are fully extended Repeat for the desired number of reps

Lie prone on the bench with your chest at the edge Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip Pull the barbell up towards your chest Pause for a moment and then slowly lower the bar back down Repeat for the desired number of reps

Lie down on a flat bench holding a barbell at arm's length above you Slowly lower the barbell towards your forehead, keeping your upper arms stationary Pause for a moment, then raise the barbell back to the start position Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions Remember to keep your elbows close to your head throughout

name_en: Barbell Lying Triceps Extension Skull Crusher
description_en: Lie back on a flat bench, holding a barbell at arm's length above your chest Bend your elbows to slowly lower the weight towards your forehead Stop just before the bar touches your forehead, then press back up to the start Keep your upper arms stationary throughout Repeat for the desired number of reps

Lie down on a bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Hold a barbell over your forehead with your arms bent,  elbows over your shoulders, and palms facing up. Raise the barbell by straightening your arms while keeping the barbell over the forehead. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Place your feet shoulder-width apart, with the barbell over your mid-foot Bend at your hips and knees to grab the barbell, one hand palm facing you, the other palm facing away Keep your back straight as you lift the bar to your waist Lower the bar back down by bending your hips and knees until the weight touches the floor

Stand tall near a barbell with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward and grab the barbell with an overhand grip and hands shoulder-width apart while bending your knees. Raise the barbell to your chest while raising your hips, bringing your elbows under it, and then stand tall. Return to the starting position step by step and repeat.

Start in a standing position holding a barbell at your mid thighs Bend your knees and hips slightly, then quickly raise the barbell towards your shoulders Catch the weight at shoulder level, keeping your elbows high Lower the weight back to your mid thighs in a controlled manner

Place the barbell across your shoulders and upper back Stand with your feet hip-width apart Lower your body by bending at the hips and knees until your thighs are parallel with the floor Push through your heels to bring your body back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Place the barbell across your shoulders, not your neck Stand with your feet closer than shoulder width apart Slowly bend your knees and lower your body Push up through the heels to return to standing position Keep your back straight and your chest up throughout the movement

Stand tall with the barbell positioned across your upper back Bend your knees and sink down into a squat position, keeping your back straight Push through your heels to return to a standing position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions Remember to always keep your core engaged

name_en: Barbell One Arm Bent over Row
description_en: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, slight bend in the knees, and lean forward slightly Hold the barbell with one hand, arm extended and parallel to the floor Pull the barbell up towards your body until it touches your ribcage Pause, then lower the barbell back down in a controlled manner Repeat this motion for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other side

Stand with right foot staggered slightly in front of left foot, holding a barbell on your right side Lower the barbell to the right foot by bending at the hip, keeping your back straight Push your body back up to the starting position using your right hip and heel Keep your abs tight during the whole exercise Repeat the movement with the left foot and left hand

Place a barbell over your hips while sitting on the ground with your shoulders against a bench and one foot flat on the ground Raise your hips off the ground until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees Lower your hips back to the starting position Switch the working leg after a set Repeat the motion for the desired number of reps

Get down on the floor your back supported against a bench, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in your lap while placing your elbows on the bench and raising one foot off the floor. Raise your hips off the step while leaning backward on the bench and keeping one foot in the air. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand holding a barbell across your upper back Lift one leg slightly off the ground and squat down on your standing leg Keep the bar balanced and your torso upright throughout the movement Push back up to the starting position Switch legs and repeat the exercise

Stand straight and hold the barbell overhead, keeping your arms fully extended Step forward with one foot and lower your body until your front and back knees are at a 90-degree angle Push back up to the starting position Repeat the lunge with the opposite foot Keep your movements controlled throughout the exercise

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a barbell overhead while extending your arms. Take a step forward and lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with a barbell at arm's length, the grip should be slightly wider than your shoulders Lift your shoulders straight up towards the ceiling in a shrug, do not roll them Hold the contraction at the top for a second Lower your shoulders back down to the starting position Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a barbell overhead while extending your arms. Lower your hips towards the floor while bending your knees. As your hips and knees level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart and the barbell resting across your upper back Bend at your hips and knees to lower your body as far as you can Press through your heels to stand back to starting position Keep your torso upright and the weight balanced over the middle of your foot Repeat for required reps

name_en: Barbell Palms Down Wrist Curl Over A Bench
description_en: Kneel behind a flat bench, taking the barbell with your palms facing down Lay your forearms on the bench and let your wrists hang over the edge Curl your wrists up as high as they can go Pause for a moment and then gently lower the weight back to the start position Repeat for your desired number of reps

Lie down on a flat bench with a barbell just above your eyes Lift the bar from the rack with straight arms and hold it over your chest Inhale as you slowly lower the barbell to your chest Pause for a second when the barbell touches your chest Exhale as you press the barbell back to the starting position

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the barbell with an overhand grip Bend at the hips and knees, keeping your back straight Pull the barbell towards your torso, keeping your elbows close to your body Hold the position briefly, then lower the barbell slowly

Stand behind a loaded barbell, your shins almost touching the bar Bend at your hips and knees, grasp the bar with an overhand grip Without allowing your lower back to round, stand up with the barbell Hold for a brief pause, then lower the bar back to the floor Pause for 1-2 seconds and repeat the lift

Position yourself on a decline bench with a barbell rack within reach With a medium grip, lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms full extended Lower the bar slowly to your lower chest, remembering to keep your elbows close to your body Hold at the bottom for a count of 1-2 seconds Press the bar back to the starting position

Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing outwards and the barbell in front of you Bend your knees and hips to lower your body and grab the barbell Keep your back straight and lift the barbell by straightening your hips and knees Pause for a moment at the top then lower the barbell back to the ground

Position the barbell across your chest, holding with an underhand grip Squat down until your hips are lower than your knees, pause for a few moments Push back up to the starting position through your heels Keep your back straight and chest up throughout the movement Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Stand with a barbell resting on your shoulder. Lower your body into a full squat position, pause at the bottom. Push through your heels to stand back up. Repeat the movement for your desired number of reps. The entire movement should be slow and under control

Lie back on an incline bench. Hold the bar with a pronated grip (palms facing forward). Unrack the bar and hold it straight over your chest with your arms fully extended. Lower the bar to the sternum by bending at the elbows. Pause for a second. Push the bar back to the starting position by extending the elbows. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Position a barbell across your upper back Step forward with your right foot, lowering your body into a lunge Hold this position for a moment Push back up to the start position Switch legs and repeat

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a barbell over your shoulders behind your neck. Take a step forward and lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, pause for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Hold a barbell near your shins by leaning forward with a straight back, knees slightly bent, and arms hanging straight. Raise the barbell towards your waist by folding your arms and taking your elbows past your back. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand over the barbell with your feet shoulder-width apart Bend over and grasp the bar with a wide grip Raise the bar to your chest level, keeping your elbows close to your body Hold for a second then return the barbell to the floor in a controlled manner That's one rep. Continue for your desired amount of sets and reps

name_en: Barbell Pin Bench Press Conventional grip
description_en: Position your body beneath the barbell, aligning it with the mid-chest area Grasp the barbell with a conventional grip slightly wider than shoulder width Unrack the barbell and slowly lower it to touch your chest Push the barbell back up until your arms are fully extended Repeat the exercise for the intended number of repetitions

Set the barbell on a rack at about chest level and step underneath it, placing it across the front of your shoulders Unrack the barbell, keeping your chest up, and move back into a squat position Lower your body by bending at your knees and hips, maintaining a straight posture Drop down until your thighs are almost parallel to the floor Push yourself back up to your starting position

Stand upright with a barbell positioned on your shoulders Bend at the hips, pushing your buttocks back and keeping your back straight, until your torso is parallel to the floor Rise back up to the starting position Repeat the action for the desired number of times

Stand with feet hip-width apart and the barbell in front of your shins Bend your knees and hips to grab the bar with a shoulder-width grip Raise the bar by straightening your legs while keeping your back straight Explosively stand up and shrug your shoulders, pulling the bar up to your shoulders Lower the bar back to the ground in a controlled manner

Stand tall near a barbell with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward and grab the barbell with an overhand grip and hands shoulder-width apart while bending your knees. Raise the barbell to your knees while lifting your hips, straighten your legs and bring it to your waist. Lastly, lean back and take the barbell to your chest while bending your wrists and slowly bringing your elbows under it.

Position yourself over the bar which is set on blocks Bend and grab the bar with an overhand grip Explode upwards pulling the bar up to your chest level Quickly rotate your wrists under the bar and catch it at your shoulder level Lower barbell to blocks following the same path

Stand tall near a barbell placed on blocks with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward and grab the barbell with an overhand grip and hands shoulder-width apart while bending your knees. Raise the barbell to your chest while straightening your legs, bending your wrists, and slowly bringing your elbows under it.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a barbell over your chest just under your chin, with your arms folded, hands wider than shoulders, and palms facing the ceiling. Bend your knees and thrust the barbell overhead while extending your arms. Lower the barbell to the initial position and repeat.

Begin in a standing position, holding the barbell at shoulder height with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your body into a shallow squat, pushing your hips back and bending your knees. When you are at the bottom of your squat, quickly extend your legs and push the barbell up over your head. Hold the barbell overhead for a moment, then carefully return it to the beginning position.

Stand tall near a barbell with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward while bending your knees and grab the barbell with an overhand grip and hands double shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell to your knees, lean backward, and bring the barbell overhead by extending your arms. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand straight with the barbell on the ground close to your shins. Bend at your hips and knees and grab the bar with an overhand grip In one swift motion, lift the barbell by powerfully extending your hips and knees As the bar raises to your chest, rotate your wrists to face forward and catch the barbell overhead while squatting under it Stand up straight with the weight overhead balancing it Lower the barbell back to the ground in a controlled manner

Set up the blocks and place the barbell on top Stand facing the barbell in a squat position Grasp the barbell wider than shoulder width apart Explode upwards, pulling the barbell upwards and extending your body Rotate your wrists and bring the barbell over your head and then lower it

Get on the preacher curl machine, hold the barbell with an underhand grip, straight arms, and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the bar towards the shoulders by folding your arms. As you reach near the shoulders, return to the starting position slowly and repeat.

Sit on the preacher bench properly and adjust the height to fit you Hold the barbell with your palms facing upwards Keep your upper arms stationary and curl the weights while contracting biceps Reach the fully contracted position and squeeze your biceps hard Slowly begin to bring the barbell back to original position

Sit on a preacher bench and place your arms on the padding, extend your arms fully Grab the bar with an upward curl movement until your biceps fully contract Hold your position at the top and squeeze your biceps Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position Repeat the exercise as much as recommended

Lay chest-down on the incline bench, gripping the barbell with an underhand grip With your arms fully extended, curl the barbell towards your shoulders Pause for a moment while squeezing your biceps Slowly return to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Lay chest down on an incline bench, holding barbell with an underhand grip Curl the barbell upwards towards your shoulder, keeping the elbows stationary Pause at the top of the motion where your bicep is contracted Lower the barbell down slowly to the starting position Repeat for required number of reps

Lie on your back on a flat bench, with your feet flat on the floor Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip that is slightly more than shoulder-width apart With your arms fully extended, lower the barbell back over your head until the weight is directly above your head Pull the barbell up over your head and chest, returning to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Lie down on a bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Hold a barbell over your head and under the bench with your arms slightly bent and palms facing up. Raise the barbell by taking your elbows to your shoulder and then extend them entirely.

Lie on your back on a flat bench, holding a barbell above your chest with your hands nearly shoulder-width apart Lower the bar in a controlled manner behind your head while keeping your arms slightly bent Pull the bar back over to the starting point over your chest Press the bar up until your arms are extended Lower the barbell back to your chest to complete 1 repetition

Hold a barbell near your legs by leaning forward with a straight back, knees slightly bent, and arms hanging straight. Raise the barbell towards your chest by folding your arms and taking your elbows past your back. Apply over-pressure while pushing your elbows past your back twice, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a barbell over your shoulders behind your neck. Slightly bend your knees and take your hips backward. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Position a barbell on your upper back Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the floor, keep your head up and chest out Contract your glutes and push your body back up Repeat the process for your set

Stand behind a barbell that is positioned on a weight rack, your feet shoulder width apart Bend at your waist and slightly bend your knees to grab the barbell, keeping your back straight Lift the barbell by extending your hips and knees to full extension Hold for a second at the top before lowering the barbell back to the rack Repeat for the desired amount of repetitions

Stand tall near a barbell which is placed on racks with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward and grab the barbell with an overhand grip and hands shoulder-width apart while bending your knees and lowering your hips. Raise the barbell by straightening your knees and bringing your chest out. Hold for a while, return to the starting position slowly, and repeat.

Position your barbell on a rack at knee level Stand in front of the barbell with a hip-width stance Bend and grip the bar, ensuring your back is straight and knees slightly bent Pull up the barbell by extending your hips and knees to a full stand Lower the barbell back down to the rack in a controlled manner

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart With arms slightly bent at the elbows, hold the barbell at hip level in front of you Raise your arms to shoulder level or slightly higher, as long as it feels comfortable Lower down the barbell close to your body, returning to the starting position Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps

Stand up straight with a barbell, hands shoulder-width apart. Bend at your waist slightly with knees slightly bent. Keep your head up and bring the barbell up to the shoulder level. Lower the barbell down to the starting position. Repeat this movement for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hold the barbell with your hands shoulder width apart Bend your body forward at the waist while keeping your back straight Pull the barbell up to your chest level Hold this position for a second Return the barbell back to the starting position with a controlled movement

Place the barbell on your back with your shoulders Step backward with your right foot and lower your body into a lunge Push yourself back to initial position Repeat the movement with your left foot Continue alternating sides for the desired number of reps

Position barbell on your shoulders behind your neck. Step one foot backward into a lunge position, bending both knees to 90 degrees. Keep your core tight and chest up during the lunge. Push through the heel of your front foot to return to the standing position. Repeat this with the other leg and continue to alternate.

Place the Barbell on your shoulder, standing with feet hip-width apart Step backward with one foot, lowering your body until your other knee almost touches the floor Push up through the heel of the front foot to return to the start position Repeat with the other foot Alternate legs for each repetition

Stand tall on a box with your back straight, feet hip-width apart, and hold a barbell over your shoulders behind your neck. Take a step back with your right foot and lower yourself unless your left thigh is parallel to the floor. Hold for a while, then return to the initial position and repeat by stepping back with your left foot.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet hip-width apart, and hold a barbell over your shoulders behind your neck. Take a step back with your right foot and lower yourself unless your left thigh is parallel to the floor. Hold for a while, then return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand near a barbell and spread your arms wide, each hand gripping each corner of the barbell Keeping your back straight, bend your hips and knees to lift the barbell Once your legs are straight, push your hips forward to stand upright Lower the barbell back down to the ground by bending at the hips and knees Practice this motion with lighter weights first to engage all the muscles

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the barbell near your thighs with an overhand grip, straight arms, and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell towards the shoulders by folding your arms. As you reach shoulder level, return to the initial position slowly and repeat.

Lay flat on a bench holding a barbell with a reverse grip, hands close together Lower the bar to your lower chest Press the bar back to the starting position without locking your elbows Hold for a moment at the top Lower the bar back down to your lower chest in a controlled manner

name_en: Barbell reverse close grip bench press
description_en: Lie down on a bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet resting on the floor. Grab a barbell over your abdomen with your arms bent, elbows placed at the sides, hands set shoulder-width apart, and palms facing your face. Raise the barbell by straightening your arms. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart and hold the barbell with your palms facing down Curl the barbell upward while keeping your elbows close to your torso Hold this position for a second when your arm is fully contracted and squeeze your biceps Slowly return the barbell back down to the original position

Stand upright grasping the barbell with an overhand grip (palms facing down) Keep your elbows tucked into your sides Curl the barbell upward while keeping your wrists straight Smoothly lower the barbell back down to the starting position Repeat the movement for desired repetitions

Lie down on a bench with your back supported, knees bent, and your feet resting on the floor. Grab a barbell over your chest with your elbows dipped under the bench, hands placed shoulder-width apart, and palms facing backward. Raise the barbell by straightening your arms. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Lie back on a flat bench holding a barbell using a reverse grip (palms facing towards you) Lower the bar to your chest in a controlled manner Press the bar back to the starting position, fully extending your arms Pause for a moment at the top before lowering the bar again Perform the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Barbell Reverse Grip Bench Press on Floor
description_en: Lie down on the floor, and hold the barbell above your chest with a reverse grip Lower the barbell to your chest in a slow and controlled manner Once the bar touches your chest, push it back up to the starting position Try to maintain the same path on the way up and down Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Barbell Reverse Grip Bent Over Row
description_en: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent Hold the barbell with a reverse grip, hands roughly shoulder-width apart Bend at your hips, keeping your back straight and nearly parallel to the floor Raise the barbell to your upper waist and pause Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position

name_en: Barbell Reverse Grip Incline Bench Row
description_en: Lie face down on an incline bench with a barbell held at arm's length getting a reverse grip. Pull the barbell to your chest while keeping your back straight. Hold this position for a moment and squeeze your back muscles. Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position. Repeat the motion without letting the weights touch the floor for your desired reps.

Sit on a preacher bench and place your arms on the support pad Hold the barbell with palms facing downwards Curl the barbell up towards your shoulders Pause at the top of the motion Lower the barbell back down in a controlled manner

Sit on an inclined bench and press your chest against it while keeping your knees bent and feet on the ground. Grab the barbell under the bench with an overhand grip, straight arms,  and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell towards your chest by folding your arms. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Place a barbell on your legs whilst seated on an incline bench Raise the barbell to your shoulder level Lower the barbell until your hands are fully extended Repeat this movement for the desired amount of repetitions

Hold the barbell with an overhand grip Rest your forearms on your thighs or a bench Let your wrists hang over the edge Curl your wrists up towards your body Lower the weight back down in a controlled motion

Sit on a flat bench and hold a barbell with a shoulder-width overhand grip. Rest your forearms on your thighs with your hands hanging off the end of your knees. Lower the barbell as far as possible by flexing your wrists. Curl the barbell up as high as possible by extending your wrists. Repeat for the desired amount of repetitions.

Sit on a bench and rest your forearms on your thighs, letting your wrists hang over your knees with your palms facing downward Hold the barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart Slowly curl the barbell upward, keeping your forearms on your thighs Pause at the top of the movement for a moment Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position in a controlled fashion

Get down on your knees and hold a barbell with a wider-than-shoulder grip. Slowly roll the barbell in front of you while keeping your back and arms straight. Tighten your abdominal muscles and roll the barbell back to your knees. Repeat.

Get on your knees and position a barbell in front of you Grip the barbell with your hands, shoulder-width apart Engage your core, then slowly roll the barbell forward while keeping your body straight Roll out as far as you can, then use your abs to roll back to the starting position Repeat as desired

Stand tall in front of a barbell with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward and grab a barbell with an overhand grip by bending your knees and lowering your hips. Raise the barbell by straightening your knees and bringing your chest out. Return to the starting position slowly and repeat.

Position a barbell at hip level, grasping the bar wider than shoulder width with an overhand grip Lower the barbell over the top of your feet by pushing your hips back, keeping your back straight Return to the starting position by driving your hips forward and standing tall Repeat the process for the recommended number of repetitions Maintain a slight bend in your knees throughout the exercise

Stand tall while holding the barbell at your thigh level with shoulder-width apart Lower the barbell towards the floor while keeping your back straight and bending at your hips Stop when you feel a stretch in your hamstring, then stand back up by squeezing your glutes Keep your knees slightly bent during the whole movement yet remain mostly straight Do not let the barbell go beyond your second toe while lowering down

Stand upright holding the barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart Bend your hips and knees and lower the bar towards your feet Pull your shoulder blades back and bend your elbows to lift the barbell towards your midsection Extend your elbows and raise your torso to return to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Barbell Seated Behind Head Military Press
description_en: Take a seat on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold the barbell behind your head at your shoulders. Extend your arms straight up to lift the barbell. Pause briefly at the top. Slowly lower the barbell back to your shoulders.

name_en: Barbell Seated Behind Head Military Press
description_en: Sit on a bench with a barbell rested on your thighs Lift the barbell up overhead to a starting position behind your head Press the bar straight up until your arms are fully extended Lower the bar back down to the starting position behind your head Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on the edge of a flat bench with the barbell across your thighs Raise your heels by extending your ankles as high as possible Pause at the top for a second, then lower your heels back down Control the downward motion, don't let your heels simply drop Repeat the process

Place the barbell on your thighs, close to your knees Lift your heels off the floor by pushing up onto your toes Lower your heels back down until you feel a stretch in your calves Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise

Sit down on a bench, holding the barbell Place your elbows against your inner thighs Curl the barbell towards your chest in a slow, controlled motion Pause at the top of the movement Lower the barbell back to the starting position

Sit on the edge of a bench with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Lean forward, place your elbows on your thighs, and hold a barbell with an underhand grip. Raise the barbell towards your shoulders by folding your arms. Return slowly to the starting position and repeat.

Sit on a bench with back support, holding a barbell with an overhand grip, palms facing down. While keeping your arms slightly bent, raise it in front of you till it is at or slightly above shoulder level. Pause for a moment, then lower the barbell back down to the starting position in a controlled manner. Make sure your movements are slow and controlled, not quick and jerky. Breathe in as you lift the barbell, and breathe out as you lower it.

Sit on a bench with your back straight, knees open wide, and feet on the floor while holding a barbell behind your neck. Lean towards the bench while keeping your feet on the floor. Lean back unless your back becomes perpendicular to the floor, and then repeat.

Sit on a flat bench with a barbell positioned on your upper back Keep your back straight and bend forward at your hips Lower your torso until you feel a mild stretch in your hamstrings Raise your body back up to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on a flat bench with a barbell placed across your upper back. Lean forward at the waist until your torso is roughly parallel with the floor. Keep your back straight as you tilt forward. Return to an upright position by extending your hips and waist. Repeat this motion for the desired number of repetitions.

Sit on a bench inside a squat cage, place the barbell on a height that is just above your chest Take a deep breath and push the barbell over your head Hold at the peak for a moment Slowly lower the barbell down to the original position Exhale and start your next repetition

Sit on a bench with back support, holding a barbell at about chest high Push the barbell up overhead until your arms are fully extended Lower the barbell back to the starting position in a slow and controlled manner Pause briefly at the chest, then start your next repetition Repeat for the desired number of reps

Sit on a bench with a barbell rack, head up and back straight Lift the barbell off the rack and hold it slightly above shoulder level Exhale and push the barbell upwards until your arms are fully extended Inhale and slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position Repeat

Sit on a bench with the barbell held overhead Lower the barbell behind your head Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement Extend your arms, lifting the barbell back to the starting position Repeat the movement for your desired number of repetitions

Sit on a bench with a barbell on your thighs Raise the barbell above your head until your arms are fully extended Bend your elbows to lower the barbell behind your head Raise the barbell back to the starting position by straightening your elbows Repeat this for your desired number of repetitions

Sit on a bench with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Hold a barbell behind your neck with your arms folded and your elbows pointing forward. Raise the barbell by straightening your arms overhead. Hold momentarily, then return to the initial position and repeat.

Sit on a flat bench with a barbell across your thighs Keep your back straight and your feet flat on the floor Grab the barbell with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart Shrug your shoulders straight up towards your ears Lower the barbell back down to the starting position

Sit on a bench with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Hold a barbell behind your neck and rotate your torso towards any side. Return to the initial position and rotate your torso towards the other side. Continue for a suitable duration.

Sit on the stability ball with feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart Hold the barbell across your shoulders and chest Rotate your upper body to one side, keeping your hips square Pause at the end of the movement, then return to the starting position Repeat, rotating to the other side for balance

Sit upright on the edge of a flat bench holding the barbell across your shoulders. Twist your torso to the right till you feel a stretch in your obliques. Pause for a moment, then twist your torso to the left. Again pause at the peak contraction, then return to the center.

Seat on a stability ball holding a barbell with an overhand grip Twist your torso to the left side while exhaling Hold the contraction for a second Twist your torso to the right side while exhaling Repeat the exercise according to the training plan

name_en: Barbell seated twist on exercise ball
description_en: Sit on an exercise ball with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Hold a barbell behind your neck and rotate your torso towards any side. Return to the initial position and rotate your torso towards the other side. Continue for a suitable duration.

Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a barbell in front of your body with your hands shoulder-width apart. Lift the barbell straight up towards your chin, keeping it close to your body. Slowly lower the barbell back down to starting position. Keep your torso stationary and your elbows above your wrists throughout the motion. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

Stand upright holding a barbell in front of your body with your hands shoulder-width apart and palms facing inwards Raise your shoulders up towards your ears as high as you can Hold the position for a second Lower your shoulders back to the starting position Repeat the movement for the desired amount of repetitions

Stand up straight with your feet at shoulder width as you hold a barbell with both hands in front of you using a pronated grip. Lift the barbell by elevating the shoulders as high as possible while you exhale. Hold the contraction at the top for a second. Lower the barbell back to the original position while you inhale. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a barbell in front of your thighs with your arms straight at your sides. Raise your shoulders towards your ears. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a bar on your shoulders behind your neck. Bend your torso towards one side and hold. Return to the initial position and bend towards the other side. Continue for a suitable duration.

Stand upright, feet shoulder-width apart, with the barbell behind your neck Keeping your back straight, bend to one side as far as you can, then return to the initial position Repeat the movement to the other side Perform the designated number of repetitions Ensure to keep your movements controlled and smooth

Stand upright with a barbell resting on your shoulders Take a big step to the side and squat down, keeping your other leg straight Lower your body until your squatting knee is bent at 90 degrees Press back up to the standing position, bringing your feet back together Switch sides and repeat the movement

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the barbell in one hand near your thigh with an underhand grip and straight arm. Raise the barbell towards the shoulder by folding your arm. As you reach the shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet wider than the shoulders. Hold a barbell near your thighs and lean forward to bring your torso nearly parallel to the floor while extending your left leg backward. Maintain this position for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand on one foot, chest high to the barbell on the floor in front of you Bend at your hips to lower your torso and grab the barbell Pull yourself back up, driving through the heel of your standing leg Lower the barbell back to the floor, controlling the movement Repeat this action on the other leg

Place the barbell across your shoulders, not your neck. Stand on one leg, keeping the other leg slightly off the ground. Slowly bend at the hips, lowering your torso towards the ground while keeping your back straight. Return to starting position by using your glutes and hamstrings. Repeat the movement with the other leg.

Stand 2-3 feet in front of a bench, extend one of your legs backward, and rest your toes on it. Stand upright in this position and hold a barbell on your shoulders just behind your neck. Lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Place a barbell on your shoulders, standing with one foot placed ahead of the other Bend your front knee to lower your body towards the ground Push up through your front heel to return to starting position Repeat with one leg before switching to the other Maintain balance and control

Stand with a barbell balanced on your shoulders behind your neck Place one foot in front of the other in a linear stance Lower your hips down until your front knee is bent at about a 90 degree angle Push back up to the standing position, driving through your front heel Switch legs and repeat

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and a barbell across the back of your shoulders Lift one foot off the floor and balance on the other, slowly bend your knee and squat down as far as comfortable Push back up through the heel of the balancing leg to return to the start Switch legs and repeat the movement Ensure to keep your torso upright during the exercise

Stand up straight with a barbell in your hands Keep your shoulders down and relaxed While keeping your arms straight, raise them up on the sides until they are parallel to the floor Lower your arms in a slow, controlled movement Repeat for the desired number of sets and reps

Stand tall near a barbell with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward while bending your knees and grab the barbell with an overhand grip and hands double shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell to your waist while unfolding your knees, then pull the barbell overhead by extending your arms while lowering your hips deep under the knees. Finally, straighten your legs and hold for a while.

Start with the barbell on the ground, slightly closer to your shins Bend at your hips and knees and grasp the bar with an overhand grip Explode upwards rapidly and shrug your shoulders, pulling the bar as high as possible Quickly drop under the bar by squatting and catch it overhead with straight arms Stand up straight to complete the lift

Start by holding the barbell on your shoulders, behind your neck Squat down slightly and forcefully push up using your legs As you push up, also press the barbell straight up until your arms are fully extended Hold this position for a moment Lower the bar back to your shoulders and repeat

Stand tall, holding a barbell over your shoulders behind your neck. Bend your knees, then raise them again like a pulse. Lower your hips under the knees while extending your arms overhead, and straighten your legs. Bend your knees, raise them again like a pulse, and then return to the initial position.

Bend over and grasp the barbell with an overhand grip Stand up and lift the bar by extending the hips and knees Lower the bar to the mid shin level while keeping the back straight Extend your knees and hips to return to the starting position Keep repeating this until the set is complete

Stand tall in front of a barbell with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Bend your knees, lower your hips, and grab a barbell with an overhand grip with your hands placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell to your knees while raising your hips, and then bring it to your waist by extending your back.

Stand tall near a barbell with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Bend your knees, lower your hips, and grab a barbell with an overhand grip with your hands placed double shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell to your knees while raising your hips, and then bring it to your waist by extending your back.

Position yourself standing with the barbell raised on blocks at mid-thigh level Grip the barbell with hands wider than shoulder width, maintaining a slight bend in the knees Explosively pull the bar upward by extending your hips and knees, keeping the bar close to your body Quickly duck under the bar to catch it overhead while you squat down to a full squat position Stand up straight by extending your hips and knees to complete the lift

Stand tall near a barbell which is placed on blocks. Lean forward while bending your knees and grab the barbell with an overhand grip and hands wider than your shoulders. Raise the barbell to your waist while unfolding your knees, then pull the barbell overhead by extending your arms while lowering your hips deep under the knees. Finally, straighten your legs and hold for a while.

Stand with your feet hip-width apart with the barbell on the ground in front of you. Bend at your hips and knees and grab the bar with a wide overhand grip. Keep your lower back naturally arched, and pull your torso up and thrust your hips forward as you stand up with the barbell. Lower the bar to the floor, bending at the hips first, then the knees. Reset before each lift. Don't bounce the bar off the floor.

Stand tall near a barbell with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Bend your knees, lower your hips, and grab a barbell with an overhand grip with your hands placed wider than the shoulders. Pull the barbell towards your abdomen while unfolding your legs and extending your back.

Stand with feet hip-width apart and place your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width on the barbell With a straight back and tight core, initiate the pull by extending your knees and hips Once the bar passes your knees, extend your hips and shrug your shoulders Return the barbell to the floor in a controlled manner Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall near a barbell with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward by bending your knees, and grab the barbell with an overhand grip and your hands wider than the shoulders. Raise the barbell to your knees while lifting your hips and bring it to your waist. Take the barbell to your chest while taking a step back, bringing your elbows under it, and then stand tall. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and the barbell in front of you Bend at your knees and hips to grab the barbell Explosively stand up, pulling the barbell up to your chest Split your legs into a lunge position as you catch the barbell at your shoulders Return to the start position and repeat

Start with the barbell in a clean position, resting on your collarbone and shoulders Bend your knees and push your hips back slightly Explosively push the barbell up as you drive yourself underneath it, splitting your legs one forward and one back Straighten your legs and bring your feet together, maintaining control of the barbell overhead Lower the barbell back to your collarbone and shoulders in a controlled movement

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a barbell over your chest just under your chin, with your arms folded, hands wider than shoulders, and palms facing the ceiling. Bend your knees, thrust the barbell overhead while taking a step back and extending your arms, and stand tall. Lower the barbell to the initial position and repeat.

Start with the barbell on the ground in front of you, slightly wider than hip-width apart Bend at the hips and knees to grip the bar Explosively lift the bar, fully extending your hips, knees and ankles As the bar reaches your shoulders, split your legs into a lunge position, catching the bar in an overhead position Stand up to a full standing position, keeping the bar overhead

Stand tall, step forward with your back straight, and hold a barbell over your shoulders just behind your neck. Lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position and repeat.
