Start by standing about 2 feet in front of a bench with a loaded barbell on your shoulders Extend one leg back and place the top of your foot on the bench Lower your body by flexing the knee and hip of your front leg until your knee almost touches the floor Return to the starting position by extending your hips and knee Switch legs and repeat

Hold the barbell on your shoulder. Stand comfortably and step your right foot forward. Bend your right knee and lower your body, creating a 90-degree angle with your right leg. Push your body back to the starting position. Switch legs and repeat.

Place a barbell across your shoulders Step forward with one foot into a lunge position Lower your body until the back knee nearly touches the ground Push back up through the heel of your front foot to return to start Switch legs and repeat the movement

name_en: Barbell Split Squat Front Foot Elevanted
description_en: Stand with one foot elevated on a surface, holding a barbell across your upper back Bend at the knee and hip of your front leg to lower your body down Keep your torso upright and avoid leaning forward Push up through your front heel to return to the starting position Repeat then switch legs

Stand with your feet hip-width apart, barbell on your upper back Bend at your hips and knees at the same time to lower your body towards the floor Once your thighs are parallel to the floor, pause for a moment Push through your heels to rise back to the initial position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Place the barbell behind your head, resting on your shoulders Slowly lower yourself down by bending your knees until your thighs are parallel to the ground Once you reach the lower position, push your body back up to the starting position Repeat this movement until your set is complete Ensure your back is straight and chest is out throughout the entire exercise

Stand with your feet hip-wide apart with a barbell on your shoulders Bend at your knees and hips, lowering your body as you keep your torso upright Hold the position for 2 seconds Push back up to your starting position through your heels Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Stand with a barbell balanced on your traps and shoulders Lower your body by bending at the hips and knees until your thighs are parallel with the ground Pause for a moment at the bottom Push your body up to return to the starting position Repeat this movement for your desired amount of reps

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place a barbell on your upper back Bend at your hips and knees to lower your body as far as you can Keep your heels flat on the floor Push your body back to the starting position Repeat the movement

Place the barbell on your upper back, not your neck Bend your knees and lower your hips like you're sitting back into a chair Drop down until your thighs are parallel to the floor Push off the floor, driving through your heels to regain standing position Keep your back straight and core tight throughout

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a barbell over your shoulders just behind your neck. Lower your hips to the floor while bending your knees. As your thighs come parallel to the floor, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a barbell over your shoulders just behind your neck. Lower your hips towards the floor as far as possible while bending your knees. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand up straight with a barbell in your hands at arm's length Keep your elbows close to your torso at all times Curl the weights while contracting your biceps Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level Slowly begin to bring the barbell back towards the starting position as your breathe in

Position your barbell over your hips, while in a standing position Step one foot forward, one foot back into a staggering stance Lower your body by bending at the hips and keeping your chest up Thrust hips up until thighs and body are aligned Return back to the initial position with a controlled movement

Stand up straight and hold a barbell with palms facing down Curl your wrists inward as far as possible Reverse the movement to uncurl your wrists, moving them as far back as possible Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand up straight while holding a barbell with an overhand grip. Slowly curl your wrists upwards while keeping your forearms stationary. Hold the top contracted position for a second as you squeeze the forearms. Lower the barbell slowly back to the initial position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart while holding a barbell behind your hips. Raise the barbell by bending your wrists towards your forearms. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Place the barbell across your upper back, shoulder width apart. Stand with your feet hip width apart, your toes facing forward. Slowly raise your heels off the ground until you are standing on your tiptoes. Pause at the top, then slowly lower your heels back down to the floor. Repeat the exercise for your desired number of reps.

Position the barbell across your shoulders Stand erect with your feet shoulder width apart Raise your body by standing on your toes as high as possible Pause for a moment at the top Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the barbell near your thighs with an underhand grip, straight arms, and hands placed close to each other. Raise the barbell towards the shoulders by folding your arms. As you reach the shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand upright, hold the barbell at a close grip with your arms extended Slowly curl the barbell up, keeping your elbows stationary and near your body Curl until your biceps are fully contracted and the barbell is at shoulder level Hold the contracted position for a brief pause Lower the barbell to the starting position in a controlled manner

Stand up straight while holding a barbell at shoulder-width with your elbows close to your torso While keeping the upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting the biceps as you breathe out Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level Hold the contracted position for a second Slowly begin to bring the bar back to original position as your breathe in

name_en: Barbell Standing Close Grip Military Press
description_en: Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart Grasp the barbell at shoulder level with a close grip Push the barbell directly overhead until arms are fully extended Lower the barbell to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the movement for desired repetitions

name_en: Barbell Standing Close Grip Military Press
description_en: Stand with feet hip-width apart holding the barbell at your upper chest Engage your core and lift the barbell straight up Pause at the top with your arms fully extended Lower the barbell back to your chest in a controlled manner Repeat the movement

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward, place your elbows over your thighs just above your knees, and hold a barbell with an underhand grip. Raise the barbell towards your shoulders by folding your arms. As you reach shoulder level, return to the starting position slowly and repeat.

Stand up straight holding a barbell at arm's length. Your elbows should be close to your torso. Curl the weights while contracting your biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze your biceps. Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as you breathe in.

Position the bar on your upper back, just beneath the neck Lift your heels off the ground while keeping your toes on the floor Extend your feet as far as possible Hold this position for a second Lower your heels slowly back to the floor

Place your toes on a step and stall tall while holding a barbell at your shoulders behind your neck. Raise yourself by lifting your heels, and hold this position for a few seconds. Return to the former position and repeat.

Stand up and hold the bar in front of your head, shoulder width apart Press the barbell upward until your arms are fully extended overhead Lower the barbell back down to the front of your head Ensure your back remains straight and upright throughout the exercise Repeat this movement for the desired amount of reps

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the barbell with an overhand grip Start with the barbell resting on your upper chest area Press the barbell directly upwards, locking your arms at the top Hold for a second at the top then slowly lower the barbell to the starting position Repeat the desired amount of times

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a barbell by folding your arms and raising your elbows over the shoulders while keeping your palms up. Raise the barbell by straightening your arms overhead. Hold for a moment, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Hold the barbell with an overhand grip Extend your arms overhead, keeping your elbows close to your ears Lower the barbell behind your head by bending at the elbows Pause, then raise the barbell by straightening your arms

Position the bar around collar bone level, with your hands just outside shoulder width apart Push the bar upwards to full arm extension Hold briefly at the top, then lower the bar back down under control Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a barbell behind your neck and rotate your torso towards any side. Return to the initial position and rotate your torso towards the other side. Continue for a suitable duration.

Stand up straight while holding a barbell behind your shoulders While keeping your lower body static, rotate your upper body and barbell to the left side Pause briefly, then rotate your body back to the start position Repeat the movement on the right side Continue alternating sides for each set

Stand upright and place the barbell on your back in the same position as you would for a squat. Keep your feet shoulder width apart, knees slightly bent, and maintain a neutral spine. Without moving your hips, turn your torso to the right as far as comfortably possible. Pause briefly then twist your torso to the left as far as comfortably possible. Repeat this process for the desired amount of repetitions.

Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the barbell with a wide grip Curl the bar up to your shoulder level while keeping your elbows stationary Hold at the top and contract your biceps Slowly return to start position Repeat the movement for your desired number of reps

name_en: Barbell standing wide grip biceps curls
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the barbell above your thighs with an underhand grip, arms slightly bent, and hands placed wider than your shoulder width. Raise the barbell towards the shoulders by folding your arms. As you reach the shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand up straight with a barbell, grasp it with a wide grip Keep your elbows close to your body Curl the weights while keeping your upper arms stationary Hold the contraction at the top for a brief moment Lower the barbell back down in a controlled fashion

Hold the barbell with a grip that is wider than shoulder width Raise the barbell until it is chest height, keeping your elbows stationary Draw your shoulder blades back and flex your biceps as the barbell comes up Lower the barbell back to the start in a controlled manner Repeat the process for your deciding number of repetitions

Stand up and hold a barbell at chest level, with hands width further than shoulder-width Lift the barbell up until your arms are fully extended above your head Hold the position for a few seconds Lower the barbell back down to the starting position in a controlled fashion Repeat the exercise as desired

Hold the barbell with an underhand grip Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart Let the wrists fall back towards the floor Flex your forearms to curl the weight back up Lower the weight back down in a controlled manner

Stand up with a barbell, keeping your grip at shoulder-width apart and palms facing your body Bend your wrists and slowly curl the barbell upwards at a controlled pace Hold the position for a moment and feel the tension in your forearms Slowly lower the barbell back to the initial position Repeat the movement for your desired number of repetitions

Place the barbell on your shoulders just like a squat Stand facing a bench or a sturdy elevated platform Step up with one leg onto the bench Push through that leg to lift your body up Slowly lower yourself back to the ground

Place a barbell across your shoulders, not your neck. Stand upright and place one foot on an elevated platform. Step up onto the platform by extending your hip and knee of your forward leg. Step down with the other foot by flexing your hip and knee. Repeat the movement by alternating the legs.

Stand tall near a bench with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a barbell behind your neck. Step on the bench with your right foot, drive up through your right leg, and stand upright on the bench. Pause momentarily, step down with your right foot, follow with the left, and repeat.

Stand tall near a barbell with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward and grab the barbell with an overhand grip and hands shoulder-width apart while keeping your legs stiff and taking your hips backward. Raise the barbell by extending your back and bringing your chest out.

Stand with feet hip-width apart, maintaining a slight bend in the knees. Hold the barbell in front of you with an overhand grip, keeping your arms fully extended and your back straight. Bend forward at your hips, lowering the barbell without bending your knees further. Lift your torso back to the starting position, pushing through your heels and engaging your glutes and hamstrings. Repeat for desired number of reps.

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hold the barbell in front of you with your arms fully extended Bend at the hips, keeping your knees slightly bent and back flat, until your upper body is parallel to the floor Push your hips forward to return to the standing position Keep the barbell close to your body at all times Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Stand upright holding a barbell, feet hip-width apart Bend at your hips and keep your knees slightly bent Lower the barbell to around mid-shin Lift the barbell back up by extending your hips and standing upright Repeat the process for your desired number of reps

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, with the barbell on the floor in front of you Lean forward from the waist, keep your knees straight, and grip the barbell Lift the barbell by extending your hips and waist until you are standing straight up Hold the top position briefly then return the weight to the floor by bending at the hips Repeat for desired number of reps

Stand tall near a barbell with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward and grab the barbell with an overhand grip and hands shoulder-width apart while keeping your legs straight and taking your hips backward. Raise the barbell by extending your back and bringing your chest out. Hold for a while, return to the starting position slowly, and repeat.

Stand tall in front of a barbell with your back straight and your feet wider than your shoulder-width Lean forward and grab a barbell with an overhand grip by bending your knees Raise the barbell by straightening your knees and leaning back into a standing position

Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing out, and barbell at your shins Bend at your hips and knees to grip the barbell Push your hips forward to stand up straight while lifting the barbell Lower the barbell to the ground by pushing your hips back and bending your knees Repeat the movement

Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and toes pointing out. Bend at your hips and knees, and then grab the barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart. Keep your back straight and lift the bar by extending your hips and knees to full extension. Slowly lower the bar back to the ground in a controlled fashion. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Stand on a raised platform or 2-4 inch deficit with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointed outward. Bend at your knees and hips to grip the barbell. Keep your hips back, with your chest up. By pushing through your heels, lift the bar until your hips and knees are locked. Hold at the top for a moment, then return the weight to the ground in a controlled manner. Repeat the movements for the desired number of reps.

Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart with the barbell on the floor in front of you Bend at your hips and knees, and grasp the barbell with an overhand grip Keeping your back straight, stand up with the barbell Lower the barbell back to the floor, pushing your hips back and keeping your chest up Repeat the exercise for the desired amount of repetitions

Stand tall near a barbell with your back straight and feet wider than your shoulder width. Lean forward and grab a barbell with an overhand grip by taking your hips backward. Raise the barbell by extending your back and bringing your chest out. Slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

Position your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing outwards Hold the barbell with both hands, extended in front of you Bend at the hips and lower the barbell down the front of your legs Keep your back straight and use your hips and hamstrings to pull the barbell back up Return to your starting position

Place the barbell on your shoulders, keeping your legs wider than hip-width apart with your toes pointed slightly outwards Bend your knees and lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the floor Hold for a second, then press through your heels to extend your legs and return to the starting position Keep your back straight during the whole movement and focus on pushing from your heels Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand with your feet wider than shoulder width, toes pointed outwards Place the barbell over your shoulder blades, holding it with both hands Bend at the knees and hips, lowering your body until your thighs are parallel to the floor Push up through your heels, returning to the starting position Repeat the process for the desired amount of repetitions

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and grasp the barbell at slightly wider than shoulder width Hold the barbell at shoulder level, and then dip down into a squat Pushing up from the squat, extend your legs and arms, lifting the barbell above your head Lower the barbell back down to your shoulders while simultaneously bending your knees to go back into the squat position Repeat the movement

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart while holding a barbell at your collar bones with your palms facing forward. Lower your hips while bending your knees. As your hips come under your knees, return to an upright position while extending your arms overhead. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward and grab a barbell in front of your thighs with your arms straight, hands placed shoulder-width apart, and palms facing forward. Maintain this position and bring the barbell towards your abdomen by bending your arms and taking your elbows past your back.

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent Hold the barbell with an underhand grip Keep your back straight and slightly lean forward from the hips Pull the barbell towards your midsection Lower the barbell slowly to the starting position

Stand upright and hold the barbell at your mid-thigh level with a shoulder-width grip Raise the barbell to your chest while keeping your elbows above your wrists Pause when the barbell is just below chin level Lower the barbell back to your mid-thigh level Repeat the process for the recommended sets and repetitions

Stand up straight with the barbell in front of your body, with your palms facing your body Raise the barbell towards your chin, keeping it close to your body Your elbows should be higher than your forearms at the top of the movement Slowly lower barbell back to the starting position

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab a barbell near your thighs with an overhand grip, straight arms, and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell towards your chest by folding your arms and taking your elbows over the shoulders. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand up straight with a barbell across your upper back. Step forward with your right foot, lowering your body until your right knee is at a 90-degree angle. Push yourself back up and bring your back foot forward to meet the lead foot. Repeat the lunge with your left foot stepping forward. Alternate legs with each repetition.

Lay flat on a bench, hold the barbell wider than shoulder-width apart Lower the bar to your chest in a controlled manner Press the bar back up until your arms are fully extended Pause at the top, then repeat the process for multiple reps

Lie down on a bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab a barbell over the chest with your arms extended, hands double shoulder-width apart, and palms facing forward. Lower the barbell by bending your arms and dipping your elbows under the bench.

Lie down on the bench with your feet flat on the ground Hold the barbell wide apart, arms extended straight above your chest Lower the barbell to your chest in a controlled motion Press the barbell up until your arms are fully extended Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab a barbell near your thighs with an overhand grip, straight arms, and hands placed double shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell towards your chest by folding your arms and taking your elbows over the shoulders. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand erect with a barbell in your hand, using a grip wider than your shoulders Lift the barbell, pulling it up until your elbows are shoulder height and the bar is near your chin Pause briefly at the top Lower the barbell in a smooth and controlled motion to the starting position Repeat this motion for desired number of repetitions

Stand up straight while holding a barbell with your hands wider than shoulder width apart. Lift the barbell upward in a straight line until it is nearly at chin level. Keep your elbows bent and pointing upwards throughout the movement. Lower the barbell back down to the waist in a controlled motion. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Stand tall holding the barbell with both hands wider than shoulder-width apart Keep your arms straight and slowly lift the barbell up to just below your chin Make sure to keep your elbows higher than your wrists at all times Pause at the top of the movement for a second Lower the barbell slowly back to the starting position

Stand tall with a barbell held at waist level, hands wider than shoulder width Lift the shoulders upwards as high as possible Hold for a second at the top of the motion Lower the barbell back down in a controlled manner

Position the barbell on your shoulders, a bit wider than normal squat stance Slowly lower your body into a squat position, bending at the knees and pushing your hips back Once you reach parallel or deeper, pause for a moment Push through your heels to return to the starting position Repeat the movement with the desired amount of reps

Place the barbell on your shoulders, wider than shoulder-width apart Lower your body by bending at the hips and knees, until your thighs are parallel to the floor Keep your back straight and your chest up Push through your heels to return to the standing position Ensure your knees stay directly over your feet throughout the motion

Sit on a bench, holding a barbell with your palms facing up Rest your forearms on your thighs, with your wrists just beyond your knees Lower the barbell towards the floor, flexing your wrists Raise the barbell by curling your wrists towards your forearms Pause at the top and repeat the movement

Start by sitting and holding a barbell in front of you with palms facing upward Bend your wrists so that the barbell rolls out of your palms Curl the barbell back up using just your wrists Repeat the motion

Sit on a bench with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab a barbell with an underhand grip just ahead of your knees while placing your elbows on your thighs. Raise the barbell by curling your wrists towards the forearms and hold for a while. Lower the barbell by returning your wrists to the initial position, and then repeat.

Sit on a bench with your back straight, open wide, and feet on the floor. Grab a barbell with an underhand grip just ahead of your knees while placing your elbows between your thighs. Raise the barbell by curling your wrists towards the forearms,  and hold for a while.

Sit on a bench with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab a barbell with an overhand grip just ahead of your knees while placing your elbows on your thighs. Raise the barbell by extending your wrists towards the forearms,  and hold for a while.

Place a loaded barbell into the crook of your elbows with palms together. Stand with your right foot planted firmly and your left foot elevated on a bench or block behind you. Bend your front knee to lower your body towards the floor, keeping your torso upright and your back tight. Use your front foot to power you back up to the standing position, pressing through your heel. Switch sides and repeat.

Sit with your legs extended straight in front of you and hold the barbell above your chest Press the barbell straight up until your arms are fully extended Pause at the top and then lower the barbell back down to your chest Keep your back straight throughout the move Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand up straight, holding a bar in your hands at shoulder width with palms facing forward Carefully curl the bar upwards, keeping the upper arms stationary Contract the biceps as you lift the weight Lower the bar back down to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat this movement

Start on a hands and knees position with palms under your shoulders and knees under your hips Extend one leg straight out to the side at hip height Bend your knee, cross it behind your stationary leg, tapping the floor with your toe Arc your leg out again to the side and straighten it out at hip height Repeat this on each leg alternately

Stand tall with your back straight, arms extended overhead, and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward and lower your arms to touch your toes while keeping your legs straight. Return to the initial position by extending your back, and repeat.

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Keep your legs as straight as possible Bend forward at the hips and reach for your toes Hold this position for a few seconds Slowly return to the start position

Start in a standing position, feet shoulder-width apart Bend your knees and lower into a squat Explosively push off the ground to jump as high as possible, mimicking a basketball shot movement Land softly on the balls of your feet and immediately go into the next squat for continuous motion Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on your feet with your back straight and legs bent while your arms are folded at your sides. Push through your feet and raise yourself while jumping in the air and extending your arms overhead and forward. Land back into the initial position and repeat.

Stand feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent Grab the ends of the rope, palms facing each other Start to wave the ropes up and down alternately Maintain the motion for the desired time Return to the starting position

Stand feet hip-width apart, knees slightly bent, hold rope with both hands Raise one arm to shoulder level and then quickly lower it back At the same time, raise the other arm to shoulder level Continue alternating the movements quickly, creating waves in the rope

name_en: Battling Ropes Alternate Arms Jump Squat
description_en: Begin in a squat position with one arm raised, holding the battling rope Explosively jump up, lifting the alternate arm, and bringing down the previously raised arm Land back in the squat position and immediately repeat the movement Continue alternating arms with each jump Maintain a brisk and steady rhythm for the duration of the exercise

name_en: Battling Ropes Alternating Waves with Kneeling Get-up
description_en: Kneel down in a sturdy position and hold the ends of the battling rope in each hand Start by making alternate waves with the rope for a set duration Lower the rope, and then rise to a standing position Return to kneeling and repeat the sequence

Start in a half kneeling position with one knee up and the other knee down Hold one end of the battling rope in each hand In a rhythmic motion, whip the ropes up and down Continue the motion for the predetermined amount of time or reps Switch to the other knee and repeat

Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding one end of the battling rope in each hand Begin by performing a standard jumping jack motion, while maintaining grip on the ropes As your legs separate, bring the ends of the rope up and out When your legs come back together, bring the ropes back down to your sides Repeat this motion in a swift, continuous rhythm

Stand feet hip-width apart, knees slightly bent, and hold the ends of the rope in each hand Raise both arms up fully extend overhead Slam the ropes down onto the ground as hard as you can, bending your knees as you do Immediately raise your arms back overhead to ready for the next slam Perform this motion in a rapid, continuous manner

Sit on the floor with a straight back Grip both ends of the battling ropes Alternate your arms to make waves with the ropes Maintain a steady pace throughout the exercise For a tougher workout, increase your speed and the size of your waves

Stand in front of the battling rope with your feet hip-width apart Grasp the rope ends in both hands, lift one leg in a forward jump while simultaneously waving the battling rope In mid-air, switch legs so that your opposite leg is in front when you land Continue this battling ropes split jump in a steady rhythm Keep your core tight and your chest upright throughout the exercise

Start in a push-up position with your hands underneath your shoulders Begin moving forward by starting with your right arm and left leg, then follow by your left arm and right leg Keep your hips stable and your head looking forward Maintain a slow and steady pace, covering a distance that you feel comfortable with Return to the starting position by crawling backwards in the same pattern

Start on your hands and knees Raise your knees so they're off the ground, keeping your back flat Move one hand and the opposite foot forward simultaneously Switch sides, moving the other hand and foot forward Keep your hips low as you continue alternating sides

Start on your hands and knees, then lift your knees off the ground and straighten your legs Keep your back flat and your body in a straight line Hold this position while keeping your abs and glutes engaged Remember to breathe evenly throughout this exercise Gently lower your knees back to the ground to finish

Start in a high plank position, palms flat on the floor, hands shoulder-width apart, shoulders stacked directly above your wrists With your core engaged, lift your right leg and bend the knee 90 degrees, bringing your heel toward your butt Kick your right leg back to straighten it, squeeze your glutes at the top Return your right knee under your body and repeat with the left leg Do as many reps as recommended

Start in a plank position with your arms straight Perform a push-up by lowering your chest towards the floor Push back up to the high plank position Lift your hips up towards the sky, bringing your body into an inverted 'V' shape Lower your body back into the starting plank position

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and bend your knees slightly Bend at the waist until your hands are on the ground in front of you Similar to a crawl, walk forward with your hands and feet Move in a smooth, controlled motion, walking forward as far as you can Gently return to your initial standing position and repeat for the desired amount of time

name_en: Behind neck lat pull down machine
description_en: Get on the lat pull-down machine with your back straight, knees bent, and feet placed on the floor Grab the bar with an overhand grip with your hands placed wider than your shoulder-width Pull the bar and bring it behind your neck by taking your elbows down Return to the initial position by straightening your arms again

name_en: Behind Neck Press Resistance Band Cable
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and a resistance band under your feet. Hold the ends of the band near your shoulders with your arms folded at the sides. Stretch the band by extending your arms overhead. As your arms become straight, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Start by standing tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms out to the sides at shoulder height Quickly bring your arms behind your back to clap Return your arms back to the starting position Repeat the motion while maintaining a rapid, continuous pace

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the stability ball above your head Quickly slam the ball down behind your head into the ground Bend your knees to pick the ball up and raise it back above your head Repeat the slam Keep on repeating for the set amount of reps or time

Stand with feet shoulder width apart, holding the stability ball overhead. Slam the ball down on the ground as hard as possible, aiming right behind your head. Bend your knees and squat to pick up the ball. Lift the ball back over your head, extending your arms and standing straight. Repeat the movement.

Start in a standing position, feet shoulder-width apart, arms by your side Raise your arms up and behind your head Swiftly move your arms forward to clap them in front before moving them back Repeat this movement for the desired amount of reps Ensure to control your movement and pace yourself

Stand tall near a bench with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Step on the bench with your right foot, drive up through your right leg, and stand upright on the bench. Pause momentarily, step down with your right foot and follow with the left. Repeat this activity, alternating the leading leg each time.

Stand 2-3 feet in front of a bench, extend one of your legs backward, and rest your toes on it. Lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie down on a decline bench with hands behind your head, knees bent to nearly 90 degrees and feet fixed. Inhale and raise your torso until it is in upright position. Slowly lower your torso back to the starting position and repeat.

Sit on the edge of a bench and place your palms on the edge, fingers pointing forwards. Move your body forward, while keeping your hands on the bench. Bend your elbows and lower your body towards the floor. Push up with your arms, straightening your elbows. Repeat this movement.

Sit on the edge of a bench with hands just outside of your hips Move forward to lift your butt off the bench and bend your knees Lower your body by bending your elbows until they're at about 90 degrees Push your body back up to the start position Repeat the movement for desired reps

Sit on a bench and place your hands on its edge near your hips. Walk your feet out with your knees bent, and take your hips off the bench while holding the bench with straight arms. Lower your hips down by folding your arms. As your arms form a 90-degree angle, raise your hips and repeat.

Sit down on a bench and place your hands on either side of your hips. Slide your butt off the bench while keeping your legs extended out in front of you. Lower your body by bending at the elbows until your arm at forearm create a 90 degree angle. Hold this position for the desired length of time. To finish, push yourself back up to the starting position.
Sit on your hips, place your hands on the floor near your hips, and prop your feet on the bench. Raise your hips and align your body straight. Maintain this position for a suitable duration.

Sit down on the floor with your legs extended in front of you. Place your hands just outside of your hips. Lift your hips off the ground by straightening your arms and pushing your palms into the ground. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your arms are at a 90 degree angle. Push your body back up to the starting position by straightening your elbows.

Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you. Place your hands on the floor behind you, fingers facing your feet. Lower your body towards the floor by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the floor. Push your body back up using your hands until your arms are fully extended. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Sit on a bench and place your hands on its edge near your hips. Walk your feet out, extend your legs, shift your weight on heels, and take your hips off the bench while holding the bench with straight arms. Lower your hips down by folding your arms and legs. As your arms form a 90-degree angle, raise your hips and repeat.

Lie down on a flat bench, stomach down Hold onto the sides of the bench for support Lift both legs up and towards the ceiling Lower your legs back down in a controlled way Remember to engage your glutes throughout

Sit down on edge of a bench with your legs straight and feet resting on the floor With your palms resting on the bench behind your back, lift your feet off the ground and slowly bring your knees towards the chest by bending them. Straighten your knees, moving the knees away from the chest and repeat the sequence.

Stand tall and place your left foot on a bench. Grab a bar by extending your arms overhead with your hands shoulder-width apart and palms facing forward. Pull your chest towards the bar by folding your arms and standing on the bench. As you stand upright on the bench, get back to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand under the bar with feet shoulder-width apart Reach up and grip the bar, palms facing forward Pull your body up until your chest reaches the bar level Hold this position for a moment Slowly lower your body back to the starting position

Stand under a bar positioned at chest height. Reach up and grip the bar, palms facing towards you. Bend your knees and hang from the bar, keeping your body straight. Pull your chest up to the bar by squeezing your shoulder blades together. Lower yourself until your arms are fully extended.

Sit down on a bench and place your hands on its edge near your hips. Walk your feet out, extend your legs, and lift your hips off the bench while holding the bench. Lower your hips down by folding your arms and bending your knees. As your arms form a 90-degree angle, raise your hips while extending your legs, and repeat.

Sit down on a bench and place your hands on the edge near your hips. Walk your feet out, straighten your legs, and lift your hips off the bench while holding the bench. Lower your hips down by folding your arms. As your arms form a 90-degree angle, raise your hips, and repeat.

Stall tall with a wall at your left. Place your left hand on the wall while bending your arm. Twist your torso towards the right side to stretch your chest and arm. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Raise your arms and clasp your hands behind your head Squeeze your shoulder blades together to stretch your arms back Hold for about 30 seconds Relax and then repeat

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Lift your arms until they are parallel to the ground and bend your elbows at a 90-degree angle Raise your arms above your head, keeping the elbows bent Lower your arms back to the starting position, maintaining the bend at the elbows Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Start with your arms by your sides. Bend your elbows so that your arms are at a 90-degree angle. Raise both arms until they're in line with your shoulders. Hold for a moment, then lower your arms back down. Keep your arm movements controlled and steady.

name_en: Bent Knee Abduction Crunch with Arms Through
description_en: Start by lying down on your back on a flat surface. Bend your knees and keep your feet flat on the ground. Place your arms through between your thighs and reach toward your knees. Exhale and lift your shoulder blades off the floor, while pushing your knees outward. Slowly lower yourself back down in a controlled fashion, inhaling as you do.

name_en: Bent Knee Back to Side Kick
description_en: Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Raise your right knee to hip level while keeping your toes pointed Kick out to your right side while keeping your knee bent Return your right leg to the center and lower it back down Repeat this action with your left leg

name_en: Bent Knee Back to Side Kick
description_en: Start in a standing position. Lift your right knee up to hip height, bending it at a 90 degree angle. Extend your right leg out to your side, keeping your knee bent. Bring your leg back to the front, and lower it down to complete one rep. Repeat with the left leg.

name_en: Bent Knee Back To Side Kick
description_en: Get down on all your four while keeping your arms and back straight. Raise one of your knees to the hip level by extending your thigh backward, then return. Raise your knee again to the hip level by opening your thigh to the side, then return. Repeat the whole sequence.

Lie flat on your back with your legs bent at the knees and your feet flat on the floor. Place your arms out to the side at shoulder height. Lower your legs to one side until the hip nearly touches the ground, keeping the shoulder blades flat against the floor. Engage your core and lift your legs back to the starting position. Repeat the movement to the other side.

Lie down on your back with your hips and knees bent, arms spread wide on the floor, and your legs placed on a stability ball. Slide your legs to one side while rotating your pelvis and keeping your torso stable. Hold for a while, slide towards the other side, and repeat.

Lie on your back on the floor, legs straight out in front of you, arms out to your sides in a T shape. Bend your knees at a 90-degree angle and lift your feet off the floor. Keeping your shoulders pressed into the floor, slowly drop your knees to one side. Hold this position for a moment, then return to the starting position. Repeat this movement on the other side and continue alternating.

Lie down on your back with your hips and knees bent, arms spread wide on the floor, and feet in the air. Rotate your pelvis to one side and take your knees towards the floor while keeping your torso stable. Hold for a while, rotate towards the other side, and repeat.

Start by lying on your back on a stability ball with your feet flat on the ground Bend your knees to a 90 degree angle and place your hands out to your sides for balance Lower your knees to one side until they reach the ground, keeping your shoulders flat on the ball Hold this position for a few seconds Return your knees back to the starting position and then lower them to the other side

Kneel on the floor or an exercise mat and position your hands under your shoulders. Keeping your knee bent at a 90-degree angle, lift one leg up until your thigh is parallel to the floor. Pause at the peak of the movement and squeeze your glutes. Lower your leg back down to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat with the other leg.

Get on your hands and knees on a mat with your knees under your hips and your hands under your shoulders. Keep your right knee bent at 90 degrees as you lift it behind you until your body forms a straight line from your head to your right knee. Squeeze your glutes at the top of the movement, then slowly return to the starting position. Repeat the movements with your left leg. Do the recommended number of sets and reps for each side.

Start in a kneeling position with your hands below your shoulders Lift one leg, keeping a bent 90 angle Exhale and extend this leg to the side as high as comfortable Pause briefly, then lower the leg in a controlled manner Repeat the movement with the other leg

Get down on all your four while keeping your arms, back,  and thighs straight. Raise one of your knees to the hip level by opening your thighs and keeping your leg bent. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Start this exercise by positioning yourself on your hands and knees on a comfortable surface Make sure your hands are positioned directly under your shoulders Extend one of your legs out to the side while keeping the knee slightly bent Return to the initial position in a controlled manner Repeat the movement before switching to the other leg

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and lean forward to hold a barbell with an overhand grip near your knees. Take your hips backward while bending your knees slightly. Raise the barbell towards your abdomen while folding your arms and taking your elbows past your back.

Stand tall with your back straight and a resistance band under your feet Lean forward and grab the handles of the band near your knees while keeping your arms straight Pull the band by folding your arms and taking your elbows past your back Return to the initial position by releasing the band and repeat

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward and grab a straight bar in front of your thighs with your arms straight, hands placed shoulder-width apart, and palms facing forward. Maintain this position and bring the barbell towards your abdomen by bending your arms and taking your elbows past your back.

Stand tall and place your feet shoulder-width apart Bend your knees slightly and lean forward from your waist Grab each end of the towel, hold it so it's taut Pull the towel towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body Slowly release the towel back out in front of you

Stand straight, feet shoulder-width apart Bend over at the waist with a slight bend in your knees, letting your arms hang down naturally Keeping your back straight, swing your arms back and forth gently, simulating a pendulum Increase the amplitude of your swinging arms each time, ultimately aiming for oversized motions Make sure to engage your back and shoulder muscles as you swing

Stand tall while holding a straight bar behind your neck and lean forward with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Rotate your torso towards any side to your maximum range. Return to the initial position and rotate your torso towards the other side. Continue for a suitable duration.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and slightly bend your knees Extend your arms to shoulder-height, straight out from your sides Twist your torso to the right so that your shoulders form a diagonal line Twist back to the starting position and then repeat on the left side Continue alternating between right and left twists per your fitness plan

Stand with your legs slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and hold a medicine ball between them Squat down and retrieve the ball with both hands In one motion, stand up, lift the ball above your head and throw it forward as far as you can After throwing the ball, follow through with a side kick using your dominant leg Retrieve the ball and repeat the process

name_en: Bicep curl low cable machine normal grip
description_en: Stand tall facing the cable machine with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the bar in front of your thighs with an underhand grip, straight arms, and your hands placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the bar towards the shoulders by bending your arms. As you reach shoulder level, return to the starting position and repeat.

Stand tall facing the cable machine with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the bar in front of your thighs with an underhand grip, straight arms, and your hands placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the bar towards the shoulders by bending your arms. As you reach shoulder level, return to the starting position and repeat.

Stand tall facing the cable machine with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the bar in front of your thighs with an underhand grip, straight arms, and your hands wider than your shoulder width. Raise the bar towards the shoulders by bending your arms. As you reach shoulder level, return to the starting position and repeat.

name_en: Biceps curl cable wide grip crossover machine
description_en: Stand tall facing the crossover machine with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the bar in front of your thighs with an underhand grip, straight arms, and your hands wider than your shoulder width. Raise the bar towards the shoulders by bending your arms. As you reach shoulder level, return to the starting position and repeat.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Keeping your elbows close to your body, curl your arms upward Pause at the top of the curl and squeeze your biceps Lower your arms in a slow and controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight, arms extended forward at shoulder height, palms up, and feet shoulder-width apart. Curl your arms and take a short step forward with your right foot while keeping the other foot in place. Return to the starting position and do the same while stepping with your other foot.

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Hold dumbbells in both hands at arm's length Curl the weights while keeping your upper arms stationary Lift until the dumbbells are at shoulder level Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and a resistance band under your feet. Hold the ends of the band with your arms at your side and palms facing forward. Stretch the band towards the shoulders by bending your arms. As you reach shoulder level, return to the starting position and repeat.

name_en: Biceps Curl To Shoulder Press Resistance Band
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and a resistance band under your feet. Hold the ends of the band with your arms at your side and palms facing forward. Stretch the band towards the shoulders by bending your arms. As you reach shoulder level, turn your forearms inwards and straighten your arms overhead..

Sit on a bench with your legs spread and a dumbbell in one hand. Rest your arm holding the dumbbell on the same side leg just above the knee. Curl the dumbbell while keeping your upper arm stationary. Hold on the contraction for a second, then slowly bring the dumbbell back to starting position. Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps before switching arms.

Sit on the edge of a bench with your knees bent, and feet open wide on the floor. Lean forward and place one of your elbows on your thigh and reach under your other thigh. Hold the thigh just above the back of your knee and raise it towards the shoulder by folding your arm. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Hold the barbell with both hands shoulder width apart Bend your elbows and curl the bar up towards your shoulders Hold for a moment, then lower the barbell slowly to the original position Repeat this motion multiple times
Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Interlace your hands behind your waist and slowly raise them behind you. Hold for 30-60 seconds.

Lie flat on your back with hands behind your head Raise both knees into your chest Twist your torso to the left as you pull your right knee in, simultaneously straightening your left leg Twist your torso to the right, pulling in your left knee and straightening your right leg Alternate sides in a pedalling motion for the desired number of reps

Lie down on the floor and support your hips on your hands while placing your elbows on the floor. Alternately bend and straighten your legs as you are riding a bicycle. Continue for a suitable duration.

Lie flat on the floor with your lower back pressed to the ground Place your hands slightly either side of your head, do not lock your fingers behind your head Lift your knees to about a 45-degree angle Slowly go through a bicycle pedal motion with your legs Alternate touching your elbows to the opposite knee twisting back and forth

Lie flat on the ground with your lower back pressed to the ground. Put your hands behind your head, without pulling on your neck. Lift your knees to about a 60-degree angle and perform a pedaling motion as if you were on a bicycle Every time you pedal, reach your elbow to the opposite knee, alternating between sides. Keep alternating in this manner until you complete your set.
Get on a stationary bicycle machine while keeping your back straight and your arms at your sides. Start paddling by alternately bending and straightening your legs. Continue for desired duration.

Sit on the lever machine, placing feet on the paddles Slowly push one paddle forward while pulling the other one back as if you are pedaling a bicycle Keep your back straight and abs engaged throughout the movement Switch leg positions, always pedaling forward Do this in a continuous motion for desired time range

Start in a seated position on the ground with your legs extended in front of you and lean back onto your elbows Start to 'cycle' your legs as if you were riding a bicycle, bringing one knee in towards your chest as you extend the other leg out Repeat this pedalling motion for the desired duration Engage your core throughout the exercise to maintain position Keep your motion smooth and controlled throughout

Lie down on your back with your arms resting at your sides Lift your feet off the floor and raise your legs in the air while keeping them straight. Bring one knee towards your chest while keeping the other leg straight. Straighten this knee and simultaneously bring the other knee towards the chest by bending it. Create a rhythm of alternatively bending and straightening your knee (as you are riding a bicycle).

Lie down on your back with your legs straight, arms slightly bent and palms on each side of your head. Lift your upper back and feet off the floor and bring your one knee towards the chest and try to touch it with elbow of the opposite side by rotating your torso. Straighten your knee and torso and simultaneously bring the other knee towards chest and touch it with the opposite side's elbow. Repeat the sequence of movements and create a rhythm.

Lie down on your back with your legs extending straight in the air making a V-shape. Place your hands behind your head. Raise your chest and twist your torso to one side while bringing the opposite knee close. Return to the initial position and repeat by twisting towards the other side.

Stand with your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms out to the sides at shoulder level Gradually rotate your upper body to the right until you feel a stretch in your chest Hold this position for about 15-30 seconds Repeat on the other side

Start on all fours, with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips. Extend one leg and the opposite arm at the same time. Hold for a few seconds while keeping your body stable. Slowly lower your arm and leg back to the starting position. Repeat the same action with the opposite arm and leg.

Start on your hands and knees so that your back is flat and your knees are under your hips Raise one arm and the opposite leg to full extension Hold for a brief moment at the top Slowly lower your arm and leg back to the starting position and repeat on the other side Ensure your movements are slow and controlled and your core remains engaged throughout

Get down on all your four and ensure your hands are right under your shoulders and your knees under your hips. Raise your one arm forward up to your shoulder height and, at the same time, your opposite leg backward unless your foot comes above your back. Return to the starting position and repeat.

Start on your hands and knees with your knees under your hips and hands under your shoulders Slowly extend your left leg behind you while reaching out in front with your right arm Maintain your balance and keep your body straight Hold this position for a few seconds Switch sides and repeat

Get down on all four and ensure your hands are right under your shoulders and your knees under your hips. Raise your one arm forward up to your shoulder height and, simultaneously, your opposite leg backward unless your foot comes in line with your back. Return to the starting position and repeat.

Start on your hands and knees, hands directly under your shoulders and knees directly under your hips Extend one leg and the opposite arm straight out, making a straight line from your hand to your foot Hold this position for a moment Slowly return your hand and knee to the ground Repeat with the other arm and leg

name_en: Bird of Paradise Pose Svarga Dvijasana
description_en: Start by standing tall, balance on the right leg and bring the left ankle to cross over the right thigh Bend the standing leg so that you're in a single-leg squat Thread your right arm under your left knee and reach for your left hand behind your back Slowly begin to stand lifting the bound foot with you Once balanced, kick the bound foot out to the side, opening the chest and shoulder

Begin by sitting down on the floor, knees slightly bent and feet flat on the ground Lean back slightly, keeping your spine straight Slowly raise your feet off the floor, bringing your shins to a parallel position towards the ceiling Extend your arms out, so that they are parallel with your shins Hold the position as long as you can in a controlled manner

Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat Hold onto the backs of your thighs and lean back slightly Lift your feet off the floor and balance on your tailbone Straighten your legs and lean back more if possible Hold this position for the desired amount of time

Get down on your hips with your knees bent and feet on the floor, and lean backward while placing your hands at your sides. Grab your legs by placing your hands under the knees, and lift your feet off the floor to make a V-shape with your body. Maintain this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Flex your muscles from legs to your neck Put your arms in a position that best displays your biceps, triceps, and shoulders Turn slightly to showcase your back and abdominal muscles Maintain the pose while controlling your breath

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Flex all muscles starting from your fingers, hands, arms, and proceeding to lower body Hold your chest out and keep shoulders pushed back Maintain the pose for a few seconds Relax and repeat

Start in a high plank position with your wrists directly under your shoulders Push your body backwards to shift your weight back into your heels, coming into Down Dog position Return to the starting plank position Repeat this motion for your desired amount of reps

Start in a forearm plank position with your feet on a smooth surface Push your body back by propelling yourself with your forearms and toes Move back until your body is extended to your limit Pull yourself back to the starting position Repeat the movements

Get down on your forearms and toes and align your body in a straight line from your neck to your ankles Propel your body forward while keeping your toes and elbows on the floor. Keep doing that for a suitable duration.

Stand tall with your back straight,  arms spread wide to shoulder height, and feet placed wider than your shoulders. Keep your legs straight and thrust your pelvis to one side by taking your hips out. Return to the initial position, do the same on the other side, and keep repeating.

Begin by standing up straight, with your feet shoulder-width apart Lean your torso forward and slide your hands down your thighs, knees, and shins until you reach your toes Hold this position briefly, keeping your core muscles engaged Return to the standing position by sliding your hands back up your legs Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart, lower your hips to knee level, and extend your arms back at your sides. Push through your feet and raise yourself upright while raising your heels and extending your arms overhead. Return to the starting position and repeat.

Start with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent and core engaged Lower yourself into a slight squat Propel your body upwards and forwards with as much force as possible When you land, bend your knees to lower your body back into the squat position Repeat this movement for your desired number of repetitions

Lie down on your stomach while placing your hands near the sides of your chest, and straighten your legs by keeping your toes on the floor. Raise your chest off the floor by straightening your arms. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Start in a seated position on the floor with your hands placed behind you Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the floor Push your upper body off the floor using your triceps until your arms are fully extended Lower your body back down in a controlled fashion

Stand in front of a bench or other similar stable and knee level structure Lower your body towards the bench in a controlled manner until your glutes touch it Make sure your knees are in line with your feet Push up from the heels to return to the starting position Repeat the exercise in 3 sets of 12-15 reps

name_en: Bodyweight Bent Over Rear Delt Fly
description_en: Stand up straight with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent. Hinge at the hips, maintaining a straight back, until your torso is almost parallel to the floor. Extend your arms straight down from your shoulders, palms facing each other. Keeping a slight bend in your elbows, lift your arms out to the sides until they're at shoulder height. Lower your arms in a controlled manner to the starting position

Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart Interlace your fingers behind your head and pull your elbows back so your chest is in an open and expanded position Lower your body as far as you can by pushing your hips back and bending your knees Pause, then slowly push yourself back to the starting position Repeat for your desired amount of reps

Begin in a bent over position with your feet shoulder width apart Bend your elbow possessing arms behind you Slowly straighten your elbow extending your arms Hold for a moment then bend your elbows to return to start position Repeat the process

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Step forward with one foot, bending both knees to lower your body Keep your front knee over the ankle, and back knee pointing downwards Push back up to the starting position Repeat with the other leg and continue for the set

Start in a squatting position with your heels close together, and your toes pointed outwards Push your hips upwards while squeezing your glutes Lower yourself back into the squatting position Make sure to keep your feet planted, and your knees pointed towards your toes throughout the exercise Repeat for the desired amount of reps

Lie down on your back with your knees bent, feet close together and soles flat on the ground. Flare your knees outwards and keep your feet close together to form a 'frog' position. Elevate your hips upwards and contract your glutes at the top. Lower your hips back to starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat the movement pattern for your desired number of repetitions.

name_en: Bodyweight Front Plank to Downward Dog
description_en: Start in a traditional plank position with your forearms on the ground and your body perfectly straight Push your body upwards into the Downward Dog pose, pushing your hips up and back, forming an upside down V-shape with your body Hold the downward dog position for a few seconds Ease back into the plank position in a controlled movement Repeat the movement for your desired number of reps

Start in a standing position with feet hip-width apart. Raise your arms straight above your head, imitating holding an imaginary ball. Contract your abs and forcefully throw the imaginary ball down towards your feet, while keeping your arms straight. Bend at the waist and follow your arms through, aiming to touch the ground. Immediately get back to the initial position and repeat the movement.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet placed wider than your shoulders. Clasp your hands above your head while extending your arms overhead. Lower your hips to knee height, lean forward, and take your hands towards the floor through your knees and hold. Return to the starting position and repeat.

Stand tall with your feet shoulder width apart Raise both of your arms overhead Simultaneously swing both arms downward in front of your body quickly and intensely At the end of the swing, squat down while maintaining a flat back Stand up and repeat the procedure

name_en: Bodyweight Full Squat with Overhead Press
description_en: Begin in a standing position with your feet shoulder width apart Squat down by bending your knees and hips until your thighs are parallel to the floor Push up to a standing position, while simultaneously extending your arms overhead Lower your arms as you squat down again Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Bodyweight Full Squat with Overhead Press
description_en: Stand erect with feet shoulder-width apart Begin by performing a traditional squat, bending at your knees and pushing your hips back While descending, simultaneously raise your arms above your head Drive yourself back up to the standing position while lowering your arms Repeat this process for the requisite number of reps.

name_en: Bodyweight Full Squat With Overhead Press
description_en: Start by squatting on your knees with your thighs parallel to the floor and your arms resting on your knees with palms side down. Raise your hips upright while turning your forearms outward and extending your arms overhead. Return to the starting position and repeat.

name_en: Bodyweight Full Squat With Overhead Press
description_en: Start by squatting on your knees with your thighs parallel to the floor and your arms resting on your knees with palms side down. Raise your hips, and extend your back while straightening your legs and extending your arms overhead. Return to the starting position and repeat.

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Slowly bend forward at your hips while maintaining a straight back Continue to lower your upper body until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings Hold the position for a moment Gradually raise your upper body back to the initial position

Stand straight up with feet hip-width apart Bend slightly at the knees and drive your hips back lowering your torso Once your torso is parallel to the floor, squeeze your glutes and drive your hips forward to stand back up Make sure your back is straight during the entire movement Repeat the exercise for the recommended repetitions

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Lower your body into a squat by bending at the hips and knees while keeping your chest up Descend until your thighs are parallel or just below parallel to the floor Push through your heels to return to the standing position, straightening your hips and knees Repeat for the desired number of reps

name_en: Bodyweight Heel Elevated Bulgarian Split Squat
description_en: Stand in front of a raised surface, about lunge-length away Extend one leg behind you, placing the top of your foot on the raised surface Lower your body down until your front knee is bent at about a 90-degree angle Push through your front heel to raise your body back to the starting position Switch legs and repeat the exercise for the other leg

Find a small, stable platform to elevate your heels (like a mat or two plates) Stand tall, placing your feet shoulder-width apart Slowly lower your body by bending your knees and driving your hips back until your thighs are parallel to the floor Pause at the bottom of the squat and then push your body back up to standing position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent Swing the arms up while pushing your hips forward and straightening your legs Perform a controlled descend by bending your knees and hips, swinging your arms back Repeat by propelling your body back up via your hips and arms momentum Continue the swinging motion for the desired number of reps

Find a spacious area and place two towels on the ground. Kneel down onto the towels with your knees wide apart. Lean forward until your chest is near to the floor, keeping your back straight. Use your glutes and hamstrings to push your hips forwards and raise your torso to the starting position. Repeat this movement for the desired number of reps.

Start in a kneeling position on the floor Keep your back straight and look forward Rise to a standing position by pushing into the ground with your knees and feet Lower yourself back into the kneeling position in a controlled manner Repeat this movement several times

Place your knees on the floor with your back straight and arms hanging by your side. Raise one of your knees, bring your foot forward, and stand upright, followed by your other foot. Return back to the kneeling position and repeat.

Start on your hands and knees, hands directly under your shoulders Lower your body down towards the floor, bending at the elbows Push back up using your arms and upper body strength Raise one hand up towards your torso, then lower it back down Repeat the process, alternating hands

Lie down on your stomach while placing your hands near the sides of your chest, and straighten your legs by keeping your knees on the floor. Raise your chest off the floor by straightening your arms and bring one of your elbows past your back. Return to the former position and bring your other elbow past your back after raising your chest.

Begin in a kneeling position with your knees hip-width apart Lean backward, extending your arms in front of you for balance Lower your hips toward your heels, aiming to touch your glutes to your heels Pause at the bottom, then push your hips forward to rise back to the starting position

Kneel with your feet hip-width apart, placing your toes flat on the ground Lean back with your torso while keeping your body straight from your knees to your head Lower yourself until your buttocks are near your heels Push your body back to the initial position Repeat for the required amount of repetitions

Place your knees on the floor with your back straight and grab your hands behind your hips. Lower your hips towards your calf while leaning back to your maximum range. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Keep your hands near your thighs, raise one of your knees forward, and tap it with your opposite hand. Return to the initial position and do the same with the other knee and opposite hand.

Get down on your hands and knees while extending your back. Lower your forearms to the ground so that your elbows come right under your shoulders. Raise yourself by lifting your elbows and straightening your arms. As your arms are fully extended, lower yourself on your forearms and repeat.

Begin in a kneeling position on a mat, hands below shoulders Lower your torso towards the floor by bending your elbows Push yourself back up by extending your elbows and using your triceps Keep your core engaged throughout Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Start on your knees with your arms extended in front of you Lean forward until your forehead nearly touches the ground Use your triceps to push your body back up Pause for a moment at the top, then repeat

Begin in a high plank position with hands planted firmly on the ground Rapidly bring your knees one at a time towards your chest Always maintain a strong plank position, keeping your core tight Alternate knees in a fast-paced motion, similar to running in place Reposition yourself back into the plank position
Stand tall and step back with your left foot. Keep your knees slightly bent and thrust your left knee forward while bringing your hands towards it. Return to the former position and repeat.

Start in a high plank position, body straight and hands directly below your shoulders Bring one knee up towards the same side hand while maintaining the plank position Tap your knee to your hand, then return your leg to the starting position Repeat with the other leg Continue alternating legs for the duration of the exercise
Stand beside a step or bench Put your nearer foot on the step and push your body up Lower yourself down to the starting position Switch sides and repeat Keep your core engaged throughout

Start by standing upright with your feet hip-width apart Step forward with one foot, keeping the other foot behind Lower your body by bending the knee of the front leg until it is at a 90-degree angle Keep the back knee hovering above the floor Push up through your front heel to return to standing, then switch legs

Lie flat on your back on a comfortable surface Keep your arms at your sides, palms facing down Bend one knee and bring it towards your chest as far as comfortable Lower the leg back down slowly and repeat with the other leg Continue alternating for the desired repetitions

Lie down on your stomach while curling your arms at your chest and extend your legs on the floor. Raise your toes off the floor and curl your legs towards your hips. Hold for a while, return back to the floor and repeat.

Lie flat on your stomach on the floor Place your hands on sides for support Bend your knees and curl your legs up towards your buttock Hold this position for a moment Lower your legs back down to the starting position

Lie flat on your stomach with legs straight behind you Bend your knees and curl legs towards your buttocks Pause briefly at the top of the movement Slowly extend your legs returning to start position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Lie down on your side with your legs stacked Prop your upper body up on your elbow Contract your obliques to lift your legs and upper body off the ground as high as possible Lower yourself back down in a controlled fashion Switch sides and repeat the exercise

Lie face down on the floor with your arms extended above your head in a 'Y' shape Lift your arms and chest off the ground while keeping your legs straight and on the ground Pause at the top of the movement for a few seconds Lower your body back down to the ground

Lie down on your side on a flat surface Position your elbow at a 90-degree angle, close to your body Rotate your arm at the shoulder, lifting your forearm until it's vertical Lower your forearm back to its starting position Repeat the exercise on the both sides

Start while hanging on a bar with your arms extended overhead, hands placed wider than your shoulders, and palms facing forward. Pull your chest towards the bar while folding your arms and roll your chest over the bar by leaning your shoulders over your hands. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Begin in a dead hang position from a high pull-up bar Pull yourself up explosively to bring your chest close to the bar Once at the top, press your body upwards until your arms are fully extended, completing the muscle-up Lower yourself down slowly back to the start position Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Stand with your feet a bit narrower than shoulder-width apart Slowly lower your body as far as you can by pushing your hips back and bending your knees Pause for a moment at the bottom Push yourself back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand with your feet hip-width apart Lower your body while keeping your torso upright by bending at your knees and hips Push through your heels to return to the standing position Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions Keep your knees in line with your feet throughout the movement

Stand upright with your arms extended straight above your head, shoulder-width apart Bend your knees and push your hips back as if you're about to sit in a chair Continue bending knees until your thighs are parallel with the ground Keep your chest up and your back straight as you perform the squat Drive through your heels to stand back up, keeping your arms extended overhead throughout the movement

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart while extending your arms overhead. Lower your hips towards the floor while bending your knees. As your hips and knees level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your arms extended straight above your head Lower your body down by bending at the hips and knees, keeping your arms above your head Go down so that your thighs are parallel to the floor Press back up to the starting position while keeping arms above your head Repeat for the desired number of reps

Start in a standing position, feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms upwards with your palms facing each other. Bend your elbows, lowering your hands towards the back of your head or neck. Pause briefly, then extend your elbows to bring your hands back up. Ensure your elbows remain close to your head throughout the movement. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight and feet placed wider than your shoulders. Clasp your hands above your head while extending your arms overhead. Tighten your arms muscles and fold your arms by taking your hands down behind your head. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand up straight while holding a medicine ball close to your chest. Slowly lower yourself into a squat position while keeping the medicine ball stable. Hold this squat position for two seconds. Push your body back up to the starting position. Repeat the cycle for your target number of reps.
