Start standing straight with your feet hip-width apart Step forward with one foot until your leg reaches a 90-degree angle In this position, slowly pulsate up and down by bending and extending the front knee Push up back to the starting position Switch legs and repeat

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and place your hands on your waist. Take a step forward and lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, pulse downward 2-3 times and use its recoil to return to a standing position and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and extend your arms forward. Lower your hips towards the floor by bending your knees. As your thighs become parallel to the floor, raise your hips to mid-way and lower them again. Use its recoil to return to a standing position and repeat.

Stand with feet hip-width apart, toes pointed slightly out Lower into a squat position Hold squat position and pulse up and down A pulse is a full squat followed by a half squat Return to standing position and repeat

Start by standing straight, feet shoulder-width apart. Descend into a squat by bending your hips and knees, ensuring knees don't go past toes. Instead of coming back up fully, only come halfway up, then lower back down into the full squat. Continue this up-and-down pulsing motion. Return to standing position.

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Slowly lower your body into a squat position At the bottom of the squat, make small pulsing movements Drive your heels into the ground and return to the starting position Repeat for desired number of repetitions

name_en: Bodyweight Pulse Squat Arms To Chest
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hands clasped on your chest. Lower your hips towards the floor by bending your knees. As your thighs become parallel to the floor, raise your hips to mid-way and lower them again. Use its recoil to return to a standing position and repeat.

Begin in a lunge position with your right foot forward and the left foot back. Lean forward from the waist and raise your left arm to the side, elbow bent at 90 degrees. Extend your left arm back, keeping your elbow close to your body. Without fully straightening your arm, return it to the 90-degree angle. Repeat the pulsing motion for the desire number of reps and then switch sides.

Lay on your back on a mat with your arms extended to your sides Lift your legs off the ground and keep them straight, toes pointed Move your legs in a rainbow arc from one side to the other Control the movement and do not allow your lower back to lift off the ground Return your legs to center and repeat on the opposite side

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and place your hands on your waist. Step back and lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to standing and repeat by stepping with your other leg.

Stand upright, hands on your hips Step one foot back about two feet, keeping the front foot in place Lower your body by bending both knees 90 degrees Push off the rear foot and return to starting position Repeat with the other foot

Stand upright with feet hip-width apart Take a step backwards with one foot Lower down until your front knee is at a 90 degree angle and your back knee nearly touches the ground Push back up to the starting stance Alternate legs and repeat

Stand tall with your back straight, arms by your side, and feet shoulder-width apart. Step back and lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee and extending your arms forward. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to standing and repeat by stepping with your other leg.

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Take a large step back with your right foot while lifting both arms in front of you Lower your body into a lunge by bending both knees Rise back to the start position and lower your arms Repeat the exercise by stepping back with your left foot

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Step your right foot back into a lunge, bending both knees at a 90-degree angle Simultaneously, raise your arms straight in front of you until they're shoulder level Return to standing position and lower arms Repeat with the left leg and continue alternating

Begin in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart Step your right foot back and lower into a lunge Rotate your upper body to the left while keeping your lower body stable Return your torso to center and push yourself back up to standing position Repeat the movement, this time stepping back with your left foot while rotating to the right

Stand straight with feet hip-width apart Step backward with one foot, lowering your hips until both knees are bent at a 90-degree angle Keep your front knee directly above your ankle, not pushed out too far Keep your other knee slightly off the floor Return to standing by pushing off the heel of your front foot

Start by standing up straight, your feet shoulder-width apart Step one foot back, dropping into a reverse lunge by bending both knees Push off your back foot and propel your knee towards your chest Lower the raised leg back into the reverse lunge Repeat on the other side

name_en: Bodyweight Reverse Lunge with Overhead Reach
description_en: Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Take a step back with your right foot and lower your body until your left knee is at a 90-degree angle At the same time, raise your arms over your head Push back up to the starting position Repeat these steps, alternating legs

Stand in front of an open doorway Extend your arms to hold onto the doorway sides Lean back until your body is at a slight angle Pull yourself towards the door using your back and arm muscles Return back to the starting position in a controlled manner

name_en: Bodyweight Side Lying Inner Thigh-up and Down
description_en: Start by lying on your side on a flat surface, with your body straight from head to toe Rest your top arm on your hip or use it to steady yourself Lift your top leg and hold it slightly in front of your lower leg Keeping your toes pointed forward, raise your bottom leg off the ground Lower your bottom leg in a controlled manner to return to the start

Lie on your side with your legs straight and on top of each other Slowly lift your lower leg as high as you can while keeping it straight Pause at the top for a second Slowly lower your lower leg back down Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other side

Lie on one side with your legs stacked on top of each other Keeping your bottom leg straight, slowly lift it up towards the ceiling Lower your leg back down in a controlled manner Repeat this movement for a set amount of times, then turn over and do the same with your other leg

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Take a large step out to your right. Keep your left leg straight as you push your hips back and down on the right side Push through the right heel to stand back up and bring your right foot back to the starting position Repeat the process on your left side Alternate sides with each rep for the duration of your set

Stand straight, feet hip-width apart with a towel placed under one foot. Slide your foot out to the side while bending the stationary leg until the knee is at a 90-degree angle. Push back up to starting position through your heels. Switch the towel to another foot and repeat the movements. Keep your movements slow and controlled for more effectiveness.

Stand on one foot with the other foot behind you. Bend at your hips, lowering your body and raising your back leg. Keep your back straight and use your glutes and hamstrings to pull yourself back up. Repeat the movement with the other leg. Keep alternating legs for the desired amount of reps.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms while leaning forward, nearly parallel to the floor, and extend your left leg backward. Straighten your back while lowering your leg and standing upright. Return to the former position and repeat.

Stand on one foot while lifting the other leg behind you. Bend at your hips, lowering your torso towards the ground. Balance your body to remain stable throughout the movement. Return to stand straight, keeping contact with your one foot on the ground. Repeat and switch legs.

Stand on one leg, keeping your other leg slightly off the ground Slowly bend your standing knee, lowering yourself down into a squat position Maintain balance throughout the motion Push up through your heel to return to the starting position Repeat this on both legs for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Bodyweight Single Leg Squat with Support
description_en: Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart. Raise one foot off the floor, extending it forward. Slowly lower your body while keeping your supporting leg bent. Lower until your thigh is almost parallel to the floor. Push yourself back up and repeat with the other leg.

Begin by standing erect with a skipping rope in each hand, hands resting on your sides Jump off the ground, simultaneously swing the skipping rope over your head and beneath your feet Land gently on the balls of your feet and immediately jump again Ensure that your jumps are not too high; keep them low and quick for increased speed and efficiency Continue skipping for your desired number of repetitions or duration

Stand straight with the jump rope in your hands, feet should be hip-width apart Swing the rope over your head and start jumping on the balls of your feet Keep your jumps low to the ground and stay light on your feet Keep your elbows close to the sides of your body Repeat the movement

Stand with your feet spread slightly wider than shoulder-width apart Squat down slowly, keeping your back straight and your chest up Pause at the bottom of the squat Push back up to the starting position with an explosive movement Repeat this action

name_en: Bodyweight Split Squat Front Foot Elevanted
description_en: Stand tall with a step or bench in front of you. Place one foot on the elevated surface, bending the knee slightly. Lower your body until your back knee nearly touches the floor. Push back up to the starting position. Repeat the exercise, then switch legs.

Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart, arms hanging loosely by your sides Lower your body by bending your knees until your thighs are nearly parallel to the floor Keep your core engaged and back straight Push yourself upwards to the starting position Repeat for the set number of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and place your hands at opposite shoulders. Lower your hips to the floor by bending your knees. As your thighs become parallel to the floor, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart Lower your body as far as you can by pushing your hips back and bending your knees Pause for a few seconds in the squat position and keep your back straight Slowly stand up and repeat Aim to do 15-20 repetitions for a set

Stand on the slackline with feet hip-width apart Bend your knees and hips to lower your body as if you were sitting back into a chair Keep your chest up and look straight ahead Push up through your heels to return to the starting position Repeat the movement for desired repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and place your hands at opposite shoulders. Lower your hips to the floor by bending your knees. As your thighs become parallel to the floor, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and place your hands at opposite shoulders. Lower your hips to the floor by bending your knees. As your thighs become parallel to the floor, hold for some seconds then return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your toes pointing forward Lower your body as far as you can by pushing your hips back and bending your knees Pause and then slowly push yourself back to the starting position Lift one foot off the ground and extend it in front of you, balancing on your other foot Perform the exercise for the desired reps and then repeat with your other leg

Stand tall with your back straight, arms by your side, and feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your hips towards the floor and bend your knees. As your thighs become nearly parallel to the floor, raise your hips while extending one of your legs forward. Lower your hips again, and raise them while extending your other leg.

Stand with your feet hip-width apart, engage your core Lower your body into a squat position As you rise from the squat, lift one leg to the side to hip height Return your lifted leg to the ground to go back to the starting position Repeat the movement, alternating sides for each rep

Stand tall with your back straight, arms by your side, and feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your hips towards the floor and bend your knees. As your thighs become nearly parallel to the floor, raise your hips while extending one of your legs to its side. Lower your hips again, and raise them while extending your other leg to its side.

name_en: Bodyweight Squat to Side to Front Leg
description_en: Start by standing upright with your feet hip-width apart Lower your body into a basic squat, keep your chest and head up As you push back up, step out to the side with your right leg and squat down again Push back up and bring your right leg back to the start position Repeat on the left side then perform a forward lunge with each leg in turn

Stand up straight with your arms extended outwards at shoulder height Keeping your body still, bring one arm across the front of your chest Return the arm back to the start position and repeat with the other arm Keep alternating between arms until the set is complete Ensure your arm remains parallel to the floor throughout the exercise

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Lift your arms in a sweeping motion above your head, forming a circle Lower your arms down to the sides Repeat the motion in the opposite direction Continue alternating between directions

name_en: Bodyweight Standing Around World Wall Supported
description_en: Stand close to a wall with your feet shoulder-width apart Lift your arms to the sides until they are parallel with the floor Begin to make large circular motions with your arms, keeping your palms facing the floor Start with clockwise direction, then switch to counter-clockwise Maintain steady breathing throughout the movement, exhale during exertion

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms out in front of you Interlace your fingers and push your palms away from your body Round your back and look downward, feeling the stretch Hold for 20-30 seconds

Stand tall with your back straight, arms by your side, and feet shoulder-width apart. Clasp your hands behind your hips and stretch your back muscles by tightening your arms. Maintain this stretch for some seconds and then relax.

Stand tall with your back straight, arms by your sides, and feet shoulder-width apart. Raise yourself by raising your heel and shifting your weight on the toes. Hold for a few seconds, lower your heels, and repeat.

Stand upright and press down into the balls of both feet to raise your body upward Keep your abdominal muscles pulled in so that you move straight upward and avoid pitching too far forward or backward Lower your body back down to the starting position with control Repeat for the desired number of reps

name_en: Bodyweight Standing Close grip One Arm Row
description_en: Stand upright and extend your arm in front of you at shoulder height, clench your fist Pull your elbow back while keeping the arm close to your body until your hand is near your chest Pause and squeeze the muscles in your back Slowly return to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise with the other arm

Stand upright with your feet shoulder width apart Place your hands on the neck, fingers pointing upward Bend at the waist, tilting your upper body forward Reach for your left elbow to touch your right knee and then the right elbow to the left knee Return to the upright position

Start in a standing position, feet hip-width apart Place your hands on the back of your neck, elbows pointing out to the sides Lift one elbow towards the opposite knee while twisting your torso Lower back down in a controlled manner Repeat on the other side for one rep

Stand upright with feet slightly apart Extend arms out to the side, palms facing forward Move your arms in a wide arc until they meet in front of your body Try to keep your arms at shoulder level throughout the exercise Slowly reverse the movement and return to starting position

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Take your elbows out to the shoulder height with your arms bent and palms facing forward. Take your elbows forward and close your hands in front of your chest. Hold for a few seconds, return to the former position and repeat.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and extend your arms at your sides Lean forward slightly and imagine hugging a big tree, bring your arms in front of you Open your arms back out and return your body to the starting position Keep your movements smooth and controlled throughout the exercise Repeat this motion for the desired number of repetitions

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hands on hips Shift your weight to one leg Slowly kick the other leg back, keeping it straight Hold at the top for a few seconds Slowly lower back down to the starting position

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms straight above your head without locking the elbows Lower your arms down in a slow, controlled fashion towards your chest Push your arms upward until they are fully extended again Maintain good posture throughout the exercise

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Take your elbows out to the shoulder height with your arms bent and palms facing forward. Raise your elbows while extending your arms overhead. Hold for a few seconds, return to the former position and repeat.

name_en: Bodyweight Standing Military Press Wall Supported
description_en: Stand up straight with your back against the wall Extend your arms straight above your head Lower your arms back down in a controlled manner Repeat this motion for your desired number of repetitions

Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart Lean forward from your hips, letting your bodyweight shift onto your heels Keep lowering until you can feel a stretch in your hamstrings Gradually straighten back up to the starting position Repeat for desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Slowly bend from your hips and push your hips back while keeping your back straight Lower your body as far as you can without discomfort or until your back begins to round Pause for a moment, then lift your body back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms straight out in front of you at shoulder-level Pinch your shoulder blades together without bending your elbows Hold this position for a beat Slowly relax your shoulder blades, returning to the starting position

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Lift your shoulders up towards your ears as high as you can Hold this shrug position for a second Slowly lower your shoulders back down Repeat this process for the desired amount of repetitions

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Begin to bend your knees and push your hips back as if you were sitting down Continue lowering your body until your thighs are parallel to the floor, keeping your back straight Push through your heels to stand back up straight Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Bodyweight Standing Straight Arm Chest Fly
description_en: Stand with your legs shoulder-width apart Extend both of your arms straight out to either side Move your arms forward until your hands meet in front of your chest Slowly move your arms back out to the side, feeling a stretch in your chest Repeat the exercise the desired number of times

name_en: Bodyweight Standing Straight Arm Chest Fly
description_en: Stand tall with your feet hip width apart Extend your arms out to the sides, palms facing forward Keep your arms straight and bring them together in front of you Slowly let your arms return to the initial position Repeat this movement

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Place your hands behind your head. Take your elbows forward and try to close them in front of your face. Hold for a few seconds, return to the former position and repeat.

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms straight out to the sides. Bend at the elbows while forcing your chest forward to squeeze your shoulder blades together. Slowly return to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Stand in front of a sturdy bench or step Place your right foot on the bench Push your body up using your right leg until it's straight Slowly lower your body back down Repeat with the other leg

Locate a step box that's about knee height Stand upright and step onto the box with one foot and press through the heel to lift your body onto the box Carefully step back down and repeat with the other leg Keep your abs tight and your back straight throughout the exercise Take your time, don't rush

Start by standing in front of the step box Step up onto the box with one foot Push off with the same foot to return to the starting position Switch feet and repeat the movement Do the exercise according to your desired repetitions or timing

Stand tall near a step box with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Step on the box with your right foot, drive up through your right leg and stand upright on the box. Pause momentarily, step down with your left foot and follow with the right. Repeat this activity for a suitable time.

Stand tall with feet hip-width apart, toes pointing forward Lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the floor Briefly pause at the bottom before pushing back up to the starting position Ensure your back remains straight and chest lifted throughout the exercise Repeat the squat for desired number of reps

Stand tall, feet shoulder width apart, holding your hands at chest level Push your hands together tightly Press your hands out in front of you, while keeping them pressed together Control the return to the starting position

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Fold your arms and close your palms in front of your chest. Extend your arms forward while keeping your palms together. Hold for a while, fold your rams again, and repeat.

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Press your palms together at chest level Extend your arms straight in front of you Pull your arms back to your chest in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise for your desired number of repetitions

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart Slightly bend your knees Swing your arms back between your legs Thrust your hips forward and swing arms up to shoulder height Let your arms swing back down as you return to the initial position

Start in a squat position with your hands by your shoulders. Push through your heels to stand up, while extending your arms straight overhead. Return to the squat position, lowering your arms back to your shoulders. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions. Keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout this movement.

Get down on your hands and toes while extending your legs and back. Lower your forearms to the ground in such a way that your elbows come right under your shoulders. Raise yourself up by lifting your elbows and straightening your arms. As your arms are fully extended, lower yourself on your forearms and repeat.

name_en: Bodyweight Triceps Extension from Plank Position
description_en: Start in a full plank with your hands beneath your shoulders Bend your elbows to lower your body towards the floor and extend your body back into plank position Make sure to keep your body and shoulders steady throughout the move Contract your triceps at the top of the movement

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Raise your heels off the ground, balancing on the balls of your feet Take a step forward, staying on the balls of your feet Lower your heels back to the floor Repeat for the other leg

Stand with your back against a wall, your feet shoulder-width apart Slowly bend your knees, keeping your back and pelvis against the wall, until your thighs are parallel to the ground Keep your knees over your ankles, they shouldn't move forward over your toes Pause at the bottom, then push back up to the starting position Repeat

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and extend your arms forward. Lower your hips to the floor while sliding your hips to the wall and bend your knees while leaning forward slightly. As your thighs become parallel to the floor, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your feet placed wider than your shoulders, and your arms extended wide at shoulder level. Lean forward while twisting your torso and take your hand towards the opposite toe. 3.. Return to the starting position and do the same with your other hand and opposite toe.

Stand with your feet wider than shoulder width Extend your arms out to the side Shift your weight to one side and lower your hand towards the corresponding ankle Simultaneously lift the opposite arm up towards the sky, keeping it line with your other arm Reverse the move to the start position and repeat with the other side

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and extend your arms out to your sides at shoulder height Slowly lean to one side, reaching your hand toward the ground Maintain a slow and controlled motion, then return to the upright position Repeat the movement on the other side Continue alternating sides for the desired amount of reps

Stand tall with your feet placed wider than your shoulders, and your arms extended wide at shoulder level. Lean forward while twisting your torso and take your hand towards the opposite toe. As your hand reaches near the toe, perform 2-3 repetitions by taking your hand away and then back towards the toe, in end range. Return to the starting position and do the same with your other hand and opposite toe.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms stretched out to the sides Bend at the waist and reach your right hand towards your left foot Return to the starting position in a controlled movement Repeat the movement on the other side Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Lock your hands together in front of you, raise them up and over your head to the right, and then bring them down and over to your left side Repeat the movement in the opposite direction, from the lower left to the upper right side Keep your core engaged and legs stable throughout the movement Continue to alternate sides for the duration of your set

Stand with your feet hip-width apart, and your knees slightly bent Swing your arms up to the right, assuming you're holding an ax Bring your arms down towards your left knee, in a 'chopping' motion Repeat the movement on both sides for an equal number of reps Make sure your movements are controlled and not abrupt

Start by standing with feet hip-width apart, interlock your hands and extend your arms out straight Bend knees into a squat while swinging your arms down on one side almost touching the floor Push up from the squat while swinging your arms diagonally across the body towards opposite side, ending with your arms above your head Repeat the movement on the other side Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Bosu Ball Alternate Heel Touch Side Kick Squat
description_en: Step onto Bosu ball with your feet shoulder width apart Lower into a squat position, while maintaining balance Raise up, then kick one leg out to the side while reaching the opposite arm to touch your heel Return to the squat position Switch legs and repeat

Place the Bosu ball flat side up and stand on it with feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell at chest level Bend your knees to lower your body as far as you can, keep the torso upright Pause, then push your body back to the starting position Make sure your knees are in line with your toes while going down Repeat for the desired number of reps

Place your hands on the flat side of the Bosu ball, assuming a push-up position Pull one knee up towards your chest, keeping the foot off the ground Return the foot to the starting position and repeat with the other foot Perform the motion with quickness and intensity, hot-swapping feet on each repetition Maintain a tight core through all the movements

name_en: Bosu Ball Single Leg Good Morning
description_en: Stand on the flat side of a BOSU ball with one foot in the center of it, other foot off the ground. Maintain a slight bend in the knee, and lead with your chest to hinge forward at the hips. Lower your chest towards the ground while maintaining a neutral spine. Drive through your foot to return to an upright position. Repeat the motion on the same side for a set before switching legs.

Place the Bosu Ball on the floor with the flat side down Step onto the center of the Bosu Ball with one foot Push off the foot on the floor to raise your knee as high as you can Bring that leg down and step off the Bosu Ball Repeat the movement with the other leg

name_en: Bosu Ball Step-up High Knee Air Twist
description_en: Place a Bosu ball flat side down on the ground Step onto the Bosu ball with one foot Push through the foot on the Bosu ball to lift your body up While lifting your body, bring the opposite knee as high as you can and twist your body towards the lifted knee Return to the starting position and repeat with the other foot

name_en: Bosu Ball Step-up Single Leg Deadlift
description_en: Place the Bosu ball flat side down Step onto the Bosu ball with one foot and rise to a standing position, maintaining your balance Slowly lift the other leg off the ground and bend forward, reaching your hands towards the ground Return to the upright position, then step back down off the Bosu ball Repeat the exercise with the other leg

Stand tall with a bottle in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso. Keep your elbows close to your torso at all times. Curl the right hand while keeping the left hand to your side. Now, lower the right hand and simultaneously curl the left hand. Repeat this alternate biceps curl.

Stand straight, holding a weight in each hand with arms fully extended and palms facing towards you. Slowly raise one arm to shoulder level with a controlled motion, keeping a slight bend in the elbow. Lower your arm back to your body and repeat with the opposite arm. Swap back and forth for the desired number of reps. Ensure your back remains straight and still throughout.

Start by standing up straight with a bottle in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso Curl the right hand towards your shoulder while keeping the upper arm stationary, continue to curl the hand until your biceps are fully contracted and the bottle is at shoulder level Hold the contracted position for a brief moment as you squeeze your biceps, then inhale and slowly begin to bring the bottle back to the starting position Repeat this motion with your left hand Alternate each hand until the specified number of repetitions are performed

Stand straight holding a bottle in each hand Lift the bottles up to your armpits keeping your elbows close to your body Pause at the top and squeeze your back muscles Lower the bottles at a slow and controlled pace back to the starting position Repeat for the next repetition

name_en: Bottle Weighted Bent Over Reverse Fly
description_en: Stand with your feet hip-width apart, a bottle weight in each hand Bend over at the waist while keeping your back straight Extend your arms out to the sides, bending your elbows slightly Squeeze your shoulder blades together Lower your arms back down in a controlled manner

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent. Lean forward at your waist, back straight, and hold the bottle with both hands. Pull the bottle up to your chest keeping your elbows close to your body. Lower the bottle, extending your arms back to the starting position. Repeat the process for several repetitions.

Sit on a bench with a bottle at your feet. Pick up the bottle with your right arm, keeping your elbow firmly placed on your inner right thigh. Curl the bottle towards your chest. Lower the bottle in a controlled manner. Repeat the motion with your left arm.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent Bend forward from your hips, hold the weighted bottle with both hands Keep your back straight, raise your body and the weighted bottle by straightening your hips and knees Lower the weighted bottle by bending your hips and knees, return to the starting position

Hold a bottle in each hand, arms down at your sides Step forward with one foot, bending your knee until your thigh is parallel to the ground Push off your front foot to return to the starting position Repeat on the other side Do 10-15 reps on each side for 3 sets

Lay flat on your back on the floor with your knees bent outward and your feet together Hold a weighted bottle between your hands, extend your arms towards the ceiling Perform a crunch by raising your shoulders off the floor, simultaneously lift the weighted bottle above and to the opposite side of your head Lower back down in a controlled manner to the starting position and repeat to the opposite side

Stand up straight with a weight in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso. While keeping your torso stationary, lift the weights to the front of your body with a slight bend at the elbows and palms facing down. Continue to go up until your arms are slightly above parallel to the floor. Pause for a second at the 'top' and then start to lower the weights back down. Repeat the movement for desired repetitions.

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart, holding a bottle in each hand at shoulder height with elbows bent Lower your body into a squatting position, keeping your back straight and thighs parallel to the floor Push back up to your starting position using your heels Keep your chest up and your gaze straight ahead throughout the movement Repeat the squat for the desired number of reps

Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Place a weighted bottle over your pelvis Lift your hips off the floor until your knees, hips, and shoulders form a straight line Hold the top position for a second, then slowly lower your hips down to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and a weighted bottle in each hand Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at your hips, keeping your back straight Pull the bottles up to your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together Lower the bottles back down in a controlled manner Repeat this motion for the desired number of repetitions

Stand up straight holding a bottle with both hands, close to your chest Move the bottle in a circle around your head Repeat the motion in the opposite direction Ensure to keep your core engaged throughout the exercise Aim to perform the movement smoothly and continuously

Stand tall with a bottle in one hand, feet shoulder-width apart Bend at the waist and keep your back straight Hinge the elbow at 90 degrees and push the bottle back until your arm is fully extended Hold for a moment, then return to the starting position Switch hands and repeat with the other arm

Start by holding your weighted bottle at chest level and kneel on the floor Bend at your hips and lower your buttocks toward your heels Pause for a moment, then push through your heels to raise back up to the starting position Make sure to keep your core tight and your back straight during the movement Repeat the motion for your desired number of repetitions

Stand upright holding a bottle in each hand with your arms fully extended Slowly lift the bottles away from your body to your side until your arms are parallel with the floor Hold the position for a second Slowly lower your arm back down to your side in a controlled manner Repeat the process

Lie on your back on a bench or floor with a bottle of weight in each hand Extend the arms above your chest Slowly lower your arms to the sides of your chest Press your arms back up above your chest Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on the floor with your knees bent, feet flat Hold the weighted bottle with both hands and extend your arms straight up Slowly lower your torso to the floor while maintaining your extended arms Pause briefly and lift your torso back to original position Repeat for the set amount of reps

Stand or sit with a bottle in both hands, and your arms fully extended above your head. Keep your elbows close to your head and perpendicular to the floor. Lower the bottle behind your head until your forearms touch your biceps. Return to the starting position by using the triceps to raise the bottle. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Lie on your back on a bench with your feet planted firmly on the floor Hold the bottle overhead with both hands, your arms fully extended Lower the bottle behind your head while keeping your arms straight Pull the bottle back over your head to the starting position

Stand straight and hold a weighted bottle in each hand at your sides. Step back with one foot and lower your body by flexing the knee and hip of your front leg until the knee of your rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to the standing position by pushing up with your front leg's heel. Repeat the movement with your other leg. Continue alternating between legs for the determined number of repetitions.

Stand tall with a bottle in each hand, palms facing your torso Keep your elbows tucked in at your sides Curl the bottles until your forearms are fully contracted Pause, then slowly return to the starting position

name_en: Bottle Weighted Reverse Grip Concentration Curl
description_en: Sit down and place one elbow on the inner thigh while holding the bottle as a weight Make sure your palm is facing upwards Slowly lift the bottle up until the whole arm is almost completely flexed Pause for a brief moment and then slowly lower your arm Repeat this process on the other arm

Stand up straight holding the bottle in front of you. Ensure your knees are only slightly bent, not locked. Bend at the hips and lower the bottle without allowing your lower back to round. Stand back up to the initial position by pushing your hips forward and standing up straight. Repeat the movement.

Sit on the floor with your knees bent and pull in your abs to your spine Hold the weighted bottle in front of your chest and lean back a few inches while keeping your back straight Rotating your torso, swing the bottle to the left and the right Repeat the movement for the desired repetitions each side Make sure the movement is performed by rotating your torso and not just moving your arms

Stand or sit with a weighted bottle in each hand at should level Raise the bottles above your head until your arms are straight Lower the bottles back down until at shoulder level Repeat for the specified number of reps

Stand up straight with a weighted bottle in one hand. While keeping your back straight and your eyes forward, bend at the waist to the side with the weight. Return to the original position. Repeat this motion on the same side for your desired number of reps. Switch the weight to the other hand and repeat on the other side.

name_en: Bottle Weighted Single Leg Romanian Deadlift
description_en: Stand on one leg (leg closest to the hand holding the weights), holding a weight in one hand Bend at the hip, extending your free leg behind you for balance Continue lowering the weight until your torso is parallel to the ground Return to the starting position by driving your hips forward and standing tall

Stand with one foot in front of the other, holding a bottle in each hand by your sides Lower your rear knee towards the ground in a lunge, then rise back up Perform the required amount of repetitions, then switch legs Ensure your front knee doesn't go beyond your toes Keep your torso upright throughout the move

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the weighted bottle in your hands Begin by performing a squat, bending your knees and lowering your hips as if sitting down in an imaginary chair As you squat, simultaneously lift the weighted bottle in an alternating wave motion Rise back up to the standing position while lowering the weighted bottle Repeat this for the desired number of repetitions

Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a bottle in each hand in front of your thighs Bend at your hips and lower your torso until it's almost parallel to the floor Keep your legs slightly bent as you lower the weights towards your feet Squeeze your glutes, push your hips forward and come back up to the starting position Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps

Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and toes slightly turned out. Hold the bottle weight in front of you at chest level Bend your knees and hips to lower your body as if sitting back into a chair, keeping your chest up and knees out over your toes Go down until your thighs are parallel to the floor or lower if possible Press through your heels to stand up straight Repeat the movements for the recommended sets and repetitions

Hold a bottle filled with water or sand between your palms in front of your chest While keeping your elbows flared out, press the bottle straight out in front of you until your arms are fully extended Keep the pressure and control the motion, then slowly bring the bottle back to the start Repeat the motions while maintaining the squeeze on the bottle Avoid arching your back during the movement

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart, holding the weighted bottle between your legs using both hands. Bend your knees slightly, hinge forward at your hips and push your hips back while swinging the bottle up to chest level. Control the weight as it falls back down in a swing motion, hinging at the hips and bending your knees. Immediately ready yourself for the next rep, swinging the weight upwards as you stand. Repeat the movement for the desired amount of reps.

Stand upright while holding a bottle in each hand at arm's length, palms facing your torso. This will be your starting position. Keeping your upper arms stable, bend at the elbow and extend both hands behind you while contracting the triceps. Pause briefly at the full extension before lowering the weights back to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions. Do not use your back or shoulders to lift the weights; your forearms should do all the work.

Stand straight with a bottle in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your body. Raise the bottles with your arms to the level of your shoulders, keeping your elbows above your hands. Hold for a second at the top, then slowly lower the weights back down. Repeat this for your desired number of reps. Remember to keep your back straight and shoulders relaxed throughout the exercise.

Lie on your back, with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Keep your hands either by your sides or behind your head Engaging your core, lift your hips up towards the ceiling while tightening your glutes Hold for a moment and lower your hips back down Repeat the exercise for the desired amount of repetitions

Begin with feet shoulder-width apart, and arms extended straight out in front of you at shoulder level Lower your body into a squat, pushing your hips back and keeping your chest lifted Hold the squat for a few seconds before slowly rising back up Keep your core engaged throughout the entire movement Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps

Lie down on your back with your legs extended and arms resting on the floor with palms down. Fold your legs and bring your knees above your hips. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand straight with legs apart, wider than shoulder-width As if drawing a circle, squat down, moving in a clockwise direction, lowering your body until you feel a stretch in your thighs Return to standing position moving in a counter-clockwise direction Repeat this motion consistently to maintain a bouncing effect Switch the direction of the circle after each set

Stand tall with your back straight, knees bent slightly, and feet shoulder-width apart. Make circles with your arms by first opening and raising them overhead, then closing and lowering them. Lower and raise your hips in a bouncing fashion simultaneously. Continue this activity for a suitable duration.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Begin to jump lightly while using your hips to make 'circle' rotations Alternate the direction of the 'circle' with each jump Maintain the bouncing motion continuously for a set amount of time Ensure your landings are soft to minimise impact

Start by standing up straight, feet shoulder-width apart Perform a small jump and while in the air, cross your legs Once your feet touch the ground, bounce back up and uncross your legs Repeat this process, switching the crossing of the legs each time.

Stand tall with your feet placed wider than your shoulders, and your arms extended wide at shoulder level. Fold your knees slightly and twist your torso to tap the inner side of your opposite thigh with your right hand. Return to the initial position and repeat the same with your left hand.

name_en: Bound Angle Yoga Pose Baddha Konasana
description_en: Sit up straight with your legs stretched out in front of you. Bend your knees, pull your heels toward your pelvis, then drop your knees out to the sides and press the soles of your feet together. Hold your feet or ankles and ensure your spine remains straight. Hold this pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute. Release the pose and stretch your legs out in front of you.

Assume a boxing stance with your left foot forward if you're right-handed, or vice versa Pivot on your back foot and throw a straight punch (Cross) with that hand, aiming for a central point Rotate your body back to its original position, pivoting on your front foot, to throw a hook punch with your front hand Return to your original boxing stance and repeat the Cross with your back hand Repeat the cross-hook-cross combination smoothly and fluidly

Stand in a boxing stance with your feet shoulder-width apart Duck down by bending your knees and lowering your body Quickly rise back up As you rise, rotate your torso and throw an uppercut punch with your back arm Repeat on the other side

Get into a boxing stance by taking your hands up, elbows in, knees slightly bent, and hips between your feet. Extend your front arm quickly while rotating your entire arm so that your punch lands with your palm facing down and your shoulder rotated up to cover your chin. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand in a boxing stance, with your left foot forward (if you're right-handed) or right foot forward (if you're left-handed) Keep your elbows tucked in and your fists up near your jaw Extend your leading hand straight out in front of you, turning your fist so your palm faces the ground Immediately after extending your fist, quickly pull it back to the starting position Keep your other fist near your face for protection during this movement

Get into a boxing stance by taking your hands up, elbows in, knees slightly bent, and hips between your feet. Keep your right hand up guarding your chin with your elbow tucked in. Keep your elbow bent to almost a 90-degree angle and rotate your body towards the right and follow through your left arm while pivoting on your front foot.

Assume a basic boxing stance with your gloves guarding your face Rotate your body to the left while extending your left arm across your body Pour your weight into the hook, using your hip and leg power Snap back quickly to your initial position after the left hook is thrown Keep your right hand guarding your face during the entire move

Get into a boxing stance by taking your hands up, elbows in, knees slightly bent, and hips between your feet. Keep your right hand up guarding your chin with your elbow tucked in. Lower your hips and take your left hand to waist level and punch upwards while rotating your torso towards the right and pivoting on your front foot.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and raise your fists Bend your legs slightly and rotate your body to the right Swing your left arm in an upward direction Rotate your body back to the original position Lower your left arm back down

Get into a boxing stance by taking your hands up, elbows in, knees slightly bent, and hips between your feet. Keep your left hand up guarding your chin with your elbow tucked in. Fully extend your right arm while rotating your torso towards the left and pivoting on your rear foot.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, your left foot forward and your right foot behind Bend your knees slightly and keep your guard up With your right arm, punch straight forward Twist your right forearm so the punch lands with your palm down Retract your arm back to the starting guard position

Get into a boxing stance by taking your hands up, elbows in, knees slightly bent, and hips between your feet. Keep your left hand up guarding your chin with your elbow tucked in. Keep your elbow bent to almost a 90-degree angle and rotate your body towards the left and follow through your right arm while pivoting on your rear foot.

Stand in a boxing stance with left foot forward, fists up in guard position Rotate your right hip forward and pivot your right back foot At the same time, swing your right arm horizontally across your chest Snap your right fist back to the guard position immediately after striking Repeat movements with a controlled rhythm

Start in a boxing stance, with your left foot forward and your fists protecting your face Perform a right hook by rotating your right foot and driving your right fist in a hooking motion toward your opponent Immediately perform a left hook by rotating your left foot and driving your left fist in a hooking motion toward your opponent Return to the starting boxing stance and repeat

Stand in a boxing stance with your left foot forward and your fists by your cheeks Rotate your body to the right while shifting your weight to your back foot and punching upwards with your right hand Visualize aiming for the chin of an imaginary opponent in front of you Return to your starting position in a controlled motion Repeat the exercise for your desired amount of repetitions

Get into a boxing stance by taking your hands up, elbows in, knees slightly bent, and hips between your feet. Keep your left hand up guarding your chin with your elbow tucked in. Lower your hips and take your right hand to waist level and punch upwards while rotating your torso towards the left and pivoting on your rear foot.

Stand near a knee-high box with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Jump on the box and maintain a squat position with your back straight, knee bent, and thighs parallel to the box. Hold for a while, step down and return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand near a knee-high box with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Jump on the box and maintain a squat position with your back straight, knee bent, and thighs parallel to the box. Hold for a while, step down and return to the initial position, and repeat.

Get down to the floor on your hands and toes with your arms, back, and legs straight Lift one of your feet off the floor and bring your knee forward towards the opposite side Return to the initial position and do the same with your other knee.

Lie on your back, bend both knees to your chest and roll onto your left side With your left hand, pull your right knee towards the ground keeping your back flat Extend your right arm, keep it at shoulder height and try to touch the ground Turn your neck to the right side Hold this position for 20-30 seconds, then switch sides

Lie down on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor shoulder-width apart. Lift your hips off the floor until your knees, hips and shoulders are all in a straight line. While maintaining the bridge position, slowly move your knees apart as far as possible. Hold this position for a moment, then slowly return your knees to the starting position. Lower your hips back to the floor to complete one repetition.

Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Raise your hips off the ground until your knees, hips and shoulders form a straight line. Hold your bridge position and lift one foot off the floor, keeping your knee bent. Return your foot to the floor and lower your hips back to starting position. Repeat this action, alternating legs each time.

Get down on your back with your knees bent and feet on the floor while your arms are spread wide on the sides. Raise your hips off the floor, and straighten your thighs with your back while your knees are open wide. Maintain this position and bring your knees to close. Hold for a while, open your knees again, and then repeat.

Start in a high plank position, hands directly below your shoulders, feet hip-width apart. Bring your right knee towards your left elbow. Return to the starting position and repeat with your left knee towards your right elbow. Keep your core tight and your hips in line with the rest of your body. Continue alternating sides for the prescribed number of reps.

Get down on your hands and toes and form a straight line from your head to your ankles. Lift one of your feet off the floor and bring your knee through your torso towards the opposite side. Then straighten your leg rapidly while bringing your foot back to the initial position and perform the same with your other knee.

Lie flat on your back on a yoga mat. Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the ground, hip width apart. Place your arms alongside your body. Breathe out and push your torso off the floor with your feet. At the peak of the pose, push your chest towards your chin. Slowly lower your body back onto the mat while exhaling.

Lie down on your back with your knees bent, feet together on the floor, and arms resting at your sides. Raise your hips and straighten your thighs with your back while your knees are closed. Maintain this position, raise your arms and then land them overhead with your palms facing upward. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Lay flat on your back on the mat. Bend your knees and make sure your feet are flat on the floor. Raise your hips off the floor while keeping your feet and shoulders down, creating a bridge. Hold the pose for a few seconds. Slowly lower your hips back down to the floor.

Start in a bridge position by lying on your back, bend your knees, and place your feet flat on the floor, hip width apart Raise your hips to create a straight line from your knees to shoulders With your hips lifted, walk your feet forward one at a time, then walk them back Lower your hips back to the floor after completing your rep count

Start in a bridge position with your hands and feet on the ground and your body lifted towards the sky Walk your feet out one at a time until your legs are fully extended Raise one leg up towards the ceiling, keeping your knee straight Lower your leg back down and walk your feet back to the bridge position Repeat with the other leg

Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet on the floor. Raise your hips off the floor and straighten your thighs along with your back. Maintain this position and extend one of your legs straight in the air. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat the same with your other leg.

Begin in a standing stance with straight posture Start walking at a moderate pace Increase your pace until you're walking briskly, but not jogging Make sure to move your arms in tandem with your legs Maintain this pace for the desired duration of your workout

Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart. Start walking with a steady gait by rolling your feet from heels to toes. Loosely swing your arms alternately while pumping them a little with each stride.

Start by standing tall with your feet hip-width apart Begin walking forward in a quick pace Move your arms in a natural swing with each stride Maintain a straight posture all throughout Breathe deeply and consistently while maintaining the rhythm

Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart. Start walking with a steady gait by rolling your feet from heels to toes. Loosely swing your arms alternately while pumping them a little with each stride. Walk in a circle as you are moving around a  fixed point.

Begin standing with feet hip-width apart, lower into a squat and swing your arms back Explode forward as far as you can, swinging your arms for extra momentum Land lightly on your feet, bending your knees to absorb the impact Walk back to your starting position slowly to recover Repeat this process for the desired number of repetitions

Stand 2-3 feet in front of a bench, extend one of your legs backward, and rest your toes on it. Stand upright in this position and lower your rear knee towards the floor while bending your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand upright and place one leg on a raised platform behind you. Lower your body by bending your front knee until your back knee nearly touches the ground. Push back up to the starting position using your front leg Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch legs. Ensure your front knee stays in line with your foot and doesn't go past your toes.

Stand 2-3 feet in front of a knee-high platform, extend one of your legs backward, and rest your toes on it. Stand upright in this position and place your hands on your waist. Lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position, and repeat.

name_en: Bulgarian Split Squat Cable Resistance Band
description_en: Stand 2-3 feet in front of a knee-high platform, extend one of your legs backward, and rest your toes on it. Stand upright in this position, place a resistance band under your feet, and hold its end in your hands near the shoulders. Lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. Return to the initial position while stretching the band, and repeat.

Stand up straight with a chair behind you. Place one foot on the chair and step forward with the other. Lower your body until your front thigh is parallel to the ground. Push back up to the starting position. Switch legs and repeat.

Start in a standing position. Squat and place your hands on the ground in front of you Kick back into a push-up position Perform a push-up Return to the squat position by bringing your feet forward under you Jump up into the air, raising your arms above your head

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your hips while bending your knees and place your hands on the floor. Extend your legs backward to get into a plank position. Jump your legs forward and return to the standing position while extending your arms overhead.

Start standing up, knees slightly bent Bend down and place your palms on the floor Kick your feet back into a plank position Immediately return your feet to the squat position Jump up and repeat the process

Start in a standing position, then crouch down and place your hands on the ground Kick your legs back into a push-up position Bring your legs back under and stand up, raising one arm and the opposite leg Lower your arm and leg, then alternate with the other arm and leg on the next rep Repeat this for your set

Start in a standing position, and then drop into a squat Place your hands on the ground in front of you and kick your feet back into a push-up position Do a push-up before bringing your feet back under you in a squat From the squat position, do a long jump forward Turn around and repeat the process

Start in a standing position and lower your body into a squat Place your hands on the ground in front of you and jump your feet back into a plank position Perform a push-up and then jump your feet back towards your hands Elevate from the squat and shuffle sideway in two quick steps Repeat this exercise alternating the direction of shuffle

Start in a standing position, then squat down and place your hands on the ground in front of you Kick your feet back into a plank position Lower your chest and thighs to the floor in a push-up motion Quickly return your feet to the squat position Stand up from the squat position and jump into the air with your arms stretched upwards

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your hips to the knee level while extending your arms forward. Place your hands on the floor by leaning forward, and extend your legs, one by one, backward to get into a plank position. Return to the standing position in a reverse fashion and then repeat.

Start in a standing position, feet hip-width apart Lower into a squat position and place your hands on the floor in front of you Kick your legs back into a push up position and then immediately return them to the squat position Leap into the air, in a tuck position bringing your knees towards your chest Upon landing, immediately proceed into the next repetition

Start standing with feet hip-width apart Squat down and place your hands on the floor Kick your feet back into a push-up position Return to squat position in a quick motion Jump up into the air and perform a star jump twice before landing

Start in a standing position, feet shoulder-width apart Drop into a squat position and place your hands on the ground in front of you Kick your feet back into a push-up position and perform one push-up Immediately return your feet to the squat position Jump up from the squat position

Start by sitting on your mat with your legs straight in front of you Bend your knees and bring the soles of your feet together Gently let your knees fall out to the sides Fold forward, bringing your upper body towards your feet Hold the pose for a few breaths before returning to starting position

Begin with a standard pull-up position Use a kipping motion to generate momentum, swinging your body forward and back On the forward swing, pull your chin up to the bar Use the momentum to 'butterfly' around the bar, straightening your arms as your body swings downward Continue the momentum for the next rep

Start by sitting on the floor with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground Lean your torso back slightly and lift your feet off the ground Twist your torso to one side, bringing your hands towards the ground on that side Quickly twist your torso to the other side, bringing your hands towards the ground on that side Repeat this motion while keeping your abs engaged

Get down on your hips and fold your legs to bring under surfaces of your feet together. Hold your toes and start flapping your thighs on the floor by moving your knees up and down. Continue for a suitable duration.

Begin in a seated position with both knees bent and both feet on the ground. Bring the soles of your feet together and allow your knees to drop out to the sides, creating a butterfly wing shape with your legs. Keeping your spine straight, lean forward at the hips towards your feet, stretching your hip adductors and glutes. Hold the position for a few seconds, then slowly come back to the seated position. Repeat the stretch several times.

Sit on the floor with the soles of your feet together Pull your heels as close to your body as you can Hold your feet or ankles with your hands Keep your spine straight and press your knees towards the floor Hold and release the pose gently

Sit on the floor and establish a stable base with your sitting bones. Join your feet together, pull them closer to your body, and let your knees drop to either side. Hold the ankles or the feet and try to push the knees down by using the elbows. Stay in position for 30-60 seconds with every inhale lengthening the spine and every exhale trying to fold deeper. Slowly release and straighten the legs.

Get down on your hips and fold your legs to bring under surfaces of your feet together. Hold your toes and take your knees towards the floor while leaning forward. Hold this stretch for suitable duration then relax.

Start by standing with your feet shoulder width apart Flex your right knee behind you and try to kick your buttock Return to the starting position and repeat with your left leg Continue alternating legs at a fast pace Repeat for desired repetitions or time

Start with a semi-squat position, and swing your right foot to your buttocks Immediately swing your left foot to your buttocks and raise both hands overhead into a jumping jack Return to semi-squat position and repeat for desired reps Balance out your movements to ensure a smooth transition between butt-kick and jumping jack Maintain a rhythm and avoid pausing between reps

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Shift your weight on one leg and kick your butt with your other foot. Take your foot back to the floor while simultaneously kicking your butt with your other foot.

Stand tall with your legs extended straight below you Kick your right heel up towards your glutes, keep the knee pointing down As your right leg comes back down to the ground, kick your left heel up towards your glutes Keep your upper body straight and relaxed during this movement Repeat this for your desired amount of reps or time

Start by standing straight with your feet hip-width apart Bend your right knee to lift your heel towards your glute, kicking your own butt with your heel. As you lower your right leg back, raise your left heel towards your glutes in the same manner. Gradually increase your speed, alternating your legs. Maintain this movement for your desired length of time.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Shift your weight on one leg and kick your butt with your other foot. Take your foot back to the floor while simultaneously kicking your butt with your other foot.

Start standing, feet shoulder width apart, arms at your sides. Next jump and kick your right knee towards your butt while simultaneously performing a row action with your left hand. Return to the starting position to complete one repetition. Repeat the movement by kicking your left knee and performing the row action with your right hand. Continue alternating sides for a balanced workout.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, arms extended forward with palms facing downward. Shift your weight on one leg and kick your butt with your other foot while opening your arms and taking your elbows past your back simultaneously. Return to the initial position and do the same while shifting on the other leg and kicking with your opposite foot.

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your arms extended in front of you Bend your right knee and kick your heel toward your glutes As you kick your right heel up, pull your arms back into a row Return to the starting position and repeat the movement with your left leg Alternate legs with each repetition

Start by standing tall, with your abs drawn in and your feet shoulder-width apart Simultaneously raise your right knee up towards your buttocks and tap your left hand to your right shoulder Quickly switch and do the same motion on the other side Continue the pattern, alternating sides for the duration of your exercise Maintain a fast pace to get your heart rate up

Lie flat on your back with your legs in the air and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle Place your hands behind your head, elbows out wide Engage your core while lifting your head and shoulders off the floor Rotate your upper body pulling your right elbow towards your left knee, and at the same time, straighten your right leg Perform the same operation for the other side to complete one rep

name_en: By MAJOR MUSCLE GROUPS Muscle body
description_en: Start with a full body stretch, reaching from toes to fingertips Do a set of bodyweight squats, ensuring your knees don't go past your toes Next, perform push-ups, keeping your body in a straight line Do a set of standing forward bends for your abs and lower back Finish with a set of stationary lunges, alternating legs

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the cable by folding your left arm and raising your elbow over the shoulder while keeping your palm side up. Hold your left elbow with your right hand for support and pull the cable by straightening your arm overhead. Hold for a moment, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand close to the high pulley of cable station Grasp the handle with your hand, the palm should face up Pull the handle down until your arm is fully extended Slowly return your arm to the initial position Repeat the process with the other arm

Attach a cable ankle strap to your desired leg Face towards the cable machine and pull your leg back towards your glutes Slowly return the leg to the start position Repeat on both legs according to your fitness level Make sure to maintain a straight posture throughout the exercise

Attach an ankle strap to a low cable pulley and to your ankle Face the cable and hold onto the handles Pull your heel towards your buttocks using your hamstring and quad strength Slowly return your foot to the starting position and repeat

Get on the machine while kneeling with a straight back and hold the bar behind your neck with your hands near the shoulders and palms facing forward. Lean forward to pull the bar unless your body comes parallel to the floor. Hold for a while, return to the starting position, and repeat.

Get on the pull-down machine with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab the ends of the bar by extending your arms overhead with your hands placed wider than your shoulders and your palms facing forward. Pull the bar while folding your arms and taking your elbows down and past your back.

Sit with your thighs under the supports and grasp the bar with a wide grip Pull the barbell down towards your upper chest Contract your back muscles at the lowest part Return the bar back up in a controlled manner Allow your lat muscles to stretch at the top

Sit on the provided bench and adjust it to a comfortable height, your feet flat on the floor Grasp the cable bar with a wide enough grip, arms fully extended Pull the bar down to your upper chest, while keeping your back straight Hold at the bottom of the movement for a brief moment Return the bar to the starting position, maintaining control

Lie down on a flat bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab the cables while opening your arms and dipping your elbows under the bench with your palms facing the ceiling. Pull the cables by straightening your arms over your chest. Return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand between a low pulley cable station with a bar handle attachment on each side Hold the handles and bring the cables together in front of you at chest level Extend your arms straight out, pushing the cables forward Slowly bring the cables back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Lie down on a flat bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab the cables while opening your arms and dipping your elbows under the bench with your palms facing the ceiling. Pull the cables by straightening your arms over your chest. Return to the initial position, and repeat.

name_en: Cable Bent Over Lateral Raise Single Arm
description_en: Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, lean forward, and bend your knees slightly. Hold the cable in your left hand with your arm hanging straight, and your palm is facing backward. Pull the cable by opening your arm wide apart. As your arm is parallel to the floor, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Cable Bent Over Neutral Grip Kickback with Rope Attachment
description_en: Start by setting the cable at the lowest setting and attach the rope attachment. Stand facing the pulley, grab the rope attachment and bend over at your waist with a slight bend in your knees. With your arms pulled close to your sides, extend your arms straight backwards. Return your hands to the starting position in a slow and controlled manner. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name_en: Cable Bent Over One Arm Lateral Raise
description_en: Stand next to the cable machine, bending slightly at the waist Secure the handle with the arm farthest from the machine and bring it across your body to the far shoulder Steadily return the handle to the starting position Repeat the movement with the same arm before switching to the other

name_en: Cable Bent Over Reverse Grip Row
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward and grab the bar attached to the cable with your arms straight, hands placed shoulder-width apart, and palms facing upward. Pull the bar towards your abdomen by folding your arms and taking your elbows past your back. Return to the starting position slowly and repeat.

name_en: Cable Bent Over Reverse Grip Row
description_en: Stand facing the cable machine with feet shoulder-width apart Bend your knees slightly and lean forward from your waist, keeping your back straight Grasp the cable bar with an underhand grip Pull the bar towards your waist, keeping your elbows close to your body Extend your arms fully, returning to the starting position

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward and grab the bar attached to the cable with your arms straight, hands placed shoulder-width apart, and palms facing downward. Pull the bar towards your abdomen by folding your arms and taking your elbows past your back.

Stand facing the cable machine with a double handle, bend slightly at the knees and push the hips back while keeping the back straight Pull the handles towards your abdomen Pause for a moment at the end of the pull, then slowly return to the starting position Continue for the desired amount of repetitions Make sure to pull the cable with your back muscles, not just your arms

name_en: Cable Bent Over Single Arm Crossover
description_en: Stand next to the cable machine, handle attached at chest height Grasp the handle with the hand closest to the machine, palm facing down Keeping a slight bend in your elbow, pull the cable across your body to the opposite hip Slowly reverse the movement, controlling the weight as it returns to the start position Repeat for the desired number of reps before switching to the other side

name_en: Cable Bent Over Single Arm Neutral Grip Kickback with Rope Attachment
description_en: Stand close to the cable machine, bending slightly at the hips. Hold the rope attachment with a palm-facing-inward grip (neutral grip). Keeping your elbow stationary, extend your arm back until it is straight. Slowly bend your elbow, returning your hand to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand up with your torso upright while holding an E-Z Bar attached to the low pulley with a shoulder width grip. While keeping the upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the biceps. Slowly begin to bring the bar back to original position as you breathe in.

Stand close to the cable machine, facing towards it Hold the SZ bar with an underhand grip Curl the bar upwards towards your shoulders in a controlled manner Hold for a moment as you contract your biceps at the top Lower the bar back down slowly to the starting position

Stand tall and stable in front of the cable machine Hold the close-grip bar with palms facing up Lift the bar by curling your arms and bringing it close to your shoulders Return to the starting position by extending your arms Repeat the movement for your desired number of repeats

Stand tall facing a pully machine with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the bar attached to the cable near your thighs with an underhand grip and place your hands close to each other. Raise the bar towards the shoulders by bending your arms. Return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Cable Close Grip Front Lat Pulldown
description_en: Sit at the cable machine with a straight back and grasp the close grip bar Pull the bar down to your upper chest while contracting your Lats Pause and hold at full contraction for a moment Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Get on the pull-down machine with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab the ends of the bar by extending your arms overhead with your hands placed shoulder-width apart and your palms facing forward. Pull the bar while folding your arms and taking your elbows down and past your back.

Sit down at a lat pulldown station and grab the bar with an underhand grip that's just beyond shoulder width Pull the bar down to your chest, leading with your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together Slowly extend your elbows and return the bar to the starting position

Kneel down in front of the cable machine and grab the handle with an overhand grip Pull the handle down and fully extend your arm, making sure your elbow stays close to your body Hold this position briefly, contracting your tricep muscle Return the handle back to the starting position in a controlled motion Repeat this action for the desired amount of reps in each set

Kneel in front of a low pulley cable Grab the handle with one hand, keeping your elbow at a 90 degree angle Straighten your arm, focusing on the contraction in your triceps Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position Repeat on the other arm after completing the set

Stand between the cable machines with a handle attached to each high pulley Reach up and grab each handle, keeping your arms fully extended Pull the handles down towards your sides, bending your elbows Return to the starting position with a controlled movement

Adjust the pulleys to your shoulder height and select the weight you want to lift Grasp the handles and step forward to create tension in the cables Pull your arms down and out to your sides, creating the 'cross-over' effect Slowly return to the starting position
