Stand in the center of the cable crossover station, facing away from the machine Hold the handle of each cable in your hands Lean forward slightly and extend your arms out to your sides Pull the cables across your body until your arms are fully extended Return to the starting position in a controlled motion

Stand in the middle of a cable machine, with dual pulleys, adjust them to be above your head. Hold the left cable with your right hand and the right cable with your left hand. Keep your arms slightly bent, and pull the cables across your body to your sides. Pause for a second when your arms are extended to your sides, then slowly return to the original position. Repeat the movement for the required amount of repetitions.

Stand comfortably in front of the cable machine Hold the cable handle in each hand with an underhand grip Keep your elbows close to your torso at all times Curl your hands toward your shoulders Lower your hands back down to the starting position

Stand in front of a cable machine, firmly planting your feet shoulder-width apart. Grasping the bar with an underhand grip, take a few steps back from the machine. Keep your elbows close to your body and freely hanging, just slightly bent. Curl the bar towards your body until your forearms are in a vertical position. Slowly extend your elbows and lower the bar back to the starting position.

name_en: Cable Curl with Multipurpose V bar
description_en: Attach the multipurpose V-bar to the low pulley cable Stand upright with your back straight, holding the V-bar with palms facing up Curl the bar towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the bar back to the start position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand in front of the cable machine with feet shoulder-width apart Bend at your hips and knees, and grab the cable with a overhand grip Stand up, pulling the cable by extending your hips and knees till you're fully standing Lower the cable back down by hinging at your hips, bending your knees until the weights almost touch the floor Return to the starting position and repeat the process

Stand in front of the cable machine with feet hip-width apart Grasp the bar with a wide, overhand grip Bend at your hips and knees to lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the floor Push your hips back and stand up straight Repeat for the desired number of reps

Secure the cable at a high position and stand with your back against it Hold the handles and bend your torso forward, pulling the handles down towards your knees Pause for a second at the maximum point of contraction before returning to the starting position Repeat for required number of reps

Attach handles to the high pulleys of a cable crossover machine. While keeping your back straight, lean slightly forward, and grip one cable in each hand. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and pull your hands towards each other in an arc, targeting your chest. Hold at the peak of contraction for a second then slowly release back to the starting position. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

Adjust the pulleys to the high position. Grasp each pulley handle and stand at the center of the station. Lean forward slightly, maintain a slight bend in your elbows. Draw your hands together and downward in a wide arc until they meet in front of your abdomen. Reverse the movement to return to the starting position.

Adjust cable machine to shoulder height position Stand in the middle of the cable cross machine, facing away from it Grasp each handle and push down and across your body drawing your hands together Slowly return your hands back up to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Sit on the seat and align yourself with the cable machine Grasp the cable bar with a wide grip Pull the bar towards your abdomen while maintaining a slight backward lean Hold for a moment and then slowly release and extend your arms back to the starting position Repeat the movement maintaining controlled form

Attach a cuff to your ankle and connect it to a low cable pulley. Stand facing the weight stack and grasp the frame for support. Keep your back straight and kick your leg diagonally towards the ceiling. Slowly return your leg to the starting position. After completing the reps on one leg, switch to the other leg.

Attach a low pulley to your ankle, facing away from the machine Slightly bend your standing leg and stabilize your body Kick your attached leg diagonally backwards and upwards, engaging your glutes Hold for a moment at the top of the kickback Slowly lower your leg back to the starting position

Attach the ankle cuff to a low pulley whilst also attaching it to your ankle Stand forward so that you're facing the cable machine Bend your torso forward slightly and start the movement by driving your attached foot up toward your glutes At the peak of the movement, contract your glute muscle before lowering your leg back down

Attach ankle cuff to a low cable pulley and to your ankle. Stand facing the pulley machine, grasping it for support. While keeping your knee slightly bent, kick your leg back as far as possible. Return your leg to the starting position. Repeat the kickback on the opposite leg.

Stand up with your torso upright while holding a cable curl bar that is attached to a low pulley. Grab the cable bar at shoulder width and keep the elbows close to the torso. While holding the upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a brief moment as you squeeze the bicep muscles. Slowly begin to bring the bar back to original position as your breathe in. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Sit on a bench and adjust the cable machine so that it is at shoulder height Pull the cable toward your chest while keeping your back straight Squeeze your back muscles during the motion Hold for a second at the peak of the contraction Return to the starting position in a controlled manner

Stand tall with your back straight and take a step forward. Open your arms wide at the shoulder level holding the cables with your palms facing forward. Pull the cables by bringing your arms close in front of your chest. As your arms come close to each other, return to the initial position and repeat.
Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart Grab the handles of the cable machine Raise your arms forward until they are parallel to the floor Slowly lower your arms back down

Stand straight facing the cable pulley machine while holding on to the rope attachment at hip level with both hands. With your elbows slightly bent, lift the rope in front of you to eye level. Hold this position for a second, then slowly lower the rope back to the starting position. Repeat the process for your designated number of reps. Ensure your core is strong and back is straight during movement

Stand up straight and grasp the cable attachment with an overhand grip. Keep your back straight, with your hand in front of your body using a light weight at the start. Use your shoulder to lift the cable handle upward until your hand goes above shoulder level. Lower the handle slowly back down to the starting position. Repeat this movement with the recommended repetitions and then switch hands.

Stand up straight with the rope attached to the bottom of the cable machine Keep your feet hip-width apart Pull the rope upward till your hands reach shoulder level Hold at the peak for a moment Slowly lower your hands back to starting position

Stand facing the cable machine, grab handles with an overhand grip Pull the handles upward to shoulder level, keeping your arms straight Hold for a second at the top and then slowly lower back Repeat movement for desired reps

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the straight bar near your thighs with your arms straight and palms facing downward. Raise the bar by extending your arms forward. As your arms reach shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Sit down on the cable row machine and place your feet on the front platform Reach forward to grab the cable bar with an overhand grip Pull the cable bar towards your body while keeping your back straight Let the cable bar come back in a controlled motion

Sit at the cable machine with your feet placed on the foot rest Grab the cable attachment with both hands Pull the cable towards your waist while keeping your back straight Return to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Stand on the cable platform, feet shoulder-width apart Hold the cable handle with both hands against your upper chest Lower your body by bending your knees, keeping your chest up and back straight Push back up through your heels to the starting position Keep your abs engaged throughout the exercise

name_en: Cable Front Squat with V bar
description_en: Stand in front of the cable machine with the V bar at your chest level Grab the V bar with both hands and pull it to your shoulders Squat down by bending your knees, keeping your back straight Return to the original position by extending your knees and hip Repeat the process for your desired number of reps

Begin by placing the cable ankle cuff on your right ankle Next, step onto a sturdy box or bench with your left foot As you step up, bring your right knee up towards your chest Lower your right leg back down in a controlled manner Switch legs after your desired reps

Stand at a cable machine, pull the handle and hold it at chest level Keeping your back straight, lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the floor Pause for a moment at the bottom Push through your heels to stand back up Repeat for the desired number of reps

Kneel down by the cable machine, one knee on the floor, other foot flat on the floor in front of you. Grab the rope handles attached to the cable machine at a high position with your palms facing each other. Pull the rope towards your forehead, ensuring your elbows stay high and in line with your shoulders. Return the cable back to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat the process for the desired number of repetitions.

Kneel down and set the cable machine to the lowest setting Hold the cable handle with both hands Pull the handle up and across your body to shoulder height Lower the handle back down in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise for desired repetitions

Start by kneeling down a few feet away from the cable stack Grab the handle with both hands at chest height Press the handle out and away from your chest, fully extend your arms Hold for a few seconds before slowly bringing your hands back to your chest Repeat the exercise as many times as necessary

name_en: Cable Half Kneeling Single Arm Row
description_en: Begin in a half kneeling position, with one knee on the ground and the other foot placed in front of you Pull the cable towards your body while keeping your arm close to your side Make sure to squeeze your back muscles as you pull Slowly return the handle to the starting position Repeat the movement with the other arm

Stand straight in front of a cable machine, holding a rope attachment that is attached to the low pulley With your palms facing your torso, keep your elbows close to your torso and curl the weights while keeping your upper arms stationary Continue curling the weight until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze your biceps Slowly bring back the rope to the starting position

Stand up with your torso upright while holding a cable rope attachment that is attached to a low pulley. Keep your elbows close to your torso. While holding the upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting the biceps. Continue to raise the weight until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Slowly begin to bring the bar back to the starting position, as you breathe in. Repeat the movement for the recommended amount of repetitions.

name_en: Cable High Pulley Overhead Tricep Extension
description_en: Stand in front of a high pulley machine with your back to the machine Reach up to grab the bar or rope with both hands With elbows bent, pull the bar or rope down, extending your arms Pause at the full stretch position, then slowly return your arms back to the starting position Repeat the movement for your desired number of reps

name_en: Cable High Pulley Overhead Tricep Extension
description_en: Stand with your back towards the pulley machine Grasp the handle with both hands behind your head Straighten your arms and pull the handle down and away from the pulley Slowly return to the starting position

name_en: Cable High Pulley Straight Bar Overhead Triceps Extension
description_en: Set the high pulley to the desired weight. Facing away from the pulley with the bar overhead, grasp it with both hands. Bend your elbows to lower the bar behind your head, keeping your upper arms stationary. Extend your elbows to lift the bar back up to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Stand in front of the cable machine and grab the high pulley attachments Pull back the attachments until your hands are next to your chest, maintaining a slight bend in your knees Hold for a second at full contraction, squeezing your back muscles Slowly return to the starting position, extending your arms fully Try to keep your back straight throughout the course of the exercise

name_en: Cable High Row with Chest Support
description_en: Adjust the cable to a high position, and attach a straight or V-bar. Lean against the chest support with your knees slightly bent. Grab the bar with an overhand grip, pulling it towards your abdomen. Hold for a second, then return to the start in a controlled manner. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Stand in front of a high pulley with a rope or bar attachment Grab the attachment with an overhand grip Position your elbows at 90 degrees and pull the bar down, extending your elbows Slowly return the bar to the starting position, maintaining control at all times Repeat this for as many repetitions as desired

Attach a strap around your leg and connect it to a low cable Stand up straight, feet shoulder-width apart with your attached leg slightly behind you While keeping your glutes engaged, slowly lift your attached leg away from your body Hold for a second, then slowly lower the leg back to the starting position Repeat the process for the desired number of repetitions and then switch to the other leg

Attach a cable to your ankle. Stand near the cable machine, with the leg closest to the machine being the one attached to the cable. Lift your leg out to the side, keeping it straight. Lower your leg back down in a controlled manner. Repeat the exercise for the desired amount of reps, then switch legs.

Stand sideways to the cable machine and attach the cable to your ankle Stabilize yourself by holding onto the machine Keeping your leg straight, pull your working leg across your body Pause at the top of the motion before slowly returning to the starting position Repeat for the desired amount of reps before switching sides
Stand near the cable machine with one foot attached to the low pulley Slowly move your leg across the front of your body Slowly return the weight back and repeat Switch legs and repeat the motion

Stand perpendicular to the cable machine with the handle pulled to the chest level With the cable handle in both hands, extend your arms straight in front of you Pause for a moment before returning to the original position Switch sides and repeat the exercise Maintain a steady pace throughout
Start by sitting on an incline bench and grabbing the cable handles Push your hands forward until they straighten out Slowly let your arms bend back to the starting position Repeat the motion

Stand in front of an inclined cable machine with a handle attached to the low pulley Grab the handle with an underhand grip and lean back onto the inclined bench Curl your hands up to your shoulders, keeping your elbows stationary Slowly release the handle down, fully extending your arms Repeat the movement for the desired amount of repetitions

Position yourself between two cable machines with the handles attached on a high setting Hold the handles and step forward, leaning your body slightly forward Pull your arms together in front of your chest Hold this position for a second and then return to the starting position Repeat the exercise maintaining a slow and controlled movement

Stand between two overhead pulleys with a handle attached to each. Hold the handles and step into a staggered stance, leaning slightly forward. Pull your hands together in an arcing motion in front of your body. Hold for a moment then slowly return your hands back to the starting position. Repeat the movement while maintaining your stance and slight forward lean.

Sit on a stability ball and lean back until your shoulders and head are resting on the ball Reach up and grab the handle of a cable machine set at a high position Extend your arms fully above your chest, but avoid locking your elbows Lower your arms out to your sides in a wide arc until you feel a stretch in your chest Return your arms back to the starting position

Stand in front of the cable machine and grip each handle with your palms facing down, hands shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms fully while pushing down on the handles. Hold this position for a moment before slowly releasing back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired amount of reps. Ensure your back remains straight throughout the movement.

name_en: Cable Incline Rear Delt Fly with Back Support
description_en: Sit on an adjustable bench set to a low incline and reach for the cable handles Raise your arms out to the sides until they are level with your shoulders, then slowly lower them back down Keep a slight bend in your elbows throughout the movement Do this motion gradually and control the weights Repeat the desired number of repetitions

Stand in front of a cable machine, with your back towards it Hold the cable bar with an overhand grip Raise your arms above your head with elbows bent at 90 degrees Extend your arms until they are fully extended Return your arms to the initial position in a controlled manner

Attach a low pulley cable to your ankle and stand facing the cable machine Step up onto a bench or step with the foot opposite the cable attachment Drive through the leading foot, extend your hip and knee, and pull your trailing leg up toward your chest Lower your trailing leg in a controlled movement to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs

Stand beside the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart Grasp the handle with both hands, palms facing each other Keeping your feet planted, twist your torso pulling the handle to opposite side Control the motion when you return back to the original position Repeat the set on your other side

Attach a single grip to the low pulley cable. Turn away from the machine, holding the grip behind you with your arm bent. Extend your arm backwards until it's straight, focusing on your triceps. Hold for a second and then gradually bring your arm back to the initial position. Repeat this for the desired number of repetitions.

Attach a ankle strap to a low pulley. Then attach the ankle strap to your ankle. Face the pulley and hold onto the machine for balance. Keeping your core tight, kick back your leg straight behind you, contracting your glutes. Hold for a second and then slowly return your leg back to the starting position. Perform the desired number of repetitions and then switch legs.

Kneel below the high pulley and grasp cable rope attachment with both hands. Flex your waist to pull the upper torso from the hips towards your knees. Contract your ab muscles at the end of the movement. Slowly reverse the movement back to the starting position, while controlling the resistance. Repeat as per your training routine.

Kneel down in front of the cable machine, with the rope attached at a high pulley Grasp the ends of the rope, pulling it down to your forehead Perform a crunch by contracting your abs and curling your hips towards your torso Hold for a moment, then slowly return back to the starting position

Kneel down in front of the cable machine, positioning the rope attachment to your desired height. Grasp the ends of the rope with both hands, bring your hands to the side of your head. Flex your waist to bring your elbows to your knees. Return slowly to the initial position, extending your torso.

Attach a rope to a high pulley and kneel in front of it With the sides of your hands at your ears, pull your elbows to your knees as you inhale Crunch your uppers to your lowers in a hinging motion Maintain a smooth movement, hinging the hip as you crunch Exhale as you rise and inhale as you return to the starting position

Attach the ankle cuff to a low cable, then attach the cuff to your ankle Kneel down on your hands and knees, keeping your torso straight Kick one leg back until it's inline with your body Slowly bring your leg back to the starting position Repeat this motion with the given repetitions then switch and repeat with the other leg

name_en: Cable Kneeling High Low Anti Rotation Chop
description_en: Set up a cable machine to a high setting. Kneel down on the floor, facing away from the machine. Grip the handle with both hands and pull the cable down and across your body. Pause at the bottom, hold it for a second. Return the weight back up in a controlled manner.

name_en: Cable Kneeling High to Low Fly
description_en: Start in a kneeling position in front of the cables Hold onto the cables, arms outstretched at shoulder height Pull the cables down and towards the center of your body Return to the starting position in a controlled movement Repeat for the desired number of reps

Kneel next to the low pulley machine with one knee completely bent, the other knee is the working leg with the ankle strap attached Keeping your body stable, move your working leg away from your body until you feel a stretch in your hip Return to the starting position following the same path Switch sides and repeat the same motion with the other leg Perform the desired number of reps on each side

name_en: Cable Kneeling One Arm Lat Pulldown
description_en: Kneel in front of the cable machine with one knee, keeping the other foot flat on the floor behind you Grab the handle with one hand, keeping your arm extended Pull the handle down to your chest, contracting your lat muscles Pause briefly at the bottom, then slowly release the handle back up Repeat the motion with the other arm

Kneel in front of the cable machine holding the rope attachment, keep your arms straight Push your hips back and bend at the waste, lowering your torso Drive your hips forward, standing up straight and squeezing the glutes Return to starting position, and repeat

Begin by attaching a rope to a low cable pulley and then kneel in front of the cable machine Grasp the rope with both hands and extend your arms in front of you Pull the rope towards your upper chest while keeping your elbows high Hold this position for a moment before slowly returning to the initial position Repeat this for the desired amount of repetitions

Kneel down in front of the cable machine and grab the cable handle with your desired hand. Keeping your elbow bent at 90 degrees, slowly rotate your shoulder outwards away from your body. Hold for a second when your arm is fully extended. Slowly rotate your shoulder back to the start position. Repeat this motion for desired reps then switch arms.

Kneel down next to the cable system with the cable at your side at about the elevation of your lower ribs Hold the handle with your closest arm, elbow bent at 90 degrees Rotate your arm outward, away from your torso, maintaining the 90-degree bend at your elbow Slowly return your arm to the original position Repeat the exercise with the same arm before switching to the other

Kneel in front of a cable machine, holding the handles at shoulder height. While keeping your back straight, push the handles upward until your arms are fully extended above your head. Pause at the top, then carefully lower the handles back to the starting position. Make sure to control the movement both on the way up and on the way down. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Attach a D-handle to a low pulley cable machine. Kneel down beside the machine, grasp the handle with one hand, then hold onto the machine for support with the other hand. Bend at your waist towards the side of the machine, squeezing as you crunch. Pause at the point of tension then slowly return to the starting position. Repeat this for the desired number of repetitions then switch sides.

Kneel in front of a high pulley, holding a straight-bar attachment with an overhand grip Slowly bend your elbows and lower the bar towards your forehead while keeping your upper arms stationary Extend the arms back to the starting position Keep your elbows close to your head throughout the motion

Start by kneeling in front of the cable machine Grab the cable rope with both hands behind your head Extend your arms up until they are straight and parallel with the floor Slowly return to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Kneel in front of a high pulley with a rope attached Grasp the rope with your hands and pull it down until your hands are next to your face Extend your arms fully using your triceps Slowly return back to the starting position Repeat the movement for desired reps

Attach a single handle to a high pulley and kneel down directly under it Grasp the cable with both hands and pull down to your chest, keeping your knees and hips in place Twist your waist and lower the handle towards one side, return to the center and then towards your other side in a controlled movement Repeat for the desired repetitions Switch sides after a set

Start by standing in front of a cable machine with the rope attachment at the highest position Grasp the ropes with both hands and pull them down to your sides, maintaining a small bend in your elbows Extend your arms back up in a controlled manner to return to the starting position Make sure to feel a full range of motion in your latissimus dorsi, to ensure maximum benefit Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Cable Lateral Pulldown with Mag Grip
description_en: Stand in front of the machine and grab the mag grip with an overhand grip. Lean back slightly keeping your torso straight. Pull the handles down to your sides while keeping your arms close to your body. Hold for a moment and squeeze your back muscles, then slowly return to the start position. Maintain control throughout the exercise, avoiding any sudden movements.

Stand upright in front of a high pulley with a V-bar attached Grip the V-bar with both hands, with a slight bend in your elbows Pull the bar down to your sides while keeping your body straight Hold the contraction at the bottom before slowly raising the bar back up Repeat the motion for the desired amount of repetitions

Stand next to the cable machine with the pulley adjusted to the lowest position Hold the pulley handle with the hand furthest away, your arm should be fully extended Raise your arm using your shoulder until it is parallel to the floor Pause at the top of the movement for a moment Slowly lower your arm back down to the start position

Stand up straight and grab the low cable pulley with your right hand. Keep your arm slightly bent and raise it to your side, up to shoulder-level. Hold for a moment at the top, feeling the contraction in your deltoids. Lower your arm back down slowly. Repeat the exercise with your left arm.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the cables near your thighs in opposite hands with your arms straight and palms facing inward. Pull the cables by extending your arms wide apart. As your arms reach shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Cable Lat Pulldown Full Range Of Motion
description_en: Sit down at a lat pulldown station and grab the bar with your hands shoulder-width apart Pull the bar down until it's approximately at chest level Slowly raise the bar back up until your arms and lats are fully extended Repeat the movement for your desired number of reps Ensure to perform the full range of motion

Stand next to the pulley system and grab the handle attached to the low pulley with your far hand. Lean away from the pulley as you raise the handle up and out to your side until your upper arm is about parallel with the ground. Pause at the top for a second, then slowly lower the handle back to the starting position. Repeat the process for your required repetitions then switch to your other arm.

Stand up straight in front of the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart Grab the cable bars in each hand and step forward to create tension Push forward by extending your arms, keeping your hands at chest level Return your hands to chest level in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand in the middle of the cable machine and grab a handle in each hand at your sides Keep a slight bend in your elbows and pull the handles together in front of you Slowly return the handles back to your sides Repeat for the desired number of repetitions Remember to maintain a stable and strong core throughout the exercise

Start by standing in the middle of the cable machine with a handle in each hand With slightly bent elbows, pull your arms together in front of your chest Pause for a moment, then slowly return your arms to the starting position Maintain a straight posture throughout the exercise Repeat this motion for the recommended number of repetitions

Sit on a bench with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Extend your arms to hold the machine's handle with an overhand grip by placing your hands shoulder-width apart. Pull the bar towards your chest while folding your arms and taking your elbows past your back.

Sit at the low row cable machine with your legs perpendicular to the floor Place your feet firmly on the foot pad Pull the handle towards your abdomen Pause for a moment, then slowly extend your arms back to the starting position Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps

Sit at a low pulley cable station with a V-bar handle attached. Pull the handle towards your waistline, keeping the torso stationary. Pause when your hands reach your abdomen. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

name_en: Cable Low Seated Row with V bar
description_en: Sit down at the machine and place your feet on the platform. Grip the V handle and keep your back straight with a slight lean back. Pull the handle towards your abdomen. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and pause. Slowly return to the start position.

Lay down on the floor, facing upwards, near a low pulley cable Grasp the handle of the cable with your hands Curl the weight up while keeping your elbows stationary Hold for a moment and contract your biceps Slowly return to the initial position

Lie down on a bench or floor facing up, with your head near a low pulley Grasp the cable bar by reaching up, with a shoulder-width grip Exhale and curl the bar until your biceps are fully contracted Pause for a moment when you reach the top Lower the bar back to the starting position while inhaling

Lie down on your back in front of a cable machine with your feet towards it Take the handle or bar in both hands with an underhand grip Pull the handle or bar toward your chest while keeping your elbows still Pause when the bar is at chest level then slowly extend your arms to return to the starting position Repeat this exercise for the recommended amount of repetitions

Lie on your back in front of the cable machine with your arms stretched above your head Grip the bar with an underhand grip Curl the bar towards your forehead Slowly return to the initial position Repeat the movement

Lie down on a bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Hold the cables by extending your arms overhead and bending your elbows with your palms upwards. Pull the cables by raising your arms over the shoulders. Return to the starting position slowly and repeat.

Lie on your back on the floor with your feet near the cable machine. Grasp the rope attachment with both hands. Slowly bring your arms overhead towards the floor. Pause when you feel a stretch in your lats, then slowly bring your arms back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Lie on your back, facing the cable machine with feet towards it Grab the pulley handle with both hands Keep arms fully extended then pull the cable towards your face, maintaining elbow height Return to the starting position in a slow motion Repeat the movement

Lie down on a flat bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab the cables while opening your arms at your sides with your palms facing the ceiling. Pull the cables by closing your arms over your chest. As your hands reach close, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie down on a flat bench placed between two low pulleys Grasp the cable handles with a neutral grip and extend your arms parallel to the floor on each side of your body Breathe out and press the handles together above your chest, until your hands touch Slowly return your arms back to the starting position as you inhale Repeat the exercise for the recommended amount of repetitions

Lay down on a flat bench, making sure your head and back are fully supported Hold the cable handles extended straight out to your sides with a slight bend in your elbows Pull the handles together in a wide arc over your chest Pause at the top, contracting your chest muscles Slowly return the handles back to the starting position in a controlled motion

Lie on your back on a bench and position both feet square on the floor. Grasp the cable bar with an overhand grip. Extend your arms with your hands directly above your shoulders. Bend your elbows to bring the bar towards your forehead. Extend your elbows to return to the starting position.

Start by lying flat on your back on the floor near a low pulley, with your feet flat on the floor and your head towards the pulley Grasp the cable bar with an overhand grip Fully extend your arms straight above you Keeping your elbows in place, lower the bar down to your forehead by bending at the elbows Once the bar has lightly touched your forehead, push the bar back to the starting position by extending your elbows

Lie flat on your back on a bench, feet planted firmly on the ground Hold the rope attached to the cable with both hands above your chest Bend your elbows and allow the rope to be pulled by the weight towards your forehead Stretch your arms back out to the starting position Avoid moving your shoulders during the movement

Lie on your back and grab the cable bar with an overhand grip Extend your arms straight up in front of you Lower the bar by bending your elbows until the bar is just above your forehead Raise the bar back to the starting position by straightening your arms Repeat according to desired sets and repetitions

Lie down on a bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Hold the cable bar above your head by bending your elbows with your palms upward. Pull the bar by straightening your arms over your shoulders. Return to the starting position slowly and repeat.

Lie down on a bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Hold the cable bar above your head by bending your elbows to a 90-degree angle with your palms upward. Pull the bar by straightening your arms over your shoulders. Return to the starting position slowly and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and take a step forward. Open your arms wide just above the shoulder level holding the cables with your palms facing forward. Pull the cables by bringing the arms close while lowering them a bit in front of your chest. As your arms come close to each other, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and take a step forward. Open your arms a little near your thighs holding the cables with your palms facing forward. Pull the cables by bringing the arms close while raising them to shoulder level. As your arms come close to each other, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand in the middle of a cable machine with a strength cord in each hand Lean slightly forward from your waist Pull your arms together in front of you, bending your elbows slightly Return your arms back to the start position in a controlled fashion Repeat the movement

Position yourself seated on a narrow chair placed close to the cable machine Attach the cable to your waist level and hold its ends Stand up by driving through your heels, engaging your glutes and hamstrings Unlock the hips first and then the knees, keeping the torso as straight as you can Slowly lower yourself back to the seated position, again engaging the glutes and hamstrings

Stand tall facing a pully machine and hold the cable rope on your chest just under your chin while folding your arms. Lower your hips while bending your knees as if you are sitting on a chair. Pull the ropes by raising your hips and getting into an upright position. Return to the starting position slowly and repeat.

Stand straight in front of the cable machine, holding the neutral grip handle Bend your elbows and pull the handle towards your chest Squeeze your biceps at the top of the curl Slowly lower your arms back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand in the center of the cable machine with handles in both hands Push the handles forward until your arms are fully extended Return to starting position by allowing your arms to slowly return back Maintaining proper form, repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions

Stand in front of a cable machine with knees slightly bent and body hinged forward Grab the cable with one hand, elbow flexed at 90 degrees, upper arm close to your body Extend your arm backwards until it's straight Pause at the top, then slowly return to start position Switch sides after a set

Sit down at a pulldown station and grab the handles of the cable attachment with a neutral grip Initiate the movement by retracting your shoulder blades and pulling the handles towards your chest Hold for a moment before slowly returning the handles to the starting position Avoid using your upper body or swinging to pull the handles down Repeat for the desired number of reps

Sit at a cable station with a wide neutral-grip bar attachment Pull the bar down towards your chest while maintaining a straight back Hold at the bottom while squeezing your shoulder blades together Slowly let the bar pull back up until your arms are extended Repeat the process for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Cable One Arm Bent over Row
description_en: Stand tall in a stepping position and lean forward while bending your knees. Place your right hand on your knee, and hold the cable in your left hand by extending your arm forward with your palm facing inwards. Pull the cable up by folding your arm and taking your elbow past your back. Return by straightening your arm, and repeat.

name_en: Cable One Arm Bent over Row
description_en: Stand next to the cable machine, feet shoulder-width apart Bend over at the waist while keeping your back straight Grab the cable handle with one hand and pull it towards your rib Slowly return the handle to the starting position Repeat the movement on the other side

Stand up straight next to the cable machine and grab the handle with one hand. While keeping your elbow close to your body, slowly curl the handle up to your shoulder. Squeeze your biceps briefly at the top of the movement. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position. Repeat on the other side.

Stand straight and grab the single cable handle with a underhand grip. Keep your elbow close to your body and curl the weight up. Pause at the top, then lower it back down to the starting position in a slow and controlled manner. Repeat this for the recommended amount of repetitions. Switch to the other arm and repeat the process.

Stand shoulder width apart and pick up the cable handle with your palm facing up. Keep your elbow close to your torso and curl your arm, pulling the cable towards your shoulder. Pause and then slowly lower your arm back down to the starting position. Repeat the exercise with your other arm.

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the cable near your thigh with your arm slightly bent. Keep your wrist straight and your palm facing the ceiling. Raise the cable towards the shoulder by folding your arm. As you reach near the shoulder, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand straight facing the cable machine, holding the handle attached to the low cable with one hand Raise your arm straight up to shoulder level while keeping a little bend in your elbow Hold the position briefly and slowly lower your arm back to the starting position Repeat the exercise for the appropriate number of repetitions before switching to the other arm

name_en: Cable One Arm Inner Biceps Curl
description_en: Stand up straight, holding onto the cable handle with one hand, arm extended Curl your arm up, keeping your elbows close to your body Pause at the top of the curl for one second Slowly lower your arm back to the starting position Repeat process with other arm

name_en: Cable One Arm Inner Biceps Curl
description_en: Stand tall facing the cable machine with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the cable's handle in one hand while keeping your arm straight and palm on the upper side. Pull the cable by folding your arm. As your hands reach near the head, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Cable One Arm Lateral Bent over
description_en: Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, lean forward, and bend your knees slightly. Hold the cable in your right hand while extending your arm to that side with your palm facing forward. Pull the cable by lowering your arm forward.

name_en: Cable One Arm Lateral Bent over
description_en: Stand side-on to the cable machine and reach for the handle with one hand. Your feet should be shoulder-width apart. Bend at the waist till your torso is almost parallel to the floor. Make a rowing motion pulling back and upward, keeping your arm close to your body. Slowly return the cable back to starting position. Repeat and swap sides to train your other lat.

Stand up straight next to the machine, feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the cable machine handle with your free hand. Without bending your elbow, raise your arm out to your side to shoulder height. Lower your arm back down in a controlled manner to the starting position. Repeat the same movement with the other arm.

Stand next to the low pulley cable machine, feet shoulder-width apart Hold the cable handle with your outside hand, palm facing down Keeping your arm straight but not locked, raise it out to the side until it's at shoulder level Slowly lower your arm back down to your side Repeat, and then switch sides to exercise the other arm

Stand erect at a cable pulley station, facing the machine Grasp the single-hand grip attached to the cable with your hand Pull the cable down towards your body until your elbow is close to your side Slowly return your arm to the starting position Repeat the motion with the opposite arm

Get on the pull-down machine with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab the cable in your left hand by extending your arm overhead and your palm facing forward. Pull the cable while folding your arm and turning your forearm inward. Return to the initial position by extending your arm, and then repeat.

Position yourself on the cable machine with a single handle attachment, standing upright Grasp the handle with one hand Pull downward in a controlled motion, with your elbow tucked in towards your side Pause briefly at the bottom and contract your lat Slowly return to the starting position

name_en: Cable One Arm Neutral Grip Biceps Curl
description_en: Stand next to the cable machine, setting the pulley at the lowest level Grab the handle with a neutral grip and stand up straight, keeping your elbow close to your body Flex the elbow, pulling the cable up until the forearm is near your biceps Pause at the top, then slowly lower the cable back to the initial position Repeat for desired amount of reps, then switch arms

Secure a D-handle to the bottom setting on the cable machine Stand facing the machine and grab the handle with one hand With the back of your upper arm resting on the preacher pad, keep your elbow planted and curl the weight Pause for a moment at the top before slowly letting the weight back down Repeat and alternate arms

Stand facing the cable machine with your feet hip-width apart Select the appropriate weight and grab the handle with one hand Pull the cable downward as you bend your elbow and squeeze your shoulder blade Pause when the cable is close to your body Slowly return your arm to the starting position while maintaining control

Stand sideways to the cable machine, keeping your feet shoulder-width apart Hold the handle with your hand that is farthest from the machine Keep your arm straight and pull the handle across your body and out to your side Return your arm slowly back to the start position Repeat the movement with the other arm

name_en: Cable One Arm Side Triceps Pushdown
description_en: Stand next to the cable machine, feet shoulder width apart With the handle at the high pulley position, grab it with one hand, arm fully extended Slowly lower the handle down to your side until your arm is fully extended Pause, then bring your arm back to the starting position Repeat with the other arm

Stand upright next to the high pulley of the cable machine, holding the handle with one hand, palm facing down. Using your tricep, bring your forearm down until it is almost straight, keeping your upper arm stationary. Pause for a moment, then slowly return your arm to the starting position. Repeat the movement with the same arm for the specified amount of repetitions, then switch to the other arm. Ensure to keep your back straight and chest out throughout the exercise.

Stand up straight and position yourself in front of a high pulley machine. Grab the handle with one hand, ensuring your palm faces down. Pull the handle down by extending the elbow and allowing your triceps to contract. Slowly release back to the starting point, allowing your triceps to stretch. Repeat the movement for the other arm.

name_en: Cable one arm twisting seated row
description_en: Sit on the bench and plant your feet firmly on the ground Grasp the cable handle with one hand Pull the cable handle towards your waist while twisting your torso Return the handle to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat with your other arm

name_en: Cable One Arm Twisting Seated Row
description_en: Sit on the seat, place one foot on the platform and grasp one of the cable handles. Using your latissimus dorsi, pull the handle towards your waist while rotating your torso towards the pulling arm. Hold in this position for few seconds. Slowly return to the neutral position. Switch sides and repeat the exercise.

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the cables by spreading your arms overhead. Keep your elbows slightly bent and at shoulder level and palms inward. Raise the cables towards your head by bending your arms. As your hands reach near the head, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand in front of a cable machine with the bar attachment at the top. Grab the bar with palms facing forward. Keeping your upper arms stationary, curl the weight while contracting the biceps. Hold at the contraction point, then slowly return to your starting position.

Stand tall with a straight back and take a step forward. Grab the rope in your hands by extending your arms overhead with bent elbows, and lean forward. Pull the rope forward by straightening your arms while turning your forearms inward. As your arms are fully extended, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Cable Overhead Tricep Extension Straight Bar
description_en: Stand upright with a straight back, holding the straight bar on the cable machine with both hands behind your head Slowly extend your arms, lifting the weight held at the straight bar Ensure your elbows stay close to your head throughout the movement Pause at the top, then lower the weight back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand in front of a high pulley with a rope attachment. With your palms facing each other, extend your arms straight out in front of you. Pull the handle down to your forehead by extending your elbows while keeping them close to your body. Return to the starting position by flexing your elbows and extending your arms upwards. Avoid using your back or shoulders to generate momentum; just use the triceps strength.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, grasping the rope attachment with both hands. Raise your arms above your head, keeping a slight bend in your elbow. Slowly lower the rope behind your head, extending your arms. Pause at the bottom of the movement and then return to the starting position. Repeat this movement for the desired number of reps.

Stand tall facing a rowing machine with your back straight, knees bent slightly, and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the cable handle in your right hand with an overhand grip while keeping your arm straight. Pull the cable towards you by folding your arm, turning your forearm side up, and taking your elbow past your back.

Grab the cable handle with your palms facing each other Pull the handle towards your torso, rotating your palms upward Slowly return to the initial position, rotating your palms back Perform the movement in a controlled manner Repeat the process for the recommended number of repetitions

name_en: Cable Parallel Grip Lat Pulldown on Floor
description_en: Sit on the floor with your legs stretched out in front of the cable pulley Hold the parallel grips firmly and keep your back straight Slowly pull the grips towards your upper chest Pause for a second then return to the starting position Repeat this for your desired number of sets and reps

Get on the preacher curl machine and place your arms on the platform with your palms facing the ceiling. Grab the bar attached to the cable with your hands placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the bar towards the head by folding your arms. as you reach near the head, return to the starting position and repeat.

Attach the rope handles to the low pulley on the cable machine Stand facing the machine, grasp the rope with palms up or facing towards each other Pull the rope towards your shoulders, bending at the elbows Pause for a moment at the top and squeeze your bicep muscles Lower the rope back down in a slow, controlled manner

Adjust the cable machine to a low position, and attach the straight bar. Stand facing the cable machine with your torso against an angled bench and both hands gripping the straight bar. Curl the bar upwards keeping your elbows firmly against the bench. Hold for a short pause at the top before slowly lowering the bar back to the starting position.

Attach the pro lat bar to the high pulley of the cable station Stand or sit with a straight back, grab the bar with an overhand grip Pull the bar down to your upper chest while keeping your elbows close to your body Slowly return the bar back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Adjust the cable machine to desired height with a bar attachment at the top Sit on the pulldown machine with your torso upright, grab the bar with an overhand grip Pull down the bar to your chest while contracting your lats Hold for a second with a squeezed back Slowly return the bar to the initial position, allowing your lats to fully stretch

Get on the pull-down machine with your back straight, knees fixed, and feet placed on the floor. Grab the ends of the bar with an overhand grip. Pull the bar and bring it towards your chest by folding your arms and taking your elbows down. Return to the initial position by straightening your arms and then repeat.

Get on the pull-down machine with your back straight, knees fixed, and feet placed on the floor. Grab the bar with an overhand grip and your hands shoulder-width apart. Pull the bar and bring it towards your chest by folding your arms and taking your elbows down. Return to the initial position by straightening your arms and then repeat.

Attach the rope to the low pulley of the cable machine Stand facing away from the machine, go a few steps forward to create tension on the cable Grab the rope between your legs with both hands Lean forward slightly, bend at your hips and knees, keeping a straight back Extend your hips and stand up straight, pulling the cable through your legs Return to the starting position in a controlled manner

Stand facing away from the cable station with the rope between your legs Grasp the rope with both hands and with your hips pushed back Drive your hips forward to stand erect, pulling the cable through your legs Pause for a moment at the top of the movement Slowly reverse the motion, returning to the starting position

Stand facing away from the cable machine, legs shoulder-width apart, holding the rope with both hands between your legs Hold your shoulders back and look straight ahead Pull the cable through your legs by contracting your glutes and hamstrings Straighten your hips and knees Return to the initial position by bending your hips

Stall tall with your feet open wide and lean forward to hold cables while extending your arms through your legs. Pull the cables by extending your back, bringing your chest out, and straightening your legs. Return to the starting position slowly and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the bar with an overhand grip and your hands shoulder-width apart by extending your arms overhead. Pull the bar down and bring it towards your belly while keeping your arms straight. Return to the initial position slowly and then repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the bar near your chest with an overhand grip, folded arms, and your hands shoulder-width apart. Pull the bar towards your thighs by straightening your arms. Return to the initial position slowly and then repeat.

Stand in front of a high pulley with a straight bar attached to the top. Keep your feet shoulder-width apart Grasp the bar with your palms facing down at shoulder width Contract your lats and pull the bar down, keeping your arms straight throughout the move Lower the bar until your arms are fully extended by your sides Pause, then return to the starting position in a controlled manner

Stand in front of the cable machine, attaching the rope to a high cable pulley Grab the ropes with each hand hanging from the pulley and take a step back Start by bending at your elbows to pull the ropes down toward your thighs Slowly let the ropes come back up to the original position Repeat the motion while keeping your upper arms stationary

Stand in front of a high pulley with a bar attached Grasp the cable bar at shoulder width Push down the bar until your arms are fully extended by your sides Return to the starting position until your forearms are close to vertical

Stand up with your torso upright and a handle attached to a high pulley. Keep your elbows close to your body Exhale and push the handle down until your arm is fully extended Inhale and slowly return to the starting position Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the cables in your opposite hands while extending your arms to shoulder height with your palms facing downward. Pull the cables by extending your arms wide apart. As your arms align with the shoulders, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand in between the parallel bars Grab each bar while keeping your elbows high Pull the bars towards you whilst keeping your back straight Hold the position momentarily Release the bars to the initial position in a controlled manner

Attach a straight bar to the lowest pulley on the cable machine Stand straight facing the pulley, then grab the bar with your hands shoulder-width apart Pull the bar toward your lower chest while keeping your elbows flared out Hold at the peak position for a moment Slowly return to the starting position

Stand upright and hold the rope with palms facing each other Pull the rope back, keeping your arms close to the body Retract your shoulder blades as you perform the movement Return to the start position in a controlled manner

Stand with your feet hip-width apart in front of a cable machine Grab the cable with your palm facing down and extend your arm completely Pull the cable back until your arm is fully extended behind you Slowly bend your elbow to return the handle to the starting position Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Raise your right arm and hold the cable in front of your chest with your arm bent to a 90-degree angle and your palm facing downward. Pull the cable by taking your elbow past your back while keeping your arm bent. Return to the initial position slowly and then repeat.

Get on the pull-down machine with your back straight, knees fixed, and feet placed on the floor. Grab the ends of the bar with an overhand grip. Pull the bar and take it behind your neck by folding your arms and taking your elbows down. Return to the initial position by straightening your arms and then repeat.

Stand at a high pulley machine with a straight-bar attached Grab the bar with a shoulder-width overhand grip Pull the bar down to your upper chest, while keeping your torso still Hold for a moment, then slowly raise the bar back to the starting position Repeat for desired reps

Stand tall facing a pully machine with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the bar attached to the cable near your thighs with an overhand grip and place your hands shoulder-width apart. Raise the bar towards the shoulders by bending your arms. As you reach near the shoulders, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand straight and grip the cable bar with palms facing down Keeping the upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting the biceps as you breathe out Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as your breathe in Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the cables in your opposite hands while extending your arms to shoulder height with your palms facing downward. Pull the cables by extending your arms wide apart. As your arms align with the shoulders, return to the initial position and repeat.

Sit down at a cable row machine with a wide double bar attached. Grab the bar with palms facing up. Pull the bar towards you, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Slowly extend your arms back out to the starting position. Repeat the exercise for your desired number of repetitions.

Position yourself on the pulldown machine with knees under the pads Grasp the bar with a reverse grip (palms facing you) Begin to pull the bar down to your chest level Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement Slowly release the bar back to the starting position

Stand at a high pulley cable station, grabbing the bar with a reverse (underhand) grip Keep your upper arms stationary, exhale and push the bar down until your arms are fully extended Pause briefly keeping your muscles contracted at the bottom Slowly return the bar back to the initial position while inhaling Repeat for the desired amount of repetitions

Stand in front of a high pulley with a bar attached. Grasp the bar with reverse grip at shoulder width. Keeping your elbows close to your body, push the bar down. Pause and slowly return the bar back to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the bar near your chest with an underhand grip, folded arms, and your hands shoulder-width apart. Pull the bar towards your thighs by straightening your arms. Return to the initial position slowly and then repeat.

name_en: Cable reverse grip straight back seated high row
description_en: Get on the pull-down machine with your back straight, knees fixed, and feet placed on the floor. Grab the bar with an underhand grip and your hands shoulder-width apart. Pull the bar towards your chest by folding your arms and taking your elbows past your back.

name_en: Cable Reverse-grip Straight Back Seated High Row
description_en: Sit at the cable machine, with your feet flat on the foot supports. Hold the cable handles with a reverse grip (palms facing you). Lean slightly forward from your hips and pull the handles towards your abdomen. Pause briefly then slowly return to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps.
Stand in front of a high pulley with an EZ-bar attached Grab the bar with palms facing upwards Pull the bar down to your thighs by extending your arms Return slowly back to the starting position

Stand straight facing the cable machine Hold the SZ-bar with an overhand grip Keep your elbows close to your body and push the bar down Hold for a moment at the bottom, flexing your triceps Slowly bring the bar back up to the starting position

name_en: Cable Reverse Grip Triceps Pushdown Back Side POV
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the bar near your chest with an underhand grip, folded arms, and your hands shoulder-width apart. Pull the bar towards your thighs by straightening your arms. Return to the initial position slowly and then repeat.

name_en: Cable Reverse Grip Triceps Push Down Straight Bar
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the straight bar in front of your chest with bent arms and an underhand grip. Pull the bar down by straightening your arms. As your arms are fully extended, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand in front of a low pulley holding a straight bar with an overhand grip. Place the back of your arms on a preacher bench and extend your arms in front of you. Curl the weight while contracting your forearms. Lower the weight in a controlled manner to the starting position. Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps.

Stand facing the cable machine, hold the bar with an overhand grip Keep your arms extended and aligned with your body Curl your wrists upward while keeping the rest of your arm stationary Pause at the top of the movement Lower your wrists back down in a controlled manner

Stand in front of the cable machine with feet hip-width apart Grab the cable handle, keep your back straight, hinge at your hips and lower the handle towards your feet Drive through your hips to stand back up straight, pulling the cable up with you Maintain a slight bend in your knees throughout the exercise

Sit on the machine with your feet on the front platform and knees slightly bent. Lean forward at your hips and grab the rope handles with both hands. Pull the handles toward your abdomen, extending your back and squeezing your shoulder blades together. Slowly release the handles back to the starting position under control. Repeat the motion for a designed number of repetitions.

Sit on the preacher bench, resting your arm against the pad with the rope within reach Grasp the rope with a hammer grip As you breathe out, pull the rope towards you until your forearm is vertical Hold for a second at the peak bicep contraction, then lower back down in a controlled fashion

name_en: Cable Rope High Pulley Overhead Tricep Extension
description_en: Stand in front of a high pulley with a rope attached Hold the rope with palms facing each other Pull the rope down until your forearms are parallel to the floor Extend your arms, pushing the rope down Slowly return to the starting position

Set the pulley of the cable machine at the highest position. Grab the rope with both hands. While keeping your elbows at your sides and slightly bent, pull the rope down towards your body. Extend your arms fully, focusing on contracting your triceps. Hold this position momentarily before slowly returning to the starting position. Repeat this movement for your desired number of reps.

Sit down at a row machine with a rope attachment and place feet on the front platform Lean over as you keep the natural alignment of your back and grab the rope handles With your arms extended pull back until your torso is at a 90-degree angle from your legs Breathe out as you pull the handles back towards your abdomen Return back to the original position as you breathe in

Sit on the bench and attach the cable to a high pulley Grab the cable rope handles with both hands, and pull them down towards your shoulders Bend at the waist while keeping your back straight, and try to bring your shoulders towards your hips Return up to your starting position slowly Repeat the motion for your desired reps

Sit on a flat bench facing away from the cable stack with your feet flat on the floor Hold the cable rope attachment with both hands and position it at the side of your head Crunch forward and down, bending at the waist while keeping your hips and lower body stationary Hold for a moment then slowly return to the starting position Repeat for the desired amount of reps

Sit down at a cable station, placing your feet flat on the platform Grab the ends of the rope with each hand, starting with your arms fully extended in front of you Pull the rope towards your face, squeezing your shoulder blades together Hold at the peak contraction for a moment Slowly return to the starting position

Sit down at a low pulley cable machine with a cuff attachment and attach it to your foot Move your foot outward away from the center of your body Pause when you feel the full stretch in your calves Slowly bring the foot back to the center Repeat the motion
Sit on the seat and attach the cable to your foot Press your foot inward against the resistance Return to the starting position in a controlled manner Do a set with one foot, then switch to the other

name_en: Cable Seated High Pulley Overhead Tricep Extension
description_en: Sit on the bench facing the cable machine, grab the rope with both hands overhead Pull the rope down by extending your arms until they are fully extended Pause briefly, then slowly return to the starting position by bending at the elbows Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps

Sit at a cable station with a V-bar attached to the high pulley Grab the bar with both hands and pull it towards your body, bringing your elbows back Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement Slowly return the bar back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Sit down on the high row machine, feet flat on the ground and grab the V-bar with an overhand grip. Keeping your back straight, pull the handle towards your body, to your lower chest/stomach area. Squeeze your Shoulder blades when you are at the peak contraction, hold for a second. Release the handle back to the starting position in a slow and controlled manner. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Sit on the machine with your back firmly against the back padding Place your feet under the pad, adjust the pad so it rests on your lower shin Extend your legs, pushing against the pad Lower legs back down in a slow, controlled motion

Put on the head harness and attach it to the cable. Sit with your head slightly bent forward. With your spine straight, extend your neck backward against the weight. Hold for a second before returning to the starting position. Repeat this for the desired number of repetitions.

Sit on a low pulley cable station with a head harness attached Attach the other end of the harness to the cable Slowly move your head forward, flexing your neck as you do so Bring your head back to the starting position and repeat the exercise

name_en: Cable Seated One Arm Alternate Row
description_en: Sit on the machine and place your feet on the platform. Grab the handle of the cable with one hand and pull it towards your waist. Pause for a moment while squeezing your back muscles. Slowly return the cable back to the starting position. Switch hands and repeat the same movements.

name_en: Cable Seated One Arm Alternate Row
description_en: Sit on a bench with your back straight, knees bent, and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean back a bit and extend your right arm to hold the cable handle with your palm facing inward. Pull the handle towards you by folding your arm and taking your elbow past your back. Return to the initial position slowly and then repeat.

name_en: Cable Seated One Arm Concentration Curl
description_en: Sit on the edge of a flat bench and position a low pulley cable machine at about arm's length Hold the cable handle with the palm of your hand facing upwards Keep your elbow close to your body and bend your arm at the elbow to curl the weight as far as possible Pause at the top and then slowly lower the weight back to the starting position Repeat this movement for your other arm

Sit on your hips with your back straight and legs extended in front of you with your knees slightly bent. Hold the cable bar over your knees with an overhand grip and your hands are placed shoulder-width apart. Pull the bar towards your chest by folding your arms and taking your elbows past your back. Return to the initial position by straightening your arms, and then repeat.

name_en: Cable Seated on Floor Row with Rope
description_en: Sit on the floor and extend your legs out in front of the cable machine Grab the rope with both hands and lean back slightly Pull the cable towards your abdomen Pause and squeeze your back muscles Extend your arms back to starting position

Sit on a bench and attach a rope attachment to a cable machine, the pulley should be above your head Grab the rope with both hands, arms stretched straight and angle between them must be 90 degrees to the floor Slowly curl the rope down by bending your elbows without moving your upper arms Sustain the movement at the peak contraction of the biceps for a second Slowly and controlled, return to the starting position

Sit at a low pulley cable station with a straight bar or EZ bar attached. Grab the bar with an underhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart. While keeping your elbows stationary, curl the bar towards your forehead. Pause briefly at the top of the lift. Slowly return the bar to the starting position, feeling the tension in your biceps.

Sit at a low pulley row machine with a handle in each hand Bend over slightly from the hips and position your hands at shoulder level Pull both handles back towards your body, keeping your elbows straight Return the handles back to the initial position in a controlled manner Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Sit at a low pulley row and grab a handle with each hand Pull the cable towards your body until your hands are in line with your shoulders Hold for a moment and squeezing your shoulder blades together Lower the handles back down to the start position in a slow and controlled manner Repeat

Sit at a low pulley cable station and hold the cable bar with an overhand grip. Start with your arms fully extended and shoulders down. Pull your shoulder blades down and back, contracting your trapezius muscles. Hold for a moment and then slowly return to the starting position. Repeat for several repetitions.

Sit on a bench with your back straight, knees bent, and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward and extend your arms to hold the cable bar with your palms facing inward. Pull the bar towards your abdomen while leaning back, folding your arms, and taking your elbows past your back.

Sit at the cable row station with your feet on the platform and knees slightly bent. Grab the cable attachment with both hands and lean back slightly. Pull the handles towards your abdomen while keeping your back straight. Return to the starting position in a controlled fashion.

Sit down at a cable row station with your feet on the platform. Reach forward to grab the cable handle, keeping your back straight. Pull the handle towards your abdomen, keeping your elbows close to your body. Slowly return the handle back to the starting position, extending your arms fully. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Sit at a cable station with your feet placed on the footrests and bend your knees slightly Grab the V-bar handle with a firm grip and retract your shoulder blades Pull the handle towards your abdomen while keeping your back straight Pause for a second as you squeeze your back muscles Slowly extend your arms back out to the starting position

Sit on the cable row machine, feet on the footrests and grip the handle Pull the cable towards your waist while keeping your back straight Hold for a moment and then slowly return the handle to the starting position Repeat this for the recommended amount of repetitions Switch arms and repeat the exercise

Sit on the seat with one foot on the footpad and the other on the ground Extend your leg out in front of you, straightening the knee Hold for a moment at peak contraction Slowly return back to the starting position

Sit on a bench with your back straight, knees bent, and feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms forward to hold a straight bar with an underhand grip and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Pull the bar towards your abdomen while folding your arms and taking your elbows past your back. Return to the initial position slowly and then repeat.

Sit at a low pulley cable station and secure your feet on the platform. Grab the handle with an underhand grip, pulling your shoulders back and chest up. Pull the handle towards your waist, keeping your elbows close to your body. Return to the start position in a slow and controlled manner. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Sit on the floor near a cable machine Hold the cable machine's handle and position yourself in a way that there is a tension in the cable Rotate your waist to your right while pulling the handle of the cable toward your left waist Hold this position for a few seconds Repeat the process, but this time, rotate to your left

Sit down on the machine and place your feet on the provided foot rests Grasp the cable handle with both hands in a wide grip Pull the handle towards your waist keeping your torso stationary Slowly let the handle return to the starting position

Sit at the machine with your knees bent and feet on the platform. Lean forward to grasp the wide-grip bar with an overhand grip. Sit back with your arms extended and keep your back straight. Pull the handle towards your waist while squeezing your shoulder blades and keeping your torso stationary. Slowly return to the starting position.

Stand perpendicular to the cable machine Grasp the handle with your near hand, keeping your elbow at 90 degrees Slowly rotate your forearm outward, away from your torso Return to your initial position in a controlled manner

Adjust the cable machine to chest height. Turn sideways and hold the handle with the hand closest to the machine. Bend your elbow at a right angle, rotate your shoulder inward, and pull the cable across your body. Return slowly to the starting position. Repeat on the other side if desired.

Stand side-on to the cable tower with the handle attached at waist height Hold the handle with the hand closest to the cable Keep your elbow close to your body, and rotate your forearm across your body Hold momentarily, then return to the start position Repeat the motion for the desired number of reps, then switch to the other arm

Stand in front of a cable machine, with the pulleys set at the lowest. With your palms facing forward grab the cables. Press the cables straight up until your arms are fully extended. Slowly lower the cable handles back to the starting position. Repeat the movements for desired sets and reps.

Stand between two low pulleys holding two handles, palms facing each other Extend your arms to press the handles above your head until your arms are fully extended Pause briefly at the top before slowly lowering the handles back to shoulder level Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand upright and grab the cable bar with both hands. Keep your arms straight and shoulders relaxed. Raise your shoulders towards your ears, squeezing at the top. Slowly lower your shoulders back to the starting position. Repeat for desired number of repetitions.

Stand in front of a cable machine with your feet shoulder width apart Hold the cable handles, with your arms fully extended, and shoulders relaxed Shrug your shoulders up towards your ears, keeping arms straight Hold this position briefly before slowly lowering your shoulders back down Repeat for the desired amount of reps

Stand straight next to the cable machine, handle attached at shoulder height Grab the cable handle with the hand closest to the machine Bend your torso sideways away from the machine Hold for a few seconds Return back to the starting position

Stand upright next to a high pulley cable with your feet shoulder-width apart Hold the cable handle in both hands at shoulder height Bend your waist to the side, away from the machine, keeping your back straight Use your obliques to lift the weight back to the starting position Repeat for desired reps then switch sides

Stand straight next to the cable machine, feet hip-distance apart Hold the cable handle with closest hand to the machine Bend your waist towards the machine then return to the start position Repeat the same process on the other side after doing the desired reps Keep this movement slow and controlled throughout the workout
Stand between the cable machines with a handle in one hand Pull the handle across your body, keeping your arm straight Return to the start position in a controlled manner Repeat with the other arm

Stand in front of the cable machine and grab the handle with one hand Pull the cable towards your body while keeping your elbow close to your side Squeeze your back muscles when the handle comes near your torso Slowly return the handle back to the start position

name_en: Cable Single Arm High Row with Chest Support
