description_en: Position yourself on the chest support pad while holding the handle of the cable machine Pull the handle towards your body until your elbow is at a 90 angle Pause for a second at the top of the movement Slowly return to the starting position while controlling the resistance Repeat for the desired number of repetitions and then switch arms

name_en: Cable Single Arm High Scapular Row
description_en: Attach a single handle to the high pulley of a cable station Stand perpendicular to the cable machine with feet shoulder-width apart With your free hand on your hip, pull the handle towards your body, moving from a high to low position Hold the contracted position momentarily then slowly return to the start position Repeat for desired reps and switch sides for symmetry

name_en: Cable Single Arm Low Scapular Row
description_en: Stand upright facing the cable machine and hold the handle with one hand Keep your back straight and pull the handle towards your lower abdomen Squeeze the shoulder blades as you pull back your elbow Slowly return the handle to the start position and repeat

name_en: Cable Single Arm Neutral Grip Front Raise
description_en: Stand upright and grab the handle attached to the low cable pulley with your left hand Keep your arm straight and raise it forward and upward until it is parallel to the floor Pause for a second at the top, then slowly lower the handle back down to the starting position Repeat the movement for your desired number of reps Switch to your right hand and repeat the steps

Stand in front of a high pulley with a rope attachment Grip one end of the rope with one hand, underhand grip Pull the rope down until your arm is fully extended by your side Slowly return back to the starting position Repeat movement with the other arm

name_en: Cable Split Stance Single Arm Row
description_en: Start by standing sideways to the cable machine, one foot in front of the other in a split stance Grasp the handle using one hand, arm fully extended Pull the handle towards your upper abdomen region Hold the position briefly, then lower your arm back to starting position Repeat steps for a set amount of repetitions, then switch to the other side

Stand in front of the cable machine, grab the rope attachments with both hands Squat down while keeping your back straight Pull the rope towards your body while rising from the squat position Slowly return to the starting position in a controlled movement Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand in front of a low pulley cable machine, feet shoulder width apart Grab the cable bar with both hands Squat down slightly and curl the bar towards your chest Hold the contraction for a second Slowly lower the bar back to the initial position

Stand side on to the pulley machine with your feet shoulder-width apart Hold onto the cable with the hand furthest away from the machine Keep your arm straight and pull the cable across your body to the opposite side Slowly return the handle back to the starting position maintaining a slight resistance Repeat for a set number of reps then switch sides

Stand in front of a cable machine and attach a straight bar to the machine's low pulley Grab the bar from behind with your palms facing up Flex your wrist and curl upwards as far as possible Pause briefly at the top of the movement Slowly reverse the motion, extending your wrist until your forearm is fully flexed

Stand in front of a cable machine with the cables set to chest height Grab the handles and step forward to create tension Press the cables directly out in front of you, extending your arms fully Slowly retract your arms back to the initial position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand up straight in front of a cable machine, holding a cable in each hand at chest height Push both cables forwards until your arms are fully extended Slowly return your hands to your chest in a controlled motion Keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise Repeat the motion as recommended

Stand slightly bent over, facing the cable machine, feet shoulder-width apart Hold the cable attachment with both hands, arms should be fully stretched out Pull the cable attachment towards your belly, squeezing your shoulder blades together Pause for a second then return to the starting position Repeat for the desired amount of repetitions

Stand in front of a cable station with a bar attached at chest height Hold the bar with both hands and extend your arms until they are fully extended Bend your elbows to return the bar to the starting position in a controlled fashion Repeat for the desired number of reps

name_en: Cable Standing Cross over High Reverse Fly
description_en: Stand in between a cable crossover machine with the pulleys set to the highest setting Hold the handles with your arms extended and a slight bend at the elbows Pull the handles down and across your body until your hands meet Return to the starting position in a controlled motion Repeat the movement for reps

Start by selecting the resistance on the machine. The resistance should be enough to challenge you but not so much that it compromises your form Grasp the handles of the rope and with your back facing the machine, move a few steps forward Bend at the waist and stabilize your lower body while keeping your arms straight above your head Perform a crunch by bending at the waist and bringing your elbows down to your thighs Return to the starting position by slowly extending your waist and lifting your upper body

Stand facing the cable machine with the rope attachment at the highest position With each hand on an end of the rope, bend your torso forward while contracting your abdominal muscles Continue bending until your elbows meet your thighs or the contraction can't go further Hold the position briefly, then slowly return to the starting position Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Stand in front of the cable machine, feet shoulder-width apart Grab the rope attachment with overhand grip, getting into a half-squat position Pull the rope towards your face, while keeping your elbows high Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position

Stand in front of a cable machine, grab the rope two-handedly Pull the cable towards your forehead, keeping your elbows higher than your hands Return the rope in a controlled manner to the start position Repeat for the number of desired repetitions

Stand between two low pulleys, hold the handles with palms facing forward Extend your arms out to your sides while keeping your elbows slightly bent Bring the handles together in a hugging motion until they meet in front of your chest Pause, then slowly lower the weights back to the starting position Repeat the motion until you've completed your set

Stand in front of the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart Grab the cable with one hand and keep your arm straight in front of you Raise your arm until it is parallel to the ground Hold this position for a second Slowly lower your arm back down to the original position

name_en: Cable Standing High Cross Triceps Extension
description_en: Stand in the middle of a cable cross machine, holding a high cable handle in each hand Keeping your upper arms stationary, extend your arms straight down by your sides Pause briefly at the bottom, then slowly return to the start position Repeat for the desired number of reps Switch sides and repeat the exercise

Attach the ankle strap to a low cable pulley and attach it to your ankle. Facing the pulley, take a step back to increase tension in the cable. Keep your back straight, thighs together and extend the cabled leg backwards in a controlled manner. Return the leg forward to the starting position. Repeat for desired number of reps, then swap legs.

Attach the ankle strap to a low pulley at the cable station and secure it around your ankle Stand facing the machine and hold onto the handle for support Extend your leg backward without bending your knee Hold for a second at the top of the move, then slowly lower back to the start position Switch legs and repeat

Stand in front of a low pulley with a cable attached to your waist. Place your feet a little wider than shoulder width apart. Lean slightly forward and keep your knees slightly bent. Drive your hips forward whilst squeezing your glutes until you're standing upright. Slowly retract back into the starting position.

Stand close to a cable machine, grab a straight bar attachment with palms facing up Curl the bar towards your shoulders, keeping the elbows fixed at your sides Hold the contraction at the top for a second Slowly release the bar back down to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of sets and reps

Start in a standing position facing the cable machine, holding a cable bar with a shoulder-width grip Keeping your elbows stationary, curl the bar up towards your chest Contract your bicep muscles at the top of the movement Lower the bar back to the starting position Repeat the movement for the set number of repetitions

Stand in front of a high pulley, grasping the straight bar with a shoulder width grip Pull the bar down until it's approximately level with your chin Return the bar slowly to the original position, extending your arms fully Keep your body still, only your arms should move Repeat the exercise for the desired amount of repetitions

Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart Hold the rope with both hands, palms facing each other Keep your elbows close to your body and pull the rope downwards towards your thighs Hold at the bottom, then slowly release and let the cable pull your arms up to the starting position

Position the cable at the lowest point and attach an ankle strap to it Stand facing the cable machine with your feet hip-width apart Fasten the ankle strap to your working leg and place the non-working leg on to the ground for stability Keeping your torso straight, bring your heel towards your glutes in a controlled fashion Lower your leg back to the original position and repeat

Position yourself sideways to the cable machine and grab the cable with both hands Pull the cable across your body and lift it up to shoulder level Hold for a moment and then lower the cable back down Repeat this for the desired number of reps Switch sides and repeat the same motion

Stand between two cables set at shoulder height Grasp the handles with a neutral grip and take a step forward Extend your arms out to the sides and slightly forward Draw your hands towards each other while keeping your elbows slightly bent Return your arms to the starting position in controlled manner

name_en: Cable Standing One Arm Face Pull
description_en: Stand straight in front of the cable machine, with the pulley at high position Grab the single handle attachment of the cable machine with one hand Pull the handle towards your face, while keeping your elbows high Hold for a moment, then return to starting position Repeat, then switch your arms

name_en: Cable Standing One Arm Serratus crunch
description_en: Stand next to the cable machine with your side facing the machine Hold onto the cable handle with the arm closest to the machine Pull the cable towards your waist while focusing on contracting your oblique muscles Slowly return to the starting position Switch sides and repeat

name_en: Cable Standing One Arm Tricep Pushdown
description_en: Stand up straight facing the cable machine Grab the cable with one hand using an overhand grip Keep your elbow close to your body and push the cable down until your arm is fully extended Slowly return your hand to the starting position Repeat the exercise with the other arm

name_en: Cable Standing One Arm Triceps Extension
description_en: Stand next to the cable machine, feet shoulder-width apart Grab the handle of the low pulley with one hand Keep your elbow close to your body and extend your hand down Contract your triceps as you fully extend your arm Give a brief pause, then return the handle back to the starting position

name_en: Cable Standing One Arm Triceps Extension
description_en: Stand in front of a high pulley with a rope or handle attached Grasp the cable attachment and pull the cable down to position your hand next to your head Extend your arm until it is fully extended Return your hand back to the position near your head Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching arms

name_en: Cable Standing One Leg Calf Raise
description_en: Stand up straight while holding the cable handles with your palms facing your body. Lift your one foot off the floor. With the heel of your other foot, push off the floor and raise your body upwards. Hold the position for a sec and then lower your body back down in a slow and controlled motion. Switch legs and repeat.

Face the cable machine and grab the rope with palms facing inwards Pull the rope towards your chest, keeping your elbows high Squeeze your shoulder blades together as you pull Return to the starting position in a slow and controlled manner Repeat for desired reps

Stand a few feet away from the cable machine, holding the rope with palms facing each other Pull the rope back towards your stomach, keeping your back straight Pause when your elbows are at their maximum bend, feeling the contraction in your back Return to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat for the prescribed number of repetitions

Stand facing the cable machine with the bar attachment at thigh level With palms facing down, hold the bar slightly less than shoulder width apart Slowly curl the bar up towards your chest without moving your elbows Hold this position for a moment Lower the bar back to the starting position in a controlled way

Stand up straight with a cable bar held at shoulder width. Initiate movement by flexing at the elbows, pulling your hands toward your shoulders. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze your biceps. Slowly return to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat the exercise for your desired number of repetitions.

Stand straight in front of the cable machine, feet shoulder-width apart Grab the cable handle with extended arms Pull the handle toward your abdomen, keeping your elbows close to your body Hold for a moment, then return to the starting position Repeat for the desired reps

Stand in front of the cable machine and grasp the handle with both hands Bend slightly at the waist and pull the handle towards your waist using your obliques Hold the position for a brief moment and then return to the starting position Repeat the action for the set number of repetitions Repeat on the other side for balance and symmetry

Stand upright next to the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart Hold the cable handle with your arm bent at a 90-degree angle and your elbow at your side Rotate your arm outward, keeping your elbow stationary Slowly return your arm to the original position Repeat the movement with the other arm

Stand next to the cable machine with your feet shoulder width apart Grasp the handle and pull it across your body to the opposite side Slowly return the handle back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching to the other arm Make sure your arms and torso stay straight throughout the movement

Stand in front of a low pulley cable with your feet shoulder-width apart Grasp the handle with your palm facing your torso Keeping your back straight, pull the cable towards your chest Hold for a moment, then slowly return the handle to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Cable Standing Squeeze Upper Chest Press
description_en: Stand in the middle of the cable machine, grab the handles with both hands Bring your hands together in front of your chest Press your hands forward, keeping the arms at chest level Slowly return your arms back to the starting position Repeat the movement for the set

Stand facing the cable machine with the rope attached at chest level Grasp the rope ends with an underhand grip (palms facing up) Pull the rope towards your face, keeping your elbows high Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement Slowly return to the starting position, allowing the cable to gently pull your arms and shoulders forward

Attach a single-grip handle to each of the high-pulley cables. Stand in the middle of the machine, about one step forward. Keeping your arms slightly bent, pull the handles down and across your body until your hands touch, Return your arms back to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Stand in the middle of the cable machine Hold the handles of the upper cables and step forward to create tension Bring the cables down and cross them in front of your body Slowly bring the handles back up Repeat the movement

Stand tall with your back straight and take a step forward. Open your arms wide just above the shoulder level holding the cables with your palms facing forward. Pull the cables by bringing the arms close while lowering them over your thighs. As your arms come close to each other, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand facing the cable machine, holding the handle or rope attached to the lower cable Keep your arms straight and curl your wrists towards your body Pause for a moment at the top, squeezing your forearms Slowly extend your wrists back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand close to the cable machine and attach a straight bar to the bottom setting Hold the bar with a double overhand grip and your arms fully extended Curl your wrists upwards, keeping your arms still Pause, then slowly lower your wrists back to the starting position Repeat the exercise for desired repetitions

Stand straight facing the cable machine Keep your arms fully extended in front of your body Grip the cable bar with both hands tightly Roll the wrists slowly and as far as possible Slowly unroll your wrists back to the starting position

name_en: Cable Stiff Leg Deadlift from Stepbox
description_en: Stand on a step box and hold a cable machines bar with your hands Keep your legs slightly bent, back straight, and lift your torso to the starting position Lower your torso towards the floor by bending at the hip Keep lowering until you feel a stretch on the hamstrings Lift your torso back to the initial position while squeezing your glutes

Stand in front of a high pulley with a straight bar attached Extend your arms and hold the bar with an overhand grip Pull the bar down to your thighs while keeping your arms straight Slowly return to the starting position

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the bar by extending your arms overhead with an overhand grip and your hands shoulder-width apart. Pull the bar towards your thighs while keeping your arms straight. Return to the initial position slowly and then repeat.

Stand in front of a high pulley with a rope attachment Grasp cable rope attachment and lower the rope until your arms are fully extended by your sides Pull the rope downwards towards your thighs while keeping your arms straight Return to the starting position in a controlled manner

Stand with feet shoulder width apart in front of a high pulley cable Grip the cable bar with your arms fully extended forward Pull the bar down towards your thighs in a slow and controlled motion Return the bar back to starting position This makes one repetition

Position yourself standing in front of the cable machine with your feet shoulder width apart Grasp the bar/s with your hands slightly wider than shoulder width Keeping your arms completely straight, pull the bar down to your thighs Slowly return the bar to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit at a low pulley cable station with a V-bar attached. Plant your feet securely against the platform Keep your torso upright and pull the handles towards your abdomen Pause and squeeze your back muscles when the handles reach your body Slowly return the handles to the starting position, allowing your muscles to fully stretch Repeat the exercise for the recommended number of repetitions

Sit down on the machine, extend your legs and get a grip on the cable attachment Pull the cable attachment towards your waist while keeping your back straight Hold for a moment when you feel a contraction in your back muscles Release the cable attachment back to the starting position in a controlled motion Continue this process for the desired set of repetitions

Stand facing away from the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart Reach between your legs to grab the handle Pull the handle through your legs by forcefully contracting your glutes, keeping your spine neutral Slowly return the cable handle between your legs

name_en: Cable Supported Single Leg Hamstrings Concentration Curl
description_en: Stand in front of the cable machine and attach the cable to your ankle Shift your weight onto your standing leg and slightly bend it for stability Slowly curl your leg up to your buttock, keeping your upper leg stationary Hold the position for a moment, then slowly return to the start position Repeat the motion for the desired amount of reps and switch sides

name_en: Cable SZ bar Close Grip Curl
description_en: Stand in front of a low pulley with a close grip on the handle Keep your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent Curl the handle towards your chest while keeping your elbows close to your body Squeeze your biceps at the top Slowly return to starting position

Stand tall with a straight back and take a step forward. Grab an Ez bar in your hands by extending your arms overhead with bent elbows, and lean forward. Pull the bar forward by straightening your arms. As your arms are fully extended, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand with feet at hip-width distance Hold the bar with an overhand grip Bring the bar down until it's parallel with your body, contracting your triceps Return to the starting position by gradually releasing the bar Repeat for desired number of reps

Stand in front of the pulley machine. Grab the V-bar with an overhand grip. Keep your elbows close to your body, push the bar down until your arms are fully extended. Pause for a second then slowly bring the bar back up to the initial position. Ensure that only your forearms are moving. The elbows should remain stationary. Repeat the routine for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Stand in front of a high pulley with a v-bar handle attached Reach out and grasp the v-bar with an overhand grip While keeping your elbows close to your body, push the v-bar down until your arms are fully extended Hold the contracted position briefly before you start to bring the v-bar back up to the starting position Repeat the motion as needed

name_en: Cable Triceps Push Down Elbow Out
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the V bar in front of your chest with bent arms, and elbows spread wide at your sides. Pull the bar down by straightening your arms. As your arms are fully extended, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Cable Triceps Push Down Ez Bar
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the EZ bar in front of you with an overhand grip, arms bent at a 90-degree angle, and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Pull the bar down by straightening your arms. As your arms are fully extended, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Cable Triceps Push Down Ez Bar Close Grip
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the EZ bar in front of you with an overhand grip, arms bent at a 90-degree angle, and hands placed close to each other. Pull the bar down by straightening your arms. As your arms are fully extended, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Cable Triceps Push Down Ez Bar Wide Grip
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the EZ bar in front of you with an overhand grip, arms bent at a 90-degree angle, and hands placed wider than your shoulder width. Pull the bar down by straightening your arms. As your arms are fully extended, return to the initial position and repeat.

Start by setting up a cable machine with a high pulley attachment Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, your hands should be shoulder width apart In a kneeling position, keep your elbows tucked snugly to your torso Exhale and push the bar down until your arms are completely straight Inhale and return the bar back to the starting position in a controlled motion

name_en: Cable Triceps Push Down Straight Bar
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab a straight bar in front of you with an overhand grip, arms bent at a 90-degree angle, and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Pull the bar down by straightening your arms. As your arms are fully extended, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Cable Triceps Push Down V Bar
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab a V bar in front of you with your elbows near the torso and arms bent at a 90-degree angle. Pull the bar down by straightening your arms. As your arms are fully extended, return to the initial position and repeat.

Attach the pulley to the low cable and place a mat close to the cable. Lie on your back on the mat, and reach overhead to grab the cable handle, keeping arms slightly bent. Pull your knees towards your chest, while contracting your abs. Slowly lower your legs back down to the initial position. Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions.

name_en: Cable Twin Handle Parallel Grip Lat Pulldown
description_en: Sit on the lat machine with your body upright and secure your knees under the pad. Grasp the handles with each hand, using the parallel grip. Pull the handlebars down to your upper chest while maintaining a slight arch in your back. Return the handles up until your arms and shoulders are fully stretched. Repeat the exercise for your desired number of repetitions.

Start by setting the cable to the highest point. Stand next to the machine, grab the handle with both hands and step away from the tower. Twist your torso downward, keeping your arms extended and bring the handle to your opposite knee. Slowly reverse the movement and return to the starting position. Repeat for desired number of reps, then switch sides.

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart facing the cable machine Hold the handle and bring it to your chest, keep your elbows close to your body Twist your torso up and to the right and then down and to the left Reverse motion back to start Repeat for desired repetitions and then switch sides

Stand straight and position yourself between two cable machines Extend your arms completely and grasp the cables Pull both cables downwards, diagonally across your body in a twisting motion Return to your initial position in a controlled manner Repeat the movement with the other side

Stand tall with your back straight and feet placed wider than your shoulders. Rotate your torso towards your right and extend your arms overhead to hold the cable's handle by clasping your hands. Pull the cable by twisting towards the other side while lowering your hands towards your left thigh. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet placed wider than your shoulders. Rotate your torso towards your right and extend your arms to shoulder height to hold the cable's handle by clasping your hands. Pull the cable by twisting towards the other side along with your arms. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand side-on to the cable machine with the handle at your chest level Hold the handle with both hands straight out in front of you Twist your torso away from the machine, keeping your arms straight Return to the starting position Repeat the process on the opposite side

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the cable handle with both hands with an overhand grip. Twist your torso towards one side, pulling the cable across your body. Slowly return to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat the movement on the other side. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet placed wider than your shoulders. Lower your hips, bend your knees slightly, and hold the cable in your right hand near your shoulder with your palm facing inwards. Pull the cable by extending your arm overhead, straightening your legs, and rotating your torso towards the other side. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand between two low pulleys with a cable in each hand Raise your arms to shoulder height, holding the cables away from your body in a 'T' shape Twist your body as you press one cable diagonally overhead, keeping the other arm stationary Return to your original position and repeat on the other side Keep alternating between sides for the duration of your set

Stand sideways next to a cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart Hold the cable handle with your near hand and pull towards you, rotating your torso Use your lat muscle to pull the cable towards you, bending your arm slightly Return to the starting position in a steady motion Switch sides and repeat

Stand tall in a stepping position and lean forward while bending your knees. Place your left hand on your knee, and hold the cable in your right hand by extending your arm forward with your palm facing downwards. Pull the cable by folding your arm while taking your elbow in and twisting your forearm outwards to bring your palm side up.

Sit down at the cable machine and adjust the thigh pads to your height Grasp holds of the bar with underhand (palms facing up) grip Lean back slightly and pull the bar down to your chest Hold for a second at the bottom while squeezing your back muscles Return the bar back to the starting position in a slow, controlled manner

Stand up straight in front of a cable machine with a D-Handle attached at the low position Hold the D-Handle with your palm facing forward Curl the handle towards your shoulder while keeping your upper arm stationary Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position

Stand between the cable machines, adjusting them to a high position Hold a handle in each hand with arms spread out at shoulder level Pull the cables in a downward sweeping motion until your hands meet in front of your body Pause at the end of the motion before slowly returning to the start position Repeat for desired number of reps

Stand tall with your back straight and take a step forward. Open your arms wide by your sides and hold the cables with your palms facing forward. Pull the cables by bringing your arms close and extending them overhead. As your hands come close, return to the initial position and repeat.

Position the cable machine at its lowest setting. Stand upright and grab the cable handle with both hands, palms facing your body. Pull the cable handle upwards towards your chin along the front of the body, keeping your elbows high. Slowly lower the cable handle back to the starting position, in a controlled manner. Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.

Attach a straight bar to a low pulley cable machine Stand upright and grasp the bar with hands slightly less than shoulder-width apart Pull the bar directly upward until it is in line with your chin, keeping it close to your body Return the bar down to the starting position in a slow and controlled manner Repeat the process for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Cable Upright Row With EZ Bar
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold an EZ bar near your thighs with an overhand grip, and your hands are placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the bar towards the chest by folding your arms and bringing your elbows above your shoulders. As the bar reaches the chest, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Cable Upright Row With Straight Bar
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a straight bar near your thighs with an overhand grip, and your hands are placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the bar towards the chest by folding your arms and bringing your elbows above your shoulders. As the bar reaches the chest, return to the initial position and repeat.

Sit down at a pulldown station and grab the wide bar with an overhand grip that's beyond shoulder-width Lean back slightly and pull the bar down to your upper chest Pause and slowly return the bar back to the starting position Keep your torso stationary throughout the exercise Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Cable Wide Grip Rear Pulldown Behind Neck
description_en: Sit at a cable station with a wide bar attached to the top pulley. Stand or kneel if needed. Reach up and grip the bar with palms facing forward, hands spaced wider than shoulder width. Pull the bar down to your neck while keeping your back straight. Hold for a moment, then slowly return to the starting position. Repeat this action for as many reps as needed.

Position yourself in front of the cable machine, standing in a way that the cable is in front of your body Grasp the cable bar with palms facing upwards Using your wrist, curl the bar as high as you can while keeping your forearm against your thighs Hold for a second, then slowly lower the bar back to the initial position Repeat for desired reps

Sit on a bench with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab a cable bar with an underhand grip just ahead of your knees while placing your elbows on your thighs. Pull the bar by curling your wrists towards the forearms,  and hold for a while.

Stand between a double cable station, with the stirrups attached to the low pulleys Reach down and grab both stirrups, your palms should be facing inwards Keep your arms straight and raised the stirrups overhead in a 'Y' shape Pause for a second at the top Lower your arms in a controlled movement back to the starting position

name_en: Calf Push Stretch With Hands Against Wall
description_en: Stand arm's length from a wall Position your feet hip-width apart Place your palms on the wall at shoulder height Step one foot back and press that heel into the floor Keep your back leg straight and lean into the wall

name_en: Calf Push Stretch With Hands Against Wall
description_en: Stand tall facing a wall and take a step forward while placing your foot against the wall and keeping your heel on the ground. Place your both hands against the wall with your arms bent and lean forward while keeping your rear leg straight. Press against the wall with your hands and foot to put a stretch on your calves.

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Begin to drop down into a slightly squatted position and then explosively push your body up into a jump While in mid-air, clap your hands under your lifted knee Land softly with your knees slightly bent Repeat the process

Stand tall with your back straight, arms spread wide at your sides, and feet shoulder-width apart. Raise yourself by lifting your heels off the floor and clap by closing your hands. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Raise your body onto the balls of your feet At the top of the movement, clap your hands once Lower your body back down Repeat the movement for the desired amount of reps

name_en: Calf Raise From Deficit With Chair Support
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight, your toes placed on a step, and your hands holding a chair for support. Raise yourself by lifting your heels, and hold for a while. Return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Calf Raise from Deficit with Chair Supported
description_en: Stand on a raised platform, edge of a step or a stairwell, heels hanging over the edge. Hold onto a chair or wall for balance. Lift your body upwards by pressing down through the balls of both feet. Hold at the top of the lift for one to two seconds. Slowly lower your heels down below the platform edge. Repeat the exercise as many times as necessary.

name_en: Calf Raise from Deficit with Chair Supported
description_en: Stand on a small stand or step with your heels hanging off the edge Hold onto a sturdy chair for balance Raise your body upwards by pushing down with your toes and contracting your calves Lower your body back down until your heels are below the step Repeat this motion

Lie down on a leg press machine with your back supported, legs extended forward, and feet placed against the platform. Push the platform forward by using your toes. Hold for a few seconds, return to the initial position, and repeat.

name_en: Calf Raise On Hack Squat Machine
description_en: Get on the hack squat machine with your shoulders fixed under the padded bars, back supported, and feet placed on the platform. Hold the handles of the bars and raise your heels while pushing the bars up. Hold for seconds, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight, arms by your sides, and feet shoulder-width apart. Raise yourself by raising your heel and shifting your weight on the toes. Hold for seconds, lower your heels, and repeat.

Stand upright and place your hands on a wall for balance Lift your heels off the floor and stand on your toes Hold this position briefly Slowly lower yourself back down Repeat for a set amount of reps

Stand upright and face a wall, keeping your hands flat against it for support Keep your feet hip-width apart and slowly rise on the balls of your feet Hold the peak position for a moment Slowly lower yourself back to the ground Repeat the process for your desired number of repetitions

Stand tall facing a wall with your back straight and feet should-width apart. Place your hands on the wall and raise yourself by lifting your heels. Hold for a while, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Calf Stretch With Hands Against Wall
description_en: Stand facing a wall with your hands on the wall at about eye level Place one foot about a step behind your other foot Keeping both feet flat on the floor, bend your front knee until you feel a stretch in the back leg Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds then switch to the other leg Repeat for desired number of sets

name_en: Calf Stretch With Hands Against Wall
description_en: Stand tall facing a wall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Place your hands on the wall with straight arms and step back with your right foot. Take a step back with your right foot and extend your legs straight to put a stretch on the calf muscles. Hold this stretch for a few seconds.

Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you Loop a rope around the ball of your foot Gently pull the rope towards you while keeping your leg straight Hold the stretch for about 30 seconds Release and repeat with the other leg

Sit on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you. Wrap the rope around the ball of one foot, holding onto the ends of the rope. Pull the ends of the rope towards your body while keeping your leg straight. Feel the tension in your calf muscle and hold for about 30 seconds. Repeat the stretch with the other calf.

Lie down on your back with your legs extended in front of you. Pass a rope through the notch of your shoe and hold its ends near your hips. Pull the rope by folding your arms while bending your knee and take your foot towards your shin to put a stretch on your calf. Hold this stretch for a few seconds.

Stand with one foot in front of the other Bend your front knee while keeping your back knee straight and heel on the ground Lean into the wall until a stretch is felt at the back of your calf Hold for 15-30 seconds, then switch to the other leg Repeat this stretch 3-5 times on each side

Stand tall and straight, step one foot back, keeping the heel on the floor Bend the front knee and keep the back leg straight Lean forward until you feel a stretch in your calf Hold for 15-30 seconds then switch legs

Start by stepping on the stairs and plant your front foot nicely on the step. Place your rear toe on the step while keeping its heel unsupported. Lower yourself by dropping your rear heel to stretch your calf. Maintain this stretch for a few seconds.

Lie down on a flat bench, chest down, with the cambered bar under you. While keeping your chest firmly on the bench, grab the bar with your hands facing downwards. Pull the bar upwards towards your chest. Hold this position momentarily before lowering the bar back to the starting position. Repeat this motion for desired repetitions.

Lie on your stomach on a bench with your legs straight. Grab a cambered bar under the bench with your hands double shoulder-width apart and your palms facing backward. Raise the bar by folding your arms and taking your elbows up. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Lie face down on a flat bench with your chest hanging just off the edge Hold the cambered bar with an overhand grip and hang it down straight Pull the bar up to your upper waist Lower the bar back down in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand upright on the captain's chair with your back pressed against the backrest Grip the handholds, keeping your elbows at a 90-degree angle Bring your knees up towards your chest in a smooth motion Hold the contraction at the top for a moment Lower your legs back to the starting position in a slow, controlled manner

Stand tall with your back straight and support your forearms on the padded bars while holding the handles. Raise your feet while folding your legs and bring your thighs parallel to the floor. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and support your forearms on the padded bars while holding the handles. Raise your feet and bring your legs parallel to the floor. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand in a captain's chair frame, grip handles and stabilize your upper body Keep your legs straight and raise them in front until your body forms a 90 degree angle Hold the position for a second Lower your legs back to the starting position Repeat the movements for the desired amount of reps

Sit securely on the captains chair and hold onto the handles, ensuring legs are straight or slightly bent Brace your abdomen, then lift your legs straight up while keeping your torso still Pause for a moment when your legs reach hip height Lower your legs back down in a slow, controlled motion Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall in a stepping position with your back straight and lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. Take your rear foot forward while standing nearly straight, swinging your arms in the opposite direction, and stepping back with your other foot. Quickly return to the former position and repeat.

Start in a standing position, feet hip-width apart. Step forward with your right foot, sinking into a lunge. Push off with your right foot and return to the starting position. Repeat the move with the left leg. Continue to alternate legs for the duration of your workout.

Start on your hands and knees, with your knees hip-width apart and your wrists directly under your shoulders Slowly arch your back downward, while lifting your head and tailbone towards the ceiling for the 'cow' position Hold for a few seconds, then slowly round your spine upwards towards the ceiling, dropping your head and tailbone down towards the floor for the 'cat' position Hold this position for few seconds, then return to the starting 'cow' position to complete one repetition Repeat this sequence at a calm and relaxed pace

Start on all fours, with knees under hips and wrists under shoulders Take a deep breath in and as you do, lower your belly towards the floor and lift your chest and eyes towards the ceiling Breathe out slowly through your mouth, round your spine towards the ceiling, tuck your tailbone under and drop your head Breathe in and return to the starting position Repeat this sequence for your intended sets
Get down on all your four while keeping your arms and back straight. Keep your knees close and hunch your upper back. Maintain this stretch for some time and relax.

Start on all fours, make sure your knees are set directly below your hips and your wrists, elbows and shoulders are in line and perpendicular to the floor As you exhale, round your spine towards the ceiling, keeping your knees and elbows stationary Pause at the top for a few seconds as you draw your abdominal muscles inward As you inhale, come back to a neutral spine position, allowing your belly to fill with air Repeat this movement for a desired number of repetitions

Start on your hands and knees with hands directly under your shoulders and knees directly under your hips. Round your back towards the ceiling, pulling your abdominals to your spine and tucking your tailbone down. Hold this position for five to ten seconds, feeling the stretch in your back and abdominals. Release the pose, letting your belly drop down towards the floor as you lift your head and tailbone up. Repeat this cycle for five to ten times.

Stand up with your feet shoulder-width apart Place your hands lightly on the back of your head Tilt your head back and look towards the ceiling Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds Gently return your head to the starting position

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and look straight ahead Place your hands on your hips Slowly bend backwards, tilting your pelvis and pushing your hips forward as if trying to look at the ceiling Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds Return to the starting position and repeat

Get down on all your four while keeping your arms and back straight. Lean backward while bringing your chest over your feet and place your hands on your calves with your fingers pointing towards your knees. Maintain this stretch for a few seconds and then relax.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and extend your arms forward above your head. Keep your fingers curled in with your thumbs up. Lower your hips while bending your knees and fold your arms while tucking your elbows. Return to the starting position and repeat.
Stand tall with your feet hip width apart Lower into a slight squat position Thrust your hips forward, squeezing your glutes at the top Return to the starting position

Stand tall with feet hip-width apart Bend your knees slightly and push your hips back, keeping your back straight Thrust your hips forward forcefully as if you were jumping Condense your glutes at the top of the movement Repeat the movement

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart, hands clasped in front of your chest. Keep your core engaged and quickly drive your right knee up towards your chest Lower your right knee down and repeat with the left knee. Alternate legs quickly for the duration of your set. Try to maintain a brisk pace and land lightly on your feet.

Start by standing tall with your feet hip-width apart. Swing one knee up towards your chest while simultaneously extending your opposite arm in front of you. Quickly lower your knee back down and return your arm to your side. Repeat with the opposite leg and arm. Aim for height and speed but ensure you maintain good form throughout. Continue alternating legs and keep up a rapid rhythm for about a minute.

name_en: Chair Back Lunge Left Resistance Band
description_en: Stand tall behind a chair holding its back while keeping your feet shoulder-width apart. Tie a resistance band with your leg and the chair's leg. Stretch the band by taking a step backward and lowering your knee to the floor. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Chair Bulgarian Split Squats Bodyweight Left
description_en: Stand 2-3 feet in front of a chair, extend your left leg backward, and rest your toes on it. Stand upright in this position then Lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position, and repeat.

name_en: Chair Bulgarian Split Squats Bodyweight Right
description_en: Stand 2-3 feet in front of a chair, extend your right leg backward, and rest your toes on it. Stand upright in this position then Lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position, and repeat.

name_en: Chair Elevated Single Leg Glute Bridge
description_en: Get down on your back with your knees bent, arms resting by your sides, and feet on the floor. Bring your thighs perpendicular to the floor, place one of your feet on the edge of a chair, and raise your hips off the floor. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat by placing your other foot on the chair.

Get down on your back with your knees bent, thighs perpendicular to the floor, and feet on a chair. Raise your hips off the floor while shifting your weight on the arms. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

name_en: Chair Frog Feet Elevated Glute Bridge Bodyweight
description_en: Get down on your back with your knees bent, thighs perpendicular to the floor, and feet on a chair. Raise your hips off the floor while shifting your weight on the arms. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Sit down on a chair and place your hands on its edge near your hips. Walk your feet out, extend your legs, and lift your hips off the chair while holding the bench. Lower your hips down by folding your arms and bending your knees. As your arms form a 90-degree angle, raise your hips while extending your legs, and repeat.

Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders With a flat back, lower yourself towards the floor Stop when your elbows reach a 90-degree angle, holding your body just off the floor Keep your elbows close to your sides Hold the position for a few breaths before pushing back up to a high plank

Stand upright with a weight in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso Keep your elbows close to your torso at all times Use your biceps to curl the weights while keeping your upper arms stationary Continue to raise the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level Slowly begin to bring the weights back to starting position as your breathe in

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and arms by your sides Engage your core and raise your arms out to the sides, palms facing forward Swing your arms forward, bringing your palms to meet in a clap in front of your chest Immediately swing your arms back out and then bring them behind you as far as comfortable, while keeping your elbows straight Return to the starting position and repeat

name_en: Chest and Front of Shoulder Stretch
description_en: Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms out to your sides and move them backward Press your chest forward and pull your shoulder blades together Hold the position for 15 to 30 seconds Repeat for several sets

Lie flat on your back on a bench Hold your body weight bar slightly wider than shoulder width Lower the weight in a slow, controlled movement to your chest Push the weight back up until your arms are fully extended Repeat this for your desired number of reps

Lie down on a bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet hanging in the air. Hold a barbell over your chest while folding your arms. Raise your chest towards the barbell while lifting your hips a bit and, hold for a while. Lower your chest and repeat.

Place your hands on the bars and raise yourself in the air by straightening your arms on them and curling your feet around each other. Lower yourself while bending your arms and leaning your chest forward. As your feet reach the floor, return to the starting position, and repeat.

Stand on the parallel bars with your arms straight Bend your knees and cross your feet over each other Lower your body by bending your elbows Push your body up, returning to the starting position Repeat the exercise as many times as required

Approach the parallel bars, grip them firmly and lift your body up until your arms are fully extended Lean your body forward slightly and lower yourself by bending your elbows until your chest is on level with your hands Push your body back up to the initial position in a controlled manner until your arms are fully extended again Pause for a second and then repeat the movement for your desired number of repetitions

Hold onto the bars of a dip station, keeping your body at arms length above the bars Lower your body towards the floor while leaning your torso slightly forward Press your body back up, extending your arms Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand between the bars of a chest dip machine and hold the bars by taking your arms past your back with bent elbows. Lean forward, and bend your knees and hips to lift yourself off the floor. Pull yourself up by straightening your arms. As your arms become fully straight, return to the initial position and repeat.

Sit on a bench and place your hands on its edge near your hips. Walk your feet out with your knees bent, and take your hips off the bench while holding the bench with straight arms. Lower your hips down by folding your arms and knees. As your arms form a 90-degree angle, raise your hips and repeat.

Place your hands on the bench behind you Lower your body until your arms form a 90-degree angle Push back up to the starting position, straightening your arms Do not let your hips sink Repeat for desired amount of reps

Stand between the bars of a chest dip machine and hold the bars by taking your arms past your back with bent elbows. Place a dumbbell between your legs and bend your knees and hips to lift yourself off the floor. Pull yourself up by straightening your arms. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand between the bars of a chest dip machine and hold the bars by taking your arms past your back with bent elbows. Place a dumbbell between your legs and bend your knees and hips to lift yourself off the floor. Pull yourself up by straightening your arms slowly. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Get on a chest dip machine and hold the bars by taking your arms past your back with bent elbows. Lean forward, and bend your knees and hips to lift yourself off the floor. Pull yourself up by straightening your arms. As your arms become straight, pause for a while and then return to the initial position.

For Chest Fly: Lie on your back with your knees bent, hold your arms out to the sides in a 'T' shape  Keep your elbows slightly bent and lift your arms above your chest until your hands meet Bring back your arms to the initial position For Press-up: Place hands slightly wider than the shoulder width and push up your body Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor and push your body back up

name_en: Chest fly high to low resistance band
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and place one foot ahead of the other. Hold the cables by extending your hands wide and above shoulder level. Pull the cables down while bringing your arms forward in front of your chest. As your arms come near each other, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Chest fly low to high resistance band
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and place one foot ahead of the other. Hold the cables by extending your hands wide at shoulder level. Pull the cables while bringing your arms forward in front of your chest. As your arms come near each other, return to the initial position and repeat.

Start in a standing position and squat down Push through your heels to jump up and spread your arms out to the sides Land softly to return to the squat position Push yourself up to the standing position and bring your arms in front of your chest Repeat this movement for your desired rep count

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Take your elbows to the shoulder height with your arms bent and palms facing forward. Take your elbows forward and close your hands before your chest while stepping out to one side. Bring the other foot close, return to the former position, and repeat by stepping out to the other side.

Start by standing feet apart, then step to the side with one foot As you step, extend your arms to the sides at shoulder height Close your arms in front of you, squeezing your chest Step back to the initial position as you lower your arms Repeat the movement by alternating sides

Start standing straight with your feet hip-width apart and arms extended at your sides Take a step to the right and simultaneously bring your arms out to your sides and up to shoulder level, like a bird spreading its wings Bring your arms together in front of your chest as you bring your left foot to meet your right Step to the left and open your arms again, then close them as you bring your right foot to meet your left Continue alternating the movement on each side for a desired number of repetitions

Lie down on your back with your knees bent and heels on the floor. Place your hands behind your head. Raise your upper back and rotate your torso to one side. Return to the initial position and repeat by turning towards the other side.

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Place your hands behind your head but don't interlock your fingers Contract your core and lift your upper body off the floor Rotate your upper body to the left, then return to the center and lower Repeat the movement, but to the right this time

Stand or sit upright and extend your arms behind your back Interlock your fingers with palms facing inward Lift your arms upward while keeping your arms straight until you feel a stretch in your chest and shoulders Hold this position for about 10 to 30 seconds Release and repeat

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Take your hands behind your hips and clasp your fingers while keeping your palms up. Raise your arms backward as maximum as you can. Maintain this stretch for a few seconds.

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise your hands straight above your head  Lower your hands straight down in front of you until they reach chest level Raise your hands straight back up to the starting position Repeat this motion

Stand tall with your back straight and place one foot ahead of the other. Hold the ends of the band while bending your arms and opening your elbows wide at shoulder level. Stretch the band while straightening your arms in front of your chest. As your arms come near each other, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Chest press high to low cable resistance band
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and place one foot ahead of the other. Hold the ends of the band while bending your arms and opening your elbows wide at shoulder level. Stretch the band while straightening and lowering your arms forward, in front of your chest. As your arms come near each other, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Chest press low to high resistance band
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and place one foot ahead of the other. Hold the ends of the band while bending your arms and opening your elbows wide at shoulder level. Stretch the band while straightening and raising your arms forward, in front of your chest. As your arms come near each other, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms forward at shoulder height Pull your arms back until your shoulder blades squeeze together Hold for a second and then slowly return to the starting position Repeat this movement for your desired number of reps

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms straight in front of you at chest level Pull your arms back, like you're trying to touch your shoulder blades together Hold for a moment and then slowly return to the starting position Repeat for the recommended number of reps

Stand tall with your back straight and feet wider than your shoulder width. Make fists and bend your arms to a 90-degree angle while keeping your palms inwards. Raise your arms overhead while opening your elbows wide at shoulder level. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise your arms at shoulder level and parallel to the ground Rotate your arms in a circular motion Rotate in both directions for an equal number of times Maintain control and keep your breathing steady throughout the exercise

Get down on all four with a straight back while keeping your hands right under the shoulders and your knees above the hips. Raise one of your arms outward with a bent elbow and place it on an exercise ball. Lower your chest towards the floor by folding your other arm. Return to the initial position and repeat as it comes near the floor.

Start in a regular push-up position Lower yourself down to the floor As you push back up, quickly remove one hand to tap your chest Place your hand back on the floor and continue with a regular push-up before switching hands Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Kneel on the floor, touch your big toes together and sit on your heels Separate your knees about as wide as your hips Exhale and lay your torso down between your thighs as you extend your arms Rest in this position for 30 seconds to a few minutes

Start on your hands and knees Spread your knees wide apart while keeping your big toes touching Rest your buttocks on your heels Sit up straight and lengthen your spine up through the crown of your head On an exhale, bow forward, draping your torso between your thighs

Get down on all your fours while keeping your back straight. Keep your arms straight and your hands shoulder-width apart. Take your hips backward and lower your chest to the floor while keeping your hands in place. Maintain this position for suitable duration and repeat.

Sit back on your heels, forehead resting on the floor Extend your arms in front of you, resting on the floor Rotate your right arm under your left arm, palm up, and extend it to the left side Repeat the step with your left arm under your right, extending towards the right Return to the starting position

Start in a child's pose position with your hands extended forward Push your body up into a high plank position while keeping your abs tight Lower yourself back down into the child's pose in a controlled manner Repeat the movement as per your workout plan

Get down on your fours and lower your chest on the floor while passing through your hands and bending your arms. Raise your hips and take them towards your heels while keeping your hands in place. Maintain this position for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.
Stand or sit up straight Bring your chin down towards your chest gently Hold this position for 20-30 seconds Slowly raise your head back to start position Repeat the process for a few rounds

Sit or stand straight Lower your head forward trying to touch your chin to your chest Hold this position for around 10-20 seconds Slowly lift your head back to the initial position Repeat this motion 3-5 times

Sit or stand upright with good posture Keep your gaze straight ahead Slowly draw your head directly backward Hold for a few seconds, then relax back to the starting position Repeat for a set number of times

Stand with your back against the wall Tuck your chin inwards, bring your head back to touch the wall Hold this position for a few seconds Relax and return to the starting position Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Start by standing or sitting upright. Pull the chin in towards the neck without tilting the head down. Hold this position for a few seconds. Repeat for the number of desired repetitions. Remember to breathe through the exercise.

Start in a hanging position by holding a bar with an underhand grip while your hands are placed shoulder-width apart. Curl your legs over each other to keep your feet off the floor. Take your chest towards the bar by folding your arms. Return to the initial position slowly and repeat.

Step up to the bar and reach up to grip it Pull your body up until your chin is level with the bar, hold position for a period of time for isometric contraction Lower yourself down very slowly to enact the negative part of the exercise Fully extend your arms at the bottom Repeat the movements for the desired amount of reps

Hold a bar with an underhand grip, arms folded, and your chest near it while your hands are placed shoulder-width apart. Keep your legs curled over each. Lower yourself while unfolding your arms slowly. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand under the chin-up bar, reach up and grab it with a shoulder-width apart grip, palms facing away from your body Lift your body up towards the bar until your chin is above the bar Lower yourself in a slow, controlled manner until your arms are fully extended Pause briefly at the bottom, then repeat the motion

Stand under a chin-up bar. Jump or climb up to grip the bar with your hands facing you. Pull up your body until your chin is over the bar. Pause briefly then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position. Repeat the exercise for a number of repetitions or until fatigued.

Start in a hanging position by holding a bar with an underhand grip and your hands placed close to each other Bend your knees to keep your feet off the floor Pull yourself up by folding your arms and take your chin towards the bar Return to the initial position slowly and repeat

Start in a hanging position by holding a bar with an underhand grip and your hands placed shoulder-width apart Bend your knees to keep your feet off the floor Pull yourself up by folding your arms and take your chin towards the bar Return to the initial position slowly and repeat

Start in a hanging position by holding a bar with an underhand grip and your hands placed wider than your shoulder-width Bend your knees to keep your feet off the floor Pull yourself up by folding your arms and take your chin towards the bar Return to the initial position slowly and repeat

Hold the parallel bars with your palms facing each other Pull yourself up until your chin is level with the bars Hold for a moment in the top position Lower yourself back down in a controlled manner Try not to let your body swing during the exercise

Start in a hanging position by holding the bar handles with your palms facing each other. Curl your legs over each other to keep your feet off the floor. Take your chest towards the handles by folding your arms. Return to the initial position slowly and repeat.

Stand under the pull-up bar, and grasp it with your hands close together and palms facing you Pull yourself up until your chin is level with or above the bar Lower yourself back down in a controlled manner Keep your body straight throughout the lift Repeat the movement for your desired number of reps

Stand straight with feet shoulder-width apart Raise your right knee towards your chest At the same time, swing your arms down towards your right knee as if performing a chopping motion Lower your right knee and arms to return to the starting position Repeat with your left knee and then continue alternating

name_en: Circle Arms Knee Raises on Chair
description_en: Sit on the edge of a stable chair, straight back, feet flat on the floor Place your hands on the edge of the chair for support Raise your knees up to waist level in a smooth motion Make a circle with your knees, going clockwise and anticlockwise alternately Lower your feet back to the floor in controlled motion

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Fold your arms and wrists and place your fingertips on the base of your neck. Move your elbows up and down and make circles in the air. Continue for a suitable duration.

Stand straight with your arms extend to each side Slowly rotate your arms in small circles, keeping your palms face down After a set, start rotating in the opposite direction Breathe evenly during the exercise Control the movement without letting your arms drop

Stand up straight and extend your arms to your sides Start making small circular motions forward for 30 seconds to 1 minute Pause and then start making small circular motions in the reverse direction Increase the size of your circles as you gain strength and mobility Lower your arms by your side and relax

Stand or sit with your back straight Extend your arms out to your sides at shoulder height Slowly make small circles with your arms You can change the direction of the circles halfway through your set Gradually lower your arms to rest

Stand straight with feet hip-width apart Raise one foot off the ground, balancing on the other leg Begin to move the lifted foot in a clockwise rotation After a set number of circles, switch direction to counterclockwise Repeat with the other leg

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise one knee as high as you can, making sure to keep your balance Begin to move the knee in a circle, keeping your standing leg bent slightly for balance Complete a few circles in one direction then switch directions Repeat with the other leg

Stand tall with your back straight and your feet placed together. Place your hands on your waist. Make circles with your knees while lowering them to one side and then taking them to the other side while straightening them. Repeat.

Stand tall, feet shoulder-width apart Lift up one knee to waist high, and make a big circle with the knee Switch legs and repeat the same Control the movement for best effect Repeat for the desired number of reps or time

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Step one foot behind you and to the side such that your thighs cross, bending both knees as if you were curtsying Aim to get your back knee touching the floor, keeping your back straight As you stand up straight, jump, bringing your feet together and clapping under your lifted knee Repeat for the desired number of reps on both sides

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and extend your arms overhead while placing your palms over each other. Take a step back with your left foot and place it behind your right leg while lowering your arms to your sides while keeping your palms parallel to the floor. Bend your knees and lower down unless your right thigh is parallel to the floor.

Start by standing tall with your feet together Jump and spread your feet outward while clapping your hands together at the same time above your head Jump again and bring your feet back together while lowering your arms to your sides Repeat the sequence at a fast pace for the desired amount of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight, arms spread wide, and feet shoulder-width apart. Jump and open your legs while bringing your arms forward for a clap. Jump again, close your feet, and open your arms as they were in the starting position. Repeat.

Start in a conventional push-up position with hands shoulder-width apart Lower your body towards the ground, then push explosively from your hands At the top of explodes lift, clap your hands together Immediately put your hands back to the ground and gets ready for the next repetition Try to do as many reps as you can

Start in a traditional push-up position, with your hands shoulder-width apart Lower your body towards the floor by bending your arms Push your body up with enough force to lift your hands off the floor Clap your hands together before landing again in the push-up position Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Get down on your hands and toes with your back straight. Keep your arms and legs straight and lower your chest to the floor by bending your arms. Push through your hands, raise yourself high in the air, and clap. Land back on your hands, return to the starting position and repeat.

Stand facing the padded stool Place one foot on the stool Push off the ground with your other foot and switch your feet in mid-air, landing so your other foot is on the stool Repeat the motion, switching your feet back and forth

Get down on your hands and toes with your back straight. Place your hands shoulder-width apart and keep your arms and legs straight. Place your hands one by one on the padded stool, straighten your arms and align your body straight. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Start by standing in front of a padded stool. Place your hands on the stool while stepping one foot backwards. Pull your torso towards the stool while raising one leg towards your body like you're climbing up. Switch legs and repeat. Continue this action for a set number of repetitions or time.

Start in a high plank position with your hands right under your shoulders and feet together Bend your elbows and lower your body as you would in a traditional push-up Complete the push-up and rotate to your right, shifting your weight onto your left hand as you lift your right hand off the ground and point it toward the ceiling Bring your hand back to the starting position and perform another push-up, then repeat the rotation on the other side

Get down on your hands and toes with your back straight. Keep your arms and legs straight and lower your chest to the floor by bending your arms. Hold for a while, raise your chest by straightening your arms, walk your hands to one side, and perform the same activity. Walk your hands to the former side and keep repeating.

Lie down on a bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab a barbell over the chest with your elbows dipped under the bench, hands placed close, and palms facing forward. Raise the barbell by straightening your arms. As your arms become straight, return to the initial position and repeat.

Grasp the bar with an underhand grip, hands close together Pull your body up until your chin reaches the bar level After a short pause at the top, lower yourself back down slowly Repeat for the desired repetitions

Grab the bar with a slight underhand grip, ensuring the hands are closer than shoulder-width. Slowly pull up your body until your chin clears above the bar. Pause briefly as you squeeze your shoulder blades together. Lower your body to the start position in a controlled manner. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

Stand beneath a pull-up bar with your palms facing you. Reach up and grip the bar, the hands should be slightly closer than shoulder width apart. Pull your body up until your chin is higher than the bar. Hold for a second at the top and slowly return to start position.

Kneel down on the ground and place your hands closer than shoulder-width apart. Keeping your body straight and your head in a neutral position, lower yourself until your chest nearly touches the floor. Push your body up, keeping your elbows close to your body, until your arms are fully extended. Pause for a moment, then lower yourself back to the starting position. Repeat these steps for the desired number of repetitions.

Start in a high plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and knees on the ground Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor Press your body up back to the starting position maintaining a tight core Ensure that your elbows are close to your body throughout the movement Repeat this movement for desired number of repetitions

Get in a high plank position, placing hands closer inward than shoulder-width Lower your body while keeping your back flat until your chest is close to the floor Press your body back up to the starting position Keep your elbows close to your body as you perform the exercise Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Get down into a push-up position on the floor, hands placed narrower than shoulder-width Lower your body towards the floor, keep your body straight Push your body up to the starting position Pause at the top, then lower yourself again Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions

Get down on your hands and toes with your back straight. Place your hands more narrow than your shoulder width and keep your arms and legs straight. Lower your chest to the floor while bending your arms. Hold for a while, raise your chest by straightening your arms, and repeat.

name_en: Close grip Push-up against the wall
description_en: Stand about two feet away from a wall Place your hands on the wall, slightly narrower than shoulder-width apart Lower your body towards the wall by bending your elbows Push your body back until your arms are fully extended Repeat the process

Start in a hanging position by holding a bar with an underhand grip and your hands placed closer than the shoulder width. Bend your knees to keep your feet off the floor. Pull yourself up by folding your arms and take your chest towards the bar. Return to the initial position slowly and repeat.

Stand near a barbell and hold it by leaning forward and bending your knees with your hands wider than your shoulders. Raise the barbell to your knees while raising your hips, then take the barbell to your chest by bringing your elbows under it and straightening your legs. As your legs become straight, return to the starting position and repeat.

Stand on the ground and slightly squat, keeping your hands on the ground Spring from the balls of your feet into the air In mid-air, bring your knees up into your chest and extend your legs to land back on the ground in the starting squat position Repeat this jumping and landing movement for the desired number of repetitions

Get down on your hands and toes, and straighten your back along with your legs. Lower your chest towards the floor while folding your arms, land down on your stomach, and take your chest backwards while straightening your arms. Hold for a while, lower your chest to the floor, raise your body while straightening your arms, and repeat.

Start by lying flat on the floor, face down. Place your hands in line with your chest, similar to traditional push-up position. Push up your upper body while leaving your legs and hip on the floor, arching your back. Pause at the top, then lower yourself back down slowly. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Start in a plank position with your hands on the ground directly beneath your shoulders and your feet hip-width apart Lower your body, bending the elbows until your chest is nearly touching the ground Curl your back upwards, lifting the chest off the ground, while keeping the hips near the ground, similar to a cobra pose in yoga Press through the palms of your hands to extend your arms and return to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Lie flat on your stomach with your palms under your shoulders Press into your palms and lift your chest and abdomen off the floor, stretching your abs Turn your head and upper body to one side, feeling a stretch in the obliques and side abs Return to center and lower your body back to the floor Repeat on other side
