Lie down on your stomach with your legs straight. Place your hands near the sides of your chest while folding your arms. Raise your chest off the floor while straightening your arms and rotate your torso towards your left while raising your left hand a bit. Hold for a while, return to the floor, and repeat while rotating towards your right.

Lie on your stomach with your legs extended and the tops of your feet on the floor. Place your hands under your shoulders keeping your elbows close to your body. Push through your hands to straighten your arms and lift your upper body off the floor. Lift your head up and back, keeping your shoulders down. Hold the pose for 15 to 30 seconds before lowering yourself back down to the floor.

Start by lying flat on your stomach Place your hands underneath your shoulders Engage your core muscles and raise your head and chest by using your back muscles Hold this position as long as you comfortably can Slowly lower your body back to the start position

Start by lying flat on your back, legs extended and arms stretched above your head Bring your knees towards your chest, while simultaneously curling your upper body up without lifting your lower back off the floor Once your body is in a 'curled' position, with your knees close to your chest and your arms around your knees if possible, hold the pose for a few seconds Unroll your body slowly back into the starting position

Lie flat on your back with your legs straight and arms by your sides Raise your legs and torso simultaneously in a controlled motion, bringing your knees towards your chest and reaching your arms around your legs Pause at the top, squeezing your abdomen Slowly lower your legs and torso back down to the initial position Repete the motion for desired number of repetitions

Lie down on your back with your legs straight, and arms extended overhead. Fold your legs, take your knees towards your chest and curl your arms around your knees. Hold this pose for a few seconds, return to the floor, and repeat.

Stand under the pull-up bar with your body oriented perpendicular to it Reach up and grip the bar with one hand in front of the other, fists facing each other Pull yourself up until your shoulder reaches the bar Lower yourself back down in a controlled manner Repeat the process, alternating the leading hand

Stand side faced between a rack and hang on its bar by holding it with a mixed grip. Curl your legs over each other to keep your feet off the floor. Fold your arms and take your head towards one side of the bar. Return to the initial position slowly and repeat while taking your head towards the other side of the bar.

Stand facing the bar and hold it with both hands in a shoulder-width grip. Pull your body up to one side of the bar, twisting your torso slightly as you do so. Lower your body back down in a controlled manner. Repeat the process for the other side. Continue alternating between left and right pull-ups.

Sit on the edge of a flat bench with your legs spread. Place your right arm against your right thigh, your palm facing upwards. Use your off hand to maintain balance if needed. Curl your right hand towards your shoulder in a controlled manner, keeping the rest of your body stable. Lower your hand back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps before switching to your left arm.

Sit on the edge of a bench with your knees bent, and feet open wide on the floor. Lean forward, place one of your elbows on your thigh, hold a dumbbell with an underhand grip, and straighten your arm. Raise it towards the shoulder by folding your arm. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand about two feet away from a corner Extend your right arm and place your hand against one wall Turn your body left and lean forward until you feel a stretch in your chest Hold this position for about 30 seconds before switching to the other side

Begin in a supine position with your legs perpendicular to the ground and arms extended at your sides Keep your abdominal muscles contracted and raise your hips off the ground Balance your weight on your shoulders, slowly lower your legs until they are parallel to the ground Return your legs and hips to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Lie down on your back, raise your legs towards the head, and hold your feet by extending your arms overhead. Release your right leg and take it forward unless it becomes perpendicular to the floor. Place your free hand on your left calf and maintain balance. Hold for a while, return to the starting position, and repeat.

Lie on your back with your legs straight and arms extended at your sides Lift your legs about a foot off the ground Roll your hips and legs to one side, then to the other, making a 'corkscrew' motion Keep your legs together and your movements slow and controlled Return to the starting position and repeat

Grip the bar with palms facing away from you Pull yourself up until your chin passes the bar, moving in a side-to-side fashion At the peak, shift your body weight from one side to the other Lower yourself in a controlled manner to the starting position Repeat the exercise while alternating sides during each pull-up

Stand straight with adequate space around you Lift your right arm and touch your left foot, then return to the starting position Do the same thing with your left arm and right foot Continue this action as quickly as possible, alternating sides Remember to keep your back straight throughout

Stand tall with your back straight and feet wider than your shoulders. Bring your arms forward with palms down. Turn towards one side while pivoting your feet, lowering your hips and raising and lowering your arms alternately. Repeat while turning towards the other side and do the same.

Stand tall, facing a room corner, and spread your arms wide while placing your hands on the walls. Take your chest forward while keeping your feet in place. Maintain this stretch for a while, then relax and repeat.

Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart Descend by flexing one knee and hip, while keeping the other leg straight Squat as deep as possible to your side Keep your weight over the squatting leg Return to the standing position and repeat on the other side

Stand tall with your back straight, open your feet wide and clasp your hands in front of your chest. Lower your hips while bending one of your knees while keeping the other leg straight. Return to the initial position and repeat while lowering your hips to the other side.

Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart Point your toes outwards about 45 degrees Lower your body towards your right side by bending your right knee, keep your left leg straight Push back up to the starting position Repeat on the other side

Start by standing in front of a couch or a bench with your back towards it Bend one knee and place the top of your foot on the couch behind you Slowly sink down until you feel a stretch in the front of your thigh and hip Hold this position for 20 to 30 seconds, then switch to the other leg Repeat the exercise three or four times on each leg

Stand tall on your right foot, curl your left leg to 90 degrees, and extend your arms forward. Lower your hips while bending your right knee, lean forward, and maintain balance by moving your left thigh backward. Hold this position for a while, return to the initial position,and repeat.

Stand with feet hip-width apart and extend arms out in front Bend at the knees and hips to lower the body, similar to a slide on ice Balancing on one foot, reach the other foot diagonally behind your standing leg Return to the starting position by pushing off the standing foot Repeat with the other leg and continue alternating

Start on your hands and knees keeping your wrists directly under your shoulders, and your knees directly under your hips. Inhale as you drop your belly towards the mat. Lift your chin and chest, and gaze up toward the ceiling. Exhale, drawing your belly to your spine and rounding your back toward the ceiling. Repeat in a rhythmic motion.

Start on your hands and knees in a 'tabletop' position Make sure your knees are set directly below your hips and your wrists, elbows and shoulders are in line and perpendicular to the floor As you inhale, lift your sitting bones and chest toward the ceiling, allowing your belly to sink towards the floor Lift your head to look straight forward Exhale, coming back to neutral 'tabletop' position on your hands and knees

Sit on the ground with your feet hip-width apart in front of you and your palms placed behind your hips. Lift your hip off the ground by pressing down with your hands and feet, your body should resemble the shape of a table. Hold this position for 10-30 seconds. Lower your body back down to the ground in a controlled manner. Repeat this 5-10 times.

Begin by sitting on the floor with your hands planted behind you, fingers pointing towards your feet Lift your hips off the floor to come into the crab position Now lift your right hand and left knee to touch them together Return to the crab position and then switch to touch left hand to right knee Continue alternating for desired reps

Sit on the floor with your feet flat and knees bent Place your hands on the floor behind you with your fingers pointing towards your feet Lift your hips off the floor, pressing your hands and feet into the ground Try to achieve a straight line from your head to your knees Hold the position for 10-30 seconds, then gently lower your hips back to the floor

Sit down on your hips with your knees bent and feet on the floor. Place your hands behind your back on the floor and lean backward. Raise your hips off the floor and straighten your back along with your thighs. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Start seated with knees bent, feet flat on the floor and hands placed behind you Lift your hips off the floor into a high bridge Pull one knee towards your chest and then extend the arm opposite of the knee, reaching to touch the toes Return your arm and leg back to the 'high bridge' position Repeat with the other arm and leg

Start in a seated position, hands and feet on the floor Lift your hips off the floor, coming into a 'crab' position Bring one hand to touch the opposite foot, twisting your body Return your hand and foot to the starting position Repeat the movement on the other side

Sit down on your hips with your knees bent and feet on the floor. Place your hands on the floor near your hips and lean backward. Raise your hips off the floor and straighten your back along with your thighs. Raise one of your legs straight in the air and touch it while bringing your opposite hand towards it. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat by switching sides.

Start sitting on the ground with your feet flat and your palms resting behind you Press up through your hands and feet to raise your hips Move forward by taking a step with your right hand and left foot Next, take a step with your left hand and right foot Continue alternating and repeat for the desired repetitions or distance

Start in the plank position with your shoulders directly above your wrists Keeping your core engaged, move your left hand and right foot forward Return to the start position and repeat with your right hand and left foot Repeat the process, alternating sides each time for the desired number of reps

Stand upright with arms extended out to the side Cross your arms in front of your chest Return your arms out to the side Bring your arms back to the crossed position Repeat the movement for the desired repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms with your palms inwards and raise them above your head while crisscrossing them over each other. As they reach above head level, lower them in the same manner and repeat.

Start standing, feet shoulder-width apart, arms reaching out to sides Cross your arms over your chest and then rapidly stretch them out to the sides again Repeat this movement in a rapid, controlled manner for a set time duration Maintain a slight bend in the elbow throughout the exercise Keep your chest lifted and your abs engaged

Start by standing up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and arms at your sides. Raise your arms to shoulder level and move them in a forward circular motion. Then move your arms in a backward circular motion. Repeat these steps in an alternating fashion for a desired number of repetitions. Remember to keep your motions controlled and consistent.

Stand tall and place your hands together in a prayer position at chest level Keep your elbows out to your sides and level with your shoulders Push your palms together as hard as you can for about 20 seconds Relax for 10 seconds Repeat this process

Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart and hands behind your head Raise your right knee towards your left elbow in a cross-body motion Lower back down and repeat on the opposite side, raising your left knee towards your right elbow Keep alternating sides for the duration of the exercise Aim to keep a brisk pace for this aerobic exercise

Stand tall with a broad base and place your hands behind your head. Jump, place your feet across each other, and open them again. Bring one of your knees and opposite shoulder towards each other while folding your leg, and return to the former position. Repeat step 2 and then do the same while bringing your other knee and opposite shoulder close.

Stand tall with a broad base and spread your arms wide. Jump and place your feet across each other while bringing your arms forward over one another. Jump again and return to the initial position. Repeat.

Stand with feet hip-width apart, arms at your sides Jump up, crossing one arm over the other in front of you at chest height, while crossing one foot over the other at the same time Jump again, spreading your arms and legs out wide, forming an 'X' in mid-air Jump once more, this time crossing the other arm and foot over Return to the starting position and repeat

Stand straight with your feet together and arms at your sides Jump into the air spreading your feet apart and crossing your wrists in front of you at the same time Jump again, this time bringing your feet back together and uncrossing your wrists Repeat these moves in a quick succession for a period of time Try to land softly each time to protect your joints

Stand tall with a broad base, open your arms wide, and bend your elbows while keeping your palms downward. Jump and place your feet across each other while bringing your forearms over one another. Jump again and return to the initial position. Repeat.

Stand tall with your chest up and shoulders relaxed Jump up, crossing your feet mid-air Land softly with your feet crossed, bending your knees to absorb the shock Jump up again, uncrossing your feet mid-air Land softly in the initial position

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Jump into the air, crossing your left knee over your right knee and vice versa in a crisscross pattern Land softly on your feet, bending your knees a bit to absorb the impact Immediately jump back into the air, this time crossing in the opposite direction Repeat this rapid criss-cross motion in a cyclical manner

Start in a high plank position Bring your right knee towards your left elbow Return your right foot back to the plank position Repeat with your left knee towards your right elbow Continue alternating sides in a quick motion

Lie flat on your back and keep your hands by your side or under your glutes for support Raise your legs off the ground to a 90-degree angle Cross your right leg over the left one, then alternate Repeat this crisscross motion while keeping your legs raised Continue the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Lie down on your back with your legs extended, arms at your sides, and your hands resting on the floor. Raise your legs straight up while crisscrossing them over each other. As they become almost perpendicular to the floor, lower them down similarly. Continue this for a suitable duration.

Lie flat on your back, place your hands beneath your lower back Raise both legs above your waist, forming a 'V' shape Cross your legs repeatedly in an alternate pattern Lower your legs slowly back to the initial position

Stand in a starting position with feet shoulder-width apart Jump up into the air, while in mid-air cross one leg behind the other Land softly on the ground with the crossed leg in a controlled fashion Immediately hop back while switching legs Repeat the process continuously for your desired amount of time or repetitions

Lie down on your back with your legs extended straight into the air Place your hands behind your head, engage your abs, and lift your shoulders off the floor Twist your upper body to the right as you pull your right knee in as fast as you can Switch sides and repeat on the left side, keeping your core engaged throughout the movement Continue alternating sides for the desired number of reps

Start in a push-up position with your feet shoulder-width apart Begin to 'crawl' by bringing your right knee towards your right elbow, while extending your left arm in front Switch sides and bring your left knee to your left elbow while extending your right arm in front Keep your body parallel to the floor throughout the movement Repeat for the desired number of reps or distance

Stand with your feet hip-distance apart and your arms by your sides Jump your feet out to the side as you bring your right arm up to do a cross body punch Immediately jump your feet back together as you bring your arm back down Again, jump your feet out to the side, but this time do a cross body punch with your left arm Continue alternating each side for the duration of the exercise

Start in a regular push-up position Shift your weight onto your left side and rotate your body Bring your right arm across your torso while lowering yourself slowly Perform the push-up Return to the original position and repeat on the opposite side

name_en: Cross Climber on a padded stool
description_en: Start in a high plank position, hands directly under your shoulders Engage your core, and bring your right knee towards your left elbow Return to the initial plank position Now bring your left knee towards your right elbow Repeat this process in a fast-paced 'climbing' motion

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Place your hands on your chest, raise one of your feet, and extend your leg forward. Return to the initial position, and repeat by extending your other leg.

Stand straight with your arms crossed over your chest Lift one leg up as high as you can comfortably. Lower the leg down in a controlled manner Repeat the motion with the other leg Alternate legs for each repetition

Sit on the ground with your legs crossed, left leg on top. Lean forward at the waist, reaching your hands in front of you. Hold the stretch for 15 - 30 seconds. Switch legs and repeat the stretch. Practice this exercise regularly for best results.

Start in a standing position Jump into a cross position, crossing your right leg in front of your left and your right arm over your left Jump back to starting position Repeat the sequence with your left leg in front and left arm over Continue alternating sides for the duration of your workout

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart and your arms extended straight up Bend forward and diagonally to touch your left toes with your right hand Return to starting position Bend forward and diagonally to touch your right toes with your left hand Return to starting position and repeat

Stand facing a wall, place both hands on the wall, shoulder-width apart Walk back a few steps until your body is at a slight angle Bring your right knee towards your left elbow, and then return to the start position Repeat the same movement with your left knee towards your right elbow Continue to alternate sides for your desired number of repetitions

Stand tall in a stepping position with your back straight, arms hanging by your sides. Lower your rear knee to the floor, and bend your front leg unless its thigh comes parallel to the floor. Rotate your torso towards the front thigh and place your arms across it. Apply stretch on your thigh muscles by lowering your rear knee more, hold for a few seconds and then relax.
Begin by kneeling on the floor Cross your right foot over your left knee Lean forward and bend your left knee Hold the stretch for about 30 seconds Switch legs and repeat

Start in a half-kneeling position with right knee up and left knee down Keep your chest high and back straight Push your hips forward to create a stretch on your left thigh Maintain this position for 15-30 seconds Change sides and repeat the process for the right side

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, lean forward, and bend your knees slightly. Place your hands on opposite knees and stretch your shoulders by pushing your arms against your thighs. Maintain this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arm out to the side and bring your knee up to meet your elbow, crunching your side abs Return to the initial position Repeat on the other side Alternate between sides for the set duration

Start in a stepping position with your back straight and arms hanging by your sides. Crouch forward while bending your front knee and take your arms towards your feet. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart. Bend your knees and lower your body into a squat position. Slowly lean forward and reach your hands to your heel. Gently pull your heel toward your body, you should feel the stretch in your calves. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then relax and stand up straight.

Start by sitting on the bosu ball and roll down until your lower back is centered on it Place your hands behind your head, elbows pointing out Pull your abdomen inward and curl your upper body forward until your shoulders lift off the ball Pause briefly, then slowly lower yourself back Keep your feet, hip-width apart, firmly on the ground throughout
Lie flat on your back with your hands at your sides Raise your legs 90 degrees Contract your abs and raise your upper body towards your knees Lower your upper body back down Lower your legs back down

Lie flat on your back with your legs straight up in the air, creating a 90-degree angle with your torso Place your hands behind your head Engage your core muscles and lift your upper body off the floor towards your knees Hold for a brief moment then slowly lower your upper body back down Repeat for the desired number of reps

Lie flat on your back on the floor with your legs bent at the knees Extend your arms straight forward Lift your upper body towards your knees using your abdominal muscles Slowly lower back to the starting position Repeat the movement for the required number of repetitions

Lie flat on your back with your feet securely put under a bar, knees bent and hands behind your head Exhale as you contract your abs and curl your shoulders towards your pelvis Hold at the top for a second as you feel tension in your abs Inhale as you slowly lower back to the starting position Repeat for the prescribed number of repetitions

Sit on the stability ball with your feet flat on the floor Roll back onto the ball while keeping your thighs and torso parallel to the floor Cross your arms over your chest Curl your upper body forward and crunch your ribs towards your hips Slowly lower your body back down
Lie on your back with your feet on a stability ball Place your hands lightly behind your head Raise your upper body towards your knees using your abs Lower yourself back down

Lie down on your back with your legs bent at the knees Extend your arms straight forward towards your bent knees Engage your core, lift your upper body towards your knees After holding the position, slowly lower your body back towards the floor Repeat the desired amount of repetitions

Sit on the stability ball with your feet flat on the floor Walk your feet forward, letting the ball roll underneath your body until it is under your lower back Cross your arms on your chest or place them behind your head Curl your body up towards your knees, tightening your abs Slowly return to the starting position

Lie down on a Bosu ball with your knees bent and hands placed on your chest. Raise your torso off the ball and bring it towards your knees. Hold for a while, then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

Lie on a stability ball with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Place your hands on your chest, and raise your torso off the ball and take it towards your knees. Hold for a while, then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

Lie down on your back with your legs perpendicular to the floor and arms extended over your shoulders. Raise your torso off the floor and take your hands towards your feet. Hold for a while, then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

Lie down on the bench with your legs bent, feet flat on the ground. Place your hands lightly on either side of your head keeping your elbows in. Curl your upper body all the way up toward your knees without lifting your lower back off the bench. Lower yourself back down in a controlled fashion, until your shoulder blades touch the bench.

Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground Extend your arms overhead Lift your upper body towards your knees, using your abdominal muscles Hold for a moment at the peak of the movement Slowly return to the starting position

Lie on a stability ball with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Place your hands on your chest, and raise your torso off the ball and take it towards your knees. Hold for a while, then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

Lie down on your back with your knees bent, feet on the floor, and hands held together overhead. Raise your torso off the floor and bring it forward with your arms. Hold for a while, then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

Lie down on your back with your knees bent, feet on the floor, and arms resting straight overhead. Raise your torso off the floor and bring it forward with your arms. Hold for a while, then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

Stand against a wall with your back and hips in contact with the wall. Keep your feet shoulder-width apart, about 1-2 feet away from the wall. Place your hands on your head or your chest. Bend forward at your waist as far as you can while keeping your back and hips against the wall. Do not use your hands to pull your head down. Return back to the start position in a smooth controlled movement.

Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground, hip-width apart Place your hands on the back of your head, dont interlock your fingers Pull your belly button towards your spine, and flatten your lower back against the floor Slowly contract your abdominals, bringing your shoulder blades about one to two inches off the floor Exhale as you rise up, and inhale as you lower back down

Position yourself so that your bum and lower back is against a wall Keep your legs bent at a 90-degree angle with your feet flat against the wall Place your hands gently behind your head Slowly lift your upper body towards your knees, while keeping your lower back against the wall Lower yourself slowly back against the wall after the contraction

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Place your hands lightly behind your head Lift your upper body, focusing on contracting your abdominal muscles Hold for a moment, then lower back down Repeat the movement

Lie on your back on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground Place your hands lightly on the back of your head or cross them over your chest Curl your upper body forward, lifting your shoulder blades off the ground Pause at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back to the floor

Lie down on your back with your knees bent, feet on the floor, and hands behind your head. Raise your torso off the floor and take it towards your knees. Hold for a while, then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

Sit down on your hips with your back leaned backward, arms spread wide and legs extended. Bring your chest and arms forward while tucking your knees through your arms. Hold for a while, then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

Lie down on your back with your knees bent, feet on the floor, and hands behind your head. Raise your torso off the floor, raise your knees, and bring them towards each other. Hold for a while, then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

Rest your feet on the bench, knees bent, while laying on the floor Put your hands on either side of your head Lift your upper body slightly off the floor by contracting your abs Hold this position for a moment before lowering back down

Lie down on your back with your knees bent, feet on the floor, and arms extended over your shoulders with a medicine ball between your hands. Raise your upper back off the floor and bring it forward through your arms. Hold for a while, then slowly return to the starting position and repeat.

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and hold the medicine ball with both hands Raise your upper body off the ground and bring the medicine ball towards your knees Hold this position for a moment, then lower back down to the starting position Keep the movement stable and manage controlled breathing

Begin in a seated position on the floor with your hands placed slightly behind you Lift your legs off the floor and lean back slightly, keeping your core tight Simultaneously, pull your knees towards your chest and wrap your arms around your legs Hold for a moment in this 'crunched' position Extend your legs outward and spread your arms wide as if in mid-flight, then revert to the starting position

Start standing straight with your feet hip-width apart Step your right foot diagonally behind you and lower your right knee until it almost touches the floor As you lunge, reach your right hand to your left foot and your left hand to your right shoulder Push through your left foot and return to the starting position Repeat the movement with the other side

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Take a big step back with your right leg, crossing it behind your left Bend your knees and lower your hips until your left thigh is nearly parallel to the floor Push through your left heel to stand back up, lifting your right knee towards your chest Return to the starting position and repeat on the opposite side

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your hands on your hips Take a big step back with your right leg, crossing it behind your left Bend your knees and lower your hips until your left thigh is nearly parallel to the floor Keep your torso upright and your hips and shoulders as square as possible Return to start. Repeat the move on the opposite side

Stand tall, feet hip-width apart Step your right foot behind you and to the left so your thighs cross Bend both knees as if kneeling, maintaining balance Straighten legs and return to the original position Repeat the process with your left leg

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Take a step back with your right foot and place it behind your left leg. Bend your knee and lower down unless your left thigh is parallel to the floor. Return to the initial position and repeat by stepping back with your other foot.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and a towel under your left foot. Keep your hands clasped before your chest and step backward while sliding your left foot and placing it behind your right leg. Bend your knees and lower your hips unless your right thigh comes parallel to the floor.

Stand upright, set your feet hip-width apart, place the towel under your right foot Slide your right foot diagonally behind your left foot and bend your knees like performing a lunge Hold the bottom position briefly Pull your right foot back to the start, driving through your left foot Repeat for the desired number of reps and then switch sides

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and a resistance band under your left foot. Hold the ends of the band in your hands at waist height and take a step back with your right foot and place it behind your left leg. Bend your knee and lower down unless your left thigh is parallel to the floor. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and clasp your hands before your chest. Take a step back with your left foot and place it behind your right leg. Bend your knees and lower your rear knee unless your right thigh is parallel to the floor. Return to the initial position and repeat by stepping back with your other foot.

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart, raise your hands overhead and interlock your fingers Bend your upper body to the right from the waist Hold the position for a few seconds then return to the initial position Repeat the process bending to the left

Lie flat on your back with arms extended above your chest Bring your legs up so that your knees are bent at 90 degrees Slowly lower your right arm and left leg until they're just above the floor Return to the starting position Repeat the exercise with your left arm and right leg

Lie down on your back and raise your arms and legs straight up. Lower one of your arms overhead while lowering the opposite leg on the floor. Return to the initial position and do the same with your other arm and leg.

Lie on your back with your arms straight above you Bend your knees at a 90-degree angle Extend your right arm back behind your head, at the same time extend your left leg out straight Return to the initial position Repeat the exercise with your left arm and right leg

Lie flat on your back on a smooth surface, extending your arms straight up towards the ceiling Bend your knees at a 90-degree angle and keep your feet in the air Slowly extend and lower one leg and the opposite arm towards the ground Bring your arm and leg back to the starting position and repeat with the other arm and leg Keep alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions

Stand beneath a pull-up bar Jump up and grip the bar with both hands shoulder-width apart Allow your body to hang freely with your feet off the floor Relax your body and allow yourself to hang for as long as comfortable Release and repeat as required

Start in a hanging position by holding a bar with your hands placed wider than shoulder-width and palms facing forward. Curl your legs over each other to keep your feet off the floor. Hold this position for a suitable duration.

Stand with your mid-foot under the bar Bend over and grab the bar with your hands shoulder-width apart Bend your knees until your shins touch the bar Lift your chest up and straighten your lower back Take a deep breath, hold it, and stand up with the weight

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Bend your hips and knees as if you were about to perform a regular deadlift In a fast, explosive movement, straighten your knees and hips simultaneously, jumping as high as you can Land softly, absorbing the impact with your legs, and immediately prepare for the next jump

Lie down on a decline bench with your arms folded across your chest and your feet fixed against the bars/handles. Move your chest forward and bring one of our elbows towards the opposite knee by twisting your torso. Return to the initial position and repeat the same sequence but with opposite elbow.

Lie down on a decline bench and hold a pair of weights over your chest with arms bent and palms facing each other. Move your chest forward and upward while twisting your torso to one side. Return to the initial position and repeat the same movement but twist your torso in the opposite direction.

Lie down on a decline bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet fixed against the bars. Place your hands behind your head and raise your chest while bringing your elbows towards your knees. Return to the initial position slowly & repeat.

Lie on your back on a decline bench and secure your legs at the top of the bench Place your hands at sides holding onto the bench for support Pull your knees in towards your chest with your abs, creating a reverse crunch motion Relax and extend your legs back to the starting position Repeat the motion without allowing your lower back to arch

Lie on the decline bench and hold the top of the bench with both hands. Raise your legs and curl your pelvis inwards to lift your hips off the bench. Pause at the top and reverse the motion to extend your legs and lower your hips back down. Keep your legs extended and your knees slightly bent throughout. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Lie down on a decline bench and hold it by placing your hands at the sides of your head. Bend your hips and knees and bring your legs parallel to the bench. Take your knees towards your chest while lifting your hips off the bench. Return to the initial position slowly & repeat.

Get down on your hands and knees then extend your legs by propping your feet on a chair. Place your hands on the floor making a diamond shape by using your index fingers and thumbs, and straighten your arms right under the shoulders. Lower yourself down by folding your arms.

Lie back on a decline bench and secure your legs at the end Place your hands across your chest Crunch your upper body forward and up Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower back down Repeat for the desired number of reps

Start by sitting down on a decline bench and securing your legs at the top Lower your body to create a bend at your waist as you stretch your abdominals Contract your abdominals to raise your upper body until your elbows come close to your knees Lower your torso back down to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Place your hands in a diamond shape on the floor and set your feet up on a decline bench Lower your body towards the floor by bending your elbows Push your body up to the original position, fully extending your arms Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions

Get down on your hands, and extend your legs backward by propping your toes on a bench and raising your hips to form a pike shape. Place your hands under your head while extending your arms and making a diamond shape using your index fingers and thumbs. Lower your head towards your hands while folding your arms.

Place your hands on the ground in the diamond formation Elevate your feet on a higher platform Lower your body towards the ground Push up using your chest, shoulder, and arm muscles Return to your starting position

Get down on your hands, and extend your legs by propping your knees on a step stool. Straighten your arms and keep your hands right under the shoulders. Lower yourself down by folding your arms. As your chest reaches near the floor, raise yourself by straightening your arms and repeat.

Get in a kneeling position and place your hands on the ground a bit wider than shoulder width apart Lower your body towards the ground, keeping your body straight and using your arms to support your weight Push your body back up until your arms are almost fully extended Keep your body in a straight line throughout the movement Repeat the exercise for the desired amount of reps

Position the hands on the ground next to the box, wider than shoulder width apart. Straighten your body and elevate your feet on the box, you should be in a straight line from head to heels. Lower your chest towards the ground by bending your elbows. Push your body up until your arms are fully extended. Repeat this motion for the desired number of repetitions.

name_en: Decline Kneeling Push Up on Box
description_en: Get down on your hands, and extend your legs by propping your knees on the box. Straighten your arms and keep your hands right under the shoulders. Lower yourself down by folding your arms. As your chest reaches near the floor, raise yourself by straightening your arms and repeat.

name_en: Decline Kneeling Push Up on Box
description_en: Find a box or step that is about knee-height and kneel in front of it. Place your hands on the box, shoulder-width apart, with your body extended out behind you. Lower your body to the box by bending your elbows. Push your body back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Position yourself on a decline bench and secure your feet at the high end. Place your hands behind your head for support. Slowly raise your knees towards your chest. Pause when your knees have reached your chest level. Slowly lower your legs back down in a controlled fashion.

Lie with your back on a decline bench and secure your legs at the top end Place your hands under your hips or on each side of your body Raise your legs and hips upwards towards your torso Hold this position for a moment, then lower your legs and hips back down

Get down on your hands, and extend your legs backward by propping your toes on a bench. Straighten your arms and keep your hands right under the shoulders. Lower yourself down by folding your arms. As your chest reaches near the floor, raise yourself by straightening your arms and repeat.

Position your feet on a raised platform, such as a bench or step Place your hands on the floor a bit wider than your shoulder width Lower your body keeping your elbows close to your body Push up until your arms are fully extended Repeat the cycle

Start in a kneeling position and place your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart on the ground. Lean forward until your body is angled downward. Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows. Once your chest nearly touches the ground, push your body back up to the starting position. Repeat the motion while maintaining the diagonal line of your body.

Place your hands on the floor and extend your legs, with your feet resting on an elevated surface Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor Push your body back up until your arms are fully extended Maintain a straight line from your head to your feet throughout the duration of the exercise

Stand facing the wall at an arm's length. Place your hands on the wall at shoulder width apart. Lean your body towards the wall by bending your elbows. Push your body away from the wall by extending your arms. Your feet should remain stationary throughout the exercise. Repeat the procedure for desired amount of reps.

Get down on your hands, and extend your legs backward by propping your feet against a wall. Straighten your arms and keep your hands right under the shoulders. Lower yourself down by folding your arms. As your chest reaches near the floor, raise yourself by straightening your arms and repeat.

Stand facing a wall, Feet hip-width apart and hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width on the wall Bend your elbows to lower your body towards the wall Press your entire body back to the starting position Keep your body straight throughout the movement Repeat the movement for desired number of reps

Place your feet on a chair behind you, your hands on the floor and assume a push-up position Lower your body towards the ground by bending your arms Push your body back up by straightening your arms Keep your body straight throughout the movement Repeat for desired number of repetitions

Get down on your hands, and extend your legs backward by propping your toes on a bench. Straighten your arms and keep your hands right under the shoulders. Raise one hand off the floor and tap your opposite shoulder while rotating your torso a bit. Return to the initial position, and repeat while taping your other shoulder with opposite hand.

Start in a high plank position with your feet on an elevated surface. Lower your body, bending your elbows to achieve a decline push-up. At the top of the push-up, touch your opposite shoulder with your hand. Repeat the decline push-up and touch the other shoulder. Alternate between shoulders for each repetition.

Start in a decline position on a sit-up bench, with your feet secured at the top Slowly raise your body towards your knees using your abdominal muscles Pause at the top of the movement and squeeze your abs Slowly lower your body back down to the starting position

Lie on a decline bench and secure your feet at the high end. Place your hands gently on the sides of your head without pulling on your neck. Raise your torso till it's at about a 45-degree angle with the bench. Lower your torso back down in a controlled manner until your shoulders touch the bench. Repeat this motion for the desired number of reps.

Lie down on a decline bench with your hands behind your head and your feet fixed against the bars/handles Raise your chest forward and bring your elbows towards your knees. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Lie down on a decline bench with your hands holding dumbbells above your chest and your feet fixed against the bars/handles Raise your chest forward and bring dumbbells towards your knees Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart Begin by lightly jumping, while bringing your knees up and flapping your arms down to meet them At the peak of your jump, bring your arms back up, preparing to land in a deep squat position Land in a squat, lowering your body down until your hips are below your knees Push up forcefully from the heels to rise back into the jump position, repeating the movements

Get into a high plank position with the dumbbells in your hands Lower your body toward the floor, keeping your elbows close to your body Push your body up, extending your arms Bring your body back down to just above the ground before pushing up again Repeat the motion for as many repetitions as your workout calls for

Start in a high plank position with your palms flat on the ground and your wrists under your shoulders Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor Pause, then push your body back up to the starting position Keep your hips lifted and your core braced the entire time If you can't do a traditional push-up, place your knees on the ground to make the push-up less intense

Hold dumbbells in your hands with your palms facing inwards. Place your hands under your shoulders and straighten your legs on your toes. Lower your chest to the floor by bending your arms. Hold for a while, raise your chest by straightening your arms, and repeat.

Stand between the bars and grip them firmly. Lower your body until your chest touch the bars or as down as you can. Push your body upward until your arms are fully extended. Lower yourself back down in a controlled manner. Repeat this motion for the desired number of reps

Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointed out. Bend your knees to lower down into a deep squat - thighs parallel to the ground or lower. Keep your chest lifted and back straight. Hold the squat position for as long as recommended. Slowly stand back up and return to start position.

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms straight upwards Bend down diagonally towards your right, keeping your arms in line Hold the position Repeat the process towards your left

Stand tall with your feet wider than your shoulder-width Clasp your hands together holding the cable  in front of you with straight arms Twist your torso to the right along with your arms diagonally toward the floor. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your feet wider than your shoulder-width Clasp your hands together and bring them forward while keeping your arms straight Twist your torso to the left along with your arms diagonally toward the floor. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your feet wider than the shoulder-width Clasp your hands together and bring them forward while keeping your arms straight Twist your torso along with your arms diagonally toward the floor and toward the outside of your right knee Return to the initial position and repeat

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms out to your sides with your palms facing forward Raise your arms diagonally in front of you to the chest level Lower your arms in a slow, controlled manner back to the starting position Repeat this motion for your desired amount of repetitions

Sit on the edge of the chair, with your feet flat on the floor Place your hands on the edge of the chair on either side of your body Lift your feet off the floor and bring your knees towards your chest Extend your legs outwards to a 45-degree angle Bring your knees back towards your chest to return to the initial position

Stand tall with feet hip-width apart Take a step backward with your right foot, crossing it behind your left Bend your knees and lower your body straight down until your left thigh is parallel to the floor Push off with your left foot to return to the start position Repeat on the other side

Start by standing straight with your feet hip-width apart Step forward and to the right, landing in a wide stance Bend your knees and lower your body straight down Push off with your front foot and return to the starting position Repeat the movement with your opposite leg

Stand tall with a broad base and spread your arms wide with your palms down. Take your foot out to one side and touch it with your opposite hand while extending your arm and rotating your torso towards it. Return to the initial position and repeat while stepping out with your other foot.

Start in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms fully out beside you at shoulder level, palms facing forward Slowly bring your arms in a diagonal motion across your chest Hold at the center, then slowly return to the initial position Repeat this movement for the desired sets and reps

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Fold your arms and open your elbows wide while keeping your palms down. Raise one of your elbows higher than the shoulder while keeping the other lower than the shoulder. Slide your forearms over one another while alternately raising and lowering your elbows.

Stand tall with your feet a little wider than your shoulders. Bend your knees, fold your arms and make fists before your chest. Turn towards your right by twisting your torso and punch forward by straightening your left arm. Return to the initial position and do the same by switching sides.

Stand with your feet shoulder width apart, knees slightly bent Extend one arm out diagonally across your body, while rotating your torso Pull your arm back to your original position Repeat with the other arm Continue to alternate sides

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise your hands and clench your fists as if you're about to box Rotate your body and punch diagonally across your body, exhale as you punch Rotate back to the starting position inhaling as you go Switch sides and repeat

Stand in front of a sturdy chair with your feet hip-width apart Bend at your knees and hips to sit back onto the chair while extending one arm diagonally towards the ceiling Push through your heels to stand back up, lowering your arm back down Alternate arms with each repetition Perform the desired number of sets and repetitions

Start in a high push-up position with hands forming a diamond shape under chest Lower your body until your chest almost touches your hands Pause at the bottom and then push back up to the starting position Repeat for the required amount of repetitions

Kneel down and place your hands on the floor, bringing your thumbs and index fingers to form a diamond shape Lower your body towards the ground, keeping your elbows close your body Push back to the original position while maintaining your knees on the ground Ensure your body is in a straight line throughout the exercise Repeat these steps for multiple repetitions

Begin in a traditional push-up position, but with your hands making a diamond shape (place your fingers together to form the shape) below the center of your chest. Lower your body towards the ground until your chest nearly touches your hands. Press your body back up to the starting position. Keep your body straight and your eyes focused about three feet in front of you to maintain a neutral spine. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

Begin in a high plank position, but with your hands close together and your thumbs and forefingers touching Lower your body, keeping your elbows close to your sides as you do Push back up into the starting position Maintain a straight line from your head to your knees throughout

Get down into a push-up position on your knees, bring your hands together beneath your chest so your index fingers and thumbs form a diamond shape Lower your body towards the floor, keeping elbows close to your sides Push your body upward until your arms are extended, keeping the knees on the floor Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Get down on your hands and knees, and straighten your back along with your thighs. Place your hands on the floor, making a diamond shape using your index fingers and thumbs, and straighten your arms. Lower yourself down by folding your arms.

Get down on your hands and toes, and straighten your back along with your legs. Place your hands on the floor, making a diamond shape using your index fingers and thumbs, and straighten your arms. Lower yourself down by folding your arms.

Stand facing the wall with your hands formed in a diamond shape, touching the wall at chest level Keeping your body straight, bend your elbows to lower yourself towards the wall Press your body back to the initial position using your chest and arm strength Repeat these steps for the recommended number of repetitions

Position your hands shoulder-width apart on a secured chair Move your feet out in front of you so your knees are bent Lower your body toward the floor until your arms form about a 90-degree angle Push your body back up to the starting position

name_en: Dip Leg Raise a padded stool Supported
description_en: Start in a seated position on a padded stool, hands beside your hips for support Keep your legs straight ahead of you and raise them slightly off the ground Next, raise your legs up toward your chest while exhaling Lower your legs back down in a controlled manner while inhaling Repeat this motion for your desired amount of repetitions

name_en: Dip Leg Raise a padded stool Supported
description_en: Start by standing straight with your back against the stool Lift your legs to a 90-degree angle keeping them straight Lower your legs back down in a controlled fashion Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on a couch, and place your hands on its edge near your hips. Walk your feet out with your knees bent, and take your hips off the couch while holding its edge with straight arms. Lower your hips by folding your arms and raising one of your legs off the floor with a bent knee. As your arms form a 90-degree angle, raise your hips and repeat.

Position two chairs opposite each other, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart Hold onto the seats of the chairs with your hands and lift your body off the ground Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the ground Push your body back up by straightening your arms Repeat the motion for your desired number of reps

Place a chair behind you and stand in front of it Lower your body to a squat position and place your hands either side on the chair Push your body up by fully extending your arms Slowly lower your body back down to the squat position Repeat the process for multiple repetitions

Sit on a chair and place your hands on its edges near your hips. Walk your feet out with your knees bent, and take your hips off the chair while holding its edges with straight arms. Lower your hips down by folding your arms. As your arms form a 90-degree angle, raise your hips and repeat.

Sit on the floor between two sturdy chairs. Grip the edge of each chair with your hands. Lift your body off the ground and lower yourself between the chairs, bending at the elbows. Push back up using your chest and tricep muscles, straightening your arms. Keep your legs and core engaged throughout the exercise. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

Place two chairs facing each other, slightly wider than your shoulder width Stand between the chairs, and place your hands onto the chair seats Lower your body by bending your arms, until your elbows are at about a 90 degree angle Push your body up to the original position using your arms and chest Repeat the exercise for the prescribed number of repetitions

Stand between two chairs, place your hands on their back, and raise yourself in the air by straightening your arms and folding your knees. Lower yourself while bending your arms and taking your knees towards the floor. As your arms form a 90-degree angle, return to the initial position and repeat.

Start in a straight-arm plank position with feet together Jump feet apart as if youre doing a horizontal jumping jack, then hop feet back together Jump feet in towards your hands, then jump them back out into a plank Complete as many reps as you can in a given time frame

Start on your hands and knees. Your knees should be below your hips and your forearms on the floor with your shoulders directly above your wrists. Press your palms together and your forearms into the floor. Curl your toes under, then exhale and lift your knees away from the floor. Stay in this position from 30 seconds to one minute. Then release your knees to the floor with an exhale. Repeat the exercise as required.

Start on your hands and knees, then lower your forearms to the floor Press your palms together and lift your hips off the floor forming an inverted 'V' Keep your head between your upper arms and look towards your feet Stay in this pose for a few breaths then slowly come back to the starting position Repeat this exercise a few times

Stand up straight and bend slightly forward, leaning onto a stable object. Bend your knees and jump upwards, raising your heels as high as possible. Squeeze your calves at the top, then lower your feet back to the ground. Continue this movement for a set amount of repetitions. Switch legs and repeat the process.

Stand near a wall and place your hands on it for support Bend at the waist and lift one leg off the ground Raise your body up on the toes of your standing foot as high as possible Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position Repeat the process on the other leg
Place your toes on a step stool, lean forward, and extend your arms to hold a bench. Raise your heels to put a stretch on your claves. Hold this stretch for some seconds and relax.

Start on all fours with your hands positioned under your shoulders and knees under your hips Lift your right leg behind you, keeping your knee at a 90-degree angle as you push your foot up towards the ceiling Squeeze your glutes at the top of the motion, then slowly lower your knee back down to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps before switching to the left leg Ensure to keep your spine neutral and core engaged throughout

Start on all fours with your hands positioned under your shoulders and knees positioned under your hips. Lift your left knee off the floor and flex your left foot. Kick your left foot up towards the ceiling as high as comfortably possible, keeping your knee bent. Lower your left knee without touching the floor and repeat. Switch to your right leg after completing the set for the left leg.

Get down on all your four while keeping your back straight. Keep your arms and thighs straight. Raise one of your knees off the floor and straighten your thigh with your back. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand in the door frame and extend your arms out parallel to the floor, gripping the door frame Slowly pull your body towards the door frame by bending your elbows Pause momentarily as your nose nears the frame Slowly return to the original position while maintaining your grip on the doorframe

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms by tilting your body backwards, and hold the door between your palms. Take yourself forward while curling your arms. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand upright in the doorway Place your hands on either side of the door frame, at approximately shoulder height Lean forward until you feel a gentle stretch in your chest and hold for 15-30 seconds Relax and repeat

Stand tall with feet hip-width apart Extend your right arm and left leg diagonally in opposite directions Return to the original position and repeat on the other side (left arm and right leg) Continue alternating between sides Maintain this motion for the duration of your workout

Stand straight with your legs close together Jump and pull both knees up as high as you can towards one side Land gently on your feet Repeat the jump, this time pulling your knees up towards the opposite side Continue alternating sides

name_en: Double Hip Rotation Cross Knee Drive
description_en: Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Rotate both hips to one side as if making a semi-circle Lift the knee of your opposite leg towards the side where you've rotated Move it across your body towards your opposite elbow Return to the standing position and alternate sides

Start with the rope behind you, then swing it over your head Jump when the rope is about to hit the floor When the rope is about to hit the floor again, jump a second time Continue the double jump rhythm for your desired duration

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and keep your arms folded before your chest. Lower your hips to the floor by bending your knees. As your thighs become nearly parallel to the floor, raise your hips a bit and then lower them again. Jump up while raising your hips, straightening your arms, and land in the starting position.

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hands at your sides Perform a normal squat As you come up, explode into a jump As soon as you land, jump again Land softly into your squat to prepare for the next rep

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Keep your arms bent and open at your sides. Bring one of your knees and opposite elbow towards each other. As they reach near, take them away slightly, bring them close again, and finally return to the starting position and repeat by switching sides.

Start from a standing position, feet hip-width apart Quickly jump and bring both knees up to your chest at the same time, while keeping your core tight Upon landing, jump again immediately and repeat the movement Maintain balance while keeping the motion quick and controlled Repeat for the desired number of reps

Begin in a hanging position from a pull-up bar with your palms facing forward As you pull up, bring both knees up towards your elbows Try to touch your elbows with your knees at the top of the movement Hold this position briefly Lower yourself back down in a controlled manner

Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders Jump both feet to the right, bringing your knees towards your right elbow Jump your feet back to the high plank position Repeat the movement on the other side Keep alternating between the sides for the duration of the set

Start in a push-up position, legs extended behind you Bring both knees toward your chest rapidly in a 'thrust' Swipe your feet to the right, then to the left Extend your legs back to the original position Repeat the move at a fast pace for the duration of your workout

Start by standing straight with your feet hip-width apart. Jump up and bring both your knees up towards your chest. When your knees are at the highest point, touch them with your hands. Land back on the ground softly, absorbing the impact with your knees slightly bent. Repeat for the desired amount of repetitions.

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart. Bend one knee and bring your foot up towards your glutes. Hold onto the ankle of the bent leg with your hand, keeping your thigh perpendicular to the floor. Lean back slightly, further stretching out the quadriceps. Hold for at least 30 seconds, then switch to the other leg.

Lie on your back on the floor or a mat with your knees bent and pulled into your chest Inhale, and on an exhale, extend both legs out in the air at about a 45-degree angle At the same time, lift your shoulders off the ground and extend your arms and hands alongside your legs Inhale and draw both knees into your chest and take your hands on your ankles, returning to the starting position Repeat this process for a series of reps

Start in a seated position with your legs extended in front of you Bend your knees and bring your ankles towards your hips, stacking your shins so that one leg lies over the other Ensure both of your sit bones are touching the ground Keep your spine straight and lean your torso forward as far as you comfortably can Hold the stretch for about 30 seconds and repeat with the opposite leg on top

name_en: Double Plank Jack to 4 Mountain Climber
description_en: Start in a forward plank position, with your feet hip-width apart Jump your feet out to the sides as if you were doing a horizontal jumping jack Quickly hop your feet back together, and then perform four mountain climbers by bringing each knee forward to your elbow in turn Repeat this combination of moves for a set number of reps or time period

Start standing with feet shoulder-width apart, arms by your sides Raise your arms out to the sides with elbows bent 90 degrees Perform a small pulse by squeezing the shoulder blades together and then release slightly Pulse again before returning to start position Repeat this pattern for desired number of repetitions

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Lower your body into a deep squat Stand up halfway, then go back into the deep squat Stand up and extend one leg behind you, squeezing your glutes Repeat with the other leg

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Bend your arms and make fists with your palms facing inwards. Extend your arms forward while raising your one leg. Return to the initial position and repeat while extending your other leg.

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart and fists up in front of your face Lift your right leg as high as possible in front of you while punching forward with your left fist Bring your right leg back to the ground while retracting your left punch Repeat the move with your left leg and right punch Continue this movement for your desired reps or time duration

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your fists at your sides Simultaneously lift your left knee to hip height, flexing your abs, and punch with both fists forward Hold for one second, then return to the start position Repeat the movement with your right leg Continue alternating legs for the duration of the set

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise one of your knees to your chest while simultaneously making a double punch movement Lower your knee back to the original position Repeat the movement with the other knee Continue alternating the knee raises for the desired number of repetitions or time

Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart Bring your knee towards your opposite elbow while twisting your upper body Return to the starting position and repeat the movement on your other side Keep alternating sides while maintaining speed and control throughout each movement Remember to engage your core and pull your knee as close to your elbow as possible

Start by holding the rope handles in each hand at about waist height Swing the rope forward and jump, allowing the rope to pass under your feet twice in one jump Land softly on the balls of your feet and immediately spring into the next jump Keep your body upright and your jumps small

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, with your knees slightly bent Engage your core and swing your arms up and to the right, as if you were chopping wood Swiftly bring your arms back down and to the left, in a controlled chopping motion Repeat the motions, alternating sides for each rep Ensure to keep your core engaged throughout

Start in a high plank position with hands under shoulders and eyes on the mat Lift your hips high, coming into a Down Dog pose and let heels lower to the ground Lift your right leg high, then bring your knee under your body, rounding your spine as you shift your weight forward, while you touch your nose to your knee Extend your right leg back to the Down Dog Split Repeat this move on the left side

Start in a high plank, hands directly under your shoulders, body straight Press your hips up and back into a Downward Dog Slowly shift your weight forward to come into a high plank position Lower your hips down as you straighten your arms, coming into an Upward Dog Return to the initial Downward Dog and repeat

Start on your hands and knees Raise your buttocks high into the air, straightening your legs Press your shoulders downward, creating an inverted 'V' shape with your body Hold the position for a few seconds Return to starting position in a controlled manner

Begin in a downward dog pose with your hands and feet on the ground Lift one leg up as high as you can, keep it straight and pointed Lower your leg back down in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise on the other leg Keep alternating legs for the duration of your set

Stand facing a wall, slightly more than arms length away Bend at the waist and place your hands flat on the wall Bend your elbows and lower your chest to the wall, keeping your legs and back straight Push your body back to the starting position Repeat the movement for desired number of reps

Start in a high plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart Push your hips up towards the sky to get into the downward dog pose Sprint your feet forward towards your hands Return to the initial high plank position Repeat the process for desired number of reps

Get down on your fours and raise your hips while keeping your arms and legs straight to form an inverted V-shape. Raise and lower your feet alternately as if you are sprinting. Continue for a suitable duration.

Start on your hands and knees in a tabletop position Lift your hips up towards the ceiling, letting your body form an inverted V Keep your hands planted firmly on the floor and your feet hip-width apart Ensure your back is straight and your head is between your arms Hold this pose for 60 seconds or as long as comfortable

Start in a tabletop position on your hands and knees Lift your knees off the floor, pushing your hips up towards the ceiling Press your heels down towards the ground Keep your head between your arms and maintain a straight line from your wrist to your hip Hold the pose for a few breaths before returning to the starting position

Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart. Clasp your hands together and push your arms up above your head to stretch. Swiftly bring your joined hands down across your body to the opposite hip, as though throwing a punch. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side. Do this repeatedly for a set amount of reps.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent Raise your arms in front of you at shoulder height with the fists clenched Exert force and punch downwards, lowering your fists as far as you can Hold the position for a second and then return your fists to the initial position Repeat for desired number of reps

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the dumbbells near the thighs with straight arms and palms facing forward. Raise the dumbbells by folding your arms and taking your elbows past your back. As they reach near the chest, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and a resistance band under your feet. Grab the ends of the band near the thighs with straight arms and palms facing forward. Stretch the band by folding your arms and taking your elbows past your back. Return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your arms at your side Bend your knees and lower your body into a squat Quickly rise to a standing position while simultaneously extending one arm for a forward punch Return to the starting position Repeat, alternating the punching hand each time

Begin in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart Squat down into a half squat position keeping your core engaged As you push back up to a standing position, punch one arm out to the side Repeat this motion, alternating sides for each punch Ensure you maintain proper form and balance throughout

Start in a standing position with your feet shoulder width apart Lower yourself into a squat, leaning onto your right side Punch straight out to your left while shifting your weight to your right side Return to the initial position and alternate sides

Start standing with a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing forward Do seven reps where you lift from the start position to halfway up Then seven reps from halfway up to full bicep curl Finally, seven reps of full range curls This completes one set of Dumbbell 21s

Sit on the bench and lean back, while holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level Press one dumbbell up until your arm is fully extended Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position while pressing the other one Repeat this alternating motion for the desired number of reps Remember to control your movements as you press and lower the weights

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso. While keeping the upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Continue the movement until the biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to starting position as you breathe in. Repeat the process with the other arm.

Stand straight while holding a dumbbell in each hand. Keep your elbows close to your body. Curl one dumbbell while keeping the other one at rest. Slowly bring the dumbbell back to the starting position. Repeat the same with the other arm.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your body Bend one arm, rotate your hand to a palm-up position, and curl the dumbbell toward your shoulder. Hold the position briefly as you squeeze your bicep. Slowly lower the dumbbell and repeat the motion with the other arm. Keep alternating arms for the desired number of repetitions.

Stand upright, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides Raise one dumbbell in front of you at a time, keeping your arm straight and raising it until it is parallel with the floor Lower the dumbbell back down to your side in a controlled manner Repeat with the other arm Continue to alternate between arms

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand. Arms fully extended and at your side. Palms should be facing your body. Keep your elbows still, bring right dumbbell to your shoulder by bending your elbow. Lower the right dumbbell back down in a steady speed. Repeat the same action with the left dumbbell. Continue to alternate between each dumbbell.

Sit on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your torso. Keep your elbows close to your torso at all times. Curl the weights while keeping your palms face your torso. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted. Lower the dumbbells to the original position and repeat with the other arm.

Sit on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level Push one dumbbell upward until your arm is fully extended Lower the dumbbell back down to shoulder level while pushing the other one up Repeat the movement, alternating between both arms

Hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level with elbows bent Raise one dumbbell overhead while keeping your other arm stationary Lower the raised dumbbell back to shoulder level Repeat the movement with the other arm Continue alternating arms for your desired set of repetitions

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand. Begin with your palms facing in towards your chest. Press one hand upwards until your arm is fully extended, keeping the other hand at chest level. Slowly lower the hand that was extended down and simultaneously press the other hand upwards. Continue alternating between each side.

Stand straight with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides Lift one dumbbell towards the shoulder on the same side, keeping your elbow at 90 degrees Press the dumbbell upwards until your arm is extended fully Lower the dumbbell back to the shoulder in a controlled manner Repeat with the other arm

Lie flat on your back while holding a dumbbell in both hands above your head Lift your right arm and left leg at the same time, trying to touch the dumbbell to your foot Lower both your arm and leg down and then repeat the motion with your left arm and right leg Continue alternating sides for your set Keep your legs and arms straight throughout the exercise

Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front and spread apart in a 'Z' shape Hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level Extend the dumbbell in your left hand upwards until your arm is fully extended Slowly lower it back down to the starting position Repeat the motion with your right hand

Lie flat on your back on the floor with a dumbbell in each hand Bend your knees and plant your feet on the floor hip-width apart Press one dumbbell up towards the ceiling while keeping the other arm stationary at your side Lower the dumbbell back down to your chest in a controlled manner Alternate arms after each rep

Lie face up on the ground with a dumbbell in each hand Push each dumbbell up until your arms are fully extended Lower one dumbbell back down to the chest As soon as the dumbbell touches the chest, push it back up and simultaneously lower the other one Repeat this motion while alternating arms

Sit on a bench with back support, holding a dumbbell in each hand at upper chest level with palms facing your body. Lift the dumbbells in an arc motion, moving your forearms out to the sides while extending your arms until they are straight above your head. Pause briefly at the top of the movement. Lower the weights in the same arc motion, reversing your forearm movements so your palms face toward you again. Return to the starting position and repeat for desired number of reps.

Sit on a bench with a backrest, hold a pair of dumbbells at shoulder level, with your palms facing your body Raise the dumbbells while rotating your palms until they face forward Continue lifting the dumbbells until your arms are extended above you in straight arm position Lower the weights to the starting position while rotating your palms towards you
