Start by standing or sitting with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level, palms facing your body. Raise the dumbbells as you rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward. Continue lifting the dumbbells overhead until your arms are extended with a slight bend at the elbows. Slowly lower the dumbbells to the starting position while rotating back to have your palms facing you.

Lie on a flat bench grasping a dumbbell with both hands Start by holding the dumbbell straight up then lower it behind your head in an arc motion At the bottom of the arc, pull the dumbbell back up the same path it came down Raise the dumbbell over your chest again Repeat the process

Stand in front of a bench holding a dumbbell in each hand Place the toes of your rear foot on the bench behind you Lower your body by bending at the knee of your front leg until your knee is almost at a right angle Push back up to the start point and repeat

Place a dumbbell on your lap, laying down with your back against a bench or step. Place a band around your knees. Drive your hips up, while keeping your feet flat on the floor. Squeeze your glutes at the top. Lower your hips back down to the floor.

Place a resistance band around your thighs, just above the knees Hold a dumbbell with both hands at your chest level With your back against the wall, lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the floor Hold this position for a predetermined period. You should feel the band's resistance and the weight of the dumbbell When finished, carefully straighten your legs and remove the band

Stand with feet wider than the shoulder width and the toes pointing outwards. Hold a dumbbell with both hands, keeping it in front of your hips. Lower your body by bending at the knees until the thighs are parallel to the ground. Push back up to the starting position. Repeat the exercise as per your workout plan.

Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointed outwards, holding a dumbbell with both hands in front of you While keeping your chest up and back straight, lower your body by bending at the hips and knees Continue lowering until your thighs are parallel to the floor Push through your heels to return to the starting position Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions

Start in a high plank position with dumbbells in your hands Lower your body towards the floor in a push-up motion Push your body up returning to the plank position Move one arm and the opposite leg forward to crawl Repeat the process switching your arms and legs.

Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your arms fully extended and your palms facing backward. Lower the divot below your pinky towards your wrist as far as possible. Curl your fingers up as high as possible. Lower the weights by only letting your fingers extend, not your arms. Repeat for the prescribed number of repetitions.

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso Keep the upper arms stationary as you curl the weights while contracting the biceps as you breathe out Continue the movement until your biceps touch your forearms Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to starting position as your breathe in Repeat the movement for the recommended amount of repetitions

Find a flat bench and place a dumbbell on your lap Sit at the edge of the bench and grip it at either side of your hips Extend your legs out in front of you and scoot your butt off the bench Lower your body towards the floor until your arms at the elbows form a 90-degree angle Push yourself back up until your arms are fully extended

Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand Hold the dumbbells directly above you with your palms facing each other Lower the dumbbells to your chest in a controlled manner Push the dumbbells back to the starting position

Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder width With the palms of your hands facing each other, raise the dumbbells Lower them slowly until they're at chest level Push the dumbbells back up Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on a bench with back support, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level Push the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended Pause at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position Keep your back firmly against the bench throughout the movement Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on a bench with back support, holding a dumbbell in each hand Raise the dumbbells to shoulder-level with your elbows bend, palms facing forward Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are extended above your head Pause at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to shoulder level

Stand upright, holding a dumbbell in each hand, keep your feet hip-width apart Lower your body as far as you can by pushing your hips back and bending your knees Pause, then slowly push yourself back to the starting position Keep your back straight throughout the exercise Repeat the exercise for desired repetitions

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart while holding a dumbbell in each hand Lower your body into a squat (hips dropped back and down, thighs parallel to the floor) while keeping your chest up and back straight Push through your heels to stand back up to the starting position Repeat for desired number of reps Ensure to keep your knees over your toes throughout the exercise

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand Bend forward at the waist Slowly lift up the dumbbells towards your shoulders while keeping the elbows close to body Hold for a moment and slowly lower the dumbbells back down Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Position yourself bent over with a dumbbell in each hand Pull the dumbbells to shoulder height, squeezing your shoulder blades together Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position Keep your back flat throughout the exercise Repeat the move with the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Dumbbell Bent Over Reverse Fly to Hammer Curl
description_en: Start by holding the dumbbells at waist level with a slight bend in your knees Bend over at the waist until your chest is parallel with the floor Spread your arms out to the sides until they're level with your shoulders Slowly lower your arms back to the starting position Then, with your palms facing your torso, curl the weights while keeping your elbows close to your torso

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length in front of your thighs. Lower your torso to form a 45-degree angle with the floor, while keeping your arms straight. Maintain a slight bend in your elbows, raise the dumbbells to the sides until they're at shoulder level. Pause momentarily, then slowly return the weights back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Bend your knees slightly and hinge at the waist Hold a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing towards you Bring the weights up to your chest in a rowing motion Hold the position for a second Lower the weights back down slowly

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand. Bend your knees slightly and bend over at the waist, keeping your back straight. Let the dumbbell hang down at arm's length. Pull the dumbbell up to your chest, keeping your elbow close to your side. Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand Bend your knees slightly and hinge at your waist, keeping your back straight Pull the dumbbells up towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body Lower the dumbbells back down in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand feet hip-width apart with a dumbbell in each hand Bend at your hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor Keep your back flat and pull the weights up to your sides Pause, then lower the dumbbells back down

name_en: Dumbbell Bent Over Row against Wall
description_en: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand. Lean forward and place your free hand on a wall for support. Bend the elbow of the arm holding the dumbbell, lifting it towards your torso. Pause for a moment when your elbow is at peak flexion. Lower the dumbbell back down in a controlled manner, fully extending your arm.

Stand with feet hip-width apart, hold a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length Bend at your hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor Pull the weights toward your torso while squeezing your shoulder blades together Pause, and then lower the dumbbells back to the starting position Repeat this movement for your desired number of reps

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso Curl the weights while contracting your biceps, keeping the upper arms still Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level Hold the contracted position for a brief moment and exhale Slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your body While keeping the upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting your biceps Continue to raise the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to the starting position

name_en: Dumbbell Biceps Curl with Overhead Extension on Stability Ball
description_en: Sit on a stability ball with your feet flat on the floor Hold the dumbbells at your side with your palms facing forward Curl the dumbbells towards your shoulders After the curl, extend your arms straight above your head Lower the dumbbells back down and repeat

Stand 2-3 feet in front of a knee-high platform, extend one of your legs backward, and rest your toes on it. Stand upright in this position and hold dumbbells in your hands near your hips. Lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand a couple of feet from a bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Extend one leg back and place the top of your foot on the bench behind you. Bend your front knee to lower your body towards the floor, keeping your torso upright. Drive through your front heel to lift your body back up to the starting position. Switch legs after the desired reps.

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the dumbbells in your hands Lower your body into a squat and put the dumbbells on the ground Jump both feet back into a plank position keeping your body straight Jump your feet back in towards the dumbbells Stand up straight and jump into the air, raising the dumbbells above your head

Start in a standing position, dumbbells in your hands by your sides. Go into a squat position and place the dumbbells on the floor in front of you. Kick your feet back into a plank position, while keeping your hands on the dumbbells. Return your feet back to the squat position. Stand up from the squat position, lifting the dumbbells upwards with your hands.

name_en: Dumbbell Change Lateral Raise Curtsey Lunge
description_en: Hold a dumbbell in each hand by your side Raise one dumbbell laterally while simultaneously performing a curtsey lunge on the opposite leg Return to starting position and switch sides Make sure to keep your core tight during the lunge and shoulder raise Perform the desired number of repetitions on each side

Start by standing with feet apart, a dumbbell in each hand Lunge to one side explosively with one leg and reach out with the opposite arm Return to standing position while transitioning the dumbbell to the other hand Repeat the movement on the other side

Lie down on a decline bench with your back supported, knees bent, and legs fixed against the roller bars. Grab the dumbbells in your hands with your arms bent, elbows dipped under the bench, and palms facing forward. Raise the dumbbells by extending your arms upward. Return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie down on a flat bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab the dumbbells in your hands with your arms bent, elbows dipped under the bench, and palms facing forward. Raise the dumbbells by extending your arms. As the dumbbells reach close, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie down on an incline bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab the dumbbells in your hands with your arms bent, elbows open wide, and palms facing forward. Raise the dumbbells by extending your arms forward and upward. Return to the initial position, and repeat.

Sit on a bench and walk your feet out to bring your hips off the bench and support your  upper back. Hold a dumbbell by clasping it in your hands while extending your arms overhead. Raise the dumbbell by extending your arms above your face. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Find a bench or similar surface to lean on, bend your torso so it's nearly parallel to the ground Hold a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended and palms facing each other Raise the dumbbells out to your sides until your arms are parallel to the ground Pause, then slowly lower the weights back to the starting position

Stand with feet hip-width apart, a dumbbell in each hand by your sides Bend at the hips and knees, lowering your torso and the weights Quickly stand up and shrug your shoulders, pulling the weights upward Dip your knees and catch the weights at shoulder height, then stand up straight Lower the weights back to the starting position

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand Bend your hips and knees to lower your body until the dumbbells touch the floor Explosively stand up, pulling the dumbbells up towards your shoulders At the top of the motion, flip your wrists so that the palms face your body Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position

Stand up straight holding a dumbbell in each hand at your shoulder level Bend at the knees and use your legs to help raise the dumbbell towards your shoulder Drive your arms upwards to extend your arms and lift the dumbbells over your head Lower the dumbbells back to your shoulder level in a controlled manner Bend your knees and return to the starting position

Start by holding a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length Keep your elbows close to your torso at all times Curl the weights while keeping your upper arms stationary Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to starting position

Lie on a flat bench holding a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other Start with the dumbbells at shoulder level and your arms fully extended Lower the dumbbells towards your chest in a controlled motion Press the dumbbells back up to the starting position without fully locking out your elbows Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Lie on your back on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, your palms facing each other Bend your elbows to lower the dumbbells towards your chest Press the dumbbells back up to the starting position by extending your arms Keep the dumbbells close together during the movement Repeat this process for the desired number of repetitions

Lie on a flat bench holding two dumbbells directly in front of you Your arms should be fully extended at a 90-degree angle from your torso and the floor Lower the weights slowly to your chest while keeping the dumbbells close together Pause briefly, then push the weights back to the starting position Repeat this motion until your set is complete

Lie back on a flat bench holding a dumbbell in each hand at your shoulder width Extend your arms fully at the elbow to lift the weights above you Lower the weights to the sides of your chest in a slow, controlled motion Pause, then press the weights back to the start position Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on a bench with your legs spread. Rest your arm holding the dumbbell on the same side leg, near the knee. Curl the dumbbell while keeping the back of the upper arm stationary. Contract your bicep muscle for a brief moment as you reach the top of the exercise. Lower the dumbbell back down to start position in a controlled manner. Switch and repeat on the other arm.

Sit on a bench with your legs spread and a dumbbell in one hand Place your elbow against your thigh and let the weight hang Curl the dumbbell up to your shoulder while keeping your upper arm still Hold for a moment, then lower the weight in a slow, controlled movement Repeat for desired reps then switch to the other arm

name_en: Dumbbell Contralateral Glute Bridge Single Arm Chest Press
description_en: Lie on your back with your knees bent, feet flat on the floor and hold a dumbbell in one hand. Push through the foot on the same side as the hand holding the dumbbell and lift your hips off the floor into a glute bridge. While maintaining this bridge position, press the dumbbell straight up. Lower the dumbbell back down in a controlled manner. Repeat the exercise on the other side.

Start by standing with your feet wider than hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in front of your chest. Slowly shift your weight to one side, bending the knee and lowering your body while keeping the other leg straight. Push off your bent leg to return to the standing position. Repeat the movement on the opposite side. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of reps.

Stand upright, holding a dumbbell in each hand by your sides Curl the dumbbell in your right hand towards your left shoulder Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position Repeat with the dumbbell in your left hand towards your right shoulder. That's one rep Maintain this alternate movement for your specified number of reps

Stand up with your torso upright and a dumbbell on each hand being held at arms length While holding the upper arm stationary, curl the right dumbbell and touch it to the left shoulder Lower the dumbbell in a controlled fashion back to the initial position Now do the same movement with the left dumbbell touching the right shoulder Continue alternating in this manner

Hold one dumbbell in each hand at your sides With your palms facing your body, curl one dumbbell across your body towards your opposite shoulder Repeat the movement with your other hand Make sure to alternate sides Do the desired repetitions

name_en: Dumbbell Crunch Hold with Legs Off
description_en: Lie down on the floor and hold a dumbbell with both hands Raise your legs off the ground, bending your knees slightly While keeping your arms stretched out, lift your upper body to create a crunch Hold the crunch position for a moment Slowly lower your body back to the starting position

Stand upright and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level Rotate your shoulders to raise your elbows up until they're level with your shoulders Extend your arms straight up until the dumbbells are overhead Slowly lower the dumbbells back to shoulder level

Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso Curl the weights while contracting your biceps, palms facing up Press the dumbbells upward into overhead press position Extend your arms straight upwards, then lower the dumbbells to the starting position

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the dumbbells in your hand with straight arms and palms facing the thighs. Raise the dumbbells towards the shoulders by folding your arms and turning your forearms outward. As they reach shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the dumbbells in your hand with straight arms and palms facing the thighs. Raise one of the dumbbells towards the shoulders by folding your arm and turning your forearm outward. Return to the initial position and repeat with the other side.

Stand upright with a dumbbell in each hand at arms length Curl the weights upward while keeping the elbows close to the body Once your hands reach shoulder level, press the weights overhead Lower them back down after a brief pause Lower the weights back down to your sides to complete one rep

Stand straight holding a dumbbell in each hand, arms hanging by your side Step back diagonally with your right foot crossing behind your left foot and then lower into a lunge Push into your left heel to stand back up Repeat the exercise with your left foot stepping behind your right

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold dumbbells in your hands near your shoulder. Take a step back with your right foot and place it behind your left leg. Bend your knee and lower down unless your left thigh is parallel to the floor. Return to the initial position and repeat by stepping back with your other foot.

Stand holding dumbbells at your side with feet hip-width apart Bend at your hips and knees, and lower your body until the dumbbells are just below your knees Push your hips forward and stand back up Lower the dumbbells back to just below your knees Return to standing position, maintaining the correct posture throughout

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at arm-length in front of your thighs Bend at your hips and knees, lower your torso until it's almost parallel to the floor Push your hips forward and lift your torso back to the starting position Pause at the top then lower the weights back to the starting position

Sit on an inclined bench with a dumbbell in each hand atop your thighs. Lower the weights slowly, just beyond the width of your shoulders. Press the dumbbells back up to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions. Make sure to keep full control of the dumbbells at all times.

Position yourself on a decline bench with your feet firmly secured With a dumbbell in each hand, extend your arms straight above your chest Slowly lower the dumbbells to the sides of your chest Pause, then press the dumbbells back to the starting position Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions

Lie down on a decline bench with your back supported, knees bent, and legs fixed against the roller bars. Grab the dumbbells in your hands with your arms spread wide, elbows slightly bent, and palms facing the ceiling. Raise the dumbbells by bringing your arms close. Return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie down on a decline bench with a dumbbell in each hand, extend your arms above you Lower the weights to the sides while keeping your arms slightly bent Pause at the bottom, then raise the weights back to the starting position Control the movement throughout the exercise Repeat the movement for the desired amount of reps

Lie back on a decline bench with a dumbbell in each hand at arms length, palms facing each other Lower your arms out at both sides in a wide arc until you feel a stretch in your chest Return your arms back to the starting position as you squeeze your chest muscles Hold at the contracted position for a second and then start coming down slowly

Lie on a decline bench holding a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip. Start with the dumbbells at shoulder height, arms bent. Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended. Lower the weights in a controlled manner back to the starting position. Repeat the movement for the desired amount of reps.

Lie face down on a decline bench, with your legs extended off the end Place a dumbbell between your feet and secure it Bend your knees and curl your legs up towards your buttocks, keeping your hips in contact with the bench Squeeze your hamstrings at the top of the motion, then lower the weight back down in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Dumbbell Decline One Arm Hammer Press
description_en: Lay down on a decline bench with one dumbbell in your hand at arm's length Lower the dumbbell to your chest by bending your elbow while maintaining square shoulders Push the dumbbell straight up with your arm and squeeze your chest at the top Hold for a moment and then lower the dumbbell back down and repeat the process Switch the dumbbell to the other hand and repeat

Lie down on a decline bench while holding a dumbbell with both hands above your chest, keeping it straight out. Bend at your waist while keeping your back flat and raise your upper body. Pause at the top and then lower your body back down. Repeat this movement for as many repetitions as needed.

Lie back on a decline bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended. Lower the weights in a semi-circular motion towards the floor behind your head. Keep your arms slightly bent throughout the motion. Pull the dumbbells back to the starting position, using your lats. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Lay face-down on a decline bench with a dumbbell in each hand Allow your arms to hang straight down, palms facing each other Lift your shoulders as high as you can, shrugging them towards your ears Hold for a second and then slowly lower your shoulders Repeat for the desired number of reps

Start in a declined or bent over position, holding a dumbbell in each hand Allow the weights to hang down at your sides Lift your shoulders towards your ears in a shrug motion Pause and hold at the top Slowly lower the weights back down

Lay down on a decline bench, feet secure under the pad and holding a dumbbell on your chest Contract your abs and raise your body towards your knees Pause at the top and then slowly lower your body back down Repeat the same movement for the preferred amount of reps Dismount from the bench carefully after completing your set

Begin by lying down on a decline bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended towards the ceiling Slowly bend your elbows to lower the dumbbells towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body Reverse the movement by straightening your arms, pushing the dumbbells back towards the ceiling Make sure to maintain a solid grip on the dumbbells throughout the movement Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Lie on your back on a decline bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand above you with your arms fully extended With a slight bend in your elbows, lower your arms out to the sides in a wide arc until you feel a stretch in your chest Twist your wrists and point your thumbs down at the bottom of the movement Bring your arms back up in the same wide arc Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions

Lie back on the decline bench with a dumbbell in each hand. Extend your arms fully with a slight bend at the elbows. Lower the weights in an arc, getting a good stretch in your chest. As you bring the weights back up, rotate your wrists inward. Return to start position and repeat the movement.

name_en: Dumbbell Deep Push-up and Renegade Row
description_en: Place two dumbbells on the floor at shoulder width, positioning your hands on the dumbbells Lower your body until your chest almost touches the floor Push your body back up Pivot one foot and rotate the body to row one dumbbell up to your side Return to the starting position and repeat for the other side

Begin in a standing position with a dumbbell in each hand Lower into a squat and place the dumbbells on the ground, then kick your feet back into a plank Do a push-up, then jump your feet back to the squatting position Lift the dumbbells to your shoulder using your momentum just like a kettlebell swing Perform a dumbbell press overhead to complete one rep

Stand tall with your feet wider than the shoulder-width Clasp your hands together holding dumbbell in front of you with straight arms Twist your torso along with the dumbbell diagonally toward the floor and toward the outside of one of your knees. Return to the initial position and repeat

Stand upright holding a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length Keep your elbows close to your torso and have palms facing your torso While keeping your upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting your biceps Continue the movement until the dumbbells are at shoulder level Slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position

Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso. Keep your elbows close to your body and move the weights up to your shoulders by bending at the elbow. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the original position. Maintain control of the movement, do not let the weights drop or use gravity to lower them. Repeat the curl for the desired number of repetitions.

Stand straight, hold a dumbbell in one hand with your arm bent at a right angle and your elbow tucked into your side. Rotate your arm, keeping your elbow still, until your hand is facing forward. Hold this position for a moment before slowly returning your hand to the starting position. Repeat on the other arm. Do the desired number of repetitions.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab a dumbbell in one hand near your chest with your arm bent to a 90-degree angle and palm facing inwards. Take the dumbbell away by moving your forearm outward. Return to the initial position, and repeat.

name_en: Dumbbell Face Down Lying Shoulder Press
description_en: Lie down on your stomach on a flat bench holding a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other Extend your arms straight down towards the floor, keeping a slight bend in the elbow Raise the dumbbells to shoulder height, squeezing your shoulder blades together Pause for a second at the top before lowering the weights back down to the starting position Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Dumbbell Face Down Lying Shoulder Press
description_en: Lie down on your stomach on a bench with your knees bent and feet in the air. Grab the dumbbells in your hands with your arms open wide to shoulder level and elbows bent to a 90-degree angle. Bring the dumbbell forward by extending your arms overhead.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the dumbbells near your hips with your arms straight and palms facing inwards. Begin walking in a normal pattern while keeping your arms at a place.

Lie down on your back on the floor with a dumbbell in each hand Extend your arms out to your sides, but keep your elbows slightly bent Move your arms together above your chest in an arcing motion Lower the weights back to the starting position, letting your chest stretch

Lie on a flat bench holding two dumbbells directly above your chest with your palms facing each other Lower the weights in an arc out to your sides until you feel a stretch across your chest Return the weights to the original position by bringing the weights back together above your chest Keep your arms slightly bent throughout the whole movement Repeat for the desired number of reps

Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand resting on top of your thighs With the dumbbells at shoulder width, begin to lift them with your palms facing each other While keeping a slight bend at your elbows, lower your arms out at both sides in a wide arc until you feel a stretch in your chest Return your arms back to the starting position as you squeeze your chest muscles Repeat for the desired amount of repetitions

Lie down on a flat bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab the dumbbells in your hands with your arms spread wide, elbows slightly bent, and palms facing the ceiling. Raise the dumbbells by bringing your arms close. Return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie down on a flat bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab the dumbbells in your hands with your arms spread wide, elbows slightly bent, and palms facing the ceiling. Raise the dumbbells by bringing your arms close slowly. Return to the initial position slowly, and repeat.

Lie down on a decline bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the footrests. Grab the dumbbells in your hands with your arms slightly bent, elbows open wide, and palms facing the ceiling. Raise the dumbbells by bringing your arms upward and forward. As the dumbbells reach close, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Sit down on an exercise ball with a dumbbell in each hand Roll forward on the ball and lift your hips off the ground, keeping only your shoulders and head on the ball Extend your arms directly above your chest with your palms facing each other Lower the weights in a wide arc until you feel a stretch in your chest Pause, then reverse the movement back to the starting position

Sit on the ball with weights at your sides, and position yourself so that your upper back is on the ball Lift the weights above your chest, palms facing each other, without locking your elbows Slowly lower the weights to your sides creating a wide arc until you feel slight stretch in your chest Pull the weights back up to the starting position using your chest muscles Repeat for the set amount of repetitions

Start by sitting on the ground with a dumbbell in your lap and your knees spread apart. Lean back and prop your upper back against a bench or step. Lift your hips by thrusting the weight up, while keeping your feet flat on the ground. Lower your hips back to the starting point in a controlled fashion. Keep your chin tuck and chest up throughout the movement.

name_en: Dumbbell Front Plank Arm Leg Raise
description_en: Start in a plank position while holding dumbbells in each hand Raise one leg and the opposite arm off the floor Hold this position for a few seconds Lower your arm and leg back to the floor Repeat this with your other arm and leg

Assume a high plank position with a dumbbell on the floor within your reach Keep your body in line from head to heels Lift the dumbbell with one hand and extend the arm straight in front of you Hold this position for a brief moment Lower the dumbbell back to the floor and switch arms

Begin by standing straight with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level Step forward with one foot and lower your body towards the floor. Keep your front knee above the foot in line with the heel Lower your body until your thigh is parallel to the ground Push yourself back to the starting position by driving through the heel of your front foot Repeat with the other foot

Stand erect with a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing toward you Keeping your elbows slightly bent, raise one dumbbell until your arm is parallel to the ground Pause at the top of your motion Slowly lower the weight back to starting position Repeat the same movement with your other hand

Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso Keeping your arms slightly bent, raise the weights in front of you until your arms are parallel to the floor Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position Repeat this movement for the desired amount of repetitions Make sure to keep your torso stationary during this exercise

Stand straight with a dumbbell in each hand maintaining neutral wrists. Raise one arm up straight ahead until it reaches shoulder height with your palms facing down. Lower the weight in a controlled manner. Repeat with the other arm. Maintain the movement until you've completed your sets.

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart holding a dumbbell in each hand Descend into a squat, keeping dumbbells at shoulder level Squat down until thighs are parallel with the floor Push your heels into the floor to return to the start position Repeat the process for your desired number of reps

Stand straight with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level, palms facing forward. Slowly bend your knees and hips to lower your body as if sitting in a chair. Keep lowering until your thighs are parallel to the floor, maintaining a straight back. Pause at the bottom for a moment. Slowly straighten your legs to lift your body back up to the starting position.

Stand straight, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Bend your knees slightly and push your hips back. In one swift motion, push your hips forward and swing the weights straight up to shoulder height. Control the swing as you let the weights fall back down between your legs. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Lie face-up on the floor with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground. Place the dumbbell on your hips. Brace your core to engage your glutes and drive your heels into the floor to rise your hips off the ground. Keep the dumbbell in place as you lift. Hold this position for a second while squeezing your glutes. Lower your hips back to the ground in a controlled motion. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Lie flat on your back with your feet flat on the ground, held apart at hip distance. Place a dumbbell on your pelvis, holding it with both hands to keep stable. Pushing through your heels, lift your hips off the ground while keeping your back straight. Hold that position for a couple of seconds then slowly lower your hips back to the starting position. Repeat the movement for the number of repetitions required

name_en: Dumbbell Glute Bridge Single Arm Chest Press
description_en: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in one hand Raise your hips off the floor by pressing them into a glute bridge At the same time, press the dumbbell towards the ceiling performing a chest press Lower the dumbbell and your hips back to their initial position Repeat with the other hand

Lie on your back on the floor with your knees bent and your feet flat Hold a dumbbell in each hand and bring the weights to your shoulders Lift your hips towards the ceiling while simultaneously straightening your arms in a 'Crushing' motion until they are fully extended Maintain this position for a brief pause, then lower the dumbbells back towards your shoulders and your hips back to the ground

Stand straight with feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell at the base with both hands at your chest. Take a big step back with your right leg, crossing it behind your left. Bend your knees and lower your hips until your left thigh is nearly parallel to the floor. Keep your torso upright and your hips and shoulders as square as possible. Return to start by pressing your left heel into the floor. Repeat on the other side for one rep.

Stand tall, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Step your right foot back and towards the left, resembling a 'curtsey'. Lower yourself into a lunge, making sure your front left knee is aligning with your ankle. Push yourself back to your starting position Repeat on the other side

Stand with feet wider than shoulder width apart, toes slightly pointed out. Hold the dumbbell with both hands at chest level, close to your body. Lower your body into a deep squat, pausing for 2 seconds at the bottom. Push your heels into the floor to return to the standing position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Stand with your feet hip-width apart holding a dumbbell at your chest using both hands. Move one foot backward and place it on a bench or box. The majority of your weight should be on your front foot. Lower your body until your rear knee nearly touches the floor and your front thigh is parallel to the floor. Push yourself back up to the starting position by driving through the heel of your front foot.

Hold a dumbbell vertically in front of your chest, with both hands cupping the dumbbell Stand in a split stance with one foot in front of the other and reasonable distance between your feet Lower your body into a squat position, ensuring your front knee does not pass your toes Push back up to the standing position through the heel of your front foot Repeat on the other side

name_en: Dumbbell Goblet Split Squat Front Foot Elevanted
description_en: Hold a dumbbell at chest height with both hands, standing in a split stance with your front foot elevated Lower your body by bending your knee and hip until your rear knee almost touches the ground Push yourself back up to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps and then switch to the other leg Keep your chest up and look straight ahead during the movement

name_en: Dumbbell Goblet Split Squat Front Foot Elevanted
description_en: Hold a dumbbell in front of your chest with both hands Place your front foot on an elevated surface Bend your front knee and lower your body into a lunge position Push through your front heel to return to starting position

Hold a dumbbell close to your chest. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your body, bending at the hips and knees while keeping your chest upright. Push through your heels to return to your starting position. Repeat this process for the required number of repetitions.

Begin by standing with feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, holding the dumbbell with both hands in front of your chest Lower your body into a deep squat, making sure your thighs are parallel with the floor Hold the position for a moment and then push back up to your starting position Keep your weight in your heels and your back straight throughout the movement Repeat the exercise for the desired amount of reps

name_en: Dumbbell Goblet Squat with Calf Raise
description_en: Hold the dumbbell close to your chest Lower into a squat by bending your knees At the bottom, pause and perform a calf raise Lower your heels back to the ground Push back up to the starting position

Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and toes pointed outwards Hold a dumbbell by one end at chest height with both hands Lower yourself into a squat, pushing your hips back and bending your knees until your thighs are parallel to the floor Press through your heels to stand back up, keeping your chest lifted throughout the movement Repeat for your desired number of repetitions

Hold the dumbbell at chest height with both hands Step forward with one foot, bending your knee and hip to lower your body Push back up to the starting position and repeat with the other foot Continue alternating legs with each step, as if walking Maintain your upper body upright throughout the exercise

Stand with your back against a wall holding a dumbbell against your chest Slide down the wall into a squat position until your thighs are parallel to the floor Keep your back flat against the wall holding the position Ensure your feet are shoulder width apart and flat on the ground Return to starting position by pushing against the wall and standing up

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, feet shoulder-width apart Bend at your waist while keeping your back straight, until your torso is almost parallel to the floor Pause for a moment, then lift your torso back to the initial position Repeat this movement for the desired number of reps Maintain a slight bend in your knees throughout the exercise

Stand up straight while holding a dumbbell on the outer part of each foot with an overhand grip. Lower your body while keeping your back straight, until your thighs are parallel to the floor. This will be your starting position. Drive through your heels to push your body upwards back to the starting position. Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended and palms facing your torso. Keep your elbows close to your torso at all times. Curl the weights while keeping your palms facing each other until they are at shoulder height. Hold the contracted position for a brief moment as you squeeze your biceps. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the initial position.

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso. Keep the elbows close to the body, raise the dumbbells until your forearms are vertical to the floor and the biceps are fully contracted. Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions. Avoid using your back or shoulders to lift the weights; your biceps should do all the work.

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended While keeping your upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting your biceps Continue to raise the weight until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps Slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your body Keep the upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting your biceps as you breathe out. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps. Lower the weights to the original position as you breathe in.

name_en: Dumbbell Hammer Grip Incline Bench Two Arm Row
description_en: Sit on the incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand Lean forward from your waist until your chest is rested against your thighs Pull the dumbbells to your side, keeping your elbows close to your body Slowly lower the dumbbells until your arms are fully extended Repeat the exercise for the desired amount of reps

name_en: Dumbbell Hammer Grip Incline Bench Two Arm Row
description_en: Lie face down on an incline bench holding a dumbbell in each hand, allowing them to hang toward the floor Pull the dumbbells up to the side of your body by squeezing your shoulder blades together Pause at the top of the motion Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit at a preacher bench with arms extended and the back of your upper arms resting on the pad. Hold one dumbbell in your hand with palms facing inwards. Curl the dumbbell upwards in a semicircular arc while maintaining tightness in your biceps. Lower the dumbbell slowly back to the starting position.

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing inward Keep your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps Continue to raise the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level Hold the contracted position for a brief moment as you squeeze your biceps Inhale and slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position

Start with feet hip-width apart and dumbbells at your sides Lower your body into a squat, keeping the dumbbells near your shins Drive upward, using the power from your hips to pull the dumbbells up to your shoulders Finish in the standing position, with dumbbells at shoulder height, held at your sides Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner

Stand beside a bench with a dumbbell in hand Support your head with your free hand on the bench Bend at your hips, keeping your back straight Pull the dumbbell up to your side Slowly lower the dumbbell back down

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended, and palms facing your torso. While holding your upper arm stationary, curl the weights while contracting your biceps as you breathe out. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a moment as you squeeze your biceps. Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to original position as your breathe in.

Stand upright, holding a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length Keep your elbows close to your body and rotate your palms until they face forward Breathe out and curl the weights while keeping your upper arms stationary Continue lifting the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells reach shoulder level Lower the dumbbells to the starting position and inhale

Sit on the ground with your back against a bench, feet planted firmly in front of you, and a dumbbell on your lap. Raise your hips off the ground until your body forms a straight line from your shoulder to knees. Lower your body back to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions. Switch sides and repeat the exercise.

Sit on the ground with a dumbbell in your lap, lean your upper back against a bench Bend your knees and plant your feet on the floor, shoulder-width apart Pushing through your heels, raise your hips off the floor Push your hips up until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees Lower your hips back to the floor and repeat

Place the dumbbell over your hips while lying on your back on the ground with bent knees and flat feet Pushing through the heels, lift your hips towards the ceiling while squeezing your glutes at the top Hold at the top for a moment before lowering your hips back to the ground in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of reps

Hold a dumbbell with both hands and stand with a tight core Slowly bend at the hips, lowering your torso towards the ground Pause when your torso is parallel to the ground Engage your hamstrings and glutes to pull yourself back to the starting position Repeat the movement for your desired number of reps

Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing each other. Curl one dumbbell till it reaches your shoulder level while maintaining the elbow stationary and the palm of the hand always facing upwards. Lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat with the other arm. Repeat turn by turn for the desired number of repetitions.

Sit on an incline bench and hold a dumbbell in each hand letting them hang at arm's length Curl the dumbbell as close as possible to your shoulder while keeping your elbow stationary Lower the dumbbell back down Repeat with the other arm Switch arms after every rep

Sit on an incline bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height Press one dumbbell to full arm extension, pausing briefly at the top Lower that dumbbell back to the starting position Repeat the movement with the other arm Alternate the press between each arm for the set duration

Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height Press the dumbbells directly above your chest until your arms are straight Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to shoulder height Repeat the movement for desired number of repetitions

Sit on an incline bench with dumbbells in each hand at shoulder height Lean back and extend your elbows to push the weights above your chest Pause for a moment at the top of the lift Lower the weights back down to shoulder height in a slow and controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit down on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing forward. With the elbow stationary, curl the first dumbbell as you breathe out and keep contracting the biceps as you move up. Hold the contracted position for a moment as you squeeze the biceps. Slowly start to bring the dumbbell back to the initial position as your breathe in. Repeat the process with the other arm.

Sit on an incline bench and hold a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length Curl both dumbbells while keeping your elbows close to your torso Continue to curl the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level Hold the contracted position for a moment Slowly bring the dumbbells back to the starting position

Sit back on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand Keep your elbows close to your torso at all times Curl the weights while contracting your biceps Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted Lower the weights back to the starting position in a controlled manner

Sit on a bench inclined at about 45 degrees. Hold the dumbbells in your hands on either side Raise the dumbbells until your arms are extended straight above your chest Lower the dumbbells back down to your sides in a controlled motion Repeat the movement for the number of desired repetitions

name_en: Dumbbell Incline Close grip Press Variation
description_en: Position yourself on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand Hold the dumbbells close to your chest, with palms facing each other Press the dumbbells up until your arms are fully extended Pause briefly before lowering the dumbbells back to the chest Repeat this movement for the desired number of reps

Sit down on an inclined bench with a dumbbell in each hand Keep your elbows close to your torso Curl the weights while keeping your palms facing each other Continue to raise the weights until your biceps are fully contracted Lower the dumbbells back down in a slow, controlled movement

Sit on an incline bench holding a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your body. Aim to keep your elbows close to your torso. Curl the weights while contracting your biceps, keep the movement only in your forearms. Hold the contraction at the top for a second, then slowly lower back to the starting position.

Lie on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand on top of your thighs Raise the dumbbells level with your shoulders Lower the weights in an arc out to your sides until a comfortable stretch is felt across your chest Pull the dumbbells back together in an arc Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand. Rest the dumbbells on your thighs close to your knees. Raise the dumbbells (keeping a slight bend in your elbows) to shoulder height, making sure your palms are facing each other. Lower the weights in a slow, controlled motion out to the side of your body. Stop when your arms are parallel to the floor then bring your arms back to the starting position. Repeat the exercise for your desired set and rep range.

name_en: Dumbbell Incline Fly on Exercise Ball
description_en: Sit on the stability ball with a dumbbell in each hand Slowly lean back onto the stability ball, letting it support your upper back Fully extend your arms out to your sides in a 'T' shape Bring the dumbbells together above your chest in a controlled manner Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the 'T' position

name_en: Dumbbell Incline Fly on Exercise Ball
description_en: Lie back on a stability ball, feet flat on the floor and knees bent at 90 degrees With a dumbbell in each hand, extend your arms directly above your chest with a slight bend in your elbows Slowly lower your arms out to the side, keeping the slight bend in your elbows Once your arms are level with your shoulders, slowly bring them back up to the start position Keep your hips pushed up throughout the entire exercise to keep your body stable

Sit on an incline bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing inwards With a slight bend in your elbow, raise one arm up in front of you until it is at the same level as your shoulder Hold for a brief moment at the top before lowering back down to the starting position Repeat with your other arm Continue alternating sides for your desired amount of reps

Sit on an incline bench holding a pair of dumbbells by your sides with arms fully extended. While keeping your core tight and maintaining a slight bend in your elbows, slowly raise the dumbbells in front of you to about shoulder level. Pause for a second at the top of the movement. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position. Repeat for recommended number of repetitions.

Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand hanging down at arm's length With palms facing your torso, curl the weights while contracting your biceps Continue raising the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level Lower the dumbbells to the starting position Repeat for the desired amount of repetitions

Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand hanging at arm's length Curl both weights while keeping your palms facing each other Pause when the weights are shoulder level Lower the dumbbells back down after a short pause Repeat desired amount of repetitions

Sit on an incline bench with dumbbells in each hand, elbows bent and facing toward your feet Press the dumbbells up, extending your arms fully Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions Finish the set and then repeat with the other arm

Sit down on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand resting on your thighs Raise the weights in a hammer grip (palms facing each other), bringing them up to your shoulder height Press the weights up until your arms are fully extended, without locking your elbows Lower the weights back down to the shoulder height in a controlled motion Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on an incline bench holding a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand grip, letting the arms hang down fully extended Keeping your upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting your biceps Slowly lower the weights back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Sit on an incline bench set at an angle of 45 degrees Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides With a slight bend at your elbow, raise the dumbbells up by extending your arms forward Move your arms until the dumbbells almost meet at the center above your chest Return the dumbbells back to the starting position

name_en: Dumbbell Incline One Arm Hammer Press
description_en: Set the incline bench at a 45 degree angle. Sit on the bench with a dumbbell in one hand at shoulder level. Extend your arm pushing the dumbbell upwards, keeping your palm facing towards your body. Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position in a controlled motion. Repeat the process for the desired number of repetitions before switching to the other arm.

name_en: Dumbbell Incline One Arm Lateral Raise
description_en: Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in one hand Keep your arm straight and raise the dumbbell to the side until it is at shoulder height Lower the dumbbell back down in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise with your other arm Perform multiple repetitions for both arms

Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in one hand on the same side of the body. Lift the dumbbell up to shoulder height, palm facing forward. Press the dumbbell upward until your arm is fully extended. Slowly lower the weight back down to the starting position. Repeat the process for your desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm.

Lie back on an incline bench with one dumbbell in your hand. Hold the dumbbell just above your shoulder, with your arm bent. Press the dumbbell up until your arm is straight. Lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch to the other arm.

Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder width Press the dumbbells upwards until your arms are fully extended Pause for a moment while squeezing your chest muscles Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on an incline bench leaning back, with a dumbbell in one hand on the corresponding side Raise your arm laterally, keeping elbow slightly bent, until the dumbbell is at shoulder level Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position Repeat the movement for desired reps Switch to the other arm and repeat

Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length Raise your arms to the side until they reach shoulder level Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position Keep a slight bend in your elbow throughout the exercise Try to lead with your elbows, not your hands

Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand, lean forward, and let the dumbbells hang down. Keep a slight bend on your elbows and maintain this posture throughout the exercise. Raise the dumbbells to the sides until your elbows are at shoulder height. Lower the dumbbells back down slowly. Repeat this movement for your desired number of repetitions.

Start seated on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand Let your arms hang naturally down, palms facing one another Lift the dumbbells out to your sides until they're level with your shoulders Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position

name_en: Dumbbell Incline Reverse Raise with Chest Supported
description_en: Position yourself chest-down on an incline bench holding a dumbbell in each hand Let your arms hang down and keep your elbows slightly bent Raise both dumbbells to your sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, resembling a skier Lower the weights back down in a controlled manner Repeat the desired number of repetitions

Position yourself on the incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand Raise the dumbbells to your side, keeping your elbows slightly bent Pause at the top for a moment Lower the weights back down in a controlled motion Repeat for desired number of repetitions

Lie face-down on an incline bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Let the dumbbells hang straight down, palms facing each other. Pull the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows close to your body. Hold this position for a moment, keeping your back muscles engaged. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the start position.

Sit down on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length. Raise your shoulders towards your ears as high as possible. Pause at the top of the contraction then slowly lower the weights back to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand at arms length Lift your shoulders up as far as you can towards your ears Pause, then lower your shoulders back down Repeat for the desired number of reps

name_en: Dumbbell Incline Single Arm Y Raise
description_en: Sit on an incline bench holding a dumbbell in one hand. Straighten your arm and raise the dumbbell upwards in front of you in a Y shape. Hold at the top for a moment. Lower the dumbbell back down in a controlled motion. Repeat the exercise with the other hand. Perform the desired number of reps.

Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand Hold the dumbbells close together at chest level Push the dumbbells straight up until your arms are fully extended Lower the dumbbells back to chest level in a controlled manner Keep the dumbbells close together throughout the exercise

Lie face down on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended Lift the dumbbells perpendicular to the body until they reach shoulder level Pause, then slowly lower them back to the starting position Keep your head down and eyes looking at the floor to maintain a neutral spine Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on an incline bench and hold a dumbbell in each hand behind your head, elbows at 90 degrees Straighten your arms to lift the dumbbells above your head Lower the dumbbells back behind your head Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions Ensure to keep your elbows close to your head throughout the exercise

Sit on an inclined bench holding a pair of dumbbells. Reach your arms back and behind your head, bending at the elbow. Extend your elbows while keeping your upper arms still. Pause at the top of the motion, where your arms are fully extended. Gradually lower the dumbbells back to the start position.

Sit on an incline bench holding dumbbells at your side With palms facing towards each other, raise the dumbbells in a wide arc until they are level with your shoulders Twist your wrists inward as you raise the dumbbells Lower the dumbbells back to the start position in a controlled fashion Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps

Lie back on an incline bench holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level Start with palms facing each other As you press the weights up, rotate your wrists until your palms face forward at the top of the movement Lower the weights back to the starting position, rotating your wrists so your palms face each other by the bottom Repeat for the desired number of reps

Start by selecting a set of dumbbells and position yourself on an incline bench, lying on your back with a dumbbell in each hand. Extend your arms above your head, ensuring they are straight and parallel to each other. Slowly lower the dumbbells in a controlled motion towards your shoulders, keeping your elbows fixed. Pause when the weights are near your shoulders, then press the dumbbells back to the starting position. Repeat for your desired amount of repetitions.

Lie back on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand held at arms length. Keep your elbows close to your torso at all times. While keeping your upper arms stationary, slowly lower the weights by flexing at the elbows until they are at a 90 degree angle. Using your triceps, lift the weights back to the initial position. Try to keep the rest of your body stationary throughout. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand Lay back and extend your arms with the dumbbells over your chest Flare your arms out at an angle away from the torso forming a Y shape with your head Raise the dumbbells until your arms are fully extended above your chest Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner

name_en: Dumbbell Ipsilateral Glute Bridge Single Arm Chest Press
description_en: Start by laying on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Hold the dumbbell in your right hand and perform a glute bridge by raising your hips off the floor. Extend your right arm, pushing the dumbbell towards the ceiling. Lower the dumbbell back down to your chest in a controlled manner. Repeat this process while maintaining the glute bridge position and then switch to the left hand.

name_en: Dumbbell Ipsilateral Single Leg Stiff Leg Deadlift
description_en: Stand on one leg while holding a dumbbell in your hand on the same side Tip forward from the hip while keeping the back straight and leg extended Lower the dumbbell towards the floor Controllably rise back to the starting position, squeezing your glutes

name_en: Dumbbell Ipsilateral Single Leg Stiff Leg Deadlift
description_en: Stand on one leg, holding the dumbbell in the same-side hand Push your hips back and lower your torso while keeping your back straight When torso is parallel to floor, pull up to the starting position by pushing your hips forward Perform the repetitions on one side then switch to the other side Keep your standing leg slightly bent throughout the motion

Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand by your sides Squat down, pushing your hips back and bending your knees, while keeping your chest up and your back straight As you stand up from the squat, lift the dumbbells out to the sides and up to shoulder height, making a 'T' shape with your body Lower the dumbbells back to your sides as you squat back down Repeat this for your desired number of reps

Begin by standing with a dumbbell in each hand, arms extended out to the sides at shoulder level Lower into a squat while keeping your arms extended out to the sides Return to standing position while keeping your arms extended Lower the dumbbells to your sides

Stand straight holding the dumbbell in both hands in front of you. Begin to slowly curl your spine down, starting from the head and ending at the hips. Once you've curled as far down as possible, reverse the movement, and slowly uncurl your spine back to the starting position. Perform this movement in a slow and controlled manner. Ensure your knees remain slightly bent throughout the entire movement.

Stand straight holding the dumbbells by your sides Lower your body into a squat position Explosively jump upwards Land softly and immediately lower yourself back into the squat position for the next repetition Repeat for desired number of reps

Start by holding a dumbbell in one hand, bend your knees slightly and bend over at your hip joints while keeping your spine neutral Keep your upper arm stationary, exhale and use your triceps to lift the weights until the arm is fully extended Pause briefly at the top then inhale while you slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position Repeat for the required number of repetitions. Switch to the other arm and repeat the process.

Bend over at a 45 degree angle with a dumbbell in one hand Tuck your elbow into your side Extend your elbow until your arm is straight Slowly bend your elbow to return to the starting position Repeat for desired number of reps before switching arms

Start in a kneeling position with two dumbbells raised at shoulder height, palms facing you Slowly lift the dumbbells overhead while rotating your wrists, so your palms face forward at the top Pause for a second at the top Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position with the same rotating motion Repeat for desired number of repetitions

Start in a kneeling position holding two dumbbells at your sides Push through your heel of the front leg to stand up Lower back down to the kneeling position slowly Repeat the movement with the opposite leg leading Continue alternating legs for the desired number of reps

name_en: Dumbbell Kneeling Hold to Stand Clean grip
description_en: Begin kneeling holding a pair of dumbbells at your sides Press your heels into the ground and stand up, keeping the dumbbells at your sides Once standing, lower yourself back into a kneeling position while maintaining a clean grip on the dumbbells Repeat this movement for desired amount of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold dumbbells in your hands near your shoulder. Take a step back with your right foot. Bend your knee and lower down unless your left thigh is parallel to the floor.

Lie flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing towards your feet Begin with the weights directly above your chest, elbows extended Lower the weights until the upper arms are approximately parallel to the floor Hold this position briefly, and then press the dumbbells back to the starting point Repeat for desired number of repetitions

Stand straight holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with your palms facing inward Slowly lift the dumbbells to your side until they are shoulder height Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your shoulder muscles Lower the dumbbells back down to your sides in a slow and controlled manner

Stand next to a sturdy bench or step while holding the dumbbells at your sides Place the foot of your closest leg onto the bench, pushing through your heel to step up, keeping your other foot off the bench Pause for a second, then lower yourself back down in a controlled fashion Repeat this motion, then switch sides to ensure both legs are equally worked

Stand upright, hold a dumbbell in each hand by your sides at arm's length. Position yourself to the side of a bench, step-up on the bench with one leg and push through the heel to straighten it. Lower your body back to the starting position in a controlled fashion. Repeat with the opposite leg. Perform the desired number of reps before resting.

Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your arms fully extended by your sides Raise your arms laterally to shoulder height and then bring them forward in front of you Lower the dumbbells back down to your sides in a controlled manner Repeat the movement for your chosen number of repetitions

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length, palms facing your torso Keeping your torso stationary, lift the dumbbells to your side with a slight bend on your elbow Continue to go up until your arms are slightly above parallel to the floor Lower the dumbbells back down slowly to the starting position Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Stand upright while holding a pair of dumbbells at arm's length beside your body. Take a wide step sideways to your right while keeping your left leg straight. Bend your right knee and move your hips back as if you're sitting into a chair, keeping your right knee aligned with your right foot. Press from your right heel to stand back up and repeat the movement to the left side. Continue to alternate sides for the desired amount of repetitions.

Stand straight holding dumbbells at arm's length, palms facing your body Lift the dumbbells in front of you with straight arms until they are at shoulder height Pause at the top of the movement Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Lie on a flat bench holding a dumbbell in each hand. Extend your arms above you but slightly bend your elbows. Steady your breath and slowly lower your arms in a wide arc until you feel a stretch in your chest. Bring your arms back to the starting position as if hugging a giant tree. Contract your chest muscles and hold for a second when your arms are above you. Repeat the whole process for an appropriate number of reps.

Hold a dumbbell in each hand, stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Step your right foot forward and lower your body until your front knee is bent to 90 degrees Push back up to the starting position Switch sides and repeat the movement with your left foot forward Perform the desired number of reps on each side

Stand with your feet wider than hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in your left hand Lower your body to your right side, bending at the waist, and touch your right foot with the dumbbell Keep your abs tight and back flat throughout the movement Push your hips back and come back to the starting position Repeat the movements on the other side, holding the dumbbell in your right hand

Stand upright holding a pair of dumbbells at arms length by your side Step forward with one leg, lowering your hips until both knees are bent at about a 90-degree angle Tips: Make sure your front knee is directly above your ankle, not pushed out too far. Your other knee should not touch the floor. Push back up to your starting position, then alternate with the other leg.

Stand up straight while holding a dumbbell in each hand Step forward with either leg into a lunge position, bending your knee to around 90 degrees Ensure the front knee is directly above the ankle Push back up from the ground to the starting position, using mainly your heel Repeat this process on the other leg

name_en: Dumbbell Lunge Alternating On The Spot
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold dumbbells in your hands near your hips. Take a step forward and lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position, and repeat by stepping forward with your other foot.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold dumbbells in your hands near your hips. Take a step forward and lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold dumbbells in your hands near your hips. Take a step forward and lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, pulse downward 2-3 times and use its recoil to return back to a standing position.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold dumbbells in your hands near your shoulder. Take a step forward and lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee and extending your arms overhead. Return to the initial position and repeat by stepping forward with your other foot.

Start by standing upright with a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length Step forward with one leg into a lunge position while simultaneously curling the dumbbells to your shoulders Push back to the initial position, and lower the dumbbells Repeat the movement with the opposite leg, continue alternating

Lie down on a flat bench, clutching a dumbbell in each hand over your chest with your palms facing each other Keep your elbows fixed and extend one arm, raising the dumbbell until your arm is fully extended Return the dumbbell back to the starting position, performing the movement in a slow and controlled manner Repeat with the other arm Continue alternating arms for the duration of your workout

Lie flat on a bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand over your head Slowly bend your elbows to lower the dumbbells towards the sides of your head Extend your arms again to lift the dumbbells back over your head Alternate between your arms, doing the extension with one arm while the other remains static

Lie down flat on a bench, clutching a dumbbell in each hand overhead with arms fully extended. Keeping the upper arms stationary, lower the dumbbells by bending your elbows until they are at a 90-degree angle. Return to the starting position by extending your arms and lifting the dumbbells back to the original position. Keep the movement slow and controlled for the entire exercise. Repeat the exercise for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Lie down flat on a bench, holding the dumbbell in both hands above your chest Extend your arms fully, keeping the elbows in Lower the dumbbell towards your forehead by bending at the elbows Pause briefly, then extend your arms back to the start position

Lie flat on your back with your legs extended and the dumbbell situated between your feet Bend your knees and raise the dumbbell towards your buttocks, contracting your hamstrings Lower the dumbbell in a controlled fashion, straightening your legs Pause for a second at the bottom of the movement before starting the next repetition Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Lie on a flat bench, holding a dumbbell in one hand on the same side of the body. Bend the knee and raise the leg perpendicular to the ground. Extend your leg, slowly lowering the dumbbell towards the foot maintaining a slight bend in the knee. Bring the dumbbell back to the starting position by flexing your hamstring. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions and then switch legs.

Lie flat on your back on the floor holding two dumbbells Extend your arms fully above you Bend your elbows to slowly lower the dumbbells towards your forehead Pause once the dumbbells are an inch above your forehead Slowly press the dumbbells back up to the starting position

Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand Hold the dumbbells above your chest with palms facing each other Slowly lower the dumbbells to the side of your chest Once the dumbbells reach chest level, push them back up to the starting position Repeat the movement for the recommended number of repetitions

Lie flat on a bench while holding two dumbbells at a hammer or neutral grip. Lower the dumbbells to the sides of your chest in an arched motion. Press the dumbbells back up to the start position. Keep the tension on your chest muscles throughout the motion. Repeat the exercise for your desired number of reps.
