Lie flat on a bench, holding dumbbells with a neutral grip (palms facing towards each other) and extend your arms directly above you. Bend your elbows and lower the dumbbells until they are just above your chest. Pause, then press the dumbbells back up to the starting position. Ensure your movements are slow and controlled. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Lie face down on a flat bench with your legs fully extended off the end Hold a dumbbell between your feet, curl your legs up as far as possible Pause at the top for a moment and contract your hamstrings Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Lie face down on a flat bench with your legs extended. Hold a dumbbell between your feet. Bend your knees and curl the dumbbell towards your glutes. Hold this position for a second and squeeze your hamstrings. Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position. Repeat this movement for the desired number of reps.

Lie face down on a flat bench with your legs extended off the end of it. Hold a dumbbell between your feet. Without moving your hips, bend your knees and curl the weight upwards until your hamstrings are fully contracted. Lower the weight back down to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat for your desired number of repetitions.

Lie on your side with a dumbbell balanced on your top hip Lift both your legs and torso together, aiming to touch your elbow to your thigh Hold this position briefly and exhale Lower your legs and torso slowly back to the starting position inhaling

name_en: Dumbbell Lying One Arm Deltoid Rear
description_en: Lie on your side with your lower arm extended above your head and your upper arm resting on your side Hold the dumbbell in your upper hand with your palm facing your body Lift the dumbbell straight up until your arm is fully extended Lower the dumbbell back down in a smooth, controlled motion Repeat this for the desired number of repetitions and then switch sides

Lie down on a bench with your feet flat on the floor Hold a dumbbell in one hand at shoulder height Press the dumbbell up until your arm is fully extended Lower the dumbbell back down to your shoulder in a controlled manner Repeat this exercise for your desired amount of reps before switching to the other arm

Lie on your back on a flat bench with a dumbbell in one hand. Extend your arm straight up to the ceiling, keeping your wrist straight. Lower the dumbbell in a controlled manner until your elbow is slightly lower than your shoulder. Press the dumbbell back up until your arm is fully extended. Repeat the process with the other arm.

name_en: Dumbbell Lying One Arm Pronated Triceps Extension
description_en: Lie on your back on a bench with a dumbbell in one hand. Extend your arm straight up towards the ceiling. Slowly bend your elbow, lowering the dumbbell until it is next to your head. Return the dumbbell to the starting positioning by extending your elbow. Repeat with the desired amount of repetitions before switching to the other arm.

name_en: Dumbbell Lying One Arm Pronated Triceps Extension
description_en: Lie down flat on a bench with a dumbbell in one hand Fully extend your arm holding the dumbbell above your head Slowly, bend your elbow and lower the dumbbell towards the opposite side of your head Pause when the dumbbell is near your head and your arm is bent nearly at 90 degrees Push the dumbbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arm

name_en: Dumbbell Lying One Arm Rear Lateral Raise
description_en: Lie down on your side on a bench, with your top arm holding a dumbbell Keep your upper arm close to your body and bent at the elbow, your forearm should be hanging down with the dumbbell Lift the dumbbell up until it is at shoulder height Lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise with the other arm

name_en: Dumbbell Lying One Arm Supinated Triceps Extension
description_en: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in one hand with your arm fully extended towards the ceiling. Bend at the elbow to slowly lower the dumbbell towards the opposite shoulder. Once your forearm is parallel to your body, extend your arm back to the starting position. Repeat for your desired number of reps, then switch arms.

name_en: Dumbbell Lying on Floor Chest Press
description_en: Lie on the floor holding a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing your feet. Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the floor. Press the dumbbells up until your arms are fully extended. Lower the dumbbells back down in a controlled motion to the starting position. Repeat for the desired amount of repetitions.

name_en: Dumbbell Lying on Floor Chest Press
description_en: Lie down on your back on the floor holding a dumbbell in each hand Bend your knees and press your feet into the floor for stability Start with the weights held up over your chest, arms extended Lower the weights down towards your chest in a controlled manner Push the weights back up, extending your arms fully

name_en: Dumbbell Lying on Floor Hammer Press
description_en: Lie flat on your back on the floor holding two dumbbells to the sides of your chest with palms facing one another Raise the dumbbells until your arms are fully extended up Pause in this position and squeeze your chest muscles Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat this sequence for a desired number of reps

name_en: Dumbbell Lying on Floor Hammer Press
description_en: Lie flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder width apart Press the dumbbells straight up until your arms are fully extended Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the weights back down Keep your elbows close to your body at all times Repeat the movement for desired reps

name_en: Dumbbell Lying on Floor Rear Delt Raise
description_en: Lie face down on the floor with a dumbbell in each hand Extend your arms out to your sides at shoulder level Lift the weights in a semicircular arc until your arms are perpendicular to your body Hold for a moment and feel the contraction Lower the weights back to the starting position

Lay flat on the floor holding a dumbbell in one hand Keep the arm with the dumbbell fully extended towards the ceiling Rotate the hand so that the back of the hand is facing the ceiling Rotate the hand back so that the palm is facing the ceiling Repeat for the desired number of reps and then switch arms

name_en: Dumbbell Lying Pullover on Exercise Ball
description_en: Lie with your upper back and shoulders on the exercise ball, feet flat on the floor with knees bent at a 90-degree angle Hold a dumbbell with both hands straight up over your chest Lower the dumbbell behind your head, keeping your arms extended Raise the dumbbell back up to the starting position Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps

Lie face down on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand Extend your arms down towards the ground Lift the dumbbells up to your chest in a rowing motion Hold for a moment and squeeze your shoulder blades together Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position

Lie flat on a bench, holding two dumbbells in your hands Extend your arms out to the sides with a slight bend at the elbows Raise the dumbbells in a semi-circular motion towards the ceiling until they meet above your body Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise for the recommended amount of repetitions

Lie flat on a bench with a dumbbell in one hand Extend your arm with the dumbbell directly above your shoulder Slowly lower the dumbbell behind your head by bending your elbow Lift the dumbbell back to the start by straightening your elbow Repeat on the other side

Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length While keeping the upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting your biceps Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to starting position Repeat the process for the recommended amount of repetitions

Lie flat on your back on a bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand Position your arms perpendicular to the floor Curl the dumbbells towards your shoulders while keeping your elbows stationary Lower the dumbbells slowly back to the start position

Lie on a bench, a dumbbell in each hand, your palms facing each other Extend your arms fully above your chest Keep your elbows still, lower the dumbbells until they are beside your head Lift the dumbbells back to the starting position Repeat the desired number of times

Lie down on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand Extend your arms straight above you Lower the dumbbells down by bending your elbows Stop before the dumbbells reach your forehead Extend your arms to return to the starting position

Lie on your back on a flat bench with feet firmly on the ground Holding the dumbbells, extend your arms straight up toward the ceiling Lower the dumbbells by bending your elbows and making sure to keep your elbows pointed towards the ceiling Pause for a moment when the dumbbells are near your forehead, then push back up to the starting position Repeat for the desired amount of repetitions

name_en: Dumbbell Lying Triceps Extension on Floor
description_en: Lie down on the floor, and extend your arms straight up while holding dumbbells Slowly bend your elbows to lower the weights down towards your head Pause for a moment, then extend your arms straight up again, flexing your triceps Repeat this movement for your desired amount of repetitions

Lie down on your back with your legs extended and hold a dumbbell in both hands Raise your arms and legs to a point where the dumbbell nearly touches your shins Slowly lower both your arms and legs back down Try to keep your back flat on the ground as you're lowering your legs Repeat this movement while maintaining control

name_en: Dumbbell Military Press Russian Twist with Legs Floor Off
description_en: Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet elevated Hold a dumbbell with both hands at the chest Engage your core and lean back slightly Rotate your torso to one side, bringing the dumbbell to that side Repeat the movement on the other side

name_en: Dumbbell Military Press Russian Twist with Legs Floor Off
description_en: Start by sitting on the floor with your legs off the ground and knees slightly bent Holding a dumbbell with both hands, extend your arms in front you at about chest height Rotate your upper body to the right as you press the dumbbell upwards into a military press Lower the dumbbell while rotating your upper body to the left in a controlled motion Repeat this movement, alternating sides each time

Stand tall with your back straight, feet hip-width apart, and hold dumbbells in your hands near your hips. Lower your hips to the floor while bending your knees. As your thighs become parallel to the floor, return to the initial position, and repeat.

name_en: Dumbbell One Arm Bent over Row
description_en: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and have a dumbbell in one hand Bend over slightly keeping your back straight Pull the dumbbell up to the side of your chest Lower the weight back down in a controlled manner Repeat the same steps with the other arm

Lie flat on the floor, clutching a dumbbell in one hand With your arm fully extended, slowly lower the dumbbell out to the side of your body Pause and keep your arm slightly bent Lift the dumbbell back to the starting position Repeat and then switch to the other arm.

Stand upright holding a dumbbell in one hand Lift the dumbbell in front of you to shoulder height, keeping your arm straight Pause briefly, then lower the dumbbell back down in a controlled manner Repeat the movement with the other arm Continue to alternate between arms for the desired number of repetitions
Stand straight and hold the dumbbell in one hand Extend your arm forward until it is parallel to the ground Slowly lower the dumbbell back to your side Repeat and switch to the other arm

name_en: Dumbbell One Arm Hammer Preacher Curl
description_en: Sit on the preacher bench and adjust the height so your armpit lightly touches the top of the pad Hold the dumbbell in your hand with a neutral grip Curl the dumbbell towards your shoulder while keeping your upper arm stationary Hold at the top for a brief second and squeeze your biceps Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position

Start by holding a dumbbell in one hand, bend over at the waist and brace yourself with your free hand on a bench. With your upper arm parallel to the floor, extend your elbow until your arm is straight. Slowly bend your elbow to return to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions. Remember to do the exercise for both arms.

Hold a dumbbell in one hand and kneel on a bench with the other knee and hand. Keep your elbow at a 90-degree angle and raise your arm until it's parallel to the ground. Extend your forearm backward until your arm is fully extended. Slowly lower your arm back to the starting position. Repeat the same steps with your other arm.

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing in Keep your back straight, brace your core, and then slowly lift the dumbbell directly to the side until your arm is parallel with the ground Pause, then lower the dumbbell back down slowly to the starting position Repeat these steps for your desired number of reps then switch arms The non-working arm can be left hanging at the side or placed on the hip

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in one hand, your palm facing in While keeping your torso stationary, lift the dumbbell to your side until your arm is parallel to the floor Slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position Repeat on the other arm while alternating after each set Keep your movements controlled with a light squeeze at the top of the motion

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab a dumbbell in one hand near your thigh with an overhand grip. Raise the dumbbell by extending your arm wide to your side. As the dumbbell reaches shoulder level, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand upright and hold a dumbbell in one hand. Extend your arm to the side and slightly bent at the elbow. Rotate your arm towards the front of your body as if you are performing a fly motion. Slowly bring the dumbbell back to the starting position. Repeat the move with the other arm.

name_en: Dumbbell One Arm Reverse Preacher Curl
description_en: Sit on a preacher bench and hold a dumbbell in one hand, making sure your upper arm and elbow are comfortably rested on the bench. Curl the dumbbell up in a semi-circle motion, bringing it towards your shoulder. Pause briefly at the top of the movement as you contract your biceps. Lower the dumbbell back down in a controlled manner until your arm is fully extended. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions before switching to the other arm.

name_en: Dumbbell One Arm Reverse Wrist Curl
description_en: Sit on a flat bench and hold a dumbbell with an underhand grip Place your forearm on your thigh with your wrist just beyond the knee Allow the dumbbell to roll down the palm towards the fingers Raise the dumbbell back up by flexing the wrist Repeat the exercise for the prescribed number of repetitions

name_en: Dumbbell One arm Revers Wrist Curl
description_en: Sit on a bench holding a dumbbell with an overhand grip, with your forearm resting on your thigh and your hand hanging over the end of your knee. Lower the dumbbell as far as possible, flexing your wrist. Raise the dumbbell as far as possible, extending your wrist. Repeat the motion for the number of repetitions and switch to the other hand.

Support your body on a bench by placing your knee and hand on it. Make sure your back is parallel to the floor and the free foot is firmly planted on the ground Pick up the dumbbell with your free hand, palm facing your body Slowly lift the dumbbell to your side, keeping your elbow close to your body Hold for a moment at the top, and then lower the dumbbell in a controlled manner

Place your knee and hand on a bench for support, with your other foot flat on the floor Hold a dumbbell in your free hand with your palm facing in Lift the dumbbell to your side, keeping your elbow close to your body Slowly lower the dumbbell back down, extending your arm fully

name_en: Dumbbell One Arm Seated Neutral Wrist Curl
description_en: Sit on a flat bench with a dumbbell in one hand, resting your forearm on your leg with your hand hanging off your knee Slowly lower the dumbbell, fully extending your wrist Curl the dumbbell upward as far as possible Squeeze your forearm muscles at the top of the movement Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions and then switch arms

Stand up straight holding a dumbbell in one hand at shoulder level Push the dumbbell straight up until your arm is near full extension Pause at the top of the movement for a second Lower the dumbbell slowly back down to shoulder level Repeat for desired reps and switch arms

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand. Lift the dumbbell to shoulder height, keeping your palm facing forward. Press the dumbbell straight up until your arm is fully extended. Lower the dumbbell back to your shoulder in a controlled motion. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch arms.

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the dumbbell in one hand between your legs Bend at your hips and knees to lower the dumbbell toward the floor Quickly stand up and pull the dumbbell toward the ceiling, extending your arm Hold for a moment at the top, and then lower the dumbbell back to the starting position Repeat with the other arm

Start with a dumbbell on the ground between your feet, bend your knees and hips to get into a squatting position Grab the dumbbell with one hand and lift it overhead in one single fluid motion Extend through your hip and knee to assist the lift Lower the weight back down to the ground in a controlled manner Perform the same steps with your other hand

Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding the dumbbell in one hand Hinge at your hips, lowering the dumbbell between your legs Drive through your hips to swing the dumbbell up to shoulder height Let the dumbbell fall back down between your legs, bending at your hips Repeat the movement

Lie down on your back on a flat bench Hold a dumbbell in one hand and extend your arm directly above you Slowly bend your arm at the elbow, bringing the dumbbell towards your shoulder Extend your arm back to the original position Switch arms and repeat the process

Stand up straight holding a dumbbell in one hand. Raise the dumbbell above your head until your arm is fully extended. Bend your elbow to lower the dumbbell behind your head. Lift the dumbbell back up by extending your elbow. Switch arms after completing your set.

Lie down on a bench holding a dumbbell in one hand Extend your arm up until it's straight keeping the elbow in place Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position Repeat the movements for your desired number of reps Change arms and repeat the same process

name_en: Dumbbell One Arm Wide Grip Bench Press
description_en: Lay on a flat bench holding a dumbbell on one hand, arm extended straight up Slowly lower the dumbbell until your elbow is slightly below the bench level Press the dumbbell back up until your arm is fully extended Repeat for the desired number of repetitions Switch arms and repeat

Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the floor. Rest your forearm on your thigh with your palm facing upwards and your wrist just beyond the edge of your knee Hold the dumbbell and let it roll down to the tips of your fingers. Curl your wrist upward, lifting the dumbbell as high as possible. Pause at the top before slowly lowering the dumbbell back to the starting position.

Sit on the edge of a bench or chair with your feet flat on the floor Grasp the dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing upwards Rest your forearm on your thigh, letting the dumbbell hang over the edge of the knee Curl your wrist upward, lifting the weight Lower the weight back down to the starting position

name_en: Dumbbell One Arm Zottman Preacher Curl
description_en: Sit in a preacher bench, hold a dumbbell in one hand with an underhand grip Raise the dumbbell until your elbow is slightly bent Rotate your wrist so you are now gripping the dumbbell with an overhand grip Lower the dumbbell slowly Reset your grip to underhand and repeat with the other arm

name_en: Dumbbell One Arm Zottman Preacher Curl
description_en: Sit on the preacher bench and rest your arm on the pad, holding a dumbbell in your hand Curl the dumbbell up while keeping your arm stationary and your palm facing upward At the top of the movement, rotate your wrist so your palm faces downward Slowly lower the dumbbell while your palm continues to face downward At the bottom of the movement, rotate your wrist back to start position

name_en: Dumbbell Over Bench One Arm Neutral Wrist Curl
description_en: Sit on a bench, one hand on your knee and the other holding a dumbbell with a neutral grip With your forearm resting on your thigh, slowly lower the dumbbell towards the floor Pause at the bottom for a moment before curling the weight back up Squeeze your forearm at the top before slowly lowering the weight back down Repeat for the desired number of repetitions and then switch arms

name_en: Dumbbell Over Bench Revers Wrist Curl
description_en: Sit on a bench and hold a dumbbell in each hand Lean forward and rest your forearms on your knees, letting the weights hang down Curl your wrists upward towards your body Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position Repeat the motion for the desired amount of repetitions

Sit on the edge of a bench with your feet flat on the floor Rest your forearms on your thighs with your palms facing up while holding the dumbbells Let the dumbbells roll down your fingers, flex your wrist and curl the dumbbells back up Lower the dumbbells until your wrists are in full extension Repeat for the desired amount of reps

Sit on a bench and hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing up Rest your forearms on your thighs and allow your wrists to hang over the edge of the bench Slowly lower the dumbbells as far as comfortably possible Curl the dumbbells toward your forearms Lower the dumbbells back down in a controlled movement

Sit down on a bench with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab a dumbell with both hands while extending your arms overhead and bending your elbows to a 90-degree angle. Raise the dumbbell by straightening your arms overhead. As your arms become fully extended, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab a dumbbell with both hands while extending your arms overhead and bending your elbows to a 90-degree angle. Raise the dumbbell by straightening your arms overhead. As your arms become fully extended, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand holding a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your body. Slowly raise the dumbbells above your head until your arms are completely straight. Take a step forward with your right foot and lower your body until your right knee is bent at a 90-degree angle. Push up off your right foot to raise back to the starting position. Repeat with left foot. Perform the desired amount of repetitions.

Start by laying flat on your back with a dumbbell in both hands, arms extended towards the ceiling Engage your core and lift your upper body off the floor while keeping your arms extended Your goal is to reach a sitting position, with arms still extended Lower yourself back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the process for the desired number of reps

name_en: Dumbbell Overhead Sit-up with Legs on Bench
description_en: Start by sitting on a flat bench with your legs secured under the pad Hold the dumbbell with both hands overhead While keeping your lower body stationary, begin to roll your upper body backwards Return to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the dumbbell with both hands above your head Begin to lower yourself by bending at the knees, making sure to keep your back straight Lower yourself until your thighs are parallel with the floor Push yourself back up to your initial standing position Keep the dumbbell over your head during the entire exercise

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the dumbbell with both hands overhead. Slowly bend your knees to lower into a squat, pushing your hips back and down. Keep your chest up and your heels on the ground. Squat down until your hips are ideally below your knees. Extend your legs to return to standing, maintaining the dumbbell overhead throughout the movement. Repeat the movement for a series of reps.

Sit on a flat bench with your legs spread and the dumbbell between them Pick up the dumbbell with your right hand (palm facing forward) and lean over your right leg With your elbow on your thigh, make sure your arm is extended and the dumbbell is over the floor Curl the weight as you twist your wrist (palm facing up) Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position, repeat the process and switch arms after the set

Bend at the hips and knees and hold a dumbbell in each hand Keep your spine neutral and your shoulders pulled back Pull the dumbbells towards your ribs, rotating your palms inward as you lift Lower the weights back to starting position, rotating your palms back to the original position Repeat for the prescribed number of repetitions

Hold a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing towards body Bend over at the waist with knees slightly bent, keeping the back straight Lift the dumbbells to your side while rotating your wrists inward Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to start position, rotating your wrists back to the initial position Repeat for the required number of repetitions

Position yourself on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level Press the dumbbells up until your arms are extended Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position at a controlled pace Maintain your palms facing each other throughout the exercise Repeat the process for the desired number of repetitions

Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides Keep your back straight and bend at the knees to lower your body Pause at the bottom of the squat for a moment Push through your heels to return to a standing position Repeat this motion

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended. Keep the elbows close to the torso and rotate the palms of your hand until they are facing your torso. Curl the weights while contracting your biceps as you breathe out. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to starting position as your breathe in.

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and dumbbells in your hands at arm's length Keep your elbows close to your torso and rotate the palm of your hands until they are facing forward Curl the weights while contracting your biceps, and keep the movement only in the forearms At the top of the movement, push further with your forearms to move the dumbbell a little extra Slowly bring the dumbbells back to the starting position

Start in a plank position with a dumbbell in each hand under your shoulders Jump your legs out to the sides as if doing a jumping jack Jump your legs back together Repeat for desired number of repetitions Keep your back flat and body in a straight line throughout the movement

Start in a high plank position with a dumbbell conveniently placed next to one of your hands Reach underneath your body with the opposite hand, grab the dumbbell and pass it across to the other side Replace your hand down and keep your body as still as possible Now, reach under your body with the other hand and pass the dumbbell back to the start side Continue this process for the desired number of repetitions
Start in a plank position while holding the dumbbells on the ground Pull one dumbbell towards your waist Lower the dumbbell back to the ground Repeat with the other arm Continue alternating

Start by standing straight with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand Squat down until thighs are parallel to the floor Jump upwards explosively, extending the legs and driving through the heels Land softly, immediately lowering into a squat to prepare for the next explosive jump Repeat the exercise for your desired number of repetitions

Hold a pair of dumbbells at your sides, stand with your feet hip-width apart. Lower your body into a deep squat, keep your chest up and knees over your toes. Press your feet into the ground to jump as high as you can. Land softly, and immediately lower into your next squat. Repeat the process for a set of reps.

Sit on the preacher bench and adjust the height so your upper arms rest comfortably on the padding. Hold the dumbbell in your hand with your arm fully extended. Curl the dumbbell up until your forearm is vertical, pause briefly at the top of the curl. Slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, before switching to the other arm.

Sit on an inclined bench with the torso angled slightly to one side Hold the dumbbell with a neutral grip Curl the dumbbell upward keeping the upper arms stationary Pause at the top of your curl Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position

Sit on the preacher bench and adjust the height so that your upper arms are comfortably resting on the padding. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing upward. Slowly curl the weights up towards your shoulders. Pause at the top of the movement for a second. Slowly lower the weights back to the starting position.

name_en: Dumbbell Preacher Curl over Exercise Ball
description_en: Sit on the exercise ball, holding a dumbbell in each hand Rest one of your elbows on your thigh and let your arm fully extend With a controlled motion, curl the dumbbell towards your chest Pause briefly at the highest point, then lower the dumbbell back to the starting position Repeat the exercise with your other arm

name_en: Dumbbell Preacher Curl over Exercise Ball
description_en: Sit down on your exercise ball, back straight and feet flat on the floor. Hold the dumbbell with your right hand while your left arm supports your right elbow. Bend your elbow and lift the dumbbell towards your shoulder. Lower the dumbbell slowly back down to the starting position. Repeat with the left arm.

Stand straight with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulders level with an overhand grip Lower your body into a squat position while keeping your chest upright Push back up to the starting position while pressing the dumbbells above your head Lower the dumbbells back to shoulders level while going back into the squat position Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Dumbbell Pronated to Neutral Grip Row
description_en: Position yourself bent over, keeping your back straight and knees slightly bent Hold the dumbbell in hand, palm facing down Pull the dumbbell up until it touches your chest Pause, then lower it back down in a controlled manner Switch your grip to neutral and repeat the movement

Sit or stand with a dumbbell in each hand, your palms facing each other Extend your arms to raise the weights above your head Bend at the elbows to lower the weights to either side of your head Then push up back to the initial position Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the dumbbell in both hands. Extend your arms straight above your head so that the dumbbell is vertically aligned with your body. Bend your elbows to slowly lower the dumbbell behind your head. Raise the dumbbell back up by extending your elbows until you reach the starting position. Repeat the exercise for the required amount of reps.

Lie face down on an incline bench and hold a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso. Keep your upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting the biceps as you breathe out, focusing only on the forearms. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a moment as you squeeze the biceps. Slowly bring the dumbbells back to the original position as you breathe in.

Lay down on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand Extend arms out to the sides, parallel from the ground, keep a slight bend in your elbows throughout Raise both dumbbells until your arms are almost perpendicular to your body Lower dumbbells back down in a slow, controlled movement to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Position yourself on an incline bench, face down, with a dumbbell in each hand and arms fully extended Slowly curl the dumbbells towards your shoulders Hold at the top of the movement for a second Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position

Lie prone on an incline bench and hold a dumbbell in each hand, arm extended Curl the weights while keeping your upper arms stationary Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted Hold the contracted position for a brief moment as you squeeze your biceps Slowly lower the weights back to the starting position

Lie face down on an incline bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand Let your arms hang straight down, palms facing each other Curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders keeping your elbows locked in place Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the start position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing each other Curl the weights while keeping your palms facing each other until your thumbs are near your shoulders Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position Repeat for the specified amount of repetitions

Position yourself face down on an incline bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand Extend your arms directly beneath your shoulders with palms facing each other Swing the weights out to the sides until they are level with your body Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions

Lie down on a flat bench face-down and hold a dumbbell in each hand Extend your arms straight in front of you Raise the dumbbells to the sides and upwards, forming a 'W' shape with your body Lower the dumbbells back until they're parallel with your body Repeat the motions for the specific number of reps

Lie down on your back on a bench, holding a dumbbell with both hands, arms extended over your chest Slowly lower the dumbbells back over your head, keeping your arms straight Pause when your arms are parallel to the floor Raise the dumbbells back over your chest Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps

Lie down on a flat bench, holding a single dumbbell with both hands above your chest Lower the dumbbell in an arc behind your head while keeping your arms slightly bent Pull the dumbbell back up in the same arcing motion until it is above your chest Keep your hips and shoulders on the bench at all times Return to the starting position and repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Lie on a bench with your feet firmly on the ground Hold a dumbbell over your chest with both hands Lower the weight in an arc behind your head Pull the dumbbell back to the starting position over your chest Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Dumbbell Pullover Hip Extension on Exercise Ball
description_en: Lie face up on an exercise ball, feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell with both hands above your chest Lower the dumbbell behind your head while moving your hips downward Pull the dumbbell back up to the starting position while lifting your hips Keep your arms straight and your hips aligned with your body during the movement Repeat for the desired number of reps

Sit on the exercise ball with your feet planted hip-width apart on the floor Hold the dumbbell overhead with both hands under the inner plate of the dumbbell Keeping the arms straight, lower the dumbbell back behind your head Slowly raise the dumbbell back overhead to the starting position Repeat this for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on the exercise ball and roll forwards while keeping the dumbbell close to your chest Lower your upper back and shoulders onto the ball, with your feet flat on the floor Push the dumbbell up towards the ceiling while keeping your arms slightly bent Lower the dumbbell back down, moving it over the crown of your head Bring the dumbbell up to starting position in a controlled manner

Lie flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell with both hands over your chest Use your chest muscles to lift the dumbbell towards the ceiling Lower the weight in a controlled manner back to the start position Pause briefly at the top and bottom of each rep Keep your arms slightly bent to avoid elbow strain

Start by standing with a dumbbell in each hand, positioning them at shoulder level with palms facing each other Bend your knees and push your hips back to initiate the movement As you ascend, push the dumbbells upward and straighten your legs Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder level as you bend your knees again Repeat this motion for the prescribed number of repetitions

Stand with feet hip width apart holding the dumbbells at shoulder level Bend your knees slightly and then quickly extend them Simultaneously, push the dumbbells straight up using your shoulders and extending your arms Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder level in controlled manner Repeat the exercise for your desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight and hold a dumbbell in your hand near your hip. Lean forward while bending your one knee slightly and take the dumbbell towards the floor while extending your corresponding leg backward. Hold this position for a while and return to the initial position. Repeat.

Bend at your waist with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand Keeping your back straight, lift the dumbbells to the side until your arms are parallel to the ground Hold for a moment when your arms are at the highest point Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position Repeat the action for the required amount of repetitions

Stand upright and hold the dumbbells with a neutral grip Bend over slightly at the hip with your knees slightly bent Raise the dumbbells straight out to the sides until they're at shoulder level Pause for a moment, then lower the weights back to the starting position

Stand up and hold the dumbbells in each hand Bend the knees slightly and bend over as far as possible keeping your back straight Raise both dumbbells straight out to the sides until your elbows are shoulder height Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner

Bend over at the waist keeping your back straight Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing the body Pull the dumbbells towards your chest, keeping the elbows close to the body Lower the dumbbells in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand upright with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing inwards Bend over at the waist keeping your back straight and legs slightly bent Lift the dumbbells upward until they are at the level of your chest Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position Repeat the process for your desired number of reps

Bend at the waist while keeping your back flat Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing each other Raise the dumbbells out to the side until your arms are parallel to the floor Lower the dumbbells in a controlled manner back to the starting position Repeat the movement for your desired number of repetitions

Bend your upper body slightly and maintain a flat back Extend your arms and hold a dumbbell in each hand Lift the dumbbells to the side until your elbows are level with your shoulders Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Bend over with a slight bend in your knees, holding a dumbbell in each hand Keep your back flat as you lift the dumbbells to the side, maintaining a slight bend in your elbows Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement Slowly lower the dumbbells to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Sit on the edge of a bench and lean forward until chest nearly touches thighs Hold the dumbbells with palms facing each other Keep a slight bend in your elbows Raise your arms out to the side until they are in line with your shoulders Slowly lower the weights back to the starting position

Stand straight while holding a dumbbell in each hand Step backwards with one foot, landing on the ball of the foot while bending both knees Push up through your front foot to return to the starting position Repeat for the desired amount of reps, then switch legs Keep your torso upright throughout the exercise

Hold a dumbbell in each hand and stand upright Step backwards with your right foot, bending both knees to lower your body Push back up to the start position using your front foot Repeat with the left leg Alternate legs until the set is complete

Stand straight and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Step one foot onto a step or raised platform about knee height. With control, step backwards with the other foot into a lunge, bending both knees. Press through your front heel to step back up to the starting position. Switch the lunging foot and repeat.

Get into a high plank position, holding a dumbbell in each hand Pull the dumbbell in your right hand up to your chest, keeping your elbow tight to your body Lower the dumbbell back to the floor in a controlled manner Repeat on the left side. That's one rep. Do the desired number of reps.

Begin in a high plank position with a dumbbell in each hand, directly under your shoulders Keeping your body still and core engaged, lift one dumbbell to your side, squeezing your shoulder blade Lower the dumbbell back to the ground slowly Repeat this process with the other hand Continue to alternate sides for the desired number of reps

Start by lying flat on your back on a bench, dumbbells in hand Bend your elbows and lower the dumbbells towards your shoulders Press the dumbbells back up until your arms are fully extended above your chest Ensure your movements are controlled and slow, not letting the weights touch at the top Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Bend at your waist with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing each other Raise dumbbells to the side of your body, maintaining a slight bend at the elbows Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position

Stand straight with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your torso. Curl the weights while keeping your palms facing down. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a brief moment, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Sit on an incline bench facing forward with a dumbbell in each hand Lower the dumbbells towards the floor, fully extending your arms Pull the dumbbells up towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled fashion Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Stand up straight holding a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your torso Bend your upper body forward from the hips while keeping your back straight Keep your torso still and lift the dumbbells towards your body Hold the contraction at the top for a moment, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position

Lie face down on a bench, with your hips on the edge of the bench Hold dumbbell between your feet Raise your legs as high as they will go, keeping them straight Lower your legs to the starting position Repeat the exercise for the desired amount of reps

Stand on an elevated surface, hold dumbbells at your side. Step back with one foot into a lunge position. Lower your body until your front knee is at a 90-degree angle. Return to the start position by pushing through your front heel. Switch and repeat with your opposite leg.

name_en: Dumbbell Reverse Lunge On The Spot
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold dumbbells in your hands near your shoulder. Take a step back with your right foot and lower yourself unless your left thigh is parallel to the floor. Hold for a while, then return to the initial position and repeat by stepping back with your left foot.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold dumbbells in your hands near your shoulder. Take a step back with your right foot and lower yourself down. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, pulse downward 2-3 times and use its recoil to return back to a standing position.

Start by holding a dumbbell in one hand with your elbow extended Curl the dumbbell upwards while keeping your elbow stablized on the bench Pause at the top for a moment before slowly lowering the dumbbell back down Repeat the movement with the other arm Maintain the same motion for your desired number of sets and reps

Lie flat on your back on the floor, each hand holding a dumbbell Extend your arms straight up, palms facing your feet Lower the dumbbells by bending your elbows until they are at a 90-degree angle Press the dumbbells back up by extending your arms to the starting position Repeat the exercise

Start in a seated position with the dumbbell held over your head with both hands Lower the dumbbell behind your head, flexing at the elbows Press the dumbbell back up to the starting position Keep your elbows close to your head throughout the move Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Lay face down on an inclined bench with a dumbbell in each hand Keep your arms fully extended downward Curl the dumbbells towards your shoulders Pause momentarily, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position Repeat for the desired amount of repetitions

Sit on a flat bench and lean forward slightly Hold the dumbbell with your palm facing down Slowly curl the dumbbell up as far as possible Pause at the top, then reverse the curl and lower the weight in a controlled manner Repeat

Start by holding a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your torso Keep your elbows close to your torso at all times Curl the weights while keeping your palms face your torso Continue to raise the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level Lower the dumbbells back down in a controlled manner

Start in a kneeling position with a dumbbell in front of you Grip the dumbbell handle with both hands Slowly roll the dumbbell forward, extending your body into a straight position Pause briefly, then pull yourself back to the starting position Continue the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your torso Bend at your hips as you lower the weights straight down, keeping your back straight Lower the weights to a comfortable level then raise yourself back to the starting position Squeeze your glutes at the top of the movement Repeat for the desired amount of repetitions

Stand holding a dumbbell in each hand with your feet hip-width apart Bend your hips back as far as you can Allow slight bend in your knees Lower the dumbbells to just past your knees Thrust your hips forward and stand up straight to return to the start

name_en: Dumbbell Romanian Deadlift to Bent Over Row
description_en: Stand up straight holding a dumbbell in each hand, knees slightly bent and feet shoulder-width apart Bend at your hips and lower your torso until it's parallel to the floor Pull the dumbbells to your ribs by squeezing your shoulder blades together Lower the weight back down, then straighten your body back to the starting position Repeat for desired number of reps

Start by sitting on the floor with your knees bent, holding a dumbbell with both hands Lean back slightly and lift your feet off the ground Twist your torso to one side, bringing the dumbbell to the same side Then twist your torso to the other side, bringing the dumbbell to the other side to complete one rep Repeat this motion, maintaining balance throughout the exercise

name_en: Dumbbell Russian Twist with Legs Floor Off
description_en: Sit on the floor with your knees bent while holding the dumbbell in front of you Lean back slightly with your torso to create a V-shape with your thighs Lift your feet off the ground and cross them at the ankles Twist your torso to the right, then to the left to complete one rep Keep your balance and repeat for the desired number of reps

name_en: Dumbbell Russian Twist with Legs Floor Off
description_en: Sit on the ground with your knees bent, feet lifted slightly off the ground and hold a dumbbell with both hands in front of you Lean back to engage your core, your back should be at a 45-degree angle to the floor Rotate your torso and dumbbell to the right, then to the left to complete one repetition Keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight and your feet shoulder-width apart Lean forward and grab the dumbbells near your thighs with straight arms and your palms facing each other Raise the dumbbells by folding your arms and taking your elbows past your back Return to the initial position by straightening your arms and repeat

name_en: Dumbbells bent over row pronated grip
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and your feet shoulder-width apart Lean forward and grab the dumbbells in front of your thighs with straight arms and an overhand grip Raise the dumbbells by folding your arms and taking your elbows past your back Return to the initial position by straightening your arms and repeat

Sit on a flat bench holding a pair of dumbbells at shoulder level, palms facing each other. Without changing the angle of your hands, press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Sit on a flat bench holding the dumbbells at arms length down by your sides Curl one dumbbell up towards your shoulder while keeping the other dumbbell at rest Slowly lower the dumbbell to the start position Repeat the same movement with the other arm Continue alternating between both arms

Start by sitting on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your body. Raise one dumbbell straight in front of you until it is at shoulder height while exhaling. Lower the dumbbell back down while inhaling. Repeat the process with the other arm. Continue alternating arms for the desired number of repetitions.

name_en: Dumbbell Seated Alternate Overhead Triceps Extension
description_en: Sit on a bench with the dumbbell held in both hands. Your arms should be fully extended at 90 degrees in the air. Keeping your elbows stationary, lower the dumbbell behind your head until your forearms touch your biceps. Use your triceps to raise the dumbbell back to the starting position. Repeat the process for the desired number of repetitions. Switch hands and repeat the process.

Sit on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level. Raise one dumbbell until it is fully extended over your head, while keeping the other at shoulder level. Lower that dumbbell back to shoulder level while simultaneously raising the other dumbbell. Repeat this motion, alternating between each hand.

Sit on a bench with back support, holding a dumbbell in each hand Lift each dumbbell to shoulder level, palms should face forward Raise one dumbbell until it's above your head and your arm is fully extended Slowly lower the dumbbell back to shoulder level Repeat with the other arm

Sit on the bench with your back straight and feet firmly planted on the ground Hold the dumbbell with both hands and extend the arms above your head Bend your elbows and lower the dumbbell behind your head until your elbows are at 90 degrees Extend your elbows, raising the dumbbell back to the start position Repeat this motion for your desired number of repetitions

name_en: Dumbbell Seated Bent Arm Lateral raise
description_en: Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the floor Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, with your palms facing your torso Bend your elbows slightly and raise your arms to the sides until they're at shoulder height Slowly lower your arms back down to the initial position Repeat the motion for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Dumbbell Seated Bent Arm Lateral Raise
description_en: Sit on a bench with dumbbells in each hand on your sides. Bend your elbows at a 90 degree angle. Raise your arms laterally until they are parallel to the ground. Pause for a second at the top position. Lower the weights back down to your sides in a controlled motion.

Sit on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor. Position the dumbbell on your knee, closer to your ankle. Raise your heels as high as possible. Hold for a moment at the top, then lower your heels back down gently. Repeat the exercise for your desired amount of reps.

Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and a dumbbell on your knees. Lift your heels by pushing off the balls of your feet while keeping the dumbbell steady. Lower your heels back to the ground in a slow and controlled manner. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions. Switch to the other leg and repeat.

Sit on a bench with back support, holding a set of dumbbells at shoulder width apart with palms facing forward. Push the dumbbells up and together until your arms are fully extended. Pause at the top for optimal muscle contraction. Slowly lower the dumbbells to the starting position. Repeat the process for the desired number of repetitions.

Sit on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, allowing them to hang at arm's length Keep your elbows close to your torso and rotate your palms to face forward Curl the weights while contracting your biceps, keep the movement only in your forearms Hold the contracted position for a brief moment as you squeeze your biceps Slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position

Sit on a bench with your legs spread and a dumbbell in each hand. Curl the weights while keeping your elbows close to your body. Lift the dumbbells until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contraction for a second and exhale. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position while inhaling.

Sit on a bench with feet flat on the floor and spread wide. Grab the dumbbells and let them hang down, palms facing forward. Bend your elbows slightly and keep them locked in this position for the course of the exercise. Curl the dumbbells upwards by flexing the elbows, until they reach shoulder level. Hold the position for a moment once top movement is achieved. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the original position.

Sit on a bench holding a pair of dumbbells on your thighs with your palms facing upwards. Pull the weight towards your shoulder while keeping your upper arms stationary. Pause at the top and squeeze your biceps. Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Start seated at the edge of a bench with the elbow of your working arm resting on your knee. Hold a dumbbell in your hand with a neutral grip. Rotate your arm outward, raising the dumbbell until it is parallel to the floor. Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position, controlling the motion. Repeat this motion for your desired number of repetitions.

Sit on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing towards your body Keep your elbows slightly bent, raise the dumbbells in front of you until they are at shoulder level Lower the dumbbells back down in a controlled motion to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your thighs With a slight bend in your elbows, lift the dumbbells in front of you up to shoulder height Pause at the top before lowering the dumbbells back to the starting position Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Sit on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing inwards Bend your elbows and curl the dumbbells towards your shoulders Pause briefly at the top of the movement Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position Repeat this movement for the desired number of repititions

Sit upright and hold a dumbbell in each hand Keep your elbows close to your torso Curl the weights while keeping your palms facing inwards Pause at the top for a moment Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position

Sit on the edge of a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand Keep your upper arms close to your body and your forearms pointed towards the floor Raise the dumbbells backwards until your arms are fully extended Pause for a moment, then lower the weights back to the initial position in a controlled manner Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Sit down with your knees bent and a dumbbell in each hand Bend your upper body forward from the waist up while keeping back straight Pull your elbows to your sides and point them towards the back Straighten your arms and push the dumbbells back Slowly lower the Dumbbells back to initial position

Sit on an exercise bench with back support holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides Bend your elbows slightly and raise your arms out to the sides until they are at shoulder level Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the weights back down to your sides Repeat for the desired number of repetitions Do not swing the weight, use your shoulder muscles to lift and lower the weight

Sit on a bench with your back straight and a pair of dumbbells on either side With a slight bend in your elbows, raise the dumbbells out to the sides Continue raising the weights until they are in line with your shoulders Pause at the top of the movement Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position

Sit on a flat bench holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides Keep your back straight and your head up Raise your arms to your sides until they are at shoulder level Lower the dumbbells back down to your side in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended and palms facing each other Bend your elbows slightly and raise your arms to the sides until they're parallel with the floor Hold for a brief moment at the top and then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the start position Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions Keep your torso stationary throughout the exercise

name_en: Dumbbell Seated Military Hold Alternate Leg Raise on Floor
description_en: Sit on the floor with your feet flat and knees bent Hold a dumbbell in both hands at shoulder level Raise one leg off the floor, keeping it straight Hold this position for a few seconds Alternate and repeat with the other leg

name_en: Dumbbell Seated Military Press In Out Leg Raise on Floor
description_en: Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you Hold a dumbbell in each hand at the level of your shoulders Press the dumbbells upwards until your arms are fully extended At the same time, raise your legs off the floor into a 'V' shape Lower both your arms and legs in a controlled manner

Sit on the edge of a bench or chair with your feet firmly on the floor Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing each other Rest your forearms on your thighs, palms still in neutral position. Let your wrists and the dumbbells hang over your knees Make sure your wrists are upright and curl the dumbbells towards your forearms Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner

Sit on a flat bench and grab a dumbbell with your palm facing inwards. Rest your arm on your thigh with the weight hanging off your knee. Slowly curl the weight upwards while keeping your forearm on your thigh. Pause briefly at the top of the curl. Return the weight to the starting position.

name_en: Dumbbell Seated One Leg Calf Raise Hammer Grip
description_en: Sit on a bench and rest your foot on the floor while holding a dumbbell on your knee Press down into the ball of your foot to raise your body upward Pause at the top of the movement for a second Lower your heel back to the floor

Sit on the edge of a seated preacher bench and place your armpits on the top of the bench's pad Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing up Curl the dumbbells up until your biceps are fully contracted Lower the dumbbells back down to starting position Repeat for the desired amount of reps

Sit on a bench and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level, palms facing your body. In a smooth motion, rotate your palms outward as you push the dumbbells up and over your head. Pause at the top of the lift before slowly rotating your palms toward your body as you lower the dumbbells back to shoulder level. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions. Maintain good posture throughout the movement, keeping your chest high and back straight.

name_en: Dumbbell Seated Revers grip Concentration Curl
description_en: Sit on a flat bench with a dumbbell in your hand, your palm facing upward Bend at the waist and rest your elbow against your knee Flex your elbow, raising the dumbbell toward your shoulder Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position Repeat for the prescribed number of repetitions and then switch arms

Sit on a bench with a back support. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at the shoulders, with an overhand grip. Press the weights upward until your arms are fully extended over your shoulders. Pause briefly at the top. Slowly lower the weights back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Sit on a bench with back support, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level Push the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended Hold the top position for a second to maximize the contraction Slowly lower the dumbbells back to your shoulders Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on a bench with back support, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level Push upwards until your arms are fully extended Lower the dumbbells back down to the shoulder level in a controlled manner Repeat the movement for the desired amount of repetitions Ensure your back is flat against the bench during the entire exercise

Sit on a flat bench with a dumbbell in your right hand, resting it on your right thigh. Keep your back straight, maintain an upright posture and look straight ahead. Lean to your right side, allowing the dumbbell to slightly slide down your thigh. Push back to your starting position by contracting your obliques. Repeat this motion. After finishing the reps for one side, switch the dumbbell to your left hand and perform the same steps.

name_en: Dumbbell Seated Single Arm Front Raise
description_en: Sit on a flat bench with a dumbbell in one hand Rest your arm on your thigh, palm facing down Raise the dumbbell in front of you until your arm is parallel to the ground Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position Repeat for the other arm

name_en: Dumbbell Seated Single Arm Overhead Triceps Extension
description_en: Start by sitting on a bench with the dumbbell in one hand. Your palm should be facing inwards. Bend at your elbow, extending the dumbbell behind you until it's about head level. Slowly lift the dumbbell back up by extending your arm, until it's fully extended. Try to keep your arm close to your head throughout the exercise. Hold for a moment at the top before lowering the weight. Repeat the process with the other arm.

name_en: Dumbbell Seated Single Arm Overhead Triceps Extension
description_en: Sit on a bench with your back straight and feet planted on the ground Hold a dumbbell in your left hand and lift it overhead until your arm is fully extended Bend your elbow, lowering the dumbbell behind your head Press back up to fully extend your arm Repeat the movement for your desired number of repetitions

Sit on a bench with a back support. Hold a dumbbell in two hands and lift above your head with arms fully extended. Slowly bend your elbows to lower the dumbbell behind your head. Lift the dumbbell back to its initial position by extending your elbows. Repeat the motion for your desired number of reps

Sit on a bench and hold a dumbbell in both hands, positioned behind your head Extend your arms, raising the dumbbell above your head Slowly lower the dumbbell back behind your head Pause for a moment before repeating Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Dumbbell Shoulder Internal Rotation at 90 Abduction
description_en: Start with your elbow bent at a 90-degree angle at shoulder height, holding the dumbbell sideways. Rotate your shoulder, lowering the dumbbell in front of your body. Rotate back up to the starting position. Repeat for the prescribed number of repetitions. Change arms and repeat the steps.

Stand straight holding a dumbbell in each hand, allowing them to hang at arm length by your sides Keep your back straight, exhale and raise your shoulders as high as you can Pause at the top of the contraction then slowly lower your shoulders back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso Raise your shoulders as high as possible as if trying to touch your ears Pause at the top for a brief moment, then lower the dumbbells back to the initial position Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Stand straight with a dumbbell in one hand, feet shoulder-width apart Keep your back straight and bend to the side where you're holding the dumbbell Return to the original standing position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions Switch sides and repeat movement

Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding the dumbbell in your right hand Keep your back straight and bend at your waist to the right as far as possible Pause for a moment and then return to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps on one side, then switch to the other side

Lie on your right side with right elbow on the ground, directly under shoulder, and hold the dumbbell on left hand Position right hand onto left shoulder Push body up so that your weight is balanced between right elbow and right foot Lower your body back down to the starting position Repeat on the other side

name_en: Dumbbell Side Bridge with Bent Leg
description_en: Lay on your left side on a flat surface Hold the dumbbell with your right hand, arm fully extended upward Bend your right leg at the knee and put your right foot on the ground Raise your hips while keeping your body straight and tilted slightly toward the front Lower your body back to starting position

Stand straight and hold a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length. Step out to the side with one foot and squat down through your hips. Push off from the floor with the foot you stepped to the side. Return to your starting position by standing up straight. Repeat on the other side.

Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing inwards Take a large step to the side with your right foot and lunge towards the floor Make sure your right knee aligns with your right foot Push back to the starting position and repeat with the left foot Continue alternating sides for a full set

Stand straight holding a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length Step to the side with one leg and lower your body while keeping your other leg straight Push off your bent leg and return to the starting position Repeat the exercise on the opposite side Alternate sides with each repetition

Stand tall with your back straight, feet placed wider than shoulder-width, and hold the dumbbells in your hands near your hips. Take a step towards a side and lower yourself by bending your knee while straightening your other leg by pivoting on its heel. Hold momentarily, return to the initial position, and repeat by stepping on the other side.

name_en: Dumbbell Side Lunge Left N Right
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight, feet placed wider than shoulder-width, and hold the dumbbells in your hands near your hips. Take a step towards a side and lower yourself by bending your knee while straightening your other leg by pivoting on its heel. Hold momentarily, return to the initial position, and repeat by stepping on the other side.

Lie down on your side on a flat bench with the upper body supported. Hold the dumbbell in your top hand with a neutral grip. Bend your elbow to a 90 degree angle, keeping it close to your body. Rotate your forearm upward until it is vertical, then lower it back down to the original position. Switch sides and repeat with the other arm.

Lie on your side on a flat bench with your shoulder on the edge Hold a dumbbell in your upper hand with your elbow bent at 90 degrees, perpendicular to the floor Slowly rotate your arm at the shoulder to bring the dumbbell towards the floor Pause for a moment then slowly bring the dumbbell back to the starting position Repeat the movement for the required number of repetitions and then switch to the other side

name_en: Dumbbell Side Lying One Hand Raise
description_en: Lie down on your side, supporting your head with your hand Hold the dumbbell in your uppermost hand, keeping your arm straight Lift the dumbbell up in front of you, only using your shoulder Return the dumbbell down slowly to the starting position Switch sides and repeat with the other hand

Lie on your right side, right arm extended on the ground and left hand holding a dumbbell Raise your body by pushing up on your right arm, lifting your hip off the ground, while lifting the dumbbell in your left hand upward. Hold this position for a moment. Lower your body and the dumbbell back to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat the exercise on the other side.

Start in a side plank position, holding a dumbbell with your top hand Lift the dumbbell up towards your side, keeping your elbow close to your body Lower the dumbbell back down in a controlled manner Hold the side plank throughout the entire set Switch to the other side and repeat

name_en: Dumbbell Side Plank with Rear Fly
description_en: Start in a side plank position, holding a dumbbell in your upper hand. Lift the dumbbell straight up towards the ceiling while balancing on your other arm. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the initial position. Maintain a firm core throughout the exercise. Switch sides and repeat.

Hold a pair of dumbbells at arm's length by your sides, palms facing each other. Take a big step to the side with your left foot, then push your hips back, bend your left knee and lower your body until your left knee is bent 90 degrees. Push yourself back to the starting position. Repeat with the same leg for a set, then do the same number with your right leg. Perform equal reps on both sides.

name_en: Dumbbell Single Arm Alternate Decline Bench Press
description_en: Start by laying down on a decline bench with a dumbbell in one hand. Safely press the weight upwards until your arm is fully extended but not locked. Lower the dumbbell towards your chest in a controlled manner. Press back to the starting position while exhaling. Switch hands and repeat.

Lie down on a flat bench holding a dumbbell in your right hand resting on top of your thigh. Lift the dumbbell to shoulder height using your thigh to push it up into position. Your palm should be facing inwards. With a slight bend on your elbow, lower the weight slowly in an arc-like motion on your right side. Your arm should be perpendicular to the torso at the bottom of the move. Lift the dumbbell back to the starting position as you breathe out. Lock the arm at the top as you squeeze your chest muscles. Repeat the movement with the left hand. Continue to alternate sides.

Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand Push your hips back and lower the dumbbell towards the floor Drive through your heels to stand up straight, engaging your glutes Lower the dumbbell back to the floor in a controlled manner Repeat with the other hand

Lie flat on your back on the floor with a dumbbell in one hand. Contract your chest muscles to press the dumbbell straight up until your arm is fully extended. Pause momentarily at the top. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position. Repeat the motion for the desired number of repetitions, and then switch to the other arm.

name_en: Dumbbell Single arm Leaning Lateral Raise
description_en: Stand next to a wall or sturdy object, leaning slightly against it. Hold a dumbbell in your free hand. Begin with your hand facing inwards and your arm fully extended down. Keeping your back straight, raise your arm out to your side, perpendicular to your body, until it is about shoulder level. Pause briefly at the top of the motion. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.

name_en: Dumbbell Single Arm Neutral Grip Front Raise
description_en: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart holding a dumbbell in one hand Keep your elbow slightly bent and lift the dumbbell upwards in front of you until your arm is at about shoulder height Maintain a neutral grip with your palm facing your body throughout the movement Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise with the other arm

Stand tall holding a dumbbell in one hand Lift the dumbbell over your head, fully extending your arm Walk forward for a set distance or time while keeping the dumbbell overhead Lower the dumbbell carefully and switch hands Repeat with the other hand

With your feet hip-width apart, hold a dumbbell in your right hand. Extend your arm so the dumbbell is above your head Step forward with your left foot, lowering your body until your left knee is bent at a 90 degree angle Keep your core engaged and ensure your knee does not move past your toes Push back up to the starting position while keeping the dumbbell overhead Switch sides and repeat with the opposite legs and arms

Sit on a preacher bench and hold a dumbbell in one hand Rest your arm against the bench with your elbow and lower part of your arm on the pad Curl the dumbbell up until your arm is fully flexed Lower it back down in a controlled manner to complete one repetition Repeat this for your desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm

Stand straight with a dumbbell in one hand Lift your shoulder as if trying to touch it to your ear Pause at the top for a moment Slowly lower the dumbbell, returning your shoulder to the starting position Repeat the exercise with the other arm

Lie on your back on a bench, with your feet firmly planted on the ground. Hold a dumbbell with both hands, arms extended above your chest. Keep your elbows slightly bent and lower the dumbbell behind your head until your upper arms are in line with your torso. Pull the dumbbell back to the starting position above your chest. Repeat these movements for the desired number of repetitions.

Lay on your back with your legs and arms spread out like a starfish, holding a dumbbell in one hand Crunch up, lifting the leg on the same side as the dumbbell, and reach for that leg with the dumbbell Lower back down to the start position in a controlled manner Repeat the sequence for the desired reps Switch sides and repeat

name_en: Dumbbell Single Arm Underhand Front Raise
description_en: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Hold a dumbbell in one hand with an underhand grip Raise the dumbbell in front of you until your arm is parallel with the floor Pause, then slowly lower the weight back to the starting position Repeat for the required number of repetitions, then switch hands

Hold a dumbbell in your right hand and place your left hand on a stable surface for balance. Lift your right foot off the ground. Push your left heel upwards, raising your body on the ball of your left foot. Lower your body to the ground. Switch sides and repeat.

Stand upright and hold a dumbbell in one hand while standing on the same side's foot Slowly raise your body upwards by pushing down on the ball of your foot Pause momentarily at the top of the movement Lower yourself back down to the starting position in a controlled manner Switch the dumbbell to the other hand and repeat the movement with the opposite leg

Stand on one leg, while holding a dumbbell in the opposite hand Bend at your hips and lower your upper body as far as you can, letting your non-working leg trail behind you for balance Use your glutes to pull yourself back up to a standing position Switch and repeat with the opposite leg and arm Keep your core tight throughout the exercise

Stand on one leg, slightly bending that knee, and hold a dumbbell in the opposite hand While maintaining the slight knee bend, tilt forward, hinging at your hip, while lifting your other leg backward in line with your body Lower your upper body until it's parallel with the floor or you feel a stretch in your hamstring Reverse the motion, pushing your hips forward to stand upright Switch legs and repeat

Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Place a dumbbell over your pelvis Lift one foot off the floor and extend it forward Press your other foot into the floor and raise your hips until your body is in a straight line from shoulder to knee Lower your hips back to the floor

Lie on your back with your knees bent and keep one foot flat on the floor while the other foot is elevated Place the dumbbell on your hip, holding it with both hands to secure it Squeeze your glutes to lift your hips off the floor until your body forms a straight line Lower your hips back to the starting position Repeat these steps with the other leg

Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your arms fully extended at your sides Stand with one foot forward and the other foot back, balance the weight on the ball of your back foot Bend your knees and lower your body as far as comfortable Press through your forward heel and straighten your legs to return to the starting position Repeat for the prescribed number of repetitions, then switch legs and repeat

name_en: Dumbbell Single Leg Split Squat with Low Box
description_en: Stand up straight while holding a dumbbell on each hand. Place the toe of one foot on a low box behind you.
