Lower your body until your front knee is at a 90 degree angle, keeping your back straight. Drive through your front heel to stand back up, keeping the weight in your heel. Switch legs and repeat.

name_en: Dumbbell Single Leg Split Squat with the Ring
description_en: Hold a dumbbell in each hand by your sides Stand in front of a ring and place your rear foot on it Bend your front knee and lower your body until your front thigh is almost parallel to the ground Push back up to the starting position Switch legs and repeat

Stand on one leg, holding a dumbbell in each hand, at your sides Slowly bend at the knee and hip of the standing leg, lowering your body and the opposite leg as you maintain balance Go as low as you can, but not more than the point where your thigh of the standing leg is parallel to the floor Pushing through the heel of your standing foot, rise back up to the original position Switch legs and repeat for your desired number of repetitions

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and a dumbbell in each hand Lift one leg off the floor, maintaining balance Slowly lower your body into a squat position with the standing leg Straighten the standing leg to return to a standing position Switch legs and repeat

Stand holding a dumbbell in each hand with your feet hip-width apart Shift your weight onto one leg Bend your knee and lower your body until your thigh is parallel to the floor Push through your heels to return to the starting position Repeat with the other leg

name_en: Dumbbell Single Leg Squat with Support
description_en: Begin by standing on one leg with a dumbbell in your hand, the other leg extending forward Lower yourself down by bending the knee of the standing leg while keeping your chest up and your back straight Go down until your thigh is approximately parallel to the floor Push your body back up to the standing position, straightening the standing leg Repeat the movement for a number of repetitions before switching legs

Stand up straight while holding a dumbbell on each hand. Place the right foot on the elevated platform. Step on the platform by extending the hip and the knee of your right leg. Lower your body back down until the foot touches the floor. Switch legs and repeat.

Hold a dumbbell in each hand by your sides and stand in front of a step or bench. Raise your right foot to step up onto the bench, pressing through your heel. Once your right foot is on the bench, push your body up until your right leg is straight. Slowly lower your body back to the starting position by lowering your left foot back to the floor. Repeat the exercise on the left leg.

Stand straight and place the dumbbell between your feet which should be shoulder width apart. Bend your knees slightly and pull the dumbbell up quickly by extending your hips and knees. As the dumbbell rises, forcefully make use of your shoulders and bend your elbows to pull it up to shoulder level. Allow the momentum to rotate your wrist, positioning the dumbbell in front of your shoulder. Lower the dumbbell down to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Dumbbell Single Power Clean and Jerk
description_en: Begin in a squat position holding a dumbbell between your legs. Perform a power clean by exploding up to standing position, while simultaneously lifting the dumbbell to shoulder height. Immediately proceed into a jerk by slightly bending your knees and then forcefully extending them, while simultaneously pushing the dumbbell overhead. Return to standing position while lowering the dumbbell to your shoulder. Squat down to place the dumbbell back between your legs and repeat.

Stand upright holding a dumbbell in your right hand with your feet shoulder-width apart Keeping your legs slightly bent, bend at the hips and lower the dumbbell straight down until your upper body is parallel to the floor Keep your back flat and your head in a neutral position Press your hips forward to lift yourself back to the start position Repeat with your left hand

Stand straight with feet shoulder-width apart Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides Rotate your waist left and right while keeping your hips stable Be sure to control your movement and not swing your arms too much Repeat the exercise as needed

Stand upright holding a dumbbell in each hand by your sides Step forward with one foot into a split stance Lower your body down by bending your front knee into a lunge position Hold this position feeling the stretch in your hip and thigh Return to standing position and repeat with the other leg

Stand with your feet hip-width apart, and hold a dumbbell in each hand by your sides Step one foot forward, and lower your body until your front knee is at a 90-degree angle Drive through your front heel to push back up to the starting position Repeat for desired reps, then switch to the other leg

Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand by your sides Step your right foot forward and lower your body until your right knee is bent at a 90-degree angle Push through your right foot to lift your body back up to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps and then switch to the left leg

name_en: Dumbbell Split Squat Front Foot Elevanted
description_en: Stand upright and hold the dumbbells in each hand with your arms hanging at your sides. Place your front foot on an elevated surface with the opposite foot behind you. Lower your body until your front knee is bent at a 90 degree angle. Push up through your front heel to return to the starting position. Repeat the same for the other leg

name_en: Dumbbell Split Squat Front Foot Elevanted
description_en: Stand up straight while holding a dumbbell on each hand. Place the toe of one foot on an elevated platform. Make sure this leg is stretched back and your other foot is firmly on the floor. Lower your body by bending the knee and hip of your front leg until the knee of your rear leg is almost in contact with the floor. Return to the starting position by pushing with your heel to extend your hip and knee. Switch legs and repeat the motions.

name_en: Dumbbell Split Stance Bent Over Row
description_en: Start by standing with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand Place your other hand on a bench or your knee for support and bend at the waist Keep your back straight and pull the dumbbell up towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your side Pause for a moment at the top of the lift, then slowly lower the dumbbell back down Repeat for the desired number of reps before switching to the other side

Stand with one foot forward and one foot behind you and hold a dumbbell in each hand with arms at your side Bend your elbows to lift the dumbbells towards your shoulders, keep your elbows close to your torso Pause at the top of the curl and then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions. Switch your stance and repeat the movement with the other leg forward

name_en: Dumbbell Split Stance Single Arm Overhead Press
description_en: Stand with feet hip-width apart and a dumbbell in one hand Hold the dumbbell at shoulder level with your palm facing forward Press the dumbbell straight up until your arm is fully extended Lower the dumbbell back to shoulder level in a controlled motion Switch arms and repeat

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Begin by pushing your hips back and bending your knees to lower into a squat. Go as low as you can while keeping your chest up and back straight. Pause at the bottom of the movement, then push through your heels to return to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Stand with feet shoulder width apart, holding one dumbbell in each hand at your side While keeping your back straight, bend at the knees and hips as if you're sitting back into a chair Lower yourself until your thighs are parallel with the floor Push back up to a standing position, pushing into the floor through your heels Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart holding a dumbbell in each hand Lower your body by bending your knees and pushing your hips back Keep lowering until your thighs are parallel with the floor Press your heels into the ground to return to the starting position Repeat for the number of reps

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold dumbbells in your hands near your hips. Bend your knees and lower down unless your thighs are parallel to the floor. Hold momentarily, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold dumbbells in your hands near your shoulder. Bend your knees and lower down unless your thighs are parallel to the floor. Raise your hips by straightening your knees while extending your arms overhead.

Stand straight and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your shoulders Squat down, keep your knees in line with your feet As you stand up, press the dumbbells overhead Pause at the top, then lower the dumbbells as you squat down again Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps

Find a flat bench and sit down, holding two dumbbells at shoulder width Lay back and bring the dumbbells to the sides of your chest Push the dumbbells up while squeezing them together Slowly lower the dumbbells to the starting position, while keeping the tension by continuing to squeeze the dumbbells together Repeat this for your desired amount of reps

Lie flat on the floor holding a dumbbell in each hand Raise the dumbbells above your chest with your palms facing each other, and push the weights together Pull your shoulder blades together and slowly lower the weights toward the floor Press the weights back up to the start position Maintain constant contact between the dumbbells throughout the movement

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length While keeping your upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting your biceps Continue this movement until the dumbbells are at shoulder level Hold this contracted position for a second as you squeeze your biceps Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to starting position

While seated, hold a dumbbell in both hands with your arms fully extended above your head Bend at the elbow to lower the weight behind your head Keep your upper arms and elbows stationary, only the forearms should move Push back up to the starting position while contracting your triceps at the top Hold for a second at the top, and then slowly lower the weight back down

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level Lift one dumbbell overhead until your arm is fully extended Lower the dumbbell back to shoulder level in a controlled manner Repeat the movement with the other arm Continue to alternate arms throughout the set

Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso Raise one dumbbell until it is level with your shoulder, while keeping your elbow slightly bent Lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the same action with the other hand Continue alternating between both arms for your desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso Curl the weights while keeping your palms facing down until the dumbbells are at shoulder level Pause and slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position Repeat with the alternate hand Continue alternating between each hand for the desired number of reps

name_en: Dumbbell Standing Alternate Vertical Front Raises
description_en: Stand straight with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your body Keeping your torso stationary, lift the left dumbbell to the front, parallel to the floor while exhaling Slowly lower the dumbbell back down while inhaling Repeat the movement with the right dumbbell Continue alternating between both sides

Stand straight with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso Keeping your upper arms stationary, slowly rotate your wrists so that the palms of your hands face forward Pause briefly in this position Return your wrists to the initial position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing towards you. Lift them at shoulder level. Raise the dumbbells as you rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward. Continue lifting the dumbbells above your head until your arms are fully extended. Pause at the top of the lift. Rotate the palms again so they face you and lower the dumbbells to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing towards you Lift the dumbbell sideways up to the level of your shoulders Rotate your hands so that your palms face the ceiling Lower the dumbbell slowly to the initial position

Stand up with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your torso Lower your hands by bending at the wrist until your arms are fully extended Raise the dumbbells back up by curling your wrists and breathe out Hold the contraction at the top for a second Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

name_en: Dumbbell Standing Behind Back Shoulders Press
description_en: Stand up straight holding a dumbbell in each hand behind your head at shoulder level Slowly raise your arms straight up over your head Pause at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position Keep your back straight and avoid arching it during the movement Repeat the movement for your desired number of repetitions

name_en: Dumbbell Standing Bent Arm Lateral raise
description_en: Stand upright holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, with your elbows slightly bent Raise the dumbbells out to your sides until they are level with your shoulders, keeping the elbow angle constant Lower the dumbbells back down in a controlled manner to your sides Repeat the movement for your desired number of reps

name_en: Dumbbell Standing Bent Arm Lateral raise
description_en: Stand upright, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your arms by your sides Keeping your elbows slightly bent, raise your arms to the sides until your elbows are at shoulder height Pause for a moment, then lower the weights back to the start position Repeat for the prescribed number of repetitions Make sure to maintain a controlled movement throughout

Stand up with a dumbbell in each hand at arms length, palms facing forward While keeping your upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting your biceps Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to starting position as your breathe out

Hold a dumbbell in one hand and brace yourself against a wall or a sturdy equipment with the other hand Stand erect with the heels hanging off the edge of a step Extend from the ankle, elevating your body using your calf muscles Hold the peak position for a second Lower your body by dropping your heels below the step

Stand erect holding a dumbbell in each hand by your sides. Raise your heels by extending your ankles as high as possible while maintaining the legs straight. Pause at the top. Lower your heels by flexing your ankles until your calves are stretched. Pause. Repeat this movement for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold the dumbbells in your hands near your hips. Raise yourself by raising your heels and shifting your weight on the toes. Hold for seconds, lower your heels, and repeat.

Hold a dumbbell in one hand and stand with your legs slightly apart Bend over slightly and place the back of your upper arm on your inner thigh Curl the weight while keeping the upper arm stationary Hold the contraction at the top for a moment, then slowly lower the dumbbell

Stand upright, feet shoulder-width apart, with a dumbbell in each hand. Keeping your elbows close to your torso, curl the weights while keeping your elbows behind your body. Continue to lift the weights until your arms are fully flexed. Hold this peak contraction for a moment. Gradually lower the weights back to the starting position.

Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level Extend your arms straight in front of you, without locking your elbows Hold for a second, then bring the dumbbells back to the starting position Repeat this motion for the desired number of repetitions Always keep your back straight and engage your core throughout the exercise

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your torso. Extend your arms fully overhead. While keeping your upper arms close to your head and elbows in, lower the dumbbells in a semicircular motion behind your head until your forearms touch your biceps. Lift the dumbbells back to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

name_en: Dumbbell Standing Front and Lateral Raise
description_en: Stand on your feet about hip-width apart, holding one dumbbell in each hand Raise one dumbbell straight in front of you while keeping your arm slightly bent at the elbow until it reaches shoulder level Pause for a second, then lower the dumbbell back down in a controlled manner Now, raise the other dumbbell out to the side, again keeping the arm slightly bent at the elbow until it reaches shoulder level Lower the dumbbell back down in a controlled manner

name_en: Dumbbell Standing Front Raise Above Head
description_en: Start by standing straight with a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing your body Raise your arms straight in front of you until they're at shoulder height Then, continue lifting the weight above your head Hold the position for a second Lower the weights back to starting position in a controlled movement

name_en: Dumbbell Standing Front to Lateral Raise
description_en: Stand straight, holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with palms facing your torso Lift the dumbbells in front of you with a slight bend on the elbow and the palms of the hands facing down until they're at shoulder height Lower the dumbbells back down to your sides Next, lift the dumbbells out to your sides until they're shoulder height Lower the dumbbells back to your sides

Stand upright with a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length. Your elbows should be close to your torso While keeping your upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting your biceps as you breathe out Continue raising the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level Hold for a brief moment at the contracted position and exhale Lower the dumbbells back down slowly to the starting position as you breathe in

name_en: Dumbbell Standing Hammer Curl to Press
description_en: Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended and palms facing inward Curl the weights while keeping the palms facing each other until they're close to your shoulders Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended above your head Lower the weights back down to your shoulders, and then uncurl your arms to the starting position Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Hold a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso Keep your elbows close to your torso and make your wrists move in a semi-circle motion toward your body (flexion) and away from it (extension) Perform this movement alternatively for both hands Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing the torso. Keep your elbows close to your torso and curl the weights while contracting your biceps. Continue to raise the weights until the biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a brief moment as you squeeze your biceps. Slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length Keep your elbows close to your torso and rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward Now, keeping the upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting your biceps Continue toraise the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length Now, while keeping your upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting your biceps Continue to raise the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to starting position

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing in towards your torso. While keeping the upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to starting position as you breathe in. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your arms fully extended and palms facing your body Keep your upper arms stationary, exhale and extend your arms backwards as you fully flex your triceps Pause at the top of the contraction, then inhale and slowly lower the weights back down to the starting position

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and a dumbbell in each hand Hinge at the waist till you are nearly parallel with the floor Pull your arms close to your body with the weight hanging perpendicular to the floor Keeping your upper arms stationary, extend your forearms backwards until your arms are fully extended Slowly lower the weights back down

Stand with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso Keep your torso stationary and lift the dumbbells to your side with a slight bend on your elbow Continue to lift the weights until your arms are parallel to the floor Lower the dumbbells back down slowly to the starting position

name_en: Dumbbell Standing One Arm Concentration Curl
description_en: Stand up straight with a dumbbell in one hand, keeping your feet flat on the floor Place the back of your upper arm on your inner thigh, positions should be similar to sitting Starting with your arm fully extended, curl the dumbbell towards your shoulder Pause at the top of the movement, then lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position Switch to the other arm after completing your set

Hold the dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing forward Bend your elbow and curl the dumbbell up towards your shoulder Pause for a moment at the top and then lower the dumbbell back down Repeat this motion for the prescribed number of repetitions Switch and do the same with the other arm

name_en: Dumbbell Standing One Arm Curl Over Incline Bench
description_en: Stand behind an incline bench and hold a dumbbell in one hand Lean over the bench and let your arm hang straight down With your palm facing forward, curl the weight up as far as possible Pause for a moment then lower the weight back down in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps before switching arms

Stand up straight holding a dumbbell in one hand. Extend your arm upward until it is straight, keeping your elbow close to your head. Slowly lower the dumbbell back until your arm is nearly fully bent. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions. Switch the dumbbell to the other hand and repeat.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level Raise the dumbbells above your head until your arms are fully extended Pause for a moment then slowly lower the weights back down to the shoulder level Keep your core tight and back straight throughout the movement Repeat for your desired number of reps

Start in a standing position with your feet shoulder width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level. Extend your arms to press the dumbbells upward until they're directly over your head. Pause momentarily at the top then lower the weights back to the starting position. Keep a slight bend in your elbow at the bottom of the movement to avoid locking your joints. Repeat this movement while maintaining a stable torso and core.

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, dumbbells at your shoulders, palms facing each other Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are extended overhead Pause at the top, then lower the dumbbells back to your shoulders Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions Maintain a straight back and tight core throughout the exercise

Stand upright, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing each other Raise the dumbbells to shoulder level Press the dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder level Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand upright holding a dumbbell in one hand, arm fully extended, and palm facing forward Slowly curl the dumbbell upwards as far as possible Squeeze your biceps at the top Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms

Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing towards you Keep your elbows close to your torso and the dumbbells parallel on either side of your body With your forearms, curl the dumbbells up until they reach your shoulders Hold the position for a second and feel the squeeze in your forearms Slowly lower the weights back down to the starting position

Stand straight while holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing towards your body. Keep your elbows close to the torso and curl the weights while contracting the forearms. Rotate your wrist outward until your palms are facing up and hold this position for a second Gradually lower the dumbbells back into the initial position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Stand with feet shoulder width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand Keep your elbows close to your body and bend your arm at a 90 degree angle Rotate your shoulder to lift the dumbbell until it is parallel with the ground Lower the dumbbell back down in a controlled manner Repeat with the other arm

Stand straight with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other. Raise your arms to be parallel to the ground, forming a 90-degree angle at your elbows. Slowly rotate your arms outwards, while keeping your elbows stationary. Hold for a moment when your arms are fully rotated outwards Slowly return to the starting position.

name_en: Dumbbell Standing Single Arm Biceps Curl
description_en: Stand up straight with a dumbbell in one hand, arm fully extended, and palm facing your torso Curl the weights while contracting your biceps, continue to raise the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level. Hold this contracted position for a brief moment as you squeeze your biceps Slowly begin to bring the dumbbells back to the starting position as your breathe in Repeat the same movement with your other arm for the prescribed amount of repetitions Switch hands and repeat the process

name_en: Dumbbell Standing Single Arm Cross Raise
description_en: Stand straight and hold a dumbbell in one hand to your side. Raise the dumbbell across your body to your opposite shoulder, keeping your arm straight. Slowly lower the dumbbell back to your side. Repeat for desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm. Maintain proper posture throughout the exercise.

name_en: Dumbbell Standing Single Leg Calf Raise
description_en: Hold a dumbbell in one hand and lift the same side foot off the floor. Balance on the tips of your other foot. Raise your body as high as you can. Lower your body back down in a controlled fashion. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps and then switch to the other side.

name_en: Dumbbell Standing Single Leg Calf Raise
description_en: Hold a dumbbell in one hand and stand on one leg, other leg bent behind you Place the heel of your standing foot on the ground Push up onto the toes of your standing foot, raising your body as high as you can Hold for a second and then lower your heel back to the ground Repeat this for your desired number of reps, then switch legs and repeat

Stand upright holding a dumbbell in one hand. Raise your arm and position the dumbbell at waist level. Curl the dumbbell upwards, keeping your elbow steady. Lower the dumbbell back down in a smooth, controlled motion. Repeat for the desired number of reps and switch arms.

Hold a dumbbell with both hands over your head, elbows close to your head Slowly lower the dumbbell down behind your head Keep your upper arms still throughout the movement Raise the dumbbell back until your elbows are nearly straight Squeeze your triceps at the top of the movement

Hold the dumbbell with both hands and lift it overhead. Keep your elbow stable and only move your forearm to lower the dumbbell behind your head. Lift the dumbbell back up until your arms are fully extended. Keep your upper arms and elbows close to your head through the movement. Exercise should be done in a slow and controlled manner.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward from your hips, keeping your back straight Lift the dumbbells to your side until your arms are parallel to the floor Lower the dumbbells back down in a controlled manner Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions

Hold a dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing up Position your forearm on a sturdy surface, hanging your hand off the edge Slowly curl your wrist upwards Lower your wrist to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps and switch hands

Hold a dumbbell in each hand letting them hang at arm's length Bend your wrists so that your knuckles point towards the ground Flex your wrist, lifting the dumbbell as high as possible Pause, then lower the weight back into the starting position

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing back. Raise the dumbbells by using your wrists, keep your arms stationary. Complete the movement by slowly lowering the dumbbells back down. Let the dumbbells hang at arm's length. Keep your palms facing down throughout the entire rotation

Start by lying flat on your back on the floor with a dumbbell in each hand Spread your arms and legs apart into a star shape Crunch up, lifting your arms and legs to meet in a jackknife position holding the dumbbells Lower your arms and legs back to the starfish shape Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand straight while holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing your torso Step forward with one leg Lower your torso by flexing the knee and hip of your front leg until the knee of your rear leg is almost in contact with the floor Return to the starting position by pushing off your forward leg Repeat the movement for your other leg

Hold a dumbbell in each hand, standing upright with feet shoulder-width apart Step forward with one foot, bending your front knee to about 90 degrees Keep your back straight and look forward Push back up to the starting position by pressing through your front heel Repeat the movement with the other leg

Stand upright with a dumbbell in each hand Place one foot firmly on a raised platform, with your hip & knee at a 90 degree angle Push off the raised platform, straightening your hip & knee Lower your body back down with control Repeat with the other leg

Start by standing in front of a bench or step, holding a dumbbell in each hand by your sides. Step up on the bench or step with one leg, pressing your heel into the step. Bring your other foot to meet your lead foot on the step. Step back down gently, starting with the previous trailing leg. Alternate between your leading leg after each repetition.

Stand upright with a dumbbell in each hand and place one foot on an elevated platform or bench Using the foot on the platform, push up until the leg is fully extended Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position Repeat this movement for the other leg Perform equal repetitions for both legs

Stand behind a flat bench or a step. Hold a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length by your sides, palms facing forward. Place your right foot onto the elevated platform, push up through your heel to lift your body onto the platform, whilst curling the dumbbells towards your shoulders. Slowly lower your left foot back to the floor, straightening your arms to lower the dumbbells at the same time. Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions and then change legs. This is one rep. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Stand up straight while holding a dumbbell on each hand Place the right foot on the elevated platform. Step on the platform by extending the hip and the knee of your right leg Raise the left knee up as far as possible Lower the lifted knee down, then step down off the platform and return to the starting position Repeat with the left leg for the recommended amount of repetitions

Stand up straight holding a dumbbell in each hand Bend at your hips and lower the dumbbells towards the floor Keep your legs and back straight as you perform this movement Raise your body back up to the starting position Repeat the movement for the desired amount of repetitions

Stand with feet hip-width apart holding the dumbbells in your hands Keeping your legs and back straight, bend forward at the hips Lower the dumbbells close to the front of your legs Lift your torso back to the initial position Repeat for the prescribed number of repetitions

Stand straight with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your body Keeping your legs somewhat straight, bend at the waist, keeping your back straight Lower the weights as far as you comfortably can while keeping your back straightly aligned Reverse the motion, driving your hips forward to come back up to starting position Repeat the motion

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing towards your body Keep your legs stationary and slightly bent while bending at the waist Lower the weights as far as possible while keeping your back straight Push your hips forward and stand up straight to return to the start position Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Hold a dumbbell in both hands above your chest with arms straight Crunch your abs and lift your upper body towards the ceiling, keeping your arms straight Control the descent back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Lie down with your back flat on the floor, knees bent and feet flat on the ground Hold a dumbbell in both hands and extend your arms towards the ceiling, keeping a slight bend in your elbows Crunch up by lifting your shoulder blades off the floor and extend the dumbbell straight up towards the ceiling Pause at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the floor

Lie down on a bench with your feet flat on the ground for balance Hold the dumbbell in both hands extending your arms up over your chest Lower the dumbbell back behind your head until your arms are in line with your torso Draw the dumbbell back over your head and chest Maintain a slight bend in your elbows throughout the exercise

Lie down on a bench with your feet flat on the ground Hold the dumbbell with both hands, straight up over your chest Keep your arms straight, lower the dumbbell over and beyond your head Pull the dumbbell back up to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Lie down on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor Hold a dumbbell with both hands overhead, keeping arms straight but not locked Lower the dumbbell behind your head stretching your chest Pull back the dumbbell to the initial position using your chest muscles Repeat the process

Lie down on your back with your knees bent, feet flat on the floor and hold a dumbbell with both hands. Lift your upper body, twisting your torso toward one side while holding the dumbbell straight. Keep your arms straight and make sure the dumbbell moves in the same direction as your torso. Lower your body back to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat the movement, this time twisting your torso to the other side.

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding dumbbells in front of you with palms facing towards the body Keeping back and legs straight, bend at your hips to lower the dumbbells along your legs Squeeze your glutes and push your hips forward to lift the dumbbells back to the start position Repeat this motion without bending your knees

Sit on the ground with your legs extended and heels touching the floor Hold a dumbbell with both hands in front of you Lean back slightly while keeping your spine straight Rotate your torso to one side, taking the dumbbell with you Rotate to the other side. That's one rep

Stand upright holding a dumbbell in each hand, with feet shoulder-width apart Keep your knees slightly bent and push your hips back to lower the dumbbells straight down Lift the dumbbells back up by pushing your hips forward and standing up straight, ensuring to keep your back straight at all times Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps

Stand up straight holding a dumbbell in one hand by your side Keep your shoulders and hips level and don't lean to the side Walk forwards maintaining your form and posture Repeat the exercise after switching the dumbbell to the other hand Keep alternating hands for each set

Stand over the dumbbell with your legs wide, toes pointing outward Bend at the hips and knees to reach the dumbbell Hold the dumbbell with both hands Straighten your hips and knees to lift the dumbbell Lower the dumbbell back down by bending at the hips and knees

Place a dumbbell on the ground between your spread feet. Bend over and grasp the dumbbell with both hands. Stand and pull the dumbbell up through your legs. Squeeze your glutes at the top of the movement. Lower the dumbbell in a controlled manner back to the starting position.

Stand with your feet wider than hip width apart, toes pointed outwards Hold a dumbbell with both hands, letting it hang down between your legs Keeping your back straight, hinge at your hips and lower the dumbbell towards the ground Push through your heels and squeeze your glutes to stand upright, bringing the dumbbell back up Repeat the movement keeping your core engaged

Stand with feet significantly wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing out Hold a dumbbell with both hands in front of you, extended down Lower your body by bending the knees until your thighs are parallel with the floor Pause for a moment, then push up to the starting position Keep your back straight and chest lifted throughout the movement

Stand with your feet wider than hip-width apart, toes turned out, and a dumbbell in each hand in front of your body Lower your body into a deep squat, pushing your hips back and keeping your knees over toes As you rise back to standing, raise the dumbbells straight out in front of you to shoulder height Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position as you return to a squat Repeat the movement for the desired reps

Position a dumbbell between your legs and stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart Lower yourself into a squat while keeping your chest upright Reach down to the dumbbell with both hands and grasp it Push through your heels to stand back up, lifting the dumbbell off the floor Lower yourself back into the squat, returning the dumbbell to the floor

Lie face down on a flat bench with the end of the dumbbells in each hand Simultaneously raise your arms and legs as high as you can Squeeze your glutes and lower back muscles at the top of the movement Lower your arms and legs back to the starting position Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, dumbbells on each side of your body Slowly bend your knees till your thighs are parallel to the ground, keeping your back straight Pause at the bottom, then push through your feet to return to the starting position Exhale as you stand up, inhale as you lower yourself down, maintaining a controlled motion Repeat for the desired number of sets and reps

Hold a pair of dumbbells at your sides with palms facing inwards Stand with your feet hip-width apart and toes pointed straight ahead Lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the floor Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push yourself back up to the starting position Repeat this till your set is complete

Stand upright, holding a dumbbell with both hands right in front of your chest. Press the dumbbell outward until your arms are fully extended. Maintain constant pressure between your hands to keep the plates together. Slowly return the dumbbell to your chest, maintaining constant tension. Repeat the movement for desired reps.

Hold a dumbbell with both hands, feet shoulder-width apart Bend your knees slightly, hinging at the hips to swing the dumbbell between your legs Using your hip drive, swing the dumbbell up to shoulder height Allow the dumbbell to swing back down in a controlled movement Repeat the swing for desired reps

Lie down on a flat bench holding a dumbbell in each hand. Hold the dumbbells over your chest with your elbows slightly bent. Lower the dumbbells to either side of your chest by bending your elbows. Pause, then push the dumbbells back up to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Stand with feet shoulder width apart, holding dumbbells at shoulder level Lower your body into a squat Explode upwards, extending your legs and pressing the dumbbells overhead Lower the dumbbells back to the shoulders while returning to the starting position

Stand upright holding two dumbbells at shoulder level with palms facing each other Lower your body into a squat position while keeping your back straight Push up from your heels, and in one swift motion, extend your arms upwards performing a shoulder press Lower the weights back to shoulder height as you return back to your starting position Repeat this movement for your desired number of repetitions

name_en: Dumbbell Triceps Kick Back Single Arm
description_en: Stand tall, take a step forward, and lean forward by bending your front knee. Grab a dumbbell in one hand by folding your arm and taking your elbow past your back. Raise the dumbbell by straightening your arm behind your back. As your arm become fully extended, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, one dumbbell in your right hand Bend your knees slightly and lean forward, keeping your back straight Lift the dumbbell straight to your side until it is level with your shoulder, keeping your elbow slightly bent Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise with your left hand

Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your body. Lift the dumbbells vertically until they are close to your chin. Elbows should be higher than your wrists. Lower the dumbbells back down to the start position in a controlled manner. Repeat the exercise for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs Raise the dumbbells vertically until they are in line with your collarbone, with elbows pointing upwards Pause at the top of the movement Lower the dumbbells smoothly and controlled back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand upright holding a dumbbell in your hand with your elbow bent at a 90-degree angle Keep your elbow close to your side and rotate your forearm outward Hold for a moment and then rotate your forearm inward to return to starting position Repeat this movement for the recommended number of repetitions Switch arms and repeat

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab a dumbbell in one hand with your arm bent, its elbow open wide, and your palm facing downward. Raise the dumbbell by taking your forearm up to your maximum range. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie flat on your back on a mat and hold a dumbbell in both hands directly above you Simultaneously lift your upper and lower body off the ground, reaching the dumbbell towards your feet to form a 'V' shape Hold this position briefly then slowly lower your body back to the starting position Keep your legs and arms straight throughout the exercise Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps

Lay flat on your back with your legs fully extended and arms extended above your head, holding a dumbbell Lift your arms and legs off the ground concurrently, employing your core to bring your body up into a 'V' shape Try to touch the dumbbell to your toes at the top of the movement Hold the 'V' position briefly, then slowly lower your arms and legs back to the original position

Stand up straight with the dumbbell in hand, use your arm to hold it very much like a waiter holding a tray. Curl the weight of the dumbbell up, keep your upper arm stationary. Pause for a second at the top of the movement. Slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the initial position. Repeat the process for as many repetitions as your workout suggests.

Start by standing straight, each hand holding a dumbbell at your sides Step forward with your right leg and lower your body until your right knee is at a 90 degree angle Push up through your right heel to the starting position Repeat with the left leg Continue alternating legs throughout the movement

Stand straight holding a dumbbell in each hand at arm's length Step forward with your right leg making sure your right knee is directly above your right ankle Push back up to the starting position Repeat the lunge with your left leg Continue alternating legs throughout the exercise

Stand with feet wider than shoulder width apart, toes slightly pointed outwards Hold dumbbells in front of you with arms fully extended Lower your body by bending the knees until thighs are roughly parallel with the floor Push through your heels to rise back up to the start position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder width holding a dumbbell with both hands in front of you Squat down as you rotate the dumbbell to the outside of your left thigh Stand up and swing the dumbbell across your body to above your right shoulder Return to the initial position in a controlled fashion Repeat this motion on the other side

Stand upright holding dumbbells with your arms straight and palms facing away from your body Curl the dumbbells while rotating your wrists so your palms face towards you In the top position of the curl, rotate your wrists again so your palms face away from you Lower the dumbbells in this position Rotate your wrists before starting the next rep

Stand tall with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing forward Curl the weights while keeping your upper arms stationary Rotate your wrists so your palms are now facing downward Lower the dumbbells back down with a controlled movement Rotate your wrists back to the starting position

Sit on a preacher bench and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height Slowly lower the weights toward the floor, rotating your palms to face downward Pause for a moment at the bottom of the curl Raise the weights back to the starting position, rotating your palms to face upwards again Repeat for desired repetitions

Sit on the Preacher Bench after adjusting the height, hold the dumbbell with an underhand grip Curl the dumbbell up as far as possible Now rotate the wrist so that you have an overhand grip Lower the dumbbell fully on the way down Repeat the cycle for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on the floor with your legs extended out in front of you Hold a pair of dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing forward Press the weights overhead until your arms are fully extended Lower the dumbbells back to the shoulder height Repeat the process for your desired number of repetitions

Sit on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand at your shoulders, your palms facing each other Press the dumbbells up over your head while rotating your palms to face forward Pause at the top of the movement then lower the weights while reversing the palm rotation Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Dumbell Bulgarian Split Squat from Deficit
description_en: Stand tall and hold a dumbbell in each hand by your side Place the toes of your rear foot onto an elevated surface behind you Lower your body by bending your front knee until your thigh is almost parallel to the ground Push through the heel of your front foot to return to the starting position Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions before switching legs

name_en: Dumbell Contralateral Glute Dominant Bulgarian Split Squat
description_en: Place a dumbbell in your right hand and stand about 2 feet away from a bench. Place your left foot behind you on the bench Lower your body toward the ground until your right thigh is parallel to the ground, keeping your back straight Push yourself back up with your right foot until you are standing straight again Repeat with the opposite leg Perform the recommended number of sets and repetitions

name_en: Dumbell Glute Dominant Bulgarian Split Squat
description_en: Stand holding dumbbells at your sides, facing away from a bench Extend one foot behind you and rest it on the bench Lower your body by flexing the knee and hip of your front leg until your rear knee nearly touches the floor Push off your front foot to raise your body back up to the starting position Repeat the movement with the other leg

name_en: Dumbell One Arm Side Lying Bench Press
description_en: Lie on your side on a flat bench with your feet on the ground for support Hold a dumbbell in your top hand with a neutral grip With your elbow bent, press the dumbbell straight up Pause at the top then lower the dumbbell back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the motion for the desired number of reps, then switch sides

Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs bent at a 90 degree angle Keep your heel planted while twisting your hips to the opposite side Try to maintain your legs at a 90 degree angle during the twist Return to the starting position by twisting your hips back Repeat the move on the other side

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent Extend your arms out in front of you Slowly swing your arms to the right while rotating your torso to the left Repeat on the other side, this time swing your arms to the left while rotating your torso to the right Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall and reach your arms up overhead, interlacing your fingers Keeping your arms as straight as possible, bend sideway to the right and then to the left Bend forward from the hips and try to reach your hands toward your feet Rise back up slowly and bend slightly backwards from the waist Repeat this series of movements for the given period of time or repeitions

Stand upright with your arms extended out to your sides Slowly move your arms forward in a hugging motion, squeezing your chest muscles Return to the starting position in a controlled motion Repeat this movement rhythmically for the desired number of repetitions

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms out to your sides, palms facing forward Quickly swing your arms forward Touch your hands together in front of you Quickly swing your arms back to the previous position

Stand upright and hold onto a support Swing one leg forward and then swing it backward in a controlled manner Keep your torso stationary throughout the exercise Repeat on the other leg Perform the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Dynamic Weight Bearing Ankle Dorsi Flexion
description_en: Stand upright and hold onto a steady support for balance Extend one leg out in front, heel on the ground while toes raised Gently lean into your extended leg, bending at the ankle to dorsiflex Hold this stretch for 20-30 seconds Return to starting position and change to the other leg

Stand tall, reach your arms straight out to the sides Bend your left elbow to a 90-degree angle Cross your left elbow over your right elbow Bend your right elbow so your hands touch each other Hold this stretch for about 30 seconds and repeat on the other side

Stand upright with your feet shoulder width apart Place your hands behind your head Bend your waist to the right, bringing your right ear towards your right knee Return to the starting position Repeat on the left side

Stand tall with your legs shoulder-width apart Place your hands on your hips Bend sideways, bring your ear down towards your knee on the same side Return to the initial position in a controlled fashion Switch to the other side and repeat

Start in a comfortable seated position Bend your left knee into your chest, then extend it out to the side opening your hip Bring your right arm under your bent left knee, and press your left hand into the floor next to your hip Extend your left leg up, keeping your right foot on the floor Hold the position for a few breaths and then repeat on the other side
Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Place your hands behind your back at the waist and stretch your back while leaning backward. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Stand or sit with a straight spine Raise your arms to the side with elbows bent at 90 degrees level with your shoulders Move your elbows towards each other, pulsing in and out Perform this motion while keeping your shoulders relaxed Repeat the pulse motion for the desired number of repetitions
Stand or sit with your spine straight Extend your arm out straight in front of you Bend your elbow, and try to touch your shoulder with your hand Straighten your arm, repeat the motion

name_en: Elbow Extension And Supination Pronation Forearm Stretch
description_en: Stand or sit upright and extend your arm out in front of you Bend your wrist upwards as if you were trying to touch your palm to your forearm Use your other hand to gently pull the fingers back towards your body After holding for 20-30 seconds, bend your wrist downwards and gently pull your fingers towards your body for another 20-30 seconds Repeat with the other arm

Stand or sit with your spine straight Extend your arm out in front of you, palm facing upwards Gently bend your wrist towards your body until you feel a stretch in your biceps and brachialis Hold for 20-30 seconds Repeat on the other side

Extend your arm in front of you with the palm facing forward Using your other hand, gently pull your fingers back towards your body until you feel a stretch Hold for 20-30 seconds then switch arms Repeat this process for 2-3 rounds

Stand straight with your arms open to either side, palms facing forwards Bend your elbows to 90 degrees Bring your palms together, in front of your chest Open your arms back to the starting position Repeat this motion for the duration of your workout

Place your hands on the ground, shoulder-width apart with your elbows bent Push your body off the ground, extending your elbows Lower your body back down Repeat the process with each repetition requiring both the push-up and lift

Start by laying down on your chest, extending your arms forward and legs straight behind you Lift your torso by pushing against the floor with your elbows Hold this position for a moment while tensing your back muscles Slowly lower your chest back to the starting position Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Begin by standing straight with your feet hip width apart Raise your elbows to shoulder height with your palms facing each other Press your hands together, pulling your shoulder blades back Push your palms upwards towards the ceiling, keeping your hands close together Lower your hands back to the starting position and repeat

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart. Press your palms together in a prayer position at chest level. Push your palms together to contract the chest muscles. While keeping your hands pressed together, draw a circle with your elbows. Return your elbows to the original position and repeat the motion.

Begin by getting into a push up position. Lower your body towards the floor while keeping elbows close to the body. Once your chest is just above the floor, push your body back up to the starting position. Maintain a straight line from head to heels throughout the movement. Make sure to incorporate deep breathing throughout.

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms straight out to your sides and pull your shoulder blades towards each other Bend your elbows to make a 90-degree angle and keep your palms forward Continue the pull backwards until you feel a stretch in your chest and shoulders Hold the stretch for about 20-30 seconds

Stand upright and extend your arms straight in front of you Bend your elbows and widen them out to the sides keeping your forearm perpendicular to your body Push your chest forward and squeeze your shoulder blades together until you feel a stretch Hold the stretch for 10-30 seconds Release slowly, returning to the initial position

name_en: Elbow to Arm Open Side Step
description_en: Stand with feet together and arms by your side Step your right foot out to the side while bending your left arm, bringing your elbow to touch your right knee Extend your left arm above your head while extending your right leg, forming a 'side star' shape Return to the original position and repeat on the other side Perform this exercise for your desired amount of time or repetitions

Start in a plank position with your arms extended straight below your shoulders Move your right hand towards your left and step your left foot out Do the same with your left hand and right foot, returning to the plank position Now reverse the actions and return to starting position Repeat the exercise as needed

Start in a standing position, feet shoulder-width apart. Raise your right knee and simultaneously twist your upper body to bring your left elbow down to meet your knee. Return to the starting position. Repeat the exercise with your left knee and right elbow. Alternate sides for each rep.

name_en: Elbow To Knee Decline Side Plank
description_en: Start in a decline plank position and brace your abs Bend your outside elbow and raise your outside knee, aiming to touch elbow to knee Lower back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of repetitions Switch to the other side and repeat the action

name_en: Elbow to Knee Side Plank Crunch
description_en: Start in a side plank position, with your left hand on the ground and your right arm straight up towards the sky Raise your right leg as you bring your right elbow to your knee Return to the starting position Repeat for desired amount of reps Switch to your other side and repeat the process.

name_en: Elbow to Knee Side Plank Crunch
description_en: Start in a side plank position with one elbow on the ground and the other hand behind your head Keep your hips elevated and your body in a straight line from head to ankles Bring your top leg to your midsection twisting your torso, trying to touch your knee with your elbow Return to the starting position Repeat the exercise for the recommended amount of repetitions then switch sides

name_en: Elbow to Knee Side Plank Crunch
description_en: Begin in a side plank position with your left forearm on the floor, elbow below shoulder. Raise your right elbow and knee up, and crunch them together on the side of your waist. Slowly lower back to the starting position. Repeat the movement. Switch sides after completing all reps.

Lie on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground Raise your upper body slightly off the ground and twist your torso bringing your right elbow to your left knee Lower yourself back down again Repeat the process alternating between left and right elbows to opposite knees Keep this movement continuous for the set number of repetitions

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent at about a 60 angle Place your hands behind your head, elbows pointed out Lift and twist your torso, bringing your left elbow towards your right knee Lower back down and repeat the motion on the other side, bringing your right elbow towards your left knee Continue alternating sides for the duration of the set

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Lift your arms out to your sides, elbows bent and at shoulder-height Touch your elbows together in front of your body Move your elbows back out to your sides, keeping them at shoulder-height Lower your arms down to the sides of your body in a controlled manner

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise your arms to shoulder height, bend your elbows and let your fingertips touch in front of your chest Keeping your back straight, lift your arms overhead, with fingertips still touching Lower your arms back to the starting position Repeat the movement for desired repetitions

Start in a plank position with your palms under your shoulders Lower your body to your elbows, one arm at a time Press back up to the plank position, one arm at a time Repeat this sequence for your set number of reps Keep your body straight throughout

Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms straight out in front of you, touching your elbows together. Keeping your spine straight, open your arms wide until they are extended to the sides. Feel the stretch in your chest and then bring your arms back in, touching your elbows together again. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Begin in a high plank position, with your hands directly under your shoulders and your feet hip-width apart. Rotate your body to the right, lifting your right arm towards the sky and stacking your feet. Return to the high plank position. Rotate your body to the left, lifting your left arm towards the sky, and stack your feet. This completes one repetition. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Start in a standard plank position on your toes and elbows Push yourself up from your elbows to your hands Now, return to the starting position by dropping down onto your elbows Repeat this movement Keep your back straight and your core engaged throughout the exercise

Start in a high plank position with your body straight and hands directly under your shoulders Bring both knees into your chest, keeping your abs tight to lift your hips slightly Extend your legs back into plank position Bring your legs wide apart towards your elbows, creating a 'V' shape Return back to high plank position

name_en: Elevanted Pike Push-up from deficit with parallettes
description_en: Position your body in an upside-down 'V' shape with hands on the parallettes Lower your head towards the ground while maintaining the 'V' shape Push back up until your arms are fully extended, keep your legs and spine straight Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Place your hands on an elevated surface, a bit wider than shoulder width Lower your body toward the surface by bending your arms Push your body up until your arms are fully extended Pause at the top for a moment Lower your body and repeat for chosen repetitions

Start by laying flat on your back, arms by your sides Lift both the legs off the floor to create a 90-degree angle Begin cycling by moving your legs in the air, mimicking a pedalling action Slowly lower your legs back down and repeat the movement

Sit on the floor with your upper back leaning against a stable bench Bend your knees and keep your feet flat on the floor Elevate your hips by pushing through your heels until your hips are aligned with your body Lower your hips back down to starting position Repeat this for the desired amount of repetitions

Start by sitting on the ground with a bench behind you, place your upper back against the bench Bend one knee and place that foot on the ground. Extend your other leg out in front of you Press your planted foot into the ground and lift your body upwards by squeezing your glutes, keeping your weight on your upper back and the foot on the ground Lower your body back down in a controlled manner Switch legs and repeat

Start with lying on your back, one foot on an elevated surface like a bench, other leg extended out Push through the heel on the box to lift your hips towards the ceiling Hold at the top position for a moment while squeezing your glutes Slowly lower the hips back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of times then switch legs

Position yourself sideways next to an elevated surface by placing one foot on it Keep the other foot on the ground, slightly rearward in a staggered position Thrust your hips upwards while keeping your shoulders and upper body firmly on the ground Lower your hips back to the starting position Repeat this motion for the desired number of repetitions before switching sides

Find an elevated surface and stand on the edge with your heels hanging off Raise yourself up on your tiptoes Hold for a second at the top Slowly lower your heels back to the starting position Repeat this a number of times as per your strength and endurance

Sit on the ground with your back against a bench or surface, your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground Pushing through your heels, raise your hips until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees Pause and squeeze your glutes at the top Lower your hips back down to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Position yourself on the elliptical machine with your feet shoulder-width apart Begin to move your legs in a side-to-side motion, emulating a sliding or gliding walk Engage your core and maintain an upright posture Perform this movement for a designated amount of time or distance Gradually slow your pace at the end of your session and step off the machine carefully

Start by standing on the pedals of the elliptical machine, keeping your back straight Hold onto the handles; they should be at about chest level Begin moving your legs in a gliding motion, just like skiing Push and pull the handles alternately according to your leg movements Keep the movement smooth and continuous for the duration of your workout

Stand upright on the machine, grasping handlebars for balance Start pedaling forward while maintaining an upright posture Increase the resistance or incline for a harder workout Move your legs in a smooth, continuous elliptical motion Coordinate your arm swings with the movement of your opposite leg

Step onto the machine and grab the handles Begin to move your feet in a walking or running motion Ensure your arms are moving in sync with the opposite leg Maintain an upright posture, looking straight ahead Adjust the resistance and incline as desired

name_en: Exercise Ball Back Extension With Hands Behind Head
description_en: Position your hips on top of the stability ball with your feet shoulder-width apart and planted firmly on the ground Place your hands lightly behind your head Curve your body around the ball and extend back up until your body is in a straight line Lower your chest back down around the ball in a controlled manner Repeat in sets of 10

Sit on an exercise ball, lean back, and walk your feet out until the ball comes underneath your back. Slowly walk your feet away to straighten your thighs. Open your arms wide to put a stretch on your back. old this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Start by getting into plank position with your feet on the stability ball Keep your upper body still and push the ball away with your feet until your body is almost flat Pull the ball back towards your feet returning to plank position Keep your core muscles engaged during the entire movement Repeat the motion for the desired number of repetitions

Stand in a lunge position with an exercise ball between your legs. Lower yourself and press the ball by bending your front knee and reaching toward the floor with your rear knee. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Get down on all four with a straight back while keeping your hands right under the shoulders and your knees above the hips. Raise one of your arms outward with a bent elbow and place your hand on an exercise ball. Take your hand forward to extend your arm overhead while sliding the ball. Maintain this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Sit on an exercise ball with your feet flat on the floor Slowly walk your feet forward, allowing the ball to roll beneath your back Continue rolling the ball until it reaches your mid to lower back Extend your arms overhead and relax your body to feel a stretch in your lats Hold for 15-30 seconds and then slowly return to the starting position

Lie flat on your back with an exercise ball under your heels Place your hands by your side for stability Lift your hips, keeping your back straight Pull your heels towards your glutes, rolling the ball as close as possible Return to the starting position by rolling the ball away from your glutes

name_en: Exercise Ball Lower Back Dynamic Stretch
description_en: Get down on all four with an exercise ball underneath your torso. Extend your legs and walk your hands out while raising your heels. Put a stretch on your back by extending your arms. Hold this position, then stretch and relax by tightening and relaxing your core alternately.

name_en: Exercise Ball Lower Back Prone Stretch
description_en: Get down on all four with an exercise ball underneath your torso. Extend your legs and walk your hands out while raising your heels. Put a stretch on your back by extending your arms. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

name_en: Exercise Ball Lying Side Lat Stretch
description_en: Sit on the exercise ball and slowly roll down until your back is resting on the ball Extend your arms to the sides and slightly above your head Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds Come back to starting position and repeat

name_en: Exercise Ball Lying Side Lat Stretch
description_en: Lie down on your one side on an exercise ball by curling it between the side of your chest and arm. Bend your lower knee and extend your upper leg. Apply stretch by raising your upper arm overhead. Maintain this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

name_en: Exercise Ball One Legged Diagonal Kick Hamstring Curl
description_en: Lie face down and place your hips and stomach on the stability ball, arms out for balance. Extend one leg out and the other tucked into the ball. Push the ball away from you with your tucked-in leg. Pull the ball back towards you, using your targeted leg. Switch legs and repeat the process.

name_en: Exercise Ball One Legged Diagonal Kick Hamstring Curl
description_en: Lie flat on your back with one heel on the stability ball and the other leg straight in the air Bend at the hips and roll the ball towards your glutes by curling your heel in Straighten your hip and roll the ball away from your body to return to the starting position Perform the movement with the opposite leg for a balanced workout Make sure you keep your core engaged throughout

Sit on an exercise ball with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Place your hands on your knees and straighten one of your legs to the maximum range while keeping your heel on the floor. Maintain this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Sit on an exercise ball with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Walk your feet out to bring your hips off the ball and lean backward unless the ball comes underneath your back. Lower one of your knees while sliding your foot towards the ball to put a stretch on the other thigh. Maintain this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Sit on an exercise ball with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Place your hands behind your head and lean back unless your back becomes parallel to the floor. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand with your back to a wall and place the exercise ball between your lower back and the wall Step your feet out in front of you, shoulder width apart Bend your knees and lower your body onto the ball as if you're sitting down Push back up to the starting position using your heels

Kneel on the ground with your hands shoulder width apart Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor Push your body up explosively so that your hands leave the ground Control your landing back into the starting position ensuring your hands are again shoulder width apart Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Get into a standard push-up position Lower your body until your chest is about an inch from the ground Push your body off the ground forcefully, so that your hands leave the ground Catch yourself on the way down and repeat

Get down on your hands and toes with your back straight. Keep your arms and legs straight and form a straight line with your body from the head to your ankles. Lower your chest towards the floor while bending your arms. As your elbows are above your torso, raise your chest to the initial position explosively by straightening your arms, and then repeat.

Begin in a standing position and step your feet wide. Turn your right foot out 90 degrees and your left foot slightly in. Bend your right knee until it is directly over your right ankle. Reach your right arm toward the ground and extend your left arm upwards. Turn your head to look at your left hand.

Start in a standing position, feet wide apart Turn your right foot out to 90 degrees Bend your right knee until it is over the ankle Reach your right hand down and place it outside your right foot Extend your left arm above your head with your palm facing downwards Turn your gaze towards your left hand

Sit or stand upright Slowly tilt your head forward until a stretch is felt in the back of your neck Hold the stretch for up to 30 seconds Slowly lift your head back up to the starting position Repeat the stretch moving your head backward until a stretch is felt in the front of your neck

name_en: Extension Of Arms In Vertical Stretch
description_en: Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms overhead Gently push your hands back, keeping them straight Hold for the stretch feeling in your triceps and deltoids Return to the initial position and repeat

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the EZ bar in front of you at shoulder width. Start by doing seven half-curls from the bottom of the movement to the halfway point. Next, do seven half-curls from the halfway point to the top of the movement. Finally, perform seven full curls, from the bottom to the top of the movement. The cycle of 21 reps is then repeated.

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart holding the EZ barbell at chest level Push the barbell upwards until your arms are fully extended Hold for a moment at the top Slowly lower the bar back down to the chest Repeat the movement

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the EZ barbell at shoulder height Push the bar upwards until your arms are fully extended Pause for a moment at the top Lower the bar down slowly to your shoulders Repeat the movement for your desired number of reps

Stand up straight holding the EZ barbell at shoulder width close grip. While keeping your elbows close to your torso, curl the weights while contracting your biceps. Hold at the contracted position for a brief moment and squeeze your biceps. Slowly lower the bar back down to the initial position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Stand up straight with a tight core and flat back. Hold the EZ barbell with a close grip. Curl the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body. Hold the top position for a moment, and squeeze your biceps. Lower the bar back down in a slow and controlled manner. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

name_en: EZ Barbell Close Grip Preacher Curl
description_en: Sit on the preacher bench, adjust the height so your armpits sit comfortably at the top Hold the EZ Barbell at shoulder width with an underhand grip Curl the bar towards your shoulders while keeping your upper arms stationary Pause and squeeze at the top Slowly lower the bar to the starting position

Sit on the preacher bench correctly and place your elbows on the pads Hold the EZ barbell with your palms facing up Curl the barbell towards your shoulder Lower the barbell back down slowly in a controlled manner Repeat for your desired amount of reps

Stand up straight holding an EZ bar at shoulder width While keeping the upper arms stationary, curl the weights till your biceps are fully contracted Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the bar back to the starting position Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Stand upright holding the EZ Barbell with an underhand grip With your elbows close to your body, raise the bar by flexing your elbows Pause for a moment as your biceps contract at the top Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position Repeat for desired amount of reps

Lie on a decline bench and securely lock your legs at the end of the bench. Hold the EZ bar with an overhand grip. Lower the bar towards the forehead by bending at the elbow while keeping your upper arms still. Raise the bar back to the starting position by extending your elbows. Repeat the motion as needed.

Stand up straight with an EZ Barbell in your hands at arm's length. Keep your elbows close to your torso. Now, while keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps. Continue to raise the weight until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as your breathe in.

Sit down on an incline bench with the EZ Barbell held at arms length over your chest Keep your elbows close together and lower the barbell to your forehead Contract your triceps to return the EZ barbell to the starting position Try to keep your upper arms stationary throughout

Lay flat on your back on a bench, holding the EZ Barbell above your chest with both hands Lower the bar to your upper chest in a controlled manner Pause briefly Push the bar back to the starting position Repeat the motion

Lie on your back on a flat bench, holding an EZ barbell directly above your shoulders with your arms fully extended. Keeping your upper arms stationary, bend your elbows to slowly lower the barbell towards your forehead. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement. Push the barbell back to the starting position, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
