Lie flat on your back on a bench with the EZ barbell grasped firmly in your hands Begin with your arms fully extended above your chest Slowly lower the barbell by bending at the elbows keeping the upper arms fixed Lower the bar until it is just above your forehead Press the bar back to the starting position

Sit on the preacher bench and adjust the height so your armpits rest comfortably at the top of the pad Grasp the EZ barbell with an underhand grip Curl the barbell towards your shoulders Pause briefly then lower the barbell back to the starting position Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Stand up straight, grasping the EZ barbell at shoulder width with a reverse grip Keep your elbows close to your torso Curl the weights while contracting your biceps, keep the rest of your body still Pause at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the weights back to the starting position

Stand up with your torso upright while holding an E-Z barbell at the wider outer handle. Lower the weight while keeping the elbows close to the torso. Curl the weights while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Continue to raise the weight until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as you breathe in.

name_en: EZ Barbell Reverse grip Preacher Curl
description_en: Start by adjusting the preacher bench so your upper arms sit comfortably on the padding Grasp the barbell with a reverse (overhand) grip Curl the barbell upwards, contracting your biceps Slowly lower the bar back to the start position, lengthening your biceps Maintain tension on the biceps throughout the lowering phase

Sit on a bench with your feet firmly on the ground Hold the EZ barbell with both hands Curl the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows stable and close to your body Pause for a moment at the top and squeeze your biceps Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position

Begin by sitting on a bench and holding an EZ Barbell with your hands about shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms skyward over your head with your arms almost fully extended. Bend your elbows and lower the barbell behind your head until your arms are at about 90 degrees. Push the barbell back up until your arms are fully extended again. Repeat for your intended amount of reps.

Sit on the edge of a flat bench with your legs spread apart. The EZ barbell should be on the floor in front of you. Bend over and grab the bar with an underhand grip (palms facing upwards). Without lifting your elbows off your knees, curl the bar up to your chin. Hold at the top of the movement for a short pause, then lower the bar back to the starting position. Keep your elbows stationary throughout the movement.

Hold the EZ barbell at hip level with your hands shoulder-width apart Keeping your elbows close to your body, bend your arms and bring the barbell up to your chest Squeeze your biceps at the top Lower the barbell back to the hip level in a controlled way Repeat the movement for the required amount of repetitions

name_en: EZ Barbell Standing Back Wrist Curl
description_en: Hold the EZ barbell behind your back with your palms facing away from you Bend your wrists and lift the weight as high as possible Hold for a moment before slowly lowering the weight Maintain a slight bend in your knees throughout

Stand behind an EZ-Barbell with a shoulder-width grip Curl the barbell up, towards the shoulders Squeeze your biceps at the top of the curl Return the barbell down to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat for your desired number of repetitions

name_en: EZ Barbell Standing Single Arm Neutral Wrist Curl
description_en: Have your feet shoulder width apart and hold the EZ barbell in your hand with your palm facing upwards Curl the barbell upwards while keeping your arm close to your body Raise the barbell until your forearm is fully flexed Slowly lower the barbell back down while maintaining control Repeat this for your desired amount of reps and then swap to the other arm

name_en: EZ Barbell Standing Wide Grip Biceps Curl
description_en: Stand straight and hold the barbell at a wide grip Curl the barbell up to about chest level, keeping elbows stationary Hold at the top and contract your biceps Slowly lower the barbell back to starting position

name_en: EZ-Barbell Standing Wide Grip Biceps Curl
description_en: Stand straight holding the EZ-barbell at a wide grip Curl the barbell upwards while keeping your elbows stationary Lift the barbell until it is at shoulder height Hold the position for a moment and squeeze your biceps Slowly lower the barbell to the starting position

Stand up straight holding the barbell with your palms facing up Curl the weight while keeping your forearms touching your biceps Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position Repeat this motion for the desired number of reps

name_en: EZ Barbell Standing Wrist Reverse Curl
description_en: Stand up straight holding the EZ bar at shoulder width. Keep your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights while contracting your forearms. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the forearms. Inhale and slowly begin to bring the barbell back to starting position. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

name_en: Ez bar biceps curl close grip
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab an EZ barbell near your thighs with an underhand grip, arms straight, and hands placed close. Raise the barbell towards the shoulders by bending your arms. As it reaches shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Ez bar biceps curl normal grip
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab an EZ barbell near your thighs with an underhand grip, arms straight, and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell towards the shoulders by bending your arms. As it reaches shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Ez bar biceps curl wide grip
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab an EX barbell near your thighs with an underhand grip, arms straight, and hands wider than your shoulder width. Raise the barbell towards the shoulders by bending your arms. As it reaches shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Ez bar cable curl wide grip
description_en: Stand tall facing a crossover machine with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the EZ barbell near your thighs with an underhand grip, straight arms, and hands wider than your shoulder width. Raise the barbell towards your shoulders by folding your arms. As you reach shoulder level, return to the starting position and repeat.

name_en: Ez bar cable curl wide grip crossover machine
description_en: Stand tall facing a crossover machine with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the EZ barbell near your thighs with an underhand grip, straight arms, and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell towards your shoulders by folding your arms. As you reach shoulder level, return to the starting position and repeat.

Lie down on a flat bench with your feet on the floor. Grab the EZ bar from the rack and hold it above your chest, hands closer than shoulder width. Lower the bar towards your middle chest. Push bar back up to the starting position by straightening your arms. Hold for a moment at the top, then repeat.

Lie on a flat bench holding an EZ bar above you with a close grip, keep your arms fully extended. Lower the bar towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body. Push the bar back to the starting position, extending your arms fully. Ensure that the bar moves in a vertical line up and down for efficient muscle engagement. Repeat the movement for the desired number of sets and repetitions.

Stand up straight while holding a EZ-barbell using a supinated (palms facing out) and shoulder width grip Bend the hips and knees while keeping your back straight to go into a deadlift position, lowering the bar to around knee level Push through your heels to lift your torso back up to the initial position Once standing, perform a biceps curl by bending at the elbow and bringing the bar towards your shoulders Lower the barbell back to your hips, then repeat the process

Start by kneeling on the floor and hold the EZ bar with both hands at shoulder-width apart. Keeping your arms straight, slowly lean forward and roll the EZ bar out in front of you. Stretch out to your limit or until your body is just above the floor. Pull yourself back to the starting position by contracting your abs. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

name_en: EZ-Bar Legs Side Pull In Sit-up
description_en: Sit on the floor with your legs extended and the EZ-bar held overhead Bend your knees and pull your legs towards your chest while keeping the bar steady Simultaneously bend forward from your waist and attempt to touch the bar to your feet Return to the starting position in a controlled manner, extending your legs and lowering the bar overhead

name_en: EZ Bar Lying Bent Arms Pullover
description_en: Lie flat on a bench, clutching an EZ bar with your hands shoulder-width apart Bend your arms slightly at the elbows, then extend your hands back over your head Pull the bar over your chest until your arms are almost fully extended vertically Return the bar back over your head to the starting position on the bench in a controlled manner

Lie on your back on a bench, holding the EZ bar above your chest with a shoulder-width grip Keeping your arms slightly bent, lower the bar back over your head Warmly the bar until it is level with your bench Pull the bar back over your head to the starting position Maintain a slight bend in your arms throughout the movement

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab an EZ barbell behind your back with your hands shoulder-width apart while extending your arms overhead with folded elbows. Raise the barbell by extending your arms overhead. As your arms become fully extended, lower the barbell by folding your elbows and repeat.

name_en: EZ-Bar Reverse Grip Bent Over Row
description_en: Stand bending forward at your waist and hold the EZ-Bar with a reverse grip Keep the back straight and pull the bar towards your waist Hold the position at the top of the motion Lower the bar back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of reps

name_en: EZ Bar Seated Close Grip Concentration Curl
description_en: Sit down on a bench and spread your legs. Rest your arm holding the EZ bar against your inner thigh, letting the weight hang. Curl the EZ bar up towards your shoulder, making sure to keep your upper arm stationary. Pause at the peak of the movement, flexing your bicep. Slowly lower the EZ bar back down to starting position.

Sit down and spread your legs Rest the back of your upper arms on your inner thighs Grab the EZ bar with palms facing upwards Curl the weight while keeping your upper arms stationary Return to the original position in a controlled fashion

name_en: Ez Bar Seated Close Grip Shoulder Press
description_en: Sit on a bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Fold your arms and hold an EZ bar in front of your chest with your hands placed shoulder-width apart and palms facing backward. Raise the bar by extending your arms overhead. As your arms become straight, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: EZ bar Seated Close grip Shoulder Press
description_en: Sit on an exercise bench with back support, holding an EZ bar at the upper part of your chest. Push the EZ bar straight up until your arms are fully extended, but don't lock the elbows. Pause for a moment at the top of your lift. Lower the bar down to the upper part of your chest in a controlled manner. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Sit on the edge of a bench with your feet flat on the ground. Your forearms should be resting on your thighs with your wrists just over your knees, palms facing up. Hold the EZ Bar with an underhand grip. Lower the bar as far as possible, allowing your wrists to hinge backward. Curl the bar upwards by flexing your wrists. Lower the bar back down to the starting point in a controlled motion.

name_en: EZ Bar Seated Wrist Reverse Curl
description_en: Sit on the edge of a bench, feet flat on the ground Grasp the EZ bar with an overhand grip Keep your forearms resting on your thighs, with your wrists just beyond the knees Curl the bar upwards by moving only your wrists Lower the bar back down in a controlled manner

Stand straight holding an EZ barbell at shoulder level With your elbows stationary at shoulder level, extend your arms to lift the bar overhead Hold the top position briefly Slowly lower the bar back to the start position Repeat the movement for your desired number of reps

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the EZ Bar using an overhand grip. Raise the bar straight up in front of you to about shoulder height. Hold this position for a second, feeling the tension in your shoulders. Lower the bar back down slowly to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.

Stand up straight while holding an EZ curl bar at the wide outer handle. Use your side shoulders to lift the bar as you exhale. Continue to lift the bar until it nearly touches your chin. Lower the bar back down slowly to the starting position as you inhale.

Lie on your back with your arms at your sides, knees bent and feet flat on the floor close to your butt Lift one leg and extend it out in front of you Drive through your other heel to lift your hips off the floor as high as possible Slowly lower your hips back down to the floor Repeat on the other side

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart and hold weights in your hands on your sides With your shoulder slightly behind and your chest high, walk across an open space Take small, quick steps while keeping the weights off the floor Walk as far as possible Rest and repeat for ensuring cardiovascular benefits

Stand up straight holding a pair of dumbbells at your sides. Begin to walk forward, taking short, quick steps. Walk as far as you can, maintaining a brisk pace, before needing to drop the weights. Rest for about a minute then repeat according to your workout plan. Increase weight as your strength improves for continual progress.

Stand tall with your back straight, knees bent slightly, and feet shoulder-width apart. Alternately raise and lower your feet a few inches from the floor. Keep doing this activity for a suitable time.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Lift one foot a few inches off the ground, keep your leg straight Rotate your foot and ankle clockwise for multiple rotations Switch direction and rotate your foot and ankle counter-clockwise for the same number of rotations Repeat with the other foot

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips Raise one foot off the ground and rotate your foot and ankle clockwise slowly After a few rotations, switch the direction and rotate your foot and ankle counter-clockwise Switch feet and repeat the exercise

Stand or sit down on a comfortable surface Extend your leg and keep your foot relaxed Move your foot and ankle side to side, slowly and gently Hold the position for a few seconds before moving to the other side Repeat the movement with the other foot

Stand close to a wall with your hands at arm length for balance Step one foot back, keeping its heel on the ground Bend your front knee slightly and press your back foots heel further into the ground You will feel a stretch in the back of your calf Swap legs and repeat the stretch on the other side

Stand upright and then step your right foot forward. Slowly bend your right knee while keeping your left leg straight. Lean forward slightly until you feel a stretch in your left calf. Hold that stretch for a few seconds and then switch legs. Repeat this on each leg for a few times.

Stand straight with your feet together and arms at your sides Jump up and simultaneously spread your legs and clap your hands above your head Land softly on the balls of your feet and bring them back together Jump up again, but this time tap your feet in front of you alternately while clapping your hands underneath your raised knee Repeat the exercise for your desired amount of repetitions or time interval

Stand tall with your back straight, feet together, and hold a barbell over your shoulders just behind your neck. Lower your hips to the floor while bending your knees. As your thighs come nearly parallel to the floor, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Extend your arms in front of you at shoulder level, palms facing down Rapidly open and close your fingers, stretching them to the maximum outspread Once your fingers are fully outspread, quickly roll them into a tight fist Repeat this process continuously for the prescribed amount of time Make sure you maintain a steady pace throughout the exercise

Extend one arm in front of you with your palm up Bend your wrist, pointing your hand toward the floor With your other hand, gently bend your extended palm further downward until you feel a stretch in your forearm Hold the position for 15-30 seconds Repeat this process with your other hand

Start in a standard push-up position, but with your fingers facing each other Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor Pause for a moment at the bottom Push your body back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Start in a traditional plank position, resting on your forearms Ensure your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your ankles Lift your palms off the ground, putting the weight on your forearms Slowly lower your palms back to the ground Repeat the exercise for a set number of repetitions

Extend your arm in front of you with your palm up. Bend your wrist, pointing your hand toward the floor. With your other hand, gently bend your wrist further until you feel a mild to moderate stretch in your forearm. Hold for at least 15 to 30 seconds. Repeat with the other hand.

Start in forward fold position, with legs slightly bent Position your hands on the floor behind your feet. Sit back onto your upper arms while lifting your feet off the ground Straighten your legs out to each side. Hold the position and breathe steadily, then gently return to starting position

Get down on all your four while keeping your arms, back,  and thighs straight. Raise one of your knees to the hip level by opening your thighs while keeping your leg bent. Hold for a while then return to the initial position, and repeat.

Get down on all your four while keeping your arms, back,  and thighs straight. Raise one of your knees by opening your thighs and start making circles in the air with your knee. Move your raised knee clockwise and anti-clockwise.

Stand upright and hold onto a fixed bar overhead with hands shoulder-width apart Lean backwards while keeping your arms extended Flex your hips forward and allow your lower back to bend backwards Maintain this stretch for a few seconds before returning to the initial posture Repeat the stretch for the recommended number of repetitions

Stall tall by placing your feet around a fixed bar. Hold the bar by bending your arms slightly, and lower your hips while bending your knees to a 90-degree angle. Lean backward while straightening your arms to feel a stretch. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Sit on the ground with your knees bent and your heels about a foot from your butt. Lie back onto the floor, extending your arms above your head. Use your abs to pull your body up and touch your elbows to your knees. Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Place your dominant hand high on the pole with an overhand grip Place your other hand vertically down the pole with a thumb up grip Engage your core pushing your body away from the pole with your bottom hand while pulling with your top hand Slowly lift your legs up to a horizontal position Lower your body back again in a controlled manner

Stand up straight and extend one of your legs forward Bend your waist and reach towards the toe of your extended leg Return upright and place the extended leg behind you Bend from your waist again for a backward stretch Repeat on the other side for a balanced workout

Lie on your back with your legs straight out Place your hands lightly on your head Raise your torso until it's upright, using your abdominal muscles Slowly return to the starting position, maintaining control Repeat for the desired number of reps

Lay flat on your back with your legs extended out straight Raise your torso into a sitting position while keeping your arms straight and parallel to the ground Pause briefly at the top before returning to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions

Stand in front of a chair Lift one knee as high as possible while bending the other slightly Jump and switch your legs in mid-air, landing with your other foot on the ground As soon as you land, jump and switch legs again Continue this jumping and switching legs motion for the desired duration

Lie down on your back with your knees bent, feet on the floor, and a resistance band under your upper back. Hold the ends of the band by raising your forearms and opening your elbows at shoulder level on the floor. Stretch the band by extending your arms up. As your arms come close, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie on your back on the floor with your feet resting on a bench, knees bent Place your hands lightly on either side of your head keeping your elbows in Push the small of your back down in the floor to isolate your ab muscles Begin to roll your shoulders off the floor Return to your starting position in a controlled manner

Lie face down on the floor, legs straight and arms crossed over the chest Tighten your glute muscles and lift your upper body off the ground Try to maintain a straight line from your head to your heels Lower your upper body back down to the ground in a controlled manner Repeat the movement for the set amount of reps

Lay face down on the floor with your arms extended out in front of you. Lift your legs and upper body off the floor as high as possible. Hold this position for a few seconds. Lower your body back to the floor in a controlled fashion. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

Lay flat on your stomach on the floor with your arms out in a T shape Raise your arms and chest off the ground Hold at the top of the extension for a second Release and lower yourself back to the start position Repeat this movement at your own pace

Lie on your stomach with your arms extended out at 90 degrees, palms facing down Lift your chest and arms off the ground, bringing your shoulder blades closer together Hold at the peak of the movement for a moment, then slowly lower your body back to the ground Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps Making sure to contract your back and shoulder muscles with each repetition

Lie down on the floor with your arms extended in a T shape, palms facing down Lift your chest and arms off the floor, keeping your arms straight and alignment with your body Squeeze your shoulder blades together as you lift Hold and then lower back to the starting position

Lay face down flat on the floor with your arms stretched out to either side forming a 'T' shape With your palms facing down, lift your arms upwards Try to squeeze your shoulder blades together when your arms are at the highest point Lower your arms slowly back to the floor Repeat the movement for desired repetitions
Lie down on your back with your legs straight and your hands under your hips with palms down Raise your legs slightly off the floor Alternately raise and lower your legs without bending them

Lie down on your back with your hands under your glutes Keep your legs extended and straight Lift one leg while maintaining the other one off the floor and alternate quickly Maintain the pace and continue to flutter kick your legs Stop when you've completed your reps

Start by lying on your back with your arms by your sides Extend your legs up straight above your hips Lower one leg down while keeping the other one up Switch and lower the other leg as you bring the first one up Repeat using a fluttering motion

Start by lying flat on your back with your arms at your sides and your palms down. Extend your legs in front of you, with a slight bend in your knees. Raise your left leg about 6 inches off the ground, keeping your right leg stationary. Lower your left leg while moving your right leg up. Alternate in a fluttering, kicking motion without touching the ground.

Lie down flat on your back with your legs fully extended Raise your legs slightly above the ground and start making small, rapid up and down movements with your legs Keep your arms by your sides, and maintain the position Breathe in a controlled manner Keep going for 30 seconds or so or until you can't maintain form

Lie on your back with your arms by your sides Lift both feet slightly off the ground Move one foot up while keeping the other stationary Alternate between feet in a fluttering motion Repeat until your set is complete

Sit on the edge of a chair, holding onto the edges Straighten your legs and lean back slightly Start lifting your knees towards your chest alternatively, like you're running Keep the pace fast to ensure your heart rate is up Do this for at least 30 seconds to 1 minute per set

Start in a standing position with your feet hip-width apart Take a step forward with your right foot, landing heel first Lower your body into a lunge position keeping your back straight Push off with your right foot, returning to the starting position Repeat the motion with your left foot

name_en: Flying Lizard Yoga Pose Utthan Pristhasana
description_en: Start in a standing position, and then bend forward at the waist to place your hands on the ground Step your right foot outside your right hand while keeping your hands flat on the ground Lower your left knee to the ground and shift your weight to your hands and right foot Raise your right hand off the ground and extend your arm to the sky while looking up Hold this pose for up to 10 breaths and then switch sides

Stand tall with a foam roller against a wall at your back. Raise your arms and try to place your hands on the wall above your head. Slide them down the wall while compressing the foam roller with your back. Slide back up to the starting position. Repeat several times for best results.

Stand straight with feet hip-width apart Start hopping on your right foot while simultaneously reaching the left foot to touch the ground a few inches to the side of the right foot Quickly shift your weight and start hopping on your left foot while reaching the right foot to touch the ground a few inches to the left of your left foot Keep a fast and steady rhythm, switching weight from one foot to the other as you tap the ground Continue alternating back and forth for the desired amount of time or repetitions

Straighten your arm out in front of you Turn your palm upward and flex hand back Use your other hand to gently apply more pressure Hold this position for 15-30 seconds Perform the same step on the other arm

Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms forward at shoulder height Push forward as if you're trying to move an imaginary object Hold the push position for a few seconds Return to the starting position and repeat

name_en: Forearms to Wide Grip Wall Push-up
description_en: Stand facing the wall with your hands wider than your shoulders Engage your core and lower your body towards the wall Press your forearms against the wall Push your body away from the wall until your arms are fully extended Repeat the exercise for the recommended number of repetitions
Stand or sit with your arm outstretched Rotate your palm upwards and then downwards Hold each position for a few seconds Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions

Stand facing a wall, feet shoulder-width apart Place your palms on the wall at shoulder height and shoulder width apart Bend your elbows and lean your body towards the wall Push back to your starting position and repeat the exercise

Start in a pushup position Lean on both forearms placed firmly on the ground Your body should form a straight line from your shoulders to your ankles Hold this position, engaging your core and squeezing your glutes Keep your head in line with your spine

Start in a standing position, with your feet hip-width apart Bend slightly at the knees, and then hop forward Land softly on your feet, bending your knees to absorb the impact Immediately hop backward, landing softly again Repeat this process for the desired number of repetitions

Start with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent. Jump forward, landing on the balls of your feet. Immediately jump backward, landing in the starting position. Jump to the right while keeping the knees slightly bent, then immediately jump to the left. This creates a four-point pattern: forward, backward, right, and left. Repeat for desired amount of time.

Begin in a standing position, feet hips-width apart. Jump forward landing on both feet and then jump backward to the starting position. Next, jump to the right sideward and then jump to the left sideward to return to your starting position. That completes one rep. Repeat for desired number of repetitions. Keep your core tight and knees slightly bent during the jumps.

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Breathe in and as you breathe out, bend forward from your hips Stretch your hands towards your toes, or as far as you can reach Hold the position for 15 to 30 seconds Slowly rise back to the starting position
Stand straight with your shoulders relaxed Lower your head forward and try to touch your chin to your chest Hold for 10 to 20 seconds Return to the starting position

Sit or stand comfortably with chest elevated and shoulders relaxed Extend head forward so that the neck is inline with the back Hold this stretch for 30 seconds Release the stretch and return to a neutral position Repeat 5 times

name_en: Forward Hop on a padded stool
description_en: Stand in front of your padded stool with feet hip-width apart. Bend knees and drop hips back, preparing to launch from a squat position. Spring forward onto the stool, landing softly on your feet. Carefully hop back down to the original position. Repeat the exercise with desired repetitions.

Stand upright with your hands on your hips Step forward with one foot until your leg reaches a 90-degree angle Your rear knee should remain parallel to the ground and your front knee should not go beyond your toes Lift your front lunging leg to return to the starting position Repeat the process with your other leg

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Take a step forward with one foot and lower your body into a lunge While in lunge position, extend your arms fully in a punching motion Return to the upright position and repeat on the other side Continue to alternate sides

Stand or sit upright and look straight ahead Slowly tilt your head forward while trying to touch your chest with your chin Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds Release the position and return your head to the neutral starting position Repeat this process for your desired amount of reps

name_en: Forward Pulse Lunge with Hands Overhead
description_en: Stand upright and step one foot forward into a lunge position, ensuring your knee is directly above your ankle Raise your arms above your head Bounce slightly in this position, pulsing up and down Return to the starting position and alternate legs after each set Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand upright with feet hip-width apart Execution elbow slightly ed and lean shoulders forward as you do a punch movement towards the front Simultaneously, tap the toe of one foot in front of the other Alternate this movement with the other foot and arm Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand upright and extend arms out to the side, parallel to the ground. Cross your arms in front of your torso until you feel a slight stretch in your shoulders. Slowly rotate your arms to point upwards while maintaining the crossover position. Return to the initial position by rotating your arms back to the side. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps.
Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise your arms to shoulder height on each side Rotate your arms, pointing your fingers to the ceiling Slowly lower your arms in a controlled movement Repeat

Stand straight with your feet together Hop forward as far as you can, and then hop to the side Hop back to the initial position Repeat this movement for the desired amount of reps Change the side direction after each repetition

Start in a classic plank position with your shoulder width apart Move your right foot forward until your knee makes a 90 degree angle Return your right foot to initial plank position Now move your left foot forward until your knee makes a 90 degree angle Return to the initial plank position and repeat

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Take a large step forward with your right foot, bending your front knee until your thigh is parallel to the floor Push off your front foot to bring the back foot to meet the front Repeat on the left side Alternate sides for the duration of your set

Start in a high plank position, hands placed directly under your shoulders Engage your core and with a deep inhale, lower your body down towards the ground Try to move as a single unit without letting your chest drop ahead of your hips Keep your elbows close to your body as you descend Hold your breath at the bottom and push your body up into the initial position as you exhale

Start in a deep squat with your hands on the floor in front of you Jump up, pushing off with your feet and aiming to get as much height as possible While in the air, pull your knees up towards your chest Straighten your legs out in front of you mid-air Land lightly on your feet in the squat position and repeat

Lie on your back with your legs bent outwards like a frog Touch your elbows to your knees by contracting your abs Lower back down to the starting position Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps Ensure to keep your head and neck in line with your spine during the exercise

Lie down on your back with your hands behind your head Bend your knees and bring them towards your chest Engage your abs and lift your upper body towards your knees Lower your body back down to the starting position Repeat as required

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet together Bring your feet towards your buttocks forming a diamond shape Gently place your hands on the back of your head to support your neck Contract your abs to lift your head, shoulders, and upper back off the ground Lower down controlly and complete your set

Start in a plank position, with your hands under your shoulders Jump your feet forward to your hands Then jump them back to a plank Make sure to keep your back straight throughout Repeat this movement for the desired reps

Lie on your back with knees bent and heels on the floor Bring the soles of your feet together allowing your knees to fall out to the sides Raise your hips off the ground while keeping your back straight Hold this position for a second and then lower your back to the starting position

Start by sitting on the ground with your knees bent, feet flat on the floor Place your palms on the floor behind you for support Press into your palms and lift your hips off the ground, keeping your spine long and straight Squeeze your glutes at the top, then slowly lower back down to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Start in a push up position Bend your elbows and lean forward, lowering your upper body towards the ground Simultaneously, bring your knees towards your elbows Hold this position for a few seconds before returning to the start Repeat the movement

Start by lying face down on a bench with your lower body hanging off Bend your knees and draw them towards your upper body Lift your legs upwards while keeping the knees bent Hold for a moment, then lower your legs back to the starting position Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Frog Reverse Hyperextension Tap on Floor
description_en: Start by sitting on the floor with your hands placed behind you and your knees bent outward. Lean back onto your hands and lift your feet off the floor, keeping your knees bent. Contract your glutes and lift your hips off the floor, extending your legs out fully till they're parallel to the floor. Control your movement as you lower your hips back to the floor. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

Start in a standing position with your feet slightly wider than hip-width apart Bend your knees and lower your hips down into a squat, while keeping your heels on the ground Hold this position and further lower your hips, bringing them closer to the ground Push your elbows against your knees gently Return to the starting position by pushing through your heels and straightening your legs

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms to the sides at shoulder height Rotate your arms in a circular motion, first forward and then backward Repeat the exercise for the desired amount of repetitions Always keep your arms at shoulder height

Start by standing straight or sitting down comfortably Slowly bring your chin down towards your chest and hold Return to the neutral position Gently tilt your head backwards and hold Return to the neutral position

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise your right knee up towards the chest as you can Lower the right leg back down and simultaneously bring the left knee up towards the chest Repeat this alternate knee raises in quick succession To add a side element, bring the knee up towards the same side shoulder instead right in front

Start standing straight with your feet hip-width apart Raise your right knee towards your chest and then extend your leg diagonally to your right side Retract your leg to a bent knee position at your chest Lower the raised leg back to the ground Repeat this motion on your left side

Start in a standing position with your feet hip-width apart Step to the side with your right foot and cross your left foot in front of the right Tap the floor with your left foot, then immediately switch to the other side Repeat this motion alternating between your right and left foot Maintain a brisk pace throughout the exercise

Stand upright with feet hip-width apart Begin by performing a small hop forward and landing on the balls of your feet Immediately follow the front hop with a back hop, returning to your starting position Repeat the action in a continuous, rhythmic cycle Maintain a slightly bent knee throughout the exercise to reduce impact

Stand tall. Lift one leg in front of you, with your foot flexed Use your hip flexors and quadriceps to kick your leg out, keeping your knee slightly bent Bring the leg back to the starting position Repeat on the other side Do as many repetitions as required, depending on your fitness level

name_en: Front Leg Lift Under Knee Tap
description_en: Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Raise your right leg, bending at the knee, until your thigh is parallel with the floor While keeping your leg lifted, reach forward with your left hand and tap below your right knee Lower your right leg and repeat with the left leg Continue alternating sides for the desired repetitions

name_en: Front Leg Lift Under Knee Tap
description_en: Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Lift your right knee up to the waist level, while keeping your hands at the same level Tap your knee with your hands Bring your right foot down and immediately lift your left knee up to waist level Repeat the same with your left knee and continue to alternate

Grab the bar with both hands, shoulder width apart. Engage your core and lift your body until it's parallel with the ground. Hold this position, keeping your body straight and rigid. Lower your body back down slowly, maintaining control. Rest for a moment and repeat.

Lie on your stomach on a mat or the floor with your elbows close to your sides pointing outwards Rise up onto your toes and elbows, keeping your body a straight line Contract your abdominal muscles and your glutes to hold your body above the ground, maintaining a straight line from your head to your toes Hold this position for as long as it is comfortable to do and then return to your starting position

Lie down on your stomach, keeping your feet together, and elbows close to your body Push yourself up onto your elbows and toes, creating a straight line from your head to your heels Hold this position, without letting your hips drop Keep your abdominals pulled in so you remain straight After holding the position, lower your body gently back to the floor

Stand facing a wall with your feet shoulder-width apart Lean forward and place your forearms against the wall Keep your body straight and hold this position Ensure your hips are aligned with your body, not sagging or raised too high Hold this position for as long as possible, gradually increasing the duration over time

Lie prone on the floor. Support your weight on your forearms and toes Keep your body straight and rigid. Don't allow your body to sag Contract your abs and hold this position for a specified amount of time Don't forget to breathe normally throughout the exercise To finish, slowly lower your body back onto the floor in a controlled manner

name_en: Front Plank on Elbow Toe Tap
description_en: Start in a front plank position with your elbows directly beneath your shoulders and your body in a straight line from your head to your heels Lift your right foot and tap it out to the side, then bring it back to the starting position Repeat this movement with your left foot Continue to alternate legs for the duration of your set Ensure to keep your body still and engaged during the exercise

Start in a plank position with your elbows directly under your shoulder, your back flat and your body in a straight line Jump your feet to the side, keeping your hands still Jump to switch to the other side Alternate back and forth for your desired amount of repetitions

Get into a pushup position, ensuring your body forms a straight line from head to heels Engage your core and maintain a flat back Shift your weight on your left foot and tap your right foot to the side Return your right foot to the starting position Repeat this process with the left foot

Start in a front plank position with your body straight, elbows directly underneath your shoulders and your feet hip-width apart Without moving your hips, lift your right foot off the floor and move your knee towards your elbow Tap your right foot to the right side of your mat Return your right foot to the starting position Repeat the same movement with your left foot

Get into a standard plank position, with your weight supported on your forearms and toes Rotate your body slowly to one side, raising your hand towards the ceiling, keeping your body straight Now you are in the side plank position Hold for one second then return to the front plank Repeat the same steps for the other side

Get into a plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders Keep your body form a straight line from your head to your heels Lift your right leg and tap it to the side Return your right leg to its original position Repeat on the left side

Start in a standing position with your feet hip-width apart Bend at your waist and place your hands on the ground Walk your hands forward until your body is in a full plank position Pause for a second, then walk your hands back towards your feet and rise back to the start position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Front Plank with Arm and Leg Lift
description_en: Start in a high plank position, with your hands directly under your shoulders Lift your right hand and left leg off the floor Hold this position for a few seconds Lower your hand and leg back to the floor Repeat with your left hand and right leg

name_en: Front Plank with Arm and Leg Lift
description_en: Start in a high plank (push-up) position with bodyweight evenly distributed between hands and toes Keep the body straight and raise one arm in front of you While keeping your arm raised, lift the opposite leg off the ground Return your arm and leg to the original position and alternate with other arm and leg Repeat this on both sides for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Front Plank with Arm and Leg Lift
description_en: Get down into a push-up position with your forearms on the ground Keeping your body rigid and straight, balance on your toes and elbows From this position, lift one leg and the opposite arm simultaneously Hold for a moment then switch to the other leg and arm Keep alternating sides for your desired reps

name_en: Front Plank with Arm and Leg Lift
description_en: Start in a plank position by getting on your forearms and toes Keep your body straight from head to heels Raise one arm and the opposite leg off the ground Hold for a few seconds, then return to the initial position Repeat the exercise, alternating your arms and legs

Start in a plank position, your elbows under your shoulders and your body straight Keep your head in neutral position by looking at the floor Lift one arm off the floor without losing your balance Hold for 2 seconds, then lower your arm and repeat with the other arm Continue alternating for the desired time

Get into a plank position with your arms straight and your hands directly under your shoulders Strongly engage your glutes and core Lift one leg off the ground keeping it straight Lower the leg back to the plank position in a controlled motion Repeat on the other side

Start in a front plank position with your elbows on the floor Keep your body straight and tight Slowly lift one leg off the ground without bending your knees Lower your leg back to the floor and repeat with the other leg Continue alternating legs for your desired number of reps

Start in a standard plank position with your forearms on the ground and your body perfectly straight Rotate your body to the right, lifting your right arm off the ground and extending it towards the sky Pause for a moment, then return your hand to the ground Rotate your body to the left and repeat the same movement on the other side Maintain the front plank position throughout the entirety of the exercise

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and a resistance band under your feet. Hold the ends of the band in your hands near your thighs with your palms facing backward. Stretch the band by taking your arms to shoulder level. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a barbell in your hands near your thighs with an overhand grip and your hands placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell by taking your arms above shoulder level. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms out straight in front of you at shoulder height Make circular movements with your arms as if you're scooping something Do this movement for a set amount of time, then reverse the direction Make sure to keep your core tight and your posture straight throughout the exercise

Stand tall with your back straight and hold a bar with your hands placed wider than your shoulder width. Raise the bar by extending your arms overhead. Bend your elbows to a 90-degree angle to produce a stretch in your shoulders. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet placed wider than your shoulder width, and hold a barbell on your shoulders just below your chin. Lower your hips to the floor while bending your knees. As your hips come lower than your knees, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet placed wider than your shoulder width, and hold dumbbells in your hands near your hips. Lower your hips to the floor while bending your knees. As your hips come lower than your knees, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet placed wider than your shoulder width, and hold dumbbells in your hands over the shoulders. Lower your hips to the floor while bending your knees. As your hips come lower than your knees, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet placed wider than your shoulder width, and hold kettlebells in your hands on the shoulders. Lower your hips to the floor while bending your knees. As your hips come lower than your knees, return to the initial position, and repeat.
Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Breathe in deeply and as you exhale, reach your hands down towards your toes Hold this position for 15-60 seconds Return to the starting position

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms out to the sides, keeping them at shoulder level Rotate your arms in a full circular motion from front to back Reverse the motion to rotate your arms from back to front Repeat the motion for the desired number of repetitions

Start by getting into a push-up position Slowly raise your lower body up while keeping your palms on the ground Hold your body in the air with your body parallel to the ground Keep your core engaged, ensuring your body forms a straight line from head to heels Return slowly to your starting position

Get down on all your fours, extend your legs back and raise them in the air by shifting your weight on your hands. Form s straight line with your body from head to toe and lower yourself to the floor by folding your arms. Raise yourself again by straightening your arms, return to the starting position, and repeat.

Begin in a plank position on your hands. Push up into a handstand, extending your legs out in front of you. Lower yourself slowly to the ground by bending your arms. Keep your body as straight as possible. Repeat the motion.

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Lower your body as far as you can by pushing your hips back and bending your knees Pause, then slowly push yourself back to the starting position Make sure your knees don't go beyond your toes while lowering the body Repeat the exercise for the recommended number of repetitions

Stand with your feet wider than hip-width apart and turn your toes outward Bend your knees and lower your buttocks towards the floor as if sitting in a chair Bring your palms together in prayer position at the center of your chest Use your elbows to push your knees further out Hold the position for a few breaths then stand up slowly

name_en: Glued Heels Leg Extension on a Chair
description_en: Sit on the edge of a sturdy chair with your feet firmly planted on the ground Extend one leg out in front of you with the heels glued together Hold the leg extension for a few seconds then slowly lower your leg back down to the floor Switch legs and repeat the process Continue alternating legs for desired reps

Lay flat on your back with your feet flat against a wall, knees bent Lift your hips off the ground while keeping your back straight At the top of the lift, spread your knees apart Return your knees to the original position Lower your hips back down to the floor in a controlled manner

Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground Lift your hips off the ground until your knees, hips, and shoulders form a straight line Once in raised position, open your knees out to the sides Then bring your knees back together Lower your hips down to just above the ground and repeat

Lie on your back with your knees bent, feet flat on the floor and hip width apart Raise your hips off the floor by pressing through the feet until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees While keeping your hips high, open your knees apart as far as possible Close your knees back together Lower your hips back down to the starting position

Lay flat on your back on the floor with your knees bent Lift your hips into the air to create a bridge Hold the bridge position and extend one leg outward Kick upward with the extended leg, keeping your leg straight Repeat with the opposite leg while maintaining the bridge position

Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Raise your hips off the floor by contracting your glutes, hamstrings and core. Lift one foot off the floor and bring your knee towards your chest. Lower the lifted leg back to the floor and repeat with the other leg. Lower your hips back down to the floor.

name_en: Glute Bridge One Leg on Bench
description_en: Start by laying flat on your back with one foot on top of a bench and the other foot elevated. Press down into the bench with the foot, squeeze the glutes, and lift the hips into the air. Hold the position for a moment making sure to keep your glutes activated. Slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position. Repeat the movement with the other leg.

name_en: Glute Bridge One Leg on Floor
description_en: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Extend one leg out straight on the floor. Press your hips up towards the ceiling, keeping your back straight and your abs engaged. Lower your body back down slowly, maintaining control. Repeat the movement with the other leg.

Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground, arms by your sides Drive your heels into the ground and lift your hips off the floor while squeezing your glutes Keep your body in a straight line from your shoulders to your knees Slowly lower your hips back to the ground Repeat for the desired number of reps

name_en: Glute Bridge Two Legs on Bench
description_en: Lie on your back on the floor with your heels on the bench. Your knees should be directly over your ankles. Push your heels into the bench to lift your hips off the floor as high as you can. Hold for a moment at the top squeezing your glutes. Lower your hips back to the floor

name_en: Glute Bridge Two Legs on Bench
description_en: Lie flat on your back with your feet placed on a bench Bend your knees to 90 degrees Lift your hips off the floor by pressing your feet into the bench Pause at the top then lower your hips back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Glute Bridge Two Legs on Floor
description_en: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor Push your hips up towards the ceiling, while keeping your back straight Squeeze your glutes at the top of the movement Lower your hips back down to the floor

name_en: Glute Bridge Two Legs with Chair
description_en: Sit on the edge of the chair, feet shoulder-width apart, knees bent. Lean back until your back is resting on the chair. Push through your heels and lift your hips off the ground to full extension. Hold the elevated position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your hips back down to the floor. Repeat the movement for the desired reps.

Lay flat on your back with your feet flat on the floor and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle Lift your hips off the floor by driving through your heels until your knees, hips and shoulders form a straight line Start stepping one foot out at a time while keeping your hips elevated Continue this movement for a desired number of repetitions Finish the set by lowering your hips back to the floor in a controlled manner

Lie on your back with your knees bent, feet flat on the floor, and arms at your sides. Press your hips up into the air, creating a bridge position. Keeping your hips high, walk your feet out, one step at a time. Walk your feet back in to their original position while keeping your hips as high as possible. Slowly lower your hips back to the floor. Repeat.

Get down on your back with your knees bent and feet on the floor. Raise your hips off the floor, straighten your thighs with your back, and open your knees apart. Hold for a while then return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lay face up on the floor and bend your knees so your feet are flat Tighten your abs and curl your shoulders towards your pelvis Pause at the top of the movement for a second Lower your body back down to the start position Repeat the movement

Begin in a standing position with feet shoulder-width apart Lean forward from your hips until your torso is almost parallel to the ground Keep your back straight and slowly lift yourself back to the starting position Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions Ensure the movement is slow and controlled throughout

Kneel on a cushioned surface with your legs straight out behind you Place your hands on your hips Slowly lean forward until your body is parallel with the ground Engage your glutes and hamstrings to pull yourself back up to the kneeling position

Kneel on the floor or an exercise mat with your feet together, keeping your body upright. Slowly lean forward from the knees, keeping your body straight from your head to your knees. Lower yourself as far as you can without falling, then push off the ground slightly with your hands and contract your hamstrings to pull yourself back to the upright position. Repeat for the desired number of reps. Ensure to keep your upper body in a straight line throughout, avoid bending at the hips.

Lie on your back with your knees bent, feet flat on the floor and your hands at your temples Contract your abs and sit up, touch your elbows to your knees Slowly lower yourself down returning to the starting position Avoid any strain on your neck by not pulling on it with your hands Keep a controlled rhythm, do not force movement

Start in a bridge position with your feet on the ground and hands under your shoulders Lift your hips high, keeping your body straight from shoulder to knee Rotate your waist to the right and then to the left Lower your body back towards the ground Repeat for desired number of repetitions

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Push your hips upwards by contracting your glutes until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees. Pull one knee toward your chest while keeping your pelvic stabilized and glute muscle active. Return the working leg to the floor and repeat the process with the other leg. Continue alternating legs for the duration of your set.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a kettlebell in front of your chest. Lower your hips to the floor while bending your knees. As your hips come under the knee level, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold dumbbells in your hands near your hips. Lower your hips to the floor while bending your knees. As your hips come under the knee level, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with a resistance band under your feet, and fold your arms close to your chest holding the handles of the band Lean forward and push your hips back while bending your knees slightly Pull the band by straightening your back Return to the initial position and repeat

Stand tall with your feet spread wide apart holding a barbell behind your neck and over your shoulders Lean forward almost parallel to the floor while pushing your hips back and bending your knees slightly Return by straightening your back and repeat

Stand tall with your feet spread wide apart holding dumbbells in your hands near your shoulders Lean forward almost parallel to the floor while pushing your hips back and bending your knees slightly Return by straightening your back and repeat

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Shift your weight to your right leg and lift your left leg into the air Slowly lower your left leg and repeat the lifting motion Switch legs and repeat the exercise Maintain a tight core and straight back throughout

Stand tall with your feet spread wide apart holding a kettlebell with your hands on your chest Lean forward almost parallel to the floor while pushing your hips back and bending your knees slightly Return by straightening your back and repeat

Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart Bend your hips back and lower your torso forward Bend your knees slightly as you go forward Lift your torso back to the starting position Repeat the operation for the set number of repetitions

Lie on your back with your legs in the air, knees slightly bent Place your hands on the sides of your head, elbows bent Curl your body up, bringing your elbows towards your knees Slowly lower your body back to the starting position Repeat the exercise for the required repetitions

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and flat on the ground Raise your body up onto your tiptoes, contracting your calf muscles Hold the contraction at the top for a second Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Get on a hack squat machine with your back supported, shoulders under the padded bars, knees bent, and feet fixed against the platform. Hold the handles of the bar in your hands and straighten your knees while pushing the bars up with your shoulders. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Sit on the floor with your legs straight out in front of you. Bend your knees, lift your feet off the floor and lean back slightly. Extend your arms parallel to the floor, palms facing down. Engage your abdominal muscles and sit up tall. Hold the pose for several breaths before returning to your start position.

Place your hands on the floor by leaning forward, and extend your legs backwards spread apart to get into a plank position. Immediately bring both legs together by jumping both legs lightly and bring both knees bent together close to your arms. Return to starting position by repeating the light jump and repeat.

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart. Take a step forward with your right foot and bend your knee, keeping your left leg straight. Extend your arms to the sides, parallel to the floor. Slightly bend your elbows. Slowly move your arms to the front until your hands meet. High-five yourself! Return your arms back to the sides. Repeat the movement.

Start by kneeling on the ground. Bring one leg forward and bend it at 90 degrees, positioning your foot near your opposite hand. Extend your other leg behind you, maintaining contact with the ground. Place your hands on the ground for support and gently lean forward. Hold for 20-30 seconds before switching legs.

Lie flat on your back on the floor, with your arms extended straight beside your body Lift your upper body and one knee towards each other, while keeping the other leg flat on the floor Pause for a second when your chest and knee meet Slowly lower yourself back to the start position Repeat with the opposite leg

Stand up straight with your feet together and hands at your sides Jump into the air and spread your legs out to the sides As you jump, raise your arms out and up in a smooth motion until they meet above your head As you land, jump again and return your legs and arms to the starting position Repeat this movement rapidly for as long as the exercise is set

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Bend your knees until they are at a 90-degree angle, ensuring your knees don't go beyond your toes Press back up to the starting position, keeping your weight evenly distributed on your feet Repeat this motion for your desired number of repetitions Change the knee being bent after desired repetitions

Start by kneeling on a mat or the floor Position one foot ahead of you, forming a 90-degree angle with your knee Lean forward, feeling the stretch in your glute and hamstring of the kneeling leg Hold the stretch for about 30 seconds Repeat with the other leg

Start in a downward-facing dog position Bring your right knee up and towards your right hand Slide your right foot towards your left hand Extend your left leg behind you, toes pointing down Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds and return to the starting position

name_en: Half Plyo Forward To Top Arms Raise
description_en: Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Jump forward a short distance, landing on both feet with slight bend in knees From this position, raise your arms above your head Jump back to the starting position, lowering your arms Repeat the movements for the desired number of reps

Start in a standing position with your feet hip-width apart Jump up, spreading your legs wider than your shoulders as you descend into a half squat Using your hands for balance, ensure your back remains straight throughout the motion Jump again and bring your feet together, returning to the starting position Repeat these jumps in a quick, controlled manner for the desired amount of reps

Start in a squat position with your feet wider than shoulders-width apart Jump slightly and turn your body to 180 degrees in mid-air Land softly, back straight, facing the other direction Lower your body back into a squat Jump again and spin back to face the original direction

Sit with legs extended in front of you. Bend the left knee and ground the foot on the mat. Draw a large circle with your right leg, lifting it as high as possible while maintaining balance. Trace the circle with your right leg, moving it all the way down and around. Repeat with your left leg.

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Place your hands gently behind your head Engage your abdominal muscles and lift your upper body towards your knees Slowly return to starting position Repeat this process for multiple reps
Stand with your feet hip-width apart, hands on your hips Slowly bend at your waist to one side Hold this position for a moment Return to the starting position Repeat for the other side

Start standing with feet hip-width apart Step the right foot out to the right and send the hips back as the right knee bends into a half squat Push off the right foot to return to standing position Repeat the same process on the left side Continue alternating sides

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Bend your knees and lower your body into a half squat Reach your right hand to the outside of your left foot Return to the standing position Repeat exercise, alternating sides

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Lower your body into a half squat position Reach your right hand towards your left foot Switch sides and reach your left hand towards your right foot Repeat the reaching for desired reps

Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart Bend your knees slightly as if you're going into a half-squat Twist your torso to the right and extend your left arm out as if you're punching Return to the center and twist to the left, extending your right arm Alternate sides, maintaining a controlled and steady movement

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, bend your knees to a half-squat position keeping your back straight Extend your arms parallel to the ground Twist your torso to the right while simultaneously punching forward with the left hand Twist your torso to the left while simultaneously punching forward with the right hand Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand straight with your back against a wall Raise your heels off the ground and stand on your toes Lower your body into a half-squat position, with thighs parallel to the floor Hold this position for a few seconds Return to your starting position

Stand straight with your arms by your sides and feet together Jump while spreading your legs shoulder-width apart and simultaneously raise your hands above your head Return to the original starting position by jumping again and bringing your feet together and arms back by your sides Move into the full jumping jack by jumping again, spreading your legs wider (slightly more than shoulder-width) and clapping hands above the head Return to the full jumping jack starting position in the same way you returned to the half jumping jack starting position

Lie on your back with your arms stretched out to your sides Raise your legs and bend them at the knees to form a 90 degree angle Rotate your legs to one side, without touching the ground Bring them back to the center Rotate them to the other side and repeat

Lie flat on your back with your arms stretched out to the sides Raise your legs so your hips and knees form a 90-degree angle While keeping your legs at the same angle, lower them to one side, move them back to the middle and then lower them to the other side Repeat the movement, ensuring your upper body remains flat on the ground Continue until you've reached your desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight, arms at your sides, and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the dumbbells in your hands with palms facing the thighs. Raise the dumbbells towards the shoulders by bending your arms. As they reach shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with a straight back, feet shoulder-width apart, and a resistance band under your feet. Hold the ends of the band with your arms at your sides and forearms facing your thighs. Stretch the band towards the shoulders by bending your arms. Return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Hammer Grip Pull-up on Dip Cage
description_en: Grab the handles of the dip cage with a hammer grip Pull yourself up until your chin is level with the handles Hold the position briefly Lower yourself in a controlled manner back to the beginning position Repeat this for the desired number of reps

Position yourself in the Dip Cage with your arms fully extended Grip the handles in a hammer grip fashion Pull up until your chest touches the handles Lower yourself down in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired amount of reps

Lie down on your back with your legs extended on the floor and arms by your sides. Raise one of your legs straight up and bend the knee, making a 90-degree angle. Grab your leg by curling your hands under the knee and apply a stretch by pulling it towards the chest. Maintain this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Lie down on your back with your legs extended on the floor and arms by your sides. Raise one of your legs straight up making a 90-degree angle. Grab your leg by curling your hands around its knee and apply a stretch by pulling it towards the chest. Maintain this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Lie on your back on a mat or a solid flat surface Bend your right knee while keeping your left leg straight Lift your right knee towards your chest and hold it with your hands Pull your knee gently closer to your chest and hold the position Repeat the same with your left leg

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Extend one leg in front of you, heel on the ground and toes pointed upwards Slowly bend forward from your hips, keeping your back straight until you feel a stretch in the hamstring of the extended leg Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds Repeat on the other leg

Stand tall and extend one foot in front of you. Keep your extended leg straight with your heel on the floor and toes pointing upward. Lean forward slightly from your hips whilst keeping your back straight until you feel a stretch in the back of your thigh. Hold this position for approximately 30 seconds. Repeat with the other leg.

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart. Hold the barbell up to your chest with an overhand grip. Extend your arms straight out, keeping elbows slightly bent. Bend your elbows and squeeze your chest to bring the barbell back to chest level. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Sit on the bike and adjust the seat and handlebars to a comfortable position Place your hands on the handlebars Start pedaling at a slow pace to warm up Increase the pedaling speed to raise your heart rate Slow down the pace towards the end of the workout to cool down

Stand tall with your feet together Take a step out to the right with your right foot whilst bringing your hands together in front of you Step your left foot to meet your right as you bring your hands up above your head Repeat this movement stepping out to the left
Start in a regular push-up position Lower yourself to the ground Release your hands briefly Put your hands back on the ground quickly and push yourself back up Repeat

Begin in a high plank position with hands shoulder-width apart. Lower your body towards the floor. Release your hands briefly then place them back on the floor. Push up to return to the starting position. Repeat the movement for your desired number of repetitions.

Start with hands placed shoulder width apart on the ground Kick your feet up to a wall or have a spotter help you into a handstand position Try to keep your body as straight as possible Hold this position Safety-first: come down when fatigued - don't risk a fall

Start by placing your palms on the floor, about a foot away from the wall Kick your legs up one at a time until you are in a handstand position against the wall Keep your body straight and your core engaged Hold this position for a few seconds Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position

Start by facing the wall, place your hands about shoulder-width apart on the ground Kick up to a handstand position against the wall Maintain a tight core and straight body line Fix your gaze between your hands Hold the position for the desired amount of time, then carefully descend

Stand about hip-width apart facing a wall Place your hands on the ground shoulder-width apart, about a foot away from the wall Kick up to a handstand position with your heels against the wall Straighten your body and hold the position Carefully come back down to your initial position

Place your feet on a chair and get down on your hands by extending your arms towards the floor. Take your head towards the floor while bending your arms. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Start in a handstand position against a wall for stability Bend your elbows and lower your body down until your head lightly touches the floor Push your body back up until your elbows are fully extended Retain control and balance throughout the movement Repeat

Start in a handstand position close to a wall with your back toward the wall While keeping your body straight, lower your head down by bending your elbows Push with your shoulders and arms to raise your body back up to the initial handstand position
Start in a handstand position against a wall Bend your elbows to lower your body toward the floor Push back up until your arms are fully extended Repeat the movement for your desired number of reps

Walk into a handstand position facing a wall Keep your head between your shoulders and lower yourself until your head touches the ground Push yourself up until your arms are fully extended Repeat the sequence as per your training schedule Slowly come back to the standing position

name_en: Handstand Shoulder Tap against the Wall
description_en: Begin in a handstand position with your feet placed against the wall Keep your body straight and aligned Lift one hand and tap your opposite shoulder Place your hand back on the ground, then lift the other hand and tap the other shoulder Repeat this sequence in a controlled rhythm

Start by standing upright with your arms fully extended above your head Position yourself into a handstand with your arms and legs fully extended Begin walking on your hands by shifting your weight from one hand to the other Move forward in a controlled fashion Continue the movement for the desired distance or time

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Raise your right hand up while simultaneously lifting your left knee up Lower your right hand and left knee back to the original position Raise your left hand up while simultaneously lifting your right knee up Repeat these movements, alternating hands and knees

Start standing with your feet together and arms at your sides Step to the side with your right foot and raise your hands above your head Bring your left foot to meet the right while lowering your hands Repeat the same on the left side Continue these steps for your set duration

Start by standing straight with arms by your sides and feet hip-width apart. Raise your right knee towards your chest while simultaneously lifting both arms above your head. Put your right foot back to its initial position while simultaneously lowering your arms. Repeat the same with your left knee and continue alternating between both sides. Maintain a brisk pace for optimal benefits.

Stand under a pull up bar, facing away from it Reach up and grasp the bar with both hands, slightly wider than shoulder width apart Bend your knees and let your body hang from the bar, keeping your arms straight Hold this position for a few seconds Slowly stand back up and release the bar

Start by hanging from a pull-up bar with hands shoulder-width apart Engage your core while keeping your body stable Pull your knees up towards your chest Slowly lower your legs back to the starting position, keeping your abs contracted Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps

Find a pull-up bar and grip it with an overhand grip Lift your legs off the ground and straighten them out Keep your legs together while you kick your feet up and down in a fluttering motion Keep fluttering for a set amount of time or reps Return your legs to the starting position

Start in a dead hang position with your arms fully extended Begin to raise your body upward while keeping your body straight Pull yourself up until your body is parallel to the ground Hold this position briefly Lower yourself back down in a controlled manner to the starting position

Hang from a bar with your legs together and straight Swing your legs together in an arc to one side Bring them up towards the bar as high as you can Lower your legs back down Repeat the process on the other side

Start by hanging on a bar with your arms fully extended Raise your legs together to a 90-degree angle and hold Keep your body in a straight line, engaging your abs Hold this position for around 30 seconds or for as long as you can Relax and lower your legs down

Start in a hanging position holding a bar with your hands wide apart and palms facing forward Riase both of your knees towards your chest while folding your legs Return to the starting position and repeat

Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms extended Bend your knees and bring them up to your elbows Pause for a moment, then slowly lower your legs Keep your abs engaged throughout the movement Repeat the process for your desired number of reps

Start by hanging from a pull-up bar with both arms extended at arms length Keep your torso stationary and raise your legs until your body makes about a 90-degree angle with your legs Pause for a second and lower your legs back to the initial position in a controlled manner Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions
