Find a pull-up bar and grasp it with both hands Hang from the bar with arms fully extended Raise your legs parallel to the floor and lift your hips off the bar Slowly lower your legs and hips back to the starting position Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps

Start hanging from a pull-up bar, keeping your body straight Raise your knees towards your chest until your thighs are parallel to the floor Hold this tucked position for a second, then lower your knees back down Repeat this motion for the desired number of times Ensure the movement is controlled and not swinging

Start in a hanging position holding a bar with your hands shoulder-width apart and palms facing forward Raise both of your knees diagonally towards one side of the chest while bending your knees. Return to the starting position and repeat

Hang from a pull-up bar with your hands shoulder-width apart Bring your knees up towards one side of your chest Hold for a second, then slowly lower your legs Repeat on the other side Keep alternating sides for each repetition

Start by hanging from a pull up bar with your palms facing forwards Lift your legs to one side while bending your knees Hold for a few seconds Slowly lower your legs back to the original position Do the same for the other side

Begin by hanging from a high bar, maintaining a grip slightly wider than shoulder width Raise your legs until your body forms an approximately 90-degree angle Stay in this position for a moment before lowering your legs back down Remember not to swing or use momentum while doing this exercise Repeat the process as dictated by your workout routine

Start in a complete hang from a bar with your legs fully extended Slowly raise your legs upward keeping them straight, body should form an 'L' or a 'V' shape Hold this top position for a moment Lower yourself down slowly to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Hang from a pull-up bar with both hands facing forward. Keep your body straight, pull your knees up to your chest and lower them back down. To increase difficulty, keep your legs straight while raising and lowering. Ensure contraction of the abdominal muscles during upward movement. Don't use your upper body to generate momentum, thus keeping the movements as controlled as possible.

Start by hanging from a pull-up bar, keeping your body and legs straight Keeping your legs together, raise them up in front of you until they are parallel to the ground Pause at the top and then gradually lower your legs back to the starting position Maintain control throughout the movement and avoid swinging your legs Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Start by hanging from the bar with hands shoulder width apart Keep your legs straight and pull your legs up until they are parallel with the ground Lower your legs back down in a controlled manner Do not let your legs swing or use momentum to lift them Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Start by hanging from a bar with your hands shoulder-width apart Keep your legs straight and lift them up towards the bar Try to touch the bar with your toes while keeping your legs straight Lower your legs back down in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Lay flat on your back on a comfortable surface Bend your knees into your chest Hold on to the outside of your feet with both hands Open your knees slightly wider than your torso and keep each foot in line with each knee Hold the position for 5 -10 breaths, then release

Lie on your back on a comfortable surface. Raise your legs towards the sky, bending your knees to bring your feet towards your head. Reach your hands to grasp your feet, keeping your arms on the inside of your knees. Gently pull your feet down and widen your knees for a deep stretch. Hold this position, breathing in and out comfortably.

Sit up straight, looking forward Slowly rotate your head to the right side until your chin is over your right shoulder Rotate your head back to the central position Rotate your head to the left until your chin is over your left shoulder Return to the central position

name_en: Head to Knee Janu Sirsasana Yoga Pose
description_en: Sit on a mat with your legs extended in front of you Bend your right knee and place the sole of the foot against the inner left thigh Reach forward to hold the left foot or ankle, and slowly bend the torso towards the left leg Hold the pose for up to one minute Release and repeat with the other leg

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground Push through your heels and raise your hips towards the ceiling Keep pushing until your knees, hips and shoulders form a straight line Hold this position for a moment while squeezing your glutes Gradually lower your hips until they're hovering just above the floor

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground. Lift your hips off the ground while keeping your back straight. Squeeze your glutes hard at the top of the movement. Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position.

Begin by standing upright with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise one foot off the ground and straighten it in front of you While keeping your leg straight, try to press your heel forward Hold the stretch for 15 to 30 seconds Switch legs and repeat the process

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Jump from one foot to the other, tapping the heel of the lifted foot to the inner thigh of the standing leg Immediately repeat with the other foot Continue alternating in a quick, fluid motion

Lie down on your back with your knees bent, feet together, and arm resting at your sides Raise your torso slightly off the floor and try to touch one of your heels with your hand Return to the initial position and touch the other heel with the opposite hand

Start in a relaxed stance with your jump rope in hands Begin skipping, pushing off and landing on the balls of your feet Make sure your jumps are high enough for the rope to pass under your feet each time Maintain a steady and rhythmic pace Continue for the desired number of reps or until fatigue

Begin by standing up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and the rope behind your feet Bounce off the balls of both feet, swinging the rope over your head and under your feet Jump a bit higher than usual, making sure to land on the balls of both feet, cushioning your body against the impact Continue jumping smoothly, lowering yourself to the normal jump rope height Repeat for several minutes or until fatigue sets in

Stand tall with your fists near your chin as if you're going to box Jump a little off the ground, bring your right knee up towards your left shoulder, and twist slightly towards your right knee with your upper body Return to your initial position Jump and now raise your left knee towards your right shoulder, twisting your upper body towards the left knee Keep alternating these movements for the desired sets

name_en: High Knee Lunge on Bosu Ball
description_en: Stand straight and place the Bosu ball in front of you on the ground Step forward onto the Bosu ball with one foot while lifting the opposite knee high in the air Lower your body into a lunge position, ensuring your front knee never goes past your front toes Push up off your front foot to return to the starting position Repeat the movement with the opposite leg

name_en: High Knee on a padded stool
description_en: Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Lift your right knee towards your chest as high as you can Switch and do the same with your left knee Keep alternating in a running motion while maintaining an upright posture Continue the alternating motion for a designated period of time

Stand straight and open your chest Begin by jogging in place, lifting your knees high Keep your palms open facing downwards and try to touch your knee with your palm each time you lift it Engage your abdominal muscles when lifting your knee Repeat for the desired amount of time or reps

Stand straight, pull your abdominals in, and relax your shoulders Lift your right knee toward your chest, followed by your left knee to the chest Continue the action alternately as if you're running in place Do these high knee runs at a fast pace Do this exercise for a prescribed time or steps

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Shift your weight on one leg and raise your other knee up. Take your foot back to the floor while raising your other knee simultaneously. Keep doing this activity for a suitable time.

Begin in a standing position with your feet hip width apart Raise your right knee as high as you can and jump off your left foot While in the air, switch legs so you land with your right foot on the ground and your left knee in the air Repeat this process, alternating legs each time

Stand in an upright position and lift your right knee as high as you can Simultaneously, spring off your left foot to hop and land on your right foot Repeat with the left knee and right foot, maintaining an alternating pattern Increase speed to improve your cardio Maintain a straight back and tight core throughout the exercise

Start in a standing position, feet hip-width apart Quickly drive one knee up to chest level, then quickly lower it back to the ground Immediately drive the other knee up in the same manner, then lower it back to ground Continue alternating knees as quickly as possible, keeping the movement fluid Keep the torso upright and the arms moving rhythmically to maintain balance

Start by standing tall with your feet hip-width apart. Raise one knee as high as it can go and raise the opposite arm, then switch quickly so the other knee is up before the first knee hits the ground. Continue to alternate knees and arms as quickly as possible, as if running at high-speed. Keep your chest lifted and eyes forward Maintain a quick pace for the duration of the exercise

Stand tall, feet hip width apart Lift your right knee as high as you can, bringing it up to your chest Simultaneously perform a squat by bending your left knee and lowering your body Stand back up, and switch legs, this time lifting the left knee and squatting on the right Repeat for a set number of repetitions interchanging legs

Stand with your feet hip-width apart Bend your knees and lower your body into a squat As you push back up to standing, lift one knee up towards your chest Lower this foot back down and immediately lower back into a squat Repeat, alternating the knee you lift each time

Stand straight with feet hip-width apart Lift your right knee to your chest as high as you can Lower your right leg down into a squat position Repeat the same action with your left knee for one rep Keep alternating between your right and left knee

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Raise one knee high toward your chest while squatting down with the other leg Keep your chest up and back straight as you squat Return to standing position and repeat the motion on the other side Continue to alternate legs for the duration of the exercise

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Lower your body into a squat position As you stand up, lift one knee towards your chest. Return it to the ground Repeat the squat and upon rising, lift your other knee to your chest Alternate legs each time you repeat the exercise

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Start the movement by lifting your right knee as high as you can As you lift your knee, touch it with your left hand in a tapping motion Lower your right knee and repeat the same motion with the left knee and right hand Continue to alternate sides for the duration of your set

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Lift your right knee as high as possible, then tap it with your left hand Return to the initial position Repeat the same movement with your left knee and right hand Perform this repeatedly at a quick pace

Begin in a standing position with feet shoulder-width apart Drive your right knee towards your chest and tap it with your left hand Return to the start position and immediately drive your left knee towards your chest Tap your left knee with your right hand Continue the action, alternating between right and left legs

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Lift one knee as high as possible, then quickly lower it and immediately lift the opposite knee After a few repetitions, switch to butt kicks: kick one heel up towards your glutes, then quickly lower it and immediately kick up the opposite heel Continue alternating between high knees and butt kicks for your desired duration Keep your core engaged and maintain a quick pace throughout the exercise

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Bring your right knee up towards your chest as high as you can Immediately kick your right foot back towards your glutes Repeat the movement quickly on the left side Continue alternating legs for the desired amount of time or reps

Stand tall with your feet shoulder width apart and bring your hands forward by bending your arms Twist your torso towards the right and move your right knee towards your chest Return to the initial position then twist your torso towards left and raise your left knee towards the chest

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Lift your right knee towards your left elbow Now, lift your left knee towards your right elbow Continue to alternate between your knees as quickly as you can Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart. Step one foot forward keeping your front knee bent Keep your back leg straight with heel off the ground Raise your hands and stretch upwards extending your back Stay in this position for 10-30 seconds Return to initial position and repeat with the other foot

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Step your right foot forward and bend your right knee Keep your left leg straight and push your left heel towards the ground Raise both of your arms above your head while keeping your shoulders relaxed Hold the position for 15-20 seconds then switch to the other leg
Get down on your hands and toes and align your body in a straight line Keep your legs and arm straight, and your hands should be right under your shoulders Maintain this position.

Start in a high plank position with your shoulders directly over your wrists Lift your right knee towards your elbow, keeping your foot flexed Return to the high plank position Repeat with the left knee towards the left elbow Alternate legs for your desired amount of reps

Get on your knees with your hips resting on the back of your heels and your toes touching the floor Grab the handles of the band near your head with your arms folded Pull the handles of the band by taking your elbows towards your knees Return to the initial position and repeat

Begin in a standing position with your feet hip-width apart Bend your knees and lower your body into a squat position, keeping your back straight Raise back up to your starting position, pushing through your heels to engage your glutes and thighs Repeat the movement

Stand upright with your feet about hip-width apart Slowly lift one leg to the side while keeping your back straight Hold for a moment, then return to the starting position Repeat the same process with the other leg Perform the specified number of repetitions on each leg

Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart Slowly raise one leg to the side as far as you can without rotating your body Hold the stretch for up to 30 seconds Lower your leg back to the initial position in a controlled manner Repeat the process with the other leg

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Shift your weight onto one leg and lift your other foot slightly off the ground Slowly move your lifted leg across the front of your body, keeping your leg straight Hold this position for a few seconds then slowly return your leg to the center Repeat with the opposite leg
Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart Circle your hips clockwise for 15-20 seconds Switch to counter-clockwise and repeat for 15-20 seconds Repeat these circles for 2-3 sets

Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart Place your hands on your hips Slowly rotate your hips in a clockwise direction Make a full circle, and return to the starting position Repeat in an anticlockwise direction

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Slowly circle your hips in a clockwise direction for a set number of rotations Once done, switch to counterclockwise rotation for the same number of rotations Perform smooth and controlled movements, emphasizing the full range of motion Keep your upper body still, allowing the movement to originate from your hips

Stand straight and position the hula hoop around your waist Start moving your waist in a circular motion to get the hoop spinning Keep the hoop spinning by moving your hips in a circular motion Continue the movement for your desired amount of time or revolutions Gradually slow your hip movement to stop the hoop

Lie on one side with your knees bent at a 90-degree angle and your feet stacked together Keep your feet together and lift the upper knee as high as possible without moving your hip or lower back Slowly lower your knee back down to the starting position Repeat this movement for the recommended amount of reps, then switch sides and perform the same movement with the other leg

Lie on your side with your hips and knees bent 45 degrees. Keep your feet together while raising your top knee as high as you can without moving your pelvis. Slowly lower your knee back and repeat. After finishing your reps on one side, roll over and repeat for the other side.

Lie on your back, knees bent, feet flat on the floor Place your hands lightly on the back of your head Engage your core, lift your head, shoulders and upper back off the floor, simultaneously pulling your knees toward your chest Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position Repeat for desired number of repetitions

Stand upright with feet hip-width apart Step forward with one foot, keeping the other foot planted Bend at the hips and lower your body until you feel a stretch Hold the stretch for a desired amount of time Switch legs and repeat

Stand straight and shift your weight to one leg Raise the other leg backwards while keeping it straight Hold on to a secure object for balance if needed Hold the position for 30 seconds or more Switch to the other leg and repeat

Start by standing upright, shoulders relaxed. Shift your body weight onto one foot and lift the other leg backward. Tilt your pelvis and gently push your hip forward. Hold for 15-30 seconds. Switch to the other leg and repeat.

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Cross your right ankle over your left knee, bending your left knee slightly into a squat position Place your hands together in front of your chest, and use your right elbow to push your right knee away Hold this stretch for around 20-30 seconds Switch sides and repeat with the other leg

Stand up straight with your feet hip width apart Bend forward from your hips, keeping your back straight Reach down towards your toes with your hands Hold this position for 15-30 seconds Slowly return to the standing position

name_en: Hip Flexor Stretch Rear foot elevated
description_en: Stand facing away from a bench or a sturdy box Place one foot behind you on the bench or box, with your toes pointing down Keep your chest upright and bend your front knee slightly Push your hips forward until you feel a stretch in your hip of the back leg Hold for at least 30 seconds, then switch legs and repeat

name_en: Hip Flexor Stretch Rear foot elevated
description_en: Stand facing away from a bench, reach back with your right foot and place it on the bench Lower your body down by bending your front knee until you feel a stretch in your hip Hold the stretch for about 30 seconds Repeat with the other leg Do this for 3-5 sets

Stand tall in front of your chair, facing away Place one foot back on the chair seat Push your hips forwards until you feel a stretch in the front of your hip and thigh Hold for desired time, then switch legs

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Lift one leg and rest your ankle on your opposite knee Gently press down on your lifted knee until you feel a stretch in your hip Hold for up to 30 seconds, then switch sides Repeat 2-3 times on each side

Stand with your feet hip-width apart Take a big step forwards with your right foot Bend your right knee until your thigh is parallel with the floor Return to the starting position Repeat with your left foot

Sit on the floor with your legs out in front of you Bend one knee and cross it over the other leg, placing your foot beside the knee Rotate your torso towards the bent knee Hold the stretch for a few seconds Repeat with the other side

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor Tighten your abdominal muscles and lift your hips off the floor until your knees, hips, and shoulders form a straight line Hold this position while you breathe slowly Lower your body back to the original position Repeat the exercise as per your desired rep counts

Lie down flat on your back with your knees bent and feet placed flat on the ground. Place your arms by your side with palms facing down. Raise your hips off the floor by pushing through your heels until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to knees. Hold the position for a few seconds and then return to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat the exercise for your preferred number of sets.

Lie flat on the ground with knees bent Keeping your feet flat on the floor, raise your hips off the ground Hold for a few seconds and then slowly lower your hips back to the ground Repeat this motion for desired number of repetitions Try to keep your body in a straight line from your knees to your shoulders

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground Pushing with your glutes and hamstrings, lift your hips off the floor until your body is in a straight line from your shoulders to your knees Pause at the top and squeeze your glutes for a second Lower your hips back down to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Start in a plank position, with your forearms on the ground and your body in a straight line Roll your hips to one side as far as they'll go Hold the position for a few seconds Return to the starting position Repeat the movement on the other side

Start in a regular plank position with your forearms on the ground and your body perfectly straight Lower your left hip to the ground Return to the starting position Now lower your right hip to the ground Return to the plank position

Start by standing up straight with your feet shoulder width apart. Slowly lower your body as though sitting back into an imaginary chair, until your thighs are parallel to the ground. Pause at the bottom of the squat, then push back up to standing, repeating the motion. Maintain your core tight throughout the exercise. Ensure your knees do not extend over your toes as you squat down.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place your hands on your hips Swing your hips in a circular motion to the right Perform this motion for your desired number of repetitions Switch directions, now swinging your hips in a circular motion to the left Again, perform this motion for your desired number of repetitions

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Start by moving your hips in a circular motion to the right Make sure to engage your core and keep your upper body still After completing a certain number of swirls to the right, switch to moving your hips in a circular motion to the left Try to make the movements as smooth and controlled as possible

Start by sitting on the ground with a bench directly behind you. Lean back onto the bench so that your shoulder blades are near the top of it. Bend your knees and keep your feet flat on the ground, hip-width apart. Lower your hips down then push from your heels to lift your hips till they are in line with your body. Return to the starting position in a controlled manner.

Sit on the ground with your back against a bench, feet planted firmly in front of you Bend your knees and keep your feet flat on the ground Raise your hips off the ground until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees Hold the top position for few seconds before lowering your hips back down to the ground Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart Take a big step to the right, while bending the right knee and pushing hips back Push through the right foot to return to the starting position Repeat on the other side Continue alternating sides for the desired amount of reps

Stand straight with feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms out to the sides for support Slowly twist your hips to one side, keeping the upper body facing forward Hold the stretch for a few seconds Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side

Stand straight with feet hip width apart Lower your body into a squat position until your thighs are parallel to the floor Hold this position for a set period of time Keep your chest upright and your heels planted on the ground Rise back to the starting position and repeat

Lie flat on your back on the floor Press your lower back into the floor by rolling your hips and pelvis towards your chest Raise your legs and upper body off the ground at approximately a 45-degree angle Hold this position for a few seconds before releasing back to the floor

Lie flat on your back, arms extended along your sides Press your lower back into the floor Lift your shoulders and legs off the ground, only your lower back remains in contact with the floor Tighten your core and hold this position for several seconds Lower your legs and torso back to the ground

Lie flat on your back on the floor PULL your navel down toward your spine (this is the 'hollow' position) Lift your arms, your head and your legs off of the floor, and hold this position Bring your knees toward your chest and bring your arms forward, tucking your body into a small ball Hold this position, focus on keeping your core tight

Lie down on your back with your legs straight and your arms resting on the floor over your head with palms facing upwards. Raise your arms and legs straight off the floor simultaneously Maintain this position for some seconds then return to the starting position.

Lie flat on your back on the floor Lift your shoulders and legs so that your body forms a 'U' shape Keep your lower back pressed against the floor Hold this position for a set amount of time Lower your body back to the floor in a controlled manner

Lie down on your back, extend your legs and arms straight out from your body Pull your belly button in towards your spine Lift your arms, head, shoulders and legs off the floor Hold this position, keeping your abs and glutes tightly contracted Slowly lower your body back to the starting position

Lie flat on your back, with your arms extended above your head and legs flat Engage your core and lift your arms, shoulders, and legs off the ground Rock back and forth maintaining a tight body Make sure to breathe rhythmically throughout the motion Stop the exercise once your form begins to break down

Stand facing the boxing bag with your left foot back and left shoulder facing the bag Lift your right knee up to your waist Swing your right foot around in a smooth motion, striking the bag with the bottom of your foot Return your foot back to its starting position Switch to your left foot and repeat

Start in a standing position with your feet together. Jump slightly to the right, landing on your right foot and lifting your left leg sideways. Immediately jump to the left, landing on your left foot while lifting your right leg sideways. Keep your movements fluid and continue hopping from side to side. After the desired repetitions, rest and then repeat as necessary.

Begin in a standing position with your feet hip-width apart Hop up and use your right hand to touch your left toe Land softly back on the ground and repeat the same with your left hand and right toe This completes one rep. The quicker you perform these hops, the more you get intensifying benefits Continue to alternate for a set amount of repetitions on each leg

Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and toes pointed outwards Lower your body while keeping your spine straight until your thighs are parallel to the floor Maintain this position with your knees pointing in the same direction as your toes Press your heels into the ground and rise back up to the starting position Repeat this movement for your desired number of reps

Lie down flat on your back on a mat. Raise your legs and head slightly above the ground. Extend your arms too and begin pumping them up and down, vigorously. While pumping your arms, flex your abs Continue this for a set of 100 pumps

Lie down flat on your back on a mat Lift your legs about a foot off the ground and then raise your head and shoulders off the mat while keeping your lower back on the mat Move your arms up and down with small rapid movements while keeping them straight Inhale for five arm movements, and then exhale for five arm movements Repeat this cycle ten times for a total of 100 arm movements

Start with feet hip-width apart Jump upwards and forwards, bringing your knees as high as possible Land softly with bent knees Quickly rebound into the next jump Repeat the jumps for the prescribed number of repetitions

Lie back on a bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand Raise the dumbbells above your chest, palms facing each other Lower the dumbbells out and down in an arc-like motion until your chest is fully stretched Raise the dumbbells back to the starting position using the same arc-like motion Repeat for required reps

Lie on your back on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand Extend your arms straight up, perpendicular to the body Lower the dumbbells in an arc on either side of your body until you feel a stretch in your chest Pull the dumbbells back up along the same arc, squeezing your chest muscles Repeat the movement for your chosen number of reps

Lie face down on a hyperextension bench, with your ankles secured under the footpads and your upper thighs resting on the larger pad. Lower your torso, bending at the waist, as far down as possible without causing discomfort. Raise your body back to the initial position using your lower back muscles while maintaining a straight back and pinched shoulder blades. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

Lie face down on a hyperextension bench, making sure your ankle is securely tucked under the footpad. Cross your arms over your chest or put your hands behind your head. Slowly bend forward as far as you can while keeping your back flat. Raise your body back up in a controlled manner until your body is slightly above the parallel position. Repeat the movement.

Begin by positioning your body face down on the hyperextension bench, with foot pads against your lower calves Lower your upper body by bending hips until fully flexed Raise your body until your hips and waist are fully extended Repeat the movement

Stand tall with feet shoulder width apart Raise both arms overhead while keeping your elbows slightly bent Tightly squeeze your abdominal and glute muscles Slowly rotate your torso as far as you can to the right, then to the left, keeping your hips square Hold this pose for a moment, then release and return to the starting position

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Lower into a squatting position by bending your knees and pushing your hips back Push up through your heels to go back into the standing position Jump into the air, landing with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart Lower into a squat with your wide stance, then jump back to the starting position

name_en: In And Out Squats Jump Bodyweight
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight, feet together, and clasp your hands in front of your chest. Lower your hips, jump up and land into a squatting position with your knees bent, thighs parallel to the floor, and feet placed wider than your shoulder width. Then lower your hips again to jump up, and land into a squatting position with your knees bent, thighs parallel to the floor, and feet placed together this time.

name_en: In And Out Squats Jump Bodyweight
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and clasp your hands in front of your chest. Lower your hips, jump up and land into a squatting position with your knees bent, thighs parallel to the floor, and feet placed wider than your shoulder width. Then lower your hips again, jump up, and land into a squatting position with your knees bent, thighs parallel to the floor, and feet placed hip-width apart this time.

Stand tall with your legs straight and shoulder-width apart Bend at your hips and touch the floor with your hands Walk your hands forward into a plank position Walk your feet forward towards your hands Stand up straight and repeat the process

Start in a standing position and bend forward, placing your hands on the ground Walk your hands forward until you're in a push-up position Complete a push-up, then walk your feet towards your hands Stand up straight to return to the starting position Repeat this movement for your desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with your feet shoulder width apart Bend from your waist and touch the floor with your hands Walk your hands forward until you are in a plank position Walk your feet up to your hands, keeping your legs as straight as possible Stand up to return to the starting position

Stand up tall, then reach down and touch the floor in front of your feet Walk your hands forward until you reach a plank position Perform 4 mountain climbers by quickly driving your knees towards your chest one after the other Walk your hands back towards your feet and stand up Repeat the sequence for a specific number of reps or set time

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Bend forward at your waist and touch the ground with your hands Begin to walk your hands forward until you reach a high plank position Perform a leg lift with each leg while maintaining the plank Walk your hands back to your feet and rise back up to a standing position

Start in a standing position with feet hip-width apart. Bend from the waist and touch the floor with your hands. Walk your hands forward until you are in a plank position. Lower your hips to a cobra pose, lifting your chest while keeping your hands on the ground. Raise your hips and walk your hands back to the standing position and repeat.

Start by positioning yourself on an incline bench, with your hands slightly wider than shoulder width apart Lower your body until your chest touches the bench Press your body back into the starting position, using your arms and chest Repeat this movement for your desired number of reps

Lie down on a leg press machine with your back supported making a 45-degree angle with the floor, knees bent, and feet placed against the platform. Push the platform forward by extending your legs. Hold for a few seconds, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie down on an incline bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab the cables in your hands with your arms spread wide, elbows slightly bent, and palms facing forward. Raise the cables by bringing your arms forward and upward. As your arms reach close, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Sit on an inclined bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab the dumbbells in your hands, with arms hanging straight at your sides and forearms facing inward. Raise the dumbbell towards the shoulders by bending your arms. As they reach shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Find a stable elevated surface and position your hands slightly narrower than shoulder-width apart Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the surface Pause at the bottom, then push yourself back to the starting position Keep your elbows close to your body Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps

name_en: Incline Close Grip Push-up with Chair
description_en: Place your hands on a stable chair with your feet on the ground Lower your chest to the chair by bending your elbows Push your body up until your arms are fully extended Repeat for the desired number of repetitions Ensure your body remains straight and still throughout

name_en: Incline Diamond Push Up On Bench
description_en: Stand tall, place your hands on a bench, and extend your legs backward on the floor. Make a diamond shape by using your index fingers and thumbs, and straighten your arms. Lower your chest towards the chair by folding your arms. As it reaches near the bench, raise yourself by straightening your arms, and repeat.

Start in a push up position with your hands placed slightly wider than your shoulders Lower your elbows to the ground and rest your weight onto your forearms Keep your body straight throughout the exercise Try to hold this position for as long as you can Rest and repeat according to your workout plan

Position yourself below an inclined surface, fingers pointing upwards Place the pads of your fingers against the surface Push your body away from the surface until your arms are extended Bend your elbows and lower your body back towards the surface Repeat the movement for the desired amount of repetitions

Lie down on a slant board with your hips lower than your head. Extend your legs straight out with your hands under your glutes for support. Raise your legs by flexing at the hip until your hips are fully flexed. Slowly lower your legs back to the initial position. Repeat this movement for desired repetitions.

Lie down on an incline bench with your head at the top Hold the top of the bench firmly for support Keep your legs straight, raise them until your body makes a 90-degree angle Lower your legs in a slow and controlled manner Repeat the process for the desired number of repetitions

Start by placing your feet shoulder-width apart, hands on the inclined surface slightly wider than shoulder-width. Lower your body towards the incline surface keeping your body straight. Push your body upward until your arms are fully extended. Lower your body back down in a controlled motion. Repeat this process for your chosen number of repetitions.

Stand facing a bench or sturdy elevated platform Place your hands on the edge of the bench or platform, slightly wider than shoulder width Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the bench or platform Push your body back up to the starting position Repeat the movement for desired number of repetitions

Place your hands on the edge of a box, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart Bend your elbows to lower your chest towards the box Push your body back up to the starting position Remember to keep your body straight throughout Repeat for the desired number of reps

name_en: Incline Push-up on a Smith Bar
description_en: Stand facing the bar, placed high. Place your hands on the bar, a bit wider than shoulder width apart Lean forward until your body is at a 45-degree angle Lower your body towards the bar by bending your elbows Push your body back up to the starting position Repeat the exercise for desired number of repetitions

Stand tall, place your hands on a chair, and extend your legs backward on the floor. Straighten your arms and keep your hands shoulder-width apart. Lower your chest towards the chair by folding your arms. As it reaches near the chair, raise yourself by straightening your arms, and repeat.

Place your hands on the edge of a chair, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart Lower your body towards the chair while keeping your body straight Push your body back up until your arms are fully extended Keep a slight bend in your elbows even at full extension Control your tempo on both the lowering and rising phases

Position yourself on the incline bench, stomach-down, so that your hips sit on the edge. Clasp your hands behind you. Raise your legs until they're as close as possible to being in line with your torso. Slowly lower your legs back down. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

Start in an incline push-up position with your hands directly below your shoulders and your feet together Raise one hand off the floor and touch the opposite shoulder Rapidly switch hands and repeat the shoulder tap Keep your core tight and hips as still as possible throughout the motion Continue the alternating movement for the desired repetitions

Stand in front of a slight incline. Place your palms together in front of your chest. Press your palms together as hard as you can. Extend your arms out in front of you while continue pressing your palms. Slowly bring your arms back to the starting position.

Lie down on an incline bench with your hips bent and feet hooked under the foot pad. Place your hands behind your head for support. Raise your body towards your knees while twisting your upper body to alternate sides each rep. Lower yourself back down to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat this movement for desired repetitions.

Lie down on your back on a decline bench with your feet secured at the top Place your hands behind your head lightly touching your temples Lift your upper body using your abdominal muscles At the top position, twist your upper body to one side by bringing your elbow across Lower your body back down in a controlled manner while resetting for the next repetition

Start by sitting on an incline bench, with your feet hooked under the foot pads for stability Lie back onto the bench, but don't let your shoulders touch the bench Twist your torso and bring your left elbow towards your right knee while keeping the other arm behind your head Slowly lower yourself back to the initial position in a controlled fashion Repeat the exercise but this time bring your right elbow towards your left knee

Lie on your side on a flat surface Ensure your hips are stacked and your neck is in alignment with your spine Extend the leg on the ground straight and bend your top knee, stepping it in front of your bottom leg Lift your extending bottom leg up, and lower it back Repeat this pulse-like motion for a set number of times

Sit on a bench with your forearms resting on your knees, and hold a dumbbell in each hand With palms facing up, let the weights roll down your fingertips Curl your knuckles towards the ceiling while keeping your forearms still Lower the weights back down by straightening your wrist Repeat this motion for the desired amount of reps

name_en: Intermediate Hip Flexor and Quad Stretch
description_en: Loop a band around your right foot and hold the other end with your left hand Bend your right knee and pull your foot towards your buttock Hold for 30 seconds and then swap to stretch the other leg Repeat this for 3-5 rounds per leg Relax after the stretch, allowing muscles to cool down

name_en: Intermediate Hip Flexor and Quad Stretch
description_en: Stand tall, with your feet shoulder-width apart Bend your right knee, lifting your foot toward your buttock Grasp your right foot with your right hand, pulling the foot closer to your buttock to stretch Keep your torso upright and hold the stretch for 15 to 30 seconds Repeat with your left leg

name_en: Intermediate Hip Flexor And Quad Stretch
description_en: Lie down on your stomach with your face down and fold one of your legs by taking your heel towards the hips. Hook your raised foot between a resistance band and grab its ends in your hands near the shoulders. Take your foot away from the hips to produce a stretch, and hold for 30-60 seconds.

name_en: Internal and External Shoulder Rotation against Wall
description_en: Stand straight in front of a wall, keeping your arm at your side with your elbow bent to 90 degrees Rotate your arm outward until your hand touches the wall Hold this position for a few seconds Slowly rotate your arm back to the starting position Reverse motion by bringing your hand inward towards your body until you touch your stomach or as far as you can comfortably go

Position yourself facing the pull-up machine with the cable attached to your ankles Slowly raise your feet upwards bending at the knees until your hamstrings are fully contracted Hold this position for a moment ensuring your core is engaged Lower your feet back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Inverse Leg Curl with Bench Pads
description_en: Lie face down on a leg curl machine with your heels against the lower pad and the upper pads against your thighs Keeping your body straight, lift your legs until your body forms a straight line Slowly lower your legs back to the initial position Do not let your hips lift off the pad during the exercise Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Inverted Chin Curl with Bent Knee between Chairs
description_en: Place two chairs about shoulder-width apart Stand between the chairs, then squat down and put your palms on the seat of the chairs with your fingers facing towards your feet Bend your knees to 90 degrees and let your body hang between the chairs Pull yourself up until your chin goes past the level of the chairs Lower yourself in a controlled manner until your arms are straight

name_en: Inverted Chin Curl with Bent Knee between Chairs
description_en: Set up two chairs wider than hip-width apart. Lie down on your back between the chairs. Reach up and grip one chair in each hand with an underhand grip. With your knees bent, pull your upper body up towards the chairs Lower your body back down in a controlled manner.

Find a low bar close to the ground and position yourself under it Hold the bar with your hands and keep your body straight Pull your chest up to the bar Lower yourself back down with control Repeat this movement for your desired number of repetitions

Set a bar in a rack at waist height and go under the bar Grab the bar with a shoulder width grip Keep your body straight, and pull your chest towards the bar Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position

Start by lying on your back under a bar Bend your knees at a 90 degree angle and set feet flat on floor Reach up to grab the bar with an overhand grip Pull your body upwards until the bar touches your chest Slowly lower yourself back down to the original position

Sit on the ground with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Hold onto a bar or handles at waist height Lean back so your body is at a slant Pull your body up towards the bar or handles Slowly lower yourself back to the start position

Position two sturdy chairs apart such that they're wider than your shoulder-width Lie on your back between the chairs Reach up and grip the chair tops Pull your chest up to the chair level Lower your body back to the floor in a controlled manner

Place two chairs about hip-width apart, facing each other Lie down on your back between the chairs Reach up and grab the edges of the chairs with both hands Pull yourself up until your chest is level with the chairs Lower yourself back to the starting position in a controlled manner

Lie down on your back with your legs straight Set the bar of the smith machine above your chest and grab it with your hands placed wider than shoulder-width with straight arms Pull yourself up by folding your arms and take your chest towards the bar Return to the initial position slowly and repeat

name_en: Inverted Row with Bent Knee between Chairs
description_en: Place two sturdy chairs about hip-width apart Lie on your back under the chairs with your knees bent Reach up to grab the seats of the chairs Pull your chest up towards the seats while keeping your body straight Lower yourself back down in a controlled manner

Position yourself below the suspension straps, arms extended, holding onto the handles While keeping your body in a straight line, pull your chest towards the handles Return to the starting position in a controlled manner Ensure your elbows are close to your body throughout the motion Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Start by positioning yourself under the suspension straps Grasp the handles with your palms facing each other Pull your chest up to the handles by retracting your shoulder blades and flexing your elbows Pause briefly at the top before slowly lowering your body back down to the start position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand up straight against a wall Slowly slide down the wall to a position where it appears you are sitting on a chair Ensure that your knees are bent at right angles and thighs parallel to the floor Hold this position for as long as possible Slowly stand back up to the starting position
Lie down on your back and spread your legs and arms wide on the floor. Raise one of your legs and curl your raised thigh over the opposite hip joint. Maintain this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Stand upright and move your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms out to your sides and parallel to the floor Rotate your upper body to one side and then to the other Keep your hips stable and facing forward throughout the rotation Alternate sides for 15-30 seconds each

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms to out to each side, parallel to the floor Bend from your waist toward your left, reaching your right arm over your head Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds Repeat on the other side

Lie on your back, legs raised, and feet together Extend your arms out to the sides in a T position for stability Slowly rotate your legs from side to side in a semi-circular motion Keep your back flat on the floor while rotating your legs Pause in the side position, then return the legs to the center position

Assume a fighting stance with your dominant foot in the back Quickly throw a straight punch with your lead hand, rotating your arm so your fist ends palm down Quickly follow the jab with a punch using your rear hand, rotating your torso to generate power Quickly return your fists to the defensive position after delivering the punches Repeat the process

Stand in a boxer's stance with your fists raised in front of you Start the combo by extending your lead arm in a quick, light jab without fully extending your elbow Immediately follow with another similar jab Follow the second jab with a powerful cross punch using your back hand Return to the starting position and repeat

Start by standing upright with your feet hip-width apart Bend your knees and place your hands on the floor, then kick back your feet into a push-up position Do a push-up Jump your feet back in and stand up Finish the move by jumping in the air and spreading your legs and arms out into a 'star' shape

Stand with your feet hip-width apart Bend your knees and squat down, bringing your hands to the floor Jump up explosively, spreading your feet apart and raising your hands above your head to form a 'X' shape mid-air Land back into the squat position with your hands on the floor Repeat this action continuously

Lay flat on your back with your arms extended behind your head Bend your knees and pull them towards your chest At the same time, raise your upper body towards your knees Touch your knees with your hands then slowly return to the starting position

Lie on your back on the floor Place your hands at your side for balance Raise your legs and torso at the same time, bending at the waist Touch your knees to your chest if possible Return to the start position in a controlled way

Lie flat on your back on the floor Bend your knees and draw them up towards your chest At the same time, lift your shoulder blades off the floor Lower your legs and shoulders back to the starting position Repeat the exercise for desired repetitions

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Bend at your hips, push your buttocks back and squat down keeping your legs straight Bend your elbows and place your hands on your calves or ankles Push off using your hands and swing your hips forward, rising to your toes Return to the initial position in a controlled manner by bending your hips and squatting down again

Lie down on your back with your legs straight and your arms resting on the floor at your sides Raise your legs straight up while bringing your chest forward, and take your hands towards your feet without bending your arms Hold for a while and then return to the initial position slowly

Start in a standing position, feet hip-width apart Jump up and spread your legs mid-air while reaching your hands up While landing, bring your legs together and lower your arms, touching your right knee with your left hand Repeat the movement, this time touching your left knee with your right hand Continue alternate touches for a specified number of reps

Stand with feet together Jump and spread your legs out wide, while simultaneously swinging your straightened arms over your head Jump again and return your legs and arms to the starting position Repeat the movement quickly and rhythmically for the desired amount of time Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise

Stand upright with your feet together Jump up, spreading your legs wider than hip width apart while simultaneously swinging your arms out to your sides Jump again, returning to the starting position with your feet together and arms by your sides Continue these steps at a rapid pace for the desired amount of time

Lie on your back on a flat surface with your knees bent to a 90-degree angle Place your hands behind your head without interlocking your fingers Engage your abs and lift your upper body towards your knees Slowly lower your body back down

Start by jogging in place, lifting your knees high. Perform a drop by getting your body as low as possible, touching your palms to the floor. Immediately push off your hands, tucking your knees into your chest as you rise. Land back on your feet and immediately begin to jog in place again. Repeat the process.
Stand in front of a sturdy box or platform Lower into a semi-squat position and explode upwards onto the box Keep your knees slightly bent as you land Step back down and repeat the jump

Stand straight in front of the box with feet hip-width apart Bend your knees, swing your arms, and push off the ground to jump onto the center of the box Land softly on the box with your knees slightly bent Stand up straight then step back down to the starting position Repeat the exercise for the prescribed number of repetitions

Find a sturdy box or platform at knee height Start in a half-squat position in front of the box Powerfully jump onto the box, landing softly Stand fully upright with hips extended Step or jump back down and repeat

Start in a standing position, feet hip-width apart Jump up, alternating knee-up position as if riding a bicycle mid-air As you land, absorb the impact by bending your knees Be sure to keep your abdomen engaged throughout the action Repeat the movement for your target reps or time

Start by getting into a standard jumping stance Put your hands behind your head and bend your knees slightly Jump up and simultaneously twist your upper body to the left, bringing your right knee up and across to your left elbow Return to the initial position and then repeat the move on the opposite side Alternate these movements rapidly in a continuous motion

Begin in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart Bend your knees and lower yourself into a squat position Jump up explosively while swinging your arms upwards Bring your hands together for a clap above your head at the highest point of the jump Land softly and with controlled knee flexion to absorb the impact and prep for the next jump

Stand tall with your back straight and feet hip-width apart. Jump and open your feet wide while extending your arms overhead. Jump again and close your feet while lowering your arms to your sides. Repeat this activity for a suitable time.

Stand up straight with your feet together and hands at your sides Jump up, spread your feet and simultaneously bring your arms above your head Jump again to return to the initial position, bringing your arms back to your sides Repeat this process in quick succession for a set number of repetitions or for a set time duration

Stand upright with your legs together, arms at your sides Bend your knees slightly, and jump into the air As you jump, spread your legs to be about shoulder-width apart. At the same time, stretch your arms out and over your head Jump back to the starting position Repeat these for the desired number of repetitions

Start by standing straight with feet hip-width apart Jump feet out and bring arms above the head simultaneously Return to the starting position and immediately drive one knee towards your chest Return your foot to the floor and then immediately drive the other knee towards your chest Repeat the pattern in a continuous, vigorous pace

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise your arms out to the sides while simultaneously jumping your feet out wide As your feet touch the ground, punch with one hand towards the opposite direction Jump your feet back together and drop your arms to your sides Repeat with the other hand while jumping your feet out again

Start in a standing position with your feet together and arms by your sides Jump out while spreading your legs and extending your arms above your head As you jump back in, reach down to touch your toes with your arms Jump out again and repeat the jumping jack motion Keep performing this sequence for the desired number of repetitions

Stand on one leg with your flat foot a few inches from a box or step. Bend your knee and push your hips back like you're sitting, keeping your non-squatting leg straight in front of you. Spring up and land on the same foot on top of the box. Immediately drop back into a squat on the same leg, going as low as you can. Repeat the exercise with the opposite leg.

Stand under a pull-up bar, ensuring your hands can just reach the bar while standing flat-footed. Jump up and grab the pull-up bar in a shoulder-width grip. Use the momentum of your jump to pull your body upwards, finishing with your chin above the bar. Control your descent back down to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Start by standing upright with feet hip-width apart. Jump up, while in mid-air, split your legs and land in a lunge position with one foot forward and one foot back. Jump again and switch your feet in mid-air, landing in a lunge with the opposite foot forward. Repeat this jumping lunges, switching legs each time. Complete the recommended number of repetitions.

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and lunge forward with your right foot Jump up high and switch your legs in the air Landing softly, lunge forward with your left foot Repeat the jumping switch for the desired number of repetitions Also, perform the exercise with the opposite leg leading

Start by standing straight with your feet together and hands at your sides Jump up spreading your feet apart and bring your arms up in a clapping motion above the head Jump up again bringing your feet back together and arms back at your sides Land softly on your feet to protect your joints Repeat the movement quickly in a fluid motion

Stand with your feet hip-width apart, squat down keeping your back straight and chest up Explosively jump up and spread your legs slightly past shoulder-width apart while in the air Land back down into a squat position, with feet around shoulder-width apart From this position, jump back up bringing your feet together Repeat this sequence in a rapid, continuous motion

Stand in front of the fit box with feet shoulder-width apart Bend your knees and push your hips back as you prepare to jump Leap onto the box, landing gently with knees slightly bent to absorb the shock Stand up straight on the box Step back down and prepare for the next jump

Hold the rope with a handle in each hand at about hip level Jump off both feet together just high enough to clear the rope Turn the rope with your wrists, not your arms Land lightly on the balls of your feet Keep a steady rhythm throughout the duration of the exercise

Hold the handles of the jump rope in each hand at waist height Swing the jump rope over your head and jump over it with both feet together Land lightly on the balls of your feet Continue rotating the rope and jumping in a steady rhythm Start with low intensity, increasing intensity and duration as you get more comfortable

Start with feet hip width apart, knees slightly bent Jump upward, explosively extending your legs and raising your shoulders Shrug your shoulders upward as you're in the air Land softly, bending your knees and hips Reset and repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Start by holding the ends of the rope at your sides with the rope behind you Swiftly jump over the rope as it comes towards your feet, landing on the balls of your feet Continue to skip the rope maintaining a good rhythm Aim to keep a consistent jumping height Keep your elbows close to your body, and spin the rope with your wrists, not your arms

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Lower your body and jump in the air As you jump, spread your feet apart and land in a deep lunge with one foot ahead Jump in the air again and switch your legs Repeat this for your desired number of repetitions

Stand with your feet hip-width apart Begin the movement by jumping as high as you can While in midair, bring your right leg forward and the left leg backwards into a split squat position Land softly into a lunge Immediately reverse the movement and jump back up bringing the left leg forward and right leg backwards

Start in a normal standing position. Lower your body into a squat position, bending the knees and pushing your hips back. Explode upward, jumping as high as possible. Land gently back into the squat position, absorbing the impact with your knees. Repeat these steps without pausing.
Stand with feet hip-width apart Squat down as if sitting into a chair Explode upward into a jump from the squat position Land softly and immediately squat down to jump again

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Squat down until your knees are bent at a 90 degree angle Pushing through your heels, jump into the air as high as possible Upon landing, go straight into the next jump squat

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and keep your arms folded near your chest. Lower your hips to the floor by bending your knees. As your thighs become nearly parallel to the floor, jump up and land into this position again.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and keep your chest up Lower down into a squat while bending your knees Jump up explosively and reach your hands towards the ceiling Land softly back into the squat position Repeat this for your desired amount of reps

Stand in front of a step or her chosen platform Step up onto the platform, pushing through the heel Jump up, switching feet in mid-air Land on the platform with the opposite foot Step back down and repeat with alternating feet

Stand in front of a step or box, placing your right foot firmly on the step Push off your right foot and jump up to switch feet Land softly with your left foot on the box and your right foot on the ground Push off your left foot and jump up to switch feet back to the original position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding the kettlebell in your right hand, extended overhead Rotate your body at the waist to your left, bending forward and reaching your left hand towards your left foot Return to the upright position, but keep the kettlebell elevated overhead Repeat the movement for the specified amount of reps. Repeat on the other side using opposite limbs

Stand up straight with a kettlebell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso While holding the upper arm stationary, curl one kettlebell and start twisting the wrists once the dumbbell is at shoulder height Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbell is at shoulder level Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze the biceps Slowly bring down the dumbbell and repeat the process with the other arm

Stand up straight holding a kettlebell in each hand at shoulder level Press one kettlebell upwards until your arm is fully extended Lower the kettlebell back to shoulder level in a controlled manner Repeat the same movement with the other arm Continue alternating between arms for desired repetition

Start in a seated position on the floor with your legs bent at the knees and a kettlebell in each hand. Lean back so that the upper half of your body is on the floor, holding the kettlebells up at chest level. Alternately press one kettlebell up towards the ceiling, while keeping the other kettlebell in the starting position. Lower the elevated kettlebell back to starting position and repeat with the other hand. Continue alternating between arms for the desired amount of repetitions.

Place two kettlebells on the floor about shoulder width apart. Assume a push-up position, with your hands gripping the kettlebell handles. Lift one kettlebell enough to row it back towards your ribcage. Lower the kettlebell back in a controlled motion and switch to the other side. Repeat the process alternating between both sides.

Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand Bend at the waist keeping your back in a neutral position Pull one kettlebell towards your ribcage, keeping your elbow close to your body Lower the kettlebell back to the starting position Repeat with the other kettlebell and alternate between hands

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the kettlebell in one hand. Raise the kettlebell to chest level, and rotate your wrist so the palm faces forward. Press the kettlebell up and angle it diagonally across your body until your arm is fully extended. Lower the kettlebell back to chest level in a controlled manner. Repeat the movement with the other arm.

Start by standing tall, holding kettlebell with both hands at shoulder height. Rotate your torso slightly to one side and press the kettlebell overhead in a diagonal direction. Lower the kettlebell back down to shoulder height in a controlled manner. Rotate your torso to the other side and repeat the same movement. Swap hands after completing your desired number of repetitions, and repeat.

Lie on your back with a kettlebell in one hand, your arm extended towards the ceiling Bend your knee on the same side as the kettlebell and slowly roll onto the opposite side Extend your arm with the kettlebell behind your head maintaining the straight line Hold the position for several deep breaths Roll back to the starting position and switch sides

Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding the kettlebell in front of your chest with both hands. Press the kettlebell up and rotate your hands so your palms face forward. Hold for a second at the top, then lower the kettlebell back to your chest. Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps. Switch hands and repeat on the other side.

Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart Hold the kettlebell in one hand close to your shoulder Move the kettlebell around your head in a controlled manner Switch direction after each set Remember to keep your core engaged throughout the movement

Stand upright and hold the kettlebell in your right hand Start to pass the kettlebell around your head clockwise direction Transfer it to your left hand at the back of your head Complete the circle by bringing it back in front of your body and transferring it back to your right hand

Stand upright with a kettlebell on each hand Slowly step backward with your right foot till your knee almost touches the floor Pause then push into your right foot to bring yourself back to the starting position Repeat the lunge with your left foot Continue alternating between both legs for the duration of your set

Lie flat on your back on the bench, feet flat on the floor Hold a kettlebell in each hand at chest level, palms facing forward Press the kettlebells up until your arms are fully extended Lower the kettlebells back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of reps

name_en: Kettlebell Bent over Alternate Twist Row
description_en: Place a kettlebell between your feet, position your feet slightly wider than shoulder width. Bend at the waist, maintaining a straight back, and grab the kettlebell with one hand. Lift the kettlebell to your chest while rotating your torso, and twisting towards the lifting side. Lower the kettlebell back to the ground, maintaining control throughout the movement. Repeat the lifting and lowering process, this time twisting on the opposite side

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and a kettlebell on the ground between them. Bend at your hips and knees, grab the kettlebell with one hand. Pull the kettlebell up to your side, keeping your elbow tucked in. Hold for a moment, then lower the kettlebell back to the ground. Repeat the process with the other arm.

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, hold kettlebell in one hand at shoulder level Bend your knees slightly and incline your torso to the side opposite the kettlebell Press the kettlebell upwards while maintaining the incline Lower the kettlebell back to shoulder level in a controlled manner Repeat for desired number of repetitions and switch sides

Stand straight with the kettlebell in your right hand, elbow bent, and the bell resting against your outer forearm Bend over to your left side, pushing the kettlebell up above your head Look at the kettlebell as you straighten your body up to a standing position, all while keeping the kettlebell overhead Slowly lower the kettlebell down to your shoulder in a controlled manner before ultimately bringing it down to your side Repeat the process with the kettlebell in your left hand

Stand up straight with a kettlebell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing forward. Keep the upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting your biceps. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the kettlebells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps. Slowly lower the kettlebells back to the starting position.

Stand upright and hold the kettlebell at its handle with your arm fully extended downwards and a palm facing forward grip. Curl the kettlebell towards your shoulder, keeping your elbow stationary and allowing only your forearm to move. Pause at the top of the movement, contracting your biceps. Lower the kettlebell back to the starting position, controlling the movement. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions before switching to the other arm.

Stand tall with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart Hold the kettlebell in both hands in front of your chest Slowly lower your body towards the ground until your glutes touch the box Pause for a moment then push through your heels to return to the starting position

Stand 2-3 feet in front of a knee-high platform, extend one of your legs backward, and rest your toes on it. Stand upright in this position and hold kettlebells in your hands near your hips. Lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. Return to the initial position, and repeat.

name_en: Kettlebell Bulgarian Split Squat Right Side View
description_en: Stand 2-3 feet in front of a knee-high platform, extend one of your legs backward, and rest your toes on it. Stand upright in this position and hold kettlebells in your hands near your hips. Lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. Return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Kettlebell Calf Raise and Front Squat
description_en: Stand tall with a kettlebell in both your hands Raise your heels off the ground by flexing your calves Lower your heels back to the ground Bend at the hips and knees to lower into a squat Push through your heels to rise back up into the starting position

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart and hold a kettlebell in one hand Bring the kettlebell to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you raise your elbow outward Dip down, bending at the knees, keeping your back straight Push upward forcefully to extend your legs while simultaneously punching the kettlebell upward to full arm extension Reverse the motion to bring the kettlebell back down

Stand up straight with a kettlebell in each hand, arms fully extended, and feet shoulder-width apart. Clean the kettlebells to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you pull the kettlebells towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrists as you do this, so that the palms face forward and the kettlebells are resting against the forearm. Push upwards, lifting the kettlebells above your head until your arms are fully extended. Slowly lower the kettlebells back down to the shoulder position and then down to the starting position.

Sit on a bench with your legs spread apart and a kettlebell on the floor in between your legs Bend at the waist and grab the kettlebell with your palm facing up Curl the kettlebell towards your chest while keeping the upper arm stationary Slowly lower the kettlebell back down to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand upright while holding your kettlebell in your right hand Step your right foot back and bend both knees to lower into a reverse lunge Push back up to the starting position Switch the kettlebell to your left hand and repeat the movement with the left leg

Stand with your feet wider than shoulder width apart and hold the kettlebell in front of your chest with both hands Shift your weight to one side by bending the knee. The other leg should stay straight and the foot can rotate so the toes point upwards Lower your hip as much as possible while keeping your torso upright Push back up to the starting position Repeat the exercise on the other side

Place the kettlebell between your feet Bend at your hips and knees and grasp the kettlebell Keep your back straight and lift the kettlebell off the ground by extending your hips and knees Lower the kettlebell back to the ground under control

Lie down on a decline bench holding a kettlebell in each hand Relax your arms fully extended by your sides Shrug your shoulders upwards towards your ears Hold for a moment and then lower the kettlebells back down

Place two kettlebells on the ground shoulder-width apart Get into the push-up position with your hands on the kettlebell handles Lower your body until your chest almost touches the kettlebells Push yourself back up to the starting position Repeat the exercise for the set number of repetitions

Stand up straight holding two kettlebells in front of you at arm's length. This will be your starting position. Bend at your hips and knees and squat down so that the kettlebells are between your legs. Rapidly pull one kettlebell up to your shoulders by extending through your hips and knees. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm is facing forward at shoulder height. Lower the kettlebell and repeat the movement with the other. Alternate arms for the desired number of repetitions.

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and a kettlebell in each hand Start with the kettlebells in the 'rack position', tucked close to your body with elbows bent Perform a slight squat and push the kettlebells upwards, fully extending your arms Lower the kettlebells back to the rack position Stand upright to complete the rep

Start with your feet shoulder width apart and a kettlebell in each hand in front of you at chest height Bend your knees slightly and drive the weight upward by straightening your legs and extending your arms until the kettlebells are overhead Hold this position for a moment Lower the kettlebells to your chest in a slow, controlled fashion Repeat the movement for your desired rep count

Stand with feet hip-width apart and kettlebells on the ground between your feet Bend at the hips and knees to reach the kettlebells Lift them to your shoulder height while straightening your legs and hips Push your torso upright and extend your arms overhead Slowly lower the kettlebells back down to the starting position

Stand straight and grab a kettlebell in each hand with an overhand grip Keep your chest out, shoulders back and look straight ahead Walk forward in a straight line, maintaining firm grip on the kettlebells Continue for a set distance or time before lowering the kettlebells back down

Stand with your feet hip-width apart, and hold the kettlebell in your right hand Swing the kettlebell back through your legs and transfer the kettlebell to your left hand Bring the kettlebell around your left hand and transfer it back to your right hand in front of you, completing a 'figure 8' motion Keep your chest lifted and your abs engaged throughout the exercise Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and a kettlebell on the floor between your feet Squat down to pick up the kettlebell with both hands Swing the kettlebell in a figure 8 motion, passing the kettlebell between your legs and around one knee and then the other Keep your back straight, chest lifted, and hips pushed back throughout the movement

Lie flat on your back on the floor, each hand holding a kettlebell. Extend your arms to the sides, maintaining a slight bend in your elbows. Squeeze your chest and bring your hands together above your chest, lifting the kettlebells. Lower the kettlebells back to the starting position. Repeat the movement for the required number of repetitions.

Lie flat on your back on a bench and hold a kettlebell in each hand Extend your arms straight above your chest Slowly lower your arms out to your sides, keeping them slightly bent Squeeze your chest to raise your arms back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand upright holding a Kettlebell in each hand Step forward with your right foot into a lunge position, keeping your back straight Lower your body until your right knee is at a 90-degree angle Push back to your starting position using the heel of your right foot Repeat with the left leg

Stand tall holding a kettlebell in each hand by your sides. With your right leg, step forward into a lunge position. Lower your body until the right knee is bent at a 90-degree angle. Push with your right foot to bring yourself back to the starting position. Repeat with your left leg and continue alternating.

Stand tall with feet hip-width apart, hold the kettlebell in front of your thighs with palms facing toward you Raise the kettlebell straight up to shoulder height, keeping your arms slightly bent Ensure your core is engaged and keep your shoulders down Slowly lower the kettlebell back down with control Repeat the movement for desired reps
