Stand up straight with a kettlebell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your body While keeping your torso stationary, lift the kettlebells to the front of you with arms slightly bent and elbows higher than forearms Continue to go up until your arms are slightly above parallel to the floor Pause for a moment at the top, then lower the kettlebells back down to the starting position

Stand up straight while holding the kettlebell in front of you with both hands at chest level Begin to lower your body while keeping your back straight Continue down until your thighs are parallel to the ground Pushing mainly with your heels, go back up to the starting position Repeat this process as required

Stand up straight while holding a kettlebell in each hand. Bend your knees and lower your body down until your thighs are parallel to the floor. Then push your body back up to the starting position. Repeat this motion for the recommended number of repetitions. Make sure to keep your back straight throughout the motion.

Stand tall with feet hip-width apart, holding the kettlebell near your chest. Start to march on the spot, raising your knees as high as possible. Engage your core throughout the workout to keep your spine straight. Continue marching, maintaining a steady pace. Remember to breathe regularly throughout the exercise.

Stand with your feet wider than shoulder width apart, toes pointed outward Grip the kettlebell by the handle, holding it at your chest Lower your body into a squat by sending your hips back, keeping your chest lifted Bend your knees until your thighs are parallel to the ground Return to the starting position by pushing through your heels

Hold the kettlebell by the handle at chest level with both hands. Stand up straight, with your feet a little wider than hip distance apart. Lower your body by bending your knees and hips, as if sitting down on a chair. Move down until your thighs are parallel to the ground or as far as is comfortable. Stand back up to the starting position, pushing through your heels.

Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold the kettlebell by the horns, close to your chest Bend at the knees and hips to lower your body down into a squat position, keeping your back straight Pause when your thighs are parallel to the floor Press through your heels to stand up straight, keeping the kettlebell at your chest Repeat this motion for the desired number of reps

Stand straight holding a kettlebell against your chest Bend your hips back while keeping your legs stationary Keep bending your hips until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings Drive your hips forward to return to the starting position Maintain a neutral spine throughout the whole exercise

Place a kettlebell at the base of your neck Bend at the hips while keeping your back straight and chest up Lower yourself down until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings Return to standing position by driving your hips forward Repeat as many repetitions as desired

Stand in a slight squat, holding a kettlebell in each hand Lift one kettlebell towards your hip while keeping your elbow close to your body Lower the first kettlebell and repeat the process with the second kettlebell Ensure you are bracing your core and keeping your back flat during the exercise Continue alternating arms for your desired reps

name_en: Kettlebell Half Kneeling One Arm Bottoms-up Press
description_en: Kneel on one knee with the other foot flat on the floor Hold a kettlebell in one hand with the bottom of the kettlebell facing upwards Press the kettlebell overhead until your arm is fully extended Lower the kettlebell back down in a controlled fashion Switch arms and repeat

Start in a half kneeling position with your right knee up and hold the kettlebell in your right hand at shoulder height Push the kettlebell straight up until your arm is fully extended Pause at the top for a second Slowly lower the kettlebell back to the starting position Repeat these steps with left knee up and kettlebell in left hand

Stand tall with your back straight, step forward, and lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. Grab the kettlebell in one hand with your arm open wide to shoulder level and elbow, making a 45-degree angle with your torso. Raise the kettlebell by extending your arm overhead.

Stand tall with your back straight, holding kettlebells in your hands near the hips, and take a step forward. Lower yourself by taking your rear knee to the floor and bending your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie flat on your back on the floor, holding the kettlebell in your right hand straight above your shoulder. Bend your right knee and place your right foot flat on the floor. Pressing through your right foot and elbow, raise your body off the floor until you are supported on your left forearm. Lower yourself back to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat the exercise with your left hand and foot.

name_en: Kettlebell Hammer Grip Incline Bench Two Arm Row
description_en: Position yourself on your side on an incline bench, hold a kettlebell in each hand using a hammer grip Pull the kettlebells up by flexing your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together Pause a moment once the kettlebells reach your sides Slowly lower the kettlebells back to the start position Repeat the motion for the desired number of repetitions

Begin by standing with a kettlebell between your feet, your knees slightly bent Bend at the hips, grabbing the handle with both hands, then straighten up to a standing position Pull the kettlebell up to your stomach, keeping your elbows close and pointing upwards From there, dip slightly at the knees and use your arms to direct the kettlebell up to your shoulder Lower the kettlebell back to the starting position in a controlled manner

Bend at your waist with your head resting lightly on a sturdy bench. Hold the kettlebell in one hand allowing it to hang directly below your shoulder. Lift the kettlebell towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body. Lower the kettlebell in a controlled manner, extending your arm fully. Repeat the steps with your other arm.

Sit down on a bench with an incline Hold a kettlebell in each hand with arms fully extended Curl one kettlebell up to your shoulder, keeping your elbow close to your body Slowly lower the kettlebell back to the starting position Repeat with the other arm

Lie back on an incline bench while holding a kettlebell in each hand at arm's length Extend your forearms vertically, elbows at 90 degrees Press the kettlebells upwards until your arms are fully extended Return slowly to the starting position Repeat for the desired amount of repetitions

Sit down on the incline bench, holding a kettlebell in each hand with an underhand grip While keeping your elbows still, curl the kettlebells toward your shoulders Pause at the top of the curl for a beat to maximize the peak contraction Lower the kettlebells back down slowly to the starting position Repeat this movement for the desired number of reps

Lie on an incline bench with a small kettlebell in each hand Extend your arms straight out from your shoulders Slowly lower the kettlebells out and down in an arc Use your chest muscles to bring the kettlebells back up to the start position

Lie back on an incline bench with a kettlebell in each hand, hands in a hammer grip (palms facing each other) Extend your arms directly above you Lower the kettlebells to the sides of your chest in a controlled motion Press the kettlebells back up to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on an incline bench with a kettlebell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso While keeping your upper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting your biceps Continue to raise the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the kettlebells are at shoulder level Hold the contracted position for a brief moment as you squeeze your biceps Slowly begin to bring the kettlebells back to the starting position

Lie down on an incline bench with a kettlebell in each hand Start with your arms straight out in front of you, palms facing each other Lower the kettlebells until they are near your chest Push the kettlebells back up until your arms are fully extended Repeat for the desired number of reps

Position yourself face down on an incline bench, holding a kettlebell in each hand Pull the kettlebells up towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together Lower the kettlebells back down in a controlled manner, extending your arms fully Maintain a neutral spine throughout the movement and keep your head in line with your body Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions

Position yourself on an incline bench with your chest and stomach pressed against the bench Hold the kettlebell in one hand by your side Lift your shoulder towards your ear, keeping your arm straight Lower the weight back down slowly

Sit down on an incline bench with a kettlebell in each hand at arms length Lower the kettlebell slowly by flexing your elbows Pause when the kettlebell nearly reaches your forehead Push it back up to the starting position Keep the upper arms stationary throughout the exercise

Lie diagonally on an incline bench, with a kettlebell in each hand and an extended arm Twist your wrist as you lift the kettlebells towards the center of your chest Lower the kettlebells back down in a controlled manner, returning to your starting position Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions Switch sides and repeat the exercise

Lie back on an incline bench with a kettlebell in each hand Hold the kettlebells at shoulder level with your palms facing each other Press the kettlebells up while rotating your wrists so your palms face forwards At the top of the press, your arms should be straight Lower the kettlebells back to the starting position in a controlled manner

Lie on an incline bench with a kettlebell in each hand Raise both arms out to your sides, making a Y shape Keep your arms straight and level with your body Slowly lower your arms back to the start Repeat this motion for the desired amount of repetitions

Stand straight while holding the kettlebell in one hand. With the same side foot as the hand with the kettlebell, step back into a reverse lunge position. Lower your back knee towards the ground, keeping your front shin vertical. Push back up to the standing position using your front heel. Repeat with the same leg for the desired amount of reps, then switch sides.

Start by standing on one foot with the kettlebell in front of you on the floor, Bend at the hip, keeping your back straight and grab the kettlebell with your two hands, Keeping your knee slightly bent, push your hips back, lean your torso forward, and lower the kettlebell toward the ground, Lift your body back to the starting position pushing through your heel and hip

Start in a kneeling position with the kettlebell in both hands, arms extended in front of you Drive your hips forward and stand up, maintaining balance and keeping your core engaged Lower back down to a kneeling position, remembering to keep the kettlebell stable throughout the movement Repeat the action for desired reps Switch to the other leg and repeat

name_en: Kettlebell Kneeling Hold to Stand Clean grip
description_en: Start in a kneeling position with the kettlebell at your side Push off with your back foot and stand up, maintaining your hold on the kettlebell At the top of the motion, clean the kettlebell to your shoulder Lower the kettlebell back to your side and return to the kneeling position Repeat the exercise according to your training plan

name_en: Kettlebell Kneeling One Arm Bottoms-up Press
description_en: Start by kneeling on the ground with a kettlebell in one hand. Hold the kettlebell with the bottom up, near your shoulder. Push the kettlebell straight up until your arm is fully extended. Keep your core tight throughout this movement. Slowly lower the kettlebell back to the starting position.

name_en: Kettlebell Kneeling One Arm Shoulder Press
description_en: Start kneeling with your back straight and align with your thighs and your knees resting on the floor. Grab the kettlebell in one hand with your arm open wide, and your elbow making a 45-degree angle with your torso. Raise the kettlebell by extending your arm overhead. As your arm becomes straight overhead, return to the initial position and repeat.

Kneel down on the ground with the kettlebell in one hand Raise the kettlebell up until your arm is fully extended above your head, bottom-up Keep your arm, shoulder, and kettlebell in a straight line Hold the position for a few seconds Lower the kettlebell back down in a controlled motion

Hold a kettlebell in one hand. Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart. Step out to the side with your right foot, bending your right knee while keeping your left leg straight. Push back to your start position. Repeat the movement with your left leg.

Stand upright with a kettlebell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso. Keeping your torso stationary, lift the kettlebells to your side until your arms are parallel to the floor. Hold the contraction at the top for a second. Lower the kettlebells back down to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

Hold a kettlebell in each hand and stand next to a step or bench Shift your weight onto your closest leg and step up onto the bench, pushing through your heel Bring your opposite knee up towards your chest Lower yourself back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the movement with the opposite leg

Stand straight while holding a kettlebell in each hand Keep your arms fully extended at all times Raise the kettlebells until your arms are parallel to the floor and lower them back after a short pause Ensure your abs stay contracted during the exercise Avoid swinging the kettlebell, lift using your shoulder strength

Lie down on your back on a flat surface. Place a kettlebell between your feet and grip it firmly. Keeping your legs straight, raise them to create a 90 degree angle with your body. Lower your legs back to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat the movement.

Stand up straight with a kettlebell in each hand, arms fully extended Slowly lower the weights in a wide arc until they are level with your chest Hold for a moment before bringing the weights back up in an arc, contracting your chest Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder width apart, kettlebell in your right hand. Extend your right hand towards the ceiling, keeping your eyes on the kettlebell. Bend at your waist and lower your body towards the left. Touch your left foot with your left hand while keeping the kettlebell overhead. Reverse the movement and return to the standing position.

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart and hold the kettlebell in your right hand Step forward with your left leg into a lunge, lowering the kettlebell through your legs Grab the kettlebell with your left hand and stand back up, passing the kettlebell back to your right hand Repeat the process by stepping forward with your right leg, lowering the kettlebell through your legs to your left hand

Hold the kettlebell in both hands at chest level Take a large step forward with one foot into a lunge position As you lunge, twist your torso towards the lunging knee Twist back to the forward position and push off your front foot to return to the starting position Repeat on the other side

name_en: Kettlebell Lying on Floor Chest Press
description_en: Lie flat on your back with knees bent and feet on the ground Hold a kettlebell in each hand at chest level Press the kettlebells straight up until your arms are fully extended Pause for a second and then lower the kettlebells back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Kettlebell Lying on Floor Rear Delt Raise
description_en: Lie face down on the floor with a kettlebell in each hand Extend your arms outward to the side, keeping a slight bend at the elbows Raise the kettlebells upward, focusing on squeezing your shoulder blades together Lower the kettlebells back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the movement for your desired amount of repetitions

Lie on your stomach on a flat bench, legs extended straight behind you with feet grounded. Hold a kettlebell in each hand, arms extended beneath you. Lift the kettlebells toward your shoulders while keeping your elbows close to your body. Pause at the top of the lift, then slowly lower the kettlebells back to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.

name_en: Kettlebell Lying Triceps Extension Skull Crusher
description_en: Lie on your back with your knees bent Hold a kettlebell with both hands straight above your chest Lower only your forearms, bending your elbows, until the kettlebell is above your forehead Push the kettlebell back up to the initial position Repeat as necessary for your training regimen

Lie on a flat bench with a kettlebell in each hand Begin by holding the kettlebells just outside your shoulders with your palms facing each other (neutral grip) Press the kettlebells upward until your arms are fully extended Slowly lower the kettlebells back to the starting position Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

name_en: Kettlebell One Arm Clean and Jerk
description_en: Start in a standing position with the kettlebell between your feet. Squat down and with one hand, grab the kettlebell. In one swift, fluid motion, pull the kettlebell up towards your shoulder while standing up, transitioning your grip so your palm is facing forwards. Then, push the kettlebell directly upwards until your arm is fully extended overhead. Lower the kettlebell back to the starting position and repeat.

Lie on the floor and hold a kettlebell in one hand Bend your elbow and lower the kettlebell to your chest Press the kettlebell upwards until your arm is fully extended Lower the kettlebell in a controlled manner back to your chest Repeat the exercise with the other arm

Hold the kettlebell in one hand with your palm facing forward Dip your knees and use your legs to help drive the kettlebell upward Extend your arm overhead, lock your elbow and stand tall Lower the kettlebell back down to your shoulder in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise with the other arm

name_en: Kettlebell One Arm Military Press To Side
description_en: Stand up straight holding a kettlebell in one hand at shoulder level Press the kettlebell up and slightly to the side until your arm is fully extended Hold for a second at the top Lower the kettlebell back down to shoulder level in a controlled manner Repeat this process for your desired number of repetitions and then switch hands

Start by holding a kettlebell with one hand and stand with your feet hip-width apart Push your hips back and bend your knees to lower into a squat Squat down as deep as comfortable keeping the kettlebell overhead Push to return to standing while keeping the kettlebell overhead Switch hands and repeat the process

Stand beside the kettlebell, hinge at your waist with a straight back and grab the kettlebell with one hand Engage your core and maintain a tight grip on the kettlebell Pull the kettlebell straight up, bringing your elbow past your back Slowly lower the kettlebell back down to the floor, maintaining control throughout Ensure to do the exercise on both sides to maintain balance

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hold the kettlebell in one hand Bend at the knees and hips to lower your body and swing the kettlebell between your legs Explosively lift the kettlebell upwards until your arm is extended overhead Lower the kettlebell back down and repeat the motion Switch hands after completing the desired reps

Stand with your feet hip-width apart, kettlebell on the floor between your feet Bend at your hips and knees, grasp the kettlebell with one hand Straighten your legs, thrust your hips forward, and swing the kettlebell up to shoulder height Let the kettlebell fall back down, hinge at the hips and absorb the weight Then, explosively stand back up, using the momentum to start the next swing

Stand on one leg, holding the kettlebell in the opposite hand Bend at your hips and lower the kettlebell towards the ground, keeping your back straight Push your hips forward and stand up straight, lifting the kettlebell Swap the kettlebell to the other hand and repeat with the other leg

Stand with your feet hip-width apart holding the kettlebell with an overhand grip Hinge at your hips, lower the kettlebell between your legs Drive your hips forward and swing the kettlebell up to shoulder height Let the kettlebell swing back down between your legs Repeat this swinging motion

Stand holding a kettlebell in one hand at shoulder height Push the kettlebell up until your arm is fully extended overhead Brace your core as you walk, making sure to keep the kettlebell steady Switch hands and repeat with the other arm Continue walking for a set amount of time or distance

Begin by holding a kettlebell in one hand overhead, arm fully extended Stand straight and step forward with one foot Lower your body by bending your knee and hip, keeping your back straight Push up and back to the starting position Repeat the motion with the other leg

Stand while holding the kettlebell in both hands, arms fully extended and feet shoulder-width apart. Keep your elbows close to your head, bend your elbows to lower the kettlebell behind your head. Push the kettlebell back up to the starting position and repeat. Make sure to move your forearms, keeping the rest of your body still. Avoid locking your elbows at the top of the extension.

Stand tall holding the kettlebell in front of your chest with both hands, balance on one leg with the opposite leg extended straight leg forward as high as possible Lower your body while keeping your leg and kettlebell in control Push through your heel to stand back up Repeat with the opposite leg Keep your torso upright throughout the movement

Start in a high plank position with a kettlebell placed on the ground beside you With one hand, reach under your body to grab the kettlebell Drag the kettlebell across your body to the other side, maintaining your plank position Switch hands and repeat the movement Perform the set number of reps for each side

Position yourself face down on the incline bench with a kettlebell in each hand With your arms fully extended, hang the kettlebells vertically under the shoulders Curl the kettlebells towards your shoulders while keeping the elbows stationary Hold at the top of the movement and squeeze the biceps Lower the kettlebells back to the starting position in a controlled manner

Lie face down on an incline bench with your arms hanging straight down and a kettlebell in each hand Without changing the bend in your elbows, raise your arms out to your sides until they're in line with your body Hold for a moment, then lower the kettlebells back down in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of repetitions Ensure your back remains straight and stationary throughout

Lie flat on your back on the floor or a bench. Hold the kettlebell with both hands, extending your arms above your chest. Slowly lower the kettlebell over your head towards the floor. Pull the kettlebell back above your chest. Repeat the movement for a set of repetitions.

Lie flat on your back, bending your knees and keeping your feet flat on the floor Hold the kettlebell by the handle in both hands, keeping your arms straight Slowly lower the kettlebell behind your head, keeping your arms straight Pull the kettlebell back over your chest, still keeping your arms straight Repeat for the specified amount of reps

Stand tall with a kettlebell in each hand, arms fully extended, and feet shoulder-width apart Bend at your waist but keep your back straight Lift the kettlebells to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body Lower the kettlebells slowly and controlled back to the starting position Repeat

Stand straight while holding a kettlebell in your right hand. Bend at your hips and knees and brace your left hand on your left knee for support. Pull the kettlebell up towards your hip Lower the kettlebell back to the starting position Repeat on other side for equal reps.

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand Bend at the waist so your torso is nearly parallel to the floor Extend arms straight down, then raise them to the sides until they're in line with your body Lower the weights slowly back to the starting position Repeat desired reps

Stand straight holding the kettlebell in front of your chest with both hands Step backward with one foot, lowering your hip until your front knee is bent at about a 90-degree angle Push your weight back up to the starting position Repeat on the other side

Lay down on your bench with a kettlebell in each hand Position the kettlebells at shoulder level, palms facing forward Press the kettlebells upward until your arms are straight Lower them back to the starting position in a controlled way Repeat the movement

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart and hold a kettlebell in each hand Slightly bend your knees and push your hips back, lowering your torso Raise the kettlebells out to your sides until they come in line with your body Lower the kettlebells back to the starting position in a controlled motion Repeat the process for your desired number of reps

Lie flat on your back with a kettlebell in each hand Press the kettlebells upwards extending your arms Lower the kettlebells back to your chest in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of reps

Seat yourself good on an incline bench, with a kettlebell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing each other. While keeping your upper arm stationary, curl the kettlebells while contracting your biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the kettlebells are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a brief moment. Slowly begin to bring the kettlebells back to original position as your breathe in. Repeat the movement for the desired amount of repetitions.

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart while holding a kettlebell in front of you Bend at hips and knees to lower the kettlebell towards the floor, keeping your back straight Pause momentarily when you feel a good stretch in your hamstrings Push your hips forward and rise back up to the starting position Repeat for the suggested amount of repetitions

Stand up straight while holding the kettlebell with your hands extended in front of you. Lower your torso forward, while keeping the back straight until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings. Your knees should be slightly bent throughout the movement. Return your torso to the starting position while squeezing your glutes. Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.

Place a kettlebell between your feet, stand tall and position your feet a bit wider than hip-width apart Push your hips back and bend your knees to lower your body down, grab the kettlebell with one hand Push your hips forward, and as you stand, pull the kettlebell up to your chest Lower the kettlebell back down, rotating it to the opposite hand at the bottom of the squat Repeat the movement with the other hand

Sit on the ground with your legs bent, pull your abs to your spine, and lean back a few inches while keeping your back straight Hold kettlebell with both hands at your chest, and then lean back to a 45-degree angle Rotate your torso to the right, then to the left to complete one rep Keep kettlebell at your chest throughout Try to keep your legs and lower body as still as possible, the movement should come from your waist

Sit on a bench, hold a kettlebell with both hands at arm's length. The kettlebell should be touching your thighs Keeping your back straight, raise the kettlebell until your arms are fully extended and parallel to the floor Pause for a second at the top, then slowly lower the kettlebell back to the starting position Repeat the movement for the prescribed number of repetitions

Sit up straight on a bench with a kettlebell in each hand, arms fully extended and palms facing inward Keeping the arms slightly bent, raise the kettlebells out to the sides until they are at shoulder level Hold for a moment and feel the contraction Slowly lower the kettlebells back to the starting position

name_en: Kettlebell Seated Neutral Grip Shoulders Press
description_en: Sit on a bench with back support, holding a kettlebell in each hand at shoulder level with a neutral grip Drive the kettlebells upward until your arms are fully extended over your head Pause briefly at the top of the movement Lower the kettlebells back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Kettlebell Seated One Arm Military Press
description_en: Sit on a bench, holding a kettlebell in your right hand at shoulder level Keep your back straight and core engaged Press the kettlebell directly overhead until your arm is fully extended Lower the kettlebell back to shoulder level in a controlled manner Repeat on the left side

Sit on a bench with the back straight and feet placed flat on the floor, holding a kettlebell in your right hand Raise your right arm so your hand is near your shoulder, with the elbow bent and the kettlebell resting against the forearm In a controlled movement, extend your arm vertically and press the kettlebell into the air Pause briefly at the top, then lower the kettlebell back to the start position in a controlled movement

Sit on a bench, holding a kettlebell by its handle in each hand Bend your elbows and raise the kettlebells to shoulder height Press the kettlebells straight up until your arms are fully extended Pause at the top, then lower the kettlebells back to the starting position

name_en: Kettlebell Seated Two Arm Military Press
description_en: Sit on a bench with your back upright, holding a kettlebell in each hand at shoulder level Press the kettlebells straight up until your arms are fully extended Pause briefly at the top before lowering the kettlebells back to the shoulder level Continue to press and lower the kettlebells for your desired number of repetitions

Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand Push one kettlebell overhead while lowering the other one Alternate pushing one kettlebell up while lowering the other Keep your core engaged and eyes forward

Stand up straight while holding a kettlebell in each hand Raise one arm, fully extending it overhead. Keep the other arm by your side Begin to lower the fully extended arm while simultaneously raising the other arm Repeat the exercise for the desired amount of reps Switch arms

Start by standing tall with a kettlebell in each hand, arms fully extended downwards. Lift your shoulders straight up towards your ears, without bending your elbows or moving your torso. Hold the 'shrugged' position briefly, before lowering the weights back to the starting position. Keep the back straight and the core engaged throughout the exercise. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Stand up straight with a kettlebell in one hand. Keep your feet shoulder-width apart and let your arms hang at your side Bend only at your waist to the side, as far as possible Hold for a second at the peak contraction Return back to the starting position and repeat the movement on the other side Continue alternating sides for your desired amount of repetitions

Stand straight while holding the kettlebell in both hands, feet hip-width apart Take a big step to the side with your right foot, bend your knee and lower your body Push your hip back and keep your back straight Hold for a moment then push your body back up to the starting position Repeat on the left side

Start in a side plank position with your right elbow down and a kettlebell in your left hand Lift the kettlebell up to the sky while keeping your body in a straight line Hold this position for a few seconds Lower the kettlebell back down to your chest Switch sides and repeat the process with the kettlebell in your right hand

Stand with feet hip-width apart, a kettlebell between your feet Grasp the kettlebell and pull it back between your legs to create momentum Drive your hips forward, straighten your knees, and swing the kettlebell up to your shoulder Catch the kettlebell at your shoulder to complete the clean Reverse the movement to return to the starting position

name_en: Kettlebell Single Arm Clean and Press
description_en: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebell in one hand Lower into a slight squat and explode upwards, pulling the kettlebell up to shoulder height Once the kettlebell is at shoulder height, dip your knees and push upward, extending your arm and pressing the kettlebell above your head Lower the kettlebell back to shoulder height in a controlled fashion Then lower back to the starting position

name_en: Kettlebell Single Arm Clean and Press
description_en: Stand near a kettlebell and hold it by leaning forward and bending your knees. Raise the kettlebell to your knees while raising your hips, then take it to your shoulder by bringing your elbow under it and straightening your legs. As your legs become straight, take the kettlebell overhead by extending your arm. Return to the starting position step by step and repeat.

With your right hand, grasp the kettlebell and lift it to shoulder level Press the kettlebell above your head, your arm should be extended fully Step forward with your left leg and lower your body into a lunge Hold for a moment, then push up with your left leg to stand Alternate sides and repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold a kettlebell overhead while extending your arm. Take a step forward and lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand with feet hip-width apart, kettlebell in one hand between your legs Bend your knees slightly, then hinge at the hips to swing the kettlebell back between your legs Keep your core engaged as you drive your hips forward, swinging the kettlebell up to shoulder height Let the kettlebell swing back between your legs as you hinge your hips and slightly bend your knees Repeat for the desired amount of repetition, then switch to the other hand

Stand on one leg, hold a kettlebell in the opposite hand with an arm extended towards the floor. Slightly bend your knee, then push your hips back while lowering the kettlebell towards the ground. Maintain a neutral spine and keep your back flat. Push through your heel to stand straight up, bringing the kettlebell back to the starting position. Switch legs and repeat the exercise.

name_en: Kettlebell Single Leg Glute Bridge Pullover
description_en: Start by lying on your back with your knees bent at a 90-degree angle, left foot on the floor, and the right foot up in the air. Hold a kettlebell in both hands, arms extended above your chest. Lower the kettlebell over your head while keeping your arms straight. At the same time, lift your hips off the floor by pressing into your left foot and squeezing your glutes. Slowly return to the starting position while maintaining control of your movements.

Stand with your back to a bench and a kettlebell in each hand Extend one leg back and place the top of your foot on the bench Bend your front knee to lower your body towards the floor, keeping your back straight Push through your front heel to return to the starting position Repeat with the opposite leg

name_en: Kettlebell Single Leg Split Squat with Low Box
description_en: Stand next to a low box with a kettlebell in your hand on the same side as the working leg Step onto the box with your other foot, extend your working leg out and keep your toes pointed down Slowly lower your body by flexing the hip and the knee of your supporting leg as if sitting back into a chair Pause at the bottom and then push your body back up to the starting position Repeat on the other side

name_en: Kettlebell Single Leg Split Squat with the Ring
description_en: Stand with your back facing a supportive ring, hold a kettlebell in each hand at your sides Flex your knee and hip to lower your body down, maintaining your balance with the support of the ring Ensure the knee of the rear leg almost touches the ground and the front knee doesn't move past the toes Push through the heel of the front foot to stand back up to the starting position Repeat the movement on the other side

Lie down on your back with your legs straight and hold a kettlebell on your chest. Raise your torso off the floor unless it becomes perpendicular to your legs, and then raise the kettlebell by extending your arms overhead. Bring the kettlebell down, return back to the floor, and repeat.

Begin by lying on your back on a mat with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Hold a kettlebell in your right hand at chest level. While keeping your arm straight, use your abs to sit up and at the same time press the kettlebell to the ceiling. Hold this position briefly before lowering yourself back down in a controlled manner, bringing the kettlebell back to chest level. Repeat the movement with the other arm holding the kettlebell. Perform the desired number of repetitions on each side.

Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding the kettlebell in one hand Begin the swing by hinging at your hips and swinging backward As the kettlebell swings forward, explosively thrust your hips forward and stand tall At the top of the swing, pull the kettlebell towards your body and then 'punch' upward to extend your arm, ending the snatch with the kettlebell overhead Lower down carefully following the same path in reverse to bring the kettlebell back to the start position and prepare for the next rep

Start by standing up straight with a kettlebell in each hand, your feet hip-width apart. Step one foot back and lower your body into a split squat, bending at your front knee. Keep your torso straight and look ahead. Push through the heel of your front foot to return to the starting position. Switch legs and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold kettlebells in your hands near your hips. Lower your hips to the floor while bending your knees. As your hips come under the knee level, return to the initial position, and repeat.

name_en: Kettlebell Standing Bottoms-up One Arm Shoulder Press
description_en: Stand upright and hold a kettlebell upside down by its handle in one hand at shoulder level Press the kettlebell up overhead until your arm is completely straight Hold the position for a second Lower the kettlebell back to shoulder level in a controlled manner Repeat the movement for the desired amount of repetitions before switching arms

name_en: Kettlebell Standing Bottoms Up One Arm Shoulder Press
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the kettlebell in one hand with the bottom side up, your arm open wide, and your elbow making an angle with your torso. Raise the kettlebell by extending your arm overhead. As your arm becomes straight, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand up straight holding a kettlebell in one hand, touch a wall for balance if necessary Lift your heels off the ground and rise up on your toes Hold the position for a second Slowly lower your heels back to the ground Repeat for your desired number of reps before switching hands

Hold the kettlebell in both hands at waist level Rise up onto your toes, lifting your body using your calves Hold this position for a second Lower your heels back down to the ground Repeat for desired amount of reps

Stand starting with your arms straight, and a kettlebell in each hand Bend the elbows, bringing the kettlebells toward your shoulders Pause for a moment at the top of the curl Lowly lowering the kettlebells back down to the starting position Repeat for the desired amount of reps

name_en: Kettlebell Standing One Arm Curl Over Incline Bench
description_en: Stand straight with a kettlebell in one hand by your side. Slowly curl the kettlebell up, keeping your elbow stationary. Hold the lift at the top of the curl for a second. Slowly lower the kettlebell back down. Repeat with the other arm.

Stand straight holding a kettlebell in one hand with your arm extended fully downwards Slowly bend your elbow and raise the kettlebell behind your head Pause briefly, then slowly straighten your arm back to the initial position Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions Switch hands, and perform the same number of repetitions with the other arm

Stand up straight with a kettlebell in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your torso. Keep your elbows close to your torso at all times. Curl the weights while contracting your biceps, keep the forearms stationary. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the kettlebells are at shoulder level. Slowly begin to bring the kettlebells back to starting position as your breathe in.

Stand tall, feet shoulder-width apart, holding the kettlebell in front of your body with both hands While keeping your core engaged, move the kettlebell around your body in a circular motion Complete the desired number of rotations in one direction before switching to the other Keep your movements controlled and smooth throughout the exercise Remember to keep your chest up and shoulders back

Hold a kettlebell in each hand hang at arm's length at your sides, palms facing each other Stand in front of a bench. Place your left foot on the bench and push your body up until your left leg is straight Slowly lower your body back to the starting position Repeat the same motion with your right leg Alternate legs until you complete your set

Stand with your feet hip-width apart with a kettlebell positioned between your feet Bend at your hips and keep your back straight, reach down and grab the kettlebell Keeping your legs relatively straight, pull up to a standing position using your glutes and hamstrings Lower the kettlebell back down in a controlled fashion back to its starting position Repeat the movement

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a kettlebell near your shoulder by folding your arm with its palm facing inwards. Raise your arm overhead by rotating your arm to bring its palm forward and tilting your torso slightly towards the other side. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand straight with the kettlebell in your right hand at shoulder level. Press the kettlebell overhead until your arm is fully extended. Pause briefly at the top, then lower the kettlebell back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the left hand and perform the same steps. Remember to keep your core braced throughout the exercise.

Stand upright with a kettlebell in each hand, arms fully extended, and feet hip-width apart Bend your hips and knees to lower the kettlebells towards the ground, keeping your back straight and your chest up Stop when the kettlebells are just below your knees Push your hips forward and straighten your knees to return to the starting position Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight, arms by your side, and feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your hips while bending your knees and hold a kettlebell in your hand just outside your knee. Raise your hips and get into an upright position, and repeat.

Stand tall while holding a kettlebell in one hand at your side, similar to how you'd carry a suitcase Engage your core and keep your spine straight Hold the weight for the desired amount of time Switch the kettlebell to the other hand and repeat Rest and repeat for the desired number of sets

Stand tall with your feet open wide and lean forward to grab a kettlebell with an overhand grip while bending your knees. Raise the kettlebell by straightening your knees and leaning back into a standing position. Return to the starting position slowly and repeat.

Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and the kettlebell between your legs Bend at your hips and knees, grip the kettlebell with both hands Without rounding your lower back, stand up with the kettlebell Lower the kettlebell back to the starting position, keeping your chest up and back straight Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift with High Pull
description_en: Stand tall with your feet open wide and lean forward to grab kettlebells with an overhand grip while bending your knees. Raise the kettlebell by straightening your knees and leaning back into a standing position. As you stand tall, raise the kettlebells to your shoulder level by folding your arms and opening your elbows wide. Return to the starting position slowly and repeat.

name_en: Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift with High Pull
description_en: Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and a kettlebell between them Bend your knees and hips to lower your body and grasp the kettlebell Pull the kettlebell up to shoulder height, keeping your elbows above the level of your hands Lower the kettlebell back down in a controlled manner Repeat for the prescribed number of repetitions

Stand tall with your feet open wide and lean forward to grab a kettlebell with an overhand grip while bending your knees. Raise the kettlebell by straightening your knees and leaning back into a standing position. As you stand tall, raise the kettlebell to your chest by folding your arms and opening your elbows wide. Return to the starting position slowly and repeat.

Start with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing outwards, and a kettlebell on the ground between your legs Bend at your hips while keeping your back straight, and grip the kettlebell with both hands Straighten up while pulling the kettlebell up towards your chin - your elbows should aim to reach higher than your shoulders Hold the kettlebell at peak for a moment, then lower it back in a controlled fashion to the starting position Repeat the movements for your set number of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight, feet wider than shoulder-width, and hold the kettlebell in your hands against your chest. Bend your knees and lower down unless your thighs are parallel to the floor. Hold momentarily, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes turned out. Hold the kettlebell with both hands in front of you, arms fully extended. Lower your body into a squat position, keeping your back straight and chest lifted. Push through your heels to raise your body back to standing, squeezing your glutes at the top. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointed outwards and a kettlebell in front of you Bend your knees and lower your body into a deep squat, grabbing the kettlebell with both hands Push through your heels and straighten your legs to stand up, lifting the kettlebell off the ground Lower your body back into a squat, lowering the kettlebell back to the floor Repeat this movement for your desired number of reps

Stand on a step box, feet wider than shoulder-width apart, holding the kettlebell between your legs. Initiate the squat by pushing your hips back and bending at the knees. Squat until your thighs are parallel to the ground. Forcefully push through your heels to stand back up to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Stand tall on the step box with your back straight, feet wider than shoulder-width, and hold the kettlebell near your thighs. Lower the kettlebell by bending your knees and lowering your hips unless your thighs are parallel to the floor. Hold momentarily, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall while holding a kettlebell in front of you with straight arms Bend your knees slightly and push your hips back to start the swing Push your hips forward and swing the kettlebell up to shoulder height Let the kettlebell swing back down between your legs while you push your hips back Repeat the process

Stand up straight, holding the kettlebell in front of you with both hands Slightly bend your knees, hinge at the hips and swing the kettlebell back between your legs Forcefully push your hips forward and swing the kettlebell up to chest level Let the kettlebell swing back down between your legs, repeating the hip hinge Keep this swinging motion going, using your hip thrust to move the kettlebell

Stand tall with a wide base and hold a kettlebell in your hands with your palms facing backward. Lean forward by bending your knees, taking your hips back, and lowering the kettlebell between your legs. Swing your arms forward to shoulder height while getting into an upright position.

Stand tall with a wide base and hold a kettlebell between your palms. Lean forward by bending your knees, taking your hips back, and lowering the kettlebell between your legs. Swing your arms forward to shoulder height while getting into an upright position.

name_en: Kettlebell Swing Clean grip Front Squat
description_en: Start by standing with feet hip-width apart, holding the kettlebell with both hands Swing the kettlebell upwards to chest height, rotating your grip so your palms are under the kettlebell and elbows tucked in Lower into a squat, keeping your chest up and your back straight Push back up to standing position, driving through your heels Lower the kettlebell in a controlled swing back between your legs and repeat

name_en: Kettlebell Swing Clean grip Front Squat Overhead Press
description_en: Hold the kettlebell with a clean grip Swing the kettlebell between your legs and squat down Stand up powerfully with the kettlebell and press it overhead Lower the kettlebell to your chest and repeat the movement

Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart with a kettlebell about a foot in front of you on the ground Bend at your hips and knees and grasp the kettlebell with both hands Explode up and swing the kettlebell up to chest level and move to a squat position Once in the squat position, extend back up, pushing through the heels, and go back to the kettlebell swing start position

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold kettlebells near your shoulders with your palms facing each other and lower your hips while bending your knees. Get into a standing position while turning your palms forward and extending your arms overhead. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Place a kettlebell in front of your feet. Bend your knees and squat down to pick up the kettlebell with both hands. Stand up and thrust the kettlebell above your head, extending your arms fully. Lower the kettlebell back to the starting position in a controlled fashion. Repeat this motion for your desired number of repetitions

Start by lying flat on the floor, holding a kettlebell in your right hand, arm extended above you Bend your right knee and move into a seated position, keeping the kettlebell overhead Now stand, maintaining an extended arm with the kettlebell over your head Reverse the motion by lowering yourself back into a seated position, then onto your back Repeat the exercise with your other arm

Position a kettlebell between your feet. Bend at the hips and knees to take hold of the kettlebell with both hands. Pull the kettlebell upward towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body and flipping the kettlebell over at the top of the movement. Lower the kettlebell to its starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions.

Stand up straight while holding two kettlebells in front of your shoulders, palms facing each other While keeping your core engaged, press the kettlebells upwards until your arms are straight overhead Slowly lower the kettlebells back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand with feet hip-width apart and bend forward at the waist Hold a kettlebell in each hand with palms facing each other Pull the kettlebells to your side, keeping them close to your body Lower the kettlebells in a controlled manner Repeat the movement for the recommended number of repetitions
Hold a kettlebell in one hand letting it hang at arm's length Stand tall with your shoulders pulled back Walk forward for 20-30 feet Switch the kettlebell to the other hand and walk back

Stand upright and hold a kettlebell in each hand with your palms facing inward. Slowly lift the kettlebells to your chest, keeping your elbows high and your forearms parallel with the ground. With a controlled motion, lower the kettlebells back to your sides. Repeat this motion while maintaining proper form and control.

Stand straight with feet hip-width apart, hold the kettlebell in front of your thighs with both hands. Pull the kettlebell upward to the front of the shoulders, leading with the elbows. Pause for a second at the top. Lower the kettlebell back down in a controlled motion. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Stand up straight holding a kettlebell with both hands at arm length in front of you Pull the kettlebell directly upward until it reaches your neck with elbows flaring out during the movement Hold for a second at the top Lower the kettlebell back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, hold the kettlebell in your right hand and extend your arm overhead Keeping your eyes on the kettlebell, lean to your left side and slide your left hand down your left leg Keep your right arm straight and touching the side of your head with the kettlebell overhead Move your torso to your left side until you feel a stretch in your right side Return to the standing position and repeat, then switch sides

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, hold the kettlebell in one hand and raise it overhead. Turn your feet at a 45-degree angle away from the kettlebell. Keep your eyes on the kettlebell as you push your hip out to the side and reach down with your free hand towards the ground. Return to upright position while keeping the kettlebell overhead. Complete reps on one side, then switch hands and repeat.

Sit down on a bench and hold a kettlebell in one hand with an underhand grip Rest your forearm on your thigh with your wrist just beyond the knee Use your forearm muscles to curl the kettlebell upward as far as possible Hold the peak position briefly and then slowly lower the weight back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions and then switch arms

Start by lying on the floor on your back, bend your knees Place your feet flat on the floor Lift your right leg and kick up towards the ceiling Lower your leg back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the kick with the left leg

Start by standing straight up with feet shoulder width apart. Bend your knees slightly while lifting your left leg backwards. Keep your left foot relaxed and your left knee at a 90-degree angle. Kick back with your left leg while maintaining the knee bend. Lower your left leg then switch to your right leg and repeat the process.

Stand straight with your hands at your sides Raise one leg up to a 90 degree angle while keeping the other firmly planted Hold this position briefly Lower the leg back down in a controlled fashion Switch legs and repeat for the desired number of reps

Start in a downward-facing dog position Bring your right knee forward and out to the right Keep your back leg extended and your front foot flexed Reach back with your left hand to grab your left foot Extend your chest and lift your gaze

Position your hands on the ground shoulder width apart and kick up into a handstand position Bend your elbows to lower your body towards the ground Push your body back up to the starting position using your shoulder and arm strength Use a kipping motion with your legs to aid in pushing your body back up Return to the starting position and prepare for the next rep

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Raise your right knee and left arm at the same time, so they are parallel to the floor Return them to the starting position Immediately raise your left knee and right arm in the same manner Continue to alternate sides for the duration of the exercise

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Raise your right knee towards your chest Lower your right knee while lifting your left knee to your chest, simulating a running motion Extend each leg fully before switching to the other Continue the exercise for one minute or more for better results

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Lift your left knee as high as possible while swinging your right arm forward Swiftly return your left leg to the ground and lift your right knee high, swinging your left arm forward Continue to alternate knees as quick as possible Maintain an upright posture throughout

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Lift your right foot off the floor and drive your knee towards your chest. Then kick your foot out in front of you until it is parallel with the floor Lower your right foot back to the floor and immediately repeat the motion with your left foot Repeat these steps for the desired number of repetitions Keep your abs engaged throughout the exercise to maintain balance

Sit on the floor with one leg extended in front of you and the other leg bent Lean forward from your hips and reach for your outstretched foot Hold this position for 15 to 30 seconds Switch legs and repeat the stretch

Stand tall, maintaining your balance Bend one knee to bring the heel towards the buttocks Hold the ankle of the lifted leg, pull gently towards the buttocks Hold for 15 to 30 seconds, then slowly lower the leg Repeat with the other leg

Stand up straight. Bend your knee and lift your right leg up to your chest. Grab hold of your knee with both hands and hold the squeeze. Repeat the same movement with your left leg. Continue alternating between legs.

Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart Lift your right knee to your chest Grasp your right knee with both hands and pull it closer to your chest Hold the stretch for a desired amount of seconds Repeat the stretch with your left knee

Lie flat on your back with your legs extended and hands behind your head Bend your knees and bring them toward your chest while lifting your head and shoulder blades off the floor Extend your legs back out to the starting position Ensure to keep your abs contracted during the movement Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Lie flat on your back with your legs fully extended Place your hands underneath your glutes While keeping your legs together, lift them straight up towards the ceiling until your buttocks lifts off the floor Slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position Repeat the motion without allowing your legs to touch the floor between reps

Kneel on all fours with your hands under your shoulders and knees under your hips Take a deep breath and as you exhale, draw your belly button up towards your spine Hold this position for a few seconds Slowly inhale and relax your abs, letting your belly drop down towards the floor Repeat the process

Start in a kneeling position with your hands placed on the ground, directly under your shoulders and your back straight. To initiate the exercise, take in a deep breath and then as you exhale, draw your belly button towards your spine. Hold this position while maintaining a controlled breathing rhythm. Release and go back to the starting position, then repeat.

Start in a four-position, with hands under shoulders and knees under hips Extend one leg out to the side, keeping the foot on the ground Slowly push your hips back until you feel a stretch in your inner thigh Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds Switch sides and repeat the process

Kneel on the ground with one leg in front and the other one behind you Gently shift your weight forward until you feel a stretch in your calf Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds Return to the starting position Repeat with the other leg

Start on your hands and knees with your spine in a neutral position Straighten and raise one leg behind you until it's in line with your body Lower the leg back down without touching the floor Repeat with the other leg

Start in a kneeling position with your palms on the floor beneath your shoulders. Extend your right leg straight backward, keeping your hips square to the floor. Bend your leg, bringing your heel towards your buttocks, before extending it backwards again. Repeat the movement with your leg remaining off the floor for the desired number of reps. After completion, switch to your left leg and repeat.

Kneel on the floor and sit back on your heels. Keep your back straight and extend your arms out straight in front of you. Rotate your torso to one side and then back to the center. Repeat on the other side. Perform the required number of repetitions.

Begin by kneeling on all fours, your knees directly under your hips, your hands directly under your shoulders. Slowly sit back onto your heels while keeping your hands in place. Reach one arm under your body, keeping it straight. Keep your hips square to the ground and rotate your upper body to stretch. Hold this pose for a while, then repeat on the other side.

Kneel on the floor with your back straight Keep your feet flat against the floor behind you Rotate your torso to one side Hold the stretch for a moment Return to the start position and repeat on the other side

Kneel down on the floor on your hands and knees With your hand behind your head, rotate your upper body towards the upward side Hold for 15 to 30 seconds, then return to the starting position Repeat the same procedure on the other side

Start in a kneeling position on a soft surface Keep your back flat and core braced Slowly circle your hips clockwise, using your quadriceps and hamstrings to control the movement Repeat the same circle counter-clockwise Perform the desired number of repetitions

Start in a kneeling position on the floor, your body should form a straight line from your knees to your head Extend your arms fully and rotate your body as if you're aiming for the '12 oclock' position Lower your body towards the floor until your chest nearly touches it Push back up to the starting position while rotating to the '3 oclock' position Lower yourself back to the floor, then push back up while rotating to the '9 oclock' position

Start in a kneeling position, with your forearms and palms flat on the ground Push your upper body upwards, arching your back and looking towards the ceiling Lower your body back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions Avoid rushing through the exercise to maintain proper form

Start in a plank position, with your hands under your shoulders and your legs extended behind you Lower your body towards the ground while keeping your elbows close to your body Push up through your chest and extend your body into a cobra stretch Hold for a moment, then return to the push-up position Repeat for desired number of repetitions

Start in a kneeling position with your hands on the ground directly under your shoulders Move back into the plank position by straightening your arms and legs Hold the plank position for a short while Return to the kneeling position in a controlled manner Repeat the procedure for the desired number of reps

Start in a kneeling position with your hands on the ground, shoulder-width apart. Engage your core as you shift your body weight forward, extending your body into a plank position. Hold the plank position briefly, then shift your weight back to the original kneeling position. Repeat the shift from kneeling to plank and back again for your desired number of repetitions

name_en: Kneeling Elbow to Knee Side Plank Crunch
description_en: Start in a side plank position on your knees with your right hand directly under your right shoulder Extend your left arm towards the ceiling Bring your left knee and elbow together to perform a crunch Extend back to the original position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the opposite side

Start in a kneeling position, hinging at the hips and placing your fingers on the ground in front of you Press down on your fingertips, lifting your palm and wrists off the ground Hold for a few seconds and then lower your palms and wrists back down Repeat for as many repetitions as recommended Ensure to engage your forearms during the exercise

Start in a kneeling position, with the palms of your hands on the floor Bend your fingers slightly and press down into the floor Hold this position, then release and resume the normal position Repeat the finger pulses for as many as prescribed Ensure to keep your shoulders relaxed during the exercise
Start by kneeling on the floor Place your fingers on the floor, palms up Lower your body towards the floor, bending at the elbows Push your body back up by straightening your arms

Kneel on a mat or soft surface, and place your fists shoulder width apart Lower your upper body towards the floor, keeping your back straight and chin tucked in Push up with your fists until your arms are fully extended Pause slightly at the top then lower yourself back down in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Begin the exercise by kneeling on the floor Bend at the waist, extending your arms out in front of you Make fists with both hands and rotate them clockwise and then counterclockwise Maintain the movement for 10 to 15 seconds Relax and repeat the motion

Begin in a kneeling position, with your fists placed on the ground While keeping your forearms stable, rotate one fist to an open palm Return your palm to a fist Repeat this motion with the other hand Alternate this exercise for the desired reps and sets

Start in a kneeling position with your knees hip-width apart and your hands on your hips Push your hips forward and make a circle with your hips Switch directions and make another circle with your hips Repeat this action for the desired number of repetitions Ensure your movements are slow and controlled

Start by kneeling on the ground with your palms flat on the floor, fingers pointing forward. Push forward by moving your forearms forward without lifting your palms or fingers from the ground. Return to the starting position and repeat the motion for desired repetitions.

Start in a kneeling position on your hands and knees Keep your back straight and your hips parallel to the floor Bend one leg at a knee and push that foot upward towards the sky Lower the leg back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the movement with the other leg

Start by kneeling on the floor Step the right foot forward so you are in a lunge position with the right knee over the right ankle Place both hands on the right thigh for support Lean forward slightly and push the hips forward until you feel a stretch in the front of the left thigh Hold for a few seconds, then switch to the other leg

Begin by kneeling on the floor with one knee bent and your other leg behind you Keep your back straight and gently push your hips forward Hold this position for about 30 seconds and then switch legs Repeat for a total of three sets on each side Remember not to excessively arch or round your back during the stretch

Stand tall with a straight back and take a step forward. Lower your rear knee on the ground while keeping your front foot in place. Place your hands over your front knee and glide forward while bending your front knee to a 90-degree angle. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Start by kneeling on the ground Bring your right foot forward so that you are in a lunge position with your right knee at a 90-degree angle Slowly push your hips forward until you feel a stretch in your left hip Hold for 30 seconds and then switch sides Repeat this exercise for each side 2-3 times

Start in a kneeling position Lean forward, extending your hips Press your hips forward and squeeze your glutes at the top Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position Repeat for desired amount of repetitions

Begin in a kneeling position with your knees hip-width apart Sit your hips back towards your heels Drive your hips forward, engaging your glutes and hamstrings At the peak motion, squeeze your glutes then return to the starting position Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions

Start in a kneeling position with your back straight and Heads up.  Place your hands on your hips or stretch them out for balance. Using your strength, stand up from the kneeling position one foot at a time. Lower yourself back to the kneeling position and repeat. Switch your lead foot each time you stand up.

Begin in a half-kneeling position, with one knee on the floor and the other foot in front Push your hips forward and keep your back straight Hold this stretch for 15-30 seconds Repeat with the opposite leg Do this exercise for several repetitions

Start by kneeling in front of an incline bench Place your palms on the bench with fingers facing towards you Lower your body towards the bench, bending at the elbows Press back to the starting position using your forearms

Start by getting down on your knees and placing your fists (knuckles down) on the floor shoulder width apart Begin to lower your body while keeping your elbows close to your body Push your body up until your arms are fully extended Repeat the motion for the desired number of reps Remember to keep your body straight throughout the exercise

Get down on all four with a straight back, hands under the shoulders, and knees under the hips. Place your right hand a little ahead of the other and turn the palm side up of your left hand. Slide your left hand forward on the floor while lowering your chest by bending your right arm. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Start by kneeling on the floor Reach your hands out in front of you and lower your chest towards the floor Push your hips back as you continue to reach your hands forward Hold this position for the desired amount of time Slowly return to the starting position

Start in a kneeling position on the floor with your knees hip-width apart. Extend your arms in front of you and lower your chest towards the floor, keeping your hips over your knees. Hold the stretch position for about 20-30 seconds and feel it in your lats and back. Slowly return to the starting position. Repeat the exercise 2-3 times.

Kneel on a mat with your right knee and extend your left leg out to the side Keep your abs engaged and your back straight Rotate your left leg in a circle, keeping the motion controlled Repeat the circle motion for the desired number of repetitions Switch sides and repeat the exercise with your right leg

Place your right knee on the knee rest of the kneeling leg curl machine and hold the bar by leaning forward. Keep your right leg straight and set the roller bar against your calf. Push the roller bar towards your hip by folding your leg. As the roller reach near the hip, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Start by kneeling on the floor with your knees hip-width apart, hands resting on your hips Keeping your torso still, rotate one leg out to the side Hold this position for a second Rotate your leg back to the initial position Repeat on the other side

Start in a tabletop position with your hands under your shoulders and knees under your hips Extend your right leg behind you and then bring it out to the right side, making a half-circle Bring the right leg back behind you, completing the half-circle Repeat with the left leg Continue to alternate between legs

Start on your hands and knees with your hands directly beneath your shoulders and your knees under your hips Raise one leg out to the side, keeping it bent at 90 degrees Move the raised leg in a semi-circle behind you and then return it to the starting position Repeat for the desired amount of reps and then switch legs Ensure your back remains straight and flat throughout the movement

name_en: Kneeling Leg Half Circle on bench
description_en: Start by kneeling on a bench, hands placed firmly for support Extend one leg straight out from your body Move your extended leg in a half circle motion, keeping your core engaged Bring your leg back into starting position Repeat with the opposite leg

Start by coming into a four-point kneeling position on your mat From here, extend one leg straight behind you while you keep your hips in a square towards the floor Lift and lower this leg without arching your back or shifting your bodyweight Hold your core tight and keep your torso stable After your set, switch legs. If specified, repeat for the number of reps

Start in a kneeling position, hands shoulder-width apart, butt raised and core tight. Lower your body down and forward, so your nose is almost touching the ground. Push up and back to return to the starting position, keeping your belly button drawn in so you feel your abs engage. Pause at the top for a second and then repeat the exercise.

Start by kneeling on the floor with your hands resting on your thighs Tilt your head to one side, bringing your ear closer to your shoulder Hold this position for 15-20 seconds Slowly return your head to the initial position, then tilt it to the other side Repeat the stretch for the other side

name_en: Kneeling One Side Archer Push up
description_en: Kneel on the floor and put your hands on the ground, positioning one hand close to your chest and the other extended sideways Bend your elbows to lower your chest towards the floor Push back up to the original position while keeping your core engaged Repeat the exercise before switching to the other side

Start in a kneeling position with your hands directly under your shoulders Engage your core and extend your legs behind you, keeping your knees on the floor Keep your body in a straight line from your head to your knees Hold this position for a given time Rest and repeat as per your workout routine

Start in a kneeling position with your hands placed below your shoulders Extend one leg back and then the other to bring your body into a straight line from your head to your heels Engage your core and hold this position Make sure your shoulders, hips and knees are in a straight line Return to your kneeling position slowly and steadily

Begin in a kneeling position with your knees hip-width apart and your hands at your sides Lower your body back, keeping your back straight Push back up to the original position Immediately lower back again, creating a 'pulsing' motion Repeat the process for desired number of repetitions

Start in a high kneeling position Lean forward slightly and contract your glutes Pulse up and down in small movements while maintaining the glute contraction Continue this motion for the desired number of reps Switch to the other side and repeat

Kneel on the floor and place your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart on the ground Lower your body until your chest is almost touching the floor Push your body back up to the original position Repeat the motion

name_en: Kneeling Push up to Child Pose
description_en: Start in a kneel-down position with hands shoulder-width apart in a push-up stance Lower yourself as in a regular push-up but keep your knees on the ground Push up back to the starting position From that position, sit back onto your heels pulling your hands towards your feet Return to the start position for the next repetition
Begin in a kneeling position Slowly lean back and reach your hands toward your ankles Hold the position for 15-30 seconds Release and repeat the exercise for your desired number of repetitions

Start on your knees in a kneeling position, palms facing up and fingers pointing back towards knees Place the hands flat against the floor with slight pressure Keep your arms straight and, using only your wrists, lift the back of your hands towards your forearms Return your hands to the starting position

Start in the high plank position, drop down to your knees. Shift your weight onto your left hand and the outside of your left foot then twist to the right as you raise your left arm towards the sky Slowly return to the starting position and repeat on the other side Continue to alternate between sides for the specified amount of reps Remember to keep your body straight and core tight throughout the exercise

name_en: Kneeling Rotation Torso Alternate Row to Thread Through
description_en: Start by kneeling, sitting back onto your heels Rotate your upper body to one side and mimic a rowing movement Thread arm through the opposite armpit, twisting your upper body Return to the starting position Repeat on the other side

Start in a lunge position, with your left knee on the ground and your right foot on the floor in front of you. Gently lean forward, keeping your back straight, until you feel a stretch in your left hip and thigh. Hold the stretch for at least 15 to 30 seconds. Relax and switch legs to stretch the other side. Repeat this stretch 2-3 times per side.

Begin in a high plank position, but on your knees Maintaining a stable torso, lift your left hand to tap your right shoulder Return left hand to the ground Now, lift your right hand to tap your left shoulder Return right hand to the ground, repeat the same with alternative hands

Start in a high plank position, placing your knees on the ground Keep your core tight and your hips stable Lift your right hand and tap your left shoulder Return your hand to the starting position Repeat the movement with the other hand

Start in a high plank position with your knees on the floor Bend your elbows and lower your chest to the floor Push your body back up to the starting position While keeping your hips steady, lift your right hand and tap your left shoulder Repeat the movements with your left hand tapping your right shoulder

Begin in a kneeling position on the mat with your hands shoulder-width apart Lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping your body straight Press your palms firmly into the ground, pushing your body back up Touch your left shoulder with your right hand, then return hand to the ground Touch your right shoulder with your left hand, then return hand to the ground

Start by kneeling on a yoga mat or comfortable surface, then place your right hand on the mat to support your weight Raise your left leg to hip level while keeping it straight Perform a complete circle with your left leg Repeat the exercise with both legs Perform multiple repetitions until your muscles start to fatigue

Start by getting into a kneeling position on a comfortable surface. Lift your right leg to the side, keeping it in line with your body. Extend your right leg forward until it's fully straight. Return your right leg to the side and then back down to the starting position. Repeat the movement with your left leg.
