Begin in a kneeling position with your hands under your shoulders Lift your left knee off the ground and extend your left leg out to the side at hip height Bend your knee and bring it in towards your body, then extend it back out in a 'kick' Lower your knee back to the starting position Repeat on the other side

Begin in a kneeling position, leaning to one side with the weight on one hand and the same knee. Raise the free arm towards the ceiling, your body forming a straight line from your hand to your knee. Rotate your upper body from the waist to bring your free arm under your body, keeping it extended. Return to the start position and repeat the movement for the desired number of reps. Switch sides and repeat the exercise with the other arm and knee.

Start in a kneeling position on a soft surface Engage your hamstrings and glutes to lift one leg back, pulling your foot towards your buttocks Hold for a moment before slowly extending it back down Ensure that your movements are controlled, not jerky Switch legs and repeat for desired reps

Start by kneeling on all fours with your knees hip-width apart and your hands directly under your shoulders on the floor. Tighten your core and lift one leg off the floor, bending at the knee so your leg forms a 90-degree angle. Kick back and push your heel towards the ceiling until your thigh is parallel to the floor. Hold for a second, then return to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching to the other leg.

Start on all fours with your knees directly below your hips, and your hands directly below your shoulders. With your right knee bent at 90 degrees, lift it out to the side as high as you can, mimicking a dog at a fire hydrant. Lower the leg back to the starting position. Next, extend your right leg straight back and up towards the ceiling. Lower your leg back to the starting position and repeat on the left side.

Start on your hands and knees on a comfortable surface Raise one knee off the ground and extend it straight behind you Bend the knee and bring it out to your side, like a dog at a fire hydrant Bring your knee back to the starting position Repeat on the other leg

Kneel on the floor or exercise mat, ensuring your knees are under your hips and your hands are under your shoulders Lift up one leg, keeping your knee at a 90-degree angle Slowly push your foot towards the ceiling until your leg is in line with your body Hold your leg and foot in this position for a second or two Slowly lower your leg back down to the starting position

Start in a kneeling position with your back straight, thighs perpendicular to the floor, and your arms at your sides. Extend your arms behind your back, take your hips backward, and then swing your arms forward to propel your body up. During this motion, quickly pull your legs and feet underneath you and land on your feet forming a squat position.

Start by kneeling on the floor. Your one hand should be slightly in front of the other Lower your body towards the floor while keeping your elbows close to your sides Gently touch your chest to the ground Push your body back up to the starting position Repeat the exercise for your desired amount of repetitions

Start in a kneeling position, gripping the wheel handles with each hand Keep your back flat and your abs engaged Slowly roll the wheel out in front of you, extending your body into a straight line Pause, then pull the wheel back towards your knees, returning to the starting position Continue for your desired number of repetitions

Kneel on the ground with your hands under your shoulders and knees under your hips Extend your right leg straight out to the side Keeping your leg straight, slowly draw large circles in the air with your lifted leg Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions Switch legs and repeat

Start in a hands-and-knees position, with your wrists under your shoulders and knees under your hips Hold your core tight and maintain a flat back Extend one leg out straight behind you, flexing your foot Lift the leg up until it is in line with your body, hold for a moment Lower the leg back to the initial position, with control

Kneel on the ground with hands placed flat and shoulder width apart. Keep your right knee bent and foot flat on the ground. Extend your left leg straight behind you and slightly off to the side. Contract your glutes and lift the left leg as high as you can. Slowly lower your leg back to the starting position.

Kneel on your hands and knees. Keep your arms straight and directly below your shoulders. Lift your right leg, keeping it straight and kick to the side. Slowly bring your leg back down to the initial position. Repeat the movement with the other leg. Continue to do this, alternating between right and left side.

Start by getting onto your hands and knees. Your hands should be directly under your shoulders, and your knees directly under your hips Rotate one hand behind your head. Keep the other hand on the floor for stability Keeping your hips still and your elbow bent, rotate your upper chest and head to face upwards Lower your body back to the starting position in a slow and controlled movement Repeat this motion on the other side

Start in a kneeling position on the floor Extend one leg out in front of you with the heel grounded and toes pointing up Lean forward at the hips, keeping your back straight, until you feel a stretch in the back of your extended leg Hold for 15-30 seconds Switch legs and repeat

Start in a hands-and-knees position with a neutral spine Keep your knees under your hips and hands under your shoulders Take one hand and place it behind your head with your elbow pointing out to the side Rotate your chest and elbow up towards the ceiling Return to start position and switch sides

Start in a kneeling position, sit back on your heels, and stretch your arms out in front of you Keeping your hands on the ground, pull your right hand underneath your left, reaching as far as comfortable Rotate your upper body to the right, opening your chest and raising your right arm to the sky Hold for 1020 seconds, then switch sides Repeat this movement for 10 reps on each side

Get down on all four with a straight back while keeping your hands under the shoulders, and knees under the hips. Turn your forearms inwards and place your hands with fingers pointing towards the knees. Take your hips backward while putting a stretch on your wrists. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Start by getting on your knees, placing your palms flat on the floor Make sure your shoulders are directly above your wrists Push your body weight down into your palms and press into the floor Bring your palms up off the floor, weight into your fingertips Repeat the process for as many reps and sets as you can comfortably manage

Start in a kneeling position and place your hands underneath your shoulders. Lower your chest by bending your elbows, keep your spine straight. Push back up until arms are fully extended. Now, move your body backward while bending knees, until your buttocks touch your heels. Move forward returning to starting position.

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Raise your right knee until it is at hip level Lower it back to start position in a controlled fashion Repeat the movement with your left knee Continue alternating knees for the desired number of reps

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Lift your right knee to chest level Hold for a few seconds then slowly lower your leg back to starting position Repeat with your left knee Keep alternating for the desired reps

Begin by standing straight with feet hip-width apart Raise your knees up and out, opening your legs wider than hip-width as you hop off the ground Bring your legs back together and land softly on the balls of your feet Alternate between raising each knee during each hop Repeat for the desired number of repetitions or time

Stand upright with feet hip-width apart Raise one leg to the side while throwing a punch with the opposite arm Bring the foot back to the ground in a controlled manner Repeat this for the other side Continue to alternate between sides for a set number of reps

Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart and clasp your hands together Wind up and pivot on your foot, then jab to the side while raising your knee Repeat on the other side Maintain a brisk pace for the preset time duration Be sure to switch sides after each repetition

Start with your feet hip-width apart, arms at your sides Simultaneously raise your right knee and your left arm to meet in the middle of your body Quickly switch and raise your left knee and right arm Continue this motion, alternating sides, akin to running in place Accelerate the pace to increase the heart rate

Start off standing with your feet hip-width apart, toes forward Raise your right knee up to hip height as you engage your abs and crunch your shoulder towards your knee Lower your right foot as you simultaneously lift your left knee to hip height Perform the sequence as quickly as you can alternating knees Keep up this motion for the desired number of reps or length of time

Stand straight with feet shoulder width apart Raise your right knee towards your left elbow while simultaneously punching with your left hand across your body Switch and do the same with your left knee and right hand Continue alternating for the duration of your set Remember to use your waist to twist and not your shoulders

name_en: Knees In and Out on a Chair
description_en: Sit at the edge of a sturdy chair Keep your hands holding the edges of the seat for support Extend your legs in front of you while keeping them together Pull your knees in towards your chest and then extend them back out

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise one knee towards your chest as high as possible Lower your knee back to the starting position Repeat the movement with the opposite leg Continue alternating legs for your desired number of reps

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Raise your knee as high as it can go and then lower it back down Alternate between your left and right knee Make the movement as swift as possible for the best results Maintain an upright posture throughout the exercise

Start in a high plank position, hands shoulder-width apart, body straight from heel to head Pull your right knee towards your chest as swiftly as you can Touch the floor with your right foot, then quickly return it to the starting position Repeat on the left side, alternating legs for each rep

Begin by lying flat on a mat with your legs extended in front of you Slowly bring one knee toward your chest while keeping the other leg straight Hold onto your raised knee with both hands and pull gently towards your chest Hold this position for 20-30 seconds Release and switch legs
Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Raise one of your knees towards the chest and grab it with your hands to produce a stretch. Maintain this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

name_en: Knee To Elbow Touch Front Plank
description_en: Get into a high plank position Bring your left knee to your right elbow Return to your plank position Bring your right knee to your left elbow Return to your plank position and repeat

Lie on your back on the floor with your knees bent. Place your hands lightly on the sides of your head. Crunch up and bring your right elbow towards your left knee, while pulling your knee towards your elbow. Lower your body and repeat on the other side, bringing your left elbow to your right knee. Repeat this back and forth motion, alternating sides, in a controlled rhythm.

Lie flat on your back on a mat with your legs bent and feet flat on the ground. Place your hands by the side of your head. Perform a crunch motion bringing your head and shoulders off the ground. At the highest point, touch your right elbow to your left knee, then lower back to start position. Repeat on the other side, bringing your left elbow to your right knee.
Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Bend your knees slightly and then jump up While in air tuck your knees into your chest Land softly on the balls of your feet and immediately jump again

Start in a sitting position with your knees bent and feet off the floor Lean back slightly with your torso Twist your torso and bring your knees towards your chest, one side at a time Repeat the movement on the other side Continue alternating sides for the duration of your set

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the bar over one shoulder. Rotate your torso to swing the bar over the other shoulder. Repeat this back and forth motion for a set number of reps. Make sure to rotate your entire body while you switch sides, not just your arms. Keep your abs engaged during the entire movement.

Stand over the barbell attached to the leverage machine, with your feet shoulder-width apart Grab the bar with both hands and lift it to the chest level Rotate your torso to the left, then all the way to the right Move fluidly and swiftly, making sure the movement is led by your waist Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching sides

name_en: Landmine Bent over Row with V-bar
description_en: Stand over the barbell such that one end is secured on the ground. Attach a V-bar handle to the other end Bend at your hips and keep your back slightly arched. Hold the V-bar with both hands Pull the bar towards your upper waist by squeezing your back muscles Pause for a moment, then slowly let the bar return to the starting position Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight and feet together. Hold one end of a landmine bar while keeping your elbow bent at your side. Raise the landmine by extending our arm overhead. As your arm becomes entirely straight, return to the initial position, and repeat.

name_en: Landmine Floor One Arm Chest Fly
description_en: Lay down on the floor, perpendicular to the landmine bar with your feet flat on the ground. Reach up and grip the bar in your right hand with a neutral grip. With your arm fully extended, slowly lower the bar towards the ground. Stop when your arm is parallel to the ground. Pull the bar back to the starting position and repeat the motion with your left arm.

Stand in front of the barbell, so it's in your hip crease. Grab the barbell and raise it to your collarbone level. Lower your body into a deep squat, pushing your hips back and bending your knees. Push through your feet to stand back up straight, lifting the barbell as you do. Lower the barbell back to your hip crease.

name_en: Landmine Kneeling One Arm Shoulder Press
description_en: Kneel down next to the landmine setup and grasp the end of the bar with one hand. Press the bar up and away, fully extending your arm. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position. Repeat the movement with your other arm. Switch back and forth for the desired amount of reps.

Kneel with one end of the barbell placed securely in a landmine attachment Grip the other end of the bar with both hands, elbows bent at 90 degrees Extend your arms, pushing the barbell up and out Flex your pecs as though you're trying to squeeze something between your chest Return to starting position in a controlled manner

Start on your knees in front of the landmine post with the bar held at the chest Push through your knees to stand while simultaneously pressing the bar overhead Lower yourself back down to your knees while gradually lowering the bar to chest level Make sure movement is fluid, not jerky and controlled at all times Repeat for the desired amount of reps

Start by holding the end of a barbell, which is anchored into a landmine or corner Stand upright, with your left side facing the landmine, and hold the barbell with your right hand Raise the barbell until your arm is parallel with the floor Lower the barbell under control to the starting position Swap sides and repeat

name_en: Landmine One Arm Bent Over Row
description_en: Stand perpendicular to the barbell with a hip-width stance Bend at the hips and grasp the barbell with one hand Pull the barbell towards your waist until your elbow is above your back Lower the barbell back to the original position Repeat for the desired amount of reps before switching arms

name_en: Landmine One Arm Bent Over Row
description_en: Stand at the end of the barbell with your feet shoulder-width apart Bend at the hips and pick up the end of the barbell with one hand Pull the barbell up to your waist, keeping your back straight Lower the barbell back down in a controlled fashion Switch to your other hand and repeat

name_en: Landmine One Leg Stiff Leg Deadlift
description_en: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and a barbell at your right foot Hinge at your hips and extend your right leg back as you lower your upper body and reach for the barbell Grab the barbell and pull it up until your body is almost upright Pause at the top, then lower the barbell back down Repeat the exercise on your other leg

Position yourself in a staggered stance, with one foot forward and the other behind, holding the barbell at chest level Raise the barbell overhead, keeping your arms extended and upper body upright Move your back leg forward to perform a lunge, bending both knees at a 90-degree angle Push through your front heel to stand back up, lowering the barbell back to chest level Repeat the movement with the other leg

Stand perpendicular to the landmine with the bar at shoulder height in one hand Engage your core and press the bar directly above your shoulder Pause for a second with your arm fully extended Lower the bar back to the starting position in a controlled motion Repeat for the desired number of reps before switching sides

Stand facing the barbell, both hands placed on its end Lower your body towards the barbell, keeping a rigid torso Push your body away from the barbell to return to the start position Repeat for desired number of reps Don't let your hips sag at any time during the exercise

Place the one end of barbell in a landmine, and hold the other end with both hands Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Step one foot back into a lunge position, while bending the front knee about 90 degrees Press through your front heel to return to starting position Repeat this with the opposite leg

Stand at the landmine with your right shoulder facing the end of the bar. Feet should be hip width apart. Grab the barbell with your right hand and raise it to your shoulder level. Take a step back with your right foot and lunge, keeping your left knee stacked directly above your left ankle while lowering the bar until your right knee nearly touches the ground. Drive through your left heel to return to standing, bringing your right foot forward to meet your left. Switch sides. Repeat according to your training plan.

Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding the landmine bar at front of hips with both hands Hinge at the hips, lowering the end of the bar towards the floor Maintain a slight bend in the knees Return to standing position by thrusting hips forward and pulling the bar up Keep your abs tight and back flat throughout the movement

Stand facing the landmine with your feet shoulder width apart Take a hold of the end of the bar with both hands and stand erect Push your hips back and bend forward until your back is almost parallel to the floor Contract your glutes to push your hips forward and return to the standing position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand on a straight line over a landmine with feet hip-width apart, grasping the end of the barbell Bending at the hips, lower your body and the barbell towards the ground while keeping your back straight Bring the barbell back up to the starting position using the hips and glutes Squeeze the glutes at the top before repeating the move

Stand tall with your feet wider than your shoulders width Grab the barbell with straight arms through your legs by leaning forward and bending your knees slightly Raise the barbell towards your chest by folding your arms and taking your elbows past your back Return to the initial position and repeat

Sit on a bench with the landmine setup in front of you Hold the end of the bar with both hands at shoulder level Press the bar up above your head until your arms are fully extended Pause for a moment, then slowly bring the bar back to the starting position

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, and place one end of the bar in a landmine base Grab the other end of the bar with both hands at shoulder level, fingers facing towards each other Push the bar above your head until your arms are fully extended Bring the bar down onto the opposing shoulder Push the bar above your head again, before returning to the initial shoulder

Stand perpendicular to the landmine and grasp the barbell with your outer hand Raise your arm so it's parallel with your shoulder Pull the barbell across your chest in a horizontal arc Return to the starting position by lowering your arm

Stand next to the end of a barbell that is secured at the other end (using a landmine attachment or wedge it in a corner) Hold the end of the barbell with one hand at shoulder level Press the barbell straight up until your arm is fully extended Lower the barbell back to shoulder level in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise with the other arm

name_en: Landmine Single Arm Side Low Fly
description_en: Stand beside the end of the barbell, your feet slightly wider than hip-width apart Hold the end of the barbell with the hand closer to it Bend your knees slightly and lean forward, keeping your back straight Pull the barbell up and across your body, extending your arm toward the opposite shoulder Return the barbell to the starting position in a controlled manner

Position yourself in front of the loaded landmine bar with one foot firmly planted in front of it Bend the knee of your standing leg and lower your body towards the floor, while keeping your other leg straight and elevated Push through the heel of your standing leg and thrust your hips forward, returning to the standing position Squeeze your glutes at the top of the movement Switch legs and repeat

Stand perpendicular to the end of the barbell resting on the landmine attachment. With your feet shoulder-width apart, bend at your hips and knees and pick up the bar. Hold the end of the bar with both hands extending your arm. Raise your body while extending one leg behind you until it forms a straight line with your torso. Return to the starting position by lowering the barbell while you simultaneously lower your extended leg.

Place load on one end of a landmine and stand with the loaded end near one foot. Slightly bend the knee of your working leg and pick up the bar. Maintain a straight back and hinge at the hip to lower the bar while raising your opposite leg behind you. Drive your hip forward and pull the bar back up to standing position. Repeat on the opposite side.

Position the landmine attachment at waist height Grip the top of the barbell, pull it into your chest, and stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Squat down until your hips are lower than your knees Push through your heels to stand back up Finish the movement with full hip extension

Stand over the barbell so it is between your legs. Squat down and grasp the end of the barbell with both hands. Stand up, lifting the barbell as you do so, until your legs are straight. Keep your hands on the barbell, press it above your head. Lower the barbell back to the starting position and repeat.

Stand over the barbell with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart Bend your knees and grab the top of the bar Rise to a standing position, keeping your back straight Lower the bar by bending at the hips and knees until the thighs are at least parallel to the floor Return to the standing position and repeat

Stand beside a sturdy box or platform. Bend your knees slightly and leap sideways onto the box. Land softly with your knees slightly bent. Pause for a moment, then jump back to the starting position. Continue to repeat on both sides.

Place a cone or similar object on the ground Stand sideways to the cone with feet under your hips Jump sideways over the cone, pushing off and landing on both feet Quickly jump back over the cone to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Start in a high plank position with your hands below your shoulders and legs extended behind you Keep your body in one straight line while stepping your right hand and foot out to the right side Repeat this on the left side moving your left hand and foot out the the left Move to the right for 4 to 6 steps, then move to the left for 4 to 6 steps Keep your core activated, back straight and gaze forward

Begin standing with your feet together Bend your knees slightly and hop sideways to the right Land softly and immediately hop to the left Alternate sides and repeat Try to do this for 1 minute continuously

Place a hurdle at waist height. Stand on one side of the hurdle with feet shoulder-width apart. Bend your knees and jump over the hurdle by exploding up and to the side. Land with both feet on the other side of the hurdle. Immediately jump back over the hurdle to the start.

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Bend your elbows at a 90-degree angle and keep your palms facing the floor Raise your elbows to the side until they are at shoulder level Hold the position briefly, then slowly lower your arms back down Repeat for desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight, arms by your sides, and feet shoulder-width apart. Raise your arms to your sides up to shoulder level. As your arm comes in line with your shoulders, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold dumbbells near your thighs with your arms straight and palms facing downward. Raise your arms with your elbows bent slightly, to shoulder level. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the cable near your thigh in your left hand with your arm straight. Pull the cable by raising your left arm to your side. As your arm reaches shoulder level, return to the initial position, and repeat.

name_en: Lateral Raise To Shoulder Press Resistance Band Cable
description_en: Stand tall on a resistance band with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the ends of the band near your thighs with your arms straight. Raise your arms to your side, as they reach shoulder level, rotate your forearms outward, then bend your elbows, and extend your arms overhead. Return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with a towel in both hands, arms fully extended and directly in front of you Without bending your elbows, lift the towel out to your sides until it's at shoulder level Pause briefly at the top Slowly lower the towel back to the starting position

Begin standing with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent Push off from the right foot to shuffle to the left for about three steps After the shuffle, perform a crunch by bringing the right elbow towards the left knee Return to the standing position and repeat on the other side Continue alternating sides for a set amount of time or repetitions

Start in a squat position with your feet hip-width apart Shuffle to one side for three steps Tap the ground with the hand on the shuffled side Shuffle back to the starting position and tap the ground with the other hand Repeat the shuffling and tapping continuously for your set duration

Start with your feet hip-width apart, bend your knees and lower your body into a squat Take a wide step to your right, stay in your squat, and tap the ground with your right hand Push off your right foot to return to the center Repeat on the left side. This counts as one rep

Stand up straight next to a sturdy platform or step Swinging your arms for balance, lift your closest leg, bend at the knee and step up onto the platform Push down through your elevated heel to lift your body onto the platform Pause for a moment at the top, then lower yourself back down Repeat the movement before switching to the other leg

Start by standing beside a sturdy step or box Step onto the box with your near foot Drive the heel into the step and lift your body onto the step Lower yourself back down in a controlled manner Switch sides and repeat with the other foot

Stand beside a sturdy bench or step Place one foot on top of the step Press through the foot on the step to push your body upright, driving your opposite knee up towards your chest Slowly lower back down in a controlled manner until your foot touches the ground Repeat with the other leg

Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart Swing one leg to the side and then bend the knee and raise it towards your chest Lower the leg and then swing the other leg to the side, repeating the knee raise Alternate legs and keep the movement fluid Maintain a tall posture throughout

Start in a deep squat position with your knees bent at a right angle and your back straight Raise your right hand and simultaneously tap on the right side then return your hand to the starting position Same way, raise your left hand and tap on the left side then return your hand to the starting position Ensure that you stay in a squat position with your core engage Repeat for a desired set of reps or for a set period of time

Begin in a standard squat position, knees bent and hip-width apart While maintaining the squat, tap one foot out to the side and then bring it back to the original position Repeat the same action with the other foot Ensure your chest remains up and your spine neutral during the moves Keep this action going for your planned number of reps or time (not more than 60 seconds at a time)

Get on the lat pull-down machine with your back straight, knees bent, and feet placed on the floor Grab the bar with an overhand grip with your hands placed shoulder-width apart Pull the bar and bring it towards your chest by taking your elbows down Return to the initial position by straightening your arms again

Get on the lat pull-down machine with your back straight, knees bent, and feet placed on the floor Grab the bar with an overhand grip with your hands placed wider than your shoulder-width Pull the bar and bring it towards your chest by taking your elbows down Return to the initial position by straightening your arms again

Get on the lat pull-down machine with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab the ends of the bar with an overhand grip. Pull the bar towards the chest by folding your arms and taking your elbows down. Return to the initial position by straightening your arms and repeat.

Stand in front of a chair with your legs shoulder-width apart Bend over at the waist, and place your arms on the chair Push your chest downwards until you feel a stretch in your lats Stay in this position for your desired time Slowly rise back to your starting position, releasing the stretch

Lie face down on the ground with hands apart at shoulder width Keep your feet together and use your hands to push your body off the ground Lower body until your chest almost touches the floor At the apex hold the position for a second, then slowly lower yourself back to the starting position Repeat the movements

Lie face down on the floor with your palms beside your shoulders. Push your body up off the ground until your arms are straight. Lower your body till your chest just brushes the floor. Push your body back up to the starting position. Repeat as many repetitions as possible without straining yourself

name_en: Lean Back Air Cycling on a Chair
description_en: Sit on the edge of a chair, grip the sides for support Lean back 45 degrees while raising your legs Simulate a cycling motion with your legs Extend one leg out fully while bringing the other knee in Repeat with the alternate leg

Stand upright and place your feet hip-width apart Take a step forward with one foot Keeping your back straight, lean forward from the hips towards your front foot Hold the stretch for 30 seconds, then switch to the other leg Repeat for 2-3 sets

Lie on your back, raise one leg and extend it upwards Reach up and try to climb as high as you can on your raised leg, using your abs to curl your body up Lower yourself back down and repeat Switch legs and repeat the same process

Lie on your back with your feet on top of a stability ball Keep your hands at your sides on the floor for support Lift your hips off the ground Pull your heels towards your buttocks, rolling the ball as close to your buttocks as possible Slowly roll the ball back to the starting position

Lie on your back with hands under your buttocks for support Lift your legs up so they're perpendicular to the floor Slowly lower your legs until they're about a few inches off the ground Pulse your legs up and down in a small, controlled motion Bring your legs up again to the starting position

Sit down on a bench with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Place your hands on the bench near your hips for support. Raise one of your legs and extend it to maximum range. Maintain this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Position yourself on the stability ball, back down with your hips forward of the ball Place your hands behind your head and keep your legs extended on the floor Lift your upper body and upper legs simultaneously to a sitting position Lower back down slowly to the initial position Repeat as necessary

Lie face up on the floor, knees bent with your feet flat on the ground Push your hips up, keep your lower back and abdominals tight Reach the position where your knees, hips and shoulders are in line Hold this peak position for a few seconds While keeping control, lower your body back down to the starting position

Begin in a standard plank position, with your forearms on the ground and your body perfectly straight Draw your right knee in towards your chest Kick your right leg out straight behind you, engaging your quads and glutes Bring your right leg back into your chest and set it down Repeat the movement with your left leg and continue to alternate

Start by lying flat on your back, with your arms and legs spread out in the shape of an 'X'. Raise your right arm and left leg, reaching across your body to perform a crunch and touch your right hand to your left foot. Lower your arm and leg back to the starting position. Repeat with your left arm and right leg. Continue alternating sides for a full set. The movement should be smooth and controlled, with each crunch performed from the contraction of your abs, not from momentum or pulling on your head or neck.

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Lift your right knee up in front of your body to hip height Extend your right foot out in a swift kicking motion Bring your foot back in, bending at the knee and lower your leg back down Repeat with the other leg

Stand with your feet together and your hands in fists near your chin Shift your weight onto one leg Snap the other leg out straight in front of you, aiming the ball of your foot at your target Bring your leg back down in a fast, snappy motion to the starting position Switch legs and repeat

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise your right leg to hip level while raising both arms out to the sides Lower your right leg and arms back to the starting position Repeat the process with your left leg Continue alternating between your right and left leg

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Raise one leg straight out in front of you while hopping onto your other foot Lower your raised leg back down while hopping onto your other foot Repeat this movement, alternating legs Increase your speed to a pace that is challenging but sustainable

Lie down on your back with your legs straight and your hands resting on the floor under your hips Raise your legs off the floor making an angle with your torso Start moving your legs together making circles in the air with your feet

name_en: Leg Lift to Chest Front Plank
description_en: Get into a high plank position with hands under shoulders and legs extended Lift your right leg off the floor and bring your knee to touch your chest Return to the starting position Repeat the same movement with your left leg Continue alternating legs

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Lift one leg and attempt to touch your toes with the opposite hand Hold the position for 15 to 30 seconds Switch legs and repeat Perform this stretch for 3-5 rounds

Lie on your back with your knees bent, feet flat on the floor. Place your right ankle on your left knee. Push through your left heel to lift your hips off the ground until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees. Hold for a moment at the top and then lower back down in a controlled manner. Repeat with the other leg.

Lie flat on your back with your legs bent Cross one ankle over the opposite knee Drive your heel into the ground to lift your hips, squeezing your glutes at the top Slowly lower your hips back to the starting position Repeat on the other leg

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor. Place your left ankle on your right knee. Press your right foot into the floor, and lift your hips off the ground until your body forms a straight line from your shoulder to your right knee. Pause in this position, ensuring your glutes are engaged. Slowly lower your hips back to the floor and repeat.

Lie down on a leg press machine with your back supported making a 45-degree angle with the floor, knees bent, and feet placed hip-width apart against the platform. Push the platform forward by extending your legs. Hold for a few seconds, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie down on a leg press machine with your back supported, knees bent, and feet placed shoulder-width apart against the platform. Push the platform forward by extending your legs. Hold for a few seconds, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie down on a leg press machine with your back supported, knees bent, and feet placed wider than your shoulder width and high on the platform. Push the platform forward by extending your legs. Hold for a few seconds, return to the initial position, and repeat.

name_en: Leg Press Wide High Stance Behind View
description_en: Lie on a leg press machine with your back supported, knees bent, and feet placed wider than your shoulder width and high on the platform. Push the platform forward by extending your legs. Hold for a few seconds, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Begin standing tall with your feet hip-width apart Raise one knee to hip level, grasping your ankle or shin Gently pull your knee towards your chest, keeping your back straight and your other leg grounded Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds Repeat on the other leg
Begin in a straight arm plank position Raise one leg up to your side while keeping it straight Lower your leg back to plank position Repeat with your other leg Continue alternating sides for your set

name_en: Leg Raise Above Head and Under Knee Clap
description_en: Start by standing tall with your feet shoulder width apart Bend your knees slightly, jump up, and raise your right knee towards your chest As your knee comes up, clap your hands under the raised knee Land back on both feet in a controlled way and quickly jump up again, replicating movement with your left knee Alternate between legs and keep the rhythm going for a set amount of time

Lie flat on your back on a bench Place your hands to your side or underneath your hips for support Raise your legs and hips off the bench towards the ceiling Lower your body down without touching the bench Repeat the movements for a designated set of reps

Lie flat on your back on the floor with your palms down by your sides Lift your legs straight up toward the ceiling, keeping them together Lift your hips off the floor and push them upward Slowly lower your hips back to the floor Lower your legs back to the starting position

Start by laying flat on the floor with your legs extended and your arms at your sides Raise your legs up until they form a 90 degree angle with your torso Lift your hips off the floor while keeping your legs vertical Slowly lower your hips back to the floor Lower your legs back to the initial position

name_en: Leg Raise Hip Lift with Head-up
description_en: Lay flat on your back with your arms at your sides and your palms facing down Raise your legs straight up towards the ceiling until they are perpendicular to the floor Lift your head off the floor, keeping your gaze fixed on your legs Now also lift your hips off the floor, pushing your legs upwards Slowly lower your hips and head back to the original position

Lie on your back on a flat surface with your arms extended to the sides Raise your legs and lift your hips off the ground as you crunch your knees diagonally to your left side Lower your hips back to the ground in a controlled manner Repeat the process, but this time crunch your knees to your right side Keep alternating sides for the desired amount of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight and support your forearms on the padded bars while holding the handles. Raise your feet and bring your legs forward and parallel to the floor. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Sit on the edge of the chair and hold onto the sides for support Keep your back straight and lean back slightly Elevate your legs, raising your knees towards your chest Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down Try to keep your knees bent for the whole duration
Sit down on your hips while extending your legs forward. Lean forward and extend your arms to grab your toes. Maintain this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Sit on the leverage machine with your feet securely on the footrest Grip the handles, while keeping your back against the backrest Pull your knees towards your chest by flexing your waist Pause for a moment then return to the starting position in a controlled motion Repeat this movement for the desired amount of repetitions

Sit on the machine with your feet on the foot supports. Grasp the handles and push your feet against the foot supports to move the seat upward. Curl your body inward to crunch your abs. Slowly lower your body back down to the starting position. Repeat for desired number of reps.

Position yourself on the leverage machine with your back against the pad and arms on the handbars With your legs together, lift them up in front of you until your body forms a ninety degree angle Hold this position for a moment and then lower your legs back down in a controlled manner Try not to use momentum and focus on consciously engaging your abs during the lift Repeat the movement for your desired number of repetitions

Position yourself on the machine, side facing the pad Place the leg to be worked behind the pad provided Push the leg out and up as far as comfortable Hold the position for a moment before slowly lowering the leg back Repeat for the desired number of reps before switching sides

Position yourself under the machine, feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your body by bending your knees while pushing your hips back. Once your thighs are parallel to the floor, push back up. Repeat the exercise according to your training routine.

Sit on the machine, and secure your feet under the pads provided. Hold the handles that are in-front of you. Pull the handles towards your body while bending your knees and bringing them towards your chest. Return to the starting position. Repeat the exercise as per your workout routine.

Position yourself on the leverage machine ensuring your elbow rests comfortably on the padding Grab the handle with palms facing upward Raise the handle by bending your elbow until your biceps are fully contracted Slowly lower the lever back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the motion with the other arm

Position yourself on the leverage machine with a slightly reclined back and place your feet on the footpad Extend one leg completely without locking your knees Bring the leg back to starting position Repeat the move with the other leg

Sit down on the machine and place your feet on the footplate at shoulder width apart. Keep your back on the back pad while pushing the footplate forward by extending your legs. Lower the weight slowly by bending your legs, keeping your feet still. Push the footplate again by extending your legs. Alternate between legs for each cycle.

Stand or sit on the assisted pull-up machine with your knees on the pad, placing your hands on the chin-up bar using an underhand grip Lower your body, allowing your arms to fully extend Pull yourself up until your chin is level with the pull-up bar Hold this position briefly, then slowly lower yourself back to the start

Stand on the platform of the leverage machine, holding the bars with both hands Bend your knees slightly and allow the machine to assist you as you pull up Pull yourself up until your chin is over the bars Hold this position briefly, then lower yourself down in a controlled manner Repeat this motion for your desired number of reps

Position yourself on the leverage machine with your chest against the pad, holding the handles with natural grip. Extend yourself back until your body is in a straight line. Restrain from going beyond vertical to prevent straining your back. Lower your torso back down in a controlled manner to the original posture. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Adjust the pad of the lever machine to fit your height. Lie face down on the machine with your hips and upper edge of your pelvis placed comfortably on the pad. Hold onto the designated grips while keeping your body straight and only bending at your waist. Lower your torso, bending at the waist until you are nearly vertical, then raise your body back to the starting position. Repeat the movement while being mindful not to lift your body through the use of your back, but hinging at the waist.

Stand on the machine with one foot on either side of the platform. Position your hips against the pads and hold onto the handles. Bend at the waist while keeping your back straight until you are parallel with the ground. Raise your body back up by contracting your glutes and lower back. Repeat for desired repetitions.

Position your body on the lever back extension machine, with your lower waist on the support pad. Wrap your legs around the leg supports and grip the handles. Bend your body at the waist while keeping your back straight until you are parallel to the ground. Raise your torso back up to the initial position using your lower back muscles. Repeat this motion for the recommended amount of reps.

Attach a resistance band to a high pulley and lie down under it Hold the band, with legs fully extended and feet together Raise your legs until they form a 90-degree angle with your torso Pause for a second, then slowly lower your legs back to the starting position Make sure to keep your legs straight and your core engaged throughout the movement

Stand on the platform of the leverage machine, aligning your shoulders under the lever Keep your feet shoulder-width apart Squat down, lowering your body until your thighs are parallel to the ground Push yourself up by extending your hips and knees Return to the standing position and repeat

Position yourself on the machine with your chest against the pad and feet firmly on the ground Grasp the handles with an underhand grip Pull the handles towards your chest, while keeping your elbows close to your body Hold the contraction for a moment Slowly return the handles to the initial position

name_en: Lever Bent Over Neutral Grip Row
description_en: Position yourself on the machine with your chest pressed against the support Grasp the lever handles with your palms facing each other Pull the handles towards your torso while keeping your back straight Pause briefly at peak contraction then slowly return to the starting position Repeat the process

Stand behind the lever machine and grasp the handles. Bend forward at the hips keeping your back straight. Pull the handles towards your abdomen. Slowly return to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Start by standing behind the lever machine with your feet shoulder-width apart. Bend over at the waist, maintaining a slight bend in your knees, and grasp the lever. Pull the lever bar towards your waist by driving your elbows behind you. Hold for a brief moment, then slowly return the weight back to the starting position. Repeat this movement for your desired number of repetitions.

Position yourself at the leverage machine with the lever at waist height Grab the handles and stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Flex your biceps to curl the lever up towards your shoulders Hold the contraction at the top momentarily Slowly lower the lever to the initial position

Stand up straight in front of the lever machine Grab the lever with a palms-up grip Curl the lever towards your chest Pause at the top and then lower the lever back down Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand up straight and grip the lever handles with your palms facing up Keep your elbows close to your body and curl your hands towards your shoulders Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower your hands back to the starting position Keep your back straight and your knees slightly bent throughout the exercise Repeat the movements for your recommended set of reps

Sit down on the machine with your back flat on the pad. Take hold of the handles. Push the handles away from you as far as you can. Return back to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat the process for the chosen number of repetitions.

Sit on the machine with your back flat against the pad. Take hold on the handles with an overhand grip. Push the handles away from your chest, extending your arms fully. Pause for a moment before slowly returning to the starting position. Repeat for your desired number of reps.

Sit down on the machine with your back flat on the pad. Take hold of the handles and push them away from your body while exhaling. Hold the contracted position for a second and then start to come back slowly to the initial position as you inhale. Repeat the exercise for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Sit down on the machine with your back flat against the pad Grab handles with both hands Push the handles away from your chest, fully extending your arms Pull the handles back towards your chest in a smooth motion

Sit on the lever chest press machine with your back flat against the pad Grasp the handles with a full grip Push the handles away from you until your arms are fully extended Slowly let the handles come back towards you until your chest muscles are fully stretched Repeat the exercise the recommended amount of times

Sit on the machine with your back against the pad and grip the handles Push forward in a controlled motion until your arms are fully extended Return slowly to the starting position where your chest is slightly stretched Repeat the exercise for the desired amount of repetitions

Sit on the lever machine, adjust the seat height so your hands are in line with your chest Grip the handles and extend your arms fully Slowly lower the weights by bending your elbows Return to the starting position by extending your arms Repeat the process

Sit on the leverage machine with your feet planted firmly on the ground Pull the arms of the machine down to your sides in a broad motion Then slowly return the arms of the machine to the starting position controlling the resistance Repeat this motion for the desired amount of reps

Position yourself on the seat of the lever machine allowing the lever to rest across the front of your shoulders Grasp the lever handles, keeping your arms straight Pull the lever down to your chest while keeping your back straight Hold the position for a moment, then slowly return the lever to the starting position

Adjust the lever machine so that the handles are chest high Grip handles with your palms down and arms extended Pull the handles together crossing them over in front of your chest Return to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand facing the lever machine, feet shoulder-width apart Bend at your hips and knees to reach the handles Lift the weight by extending your hips and knees to a standing position Lower the weight by flexing your hips and knees until you reach the starting position

Position yourself at the lever machine with your feet shoulder-width apart Bend at the knees and hips to lower and grab the handles Extend your hips and knees to lift the weight Return to starting position by bending your hips and knees

Sit on the lever machine with your feet planted on the ground Grab the handles with your palms facing down Press the handles forward until your arms are fully extended Slowly return to the starting position Perform the specified number of reps

Sit down on the machine with your back against the padded support Grab the handles with palms inward facing Push the handles away from you until your elbows are almost locked Return the handles smoothly to the start position Repeat the motion for desired reps

Position yourself in the lever machine with shoulder pads supporting your upper body Place your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform Lower your body by bending at the knees, keeping your back straight Push back up to the starting position using your leg muscles Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Mount the machine with feet on the pedals and hands on the levers Slightly bend your knees and keep your back straight Push forward on one foot while pulling back on the opposite Switch foot and hand movements in a walking motion Continue this motion for a set amount of time

Sit on the machine with the knee pads adjusted to a comfortable height Grasp the handles with an overhand grip Pull the handles down to your upper chest Return to the initial position in a slow controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand or seat in front of the leverage machine Grasp the handles, keeping your hands shoulder-width apart Pull the handles down while bending your elbows Pull until your hands reach your chest level Slowly return to the initial position

Place your body firmly against the backrest. Place your legs on the leg pads. Press the pads outward with your legs in a push-out motion. Return your legs to the center slowly and with control. Repeat the process for the appropriate number of repetitions

Sit on the machine and align your hips with the centerline of the machine Place your outer thigh against the padded lever Press your leg outwards, against the lever and squeeze your glutes at the peak Control the movement back to the starting position Repeat these steps with the other leg

Position yourself on the machine with one foot on the platform and the other knee bent at a 90-degree angle Push the machine platform away from you by straightening your foot on the platform until your leg is fully extended Hold this position for a moment Slowly return your foot to the original position Repeat the exercise keeping your core tight and maintain good posture

name_en: Lever Good Morning on the Hack Squat Machine
description_en: Position yourself on the machine with your shoulders under the pads and hands on the handles Bend at the hips while keeping your back and legs straight Lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the ground Reposition yourself upright using your hips and lower back Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand in front of the leverage machine with your feet shoulder-width apart Keep your arms straight and hold the handles of the machine Raise your shoulders as high as you can, shrugging without using your arms Hold for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your shoulders back down

Sit or stand by the machine, ensuring good posture Take hold of the machine handles, making sure your grip is centered Squeeze the grips together as if you are trying to crush them Hold for a few seconds then return slowly Repeat the exercise for your desired sets and reps

Sit on the machine with your feet firmly on the ground and grasp handles with an overhand grip Keeping your body stationary, pull the handles towards you until your hands are by your upper waist Pause at the peak contraction, then slowly lower the handles back to the starting position Repeat the movement for the recommended amount of repetitions Ensure to keep the motion controlled throughout the exercise

Adjust the seat to a height that allows your arms to be fully extended when grasping the handles Brace your abs and pull the handles back towards your body until your elbows are behind your back Keep this position for a brief moment before returning to the starting position Repeat the exercise until the desired amount of repetitions is met

Stand in front of a loaded high row machine, grasp the handles. Pull the handles towards your upper chest while keeping your back straight. Contract your back muscles for a moment. Slowly return the handles back to the starting position. Repeat the process.

Sit on the seat with your chest against the pad and your feet flat on the floor. Grip the handles with your palms facing each other. Pull the handles towards your body until your elbows are behind you. Hold for a moment, then slowly return to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.

Position yourself on the leverage machine such that your hip is across the pad Grasp the handles for support Allow one leg to hang off the side Contract the glutes to raise your leg as high as you can Slowly lower your foot back to the starting position

Position yourself on the leverage machine with your upper back against the pad Place your feet shoulder-width apart on the foot plate Push through your heels to lift your hips, squeezing your glutes at the top Lower your hips back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Position yourself on a leverage machine with your upper back and shoulders against the padded support Place your feet shoulder-width apart Push through your heels to extend your hips and raise them towards the ceiling Hold the position for a second Slowly lower your body back to the starting position

Position yourself on the Leverage machine with your hips under the padded lever With your feet shoulder width apart, push up with your hips while keeping your upper body still Contract your glutes at the top, hold for a few seconds Lower your hips down back to the start in a controlled manner Repeat the cycle for your desired number of repetitions

Seat yourself on the machine, place your feet on the platform shoulder width apart. Push the platform away by extending your legs. Return back to the initial position without locking your knees. Repeat for desired number of reps. When finished, safely dismount the machine.

Sit comfortably on the machine with one foot on the platform and the other foot resting. Push the platform away by extending your knee and hip of your front foot. Return to starting position by relaxing your hip and knee. Make sure to keep your back pressed against the backrest throughout the movement. Switch legs and repeat.

Sit on the machine with your back pressed against the pad Place one foot on the foot plate, and keep the other foot off the bar Push the foot plate until your leg is fully extended, while making sure to not lock your knee Return to the starting position with your knee bent Switch legs and repeat the exercise

Sit down on the incline bench in the machine, with your chest pressed firmly against the padded support Grab the handles with a neutral grip Push the handles away from you until your arms are fully extended Pull the handles back towards your chest Ensure that each rep is done with full range of motion

Sit on the machine with your back flat against the pad Hold the handles in line with your chest Press the handles forward until your arms are fully extended Slowly return the handles back to the start position Repeat the movement for your desired number of reps

Sit on the seat, adjust it to align the handles with your chest level Grasp the handles, with your feet flat on the floor Push the handles away from your chest until your arms are fully extended Pause briefly, then lower the handles back to your chest in a controlled manner Repeat this for your set number of repetitions

Sit on the machine with your back against the padded support Place your hands on the handles with arms bent at 90 degrees Push the handles forward until your arms are fully extended but do not lock your elbows Return the handles back to start position in a controlled manner Repeat this action

Sit on the lever incline fly machine with your back fully supported by the pad Grip the handles with your arms spread to the sides Bring the handles together in a sweeping arc, ensuring to keep the elbows slightly bent Pause for a moment at the top of the movement before lowering the handles back to the starting position Repeat the movement for the recommended amount of repetitions

Position yourself on the incline bench of the leverage machine Grasp the handles with a neutral grip Push the handles upward until your arms are fully extended Lower the handles in a controlled fashion until your chests is comfortably stretched Repeat the process for your desired number of repetitions

Sit on the incline press machine with your back resting on the padded support Grip the handles firmly and keep your feet flat on the ground Push the handles away from your chest with your elbows slightly bent Hold for a moment then bring the handles back towards your chest slowly Repeat the exercise for the recommended number of repetitions

Kneel on the leg curl machine with one leg positioned under the padded lever Hold onto the handles of the machine for support Curl your leg up, contracting your hamstring Slowly lower your leg back to the starting position Repeat the exercise on the other leg

Position yourself with your chest facing downwards on the bench Secure your ankles under the lever with your knees just beyond the edge of the pad Inhale as you curl your legs up as far as possible Pause at the top position while contracting your hamstrings Exhale as you slowly lower your legs to the starting position
Kneel in front of the lever machine Grasp the lever with both hands Rotate your torso to one side Return to the initial position Repeat the same on the other side

Adjust the leverage machine so it is suitable for your height Sit down and grip the handles, keeping your back straight Pull the handles down until they reach shoulder level Pause briefly, then slowly return the handles to the starting position Repeat the exercise as recommended

Adjust the seat on the machine so your shoulders are in line with the handles Grasp handles with your outstretched arms Raise the handles until your arms are about parallel to the ground Lower the handles back down to the initial position in a controlled manner Ensure your movement is led by your shoulders and not your back or arms

Stand next to the machine and grab the handle with one hand While keeping your torso stationary, lift the handle away from your body until your arm is parallel with the floor Hold this position briefly Lower the handle back to your side in a controlled manner Repeat this process with your other arm

Position yourself on the seat of the machine and grasp handles Keeping your back straight, raise your arms out to your sides until they're at shoulder height Hold for a moment, then slowly lower your arms back down Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Position yourself at the lever machine, adjusting the height to align with your shoulders Grip the handles firmly and keep your arms straight Raise your arms to the sides until they are parallel to the floor Hold the position for a moment Slowly lower your arms back to the starting position

name_en: Lever Lateral Raise with Chest Support
description_en: Position yourself on the chest pad of the lever machine Hold the handles and maintain a firm grip Raise the lever arms to shoulder height & extend them fully Lower the arms in a controlled manner until they reach the starting position Repeat the exercise for desired reps

Sit on the machine with your feet flat on the floor Grasp the handles with both hands using a wide grip Pull the bar down until it is approximately level with your collar bone Hold for a moment before slowly returning the weight back to the starting position Repeat the movement

Sit on the machine with your back fully against the back rest. Set the lever under your ankles and make sure your legs are fully extended at the start. Bend your knees and lower the lever to perform the leg extension. Raise the lever back to the starting position using your quadriceps. Repeat for the recommended reps

Sit on the machine with your legs under the pad, feet pointed forward and hands holding the handles or sides Make sure your knees are at a 90-degree angle when the machine is in its resting position Using your quadriceps, extend your legs to the maximum as exhale Ensure that the rest of your body remains stationary on the seat Slowly lower the weight back to the initial position as you inhale

Sit on the machine with your back flat on the pad Place your feet on the footplate in front of you, toes pointed inwards Extend your legs fully without locking your knees Lower the weight back to the initial position slowly, keeping the tension on your quadriceps Repeat for the desired number of reps

Place your feet shoulder width apart on the machine's platform Push the platform up by extending your knees and hips Lower the platform back to the starting position by bending your knees and hips Keep your back flat against the seat during the movement Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Position yourself under the shoulder pads of the machine, with your shoulders and back against the pads. Place your feet shoulder-width apart in front of you. Lower your body by bending your knees, keeping your back straight. Push your body upwards using your legs and hips. Return to the starting position in a controlled manner.

Position yourself on the machine with your chest against the pad Grab the handles using a full grip Pull the handles towards your lower ribs Do not rotate your body; focus on using your back muscles to pull Slowly return the handles to the starting position, keeping control throughout

Lie back on the bench with your feet flat on the floor Grasp the handles with a pronated grip Push the handles away from you until your arms are fully extended Lower the weight in a controlled manner until your arms are bent at a 90 degree angle Repeat for the desired number of reps

Lie on the bench with your back flat and your feet on the ground Grasp the handles of the lever with your palms facing down Press the lever upwards using your chest muscles until your arms are fully extended Slowly return the lever to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Lie down on your back on the machine with your feet firmly planted on the ground Hold onto the handles of the leverage machine Using your abs, crunch up and lift your upper body towards your knees Pause at the top of the motion, and then slowly lower yourself back down

Lie on your back on the machine's bench with your knees bent Grasp the handles and keep your arms fully extended Contract your abs to pull your upper body towards your knees Pause, then slowly lower yourself back to the starting position

Lie face down on a lever lying leg curl machine, positioning the lever pad on the back of your legs just below the calf muscles. Grasp the side handles of the machine and point your toes straight. Curl your legs up as far as possible without lifting your thighs off the pad. Hold for a second on the contraction. Return your legs back to the initial position in a smooth, controlled movement. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Place yourself on the lever machine with your abdomen against the bench and legs under the lever pad Grasp the handles of the machine for better body stability Curl your legs upwards as far as possible Hold the contraction at the top momentarily Slowly return to initial position

name_en: Lever Lying Leg Raise Bent Knee
description_en: Lie down on the machine with your back flat against the pad Secure your feet under the pad or strap, knees bent Raise your knees towards your chest, contracting your abs Lower your legs back down in a controlled manner Repeat for desired repetitions

Lie on your stomach on the leg curl machine with the lever pad on the back of your legs (just a few inches under the calves) Keeping the upper body flat on the bench, curl your legs up as far as possible without lifting the upper legs from the pad. After a second at the contracted position, bring the legs back to the initial position with a slow controlled motion. Repeat with the other leg. Continue alternating between the two legs for the desired amount of reps.

Begin by adjusting the lever to fit your height and lie face down on the leverage machine Ensure one knee is aligned with the machine pivot and the roller is on the back of the ankle Grip the handles of the machine for support Flex at the knee and curl your leg as far as possible without lifting the upper leg from the pad Slowly return to the starting position and switch legs to continue on the other side

Lie down on the T-bar machine with your chest against the pad Grasp the handles with both hands Pull the handles towards your chest while keeping your elbows close to your body Slowly lower the handlebar back to the starting position

Position yourself on the seat and adjust it so the handles fall just below shoulder height Grip the handles, always maintaining a slight bend in the elbows Push the handles upwards until your arms are fully extended Lower the handles back to just below shoulder height Repeat for desired amount of reps

Stand underneath the lever machine Grasp the bars with a shoulder-width grip Press the bars upwards until your arms are fully extended Lower the bars back to starting position in a controlled motion Repeat for desired repetitions

Sit on the seat of the lever machine and place your feet on the provided platform. Grab the handles with a neutral grip (palms facing each other) and straighten your arms. Draw your shoulder blades together and pull the handles towards your abdomen. Hold for a second, then return the handles back to starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

name_en: Lever One Arm Incline Chest Press
description_en: Sit comfortably on the bench with your feet planted on the ground. Grasp the lever handle with one arm and push it forward until your arm is fully extended. Slowly pull the handle back to the starting position. Repeat this motion for your desired number of repetitions. Switch arms and repeat the exercise.

name_en: Lever One Arm Lateral High Row
description_en: Stand next to the lever machine, with your feet shoulder-width apart Grasp the handle with one hand at arm's length Pull the handle back and to the side until your elbow is just past your body Pause and squeeze your shoulder blades together Slowly return the handle to the start position

name_en: Lever One Arm Lateral High Row
description_en: Stand in front of the leverage machine with one foot forward for balance Grab the handle with one arm, keeping your elbow partially bent Pull your arm towards your body until your elbow is at shoulder level Lower your arm in a controlled manner back to the starting position Repeat with the other arm

name_en: Lever One Arm Lateral Wide Pulldown
description_en: Sit on the seat facing the machine and adjust the knee pads to fit your height Grip the handle with one arm while your other hand is resting Pull the handle down to your side until your elbow is fully flexed Pause for a moment and return to the starting position Switch arms after completing your set

Position yourself perpendicularly to the plate-loaded lever machine with your feet flat on the ground Grasp the handle with one hand, arm extended, and body upright Draw the handle back, squeezing your shoulder blades together and contracting the muscles of your back Hold for a brief moment, then slowly return to the starting position Repeat with the other arm

Sit on the leverage machine seat and adjust the seat height so that the handles are aligned with your shoulder Grasp the machine handle with one hand Press the handle upwards until your arm is fully extended Slowly lower the handle back to the start position Repeat as desired, then switch to the other arm

Sit on the lever machine with your back against the pad Position the lever pad across one leg Extend your leg until it's straight, remaining in control of the motion the entire time Hold the position for a quick moment before returning to the starting position Repeat with the other leg

Set up the leverage machine to match your height, and adjust the pad to fit snugly against your lower leg. Grasp the machine handles for support. Extend one leg against the resistance until it is almost fully extended. Slowly return the leg to the original position. Repeat the exercise with the same leg before switching to the other.

Step onto the machine appropriately and hold the handles Move one leg forward while simultaneously moving the other leg backwards Keep your back straight and engage your core as you stride Maintain an even rhythm throughout the exercise Slowly stop the motion and step down from the machine carefully

Sit down on the chest press machine and select the weight you want to use. Place your hands on the handles and extend your arms fully. Slowly bend your elbows to bring the levers towards you until your elbows are just past 90 degrees. Push the levers back up to the starting position. Repeat

Sit on the Pulldown machine with a wide grip on the bar, your back straight, and your feet flat on the ground Pull the bar down towards your upper chest while squeezing your shoulder blades together Hold for a moment at the bottom of your pull Slowly lift the bar back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms Repeat the motion for your desired number of repetitions
Sit down in the leg press machine Place your feet on the platform shoulder-width apart Push the platform away with your legs Bend your knees to return to the start position

Hold the lever machine at your sides, feet hip-distance apart Bend your body to one side, trying to bring your elbow down towards your hip Return to the starting position in a controlled manner and repeat on the opposite side Stay straight in your hips and knees throughout the movement Complete all reps on one side before moving to the other side

Sit on the machine with your back flat against the pad Place your arms on the levered arm pads Press the levered arms together in a hugging motion until they meet Hold for a brief moment and then return to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on the machine with your back flat against the pad Place your elbows on the pads and grip the handles Push the levers together, squeezing your chest in the process Return the levers back to the starting position Repeat the movement for desired reps

Position yourself securely in the lever pendulum squat machine Place your feet hip-width apart on the platform Bend your knees and lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the floor Push back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand in the leverage machine and position your shoulders under the pads provided Position your feet shoulder-width apart Descend until your thighs are parallel to the floor Now push up returning to the starting position Repeat this for the desired amount of reps

Sit down on a preacher bench and select the desired weight on the machine. Grip the lever handles tightly with your palms facing up. Pull the handles up until your upper arms are fully contracted. Slowly lower the handles to the initial position. Repeat for the desired amount of repetitions.

Adjust the lever machine to fit your body. The back of your arms should lean onto a pad. Hold the lever handles with your palms facing up. Curl the handles toward your shoulders. Pause a second on peak contraction. Release the handles to return to the starting position.

Adjust the height of lever machine to suit your arm length Place your arms on the pad, grip the handles firmly Perform a curl movement using your biceps and brachialis Hold briefly at the top and squeeze your muscles Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position

Position yourself on the lever preacher curl machine with your torso turned toward the side of your working arm Place your working arm on the pad, gripping the lever with an underhand grip Raise the lever as high as you can while keeping your elbow on the pad Lower the lever back down after a brief pause Continue to do this for your set before switching arms

Sit on the preacher bench and adjust the lever to your height Place your arms on the pad, with the armpits at the top of the pad Push the lever up until your arms are fully extended Slowly lower the lever back to the starting position Repeat this for the recommended amount of repetitions

Sit on the preacher bench with your chest against the pad, reach out and grab the bar with a shoulder-width grip Without moving your upper arms, bend your elbows and curl the weight as high as possible Pause, then slowly lower the weight back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on the seat of the leverage machine with your feet comfortably placed on the foot rest Grip the lever with a pronated grip and fully extend your arms Pull the lever towards your torso by squeezing your back muscles Hold for a moment, then return the lever to the starting position in a slow, controlled movement Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Lever Pronated Grip Seated Scapular Retraction Shrug
description_en: Sit on the machine with your chest against the pad Hold the handles and pull them towards you without bending your elbows Squeeze your shoulder blades together Hold this position for a moment Slowly return to the start position

Position the lever arm on the machine for your height and lay back Grip the handles with a full grip and your thumbs wrapped around the handles Lower the lever handles to your sides as you exhale Raise the lever handles to the initial position as you inhale Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions

Position yourself facing the lever machine with your feet shoulder width apart Place your hands on the handles in the machine and align them with your chest Press down on the handles until your arms are fully extended Slowly return to the starting position Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Sit down on the machine and grasp the initiated handles, palms facing upwards Pull the handles towards your upper chest, keeping your elbows upwards and away from body Hold for a moment while squeezing your shoulder blades Slowly return to the starting position
