Sit on the machine with your chest against the pad, grip the bar with palms facing you Pull the bar down towards your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together Hold for a moment then slowly release back to starting position Keep your back straight and controlled throughout the exercise Repeat the process for a set amount of reps

Sit on the machine with a bench between your thighs Grasp the bar with a reverse grip (palms facing you) Pull the bar down towards your chest while keeping your back straight Hold for a moment and contract your lats Slowly let the bar return to the starting position

Position yourself on the leverage machine with your lower abdomen against the pad. Hold the handles for stability and extend your legs back. Keep your legs straight and raise them as high as you can, engaging your glutes. Lower your legs back down in a controlled fashion. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Position yourself face down on the machine Hold the handles in front of you for support Lift your legs up using your lower back and glutes until they're parallel to the ground Lower your legs back down in a slow, controlled manner

Stand in front of the machine with your chest resting on the pad Grab the handle with both hands Pull the handle towards your chest, keeping your arms close to your body Pause at the top of the movement Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position

Stand behind the bar of the leverage machine Bend your knees and keep your back straight Grasp the handles of the lever machine Pull the lever towards your upper abdomen Hold for a second and then return the lever to the starting position

Stand against the back pad and position your shoulders under the shoulder pads. Ensure your feet are shoulder-width apart on the platform. Lower your body by bending your knees until they create a 90 degrees angle. Push back up using your heels until your legs are fully extended. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

Stand up straight on the leverage machine while holding the handles Bend your knees while keeping your chest up, pushing your hips back Lower your body until your thighs are in line with the floor or slightly below Push your body back up to the starting position Keep a steady pace and repeat

Position yourself on the machine with the balls of your feet on the foot platform Start with your calves stretched at the bottom of the movement Raise your heels by extending your ankles and flex your calves at the top Hold the contracted position for a moment Lower your heels back to the starting position in a controlled fashion

Adjust your seat so that the lever pad sits just above the top of your ankles Push down on the lever by extending your feet, lifting your heels as high as possible Hold the position briefly before slowly lowering your heels Repeat the sequence for the recommended number of reps

Adjust the lever machine to your height and stand in a lunge position Hold the handles with both hands, elbows slightly bent Pull the handles towards your torso Hold for a moment and then repeat Perform the necessary number of repetitions

name_en: Lever Seated Bent Over Rear Delt Fly
description_en: Sit on the machine with your chest against the chest pad Grab the handles with your palms facing inwards Pull the handles back until your shoulder blades are fully squeezed together Hold for a second Gradually return to the initial position

Sit on the machine with your toes on the lower part of the platform and knees lightly touching the pad Push the platform by extending your ankles as high as possible Hold there for a second then slowly lower your heels by bending your ankles till feeling a stretch in your calves Keep your movements smooth and controlled throughout the exercise

Position the machine lever under your lower calves Place your hands on the given handles for support Push the lever by extending your ankles until your calves are fully stretched Return to the starting position by bending your ankles until your calves are fully contracted

Sit on the machine and place your toes on the lower portion of the platform with your heels extending off. Place your lower thighs under the lever pad, adjusting the pad to fit snugly against your lower thighs. Lift the lever by pushing your heels up and release the safety bar. Slowly lower your heels by bending at the ankles until your calves are fully stretched. Raise your heels by extending your ankles as high as possible while maintaining a straight knee throughout.

Sit on the machine with your toes on the lower portion of the platform Place your thighs under the lever pad Lift the lever slightly by pushing your heels up Slowly lower your heels by bending at the ankles until your calves are fully stretched Raise your heels by extending your ankles as high as possible

Sit on the machine with your knees under the pad and your feet flat on the foot platform. Slowly raise your heels by pushing down on the balls of your feet. Pause at the top with your calves fully contracted and then slowly lower your heels back down. Repeat this motion for the desired number of repetitions. Make sure to maintain a straight back throughout the movement.

Sit on the machine with your feet firmly planted on the ground Grasp the handles and pull your upper body towards the machine Contract your abdomen as you pull forward Slowly return to the starting position

Sit on the machine with your feet firmly planted on the ground Place your hands on the pads in front of you Flex your waist to crunch forward and squeeze your abs at the bottom Slowly return to the starting position allowing your abs to stretch Repeat for the desired repetitions

Sit on the lever seated crunch machine with your feet firmly on the ground Grip the handles and keep your elbows at a 90-degree angle Push down towards your knees using your abdominal muscles Return back to the start position in a slow and controlled manner Repeat the process

Sit on the leverage machine seat and place your feet on the foot rests Place your hands on the pad and bend at the waist Lower your upper body towards your knees Return to the start position in a controlled manner Repeat the movement

Adjust the chest pad of the machine to align with your chest Hold the handles of the machine with a firm grip Pull the handles towards your waist while keeping your back straight Pause and squeeze your abs mid-way Return to the starting position

Sit on the leverage machine and secure your feet under the pad Hold the handles of the machine, keeping your arms straight and your back upright Pull your upper body towards your knees in a curling motion Hold this position for a moment and engage your abdominals Gently return to the starting position and repeat

Sit on the machine with your back flat against the pad Grasp the handles, your arms should be angled 90 degrees at the elbow Push down, fully extending your arms and flexing your triceps Return to the starting position in a slow and controlled manner Repeat the process as required

Sit on the seat of the machine with a straight back, placing your hands on the lever handles Push the handles down until your elbows are straight but not locked Slowly return handles back to the starting position Ensure consistent movements without jerking Repeat the process, ensuring you're controlling the descent and ascent

Sit on the machine with your back flat against the pad Place your elbows on the pads provided by the machine and grip the handles Push your arms together in front of you Slowly let your arms return to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on the machine with your back flat against the pad. Take hold of the handles and push them together until they meet in the middle. Hold this position for a moment to maximise the contraction in your chest muscles. Slowly allow the handles to return to the starting position. Repeat this process for the recommended amount of repetitions

name_en: Lever Seated Hammer Grip Shoulder Press
description_en: Sit down on the machine and grab the handles with a hammer grip. Push upwards until your arms are fully extended, keeping your back straight. Slowly lower the weights back down to the initial position. Maintain a controlled motion throughout the exercise. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Sit on the machine with your legs apart and your feet on the pedals Push your legs apart to the sides as far as you can Pause for a moment, then slowly return to the starting position

Sit on the machine with your back straight against the support Place your legs on the pads provided, adjusting the machine so that you can push outwards comfortably Push your legs out to do the hip abduction, pause for a moment, then control as you bring them back in Perform the desired number of repetitions Perform this exercise with a control and slow pace

Sit on the machine with your legs on the pads. Adjust the machine lever to fit your range of motion. Press both legs against the pads to push them apart. Pause for a moment, then pull the legs back together. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Sit on the machine with your back flush against the pad Place your legs on the provided pads with your knees bent Press both levers together using your inner thighs Slowly let the levers move back to start position

Sit on the seat of the machine, placing your inner thighs against the provided pads Adjust the machine lever so that it's comfortable for you Starting from an extended position, bring your thighs together against the resistance Hold for a moment then return to the starting position Repeat for desired number of reps

Sit on the leverage machine with your knees at a 90-degree angle and feet flat on the platform Place your inner thighs against the machine's pads Push your legs together against the resistance Return to the start by letting your legs move apart slowly

Adjust the machine to fit your height and sit on the provided seat Place your lower calves under the padded lever Lever your legs upward, bending at the knees Pause briefly at the top of the movement Lower the weight back to the start position

Sit on the machine with your back against the pad Position your legs under the pad, with your feet pointing forward Grip the handles for additional stability Pull the pad toward your buttocks by flexing at the knee Return your legs to the starting position in a controlled manner

Sit on the machine with your back against the back support pad. Place your feet on the provided footrests, thighs under the lever pad. Extend legs upward until they're straight, without locking the knees. Lower the weight back down to the starting position. Repeat the steps for the number of required repetitions.

Sit down on the machine with your legs under the pad, feet pointing forward Slowly extend your legs to the maximum as you exhale. Ensure that the rest of the body remains stationary Hold the contracted position for a second, then slowly lower the weight back to the starting position as you breathe in. Ensure that the legs are fully extended and contracted Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Position yourself on the leg press machine with your back against the seat and feet placed shoulder-width apart on the foot platform Push through your heels and extend your legs completely, but without locking your knees Lower the weight back to start position in a controlled manner, making sure not to let the weights touch Repeat this for the desired number of reps

Sit on the machine with your back against the padded support Place your feet on the platform shoulder-width apart Push the platform away using your heels and quadriceps Return to the initial position while keeping tension on your muscles Repeat for the desired number of reps

Sit on the machine with your back and head against the pad Place your feet shoulder-width apart on the foot platform Push the platform away by extending your knees and hips Return to the start position by bending your knees and hips

Sit on the machine with your back against the pad, feet shoulder-width apart on the platform Hold the handlebars on the sides Raise your legs until your body makes a 90 degrees angle Hold this position for a moment and then lower your legs back down

Sit on the lever machine with your back against the pad Place your feet on the platform in front of you Crunch forward by bending at your waist and lifting your legs Lower your legs and torso back to the starting position in a slow, controlled manner Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Lever Seated Neutral grip Reverse Fly
description_en: Sit on the bench of the leverage machine, aligning your chest with the chest pad Grasp the handles of the machine with a neutral grip Pull the handles back and out until your arms are parallel with your body Pause and feel the contraction in your upper back Slowly return to the original position in a controlled manner

Sit on the lever machine seat with one leg on the pad and the other hanging to the side Grasp the handles to stabilize your upper body Using your hamstring, curl your leg up as far as possible Pause briefly at the top, then lower the leg back down in a controlled fashion Switch legs and repeat the exercise

Sit on the machine with your back against the backrest Place the leg to be worked under the padded lever Brace core and lift the lever by flexing your knee Lower the lever back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching legs

Sit on the machine with your chest against the pad Grasp the handles with your arms extended Pull the handles apart, while keeping your arms parallel to the ground Hold for a second then return to the start position

Adjust the machine to fit your height and sit squarely on the seat, feet flat on the floor Grip the handles with your palms facing inward Pull the handles outwards until your arms are parallel to the floor Return the handles slowly until your arms are in line with your shoulders Repeat for the specified number of repetitions

Sit on the leverage machine with your chest against the pad Hold the handles, palms facing each other Pull the handles apart as far as you can, focusing on your shoulder blades Slowly return to the start position in a controlled manner Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions

Sit on the seat of the leverage machine and place your feet on the provided platform Grab the handles and fully extend your arms Pull the handles back until your elbows are drawn past your torso Pause for a moment, then slowly return to the initial position Repeat the motion for your desired number of repetitions

Sit on the machine and place your feet on the foot supports Grasp the handles and pull back until your torso is at ninety degrees Pull the handles towards your torso while keeping your torso stationary Hold at the peak of contraction and then slowly return to the starting position Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Sit down on the machine with your feet on the provided platform and your chest against the pad. Grab the handles and without moving your torso, pull them towards your chest. Hold for a moment, squeezing your back muscles. Slowly return to the starting position, letting your lats stretch. Repeat for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

Sit on the machine with your feet on the crossbar and your chest against the pads Grasp the handles with your palms facing each other Pull the handles back until your elbows are beside your body Hold this position briefly Slowly extend your arms and return to the starting position

Sit on the machine with your feet on the provided pads, lean slightly forward and grasp the handles Pull the handles back, making sure to keep your torso upright and your elbows close to your body Squeeze your shoulder blades together as you reach your chest Return to the starting position in a controlled manner

Sit on the machine with your back pressed against the pad Place your hands on the handles Push the handles upwards until your arms are fully extended Lower the weight back down to the starting position Repeat the process for the desired number of reps

Adjust the seat so that the handles are at shoulder level Keep your back pressed firmly against the seat Push the handles upwards until your arms are fully extended Lower the handles back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on the machine with one foot on the foot platform Push the platform away using the quad of your extended leg Return to the initial position slowly Switch legs and repeat the action Make sure to keep your back firmly on the backrest

name_en: Lever Seated Single Leg Squat Calf Raise on Leg Press Machine
description_en: Sit on the machine with one foot on the platform and the other foot on the knee of the working leg Push the platform by extending your knee As the knee is fully extended, raise your heel by extending your ankle Lower the heel by flexing the ankle, return to the initial position Repeat with the other foot

name_en: Lever Seated Squat Calf Raise on Leg Press Machine
description_en: Seat on the machine with your feet placed on the platform shoulder-width apart Push the sled away by extending your knees and hips Raise your heels up by performing calf raise Lower your heels back down slowly Repeat the exercise as per your routine

name_en: Lever Seated Squat Calf Raise on Leg Press Machine
description_en: Sit on the machine with your shoulders below the pads Place your feet on the platform with the balls of your feet and toes Push the platform by extending your knees and hips Lower the weight by bending your knees until your ankles are flexed Push the weight back up by extending your ankles

Sit on the seat with your back firm against the backrest Hold onto the handles of the leverage machine Rotate your torso towards one side until you feel a stretch, keeping your back against the backrest Slowly return to the starting position Repeat the movement on the other side

Sit on the machine with your hips firmly against the seat Grasp the handles of the machine Rotate your torso to one side until you feel a stretch Reverse the motion, rotating to the other side Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions

Sit on the machine's seat and grasp the handles. Start by pushing the handles upwards until your arms are fully extended. Lower the handles back to the starting position in a controlled manner. Keep your back firmly against the seat during the exercise. Repeat this for your desired number of repetitions.

Sit on the leverage machine with your chest against the pad Grip the handles above shoulder level Push the handles upwards until your arms are fully extended Lower the handles back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise for your desired number of repetitions
Stand upright and grasp lever handles with both hands. Raise shoulders or shrug shoulders towards ears. Lower and repeat the movement for desired number of reps.

Stand in front of the machine and grab the handles at shoulder width Begin the exercise by lifting your shoulders up towards your ears Hold for a second at the top, then lower your shoulders back down Maintain a straight back throughout the movement Repeat this movement for your desired number of reps

Position yourself on the machine with one side facing the pad Place the outer thigh against the pad Push your leg sideways against the pad until your hip is fully abducted Return your leg to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise with the other leg
Sit at the machine with your chest against the pad Adjust the lever and grip the handle Push forward and extend your arm completely Slowly Bring the lever back to the initial position

name_en: Lever Single Arm Neutral Grip Seated Row
description_en: Sit on the machine with your feet planted firmly. Grip the handle with one hand, arm straight. Pull the handle towards you, keeping your elbow close to your side. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement. Slowly return the handle to the starting position.

name_en: Lever Single Arm Reverse Grip High Row
description_en: Sit on the leverage machine and hold the handle with reverse grip Pull the handle towards your upper body while keeping your back straight Squeeze your back muscles as you reach your chest Slowly release back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Sit on the machine with your back against the backrest and one foot placed on the lever Push the lever upward until your leg is fully extended Pause briefly at the top Lower the lever back to the starting position, controlling the movement Repeat with the other leg

Position yourself in the lever squat machine with your chest against the pad Bend the knees and lower yourself until the thighs are parallel to the floor Push through the heels to straighten the legs and return to the starting position Repeat the process for the desired number of repetitions

Position yourself under the padded lever, feet shoulder width apart Bend your knees and lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the floor Press through your heels to return to the starting position Make sure your knees stay in line with your toes throughout the movement Maintain a straight back during the exercise

Position yourself upright in the leverage machine Position your shoulders under the pads provided Push down into your toes to raise your body upwards Ensure you're feeling the tension in your calves, not your toes Slowly lower your heels back to the starting position

Stand on the machine platform with your shoulders under the pads Push upwards by extending your ankles as high as possible Pause at the top and contract your calves Slowly lower back down to the starting position Keep your core tight and maintain body posture throughout

Stand facing the lever machine with the pad resting against your right ankle Keep a small bend in your standing leg, holding onto the machine for support Slowly push your right leg back, lifting it as high as you feel comfortable Hold for a second, then lower your leg back to the starting position Repeat the movement for the number of reps you want, then switch to the other leg

Stand facing the lever machine with your chest against the pad Place the lever pad against your lower leg, just above the ankle Keeping your body stable, push the lever back using your glutes and hamstrings Hold the position for a moment, flexing your glutes Slowly return the lever to the starting position

Stand facing the lever machine with one foot on the platform Grip the handholds firmly Push back your foot against the lever, extending your hip Return your foot to the initial position Repeat the exercise with the other leg

Stand in front of the lever machine, facing away and grab the handles Bend your knee and place your foot on the pad Extend your leg backwards, engaging your glutes and quads Hold the peak position for a second Slowly return your foot back to the starting position

Stand up straight in front of the machine with your body facing the machine Grab the handles of the machine and lift one foot to place it on the footpad of the lever Push down the footpad using your hamstrings and glutes until your leg is fully extended Slowly return the lever back to your starting position Switch legs and repeat the exercise

Approach the leverage machine and grip the handles Place one foot on the lever while keeping the other on the ground Push the lever down using your foot and then alternate your feet Continue this pattern at a steady pace for the selected duration of time Finish by allowing the machine to slow down naturally before stepping off

Approach the leverage machine and grab the handles Start stepping by pushing the levers alternatingly, keeping a brisk pace Engage your core and maintain an upright posture throughout your workout Focus on using the machine to simulate a stepping action, rather than a swinging action Remember to slow down towards the end of your workout to cool down

Stand on the lever stepper and position your feet shoulder-width apart Bend your knees slightly and keep your back straight Push down on the stepper using your leg muscles Allow the stepper to lift back up in a controlled manner Repeat this process

Stand on the platform, grabbing the handles of the leverage machine Start with one foot on the lower pedal and the other one on the higher Swap your foot position by applying force using your calves, glutes, and hamstrings Continue the up and down motion maintaining a fluid rhythm Maintain your posture, keeping your back straight and chest out throughout the exercise

Stand on the platform and grip the handles below your chest Keep your back straight and pull the lever towards your chest Hold the position for a moment and then return to the starting position Make sure to exhale while pulling the lever and inhale while returning

Approach the lever t-bar row machine and load the desired weight onto it Stand on the machine's platform facing the t-bar, your feet shoulder-width apart Bend your knees slightly and lean forward, keeping your back straight Grasp the handles, keeping your arms extended Pull the bar towards your midsection, squeezing your shoulder blades together at peak contraction

Sit on the machine with your feet secured under the pads Grasp the handles of the machine Curl your body downwards, aiming to bring your chest and knees together Hold the contraction for a moment Slowly uncurl your body to return to the starting position

Sit on the machine with your back against the pad. Grasp the handles and push downwards until your arms are fully extended. Slowly lower the weight, allowing your elbows to bend until a slight stretch is felt in your chest or shoulder. Push back to the starting position and repeat.

Adjust the lever machine to an appropriate height and load Stand tall, keep your elbows close to your body and grab the handle with both hands. Push the handle down until your arm is fully extended but not locked. Slowly bring the handle back up to the starting position. Repeat the motion for the desired number of reps.

Adjust the lever arm to your height and sit under it Hold the handles with an overhead grip Push the handles down until your arms are fully extended Raise your arms back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise for the desired repetitions

Sit down at a leverage machine, with your back resting against the pad Grab the handles with an overhand grip and extend your arms Bend your elbows and lower the handles down Push the handles back up until your arms are fully extended Repeat for your desired number of reps

Stand behind the lever machine with your feet shoulder width apart Hold the lever handle with your two hands behind your head Keeping your elbows close to your head, extend your arms straight up Lower the handle in a slow controlled motion until your elbows are fully flexed Repeat this motion for your desired number of repetitions

Start by adjusting the machine to align with the height of your shoulder or slightly lower. Grip the handle with an overhand grip and keep your feet positioned shoulder-width apart. Extend your arm, pushing the handle downward until your arm is fully extended. Hold for a moment then gradually return back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Set up the lever machine to the correct height Grasp the handles with palms facing down Slowly extend your arms and push the lever downwards Pause for a moment at the end of movement Slowly return the lever to the starting position

Position yourself sideways on the machine Hold the handles of the lever machine Rotate your torso towards the machine while keeping your back straight Return to the starting position slowly Repeat the procedure for the other side

Stand facing the lever machine with your feet shoulder-width apart Grasp the lever handle with your right hand Pull the lever towards your abdomen Hold the position for a second and then return to the starting position Repeat with the left hand

Stand under the lever machine with your feet shoulder-width apart and toes pointing slightly out Hold the handles and engage your core Lower your body by bending at the knees until your thighs are at least parallel to the floor Push through your heels to return to the starting position Repeat the process for the desired number of repetitions

Start on your hands and knees in a tabletop position Step your right foot forward to the outside of your right hand Lower your left knee to the floor Stay in this position, feeling the stretch in your hips and thighs Switch sides and repeat

Start in a high plank position, with your hands placed underneath your shoulders and your feet hip-width apart. Step your right foot to the outside of your right hand. Your knee should be bent. Lower your left knee onto the floor or keep it raised, depending on your flexibility Hold this pose for 30 seconds, then switch sides and repeat Make sure to breathe deeply through your stretches

Start in a high plank position, with your shoulders directly over your wrists Step your right foot to the outside of your right hand Keep your right knee in line with your right ankle Either keep your left knee lifted with your leg engaged, or lower your knee to the ground for a more restful posture Return to plank and repeat on the other side

Lie flat on your belly, arms at your sides Raise your head, upper body, arms, and legs away from the floor Stretch your arms back towards your legs Hold the pose as long as it feels comfortable, breathing naturally Slowly return your body to the floor

Lie face down on your mat with your arms at your sides Lift your head, upper body, arms, and legs up from the floor Reach your arms back towards your feet and focus on the length from your fingers to your toes Hold the pose for 30 seconds - 1 minute Release the pose slowly, lowering yourself back to the mat

Lie down on the floor with your legs at a 90 degree angle, raise your arms above your head Contract your abs and raise your torso, keeping your arms straight Gradually lower your body back to the ground Avoid using your neck or shoulders to pull your body up Repeat for the required number of reps

Lie flat on the ground with your arms fully extended above your head Bend your knees keeping your feet flat on the ground Engage your abs and lift your shoulder blades off the ground towards your knees Lower yourself back to the ground in a controlled manner

Lie down on your back and fold your knees while your arms resting on the floor overhead. Raise your torso off the floor along with your arms towards your knees Hold for a while, then return to the starting position slowly

Warm up with a 5-minute brisk walk or light jog Maintain a comfortable pace that allows you to talk without gasping for breath Keep your shoulders relaxed and your hands loose Drive your arms forward and back at a 90-degree angle Cool down with a 5-minute walk or a slow-pace jog

Stand with your feet hip-width apart Bend your knees and sit back into a squatting position, swinging your arms back Jump forward as far as comfortably possible, swinging your arms forward to add momentum Attempt to land lightly and smoothly, bending your knees to absorb the impact

Stand facing a wall, about an arm's length away Place your hands on the wall, shoulder width apart and straight Step back with your feet until your body is at a slight angle Keep your body straight and hold the position Return to the starting position and repeat

Sit on the floor with your back straight Bend your right knee and bring the foot towards your left hip Bend your left knee and place the foot on your right hip Place your hands on your knees with your palm facing up Inhale deeply through your nose, hold for a few seconds, then exhale

Start by standing straight. Step your left foot forward, bending it at about 90 degrees. Keep your right knee on the floor and push your hips forward. Maintain this position while keeping your upper body straight. Breathe deeply and hold the lunge for 20-30 seconds. Repeat on the other side for balance.

Start in a standing position and step one foot forward Lower your body until your front knee is at a 90-degree angle Keep your back knee off the floor and hold the stretch Return to standing position and repeat with the other leg Continue alternating legs

Stand tall with feet hip-width apart, engage your core Step forward with your right foot, lower your body until right knee is at a 90 degree angle and left knee is touching the ground Keep your right knee aligned with your ankle and both hands on the knee Hold this position, breathe deeply in this stretch for up to a minute Switch legs and repeat

Start by standing upright and taking a big step forward with your left foot Lower your body until your left knee forms a right angle Try to keep your right leg straight and the back foot flat on the ground Lift your torso and spread your hands sideways or above your head Hold this pose for 20-30 seconds then switch sides

Start by kneeling on your right knee with your left foot forward Lean forward and drop your chest slightly until you feel a stretch in the front of your right hip Straighten your left leg and flex your foot while leaning your chest forward to enter the hamstring stretch Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds Switch sides and repeat the steps

Begin in a lunge position with your right foot forward, knee bent and your left leg extended straight behind you Bring your left hand to the ground and twist your upper body to the right as you extend your right hand toward the ceiling Hold this position for a few seconds Slowly return to the starting position and switch sides

name_en: Low Lunge Yoga Pose Anjaneyasana I
description_en: Start in a standing position, then step one foot forward, bending it into a lunge Lower your back knee onto the ground Raise your arms above your head while keeping your shoulders relaxed Hold the pose for a few deep breaths before switching legs Repeat the process with the other leg

Start in a low plank position with your body in a straight line. Engage your core and keep your back flat. Raise one leg into the air, keeping it straight. Lower it back down slowly. Repeat with the other leg.

name_en: Low resistance band lying bicep curl
description_en: Lie down on a bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Hold the ends of the resistance band above your thighs with your arms slightly bent and palms facing the ceiling. Pull the band towards the shoulders by bending your arms Return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Low resistance band lying bicep curl half rep
description_en: Lie down on a bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Hold the ends of the resistance band above your thighs with your arms slightly bent and palms facing the ceiling. Stretch the band up by folding your arms to a 90 angle Hold for a while and return to the starting position.

Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended Raise your legs straight out in front of you, keeping a 90-degree bend at the waist Pull your body up until your chin is over the bar Lower your body until your arms and legs are straight again Try to maintain the 90-degree angle in your hips throughout the exercise

Sit on the floor with your legs straight in front of you Place your palms on the floor next to your hips Push your body up off the floor while keeping your legs straight Hold this position for as long as you can Lower yourself back down in a controlled manner

Start by hanging from a pull-up bar with your legs extended out in front of you Your body should be making an 'L' shape Pull yourself up until your chin is above the bar Lower yourself down in a controlled manner Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Start in an L-sit position with your hands on the floor next to your hips Lift your hips off the floor and maintain balance Extend your legs out in front in a 'kicking' motion Pull your legs back into the L-sit position Repeat the motion for desired reps

Sit on the chair with your hands either side of your hips Press down into the chair to lift your body up Extend your legs out in front of you, with your feet together Hold this position for as long as you can Slowly lower yourself back onto the chair

Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you Place your hands next to your hips, fingers pointing towards your feet Press down into your hands and lift your body off the floor Hold the position for a few seconds Lower yourself back to the floor

Sit on the ground with your legs extended in front of you Grasp the pull-up bar with your hands slightly wider than shoulder width apart Lift your body off the ground while keeping your legs straight and parallel to the ground Pull yourself up until your chest touches the bar Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Step forward with one foot until your leg reaches a 90-degree angle Keep your other knee slightly off the ground Push off with your front foot and step back to return to the original position Repeat this movement with your other foot

Stand tall with your back straight, arms folded near your chest, and feet shoulder-width apart. Take a step back with your right foot and lower yourself unless your left thigh is parallel to the floor. Return to the initial position and kick forward by extending your leg to your waist. Repeat the whole sequence.

Stand tall with your back straight, arms by your sides, and feet shoulder-width apart. Take a big step forward and take your rear knee downwards unless your front thigh becomes parallel to the floor. Thrust your hips down and up multiple times before returning to the initial position.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and a resistance band under your left foot. Hold the ends of the band in your hands near your face. Take a step back with your right foot and lower yourself unless your left thigh is parallel to the floor. Hold for a while, then return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Lunge Rotation Left And Right Bodyweight
description_en: Start in a lunge position with your left knee resting on the floor behind your back and your right knee bent ahead of you with its thigh parallel to the floor. Form a standing position and raise your left knee while driving your leg forward. Return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Lunges Same Leg Side View Bodyweight
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight, arms hanging by your sides, and feet shoulder-width apart. Take a step forward, lower your rear knee to the floor, and bend your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position and repeat.

Start by standing tall, ensuring your feet are hip-width apart Step forward with one foot until your leg reaches a 90-degree angle Lower your body until your back knee is nearly touching the floor Hold the position for a few seconds Return to the starting position and repeat with the other leg

Stand upright with feet together Take a step forward with one foot and lower your body until your front knee is bent at 90 degrees Hold for a moment and then push back up to return to the starting position Repeat the same with the other leg Perform this alternately on both sides

name_en: Lunge To Knee Drive Left Bodyweight
description_en: Start in a lunge position with a straight back, rear knee resting on the floor, and the front thigh parallel to the floor with your knee bent. Form a standing position and raise your left knee forward while driving your leg. Return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Lunge To Knee Drive Right Bodyweight
description_en: Start in a lunge position with your right knee resting on the floor behind your back and your left knee bent ahead of you with its thigh parallel to the floor. Form a standing position and raise your right knee while driving your leg forward. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand up straight, feet hip-width apart, and engage your core Step forward with your right foot and lower your body until your right knee is bent to 90 degrees Twist your torso to the right as you hold the lunge position Push off your right foot to return to the starting position Repeat the movement with your left foot stepping forward and twisting to the left side

Stand straight with your feet hip width apart Take a step forward with one foot and lower your body into a lunge Push off with both feet, jumping straight up and switching the position of your feet in midair Land softly with your knees bent Repeat the exercise for a desired number of repetitions

Start in a standing position, feet hip-width apart Step forward with your right foot into a lunge, bending your knee at a 90-degree angle Push off your front foot, raising your right leg into a lift as you return to standing Repeat on the opposite side for one rep Perform the desired number of reps

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Step forward with one foot into a lunge position Twist your upper body to the side of the forward leg Return to the starting position and repeat for the other side Continue alternating between sides for the desired number of reps

Stand tall with a straight back and take a step forward while keeping your hands at your waist. Bend your front knee while keeping your rear leg straight and your foot in place. Maintain this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Lie flat on your back on the floor with your arms by your sides. Lift your feet off the ground, keeping them together, and raise them to a point where they are about 6 inches off the ground. Engage your abdominal muscles to hold this position. Keep your lower back pressed to the floor. Maintain the position for as long as you can, aim for at least 30 seconds to 1 minute.

Lie flat on your back with your arms extended above you Lift your legs 90 degrees off the floor and bend your knees at a 90 degree angle Lift your shoulders off the ground and tap your hands to your ankles Lower your shoulders back to the ground Repeat for the desired number of reps
Lie down on your stomach with your legs extended on the floor. Place your hands on the floor near your head and lift your torso off the floor. Maintain this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Lie face down on the floor, with your legs straight out behind you Place your hands on the floor, slightly wider than shoulder width Push your upper body up slowly while keeping your hips and lower half touching the ground Hold this upward stretch for a few seconds Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position
Get down onto all fours Extend your legs behind you and lay down flat Place your palms by your sides Raise your upper body by extending your arms Hold the position for 15-30 seconds before resting

Lie down on your side with your legs extended out straight Keeping your lower leg on the floor, slowly lift your top leg as high as comfortable Lower your top leg back down slowly to meet your bottom leg Repeat for a desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other side Maintain a straight body alignment throughout the exercise

name_en: Lying Abduction Leg Raise on floor
description_en: Lie down flat on your back on the floor Bend one knee and keep your foot flat on the floor Raise your other leg keeping it straight, as high as you can without causing discomfort Lower your straight leg back to the floor Switch legs and repeat the exercise

Lie down on your back on a flat surface Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the floor Spread your knees apart as far as you can and let them drop to the side Hold this position for 15-30 seconds Slowly close your knees and come back to the start position

Lie on your back on a mat with knees bent and hands arranged at each side Lift your legs into the air so that they are parallel to the ground, while keeping them bend at the knees Pull your waist up and hold this position as long as possible Lower your waist and legs back to the starting position Repeat this exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Lie down on your back and fold your knees while keeping your feet on the floor Bring your elbows forward while bending your arms and grab the handles of the band over your head Pull the handles of the band by raising your chest off the floor and bringing your elbows towards your knees Return to the starting position slowly and repeat

Lie down on your back with your hands placed lightly behind your head Bring your knees towards your chest with your legs bent Extend your left leg out while bringing your right knee towards your chest, and simultaneously move your left elbow towards your right knee Alternate the opposite elbow to knee connection while extending the other leg Perform this cycling motion for the desired number of repetitions

Lie on your back with your hands either side of your body Raise your legs off the ground, and bend your knees at a 90 degree angle With your thighs, simulate the motion of cycling Continue pedaling in the air with controlled movements Breathe regularly throughout the exercise

Lie flat on your back with your palms facing down Bend one knee and pull it toward your chest Lower the bent leg slowly back to the start position Repeat the same for the other leg Alternate between the legs for the set duration

Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Spread your knees apart in a controlled manner until you feel a stretch in your hips Bring your knees back to the starting position Repeat the exercise for the recommended number of repetitions Switch sides and repeat the exercise with the other leg

Lie flat on your back on a gym mat with your hands by your sides or underneath your glutes for support Keep your legs fully extended, lift one leg off the ground Alternate the movement with your other leg, creating a flutter kick motion Try to keep your hips in contact with your mat Keep alternating kicks for desired amount of reps or time

Lie down on your back with your hands by your sides. Bend your knees and bring them towards your chest. Simultaneously extend one leg while bringing the other knee towards your chest. Switch and repeat with the opposite knee and leg. Continue alternating this movement for your desired rep count.

Lie flat on your back with your legs fully extended and arms at your sides Raise both legs off the ground, and bend one knee as you pull it towards your chest. As you lower it, repeat the same movement with the other leg. Continue alternating legs as if youre doing a pedaling movement. Repeat the action for a desired number of reps or until fatigue

Lie flat on your stomach with arms at your sides Tighten your glutes and lift one leg off the ground, keeping it straight Lower your leg back down to the ground Repeat with the other leg Alternate legs for each rep

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground Slowly lift your right hip off the ground, keeping your left foot stationary Hold the position at the top for a second Lower your hip to the ground and repeat with your left hip Alternate for the desired amount of repetitions

Lie down on your back with both your legs and arms fully extended Keep one leg straight and lift the other one up towards your chest as far as you can Hold the position for a second and lower it back to the starting position Repeat the same on the other leg Continue alternating legs for the desired number of reps

name_en: Lying Alternate Posterior Pelvic Shift Hold
description_en: Lie flat on the ground, keeping your legs straight Lift one leg off the ground, pulling your knee to your chest Hold for a few seconds, then switch legs Repeat with the other leg Continue alternating legs for the desired amount of time or reps

Lie down on your back with palms flat on the ground Extend one leg towards the ceiling, keeping the other one flat on the ground Rotate the raised leg in a circular motion Lower the leg back onto the floor in a controlled movement Repeat on the opposite leg

Lie flat on your back on a mat with your arms by your sides and your legs extended out straight Lift your left leg up to about 45 degrees while keeping your right leg flat on the ground Make a circular motion with your lifted leg Lower your leg down and repeat the circular motion with the right leg

Lie flat on the floor with your hands under your hips for support Lift one leg into the air, keeping it straight as you do so Lower the leg back down without letting it touch the floor Repeat this action with the other leg Alternate repeatedly between each leg

Lie down on your back with your hands resting by your sides Lift your legs so they are 90 degrees from the floor, with your knees bent Alternately lower each leg until your toe taps the floor, then return it to the starting position Keep your lower back pressed into the floor throughout the movement Switch legs and repeat the movement

Lie down flat on your back and extend your arms straight above your head Simultaneously lift one leg and your opposite arm towards each other while contracting your abdominal muscles Try to touch your toe with your fingers, or reach as far as you comfortably can Lower your leg and arm back down, and repeat with the opposite limbs Alternate sides for a set number of repetitions or for a determined period of time

Lie flat on your back on the ground with your arms straight above your head Lift your right leg and left arm up at the same time to meet in the middle of your body Lower your arm and leg back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the same process for your left leg and right arm Continue to alternate between right leg/left arm and left leg/right arm

Lie flat on your back with your arms extended above your head Bend one knee and bring it towards your chest while lifting your head and shoulders off the ground Return to the starting position and repeat the motion with your other knee Maintain a steady rhythm and keep your movements controlled throughout Continue alternating knees for the designated reps or time

Lie down flat on your back on a comfortable surface. Raise one leg off the ground, keeping it almost straight, while ensuring your other leg remains flat. Slowly flex your ankle, moving your toes towards your knee. Hold for a few seconds then slowly extend, pointing your toes away from your knee. Alternate each ankle and repeat for the desired number of sets.

Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Keep a neutral spine by maintaining a relaxed small lumbar arch. Tilt the pelvis backward by contracting your abdominal muscles and pulling your belly button towards the spine. Hold for the prescribed duration and relax. Repeat the exercise for the recommended number of repetitions or time.

Lie on your side with your head supported by your hand or arm With your top arm straight and palm facing down, slowly lift it as far as you can until you feel a stretch Hold for a few seconds Slowly lower your arm back down Switch sides and repeat with the other arm

Lie flat on your back with your arms extended out to the sides Keeping your arms straight, move them upwards in a semi-circular arc Reach a point where the hands meet above your body Lower your arms back to the starting position in the same semi-circular manner Repeat the movement for the desired amount of reps

Lie flat on your back on a flat surface with your arms extended out to your sides Keeping your arms straight, bring them up overhead and together Return to the starting position by separating your arms and moving them back out to your sides Maintain a controlled motion throughout the entire exercise Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Lie down flat on your back with your arms extended out to the sides Lift your arms from the ground in a wide arc motion until they meet above your chest Slowly lower your arms back down to the starting position following the same wide arc motion Keep your arms straight during the entire movement Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions
Get down on your belly with your legs straight and toes touching the floor. Place your hands behind your head and lift your chest off the floor. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Lie face down on the floor with your hands by your sides Using your lower back muscles, raise your upper body off the ground until you're looking straight ahead Hold the position for a moment Slowly lower your upper body back to the floor Repeat the movement for desired repetitions

Lie face down on the floor with your arms by your sides Lift your chest and legs off the ground, contracting your back and glute muscles Hold this position for a moment Lower your body back down to the start position in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise for your desired number of repetitions

Lie down flat on your back with your arms spread out beside you Raise your legs off the ground while bending your knees at 90 degrees Move your legs in a figure 8 pattern Keep your movements controlled and steady Return your legs to the starting position and repeat

name_en: Lying Bent Knee Raise and Extend
description_en: Lie flat on your back with your hands by your sides. Bend your knees and raise them towards your chest. Once they reach chest-height, extend your legs outwards without touching the ground. Pull them back to your chest and then lower them to the original position. Repeat the process.

Lie flat on your back with your arms extended out to your sides. Bend your knees and keep your feet flat on the floor. Slowly roll your bent knees to one side, trying to touch your knees to the floor. Hold this position for a moment and then slowly roll your knees back to the start position. Repeat this movement for the other side.

Lie down on your back, with your arms placed on the side Bend your knees and keep your feet on the floor Lift both your legs towards your chest keeping your knees bent Lower your legs back to the starting position, keeping the movement controlled

Lie on your back, with your arms extended by your sides and your palms pressing down into the floor. Bend your knees, and lift your feet off the floor till your thighs are perpendicular to the floor. Tuck your knees towards your chest, curling your pelvis and upper body off the floor. Hold this position briefly before uncurling and returning to the starting position. Repeat the exercise for the desired amount of repetitions.

Lie down on the floor and hold one end of the towel with the weighted object tied at its other end Keep your elbow still and close to your torso Pull the towel towards your shoulder, contracting your bicep as you do so Hold at the top momentarily Slowly lower the towel back down

Lie flat on your back on the floor with your hands gently holding your head Bring your knees in towards your chest with your shoulder blades off the ground Straighten your right leg out while simultaneously turning your upper body to the left, bringing your right elbow towards your left knee Rotate your body and repeat on the other side, bringing your left elbow to your right knee Continue alternating sides in a 'pedaling' motion for each rep

Lie flat on your back on the floor with your hands behind your head Bring your knees towards your chest, and lift your shoulders off the floor without pulling on your neck Straighten your right leg while turning your upper body to the left, bringing your right elbow towards your left knee Switch sides to perform the same action on the opposite side, this completes one rep Continue in this manner, alternating sides for each rep

Lie flat on your stomach with your hands by your sides Bend your knees and bring your heels towards your buttocks Squeeze your glutes at the top of the movement Slowly lower your legs back to the starting position Repeat this move for the desired number of repetitions

Lie down on your back with your feet flat on the floor and your knees bent. Spread your legs apart as far as you can by contracting your hip adductors. Hold this position for 2-3 seconds. Slowly bring your legs back to the starting position. Repeat the move for the desired number of repetitions.

Lie on your back with your legs straight and spread wide. Place your hands behind your head, elbows flared outwards. Crunch your upper body forward while simultaneously bringing your legs inward, bending them at the knees until your elbows and knees touch. Slowly lower your body back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Lie on your back, legs extended and arms out to your sides. Raise your legs until they're perpendicular to the ground. Keep your legs straight and lift your hips off the ground. Lower your hips back down, and then lower your legs back to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.

Lie on your back on the floor Keep your right leg resting on the floor with slight bend at the knee Raise your left leg up and grab it gently with both hands around the calf Pull the leg back gently until you feel a stretch in your calf Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then switch to the other leg

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet on the ground Place your hands next to your body or under your hips for stability Slowly raise your head off the ground, bringing your chin to your chest Hold the position for a few seconds Slowly lower your head back to the ground

Lie flat on your back with knees bent and feet on the floor Tuck your chin towards your chest Hold for a moment, then return to the starting position Make sure not to lift your head off the floor Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions

Lie flat on your back on the ground Cross your arms over your chest with your hands touching opposite shoulders Lift your legs off the ground to about a 45 degree angle, keeping them straight Cross your legs over each other, alternating which leg is on top Lower your legs to complete one repetition

Lie flat on your back with your arms extended out to the sides Raise your legs until your feet are directly above your hips Lower your left leg and touch your right ankle with your left hand Return to the starting position Repeat on the other side, touching your left ankle with your right hand

name_en: Lying Cross Over Knee Pull Down Stretch
description_en: Lie flat on your back with arms outstretched in a T position Bend your right knee and cross it over the left side of your body Hold this position for a few seconds for a good stretch Slowly bring your knee back to the center and then lower it back down Repeat this movement on the left side
Lie on your back on the floor Lift one of your knee and cross it over the other leg Slowly press the lifted knee towards the ground Hold the position for a moment to stretch Switch legs and repeat

Lie down on your back with your legs straight, and arms spread wide at shoulder height. Raise one of your knees above the hip and curl it towards the opposite side while pressing it down with your opposite hand. Maintain this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Lie flat on your back with your legs straight on the floor. Place your hands behind your head or across your chest. Engage your abs and lift your head and shoulder blades off the ground. Lower yourself back down. Repeat this motion without resting your upper body on the ground between reps.

Lie on your back on the floor keeping your legs straight Place your hands behind your head and form a 'V' Lift your head and shoulders off the floor, drawing in your abdominals Slowly return to the starting position Repeat these steps for the recommended number of repetitions

Lie on your back with knees bent and soles of the feet flat on the ground Place hands beside your head or across your chest Perform a crunch by lifting your upper body and crunch through your legs Lower yourself back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the movement for the preferred number of repetitions

Lie flat on the floor with your lower back pressed to the ground Put your hands beside your head Raise your shoulders into a curl while pulling in your abdomen towards your spine Raise your right elbow and left knee towards each other while straightening the right leg Switch sides and do the same motion on the other side to complete one rep

Lie down on your back with your hands by your sides Bend your knees and bring your feet together Lift your hips off the floor while squeezing your glutes Lower down in a controlled manner Repeat the movement for the desired amount of reps

Lie flat on your stomach with your hands clasped behind you Bend both of your knees while kicking your heels to your buttock twice After two kicks, lower your feet while extending your arms and chest off the floor Return to the initial position and repeat

Lie flat on your stomach with your legs together and arms extended forward Bend your knees and kick your heels towards your buttocks Extend your legs back and lift your chest off the ground while pulling your arms back Return to the initial position in a controlled manner Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

name_en: Lying Double Legs Biceps Curl with Towel
description_en: Lie face up on the floor and raise your legs, keeping them together Hold the ends of the towel with each hand and drape it over your upraised feet Flex your elbows and pull your hands towards your forehead, raising your upper body Lower your body, extend your elbows and return to the initial position Repeat the exercise as many times as required

name_en: Lying Double Legs Hammer Curl with Towel
description_en: Start by lying flat on your back with your legs extended and heels planted on the ground, holding a towel at both ends Pull the towel towards your body in a curling motion while lifting both legs off the ground Lower both legs while simultaneously uncurling your arms Repeat this motion for a desired number of repetitions

Lie flat on your stomach with your arms fully extended in front of you Keep your arms straight and sweep them to your side, lifting your chest off the ground Hold at the peak for a moment Lower back to the starting position

Start by lying on your back. Bend your knees and keep your feet flat on the ground. Place your hands slightly on the sides of your head. Take your right elbow and try to touch your left knee while extending your right leg out straight. Swap sides by taking your left elbow to your right knee while extending your left leg. Continue alternating between both sides.

Lie flat on your back with the palms of your hands under your lower back and your legs straight Curl your upper body forward and bring your right elbow to your left knee Lower your body back down in a controlled fashion Repeat the motion with the left elbow to the right knee Continue to alternate sides for the desired amount of repetitions

Lie on your back on the floor with your arms at your sides Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the floor Engage your core and lift your hips off the floor, creating a straight line from your knees to your shoulders Pause at the top, then lower your hips back down to the floor Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Lie down on your back, with your legs extended and your arms by your sides. Bend your knees and keep your feet flat on the floor. Raise your hips off the floor until your body forms a straight line. Hold this position for a few seconds. Slowly lower your hips back to the floor.

Lie on your side with legs straight and together Raise your top leg as high as you comfortably can Lower the top leg slowly and under control until it reaches the resting leg Switch sides and repeat with the opposite leg Cycle between each side for designated number of repetitions

Lie down on your back with your feet flat on the floor, knees bent. Extend your arms to your sides with your palms facing upwards. Raise your arms above your chest, keeping them slightly bent at the elbows. Lower your arms back down until they're almost touching the floor. Repeat the movement as many times as necessary.

Lie down on your stomach with your hands by your side Lift your upper body off the ground as high as comfortably possible Hold this position for a moment Lower your body back down to the starting position

Lie facedown on the floor with a towel wrapped around your feet Bend your knees slightly Lift your chest off the floor while extending through your spine  Hold at the top for a couple of seconds Return to start position and repeat as needed

name_en: Lying Floor Row with Bent Knee
description_en: Lie on your stomach on the floor, knees bent and feet in the air Extend your arms out in front of you Pull your elbow back towards your rib cage, keeping it close to your body Pause at the top, then slowly lower your arms back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

name_en: Lying Floor Row with Bent Knee
description_en: Start by lying on your stomach on the floor Bend your knees and keep your feet flat on the floor Extend your hands in front of you and then pull them towards your chest as if rowing Slowly lower your arms back to the starting position Repeat this movement for the desired number of reps

Lie flat on your back on the floor with your arms extended out to the sides, elbows bent at 90 degrees Keeping your arms and back flat against the floor, slide your arms upwards until they're straight above your head Slide them back down to the starting position Maintain a slow and controlled movement throughout the exercise Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Lie flat on your back with your hands placed behind your head Bring your knees in towards your chest with your feet together Contract your abs and lift your upper body while pressing your feet towards the floor Lower your body back down Repeat this for your desired number of repetitions

Lay on the floor with your legs bent and heels together Lift your shoulders and torso off the ground while squeezing your abdominals Lower your torso back to the ground in a controlled manner Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions Keep the heels together at all times during the exercise

Begin by lying flat on your back with your hands by your sides. Bring your knees up towards your chest with your feet together. Keep your knees together and move them away from your chest. Lower your feet until they are just above the ground. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

Start by lying flat on your back on a workout mat, hands behind your head Lift your legs off the floor while keeping your knees bent Kick out your legs straight and then pull them back in, keeping your feet off the floor throughout the movement Continue this motion of kicking out and pulling back

Lie on your back with your legs in the air, knees bent at a 90-degree angle, and soles of your feet touching each other Engage your core and ensure your back is flat on the floor Slowly lower your legs to the sides, keeping your heels together Raise your legs back to the starting position, squeezing your glutes at the top Repeat for the desired number of reps

Lie down on your back with your arms at your sides Keep your legs together and lift them off the floor Lift them as high as you can without discomfort or strain Hold this position for about 10-20 seconds Lower your legs slowly back down to the floor

Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet resting on the floor. Place your right foot over your left knee. Grab your left thigh just by curling your hands around it, and pull it towards your chest. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Lie on your back on a mat or carpeted floor Hug one knee into your chest, leaving the other leg extended straight out Use your hands to gently pull the knee closer to deepen the stretch Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds Repeat with the other leg

Lie flat on your back on a comfortable surface Bend one knee and bring your foot closer towards your buttock Place the ankle of your opposite leg over the knee of the bent one Gently press on the knee of the elevated leg until you feel a stretch in your glute Hold this position for 15-30 seconds, then switch sides and repeat

Lie on one side with your knees bent at a 90-degree angle Keep your feet together, and lift your top knee as high as you can Lower your knee back down in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise with the other leg before taking a break Perform the exercise sets as recommended by your trainer or the plan you are following

Lie on your side on the floor with your legs extended Lift your top leg, keeping it straight Lower the lifted leg across the lower leg, moving it towards the ground Pause for a moment, then lift your leg back up in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise and then switch sides

Lie on your side with your legs straight Slowly lift your top leg vertically upwards as far as comfortably possible Hold this position for 1-2 seconds Slowly lower your leg back to the initial position Repeat the exercise on the opposite side

Lie flat on your back with your arms at your sides Lift your legs and draw a circle in the air with your feet, moving your hips You should make sure the movement is controlled Continue this for several repetitions forming circular motion Switch your direction after a set of repetitions

name_en: Lying Hip Flexion with Knee Bent
description_en: Lie flat on your back on a mat with your arms by your sides Bend your right knee and pull it towards your chest without lifting your lower back Return your leg to the starting position Repeat this movement with your left leg Continue to alternate legs throughout the exercise

Lie down on your back with your legs straight, and arms spread wide at shoulder height. Raise your chest and legs off the floor and take one of your knees towards the chest. Grab the raised knee in your hands and pull it towards the chest. Maintain this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Lie flat on your back with your heels and calves draped over the stability ball Bend your knees and contract your glutes and hamstrings to lift your hips off the ground Lift until your hips, thighs, and torso are in a straight line Hold for a moment at the top before gently lowering your hips back to the ground Repeat the movement for your desired number of repetitions

Lie on your back and place your feet on the stability ball Place your arms by your sides for balance Push your hips up towards the ceiling, keeping your feet on the ball Hold at the top for a second Slowly lower your hips back to the floor

Start by laying flat on your back with your arms out to the sides in a T shape Bend your knees and lift your feet off the ground until your calves are parallel to the floor Now slowly let your knees fall to one side. Keep your upper back pressing down into the floor Hold this position for a few seconds before returning to the starting position Switch to the other side and repeat

Lie flat on your back with your legs straight and together Keep your back flat on the floor and hands by your sides Raise your legs perpendicular to the floor, maintaining their straightness Lower your legs back down, making sure not to touch the floor Repeat the movement

Lie down on your back with your arms at your sides Lift both legs into the air, keeping them straight Open your legs wide, then bring them back together for one repetition Repeat the movement keeping your legs straight and ensuring your back is pressed into the floor Contract your abs and glutes to perform the movement

Lie face down on the floor with your legs fully extended and arms outstretched in front of you Simultaneously lift your arms, chest, and legs off the ground and hold this position Keep your gaze forward and your neck in a neutral position Hold this position for a few seconds then slowly lower yourself back to the initial position Perform the necessary number of repetitions

Lie face down on a flat surface Extend your legs straight behind you with your toes pointed Engage your glute and hamstring muscles and raise your legs off the ground, keeping your legs straight Hold at the highest point where youre still comfortable Slowly lower your legs back down

Lie on your back, bending your knees and keeping your feet on the ground Pull one of your knees up to your chest and wrap your arms around it, hugging it close Hold this stretch for 15 to 30 seconds Lower your leg down gently, and then repeat with the other leg Perform this exercise on both legs 3 to 5 times

Lie flat on your back with your legs extended Bend one knee and pull it towards your chest, holding it with both hands Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds Slowly release and extend your leg back to the starting position Repeat the exercise with the other leg

Lie flat on your back with your arms by your sides. Bend your knees and bring them towards your chest while you exhale. Hold for a moment and then lower your legs down as you inhale. Keep your lower back in contact with the floor throughout the movement. Repeat the movement for your desired number of reps.

Lie down on the floor below the pull-down machine with your chest facing upwards Reach out and hold the pull-down bar with both hands at shoulder width Pull the bar down towards your chest in a controlled manner Pause briefly when the bar touches your chest Extend your arms and let the bar move back up to its initial position

Lie on your side with your legs stacked on top of each other Keeping your bottom leg on the ground, lift your top leg up towards the ceiling Slowly lower your top leg back down Repeat the exercise for the set number of reps Switch sides and repeat the process for your other leg

Lay on your side with your legs extended and stacked on top of each other Slowly raise your top leg as high as possible Lower your leg back down in a controlled movement Switch sides and repeat with the other leg Perform for the desired amount of reps

Lie flat on your back with your legs stretched out on the ground Raise your legs to a 90-degree angle Draw a circle in the air with your feet by slightly moving your hips Complete a full circle and then reverse the direction Lower your legs back to the ground and repeat

Lie on your back, legs stretched out freely. Raise one leg straight up and cross it over the other. Lower the raised leg slowly to the opposite side without touching the ground. Return the leg back to the initial position. Repeat the sequence with the other leg.

Lie down on your stomach on the leg curl machine and set the roller bars against your ankles. Raise the bar by taking your heels towards the hips. As your calves come perpendicular to the floor, return to the initial position and repeat.

Lie down on your back with your hands by your sides Keep your knees bent at a 90-degree angle Slowly raise your legs to a straight position Hold for a few seconds, then slowly lower your legs back down Repeat the process for the desired amount of reps

Lie flat on your back on a mat with your legs fully extended Raise your legs and hips towards the ceiling while keeping your back flat on the mat Hold the peak position for a few seconds, focusing on your abdominal muscles Lower your legs and hips back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Lie flat on your back, with your legs together and fully extended Place your hands at your sides, palms down Lift your legs and hips off the floor while keeping them together Hold this position for a moment, then lower your legs and hips back to the initial position

name_en: Lying Leg Hip Raise on Floor
description_en: Lay flat on your back with your arms by your sides Raise your legs until they are pointing straight up Slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position Keep your legs straight and your feet together throughout the movement Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps

name_en: Lying Leg Hip Raise on Floor
description_en: Lie down flat on your back, legs extended Place your hands by your sides As you exhale, raise your legs by flexing the hip and knee until your hips and knees are fully flexed Slowly return your legs to the starting position Repeat the exercise for the recommended amount of repetitions

Lie down on your back with your legs straight, arms at your sides, and your hands under your hips Raise your legs straight up unless your feet reach right above your hips Hold for a while, then return to the starting position slowly

Lie flat on your back with your hands by your side Keeping legs straight and together, lift them all the way up towards the ceiling until your butt comes off the floor Slowly lower your legs back down till they're just above the floor. Hold for a moment. Raise your legs back up, repeat the exercise

Lie on your side, legs fully extended and stacked on top of each other Slowly raise your top leg as high as comfortably possible while keeping your knee straight Hold that position for a moment Lower the leg back down Switch sides and repeat on the other leg

Lie flat on your back on the floor with your hands by your sides Raise your legs until they are perpendicular to the floor Pause for a moment at the top of the motion Lower your legs back down to the starting position Repeat for the desired amount of repetitions

Lie flat on your back with legs extended Place your hands, palms down, at your sides Raise your legs until they're perpendicular to the floor Lower your legs slowly, return to start position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Lie flat on your back, with your arms at your sides. Bend your knees and keep your feet flat on the floor. Raise your legs by drawing your knees towards your chest. Lower your legs back to the starting position in a slow, controlled movement. Repeat the exercise for your recommended set of reps.

Lie down flat on your back with your hands under your glutes Keep your legs straight and lift them all the way up to the ceiling until your butt comes off the floor Hold at the top for a moment Slowly lower your legs back down till they're just above the floor Hold for a moment and then lift back up

Lie down flat on your back with your legs straight and together Raise your legs upwards without bending at the knee to form an approximate 90-degree angle with the ground Hold this position for a few seconds Lower your legs carefully until they are just above the ground Repeat the process

Lie down on a flat bench with your legs hanging off the end Hold onto the bench behind your head for support Raise your legs until they are perpendicular to your torso Hold this position for a moment Lower your legs back to the starting position in a controlled manner

Lie down flat on your back with your legs together Bend your knees and raise them toward your chest Lower your legs to one side as far as is comfortable, while maintaining your upper body flat on the floor Raise your legs back to the center, and repeat on the opposite side Repeat the exercise in sets of your desired repetitions

Start by lying flat on your back with your legs extended upwards forming a 90 degree angle Spread your legs apart, making a V shape or a triangle Gradually lower one leg to the side while keeping the other leg still Raise your leg back to the starting position and repeat with the other leg For equal workout, alternate between both legs for each set
