Lie flat on your back with your legs extended straight out Bend one knee and bring the thigh towards your chest, holding it with your hands Gently pull your leg further into your chest to increase the stretch Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then release Repeat with the other leg

name_en: Lying Lower Back Knee to Chest
description_en: Lie flat on your back with legs fully extended Bend one knee and pull it towards your chest using your hands Hold the knee gently to your chest for a moment, feeling the stretch in your lower back and hip flexors Lower the leg back down slowly to its initial position Repeat the process with the other leg

Lie flat on your back on a comfortable surface Bring both knees to your chest and hold them with your arms Pull your knees towards your chest for a deeper stretch Hold for 15-30 seconds Slowly release and return your legs to the starting position

Lie flat on your back on the floor or a mat. Bend your knees and bring them towards your chest. Grasp your knees with both hands and pull them closer to your chest. Hold this stretch for 15-30 seconds. Slowly lower your knees and repeat the process.

Lie down flat on your back with your hands behind your head, legs extended and feet together. Bend your knees together and rotate your legs to one side, making sure your upper body remains flat on the floor. Curl your torso upward, bringing your elbow towards your hip on the same side. Pause briefly at the top of the curl, then lower your torso back to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat the exercise on the other side.

Lie down on your back on a mat, extending your legs straight out. Lift your legs slightly off the ground. Cross your left leg over your right and then alternate. Keep your abdominal muscles engaged throughout the movement. Continue this motion for the recommended number of repetitions.

Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Inhale and on the exhale, engage your abs, tilt your pelvis upwards by flattening your back against the floor Hold for a couple of seconds, then slowly release back to the starting position Perform this exercise for the desired number of repetitions
Lie face down on the ground Extend your arms forward Raise your arms, chest, and legs off the ground Hold for a few seconds Lower your body back to the starting position

Lay face-down on the floor with arms extended outward in a T shape Engage your back muscles and lift your chest slightly off the floor Squeeze your shoulder blades together, keeping your arms straight Hold for a second before lowering back down

Lie down prone on the floor with your arms in the shape of a W Keeping your forehead on the ground, lift your chest and arms off the ground Squeeze your shoulder blades together as you lift Hold for a second, then slowly lower your body back down Repeat this for the desired number of repetitions

Lie face down on the floor with arms extended out in a 'W' position Keeping your chest on the floor, squeeze your shoulder blades together and lift your arms Lower your arms slowly back to the starting position Next, extend your arms out into a 'T' position Lift your arms as high as you can and lower them back down in control

Lie flat on your stomach with your arms at a 'W' formation near your sides Stretch your arms forward to form a 'Y' Squeeze your shoulder blades together whilst moving your hands back to the 'W' position Repeat this movement for a set number of repetitions

Lie down face first on a mat with your arms extended above you forming a Y Squeeze your shoulder blades together and raise your arms off the floor Hold this position for a second before slowly lowering your arms to the starting position Repeat the motion while maintaining form

name_en: Lying pull over with resistance band cable
description_en: Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet on the floor. Grab the resistance cables in your hands with your arms extended over your shoulders. Pull the cables by taking your arms towards your thighs. As your arms reach close to the thighs, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie on your left side on a mat or padded floor Bend your right knee and grasp the top of your right foot or ankle Gently pull your right heel towards your butt until a stretch is felt in the front of your thigh Hold for the desired amount of time, then switch and repeat on the other side

Lie down on your stomach with your legs extended and arms placed at your sides. Fold one of your legs and take your heel towards the hips. Extend your corresponding arm behind your back and hold your raised foot with your hand. Maintain this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Lie flat on your back on ground, hands stretched out at your sides With your legs together, raise them off the ground about a foot Turn your lower body from side to side to mimic a windscreen wiper motion The legs should go from one side to the other without touching the ground Ensure your shoulders remain on the ground throughout the exercise

Lie flat on your back and raise your legs until they're perpendicular to the floor Keep your arms straight out to your sides for support Slowly move your legs to the right side as far as you can without lifting your left shoulder off the ground Hold for a moment and then return to the starting position Repeat on the left side, without lifting your right shoulder off the ground

Lie face down on a bench with your arms extended straight underneath your shoulders Hold light weights (you can even use water bottles) in each hand Raise your arms to the side until they are at shoulder height Lower your arms back down with control Repeat this motion for a set number of reps

Lie flat on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor Place your hands lightly behind your head or on your chest Contract your abs to lift your upper body off the floor Hold for a moment at the top, then lower back down in a controlled manner Repeat for desired amount of repetitions

Lie on your back, legs extended and hands behind your head Bend your knees out to the sides like a frog Lift your legs in the air while contracting your abdominals perform the movement in reverse, lowering your legs and releasing the contraction Repeat the exercise maintaining a steady rhythm

Lie face down flat on the floor, legs fully extended and hands positioned under your forehead Keeping your legs straight, lift them off the ground and towards the ceiling, tensing your glutes and thighs Hold for a second at the top, then slowly lower the legs back down Ensure to keep your head in a neutral position throughout the exercise Avoid touching the ground, instead keep a slight elevation to keep tension on the muscles

Lie on your back on the floor, with your feet flat and knees bent Place your hands by your side, palms down Push up through your heels and palms to lift your body off the ground Hold for a second, then slowly lower back down

Lie flat on your back with your legs stretched out straight Turn your head to one side slowly Hold this position for a few seconds Slowly turn your head back to the start position Now, repeat the movement on the other side

Lie flat on your back with legs fully extended and arms beside you Elevate your legs off the ground, keep your feet together and hands under the hips for support Begin to perform a scissor motion with your legs by lifting your right leg up and your left leg down Switch by lifting your left leg up and your right leg down Continue alternating until completion of the prescribed number of repetitions

Lay down flat on your back with your arms by your sides. Raise your legs off the ground approximately six inches. Straighten your legs and hold the position. Then, kick one leg up while keeping the other leg where it is. Switch your legs quickly and repeat the exercise.

Lie on your back with your arms by your sides Lift your legs about 6 inches off the ground Crisscross your legs by alternatively crossing one over the other Continue the switching motion for the desired number of repetitions Lower your legs back to the ground

Lie down on your back with legs straight and arms out to your sides for support Raise your feet in the air, slightly above the ground Start moving your legs in a scissors motion: lift one leg higher and lower the other, then switch Keep your legs as straight as possible throughout the motion Continue for the prescribed number of repetitions

Lie down on one side and place your lower hand behind your head by bending your elbow under it. Fold your upper leg and press its heel towards the hip with your free hand. Maintain this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Lie on your side on a flat surface Position your hands under your head Lift your legs up, bending your knees towards your chest Lower your legs down without touching the floor Repeat the movements in a steady rhythm

Lie on your side with your hands under your head or out to stabilize Bend your knees and bring them up towards your chest Using your lower abs, lift your hips off the ground Lower your hips back to the floor Switch sides and repeat

Lie down on your side on a flat surface Extend your legs straight and stack them on top of each other Extend your top arm overhead, bending at the waist Gently reach your extended arm down towards your feet Hold the stretch for 20 to 30 seconds, then switch sides

Lie on your side on the floor with your legs extended out straight Stretch your arms above your head, creating a long line from your feet to your fingertips Reach your upper arm as far towards your feet as you can while reaching your lower arm as far towards your head Hold the stretch for 15 to 30 seconds Repeat on the other side

Lie flat on your back with your arms extended out to the sides Lift both legs up towards the ceiling keeping them close together Lower them down to the right, as far as you can without letting your torso come off the floor Lift them back up to the center and then lower them down to the left Repeat this for your preferred amount of repetitions

Lie on your back with your legs bent at a 90-degree angle and feet planted on the ground Raise one leg up, extending it straight in the air Keeping your body stiff, engage your glute and hamstrings to lift your hips off the floor as high as possible Hold the position briefly, then lower your hips back to the ground in a controlled fashion Switch legs and repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Lie down on your side with your legs straight Slowly lift your top leg off your bottom leg, keeping your toe pointed forward Pause when your leg is aligned with your body, then lower it Repeat for the desired number of repetitions Switch sides and repeat with the other leg

Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Extend one leg up towards the ceiling. Slowly open your leg to the side, as far as comfortable. Hold it briefly, then bring it back to the center, keeping your hip on the floor. Repeat the movement with the other leg.

name_en: Lying Single Leg Hamstring Stretch against Wall
description_en: Lie on your back, preferably on an exercise mat. Lift one leg and place your heel against the wall, keeping the other leg flat. Straighten your lifted leg as much as able and feel the stretch in your hamstring. Hold your stretch position for a comfortable amount of time. Relax and switch the leg after a few seconds or after you cannot feel a stretch anymore.

Lie down flat on your back and extend your legs fully Keep one leg flat on the ground while you lift the other leg straight up towards the ceiling Lower the lifted leg down in a controlled fashion Repeat with the other leg Alternate between legs for the duration of your set

Lay down flat on your back with your arms by your sides Keep one leg straight and stationary while you lift the other leg as high as you can Hold the top position for a moment Slowly lower the lifted leg back down Repeat with the other leg
Lie on your back on a flat surface Keep one leg straight on the ground Slowly raise your other leg straight upwards Hold the position for a few seconds Lower your leg back down in a controlled manner

Lie on your back on a mat with your arms by your sides Raise one leg toward the ceiling, keeping the other leg flat on the mat Pause at the top of the motion, and then slowly lower your leg back down Repeat for the prescribed number of repetitions Change legs and repeat the exercise

name_en: Lying Single Legs Reverse Biceps Curl with Towel
description_en: Lie down on your back, keeping your legs extended and a towel in each hand Lift one arm and curl it by flexing the elbow while gripping the towel Lower your arm back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat with your other arm Do desired amount of reps and sets

name_en: Lying Single to Double Leg Raise
description_en: Lie down on your back, maintaining a straight line from head to toe Raise one leg as high as you can, keeping your leg straight Lower that leg and then raise the other leg Once you're comfortable, raise both legs together Lower them and repeat

name_en: Lying Single to Double Toe Tap
description_en: Lie on your back with your hands by your sides and feet flat on the floor With knees bent, lift both legs so that the knees are stacked over the hips, forming a 90-degree angle at your knees and hips Slowly lower one foot and lightly tap it on the floor Bring that foot back to the initial position, then repeat with the other foot Alternatively, you can lower both feet at the same time for a double toe tap

Lie down flat on your back on a mat with your arms by your sides Keep one foot flat on the ground and straighten the other leg towards the ceiling Point the toes of the raised leg as far as you can Hold the position for a few seconds Lower the leg back down and repeat for the other leg

Lie on the floor with your belly facing down and extend your arms and legs fully Move your right hand and left leg forward simultaneously Next, move your left hand and right leg forward Repeat these movements as if you're crawling without raising your body Repeat for desired number of repetitions

Lie down on the floor on your back with your legs spread open. Lift your legs to a 90-degree angle. Keep your legs straight and spread them apart as wide as you can. Bring your legs back together slowly, controlling the movement. Repeat the movement for the desired amount of reps.

Lie on your back with your legs extended straight up towards the ceiling While keeping your legs straight, lower one leg down towards the floor Raise the leg slowly back up to the starting position Repeat the same movement with the other leg Alternate legs for the prescribed number of repetitions

Lie flat on your back on an exercise mat with your hands by your sides Keep your legs straight and lift them up until they're perpendicular to the floor Move your legs in a reverse crunch motion towards your chest Lower your legs back down to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Lie flat on your stomach with your arms extended in front of you Raise your right leg up as far as it is comfortable while keeping your leg straight Lower your right leg down in a controlled fashion Repeat the same movement with your left leg Continue to alternate legs for the duration of the exercise

Lie flat on your back, with your arms at your sides Extend your legs straight above your hips Point your toes towards the ceiling Flex and release your calf muscles repeatedly Lower your legs after a set, rest and repeat

Lie flat on your back on the floor with your arms by your sides Raise your legs so your thighs are perpendicular to the floor and your knees form a 90-degree angle Alternate lowering each foot towards the floor, ensuring your lower back stays pressed to the ground Return your foot to the starting position and repeat with the other leg Continue these movements in a 'tapping' motion

Lie flat on your back with your legs extended and your arms at your sides Bend your knees and lift your legs so your knees are directly above your hips Lower one foot and gently tap your toe on the floor Lift your foot back up to the start position Repeat with the other leg

Lie down flat on your back. Extend your arms straight above your head. Bring your arms up over your head and try to touch your toes. Lower your arms back down. Repeat for several reps and sets as desired.

Lie down on your back with your legs straight Bend your knees towards your chest while curling your torso upward Touch your elbows to your knees Slowly lower your torso and legs back to the initial position Repeat for the desired amount of repetitions

Lie flat on your back with your legs extended in front of you Bend your knees and bring them towards your chest while you keep your back flat on the ground As your knees approach your chest, use your abdominals to curl your hips off the floor and towards your chest Hold this position briefly, then carefully lower your hips back to the start position in a controlled manner Repeat this for your desired amount of reps

Lie down flat on your back with your hands extended above your head Bend at the waist while simultaneously raising your legs and torso Attempt to touch your knees with your hands or elbows Lower your legs and upper body back to the ground

Lie flat on your back with your legs fully extended and your arms extended overhead Contract your abs and tuck your knees towards your chest while simultaneously lifting your upper body off the floor, trying to touch your knees Hold for a moment before slowly extending your legs and arms back to the starting position Repeat this motion, maintaining control and not allowing your legs or arms to touch the ground Keep this up for your desired number of reps

Lie flat on your back with your arms extended out to the sides Raise your legs about 90 degrees, keeping them straight Twist your hips to one side, trying to touch the ground with your toes Return to the center, then twist your hips to the other side Repeat the motion for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Lying Twist Toe Touch against Wall
description_en: Lie down flat on your back beside a wall or a sturdy vertical surface. Spread your arms out wide open on the floor on either side of your body. Lift your feet off of the ground until your hips and knees create a 90-degree angle. With control, lower both your legs to one side, attempting to touch the wall with your toes. Return your legs to the center and repeat the same movement onto the other side.

Lie flat on your back on a gym mat Place your hands under your glutes Lift your legs up into the air while keeping them straight Alternate crossing your legs over each other Lower your legs and repeat the process

Lie flat on your back on a mat. Place your hands, palms down, on the floor beside you. Lift your feet off the floor a few inches and keep them elevated throughout the exercise. Raise one leg as high as you can. Keep your other leg a few inches from the ground. Lower the raised leg and raise the other, crossing them in a 'scissor' motion. Continue alternating your legs, mimicking a scissors opening and closing.

Lie flat on your back with your arms spread out to the sides for support. Raise your legs so they're perpendicular to the ground. Keeping your legs straight and together, lower them to one side as far as you can. Bring your legs back to the starting position and lower them to the other side. Continue this back and forth movement.

Get on a chest press machine with your back supported, knees bent, and feet fixed under the bars. Grab the handles of the machine while opening your elbows past your back, and bending your arms. Push the handles of the machine forward and downward by straightening your arms. 4.Return to the initial position, and repeat.

Get on a chest press machine with your back supported, knees bent, and feet fixed under the bars. Grab the machine's handles while opening your elbows to shoulder height and bending your arms. Push the handles of the machine forward by straightening your arms. Return to the initial position, and repeat.

Get on a chest press machine with your back supported incline, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab the handles of the machine while opening your elbows wide to shoulder level, and bending your forearms. Push the handles of the machine by straightening your arms upward and forward. Return to the initial position, and repeat.

Get on a fly machine with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab the handles of the machine while opening your arms wide and bending them slightly. Pull the handles of the machine close by bringing your arms forward. As your arms come close, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Get on a lateral raise machine with your back supported, knees bent, and feet placed on footrests. Hold the machine's handles with your arms bent and place your elbows against the pads. Raise the pads by opening your elbows wide towards the shoulders. As your elbows reach shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart Bring your right knee up to hip height Return your right foot to the floor Repeat the movement with your left knee Continue alternating right and left in a marching manner

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Lift your right knee up to hip height and lower it back down Repeat the same with your left knee Continue alternating legs and add a swinging arm motion Increase your pace for a greater challenge

Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart Begin marching in place, lifting your knees as high as they can comfortably go As you march, perform a press motion with your arms, extending them upward and returning them to shoulder height Keep your abdominal muscles engaged throughout the exercise Continue this combination of marching and pressing for the duration of your exercise time

Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart Start by lifting your right knee to your chest At the same time, push your left arm forward like a punch Repeat this action for the left knee and the right arm Keep alternating for the desired amount of time

Assume a boxing stance with one foot staggered in front of the other Drive your back foot into the ground and rotate your hips and torso while swinging your back fist in an upward motion Try to extend your punch straight up towards the 'ceiling' Quickly retract your fist back into a guard position after each punch Switch sides and repeat with the other arm

Start by lying flat on your back on the floor with a medicine ball in your hands, arms extended above your head Raise your left leg and your right arm at the same time, trying to touch the medicine ball to your foot Lower your leg and arm. Repeat the motion with your right leg and left arm This is one repetition. Continue alternating sides

name_en: Medicine Ball Catch and Overhead Throw
description_en: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding the medicine ball in front of you with both hands Bend your knees slightly and engage your core Throw the medicine ball overhead, by extending your arms upward Catch the medicine ball on its downward trajectory by bending at the knees and bringing it back to the starting position

name_en: Medicine Ball Chest Pass against Wall
description_en: Stand facing a wall with a medicine ball held at chest level Extend your arms forcefully to throw the ball against the wall Catch the ball on the rebound, absorbing the impact with your chest and arms Quickly push the ball back out and continue the movement

name_en: Medicine Ball Close Grip Push Up
description_en: Place the medicine ball on the floor and place your hands on it in a close grip Lower your body towards the medicine ball, keeping your elbows close to your body Push your body up, extending your arms fully Lower your body back down to the starting position Repeat this exercise for the desired amount of reps

Stand up straight while holding a medicine ball close to your chest Lower yourself into a squat by bending at the hips and knees until your thighs are parallel to the floor Pause at the bottom of the squat, then push yourself back up to a standing position Keep your back straight and your heels flat on the ground during the entire movement Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Medicine Ball Lunge with Biceps Curl
description_en: Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold the medicine ball with both hands in front of you Step forward with one foot and lower your body into a lunge While in the lunge, perform a biceps curl with the medicine ball Push through the front foot to return to the start position Repeat on the other side

Lie flat on your back with your arms by your sides Place the medicine ball between your feet Raise your legs (along with the medicine ball) until they are perpendicular to the floor Lower your legs (and the medicine ball) back down in a controlled manner without touching the floor Repeat for the desired number of reps

Place your hands atop the medicine ball, getting into a plank position Bring your right knee towards your chest, then quickly switch and bring your left knee towards your chest Keep your core tight and maintain a quick pace After each set, take a brief rest, then repeat

Stand tall with feet at shoulder width apart and hold the medicine ball with both hands Raise the ball above your head fully extending your arms In a swift motion, slam the ball on the floor as hard as you can Squat down to pick the ball up and repeat

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the medicine ball with both hands. Lift the medicine ball above your head, fully extending your arms. Slam the ball down in front of your feet with as much force as possible. Bend your knees and squat to pick up the ball. Repeat the movement.

Start in a high plank position with your hands on the medicine ball Jump your feet wide apart while maintaining your plank position Jump your feet back together Repeat the exercise for your desired amount of reps Maintain a steady and controlled pace throughout

Place a medicine ball in front of you while getting into a traditional push-up position Place one hand on the medicine ball while the other is on the floor Lower your body towards the floor while keeping your body straight Push your body back up in an explosive movement switching hands on the medicine ball in mid-air Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions
Start in a plank position with your hands on a medicine ball Keep your body straight and roll the ball in a circular motion Continue rolling for set duration Repeat the exercise on the other side

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a medicine ball with both hands. Begin by twisting your waist and turning your feet to one side, bringing the medicine ball to that side. Explosively rotate your torso to the opposite side, throwing the ball against a wall. Catch the ball on the rebound and immediately rotate and throw again on the opposite side. Repeat this action, alternating sides for each throw.

Sit on the floor with your legs bent, pull your abs to your spine, and lean back a few inches while keeping your back straight. Hold the medicine ball with both hands at your chest, and lift your feet off the ground, crossing them at the ankles. Rotate your body to one side, and then twist to the other side, keeping your feet off the floor. Repeat this back-and-forth twisting motion, all while staying balanced on your sit bones. Keep up this movement for as long as the exercise routine requires.

name_en: Medicine Ball Side to Side Slam
description_en: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the medicine ball with both hands Rotate your torso to one side and raise the ball over your shoulder Slam the ball down diagonally across your body, using force from your core Pick up the medicine ball and repeat on the other side Continue to alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions

Stand on one leg with your foot directly under your hip. Hold the medicine ball in both hands over your head. Slam the ball down onto the ground as hard as you can. Catch the ball on the bounce back up. Repeat action for specified number of repetitions before alternating to the other leg.

Sit on the floor with your knees bent, feet against a wall and hold the medicine ball above your chest Contract your abs and lift your torso up to a sitting position, throwing the ball against the wall Catch the ball on the rebound, and lower your back down to the starting position Repeat the movement for your desired reps This exercise should be done in a controlled manner to avoid injury

Stand tall with feet shoulder width apart, holding the medicine ball overhead. With all your energy, slam the medicine ball down onto the ground. Catch the ball after it bounces off the ground and return to the starting position. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions. Remember to use your whole body, especially your core, when slamming the ball down.

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a medicine ball with both hands Raise the medicine ball above your head, then slam it into the ground as hard as you can Immediately follow with a burpee: quickly drop your body into a squat position, then kick your feet back into a plank Do a push-up, then quickly bring your feet back under your body Jump up into the air, extending your arms and reaching for the sky

name_en: Medicine Ball Step Behind Rotational Throw
description_en: Step into a lunge position while holding the medicine ball with both hands at the chest level Rotate your upper body towards the back leg Explosively step back into the starting position while simultaneously throwing the medicine ball Catch the ball and repeat the movement on the opposite side Do this alternately for a number of repetitions

Lie flat on your back, knees bent, feet flat on the floor Hold a medicine ball with both hands and stretch your arms straight up towards the ceiling Forcefully throw the ball straight up into the air as high as possible Catch the ball and immediately throw it back up again in a quick succession Perform the prescribed number of repetitions

name_en: Medicine Ball Throw Squat with Wall
description_en: Stand up straight facing the wall with the medicine ball in both hands. Bend your knees into a squat position while keeping your back straight. Explode up while simultaneously throwing the medicine ball against the wall. Catch the ball while returning to a squatting position. Repeat the process.

Stand tall holding the medicine ball at chest level Rotate your torso to the right then to the left, each time slamming the ball on the ground Catch the ball on the bounce after each slam Repeat for the desired number of reps Switch directions after each set

name_en: Mid Air Lateral Raises with Switching Palms
description_en: Stand upright with your arms by your sides Raise your arms out to the sides until they are at shoulder level Rotate palms facing downwards and upwards alternately while keeping arms elevated Lower the arms slowly to your sides Repeat the movements for the determined number of reps

name_en: Mid Air Lateral Raises With Switching Palms
description_en: Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms out to your sides at shoulder height, palms facing the ground While maintaining this height, rotate your palms so they face upwards Rotate back to the initial position, palms facing down Repeat the movement
Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Place your hands on your waist. Twist your torso to a side and hold for a while. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart. Extend one arm over your head and lean your torso in the opposite direction to that arm. Hold the stretch for a count of five, then return to the start position. Repeat the stretch with your other arm. Perform the stretch 10 times on each side.

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart. Slowly lean your torso to one side, allowing your arm on that side to slide down your leg. Hold this position for 15-30 seconds, feeling the stretch along your side. Repeat the stretch on the other side. Perform 3 sets on each side.

Lie down on your back with your legs straight, resting on the floor, and your arms by your sides Lift your torso and legs off the floor, bring your arms forward, parallel with your legs and hold. Then return to the starting position slowly and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Raise your hands near your shoulders with your palms facing forward and elbows, making a 45-degree angle with your torso. Extend your arms overhead, hold momentarily, and then return to the initial position. Repeat.

Find a quiet and comfortable place to sit or lay down Gently close your eyes and take a deep breath in through your nose Slowly exhale the breath out through your mouth Continue to breathe in and out slowly, focusing on the sensation and rhythm of your breath If your mind wanders, gently bring your focus back to your breath

Stand with your feet shoulder width apart Begin by doing a regular squat, then engage your core Jump up explosively When you land, lower your body back into the squat position Repeat this movement for your desired number of repetitions

Get down on your hands and toes with your back straight. Keep your arms and legs straight and form a straight line with your body from the head to your ankles. Lower your chest towards the floor while bending your arms unless your chest touches the floor. Raise yourself by propelling your hips backward while straightening your arms and forming an inverted V-shape.

Start in a Downward Dog pose with your hands flat and feet hip-width apart Bend your elbows, lower your body toward the floor, sweeping forward and down Rotate your torso upward so your chest faces forward and your hips are close to the floor forming an Upward Dog pose Protract your scapula, lower your chest and press back up to the Initial Downward Dog pose Repeat the above steps for your desired number of reps

Begin in a plank position with arms fully extended Bring one knee towards your chest, maintaining a tight core Return your foot to the starting position Repeat for the other leg Alternate legs at a quick pace, as if running in place

Start in a push-up position, with your weight supported by your hands and toes. Flexing the knee and hip, bring one leg until the knee is approximately under the chest. Return to the starting position and repeat the movement with your other leg. Continue alternating between legs, similar to running in place while in a push-up position. Keep your back straight throughout the exercise.

Start in a high plank position, ensure your body is in straight line from head to toes. Bring one knee in towards your chest, keeping the toes of your other foot on the floor. Quickly switch legs, pulling one knee out and bringing the other knee in. Keep switching legs and pick up the pace until it feels a little like running in place in a plank position.

Stand facing a wall with your arms extended in front of you and your hands flat against the wall Start with one foot slightly forward, your body in a lean-forward position Quickly switch the position of your feet, moving the back foot to the front and the front foot to the back, keeping most of your weight on the balls of your feet Continue this alternating pattern for the duration of your set

Begin in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your feet hip-width apart Pull your right knee towards your chest as far as you can Switch legs, pulling one knee out and bringing the other knee in, in a running motion Continue this movement for your desired set length Transition to dynamic planks by lifting the right hand and left foot off the floor. Then alternate with the left hand and right foot

Start in a high plank position Pull your right knee towards your chest Quickly switch and pull your left knee to your chest Keep alternating sides for a desired set of reps For Dynamic Plank, lower down to your forearms and then push back up to high plank

Begin in a high plank position Bring your right knee forward toward your chest, followed by your left knee Quickly jump back into plank position Perform a push-up Jump your feet in towards your hands, then explosively jump up towards the ceiling Land and immediately begin the next rep

Start in a high plank position, with your palms flat on the floor and hands shoulder-width apart Bring your right knee to your left elbow, returning it to the starting position Then bring your left knee to your right elbow and return it to the starting position Continue alternating sides for the desired number of reps or time Keep your core engaged and your hips aligned with the rest of your body

Start in a high plank position with your hands under your shoulders Bring your right knee toward your chest, then kick it straight out to the side Return your right foot to the starting position Repeat this motion with your left leg, alternating sides for each rep

Start in a high plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and wrists directly under your shoulders Bring your right knee forward under your chest, with the toes just off the ground Return to your basic plank, switch legs and bring the left knee forward Keep switching legs and begin to pick up the pace until it feels a little like running in place in a plank position Keep your core engaged while you switch sides

Start in a high plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart Bring your right knee forward towards your chest Extend the right leg back into the initial position Now, do the same with your left knee Alternate legs and increase speed for higher intensity

Start in a high plank position with your hands flat on the floor Bring your right knee under your torso, keeping the toes off the ground Return your right foot to the starting position and repeat with your left foot Alternate between right and left for the duration of the exercise Keep your body in a straight line throughout the movement

Start off by getting into a plank position with your hands placed on the bench Bring your right knee in towards your chest Quickly switch and do the same with your left leg - it should look like you're running Repeat the motion alternating legs for your preferred amount of time

Get in a high plank position, with your hands directly under your shoulders Bring your right knee forward towards your chest as far as you can Return to the plank position Bring your left knee forward towards your chest as far as you can Return to the starting position

Get down on your hands and toes with your arms, back, and legs straight Lift one of your feet off the floor and bring your knee quickly towards the elbow Then straighten your leg rapidly while bringing your foot back to the initial position and perform the same with your other knee. Create a rhythm of moving your knees alternatively with suitable pace.

Start in a high plank position with each foot on a small towel Slide your right knee forward towards your chest Slide your right foot back to the starting position Repeat with your left foot Continue alternating between right and left

Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders Bring your right knee to touch your right elbow Return to the high plank position Tap your left shoulder with your right hand Repeat the process on the other side

Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders Bring your right knee up towards your chest, keeping the toes of your right foot off the ground Return the right foot to the starting position Repeat the same action with your left knee Alternate quickly between your right and left knees

Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your feet hip-width apart Bring your right knee forward under your chest with the toes just off the ground Return to your basic plank and switch legs, bringing the left knee forward Keep alternating legs and begin to pick up the pace until it feels a little like running in place in a plank position Continue this movement for your desired amount of repetitions

Start in a high plank position, your palms flat on the ground, and your feet together Jump your feet to the left, bringing your knees toward your left elbow Jump your feet back to plank Repeat the jump, this time towards your right elbow Continue to alternate sides for the duration of your set

Start in a traditional plank position with your shoulders directly over your hands and wrists. Bring your knees up toward your chest simultaneously while keeping your body tight. Jump your feet back to the starting position and repeat. Keep your core engaged throughout the movement. Try to maintain a good rhythm while performing the exercise.

Close your eyes and relax your face Inhale deeply through your nose Exhale from your mouth while quickly saying 'ah' or 'uh' to create vibrations Do this for about 10 seconds and then relax your face and neck muscles for a moment Repeat this exercise 5-10 times

Start with your face relaxed, look straight ahead Open your mouth wide, pull your bottom lip over your bottom teeth, and position your upper lip over your upper teeth Hold the position for few seconds Slowly relax your mouth and return to the starting position Repeat the process for the recommended number of times

Start sitting upright with relaxed shoulders and neck. Suck in your cheeks and pout your lips. Move your mouth to one side, as far as it can go. Suck in harder, then move your mouth to the other side. Repeat the process.
Start by relaxing your face and neck muscles Open your mouth as wide as you can Hold this stretch for about 10 seconds Relax your mouth, then repeat the exercise several times

Start in a dead hang position on a bar with your hands slightly more than shoulder-width apart Swing your body forwards to generate upward momentum, then as you swing backwards, pull up and simultaneously drive your knees toward your chest At the height of the pull-up, transition into a dip by rotating your wrists around the bar and pushing your body upwards Push upwards until your arms are fully extended Control your descent back to the starting position

Stand tall with your feet flat on the floor and shoulder-width apart Bring the palms together in prayer position at the heart chakra Keep your eyes closed and take deep, slow breaths Hold this pose for a few minutes
Stand on a raised surface that's secure and shoulder-width apart Lower your body down into a squat position Push up through your heels to lift yourself back up Repeat this movement

Stand on a step or raised platform with your feet hip-width apart Lower your body by bending your knees and pushing your hips back as if sitting in a chair Continue to the lowest point you can without your back rounding Drive through your heels to stand back up straight, squeezing your glutes at the top Maintain a tall posture throughout the movement

name_en: Narrow Stance Squats With Resistance Band
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and a resistance band under your feet. Hold the ends of the band in your hands near your shoulders. Lower your hips down by bending your knees. As your thighs come parallel to the floor, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand with your feet hip-width apart, 'Narrow' stance Squat down as if sitting back into a chair, keeping your back straight and knees over your toes Push through your heels to come up to a standing position Now, adjust your feet to a shoulder-width apart, 'Normal' stance Repeat the squat movement

Stand up straight with good posture Slowly tilt your head to the right until you feel a stretch Roll your head forward and around to the left Continue the circle until you're back to the starting position Repeat in the opposite direction

Stand or sit with your back straight, relaxing your shoulders downwards Slowly tilt your head towards your right shoulder until you feel a stretch on the left side of your neck Gently roll your neck in a circular motion moving to the front, then the other side, then to the back, completing the circle Repeat the steps in the opposite direction Hold each stretch for about 15-30 seconds

Stand or sit upright with your neck aligned with your spine Gently lower your ear towards your shoulder Slowly roll your head forward and around to your other shoulder, keeping your shoulders relaxed Lift your head back to the starting position, completing the half circle movement Repeat for the suggested number of reps, then switch sides

Stand up straight with your shoulders relaxed Slowly tilt your head towards one shoulder Hold this position for a few seconds Slowly bring your head back to the center Repeat the stretch on the other side

Stand or sit tall with your spine straight Slowly lower your right ear towards your right shoulder until you feel a light stretch Hold the stretch position for about 20 to 30 seconds Return your head to the center and then perform the same movement on your left side Repeat the process 3-5 times on each side

Stand or sit upright Gently tilt your head to one side towards your shoulder Assist the stretch lightly using your hand, without forcing the movement Hold for 15-30 seconds, then release Repeat on the other side

Stand or sit up straight Slowly tilt your head down, bringing your chin towards your chest Return to the initial position Slowly turn your head to the left, then to the right Finally, tilt your head backwards gently, looking up towards the ceiling

Start by standing upright with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lift one leg and place it over your arm, resting your arm on the inside of your elevated knee. With the arm that's underneath your lifted leg, perform a bicep curl starting from an extended position, bringing your hand towards your shoulder. Pause at the top of the curl. Slowly lower your arm back to the starting position.

Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground. Place your hands on either side of your head, lightly touching your temples. Curl your upper body off the ground toward your knees, lifting your shoulder blades off the ground. Hold at the top of the contraction for a moment. Slowly lower yourself back down in a controlled manner.

Begin by laying flat on your back on a bench or mat. Extend your legs outwards, keeping them together and straight. Raise your legs and hips towards the ceiling, supporting your body on your shoulders. Lower your body back down in a controlled manner, but do not let it touch the ground.

Lie down on your back on a flat and sturdy surface Reaching behind your head, grab hold of something strong and fixed Raise your body off the ground, keeping it straight, until only your shoulders and upper back are on the ground Lower your body in a controlled manner until it's parallel to the ground again Bring your body back to the starting position and repeat

Start in a high plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart Lower your body slowly towards the ground Once your chest is nearly touching the ground, push yourself up abruptly Repeat the movement while maintaining your form Rest and repeat the set

Find something sturdy to hook your feet under Kneel down and place your hands on your hips Keep your body in a straight line and lean forward slowly Use your hamstrings to pull your body back to the upright position Repeat the exercise for the recommended amount of reps

Lie down on your back bending your knees and keeping your feet flat on the floor. Tuck your hands behind your ears. Do not pull your head up with them - they are just there for support. Lift your upper body towards one knee, trying to touch your elbow to the opposing knee. Slowly lower your body back down in a controlled manner. Switch sides and repeat.

Lie on your back on the floor and bend your knees, keeping your feet flat on the ground Place your hands behind your head, without locking your fingers together Lift your upper body using your oblique muscles, and twist to bring your right elbow to your left knee Slowly lower your body back down Repeat the movement on the other side, bringing your left elbow to your right knee

name_en: Oblique Crunches with Straight Leg Lift
description_en: Lie on your back on the floor with your legs extended out straight Bend one knee and cross it over the other leg Place your hands behind your head, and lift your shoulders off the floor Raise your straight leg while lifting your upper body off the floor Lower yourself back down to the starting position in a controlled fashion

name_en: Obliques Twist High Knee and Kick
description_en: Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Raise your left knee towards your right shoulder while twisting your torso Swiftly kick your left leg out in front Return to the initial position and repeat the movement with your right knee and left shoulder Alternate sides, performing the steps quickly and in a controlled manner

name_en: Obliques Twist High Knee and Kick
description_en: Stand in an upright position with your feet shoulder-width apart. Raise one knee towards your chest while simultaneously twisting your torso to bring the opposite elbow towards the lifted knee. Lower the leg and arm back to the starting position. Now do the same with the opposite arm and leg. After completing the twist, kick the raised leg forward while stretching the opposite arm in a punch-like movement.

Lie on your side with your body in a straight line Fold your arms across your chest Keep your legs together and lift them as high as you can Simultaneously, lift your upper body towards your legs Slowly lower yourself back

Lie on your side on the floor with your legs together, and your body in a straight line Prop your upper body on your elbow and forearm Lift your hips off the floor, pulling your ribcage and pelvis together Lower your body back to the floor in a controlled motion Repeat on the other side

Stand upright and grab a barbell with your hands shoulder-width apart Keeping your torso and arms stationary, extend your elbows to lift the barbell behind you Pause for a moment at the top Return to the starting position in a slow and controlled manner Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Stand upright and hold the barbell behind your back using a wider than shoulder width overhand grip Bend at the hips and lower your upper body until about parallel with the floor Extend your upper arms and hold this contraction at the top for a brief moment Return to the starting position in a controlled fashion

Stand with your feet approximately shoulder-width apart, maintaining a slight bend in your knees Hold the barbell at waist level with your palms facing your body Curl the barbell upward, maintaining control, until your forearms are vertical Pause for a brief moment at the top Slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting waist level position

Stand tall with a barbell in your hands, palms facing towards your body Keeping your elbows close to your body, raise the barbell towards your shoulders Squeeze your biceps at the top Lower the barbell back down in a controlled motion to the starting position Repeat for desired amount of reps

Lie flat on a bench with the Olympic barbell held over your chest Bend your elbows to lower the bar towards your forehead Stop just before the bar touches your forehead Push the barbell back to the starting position Repeat the exercise until your set is complete

Start in the push-up position, but with your forearms on the ground Extend one arm out in front of you Align your body so it forms a straight line from your head to your heels Hold the position for as long as you can Switch arms and repeat

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Curl your left arm behind your back and apply pressure over it with the help of your right hand. Maintain this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Hold a vertical bar or pole with one hand, a bit higher than your reach Bend your knees slightly and lean back, allowing your arm to be fully extended Maintain this position for the desired amount of repetitions and then switch hands Keep your back straight throughout

Stand on one foot next to a stable support to hold onto Keep your other leg bent and off the surface Raise your heel by extending your ankle as high as possible Lower your heel by flexing your ankle until your calf is stretched Repeat the movement

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Lift one foot off the ground and balance on the other foot Rise up onto the balls of your standing foot Slowly lower your heel back to the ground Repeat the exercise for your desired number of reps, then switch to the other foot

Stand on flat ground, lift one foot off the ground, balancing on the other leg Slowly raise your heel as high as possible, emphasizing the contraction in the calf muscle Hold for a moment and then lower your heel back to the ground Complete your set and then switch to the other leg Repeat the process for the other leg

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Shift your weight to one leg and lift the other foot slightly off the floor Bend your standing knee to lower your body a quarter of the way down Hold the position for a moment and then rise back up Switch legs and repeat

Stand on one leg, keeping the other leg straight and lifted slightly off the floor Slowly lower your body by bending the knee of the standing leg Maintain balance and continue to lower yourself until your thigh is almost parallel to the floor Pause for a moment, then push your body back up to the starting position

Start in a standard push up position but with one arm extended to the side Lower your body towards the ground, bending only one arm, while the other remains extended Push your body back upwards to the start position Repeat the same process on the other side Ensure that you keep your body in a straight line throughout the workout

name_en: Open and Knee Tuck on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on the edge of the stool with your hands gripping the sides Lean back slightly and tuck your knees to your chest Extend your legs out straight in front of you without touching the floor Pull your knees back into your chest Repeat the process for the desired number of repetitions

Lie down on your side with your knees bent and your arms together in front of you Keep your knees on the ground and rotate your upper body to open your chest Extend the top arm towards the ceiling Continue to open your chest until your back is on the floor or as far as is comfortable Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side

Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat on the floor, and palms flat against the floor by your sides Press your hips upward off the floor, creating a straight line from your knees to your shoulders While in the lifted position, lower your butt a few inches, then lift back up Hold your glutes tight as you pulse Slowly lower your hips back to the initial position on the floor

Sit at the edge of a chair and lean back slightly, supporting your body with your arms Open your legs outward while keeping your feet together Press your legs back to the start position Repeat the process Maintain controlled movements throughout

name_en: Opposite Arm and Leg Raise against Wall
description_en: Stand upright close to a wall Extend one arm to touch the wall for balance Extend the opposite leg straight behind you Return to the initial position and switch to the other side Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps

Lie on your back with your knees bent and your hands behind your head Raise your right elbow and left knee, trying to touch them together Lower them, and repeat with your left elbow and right knee Continue alternating sides Keep your lower back in contact with the ground throughout the exercise

Stand straight with your feet shoulder width apart, holding a kettlebell or dumbbell in front of you Raise the weight to your chest, then push it overhead Lower the weight to your chest, then lower it to the starting position Repeat this movement for your desired number of reps

Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand Lift the weights up to the shoulders using your arms and shoulder muscles Raise heels off the floor as the weights are lifted Lower heels back to the ground and bring the weights back down to your sides

Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart Raise your arms out to your sides, elbows slightly bent and palms facing down Swiftly move your arms forward until they cross, turning palms to face up Quickly bring your arms back to the sides with palms facing down, then to the back with palms up Continue these outward and inward movements at a fast pace
Stand tall with your back straight, arms by your side, and feet shoulder-width apart. Open your arms wide and clap by extending them overhead. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms overhead and fold your elbows. Grab your left elbow with your right hand and pull it towards the right side. Hold this stretch for some time.

Stand tall with feet hip-width apart Raise your arms straight out to the sides at shoulder level Bring your hands together above your head Return your arms to the starting position at shoulder level Repeat this movement for the desired number of reps

name_en: Overhead Extension Resistance Band Both Arms
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and a resistance band under your feet. Hold the ends of the band with your arms extended overhead with bent elbows. Stretch the band by straightening your arms overhead. As your arm become fully extended, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart and arms at your sides Do a jumping jack by spreading your legs wide and clapping your hands overhead Immediately transition into an overhead jack by bringing your legs together and moving your arms down to your sides Repeat this movement, alternating between jumping jacks and overhead jacks Continue for your desired length of time or until fatigue

Stand straight with your feet shoulder width apart Lift your right knee and left arm at the same time so your elbow and knee meet in the middle of your body Lower them back to the starting position Do the same with your left knee and right arm Repeat the exercise for the desired amount of sets and reps

name_en: Overhead Sit-up with Legs on Bench
description_en: Lie on your back on the floor with your legs over a bench. Place your hands behind your head and keep your elbows wide. Contract your abdominal muscles and lift your upper body towards your legs. Lower your body back down in a controlled manner. Repeat the exercise for the desired amount of reps.

Stand or sit upright and reach your right arm overhead Bend your right elbow, placing the palm of your right hand against your upper back or shoulder blades Use your left hand to gently press down on your right elbow Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then switch arms Repeat the movement with the other arm

Stand or sit upright and raise your right arm straight up Bend your elbow to position your right hand behind your neck or upper back Use your left hand to gently pull your right elbow downwards Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds Repeat on your left side

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Raise your arms overhead and fold your elbows. Pull one of your elbows towards the other side with your opposite hand. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie down on your back with your legs slightly bent and hold a weighted plate above your shoulders while keeping your arms straight Raise your chest off the floor towards your knees unless your shoulders come right under the plate Hold and return toward the initial position slowly

Lie down on your back with your legs straight, resting on the floor, and your hands holding a dumbbell overhead with slightly bent arms Raise your chest and your knees towards each other while bringing the dumbbell above your knees As the dumbbell reach above your knees, return to the starting position slowly
Stand tall and bring the palms together at chest level Push the hands against each other while keeping the abs contracted Hold this position for about 10-15 seconds Release and repeat

Stand up straight holding an EZ barbell in both hands at shoulder level Press the barbell up above your head Bend your elbows, lowering the bar behind your head Push the barbell back up until your arms are fully extended Return to the starting position

Stand straight and extend your arms out to your sides. Rotate your hands so that your palms face upwards. Rotate your hands back so that your palms face downwards. Repeat this motion in a controlled manner. Maintain your elbow and shoulder position throughout the exercise.

Stand straight with your arms relaxed by your sides Slowly rotate your palms upward and then downward Repeat the movement for a set amount of repetitions Ensure to engage your shoulders as you rotate your palms

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Spread your arms wide above shoulder level with your palms down. Lower your arms down while turning the palms side up. As your arms make a 45-degree angle with your torso, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Parallel Bars Bent Knee Inverted Row
description_en: Position yourself under the parallel bars so your back is facing the ground Bend your knees at a 90 degree angle and cross your ankles By using your arms, pull your body upwards until the chest reaches the level of the bars Hold for a second, then slowly lower your body back to the start

Start on all fours, wrists under shoulders, knees under hips Extend your right arm forward and your left leg backward, keep your balance Hold this balanced position for few seconds while breathing calmly Return to the initial position Repeat this with your left arm and the right leg

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Start the movement by pushing your hips back and bending your knees Lower yourself until your thighs are parallel to the floor, then hold the position for a pause of 1-2 seconds Push back up to the starting position through your heels Repeat the exercise for the recommended amount of repetitions or until failure

Get on a peck deck fly machine with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab the machine's handles while bending your arms and opening your elbows wide. Push the machine's handles close by bringing your elbows forward. Return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor Tighten your abdominal and gluteal muscles and raise your hips off the floor Hold the position for a few moments before lowering your body back down slowly Take a brief rest before lifting your hips again Repeat this exercise as recommended

Lie flat on your back on an exercise mat or the floor Keep your knees bent with both feet flat on the ground Tighten your Glutes and lift your hips off the ground Hold the position for a few seconds Slowly lower your hips back to the starting position

Lie flat on your back on a mat, bend your knees and place your feet flat on the floor hip-width apart Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine and tilt your pelvis up until your lower back is flat against the ground Hold this position for 10-20 seconds Relax and return to the initial position Repeat these steps for the desired number of repetitions

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Place your arms at your sides, palms down. Inhale and push through your heels, lift your hips off the floor while contracting your glutes. Lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees. Hold the position at the top for a moment, then slowly lower your hips back to the starting position. Repeat the move for the required number of repetitions.

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart and lean forward, taking your hips back and bending your knees. Grab the barbell near your shin with an overhand grip, arms straight, and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell by opening your elbows wide and taking them past your back. Return to the initial position by lowering your elbows and repeat.

Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise your right arm above your head and simultaneously lift your left leg to the side Lower arm and leg together Repeat process with your left arm and right leg Continue alternating for the desired number of repetitions
Stand with feet hip-width apart Swing one leg forward and the other leg back Jump and switch leg positions in mid-air, landing softly Continue this swing-switch motion for desired reps

Stand upright on a flat surface Shift weight to one foot Lift the other foot's heel off the ground, keeping the toes in contact with the surface Gently push down on lifted foot's toes to enhance the stretch Alternate feet and repeat

Stand upright and cross your legs, putting your weight on the foot of the targeted calf Place your hands on the knee of your crossed leg and gently apply downward pressure Maintain the stretch for 15-30 seconds Repeat the process for the other leg Perform the stretch for 2-3 sets

Start by squatting down, keeping your back straight and chest lifted Pick up an imaginary object from the ground Stand back up, still holding the imaginary object Walk around for a few steps, then squat back down and 'place' the object on the ground Repeat this motion throughout the exercise

Start in a seated position with your legs bent in front of you Bring one leg forward and bend it at the knee, placing the foot flat on the ground Slowly lower your torso over the bent knee, extending the other leg behind you Hold the stretch for a moment, then switch sides Repeat this exercise for the desired amount of time

Start in a table top position on your hands and knees Bring your right knee forward and out to the right side Slide your left leg straight back, top of foot on the ground Allow your right hip to lower towards the ground, as comfortable Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds and then switch sides

Stand tall and then lean forward to place your hands on the floor. Raise your hips and make an inverted V-shape while keeping your legs and arms straight. Lower your elbows to the floor and take yourself towards your hands. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Start in a push-up position, then walk your feet toward your hands until your hips are elevated Bend your elbows and lower your head towards the ground Push your body back upwards to the starting position Keep your hips up and your body in a straight line from your hands to your hips Repeat the exercise as needed

Start in a pushup position but with your feet closer to your hands, so your body forms an upside-down V shape Bend your elbows to lower your upper body toward the floor Press back up until your elbows are almost straight but not locked Repeat the motion in a controlled fashion

Place your hands on a bench shoulder-width apart Walk your feet backward until your body forms an inverted V Bend your elbows and lower your upper body towards the bench Push yourself back up to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand in front of a bench and place your hands on it Walk your feet back until your body forms a V shape Lower your upper body towards the bench by bending your elbows Push your body back up to the starting position Repeat for your desired number of reps

Place your hands shoulder-width apart on the floor and form an inverted V-shape with your body while keeping your back, arms, and legs straight. Lower yourself by taking your head between your hands while bending your arms. As your head reaches near the floor, raise it back to the initial position by straightening your arms.

Begin in a pike position with your feet on an elevated surface like a box or step Place your hands on the floor, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart Keep your hips high as you lower your upper body towards the floor Push back up to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Start by placing your hands on the parallettes, shoulder width apart Position your body in a pike position with your hips as the highest point Lower your body by bending your elbows until your head is near the ground Push your body back up to the initial position using your shoulders Repeat the motion for the desired number of reps

Start in a pike position, with your hands and feet on the ground Lower your body towards the ground leading with your chest As your chest almost touches the ground, change your body position to a cobra Push your body up by extending your arms fully Return to the starting position and repeat

Stand in front of a box or chair, extend one leg straight in front of you Begin to lower down into a squat, keeping your balance and control Sit back onto the box or chair, ensuring that your working leg remains extended Push through the heel of your grounded foot to rise back up to a standing position Repeat this movement, then switch legs

Start standing on one leg with your non-working leg extended straight in front of you Slowly lower yourself down to the box, keeping your non-working leg extended Once you touch the box, push up through your heel to return to standing Switch legs and repeat the exercise Maintain the correct form and balance during the squat

Stand in front of a chair with your feet hip-distance apart. Lift one foot off the floor and extend it straight in front of you. Slowly lower your body toward the chair, keeping your back straight and your abs engaged. Tap the chair lightly with your butt, then push through your standing heel to rise back up to starting position. Repeat with the other leg for one complete rep.

Start by standing tall with your feet flat and your arms by your sides Begin jogging in place, lifting your feet only a few inches from the ground As you jog, swing your arms naturally as if you were jogging on a track Maintain a steady pace and ensure that your back is straight and your core is engaged Continue for a set period of time

Stand in one place with your feet hip-width apart Jog lightly on the spot, lifting your knees high Swing your arms naturally at your sides as you jog Stay light on your feet and try to minimize your bounce Maintain a steady pace, and breathe regularly

Start in a tuck planche position on the bars, ball of your feet resting on the bars Dip your body down to perform a push-up while keeping your lower body raised in the tuck position Push back up to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat for the suggested number of repetitions Ensure to maintain your body position throughout the exercise

Start in a high plank position, keep your body in a straight line from your head to the heels Hop your feet towards your left hand, then hop back to the starting position Next, hop your feet toward your right hand and back Finally, hop your feet towards the middle, as close to your hands as possible, then back into the high plank Repeat the sequence for the desired amount of reps or time

name_en: Plank Alternate Anti Gravity Pull up
description_en: Begin in a plank position with your body straight and the weight on your toes and forearms. Contract your core and lift your hips to pull your body vertically, pivoting on the feet. Slowly lower yourself back to the original plank position. Alternate sides after a set amount of time or repetitions. Repeat for the desired number of sets and repetitions.

Start in a plank position, with your wrists under your shoulders and your feet hip-width apart Pull your right knee into your chest as far as you can Switch, pulling that knee out and bringing the other knee in Keep your hips down, your body should remain in a straight line from your head to your heels Repeat this motion, alternating legs

Assume a full push up position with arms extended and hands shoulder width apart Keep your body as flat as possible Slowly lift one arm off the floor and extend straight out ahead of you Return your arm to its original position Repeat this movement on the other side

Get into a push-up position but with elbows bent and forearms on the floor Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels Squeeze your glutes while maintaining the position Hold the position for as long as you can, aim for at least 30 seconds Rest and repeat for desired number of sets

Start in a high plank position, hands directly beneath your shoulders Lift your right foot slightly off the floor and swing it out to the side Touch the toe of your right foot to the ground Bring the foot back to the starting position Repeat with the left foot

Begin in a plank position with your hands under your shoulders and your body in a straight line Lift one foot off of the ground and tap it to the opposite side Return the foot to the starting position Repeat with the other foot Continue alternating tapping feet to opposite sides

Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders Shift your weight onto your left hand, then place your right hand slightly forward of your right shoulder Repeat the movement to the other side, keeping your body as still as possible Keep alternating hands Maintain a firm plank position throughout

Get down on your forearms and toes and align your body in a straight line from head to toe. Maintain this position, and open your legs apart by pushing the floor with your toes and raising them simultaneously Push the floor again and take your toes back to the initial position and repeat

Begin in a plank position with your shoulders directly over your wrists Your body should form a straight line from your head to your heels Jump your feet out wide and then back together Keep your core engaged and your hips steady throughout the movement Repeat for the desired amount of reps or for time

Start in a plank position with your shoulders directly above your wrists and your body in a straight line Jump your feet out to the sides, then jump them back together Keep your core engaged and try to keep your hips as still as possible throughout Repeat this jumping in and out motion for a given time or number of repetitions

name_en: Plank Jack on a padded stool
description_en: Start by getting into a plank position on the padded stool, with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels Jump your feet out wide, as if doing a horizontal jumping jack Quickly jump your feet back together, maintaining the plank position Continue the 'jacking' motion for the duration of the set

Start on the floor in the plank position with your forearms on the ground and feet together Jump your legs out to the sides as if doing a horizontal jumping jack Jump your feet back together Keep your abs engaged the whole time Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions

Start in a forearm plank position with your elbows directly beneath your shoulders Jump both feet out to the sides as if doing a jumping jack Quickly bring your legs back together Maintain a tight core and straight back throughout the exercise Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Start in a high plank position with a towel underneath your feet Spread your legs apart and slide your feet towards your hands Slide your feet back to the starting position Bring your feet back together Repeat this movement for the desired number of reps

Get down on your hands and toes and align your body in a straight line from your neck to your ankles Keep your legs and arms straight, and your hands should be right under your shoulders Maintain weight on your hands and take your knees towards your elbows by jumping on your feet Jump again, and straighten your legs back to the initial position by landing on your toes

Start in a forearm plank position, legs extended and body straight Raise your right arm straight out to the side until it is at shoulder level Pause for a moment at the top of the raise Slowly return your right arm back to plank position Repeat the same process with your left arm

Begin by assuming a traditional plank position. Lift one leg slightly off the ground, maintaining the straight line of your body. Hold the position for few seconds, then lower your leg back down. Repeat the movement by alternating between your right and left leg. Maintain control and balance throughout each movement, and avoid straining your neck or back.

Get down on your hands and toes with your back straight and legs extended. Bring one of your knees forward and place your foot near the outer margin of your hand. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Get down on your forearms and toes and align your body in a straight line from head to toe. Keep your legs straight, and your elbows should be right under your shoulders and palms resting on the floor Maintain this position

Begin in a push up position, your body forming a straight line from your head to your feet Place your hands directly under your shoulders with fingers spread wide Hold this position, keeping your body straight Engage your core muscles Hold for desired time period

Begin in a high plank position with towels under your feet Push your backside up towards the ceiling as you slide your feet towards your hands Try to keep your legs straight-ish as you pull in Slide feet back out to return to high plank position Repeat the movements for your desired number of reps

Begin in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your feet hip-width apart Jump your knees into your chest while keeping your hands grounded Jump your feet back to the starting position Maintain a tight core throughout the entire exercise Repeat this motion at a quick pace

Start by getting into a plank position with your body weight supported by your toes and forearms Keep your body straight and your abdominals engaged Maintain this posture as you reach out with one arm to an imaginary plate in front of you and slowly pull it towards you Switch arms and repeat the motion Keep alternating arms for the duration of the exercise

Start in a low plank position with your elbows under your shoulders, feet apart, and body forming a straight line from your head to heels Raise your body up by extending your arms one after another until you're in a high plank or push-up position Perform a push-up by bending your elbows and lowering your chest to the floor Push yourself back up to the high plank position Do a row by pulling your right elbow back keeping it close to your side; repeat with the left elbow

Get down on your hands and toes while extending your legs and back. Grab a bottle in one hand and raise it by opening your arm wide towards the shoulder. As your arm reaches shoulder level, return to the initial position,  and repeat.
