Start in a high plank position, with your hands shoulder-width apart and body in a straight line Shift your weight onto your left hand and tap your right hand to your left shoulder Return your right hand to the floor and repeat with the left hand tapping your right shoulder Continue alternating shoulder taps, keeping your hips as still as possible Try to do as many repetitions as you can while maintaining good form

Get down on your hands and toes with your back straight and legs extended. Bring one of your hands off the floor and tap your opposite shoulder with it. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat with your other hand.

Start in a high plank position with your shoulders stacked directly over your wrists Rotate your outer left foot to the right as you bend your left knee into your chest Kick your left leg under and across your body to the right Return your left leg to the start position and repeat on the right side Continue alternating sides for the desired amount of time or reps

Start in a forearm plank position, with your elbows directly under your shoulders Keep your body straight, and your core engaged Step both feet to the right side, without lifting your hips or twisting your body, follow with your arms Do the same movement to the left side Repeat the sequence for a set amount of reps

Start in a plank position with your body in a straight line from head to heels Touch your left hand to your right thigh Return your hand to the plank position Then touch your right hand to your left thigh Return to the start position and repeat

Start in a high plank position, with your hands directly under your shoulders and your feet hip-width apart Engage your core and lift your hips up and back to create an inverted V with your body Lower your body back into a high plank position Try to keep your legs as straight as possible throughout the movement Repeat for a set of reps

Start in a high plank position, hands under your shoulders and feet hip-width apart Walk your hands towards your feet and come into a squat position Hold the squat briefly, then walk your hands back out to a plank Repeat for a desired number of repetitions Keep your core tight and back flat during the entire movement

Lie on your right side with your legs straight and your feet stacked on each other, and your left arm straight up at the level of your shoulders Lift your hips off the floor and bear your weight on your elbow and the side of your right foot Now, lower your hips towards the floor but not let them touch it Riasre your hips again and repeat

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a weight plate near your thighs with straight arms. Raise the plate by extending your arms forward. As they cross the shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.
Pick up a pair of weight plates and pinch them together with your fingers Hold for as long as possible Rest and then repeat the exercise Gradually increase the weight as your grip strength improves

Get into a high plank position with your palms flat on the ground Lower your body down until your chest nearly touches the floor Push your body up with enough force that your hands leave the ground As you land, immediately lower for your next push-up Repeat the movement

Start by standing tall with your feet together Take a large step to your right with your right foot and sink into a side lunge, keeping your left leg straight and your right knee bent Push off your right foot and return to the starting position Repeat on the left side Continue to alternate sides for your desired amount of reps

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Take your right foot out to the right and bend at the knee, lowering your body towards the right Stretch your left leg and keep the foot flat on the ground Push off from the right foot to return to the starting position Repeat on the left side

Stand upright with your back straight, arms at your sides, and feet double shoulder-width apart. Shift your weight to the right side while leaning forward and bending your right knee. While leaning forward, also bring your left hand towards the floor and raise your other arm overhead.

Stand in front of a wall with your feet shoulder width apart. Lower yourself into a squat position. Then, explosively jump up and extend your legs. Land back in the squat position, maintaining control of your body. Repeat the exercise as per your training plan.

Stand straight with your feet a bit wider than shoulder-width apart Perform a regular squat, then engage your core and jump up When you land, lower your body back into the squat position to complete one rep Land as quietly as possible, which requires control Do 2 sets of 10 reps

Find a flat wall and stand with your back against it Tilt your head back so that it is against the wall, keeping your body straight Push your head back into the wall lightly, keeping the pressure steady Hold this position for around ten seconds Relax for a few seconds and repeat

Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart Bend your knees and sink your hips back as if you are about to sit on a chair Lower your body as much as you can while keeping your back straight Push back up to the initial position Repeat for the desired repetitions

Begin in a standing position with feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart Lower your body down as though you are about to sit on an invisible chair Keep your knees inline with your second toe Lower until thighs are parallel to the floor Rise back to the starting position by pushing through your heels

Stand close to a support and spread your feet shoulder-width apart Lower your body into a squat, keeping your chest up Use the support to balance Press your heels into the ground and return to standing Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand facing a wall, extending your arms in front of you for support Squat down, pushing your hips back as if youre sitting in a chair Ensure your knees are in line with your feet Push through your heels to stand back up Repeat the motion for your desired amount of repetitions

Stand tall with feet hip-width apart, holding the barbell at your shins Begin the lift by driving through your heels, raising the barbell up your legs As the bar passes your knees, move your body under the bar, catching it at shoulder height Extend your legs and stand tall Carefully lower the weight back to the starting position

Start by holding a barbell at the shins with a wider than shoulder-width grip Pull the barbell up to your chest in one fluid motion, dropping into a squat as you do so Push the barbell overhead explosively, while using the momentum to rise from the squat Lower the barbell back to the starting position on the floor Repeat the motion for a series of reps

Start in a standing position with your feet together and your arms at your sides. Jump up, while spreading your legs wider than hip width apart and simultaneously raising your arms above your head. Jump again to bring your feet back together and lowering your arms to the starting position. Repeat the movements in a rapid, fluid motion. Maintain a steady rhythm, keeping the intensity high throughout the exercise.

Start in a push-up position but keep your elbows on the ground aligning underneath your shoulders Engage your core tightening your abs and keep your body straight from top to heel Extend your right arm forward and hold the position Repeat the process with the left arm Repeat the series for the required amount of time or sets

Place your hands on the handles of the sled, bending your knees slightly. Push through your legs to move the sled backwards, maintaining a straight back. Keep your core engaged, and continue to push the sled with your weight in your heels. Do this for a set distance or time frame, then rest before the next set. Maintain a consistent, slow, and controlled movements throughout.

Stand behind the power sled, holding the ropes or handles Begin by driving your feet into the ground and pulling the sled towards you Walk backwards while maintaining a tight core and straight back Keep driving your feet and pulling the sled until you've reached your desired distance Relax and slowly walk forwards, returning the sled to its starting position

Place your hands on the handles of the power sled at about shoulder height Keep your body low, knees bent, and push the sled forward Continue to push the sled for your determined distance Turn around and reset for the next rep Repeat this process for the required reps/sets

Stand behind the sled with your hands on the handles Lower your body into a half-squat position Push the sled forward using your legs and keeping your core engaged Walk or run as you press the sled forward Continue for the designated distance or time

Stand behind the sled with your feet shoulder-width apart Grasp the sled handles and straighten your back Pull the sled towards you by walking backwards Ensure your legs are doing the work, not your back Continue walking backward until you've reached your desired distance

Stand up straight while holding the barbell with an overhand grip. The barbell should be resting on your upper chest Extend your arms straight up while keeping your elbows slightly bent Lower the barbell back down to your chest in a controlled manner Repeat the entire movement for desired repetitions Avoid fully locking your elbows at the top of the movement

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Place your palms together in front of your chest like a prayer Push your hands together as hard as you can Hold for several seconds then relax Repeat as per your workout routine

Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart Place your palms together in a prayer position, keeping your fingers pointing upwards Push your hands together as hard as you can whilst engaging your shoulder muscles Do not allow your hands to move apart during the entire exercise Hold for a few seconds then release

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Clasp your hands together at chest level, palms pressed against each other Push your hands against each other as hard as you can for a count of 10-20 seconds, keeping your body still Relax for a moment, then repeat for desired number of reps

Start by standing upright, palms together in a 'prayer' position Extend your arms forward until they are straight out in front of you Clench your chest muscles and hold this position Continue holding for the desired amount of time Relax and return to the start position

Stand tall with the palms together at chest level, like in a prayer position Apply constant pressure by pushing your palms together Hold for 5 seconds, then relax for a few seconds Repeat the movement for the desired amount of reps and sets

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and your hands clasped together in prayer position Perform a quarter squat and then explosively jump as high as you can Swing your hands down as you squat and then bring them back to prayer position as you jump Land softly with your knees slightly bent, back in the quarter squat position Repeat this movement without pausing between repetitions

Start in a lunge position with the right foot forward and the hands in prayer position. Jump up, pulling the left knee towards the chest and simultaneously pushing the hands out in front. Land softly back into lunge position and immediately repeat the exercise. After your set, switch legs and do the same with left foot forward.

Sit on a preacher curl machine, press your chest against it and place your arms straight on the platform. Hold a barbell with an underhand grip and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell towards your shoulders by bending your arm. As you reach the shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Get on the preacher curl machine, lean forward, and place your arms on its platform. Hold the dumbbells in your hands with straight arms and palms on the upper side. Raise the dumbbells towards the shoulders by bending your arms. As they reach shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Sit on a preacher curl machine, press your chest against it and place your arms straight on the platform. Hold an EZ barbell with an underhand grip and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell towards your shoulders by bending your arm. As you reach the shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Preacher curl ez bar close grip
description_en: Sit on a preacher curl machine, press your chest against it and place your arms straight on the platform. Hold an EZ barbell with an underhand grip and hands placed close to each other. Raise the barbell towards your shoulders by bending your arm. As you reach the shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Preacher curl ez bar wide grip
description_en: Sit on a preacher curl machine, press your chest against it and place your arms straight on the platform. Hold an EZ barbell with an underhand grip and hands placed wider than your shoulders width. Raise the barbell towards your shoulders by bending your arm. As you reach the shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Sit on a preacher curl machine, press your chest against it and place one of your arms over the platform. Hold the dumbbell in your hand while keeping the arm straight and the palm side up. Raise the dumbbell towards your shoulder by bending your arm. As you reach near the shoulder, return to the initial position and repeat.

Sit on the preacher bench and rest your arms on the pad, extended and shoulder width apart. Hold the barbell with an underhand grip, hands shoulder width apart. Curl the bar until your biceps are fully contracted, keeping your upper-arms stationary. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Get on the preacher curl machine, lean forward, and place your arms on its platform. Hold the dumbbells in your hands with straight arms and forearms facing each other. Raise the dumbbells towards the shoulders by bending your arms. As they reach shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides Jump into the air and spread your legs apart While in mid-air, raise your arms and clap your hands overhead, similar to a jumping jack As you land, crouch down into a squat, extending your arms in front of you as if you're reaching out to grab something Repeat this movement continuously for your desired amount of repetitions

Begin in a standing position with feet shoulder width apart Go into a deep squat, keeping your back straight As you stand up, raise your arms above your head as if doing an overhead press Lower your arms to the starting position as you squat down again Repeat this process

Sit down on your hips with a straight back, put your hands near your hips, and extend your legs forward. Fold your right leg and place your foot near the left knee. Twist your torso towards the right and tuck your left elbow against your knee while turning your forearm inward. Hold this position for 30-60 seconds.

Start laying flat on your back, knees bent and feet flat on the floor Engage your core and roll into a seated position without using your arms From the seated position, push through your heels to stand up straight Lower yourself back down to the ground controlling your movements Repeat the movement for your desired number of reps

Start by standing tall with your feet hip-width apart and your hands behind your head Lift your right knee as high as you can towards your chest Whilst lifting your knee, engage your core and crunch your abdominals Lower your right knee and repeat the movement with your left knee Continue alternating between your right and left knee

Stand tall with an inclined bench between your feet and press your chest against it while raising your heels off the floor. Hold the barbell under the bench with an underhand grip, straight arms, and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Pull the barbell up by folding your arms and raising your elbows past your back.

name_en: Prone bench row barbell supinated grip
description_en: Stand tall with an inclined bench between your feet and press your chest against it while raising your heels off the floor. Hold the barbell under the bench with an overhand grip, straight arms, and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Pull the barbell up by folding your arms and raising your elbows past your back.

Stand tall with an inclined bench between your feet and press your chest against it while raising your heels off the floor. Hold the dumbbells under the bench with straight arms, hands shoulder-width apart, and your palms facing each other. Pull the dumbbells up by folding your arms and raising your elbows past your back.

name_en: Prone bench row dumbbells pronated grip
description_en: Stand tall with an inclined bench between your feet and press your chest against it while raising your heels off the floor. Hold the dumbbells under the bench with an overhand grip, arms straight, and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Pull the dumbbells up by folding your arms and raising your elbows past your back.

Lie flat on your stomach with your arms straight out to your sides Slowly lift your head and chest off the ground Hold this position for a few seconds Slowly lower your head and chest back to the ground

Lay flat on your stomach with your arms by your sides Extend your neck to raise your forehead Hold for a set period of time, then relax and lower your forehead Repeat this for the desired number of reps

Lay face down on a mat, with your arms extended straight out in front of you Lift your chest up off the floor while keeping your arms straight Hold this position for a few seconds Lower your chest back to the floor Repeat this motion for the desired number of times

Lie flat on the ground, face down, and arms forming a Y shape Lift your arms and chest off the ground Hold the position at the top for a second Slowly lower yourself back to the ground Repeat the exercise for your intended count

Start in a push-up position with hands underneath your shoulders Tighten your abs and biceps to ensure a stiff body line Push your shoulder blades apart Hold this position for the desired time Slowly return to the starting position

Get into a high plank position, body straight and hands directly under your shoulders Jump your feet out to the sides as if you're doing a jumping jack, keeping your hands stationary Jump your feet back in, returning to the initial high plank position Ensure your hips stay level and do not drop as you perform the movement Repeat for the desired number of reps

Place your hands on the floor, wider than your shoulders, with fingers pointing towards your toes Lean forward, shifting your body weight onto your arms, until your feet are barely touching the ground Lower your upper body to the floor by bending your elbows Push back up by straightening your arms Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a cable resistance band in your hands while extending your arms to shoulder height. Stretch the band by opening your arms wide to the sides. As your arms are aligned with the shoulders, return to the initial position and repeat.

Start sitting on the ball and feel the balance Lean back and position the ball under your lower-mid back Pull your upper body up towards your knees, contracting your abdominals Slowly lower back down to the ball Repeat the exercise for the desired amount of reps

Start by lying on your back with your calves and heels on the stability ball Pull your knees towards your chest, rolling the ball towards you with your feet Hold this position briefly, then slowly extend your legs and roll the ball back Repeat for desired number of repetitions

Grasp the pull-up bar with hands a little wider than shoulder width apart Begin to lift your body upwards until your chin is above the bar Hold the top position briefly Slowly lower your body back to the start position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Find a pull-up bar and jump or use a step to reach the top position Hold your position at the top for a brief pause with your chin over the bar Lower yourself down slowly and in a controlled manner until your arms are fully extended Pause briefly at the bottom Repeat the exercise for desired repetitions

Position yourself under the pull-up bar Use a box or bench to jump up and reach the top position with your chin over the bar Hold this position for a few seconds Slowly lower yourself down until your arms are fully extended Do not just drop down - control your descent

Grab the pull-up bar with a wide grip Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar Hold at the top for a second Slowly lower your body back to the start position Avoid a complete hang at the bottom to maintain tension in the muscles

Stand directly underneath a pull-up bar. Reach up and grab the bar with a neutral grip. Pull your body up until your chin reaches the height of the bar. Pause for a moment before you start to lower yourself. Lower your body in a controlled motion until your arms are fully extended.

Start by hanging on a bar with an overhand grip and your hands placed wider than your shoulder width. Bend your knees and roll your feet over each other to keep them off the floor. Pull yourself up by folding your arms and take your chest towards the bar. Return to the initial position slowly and repeat.

Start by hanging on a bar with an overhand grip and your hands placed wide apart holding its edges. Bend your knees and roll your feet over each other to keep them off the floor. Pull yourself up by folding your arms and take your chest towards the bar. Return to the initial position slowly and repeat.

name_en: Pull up wide grip front view
description_en: Start by hanging on a bar with an overhand grip and your hands placed wider than your shoulder width. Bend your knees and roll your feet over each other to keep them off the floor. Pull yourself up by folding your arms and take your chest towards the bar. Return to the initial position slowly and repeat.

name_en: Pull up with Bent Knee between Chairs
description_en: Place two sturdy chairs shoulder-width apart Situate yourself between the chairs, grabbing the backrests Pull yourself up by bending your knees and pulling them towards your chest Pause for a brief moment then lower yourself back down in a controlled manner

name_en: Pull-up with Bent Knee between Chairs
description_en: Place two sturdy chairs slightly wider than hip-width apart. Stand between the chairs and place your hands on the backrests. Lift your feet off the ground by bending your knees. Pull your body up until your chin is above the level of the chairs. Lower your body in a slow, controlled movement until your arms are fully extended.

Stand facing the wall with your hands on the wall and your feet straight behind you Lower your chest towards the wall by bending your elbows Push your body back to the starting position, moving your shoulder blades towards each other. This is a pulse motion Repeat for recommended reps

Stand with feet hip width apart, arms extended Bend over at a 45 degree angle Pull your arms back to your chest in a quick, pulsing motion Lower your arms back into the starting position Repeat for the necessary amount of repetitions

Start in a split stance with one foot in front of the other Lower down into a lunge position until your front knee is at a 90 degree angle Then, pulse up and down by raising and lowering your body slightly After a set duration, switch the position of your legs and repeat

Lay down on your back with your hands under your hips Raise your legs straight up towards the ceiling Lift your hips off the ground in a quick, small upward motion, creating a 'pulse' Slowly lower your hips back down Repeat the motion without resting your hips on the ground

Sit on the ground with legs extended in front of you Rotate your legs outward and close them, engaging the hip adductors Rotate back with control, engaging your Hip Flexors and Glutes Repeat this movement with short, controlled pulses

Stand upright with feet hip-width apart Extend your arms out to your sides at shoulder height, palms facing forward Bring your arms in front of your chest, crossing one over the other Pulse your arms in and out in this crossed position Return to the starting position and repeat the process with the other arm crossing over

Start on all fours with your knees hip-width apart and your wrists stacked over your shoulders Keeping your knee bent, push your right foot up towards the ceiling and then lower it back down Do not touch your knee to the ground, rather, let it hover After completing the desired number of reps, switch to the left leg

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground Push your heels down and lift your hips up to make your body form a straight line from shoulders to knees Lower your butt slightly without letting it touch the ground, then lift it back up Pulse up and down with small, constant movements for a set amount of time Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Position yourself in a push-up stance with palms facing each other and the fingers touching Bend your elbows outwards, lowering your chest towards the floor At the bottom of the movement, do a small pulse by lowering a little more and then pushing up a little After the pulse, push back up to the starting position repeate the process

Begin standing tall with your feet parallel and shoulder-width distance apart Step out to the right keeping your left leg straight Bend your right knee until your thigh is parallel with the floor Pulse gently up and down Return to standing position and repeat on left side

Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart Shift your weight and body to one side, bending the knee of the lunging side While in the lunge position, execute a punch forward with the opposite hand Push off with your lunging foot to return to the original position Repeat on the other side

Stand with feet together and hands at your sides Start by doing a traditional jumping jack but when your feet jump out, punch forward with your right arm As your feet jump back together, retract your right punch Repeat the movement, this time punching forward with your left arm Continue the exercise, alternating arms

Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart Bend your elbows and bring your fists up to shoulder level Start marching on the spot and simultaneously throw punches forward Keep alternating hands and maintain a steady rhythm Continue the marching and punching for the desired time or repetitions

Begin with a fighting stance, feet hip-width apart Punch forward with one arm while stepping back with the opposite foot Return to your starting position Perform this move with the other arm and foot Maintain a high tempo for this exercise

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart and hands by your side Take a step forward with your right foot and simultaneously throw a punch with your left hand Pull your left hand back to its original position and step back to the starting position Repeat the exercise by stepping forward with your left foot and punching with your right hand Continue alternating sides for your desired amount of reps or time

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent Raise your fists to your chin and step forward with your right foot Punch with your left hand to the opposite direction of your right foot Quickly retract your left hand and step back to the original position Repeat this movement, alternating between your left and right foot

Stand with your legs shoulder-width apart Rotate your torso to the right while performing a punching motion with your left hand Quickly switch sides and rotate to the left, punching your right hand forward Keep switching the sides in a quick but controlled manner Ensure that your hand goes back to your body during the rotational movement

Start on all fours, ensuring your shoulders are over your wrists and your hips are over your knees. Walk your hands forward a few inches and press your chest towards the floor. Keep your elbows lifted and your hips stacked above your knees. Keep your head in a neutral position or rest it gently on the floor. Hold the stretch for 5 to 10 deep breaths, then slowly come back to all fours.

Begin on your hands and knees in a tabletop position Walk your hands out in front of you, sinking your chest towards the floor Leave your hips over your knees and let your forehead come to the floor Hold the stretch for a period of time, then carefully release and rest

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and raise your arms to the sides at shoulder height Slowly bring your arms forward, crossing them over your chest Pause for a moment, then slowly extend your arms back out and behind your back as far as possible Return to the starting position and repeat Continue for the recommended amount of repetitions

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and extend your arms in front of you at shoulder height Begin to shift your weight to one side, rotating your arms to the same side. Keep your feet grounded Rotate your body back to the initial position. This completes one rep Now shift your weight and rotate your arms to the other side. Repeat the exercise

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Bend your knees slightly and push through the balls of your feet to jump into the air While in the air, extend your legs and arms out to the side, keeping a slight bend in your elbows and knees Jump back to your starting position, bringing your arms back down to your sides Repeat these movements in a fast, fluid motion for the duration of your exercise session

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell at your shoulders Bend your knees slightly and then push up to a standing position At the same time, press the barbell straight up overhead Lower the barbell down to your shoulders again in a controlled motion Repeat the exercise for your desired number of reps

Place your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart on the floor. Keeping your body straight, lower yourself until your chest nearly touches the floor. Push back up to the starting position. Avoid flaring out your elbows and keep your body rigid. Breathe in as you lower down and breathe out as you push up.

Start in a high plank position with your hands flat on the ground, directly under your shoulders Slowly lower your body towards the ground Push your body up, returning to the starting position Ensure your body is in a straight line during the whole movement Repeat the exercise as necessary

Stand facing the wall, extend your arms in front of you and place your palms flat on the wall at shoulder height and shoulder-width apart Bend your elbows and bring your body towards the wall Press your palms into the wall to push your body back to the starting position Keep your body in a straight line throughout the movement Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Place your hands on the flat side of the Bosu ball, shoulder-width apart Keep your body straight and lower your chest towards the Bosu ball Press your body back up to the original position Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions Keep your abdominals engaged throughout the exercise

Stand facing the wall at an arm's length away Place your hands flat on the wall at shoulder width Bend your elbows and lean your body towards the wall Push your body back to the starting position without locking your elbows Repeat this move for your set number of repetitions

Start on your hands and knees. Knees should remain on the ground, hands shoulder-width apart. Slowly lower your body until your chest almost touches the floor. Pause and push your body back to the starting position. Keep your head in line with your body throughout this movement. Make sure your body is in a straight line throughout the exercise.

Start in a traditional push-up position, your body forming a straight line from your head to your heels Perform a push-up, lowering your body so your chest touches the ground Push up explosively, and as you do, hop your hands to one side Perform another push-up in this position Explode up again, hopping your hands back to center

name_en: Push-up Alternate Rear Lunge against Wall
description_en: Start in a push-up position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder width apart. Lower your body towards the ground until the chest nearly touching the floor. Push your body up back to the starting position. Follow this with a step back and lower into a lunge, keeping your hands against the wall. Repeat the movement, alternating legs for the lunge.

Get down on your hands and toes with your back straight. Keep your arms and legs straight and lower your chest to the floor by bending your arms. Raise your chest by straightening your arms and turning your torso to the right while extending your right arm. Return to the initial position and repeat while turning to the other side.

Assume a high plank position, with your palms flat on the ground Shift your weight to your left hand and stack your right hand on top of your left Perform a push-up in this position Shift your weight back to both hands, and then perform the same movement on the other side

Start by getting on all fours with your knees wider than your hips. Bend your elbows to lower your chest towards the ground, while pushing your butt back towards your heels. Return to the starting position by straightening your arms and lifting your butt. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Start in a traditional pushup position, with your feet together As you lower your body toward the floor, jump your feet out wide Push your body back up while simultaneously jumping your feet back together Repeat this movement for desired reps

Get into a push-up position with your hands grasping the medicine ball beneath your chest Lower your body towards the floor, keeping your elbows close to your body Push your body up until your arms are extended Repeat the movement for the required amount of repetitions

Start from a prone position, supporting your body with your forearms flat on the ground Keep your body aligned from your heels to your head Engage your core and push up, lifting your body slightly off the ground Lower your body back down to the starting position

Lie face down with your forearms on the floor and your elbows under your shoulders Push your body up until your arms are extended fully, supporting your body weight on your forearms and your toes Lower your body back down by bending your elbows, keeping your body straight Repeat for your desired number of repetitions

Get down on your hands and toes with your back straight. Keep your arms and legs straight and form a straight line with your body from the head to your ankles. Drop your chest a bit while squeezing your shoulder blades then lower your chest towards the floor by folding your arms. As your chest is about to touch the floor, raise it back to the starting position by straightening your arms. Repeat the whole sequence.

Start in the standard push-up position with your hands shoulder-width apart Lower your body until your chest is an inch from the ground Push up to the top of the range After reaching the top, push a little further to arch your upper back upwards while keeping your hips in place Return to the starting position

Start in a standard push-up position, hands shoulder-width apart, body in a straight line from head to feet Lower your body until your chest touches the floor, keeping your body straight Push back up to the original position At the top, push further to round your spine, as if trying to separate your shoulder blades Return to the starting position to complete one rep

Start in the push-up position, with your feet together and your hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Keeping your body straight, lower yourself down until your chest touches the floor. Push yourself back up while squeezing your pecs. Without resting, pull yourself up and bring your knees close to your chest. Return to the starting position and repeat.

Start in a high plank position, hands directly under the shoulders, a straight line from head to heels Perform a push-up, lowering the body to the floor Push up to the starting position Lift one hand off the ground and pull it up towards the chest, keeping the body stable Lower the hand back to the starting position and repeat with the other hand

Get down on your hands and toes with your back straight. Keep your arms and legs straight and lower your chest to the floor by bending your arms. Hold for a while, raise your chest by straightening your arms, and repeat.

Starting in a high plank position, perform a push-up by bending your elbows and lowering yourself down As you push back up to high plank position, rotate your body to one side forming a side plank Raise your upper arm towards the ceiling, keeping it straight Return to your starting position and repeat the push-up Perform the side plank on the opposite side and keep alternating

Start in a high plank position with your palms flat, hands shoulder-width apart Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor Push-up to the starting position Shift your weight onto your left hand and rotate your body to reach your right hand towards the ceiling in a side plank Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side

Begin in a high plank position, hands directly under shoulders, legs extended behind you Lower your body toward the floor, and as you press back up, twist your torso to one side and extend that side's arm toward the ceiling Stabilize with your core and return your hand to the plank position Repeat the move, twisting on the opposite side Alternate sides with each rep

Hold the stick in front of you with both hands, shoulder-width apart Keeping your elbows close to your side, rotate the PVC pipe to one side Rotate back to the central position Repeat same motion on the other side Ensure your rotations are controlled and smooth

Stand straight and hold the stick with both hands at hip level Descriptively, imagine a large 8 figure in front of you. Move the stick to sketch the 8 figure Make sure to get your upper body involved by twisting your torso Repeat this movement in a steady and consistent rhythm Control the stick throughout the motions

Stand upright and grab a stick with a wide grip. Keeper your chest pushed out and your back straight. Raise the stick over your head until you feel a stretch in your back. Hold for 15-30 seconds. Repeat for the prescribed number of times.

Stand upright and hold the stick behind your neck across your shoulders Bend forward at your hips, keeping your back straight until your torso is almost parallel to the floor Push your hips forward and return to the starting position Keep your knees slightly bent during the entire movement Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions

Stand upright and hold the PVC pipe vertically behind your back Ensure the pipe has three points of contact: your head, mid-back and hips Bend at your hips and push your backside out while maintaining the three points of contact with the pipe Pause for a moment in the hinged position Return to your standing position

Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart while holding the PVC pipe overhead, with your hands just wider than shoulder-width apart. Begin by pushing your hips back, bending your knees, and lowering your body towards the ground keeping your chest up. Ensure your heels remain grounded and your knees track in line with your toes. Continue to lower until your hip joint is level with or below your knee joint. Extend your knees and hips to return to the standing position, keeping the PVC pipe overhead throughout the move.

Hold the stick a little wider than shoulder width with palms down Start from your waist level, move the stick up and over your head Continue the motion until the stick reaches your lower back Reverse the motion to return to the starting position

Stand upright and step one foot back so that your feet are about 3 feet apart Align your heels, then turn your back foot out 45 degrees Square your hips and shoulders to face forward Fold forward from your hips over your front leg Reach down and try to touch your front foot or the floor
Lie down on your stomach Bend one knee and bring your foot towards your buttock Hold your ankle gently with your hand Repeat with the other leg

Lie face down on the floor. Bend your knee, bringing your heel towards your buttocks. Reach your hand back and grab your foot, maintaining the stretch. Hold this position from 10 to 30 seconds. Slowly release your hold and straighten your leg.

Stand up straight on one leg Keep your free hand out for balance if needed Bend your knee and pull your ankle back to your buttock Hold the position for up to 30 seconds Switch to the other leg and repeat

Stand upright and hold onto a wall or chair for balance if needed. Lift your right foot up behind you and grab it with your right hand. Pull your foot towards your back until you feel a stretch in your front thigh. Hold for 30 seconds or until you feel a good stretch. Switch sides and repeat.

Start on your hands and knees in a quadruped position Flex one leg and lift it to your buttocks while keeping your knee bent Lower the leg back to the starting position Repeat the exercise with the other leg Perform the exercise for the recommended number of repetitions

Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Place your hands behind your head, don't lock your fingers Raise your head and shoulders off the floor using your abdominal muscles Pause at the top then slowly lower back down to the starting position

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Place your hands on your chest Raise your upper body towards your knees about a quarter of the way Pause for a moment and then lower yourself back down

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Lift your right foot and then quickly put it down, do the same with your left foot Increase the speed slowly and continue to alternate feet as quickly as possible Maintain this rapid motion for at least 1 minute Rest for 30 seconds and repeat

Start in a standing position, feet hip-width apart Move one foot rapidly in front and then the other Try to quickly shift your weight from one foot to another Continue the sequence for your preferred period

Stand with your feet hip-width apart Start running in place as quickly as you can Keep your hands active as if you were really running Focus on quickly lifting and dropping your feet Continue for your desired length of time, then rest

Stand straight with feet hip-width apart Begin to jog in place, lifting your feet only a few inches off the ground Increase the speed gradually until your feet are moving as fast as possible Keep the movements small and quick while staying on the balls of your feet Continue the exercise for the desired amount of time

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms out to your sides at shoulder level Quickly swing your arms back and forth in a small arc Keep your elbows slightly bent throughout the motion Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions

Stand with your feet wider than your shoulders and toes facing outwards. Bend your knees and hips, lowering yourself into a squat position. Keep it quick, lowering yourself only a quarter of the way down. Push through your heels to return to the starting position. Repeat the actions in a swift motion

Lie down on your back and raise your legs straight unless your knees reach right above your hips Place your hands behind your head and raise your chest towards your knees Return to the floor and repeat

Begin in a standard push-up position but with one leg raised off the ground Lower your body towards the floor while keeping your body straight Push your body up until your arms are fully extended Repeat the process with the other raised leg Keep alternating between the two legs

name_en: Reach Front Reach Top Sumo Squat
description_en: Stand with your legs wider than shoulder-width apart and your toes turned outwards. Lower your body deep into a squat keeping your back straight. As you come up, reach with your arms up and in front of you. Return to the squat position and repeat the movement. Remember to keep your knees in line with your toes throughout the motion.
Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Take your left hand behind your back and try to touch your opposite shoulder. Maintain this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Lie with your back on the ground, arms by your side Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the floor Push your hips up towards the ceiling Lower your hips back down to the ground Keep your feet and shoulders on the ground throughout the exercise

name_en: Rear Deltoid Fly Cable Resistance Band
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms forward and hold the ends of the resistance band while keeping your palms facing inward. Open your arms wide to your sides. As your arms are aligned with the shoulders, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand upright with your back straight, arms at your sides, and feet shoulder-width apart. Take your left hand towards your right upper arm. Press your left forearm against the right arm with the help of your right hand. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Stand up straight and extend one arm across your body Use your other arm to pull the extended arm closer to your chest Hold this stretch for 15-20 seconds Release and repeat this process with the other arm

Stand tall and stretch one arm across your chest. With your other arm, apply slight pressure to the arm you're stretching to deepen the stretch. Hold this position for about 20-30 seconds. Repeat the exercise with the other arm. Perform 2-3 sets for each arm.

Start standing with feet shoulder width apart Step back with one foot, bending the front knee slightly Simultaneously, stretch your arms out to sides in a 'fly' motion Bring your arms back down and return to the standing position Repeat on the other side

Start by standing straight with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides Simultaneously take a step back with one foot and raise both arms out to your sides, keeping them straight Return to the starting position by stepping forward and lowering your arms Repeat with the other foot stepping back Continue alternating feet with each repetition

Stand tall with feet hip-width apart Step your right foot back and lower into a lunge Press through your left heel and kick your right leg back behind you Lower your right foot back into a lunge Repeat with the other leg

name_en: Recumbent Hip External Rotator and Hip Extensor Stretch
description_en: Sit on the floor with your legs crossed, the right leg over the left Press your right knee down towards the floor with your right arm Lean forwards with your upper body, extending your right hip Hold this position for about 30 seconds Switch legs and repeat step 1-4.

Lie flat on your back on a mat, stretching your arms above your head and bending your knees with your feet flat on the floor Hold onto the ends of the resistance band and loop it around each foot Simultaneously extend your right leg out at hip level and bring your left knee toward your chest At the same time, reach your right arm towards your left knee, creating a 'bicycle pedal' motion Switch to the opposite side and continue alternating

Lie on your back with your legs fully extended Hold the resistance band with each handle at foot level Raise your head, shoulders, and upper back off the floor Alternate 'pedaling' your feet in circular motions, pulling on the resistance band each time Maintain this motion for the desired count or time

name_en: Resistance Band Assisted Front Rack Stretch
description_en: Secure the resistance band at chest height Hold onto the band with both hands, palms facing towards you Step back from the anchor point to create tension While keeping your elbows lifted, allow the resistance band to pull your hands back, stretching the shoulders Maintain this position for 15-30 seconds before slowly releasing

Secure the resistance band around your mid-back and under your hands, which are firmly grounded Lower your body by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the ground Push your body up to the initial position Try to keep your body straight throughout

Position yourself kneeling on all fours and place the resistance band loop around your foot Face the floor, keeping your back flat and brace your core Push your banded foot straight back until your leg is fully extended Pause briefly before bringing your knee in towards your chest Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions before switching legs

name_en: Resistance Band Bent Leg Side Kick
description_en: Kneel on the floor and attach a resistance band around your ankles Bend your working leg at 90 degrees and kick out to the side Control your movement and slowly bring your leg back to the starting position Keep your head and spine neutral throughout the exercise Switch legs and repeat the exercise

Place the resistance band under one foot and hold onto the ends with both hands Step back with the other foot, placing it on a slight elevation behind you Squat down, keeping your front knees aligned with your toes Raise your body using your front leg, maintaining balance Repeat the same with the other leg

Take a step forward and bend both knees until your rear knee touches the floor. Hold the cable handles with an overhand grip while keeping your arms straight. Pull the handles towards you by opening your elbows wide and taking them past your back. Return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Resistance Band Calf Press Sitting on Chair
description_en: Sit on a chair and place the resistance band around the balls of both feet Hold onto the ends of the band with your hands for tension Press your feet forward, extending your ankles as much as possible Pause briefly, then return to the initial position Repeat this process for the desired number of repetitions

Wrap a resistance band around your thighs, just above your knees Lay on one side with your knees and hips bent to 45 degrees Keep your feet together and lift your top knee as high as you can without moving the hips Slowly lower your knee back down Repeat on the other side for the same number of reps

Lie on your side with your hips and knees bent 45 degrees Wrap the band around your legs just above your knees Keep your feet together and raise your top knee as high as you can without moving your hips Pause with your knee raised, then lower it back down Repeat the steps on the other side

name_en: Resistance Band Cross Body Single Straight Arm Supinated Pulldown
description_en: Secure the resistance band up high, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart Stand facing the resistance band, grip it with palm facing up Pull the band down across your body to your hip, keeping your arm straight Release and slowly let your arm return to the starting position Repeat with the other arm

Place the resistance band around both ankles, ensuring it's secure and comfortable Start in a squat position, back straight, feet hip-width apart Take a step forward with your right leg, stay low Repeat the motion with your left leg Continue alternating steps for the desired amount of repetitions or set a timer

name_en: Resistance Band Elbow Plank with Single Arm Pulldown
description_en: Begin in an elbow plank position with the resistance band anchored above you Grip the band with one hand maintaining balance using your elbow Pull the band down to your side in a rowing motion Hold the position for a moment, then slowly reverse the movement Repeat the exercise with the other arm

Lay face down on a mat and secure the resistance band around your ankles Reach your hands forward and anchor the resistance band to a stable point With legs together, raise your torso and legs, while pulling the resistance band Lower your torso and legs back down to the starting position Repeat this movement for desired repetitions

Lie flat on your back with the knees bent and a resistance band looped around your thighs Pushing against the resistance of the band, raise your hips off the floor by pushing through the heels Hold your body in the bridge position for a few seconds Lower your body back down to the initial position Repeat this sequence for your desired repetitions

Lie on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor Place the resistance band just above your knees Press your hips upward while pushing your knees out against the resistance of the band Pause briefly at the top, then lower your hips back to the floor Make sure to engage your glutes and hamstrings throughout the movement

Place the resistance band around your knees and lie flat on your back on the floor with your knees bent Keep your feet and hips width apart and flat on the floor Raise your hips pushing through your heels until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees Once at the top, move your knees apart pushing against the band Slowly lower your body back to starting position

name_en: Resistance Band Half Kneeling Face Pull
description_en: Secure the resistance band at a height above your head. Kneel on one knee at a distance where your band is taut when you reach towards it. Pull the band towards your face, keeping your hands wide and your elbows high. Hold for a moment and then slowly return to the original position. Repeat the exercise as per your training routine.

Secure the resistance band around your legs above your knees, sit on the ground with your back against a bench Bend your knees and keep your feet flat Push through your heels and lift your hips until you form a straight line from your knees to your shoulders Pause at the top squeezing your glutes, and then lower your hips back to the ground in a controlled fashion

Place the resistance band just above your knees and sit on the ground with your back against a sturdy bench or box Plant your feet firmly on the floor about hip width apart Push through your feet using your glutes, hamstrings and quadriceps to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees Hold this position briefly at the top Lower your hips back down to the ground in a controlled manner

Anchor the resistance band around something sturdy and sit on the floor with your back against it Place the band across your hips and secure it Bend your knees and keep your feet flat on the floor Push through your heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from your knees to your shoulders Lower your hips back down and repeat the exercise

name_en: Resistance Band Hip Thrusts on Knees
description_en: Put the resistance band just above your knees Kneel on the floor with your legs hip-width apart Start by sitting back on your heels Push your hips forward and squeeze your glutes at the top of the movement Return to the starting position by releasing the tension and sitting back down

Anchor the band to a stable object at waist height Hold the band and stand far enough away so there's tension Pull the band to your chest, then extend your arms and press out straight in front of you Return to the start position by pulling the band back to your chest Complete the specified number of repetitions, then repeat on the other side

Kneel on the ground and loop the resistance band around your ankle. Hold on to the ends of the band in both hands, creating tension. Kick your foot back until your leg is fully extended. Slowly return your leg to the initial position. Repeat the movement with the other leg.

name_en: Resistance Band Kneeling Cross Body Single Straight Arm Supinated Pulldown
description_en: Kneel down and anchor a resistance band at a height above your head Grab the band with one hand and hold it straight out in front of you Keep your arm supinated while you pull the band down across your body Pull the band down until your arm is fully extended down and slightly behind your torso Return to the start position in a controlled manner and repeat

name_en: Resistance Band Kneeling High Low Anti Rotation Chop
description_en: Attach a resistance band at a high anchor point and kneel down perpendicular to it. With both hands, hold the resistance band and pull it down and across your body to the opposite hip. Maintain control as you slowly return the band to the starting position. Ensure your torso stays stable and straight throughout the movement. Switch sides and repeat the exercise.

name_en: Resistance Band Kneeling Leg Half Circle
description_en: Start on all fours with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips Loop the resistance band around your ankle and secure the other end to a low anchor point Extend your leg to a straight position off the ground with your foot flexed Move your leg in a semi-circle motion, from the back to the side Return your leg to the starting position

name_en: Resistance Band Kneeling Leg Half Circle on bench
description_en: Kneel on a bench with a resistance band looped around one foot Hold the ends of the band at hip level with your hands Extend your looped foot back and move it in a half-circle from one side of your body to the other Return to the starting position and repeat Switch legs and repeat the exercise

name_en: Resistance Band Lateral Step and Squat
description_en: Place the resistance band around your ankles Step out to the side maintaining tension on the band Lower your body into a squat position Stand back up while bringing your legs back together Repeat for the other side

Place the resistance band around your legs just above the knees Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, creating tension in the band Begin to walk sideways, keeping the tension on the band Take a few steps in one direction, then switch and walk the same amount of steps in the other direction Repeat as necessary

Place the resistance band around your ankles and get into a half-squat position Keep your feet shoulder-width apart Step sideways to the left, keeping tension on the band Follow with your right foot. Continue for the desired amount of reps Switch direction, stepping sideways to the right

Lie face down and loop a resistance band around your ankles Keep your hips and upper body firm on the floor while you curl your legs up toward your glutes Slowly lower your legs back down after a short pause Keep your stomach tight throughout the exercise for stability Remember to breathe while doing the exercise

Lie flat on your stomach with the resistance band wrapped around your ankles. Keep your hips pressed against the ground while you curl your legs up towards your buttocks. Hold for a moment and then slowly lower your legs back down. Repeat for the desired number of reps. Switch legs if necessary.

Attach a resistance band to a fixed object and loop it around your ankle Stand upright and hold on to something for balance With a straight leg, kick back against the resistance band Slowly return your leg to the starting position Repeat the exercise on the other side

Lie on your side on the floor with a resistance band placed around your ankles Keep your torso stationary and legs straight, lift the top leg up as far as you can Pause at the top, then lower your leg back down Switch to the other side and repeat Maintain controlled movements throughout the exercise

name_en: Resistance Band Lying Bent Knee Hip Abduction
description_en: Lie on your side on a flat surface with your lower knee bent and the resistance band around your upper thigh Process by lifting your upper leg as high as possible against the resistance of the band Maintain the position at the top for a moment Lower your upper leg back down in a controlled manner Repeat exercise on the other side

name_en: Resistance Band Lying Bent Knee Raise
description_en: Lie on your back and attach the resistance band to your feet Bend your knees 90 degrees with your feet flat on the ground Tighten your core, pull your knees toward your chest until your thighs are perpendicular to the floor Hold for a moment then slowly lower your feet back down to the ground Repeat for a given amount of reps

Lie down on your front with the resistance band looped around your ankles Brace your core and raise your legs off the ground while also spreading them apart Hold this position for a moment before slowly releasing back to the starting position Ensure your movement is controlled throughout for maximum benefit Repeat this exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Lie flat on your back on an exercise mat with your legs extended Loop the resistance band around your feet and hold the ends in each hand Pull the band taut and perform a leg raise by lifting your legs towards the ceiling, keeping the band taut as you rise Lower your legs back down towards the floor in a slow, controlled movement Take care not to let your lower back come off the floor during the exercise

Lie down on your back with your legs extended and a resistance band looped around your ankles Keep your hands resting on the floor for support Raise your legs toward the ceiling while pressing them into the resistance band Slowly lower them back down Repeat for the desired amount of reps

Place the resistance band around your ankles. Stand in a half-squat position with your feet hip-width apart. Take a step to your right with your right foot, keeping the band tight. Step your left foot to the right, returning to the starting position. Continue these side steps for the desired number of reps before repeating on the other side.

name_en: Resistance Band One Leg Glute Bridge
description_en: Start by lying on your back with a resistance band wrapped around your thighs, just above the knees. Raise one leg in the air while keeping the other foot flat on the ground. Propel your hips upwards by pressing your grounded foot. Lower your hips back to the ground in a slow and controlled manner. Repeat this action with the opposite leg.

Place the resistance band around one ankle and the other end around a stable object. Facing the stable object, lean forward slightly, keeping your back straight. Drive the foot with the resistance band back, squeezing your glutes. Return the foot to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat the process for your desired amount of repetitions and switch legs.
Place the band just above your knees Bend over at about a 45-degree angle Kick one leg back, engaging your glutes Slowly lower your leg back down Switch legs

Stand on the resistance band with your feet shoulder width apart Hold the handles of the band in each hand at shoulder level Press the handles up and overhead Pause for a moment and then slowly lower the handles back to shoulder level Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps

Place the resistance band around your ankles Adopt a plank position with your hands and toes touching the floor Spread your legs and then bring them back together like a jack Maintain a tight core throughout the movement Perform the exercise for your desired number of repetitions

Place the resistance band just above your ankles and get into a plank position Keep your body in a straight line from your shoulders to your ankles Raise one leg off the ground and bring your knee towards your chest without bending your back Put your leg back to the starting position Repeat the movement with the other leg

Stand upright, hold the center of the resistance band with both hands, arms extended in front of you at chest height. Keep your arms straight and pull the band apart, moving your arms out to your sides. Slowly return your arms to the starting position, allowing the resistance band to pull your arms back together. Ensure your shoulder blades are engaged and pulled back during the exercise.

Stand with feet shoulder width apart with the resistance band looped around a sturdy pillar and passed in between your legs Bend your knees slightly and lean forward from your hips maintaining a straight back Pull the resistance band through by pushing your hips forward and extending your legs Squeeze your glutes at the top Slowly reverse the motion and return to the start position

Place the resistance band behind your back and under your armpits Get in high plank position, holding onto the ends of the band Bend your elbows to lower your body towards the ground Push back up to the start position

name_en: Resistance Band Reverse Hyper with Stability Ball on Flat Bench
description_en: Lie face down on a flat bench with your hips at the edge, feet pointing towards the floor with the stability ball between your feet  Loop the resistance band around your ankles and anchor the other end on a secure point below you Squeeze the stability ball with your feet and lift your legs upward until you feel contraction in your glutes Hold for a moment, then lower your legs to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise for your desired number of reps

Place the resistance band under your feet, shoulder-width apart Keep your back straight and knees slightly bent Hinge at the hips to lean forward while keeping your arms straight Squeeze your glutes to stand back up Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps

name_en: Resistance Band Seated Bent Knee Abduction
description_en: Sit on a flat surface, such as a bench or floor, with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground in front of you Position the resistance band around your thighs, just above your knees Keeping your feet steady, slowly push your knees outward against the resistance of the band Pause for a moment when your knees are as wide apart as possible Slowly return your knees to the starting position

Sit on a bench with your legs extended in front of you Place the resistance band around your ankles Spread your legs apart as far as you can Hold the position for a few seconds Return your legs to the starting position

Sit on the edge of a chair or bench with your feet flat on the floor. Place the resistance band around your thighs, just above the knees. Spread your legs apart, applying force against the band as far as possible. Hold for a moment and then return to the start position. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps.

Sit on the edge of a bench with your feet flat on the floor Place the resistance band around your knees Slowly push your knees apart, stretching the band Hold for a second and then slowly return to your starting position Repeat for desired number of repetitions

Sit on a chair with a resistance band looped around your ankles Keep your back straight and your feet firmly on the ground Move your legs apart, stretching the band Hold this position for a moment Bring your legs back together, controlling the movement

Stand tall with your back straight, knees bent slightly, and feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms forward, hold the ends of the resistance band while keeping your palms down, and lean a bit backward. Stretch the band by pulling your hands near your face, bending your arms, and taking your elbows backward.

Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a resistance band in both hands extended out in front of you Keeping your arms straight, pull the ends of the band apart until they are wide Slowly bring your arms back together Repeat this motion for the desired sets

name_en: Resistance Band Shoulder Stretch Behind the Back
description_en: Hold one end of the resistance band in your right hand and put your right arm behind your back Reach behind with your left hand and grasp the other end of the band Gently pull the band down with your left hand, causing your right shoulder to stretch Hold the stretch for 10-30 seconds Switch arms and repeat the process

Stand on the resistance band with both feet shoulder-width apart, holding the ends in each hand. Lunge to the side, bending the knee of the lunging leg, and straightening the other leg while holding onto the band. Push up to a standing position using the lunging leg. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side. Perform the desired number of reps.

name_en: Resistance Band Side Plank Glute Raise
description_en: Loop the resistance band around your ankles and get into a side plank position on your right elbow Keep your left leg straight and start to raise your left leg as high as you can without compromising your balance Lower your leg slowly back down to the starting position Switch sides and repeat with your right leg Perform the recommended number of repetitions

Place the resistance band around your legs, just above the knees. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and lower into a squat position. Take a step to the right maintaining the squat position. Step in with your left foot, still maintaining the squat. Repeat the steps walking to the left.

Secure your resistance band at chest height Stand facing away from the anchor point, then step forward until there's tension in the band With arms extended, alternately 'crawl' your hands outward, then back inward Keep your body straight and core tight during the movement Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand on the resistance band with feet shoulder-width apart Hold the handles of the band at shoulder height Bend at the knees and hips, lowering your body as off you're about to sit on a chair Using your thighs and glutes, push yourself back up to standing position Repeat for the desired amount of reps

Stand on the resistance band with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the band at shoulder level Lower into a squat position while keeping a straight back Jump explosively onto your toes while pulling the band upwards Land with control and immediately lower down to the squat position for the next jump

Stand with your feet hip-width apart, place a resistance band around your ankles and keep your head, neck, and spine in neutral position Slowly step one foot to the side while keeping the other stationary. Ensure the band is taut Lower into a squat position as you step to the side Push off the side foot to return to the starting position Repeat with the other foot and alternate for the desired number of reps

name_en: Resistance Band Standing Around the World
description_en: Stand on the center of the resistance band, feet shoulder width apart. Grip the ends of the band with both hands. Raise your arms from your sides up to overhead, forming a full circular motion. Lower your arms back to your sides in a controlled manner. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name_en: Resistance Band Standing Balance Glute Kickback
description_en: Stand upright and attach the resistance band around your ankle and to a low anchor point. Transfer your weight to one foot, keeping your knee slightly bent. Kick the leg with the resistance band back to a horizontal position, maintaining your balance. Hold for a moment, squeezing your glutes at the top. Slowly return your leg to the starting position, keeping tension on the band.

name_en: Resistance Band Standing Balance Glute Kickback
description_en: Secure a resistance band around your ankles. Stand straight, rest your hand somewhere for balance if needed. Shift your weight to one foot and kick back the other foot, keeping it straight. Draw it back in in a controlled motion. Switch to the other foot and repeat.

name_en: Resistance Band Standing Balance Hip Abduction
description_en: Stand up straight with the resistance band looped around your ankles. Lift and extend one leg out to the side as far as you can, keeping your other leg straight. Return to the initial position in a controlled manner. Repeat this on the other side. Do multiple sets of these movements.

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart, hold one end of the resistance band with your right hand, and stand on the other end with your left foot Keep your elbow close to your side and bent at 90 degrees Pull the band outward to rotate your shoulder until your hand points straight ahead Slowly return your arm to the starting position Repeat for desired reps then switch sides

Secure the band around your ankles and stand with your feet hip-width apart and your hands on your hips for balance Lift one foot and move it out to the side keeping your leg straight Control the movement and return your foot to the initial position Repeat the movement with the other foot Maintain this alternating pattern for the duration of the exercise

name_en: Resistance Band Standing Single Arm Lateral Shoulder Extension
description_en: Stand tall and hook one end of the resistance band under your foot. Hold the other end of the band with your arm by your side, resting the hand on your thigh. Keeping your arm straight, lift it laterally (to the side) until it is parallel with the floor. Lower your arm back down to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat with the other arm.

name_en: Resistance Band Standing Single Arm Shoulder Flexion
description_en: Stand on the center of the resistance band with one foot and grab the end of the band with the hand of the same side Keeping your arm straight, lift it up in front of you until it is parallel with the ground Hold at the top position for a moment Slowly lower your arm back down to the start position Switch arms after completing the set

Stand with your feet shoulder width apart and grab the resistance band with both hands Keep your elbows close to your body and push the band down, extending your arms Pause for a moment and slowly return to the starting position Keep your upper arms stationary as you perform the pushdowns

Attach the resistance band to a high anchor point Facing the anchor point, hold the ends of the band with each hand Press your hands down towards your thighs, fully extending your arms Pause for a moment at the bottom with your arms fully extended Slowly release the tension and let your hands rise back to the starting position

name_en: Resistance Band Upper Body Dead Bug
description_en: Lie down on your back with your knees bent at a 90-degree angle and your feet off the ground. Hold the resistance band with your hands and extend your arms straight up. Extend one leg and the opposite arm, while keeping the resistance band steady with the other arm. Pull the resistance band back to the starting position while retracting the extended leg and arm. Alternate between the right and left side, keeping your core engaged and maintaining the 90-degree angle in the knee of the bent leg.

Stand on the resistance band with feet hip-width apart, holding the other end of the band with both hands. Bring your hands together in front of your body at waist level. Pull the band upwards and outwards to form a 'Y' shape with your body. Hold at the top for a moment, then return to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat this motion for the desired number of repetitions.

Lie down on your back and fold your legs to bring your thighs perpendicular to the floor and bend your knees at a 90 angle Take your knees towards your chest then raise your hips off the floor Return to the initial position and repeat

Lie flat on your back with your arms by your sides Pull your knees in towards your chest with your feet together Use your abs to curl your hips off the floor and towards your chest Slowly lower them back down Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Lay down flat on your back and place your hands on the side Lift your legs all the way up to the ceiling until your butt comes off the floor Slowly lower your legs back down to the floor Pause for a moment and then lift your legs up again. Repeat as many times as suggested by your workout routine Be sure to keep your movements smooth and under control

Lie down on your back with your arms by your sides. Lift up your legs with your knees slightly bent. Pull your knees towards your chest while lifting your hips and lower back off the ground. Slowly return to the start position by lowering your hips and legs.

Lay flat on your back with your arms by your sides. Bend your knees and lift your feet off the ground to be in a 90-degree angle. Pull your knees upward toward your chest while lifting your hips off the floor. Hold for a moment, then lower your legs back down without letting your feet touch the ground. Repeat this motion.

Lie down on your back and fold your legs to bring your thighs perpendicular to the floor, and bend your knees at a 90 angle Take your knees towards your chest while raising your hips off the floor Then kick forward with your legs while straightening them in the air Bring your knees towards your chest again and repeat the whole sequence

Stand tall with your back straight, arms at your sides, and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the barbell in front of your thighs with an overhand grip, and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell towards the shoulders by bending your arms. As it reaches shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight, arms at your sides, and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the dumbbells near your thighs and palms facing backward. Raise the dumbbells towards the shoulders by bending your arms. As they reach shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Begin by sitting on the edge of a bench or stable platform Move your buttocks off of the bench and extend your legs Slowly lower your body by bending the arms, allowing your buttocks to dip towards the ground Push back up to the starting position, extending your arms fully

Start by sitting on the edge of a bench or chair, place your hands next to your hips, fingers forward Walk your feet out in front of you and slide your butt off the bench Lower your body down by bending your elbows until they are at about a 90-degree angle Push your body back up by straightening your elbows Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Lie flat on your back with your legs in the air, soles of your feet together and knees out wide. Tighten your abs and curl your hips off the floor and towards your chest. Slowly lower your hips back to the starting position. Keep your legs in their 'frog' position throughout. Repeat this movement for desired amount of repetitions.

Get on the lat pull-down machine with your back straight, knees bent, and feet placed on the floor. Grab the bar with your hands shoulder-width apart and palms facing your body. Pull the bar and bring it towards your chest by taking your elbows down. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Adjust the seat and knee pads on the Bicep machine so you can reach the pull-down bar easily Sit down and grasp the bar with a reverse grip, hands shoulder-width apart Pull the bar down to your upper chest Pause, then in a controlled manner, let the bar rise back to starting position Perform the desired number of repetitions

Grab the bar with your palms facing towards you Engage your core and pull up until your neck reaches the bar Slowly lower your body back to the starting position Maintain a slight bend in your elbows even in the bottom position Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps
