Grasp the pull-up bar with an underhand grip, palms facing towards you Pull your body upward until your chin clears the bar Pause for a moment and squeeze your shoulder blades together Slowly lower your body all the way down until your arms are fully extended Repeat the exercise for the recommended amount of repetitions

Stand tall with a straight back, feet shoulder-width apart, and a resistance band under your feet. Hold the ends of the band with your arms at your sides and palms facing backward. Stretch the band towards the shoulders by bending your arms. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Lay down on the bench with your upper body supported and legs hanging off the edge Contract your glutes and raise your legs until they make a straight line with your body Hold for a moment then slowly lower to the starting position Avoid bending your knees during the movement. Keep them slightly bent but stable Repeat the exercise for the recommended number of repetitions

Lie face down on a flat bench with your hips at the edge of the bench Extend your legs so they hang vertically down from the edge Raise your legs until they are parallel with the ground, then lower them back down Focus on using your glutes and hamstrings to lift your legs, not your back Keep your movements controlled so you dont swing

Lie face down on a flat bench, allowing your hips to hang off the edge Grab hold of the sides of the bench to stabilize yourself Begin by extending your legs downwards in a controlled motion Raise your legs until they are parallel with your body Return your legs to their original position

Start by standing tall with your feet hip-width apart Take a step back with your right foot, lowering your body until your left knee is bent at roughly 90 degrees Push off with your right foot and bring it forward into a kick, before bringing your foot back to the starting position Repeat with your left leg, alternating legs after each rep Complete the desired number of sets

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Step back with your right foot, lowering your body into a lunge Push through your left foot to stand, kicking your right leg up in front of you Return to the lunge position and complete the required reps Switch sides and repeat

Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart Step backward with your right foot, lower your body into a reverse lunge Push back up to the starting position Without pausing, step your right foot forward and lower into a lunge Push back up to the starting position and repeat with your left foot

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Take a step back with your right foot and lower your body into a lunge position Push off your right foot and kick forward with the same leg Return to the standing position and repeat the movement with the left leg Continue alternating legs throughout the exercise

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Take a step back with one foot, bending both knees at 90 degrees as you lower into a lunge Push through your front heel to stand up, driving your back knee up towards your chest for a high knee Pause for a moment at the top, then step the same foot back into a lunge again Repeat this motion, then switch legs

name_en: Reverse Lunge High Knee Forward Lunge
description_en: Start by standing up tall Step one foot back into a reverse lunge, bending both knees at 90 degrees Push off the back foot and drive the knee forward, standing all the way up into a high knee Lower this foot down directly into a forward lunge, bending both knees again Push off your front foot to return to the starting position, repeat on the other side

Stand upright with feet hip-width apart Take a step back with one foot and lower into a lunge. Keep the knee of the front foot directly above the ankle during the lunge Push off with the back foot and lift the knee toward the chest while standing upright again Switch feet and repeat on the other side Continue alternating sides for the desired number of reps

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and a resistance band under your right foot. Hold the ends of the band in your hands near your face. Take a step back with your left foot and lower yourself unless your right thigh comes parallel to the floor. Hold for a while, then return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand straight, feet hip-width apart, drop your arms down at your sides Take a step back with your right foot, lowering your body into a reverse lunge While doing the lunge, simultaneously swing your arms quickly forward and up until they are fully extended above your head Push off your right foot to return to the starting position, then repeat the lunge with your left foot and arm motions Continue performing this lunge, switching legs, to complete the set

Stand up straight with your hands at your sides Take a step backward with one foot Lower your body until your front knee is at a 90 degree angle Push off with your front foot to return to standing Alternate between each leg for the duration of the set

Sit on a stool with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Extend your arms forward and grab the handles of the machine with your palms facing down. Pull the handles by opening your arms wide to your sides. As your arms are aligned with the shoulders, return to the initial position and repeat.

Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you Place your palms on the floor behind you, fingers pointing towards your feet Press into your palms and lift your hips and torso towards the ceiling Look up to the ceiling, point your toes, and keep your body straight Hold this pose for a few seconds then slowly lower your body back down to the start position.

Sit on the floor with your legs outstretched Place your palms on the floor, fingers pointing towards your feet Push into your hands and lift your hips off the floor until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your heels Hold this position for a few seconds before lowering back down slowly

Sit on the ground with the legs pointed out in front of you Place your hands on the ground behind you, fingertips pointing towards your body Press your hands and heels into the ground and lift your hips off the ground into a reverse plank position Lift one knee towards your chest, then the other, in a marching motion Lower your body back to the ground in a controlled manner

Start by sitting on the ground with your legs extended in front of you Place your elbows directly beneath your shoulders Lift your hips up to form a straight line from your head to your heels Hold this position for a few moments, then slowly lower yourself back down Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps

Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you and your hands on the floor beside your hips Push your torso upwards into a Reverse Plank Lift one leg off the ground, maintaining your balance Hold for a second or two and then lower your leg back down Repeat the leg lift with your other leg

Start by sitting on the ground with your hands planted behind you Press your palms into the ground and lift your body upward Lower your body back down until your buttocks almost touch the ground Repeat for desired repetitions Keep your core tight throughout the exercise

Stand 2-3 feet from a waist height block with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms backward and place your hands on the block. Lower your hips by bending your knees and raising your heels off the floor. Maintain the stretch on your shoulders for 30-60 seconds.

Begin in the Warrior II position with your right foot forward Inhale and lift your right arm towards the sky as you flip your palm Bend backwards, creating a gentle arch in the back Keep your left hand resting gently on the left thigh Return to Warrior II position and repeat for the left side

Sit on a bench and hold a barbell with palms facing down Place your forearms on your thighs with your wrists just beyond your knees Lower the bar as far as possible Raise the bar as high as possible Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Start by standing in Mountain Pose Bend your knees and drop your hips, coming into a squat position Place your palms together at your chest and press your elbows against your inner knees Twist your upper body to one side. If your right elbow is against your inner knee, then twist right, and vice versa Hold this pose for a few breaths, then twist the other way

Sit on the floor with your legs extended out in a 'V' shape. Turn your torso to the right and bend over your right leg, extending your left arm towards your right foot. Look up towards your left hand, feeling the stretch in your neck. Hold this pose for at least 30 seconds, then switch to stretch towards your left leg. Remember to breathe in a harmonious pattern throughout this exercise.

Start in a high lunge position with your right foot forward Twist your torso to the right, bringing your left elbow to the outside of your right knee Press your palms together in prayer position Hold this position for 5-10 breaths, then release and switch sides

Stand tall with your feet together. Step your right foot about a metre backward, keeping heels aligned. Rotate your right foot so it points to the right. Turn your body to the right, and bend at the waist over your right leg. Reach your left hand down towards your right foot, and extend your right arm up towards the ceiling.

Start by mounting your bicycle and placing your hands on the handlebars, and feet on the pedals Ensure your back is straight, and youre looking up and ahead Begin to push down on the pedals in a circular motion, alternating between each foot Increase the intensity by increasing your speed or incline When coming to a stop, apply the brakes evenly and dismount safely

Start by straddling the bike with your feet on the ground and hands on the handles Position yourself on the seat and pedal your feet, maintaining a controlled pace Lean slightly forward while keeping your back straight and abs engaged Keep your gaze forward and be mindful of your surroundings Cool down after your ride with a slow-paced stroll

Mount on the bicycle and place your feet firmly on the pedals Start pedaling at a slow pace to warm up Gradually increase your pedaling speed During the ride, alternate between light and intense pedaling for a more complete workout After the workout, slow down your pedaling speed for cool down

Sit on the bicycle seat ensuring your feet can touch the ground comfortably Hold onto the handlebars using a gentle but firm grip Start cycling at a slow pace to warm up As you cycle, keep your back straight and your body balanced Gradually increase speed and maintain at a steady pace

Mount your bicycle and sit comfortably on the saddle Place your feet on the pedals and grip the handlebars Start pedalling at a comfortable pace to warm up Gradually increase your pace to a level that you can sustain When finished, slow down your pace gradually for a cool down

Sit on the bike and place your feet on the pedals Start pedaling at a comfortable pace Keep your back straight and your hands on the handlebars Maintain steady control over the bike Gradually increase your speed or uphill grade for a harder workout

Start by arranging the bike seat and handlebars to a comfortable position Start riding at a slow and steady pace Gradually increase your speed as you get comfortable Maintain a steady pace for the duration of your workout Slow down and perform a cool-down phase before stopping

Start by adjusting the bicycle seat and handlebars to your comfort level Place your feet in the pedals and begin pedaling at a steady pace Sit upright, maintaining a straight back Alternate your speed and resistance for a balanced workout Cool down by pedaling at a slower, relaxed pace

Sit on the bike seat making sure both feet touch the ground comfortably Put your hands on the handlebars Start cycling at a steady pace Use lower gears for uphill inclines Gradually increase your pace to build up your strength

Mount the bike and adjust the seat to an appropriate height Start pedalling at a slow pace to warm up Gradually increase your speed keeping your back straight When climbing hills, stand up on the bike to utilize more muscle strength After your ride, cool down by going for a slow ride

Start the ride in a flat area until you become comfortable Gradually increase the intensity by picking up the pace or riding up a hill Change your grip on the handles occasionally to prevent fatigue Engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine Make sure to pedal with the balls of your feet, not the arches

Mount the bike and place your feet securely on the pedals Start to pedal by pushing down first with one foot followed by the other Maintain a moderate to high pace, aiming for a consistent speed For an added challenge, try riding up steep hills After completing your desired distance or time, slow down gradually before stopping

Start by grabbing onto the rings and assuming a high push-up position. Lean forward while keeping your body straight and your core engaged. Extend your arms out in front until you begin to feel tension in your abdominals. Pull yourself back to the starting position. Ensure your movements are slow and controlled throughout the exercise.

Start by grabbing the rings with palms facing down Pull your body up until your chin is above the rings Flip your grip so that your palms are facing up Lower your body back down in a controlled manner This is one rep, repeat for the desired number of reps

Place each hand on a ring, keeping your body in a straight line Lower your body down while extending one arm to the side Push back up to the top of the dip position Repeat by lowering down again, this time extending your opposite arm to the side Repeat for the number of desired reps, alternating arms each time

Grab the rings, make sure your body is hanging straight down Pull up your body towards one ring, while keeping the other arm straight Hold at the peak then return to the starting position Alternate sides for each repetition Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Start in a regular push-up position with each hand in a ring Lower your body while one arm bends and the other extends to the side Push yourself back up and switch sides Repeat this movement alternating sides each time Maintain a plank position throughout the entire movement

Grab the rings at shoulder height with your palms facing up Bend your elbows while pulling your body upwards to meet the rings Hold this position briefly while squeezing your biceps Lower yourself back down in a controlled manner to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Start by mounting the rings and positioning yourself below them Keep your body straight and slowly lean backwards until you're in a horizontal position Hold this position while keeping your body as straight as possible Make sure to squeeze your shoulder blades together Slowly return to the initial position

Start with a false grip on the rings, arms fully extended and body in a straight line Lean back, bend your knees and roll your body under the rings using momentum Continue the motion until you bring yourself up into a supported position above the rings Hold this position for a moment Safely revert back to the starting position and repeat

Adjust the suspension trainer rings to hip level Stand in front of the rings, back straight, and grab each one Bend your knees and lean back while keeping your body straight from head to knees Pull your chest up to the rings, elbows squeezing towards each other Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position

Stand upright and grab a ring in each hand, with arms fully extended to your sides Keep your body firm and bring the rings in front of you in a wide arc Squeeze your chest at the end of the movement Hold for a second and then slowly return the rings back to the starting position Repeat until the set is complete

Grab the rings with your palms facing towards each other Engage your core and pull yourself up until your chin is level with the rings Pause at the top of the motion Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Securely attach the suspension trainer to a height adjustable point Grasp the rings and place your feet on an elevated surface Lower your chest towards the ground, keeping your body straight Push your body back up until your arms are fully extended Repeat the move for your desired number of repetitions

Start by grabbing the rings, with your arms fully extended above you Bend your elbows to lower your body between the rings Push back up to the original position Repeat the process for a set of repetitions

Attach the rings to a stable overhead support, place yourself directly under the rings Grab the rings and lean back, keeping your body in a straight line Pull your body up to the rings while keeping your body straight Pull the ring toward your face while retracting your shoulder blades Slowly return to the starting position in a controlled manner

Hang from the rings with your body fully extended. Pull your body up and lean back until you are parallel to the ground. Make sure your arms are fully extended and your body is straight. Hold this position for a few seconds. Slowly lower yourself down to your initial position.

Stand upright with the rings at your sides Raise the rings in front of you until they reach shoulder level Hold and squeeze for a second Lower the rings slowly back down to your sides Repeat for the desired number of reps

Start with both hands on the rings, keeping your body in a straight line Push through your shoulders and slowly raise your legs until you are in a handstand position Keep your body rigid and maintain balance Hold the handstand for a few seconds Slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position

Start in a handstand position on the rings, keeping your body straight and tight Begin to bend at the hips and slowly lower your legs towards the front Continue this motion until your body is in an L-Sit position, with legs straight and parallel to the ground Hold this position for a few seconds Slowly raise your legs back up and return to the handstand position

Hang from the rings with your arms and body fully extended, legs together Pull your knees towards your elbows as high as you can by contracting your abdominals Try to touch your elbows with your knees Keep your torso stable and refrain from swinging Lower your legs back down to the start position

Hang from a suspended ring with your body straight Bend your knees and raise your hips, bringing your thighs as close to your chest as possible Lower your legs in a controlled motion reaching the starting position Repeat the motion for desired reps

name_en: Ring Hanging Straight Leg Hip Raise
description_en: Hang from the rings with your arms fully extended Bend your knees slightly and lift your legs up straight in front of you Raise your legs until your thighs are parallel to the ground Pause at the top for a moment, then slowly lower your legs back down Repeat the movements for the desired number of reps

Start by grabbing the rings and standing upright with your body in a straight line Lean back to a comfortable degree while keeping your body straight Pull your body up to the rings by driving your elbows back and squeezing your shoulder blades together Pause for a moment at the top, then lower back down to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Stand facing the rings, grab them with an overhand grip and lean back Keep your body straight, pull your chest up towards the rings After reaching the top of the movement, lower your body back down controlledly Remember to squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the move Repeat this movement for desired reps

Lay flat on your back on a mat or the floor. Position the rings so that they are at the height of your ankles. Place your feet in the rings. Push off using your heels, lifting your hips off of the floor to form a bridge. Lower your hips back to the floor in a controlled manner.

name_en: Ring Hip Lift Single Leg Curl
description_en: Start by lying flat on your back, arms stretched out with the rings by your side at a lower height Lift one leg up into the air and place the other foot into the rings Use your hamstrings and glutes to lift your hips up, pulling the ring towards you Slowly return to the start position, keeping your foot in the rings Repeat the exercise for the recommended number of repetitions and then switch legs

Stand between the rings with feet shoulder-width apart Reach up and grab a ring in each hand Walk your feet forward until your body forms a straight line Pull your chest up towards the rings Lower back down to complete one rep

name_en: Ring Inverted Row parallel to the floor
description_en: Position yourself under the rings with your legs fully extended in front of you Hold the rings with an underhand grip Pull your chest towards the rings while keeping your body in a straight line Pause at the top and then lower yourself back to the start position in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of reps
Start on your knees with the rings set at hip height Grasp the rings and extend your body forward Pull yourself back in a controlled movement Repeat the motion

Attach the rings to a suitable support and adjust them so that they hang at a comfortable height Stand facing the rings, grasp them with both hands and step back to lean back Bend your knees and pull your knees towards your chest At the same time, pull your body upwards towards the rings Slowly extend your knees and lower your body back to the start position

Set up the rings or suspension straps just off the ground. Laying flat on your back, place your heels in the rings or foot cradles. Pull your hips up off the floor, then curl your legs towards your body. Extend your legs back out in a controlled fashion. Remember to keep your hips lifted and body in a straight line during the exercise.

name_en: Ring Leg Curl with yoga block
description_en: Lie on your back with your legs extended and the yoga block between your feet Raise your legs until they're perpendicular to the floor Bend your knees and bring them towards your chest Extend your legs back up to the starting position Repeat the steps for desired repetitions

Start in an L-sit position, holding the rings with your palms facing towards you Pull yourself up, bending your elbows until your chin is over your hands Hold for a moment, then lower yourself back down to the starting position Each time you pull yourself up, try to keep your legs at a 90 degree angle Repeat the exercise for your desired number of reps

Start in the support position with your hands in the rings, body lifted high Smoothly lower your body until it's parallel to the ground, arms extended to the sides Hold the position for a second or two Then smoothly pull yourself back up to the starting position Repeat the exercise for the desired repetitions

Secure your feet in the suspension straps Assume a high plank position with your hands directly below your shoulders Keeping your core engaged, bring your right knee toward your left elbow Return to the high plank position Repeat on the other side bringing left knee to right elbow

Begin by hanging down from the rings with your body straight and your palms facing each other. Pull yourself up until your chest touches the rings. Hold this position for a brief moment. Lower yourself back down to the initial position in a controlled manner. Repeat the sequence for the desired set of repetitions.

Stand facing the suspension trainer, grab a ring with one hand and position your arm fully extended Keeping your elbow stationary, curl your arm towards your chest Pause briefly and squeeze your bicep at the top Slowly lower your arm back to the starting position

Grasp the rings with your palm facing towards you, with your body hanging straight down Pull your body up by flexing your elbow and pulling your shoulder blades together Try to get your chin to touch the ring Slowly lower your body back to the starting position

Setup the suspension trainer at knee height Face away from the setup then grasp both handles Extend your body into a plank position with arms fully extended Lift your hips into a pike position, keeping legs straight Slowly lower your hips and return to the starting plank position

Start by hanging in the rings with your arms fully extended Lean forward slowly, raising your feet off the floor Use your core and upper body strength to hold your body parallel to the floor in a straight line Keep a straight body line from your head to your heels Hold the position for as long as you can, then return slowly to the starting position

Start by gripping the rings with a firmly locked grip Pull your body upwards until your chest touches the rings Hold at the top momentarily, focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together Lower yourself down with control to the starting position Keep the movement steady and controlled throughout

Get into a push-up position with your hands holding the rings and your body straight Perform a push-up by bending your elbows and lowering your chest As you rise up, rotate your body and move into the side plank position Hold the position momentarily, then return back to the push-up position Repeat for the other side

Set the suspension straps to waist height Stand facing the rings, grasp each ring with your hands Lean backwards until your body is at a slight angle Pull your body up by retracting your shoulder blades Slowly lower your body back to the starting position

Start in a kneeling position with the suspension or gym rings set low in front of you Extend your arms and lean forward, allowing your body to roll out until it is nearly parallel to the ground Contract your abs to reverse the motion and pull your body back to the starting position Repeat the motion for the recommended number of repetitions

Stand between the rings with your feet hip-width apart Grasp the rings and lean forward to an angle that you find challenging, legs should be straight Pull your arms out to your sides in a sweeping motion until you feel tension in your shoulders Lower your arms back to the starting position in a controlled movement Repeat the motion for your desired number of reps

Set the rings so that they are at waist height Grab the rings and step back until your body is leaning forward Bend your elbows and lower your chest toward your hands Press back up to the starting position Keep your body tight and straight throughout the movement

Begin by grasping the rings and pushing up into a support position Lower your body while moving your arms back until the rings touch your upper arms Push yourself back up to the starting position Ensure your chest is open and facing forward throughout the exercise Repeat for the recommended amount of repeititions

Start in a push-up position with your hands on the rings Lower your body towards the rings by bending your elbows Push back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms Lower your body back to the floor while still maintaining a balance on the rings Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand directly underneath the rings, grabbing them with your palms facing you Bend your knees and squat until you can reach the rings with straight arms Pull yourself up until your chin passes the ring level keeping the elbows close Lower yourself back down slowly and in a controlled manner to the starting position Repeat the movement for the desired amount of repetitions

Set the rings at a height where your feet can touch the ground when you hang from them. Grasp the rings and pull yourself up, keeping your feet on the ground for support. Let yourself down slowly using your arms to control the descent. Try to gradually use less and less leg support as you gain strength. Continue the exercise for desired number of repetitions

Position yourself sideways on the rings, your feet and body in line, balancing on one hand. Keeping your body straight, lift your hips off the ground, making sure both feet are still touching the ground. Hold this position for a few seconds. Lower your hips back into the original starting position. Repeat on the other side

Stand upright with your feet at shoulder-width apart, holding the suspension ring handles in each hand Lower your body into a squat while keeping the chest up At the bottom of the squat, rotate one shoulder in the direction of the opposite knee Rotate back to the center while maintaining the squat position Push through your heels to return to the starting position and repeat for the required repetitions

name_en: Ring Single Arm Rear Delt Row
description_en: Stand facing the suspension ring with a wide stance Grasp one ring with an extended arm Pull yourself up until your chest touches the ring Hold for a second, then lower yourself back down to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Lie down on your back, place your heels into the ring straps and confirm they're firm enough Bend your knees to pull your heels toward your buttocks and lift your hips off the ground Straighten one leg out Bend your knee to pull your heel back toward your buttocks Slowly return to the initial position and switch legs

Attach the suspension straps and position yourself between them, your hands grabbing the handles with your arms extended Keep your feet together, lean forward and let your body fall into a diagonal position Bend your elbows and open your arms wide while maintaining a straight line from head to toe Pull your body up by bringing your hands back together, squeezing your pectoral muscles

Start by positioning yourself around one step away from the rings with one foot suspended in them Keep your chest up, and lean forward slightly Lower yourself down until your thigh is parallel to the floor Push up through your front foot to stand back up Switch legs and repeat

Sit in between the rings with legs together and extended straight out Lift your body off the ground by pressing down on the rings Separate your legs to each side, forming a 'V' shape Hold this position for a few seconds Lower yourself back down in a controlled manner

Lie face-down with your feet in the suspension straps, hands flat on the floor Tighten your core and lift your hips off the floor, bending your knees Pull your knees toward your chest without lowering your hips Hold for a moment at the top of the movement Slowly return to the starting position

Lie down under suspension rings with your feet in front of the rings. Grab the rings and hang your body off the ground keeping it straight. Bend your knees towards your chest with your abs. Extend your legs back to the starting position. Repeat the movement for the desired amount of repetitions.

Stand between the rings and jump up, gripping the rings Push your body upwards Keep your body straight, your arms straight, and your shoulders down Hold this position for as long as you can Lower yourself down in a controlled manner to end the exercise

Grasp the rings and hang with your body straight Swing your legs to one side, using your waist and core to control the movement Swing your legs back to the center Repeat the movement to the other side Keep your movements smooth and controlled

Start by grabbing the ring grips and facing your palms towards each other Extend your arms down before bringing your body back up Repeat the movement until you've completed your set Aim to keep your body straight throughout the exercise Be sure not to lock your elbows at the top of the motion

Get in a push-up position with your hands in the rings Lean your body forward, shifting your weight on your arms Keep your body tuck and hold the position Keep your eyes on the floor and your back straight Gradually increase the holding time as you get stronger

name_en: Ring Weighted Neutral Grip Inverted Row
description_en: Attach the weighted plates to your body using a belt Grab the rings, while keeping them on the same level Pull yourself up while keeping your body in a straight line Hold and squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top Lower yourself slowly down to the starting position

name_en: Ring Weighted Pronated Grip Inverted Row
description_en: Attach weight to your waist using a belt and chain setup Grasp the rings and hang beneath them with your body straight, legs extended, and heels on the ground Pull your chest up towards the rings while keeping your body straight Pause briefly in the top position Slowly lower back to the starting position

Adjust the straps on the rings to your preferred height Grab the rings with a wide grip, palms facing each other Lean back until your body is at an angle and your legs are straight out in front of you Pull your chest up to the rings Lower yourself back to the initial position in a controlled fashion

name_en: Ring Wide Grip Inverted Row on floor
description_en: Lie down on the floor directly under the rings Reach up and grab the rings, maintaining a wide grip Pull your chest up towards the rings by retracting your shoulder blades Lower yourself back down slowly until your arms are fully extended again Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Stand underneath the rings and grab them with your palms facing forward. Pull up your body until your chest touches the rings. Pause momentarily at the top. Lower your body back down in a controlled motion. Repeat the recommended number of repetitions.

Stand facing the suspension trainer and hold onto the handles Lean your body back, keeping your body straight and feet planted Raise your arms up into a 'Y' shape, keep straight elbows Lower your body back to the initial position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders Keep your feet shoulder-width apart and your body straight from head to heels Pull your elbows towards your toes and your toes towards your elbows Hold this position, ensuring your core remains engaged Relax and return to the start position

Start on your hands and knees, with your hands under your shoulders and your knees under your hips Open your knees up to the sides, coming down onto your forearms if possible Shift your weight back, sitting back onto your heels Rock forward and back slowly, feeling the stretch in your glutes and hips Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Start on all fours in a tabletop position with hips directly over knees. Lower your forearms to the floor and push your buttocks back toward your heels. Rock back and forth gently, moving your hips closer to your heels each time. Engage your core muscles and hold for a few seconds. Slowly return to starting position and repeat.

Sit on the floor and bend your right knee out to the side near your wrist. Bend your left knee and bring your left foot under your right leg to your right hip. Gently rock back and forth to feel a stretch in your hips. Swap leg positions and repeat the stretch. Hold the stretch for about 30 seconds each time.
Lie on your back on a comfortable surface Bring your knees towards your chest Hold onto the outside edges of your feet Gently rock side to side

Find a sturdy horizontal bar that can support your weight Reach up and grab the bar with both hands Raise your legs and cross your ankles behind you Pull your body up so that your chin goes beyond the bar Lower yourself in a slow and controlled manner

name_en: Roll Around the World Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie on your back on the floor and hold a roll with both hands Stretch out your arms and rotate the roll clockwise above your head and back to the starting position Repeat the procedure, but this time rotate the roll counter-clockwise Keep your lower back pressed against the ground during the entire exercise Perform the recommended number of repetitions

name_en: Roll Around the World Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie on your back on a flat surface Gradually bring your knees to your chest with legs bent Slowly move your knees from side to side, mimicking an 'around the world' motion Make sure to keep your upper body flat on the floor throughout the movement Repeat as needed

Begin by kneeling in front of a stability ball with your hands on the ball at shoulder width apart Slowly roll the ball forward while keeping your arms straight Continue moving until your chest is near the ball and your body is in a stretched position Hold the stretch for up to 30 seconds Slowly roll back to the starting position

Sit on the stability ball with feet planted firmly on the ground Slowly roll the ball backward while laying back onto the ball Extend your legs and lean back, allowing the ball to roll underneath your hips Relax and feel the stretch in your hip flexors Hold for 15-30 seconds and return to the initial position

Sit down with the stability ball behind you Lie back onto the ball, allowing it to support your lower back Spread your arms outward for balance Relax the muscles in your lower back and hips Hold for a desirable amount of time and then return to the starting position

name_en: Roll Ball Lying Semisplinalis Capitis Muscle Activation
description_en: Lie down on a flat surface with the roll ball under your neck. Gently roll your head side to side, causing the ball to roll across the back of your neck. Keep the motion slow and controlled. Relax and repeat for desired reps or time. Never apply too much pressure on your neck.

Place the roll ball against a wall Press your chest into the ball, applying moderate pressure Roll the ball around the chest area in circular motions Continue this movement for the desired amount of time Switch to the other side and repeat

Sit on the floor with the rollball under your right buttock Bend your right knee and place your right foot on your left knee Roll on the ball to find the tender spot in your buttock Hold the position for 30-60 seconds Repeat the process with your left buttock

name_en: Roll Ball Posterior Tibialis Side Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie on your side on the floor Place the roll ball under your lower leg (the side that's facing up) Bend your lower knee for stability Slowly extend and flex the upper leg to roll the ball along your calf muscle Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions or duration

Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat, holding the rollball in front of you. Extend the arms forward and hold the ball with both hands. Slowly roll the ball away from you, keeping your back straight. Hold this position for a moment then slowly roll the ball back towards you. Repeat this process for the desired amount of reps.

name_en: Roll Ball Side Lying Scalene Muscles Activation
description_en: Lie on one side with the roll ball under your neck. Move your head gently side to side on the ball to activate the scalene muscles. Switch sides and repeat the same movement with the neck on the ball. Make sure to perform this exercise in a slow and controlled manner. Relax and breathe deeply throughout this exercise.

name_en: Roll Ball Side Lying Scalene Muscles Activation
description_en: Sit comfortably on the floor with your legs crossed Place the roll ball on the side of your neck Gently roll the ball along the length of your neck Moderate the pressure with your hand to your comfort level Repeat the process on the other side of the neck

Sit down and position the stability ball beside your hip Lean your body onto the ball, positioning it on the side of your hip Gently roll the ball up and down the side of your hip Control your movement to compress and release the muscle

Stand up straight with the roll ball against a wall Place the ball on your upper trapezius (the part of your back/neck just above your shoulder blade) Gently lean against the ball, applying pressure to the muscle Roll the ball slowly around the muscle, taking care not to roll over bone Repeat on the other side

Lie down flat on the floor, on your back Bend your knees and plant your feet hip-width apart on the floor Bend your elbows and point your fists towards the ceiling Squeeze the biceps and slowly circle your fists outward then inward

Lie flat on your back on the floor Hold the roll in both hands, with your arms extended straight above your chest Slowly lower the roll behind your head, extending your arms as far as you can Hold this stretch for a few seconds Slowly raise the roll back to the start position

Sit on the floor with your legs straight out in front of you Place the roll under one calf Using your hands to support your body weight, roll from the bottom of the calf towards the knee Repeat the motion, making sure to cover the entire muscle Switch legs and repeat the process

Sit on the ground and extend your legs in front of you Place a foam roller under your calves With your hands flat on the ground behind you, lift your body off the floor Gently roll from just below your knee to above your ankle Repeat the process several times
Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you Position the roll under your calf Lift your hips off the floor and roll up and down your calf Change legs and repeat with the other calf

Lie flat on your back on the floor Bend your knees and flatten your feet on the floor Hold the roll horizontally above your chest with both hands Lower the roll to just above your chest by bending your elbows Push the roll back upwards until your arms are fully extended

name_en: Roll Chest Opener Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie down on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat Extend your arms out to the sides with your palms facing up Slowly roll your chest open by allowing one shoulder to move towards the floor Hold the position for a few seconds Return to the start position and repeat on the other side

name_en: Roll Chest Opener Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie down flat on your back on a mat, with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Place the roll under your upper back, near your shoulder blades. Extend your arms to the side, keeping them at shoulder height. Relax and allow your chest to open up. Stay in this position for 30 seconds to 1 minute.

name_en: Roll Erector Spinae Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Place a foam roll under your lower back, near your hips Keep your arms straight and your palms down by your sides for support Gently lift your hips off the ground until you feel a stretch in your lower back and hold for a few seconds Lower your hips back down to the ground

name_en: Roll Erector Spinae Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie flat on your back on a mat or comfortable floor Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the floor Slowly lift your hips off the ground until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees Hold this position for a moment, then lower your hips back to the starting position Repeat the exercise for the desired number of times

Sit down on a chair with both feet flat on the floor. Place a tennis ball or round object under your right foot. Press down and roll the ball under your foot, from the heel to the toes and back. Spend more time on any areas that feel especially tight or sore. Repeat with your left foot.
Sit on a firm surface with one leg stretched out in front Place the roll under your calf Press down with your leg, rolling the roll up and down your calf Repeat the exercise with the other leg

Stand facing a wall with your feet hip-width apart Hold a roll in your hands and place it against the wall Lean forward, putting pressure on the roll while extending your wrists and forearms Hold this position for the recommended time Slowly release the pressure and return to starting position

Stand facing a wall with your arms extended in front Press your palms against the wall, fingers pointing downwards Without bending your elbows, slowly lean your body forwards Hold this position for 15-30 seconds Slowly return to the starting position

name_en: Roll Front Shoulder and Chest Lying on Floor
description_en: Lay flat on your back on a comfortable surface, such as a yoga mat Hold the roll above your chest with both hands Slowly lower the roll over your head towards the floor Hold this position for about 30 seconds, giving your shoulders and chest a good stretch Slowly bring the roll back to the starting position

name_en: Roll Front Shoulder and Chest Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie down flat on your back on the floor Extend your arms wide at shoulder level Slowly roll to one side, keeping your arms extended Hold the stretch for about 20 seconds Repeat on the other side

Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you Place the foam roll under your glutes Cross your right leg over your left knee Lean onto your right glute, using your hands for support Roll back and forth over your glute

Sit on the floor with legs extended Bend one leg and cross it over the other Use your hands to pull the crossed leg closer towards your chest Hold the position for several seconds Repeat with the other leg

name_en: Roll Glute Twist Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie on your back and extend both legs straight out on the floor. Bend one knee and cross it over the other straight leg. Gently pull the bent knee towards the floor until a stretch is felt in the glute and hip of the crossed leg. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds then repeat on the other side. Perform 2-4 sets on each side.

name_en: Roll Glute Twist Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie on your back on a mat with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor Hold the roll and extend your right leg then place the roll under your right knee Gently let your right knee fall out to the side, opening up your hip Hold this position for up to 30 seconds, feeling a stretch in your glutes and lower back Switch sides and repeat the step

name_en: Roll Hamstrings and Glute Sitting on Floor
description_en: Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs extended out in front of you Place your hands on your thighs and slowly slide them down towards your ankles Hold the stretch for about 20 seconds Slowly pull yourself back up to a seated position Repeat this stretch 2-3 times

name_en: Roll Hamstrings and Glute Sitting on Floor
description_en: Sit on the floor with your legs outstretched Place the roll under one leg, thighs area Use your hands to lift your buttocks slightly from the ground Roll your leg slowly over the roll, from knees to buttocks Switch legs and repeat

Sit on the floor with your legs straight out in front of you Place the roll under your thighs With your hands on the floor for support, slowly roll back and forth over the roll Keep your movements slow and controlled Continue for about 30 seconds to 1 minute

Start with a sitting position on the floor, extend one leg straight and bend the other at the knee crossing it over the straight leg. Rotate your upper body towards the bent knee. Use your elbow to push against the bent knee and twist your body further. Hold the stretch for 10 to 15 seconds, then switch sides. Repeat this a few times for each side.

Start by sitting on the floor and placing the roll under your hips Cross your left foot over your right knee Slowly roll up and down so that the roller moves up towards your lower back and then back down towards your hips Repeat this movement on both the left and the right side Ensure a slow and controlled movement to maximize the stretching effect

Lie on your side on the floor with the roll under your hip Extend your lower leg and cross your upper leg over it Rest your upper foot on the floor and your head in your hand Roll your body back and forth so the roll massages your hip and inner thighs Switch sides and repeat

Lie flat on your back and bend your knees, keeping your feet flat on the ground Raise your right knee towards your chest, clasping it with your hands Push your right hip off the ground, rolling your weight onto your left glute Lower your right hip back to the ground in a controlled manner Repeat with the left hip before alternating back to right

Start lying down on your back with the roll under your heels Keep your back straight and your arms to your side for balance Elevate your hips off the ground until your body forms a straight line Lower your hips back down and repeat

Stand tall and shift your weight on to one foot. Pull the knee of your other foot up towards your chest, using your hands for support Hold this position for 15-30 seconds, feeling a stretch at your hip and lower back Release the stretch and place your foot back on the ground Repeat on the other leg Perform 3-5 repetitions on each side

Start by lying flat on your back with knees bent and feet flat on floor Press your feet into the floor and lift your hips up, rolling spine off the floor from bottom to top Reach the bridge position with your body forming a straight line from your shoulders to your knees Hold for a moment before slowly rolling your spine back down to the floor Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Start in a plank position with your elbows under your shoulders Rotate your body to one side into a side plank Hold the side plank for a few seconds Roll back to the plank position Rotate your body to the other side into a side plank and hold

Kneel down and place your roll in front of you Bend from your waist and extend your arms on the roll Rotate your body toward the right and then the left Shift your weight back towards your heels Come back into the starting position

Kneel down on the ground and lean forward with your hands to touch the floor Extend one hand upward, turning your upper body to follow Hold the position for a few seconds Slowly lower your hand back to the starting point Repeat this process with your other hand

Place the foam roller on the floor and sit next to it Lie on your side and position the foam roller under your armpit area Slowly roll back and forth, moving the foam roller from your armpit to just above your waist Apply more pressure where you feel tightness or soreness Repeat on the opposite side

name_en: Roll Lower Back Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie down flat on your back on a comfortable surface with your legs extended out straight Place the roll under the lower back region on one side Let your body weight apply pressure onto the roll to stretch the side muscles Hold the stretch for about 20-30 seconds Switch side and repeat with the roll under the opposite side of your lower back

name_en: Roll Lower Back Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie flat on your back on the floor. Keep your arms spread out on the floor for support. Bend your knees and keep your feet flat on the floor. Slowly roll your knees to one side, keeping your shoulders flat on the floor. Hold this position for a few seconds, then roll your knees to the other side.

name_en: Roll Middle Back Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie flat on your back on the floor Bend your knees with your feet flat on the floor Slowly roll your knees to one side, keeping your shoulders flat on the floor Hold for a few moments, then return your knees to the starting position Repeat on the other side

name_en: Roll Middle Back Lying on Floor
description_en: Lay on your back on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat Place the foam roll horizontally under your upper back Interlock your fingers behind your head to support your neck Lift your hips off the floor and slowly roll from your mid-back to your upper back Return to starting position and repeat

name_en: Roll Neck Decompress Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie flat on your back on the floor Bend your knees with your feet flat on the floor Place the roll under your neck Relax your neck onto the roll and hold this gentle stretch for a comfortable time Slowly remove the roll and lay flat for a moment before rising

name_en: Roll Neck Decompress Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie down flat on the floor. Slowly roll your head from side to side. Pause for a moment each time your ear is close to your shoulder. Gradually increase the range of motion. Repeat for several repetitions.

name_en: Roll Neck Rotation Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie on your back on a flat surface with your head on a foam roll Slowly roll your head from one side to the other Pause for a moment when your head is turned to one side Return your head to the center Repeat the same on the other side

name_en: Roll Neck Rotation Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie down on your back on a flat floor. Keep your arms at your sides, palms facing down. Slowly roll your head side to side. Try to touch your ear to the floor on each side. Repeat this movement for desired repetitions.

Lie face down and position the foam roller underneath your chest Position your hands above your head, at shoulder width Roll up and down from your lower sternum to your armpits Repeat the motions for a specific period or reps Relax your body weight onto the foam roller for more intensity, if needed

name_en: Roll Peroneal Side Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie on your side with your legs extended straight Bend your top leg and place your foot on the floor in front of your bottom leg Move your bottom foot up and down, using your hand for support Try to create a rolling motion with your ankle Perform this exercise for the desired amount of time and then switch sides

name_en: Roll Peroneal Side Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie on your side with the affected leg uppermost. Bend the lower leg slightly for support. Extend the upper leg and rotate it slightly inward. Gently pull your feet back towards your shin. Hold this stretch for 15-30 seconds and then relax.

name_en: Roll Peroneal Side Lying on Floor
description_en: Start by laying on your side with the roller under your bottom leg halfway between your hip and your knee Move your body up and down so the roller massages your calf muscle Continue this movement for desired amount of time then switch to the other leg To increase the intensity, cross your top leg over and place it on the ground in front of you For an easier version, keep the top leg on the ground behind you

name_en: Roll Peroneal Side Lying on Floor
description_en: Start by laying on your side on a flat surface such as a floor or a mat Place the roll beneath your lower leg, just above your ankle Apply gentle pressure on the roll by shifting your body weight Slowly roll your leg up and down over the roll Make sure to cover the area from just above ankle to just below knee

Start by kneeling on your mat with your knees hip-width apart. Slowly lean forward, extending your hands straight in front of you. Bend one leg and slide it forward between your hands. Extend your other leg behind you, keeping the knee and top of the foot on the mat. Gently lean into the stretch, keeping your chest lifted and spine long.

Start by placing the roll on the floor Lay your hip and thigh on the roll, with the roll positioned under your glutes Extend your bottom leg straight out behind you, keeping your knee close to the ground Bend your top leg, placing your foot flat on the ground in front of you Slowly roll back and forth, directing your body weight over the roll

name_en: Roll Posterior Shoulder Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie face down on a mat, extend arm horizontally and hold the roll with your one hand Slowly try to bring the roll down towards the floor using your shoulder Hold this position for 15-30 seconds Repeat the exercise with the other arm

name_en: Roll Posterior Shoulder Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie flat on the floor on your stomach Extend your arms out to form a 'T' shape with your body Bend your right elbow at 90 degrees Gently roll onto your left side, keeping your right elbow bent Hold this stretch for 15 to 30 seconds and repeat on the other side

Start in a high plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders Roll onto your right side and lift your left arm toward the ceiling Come back to the plank position Now, roll onto your left side and lift your right arm toward the ceiling Return to the plank position and repeat the sequence

Lie down on your stomach on a mat Position the foam roll under your thighs, closer to the knees Using your forearms, roll up and down to move your body over the foam roll, from the knee to the hip Pause for breathe at any tight spots Continue the exercise for the desired number of reps or time

Sit on the floor with your legs straight out in front of you Place the foam roller under your thighs Support your body weight with your hands and begin to roll back and forth Focus on the area between the hips and knees Continue rolling for about 30 seconds or until you feel your muscles relax

Start by kneeling on the floor Lower your body onto one elbow and bend your top leg, reaching back to hold the foot Pull your foot toward your buttock to stretch your thigh Hold this stretch for desired time Repeat with the other leg

name_en: Roll Recumbent Hip External Rotator and Hip Extensor Stretch
description_en: Sit down on the floor with your legs fully stretched out in front of you Cross your right ankle over your left knee Gently press your right knee downward using your right hand to deepen the stretch Hold for at least 30 seconds, then switch legs and repeat

name_en: Roll Recumbent Hip External Rotator and Hip Extensor Stretch
description_en: Sit down on a mat with your legs extended out in front of you Cross your left leg over your right, placing your left ankle on your right knee Place the roll under your lower back Gently lean back onto the roll, keeping your spine straight Hold this position up to 30 seconds, then switch legs and repeat

Lay flat on your back with the roll beneath your lower back Hold onto something sturdy with your hands Lift your legs upwards while keeping them straight and bring your thighs towards your chest Roll your pelvis upwards and then slowly lower it down Repeat the movement

Stand erect, extend your arms forward at shoulder level and clasp your hands together Round your shoulders forward and push your clasped hands away from you Hold the stretch for about 10-30 seconds Relax and return to starting position Repeat this movement for the desired number of reps

Sit on the floor and place the roll under your upper back Cross your arms in front of your chest Gently roll your back over the roll Pause at tender points until the tightness subsides Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise

name_en: Roll Seated Shoulder Flexor Depresor Retractor
description_en: Sit on the floor with legs extended and with a foam roll placed horizontally behind your lower back. Lean back onto the roll, supporting your weight with your hands placed on either side of the roll. Slowly roll down, exhaling as you go, until the roll is positioned in the middle of your back. Stay in this position for a desired time, focusing on letting your shoulders drop towards the floor. Roll back to the starting position, inhaling as you go.

name_en: Roll Seated Single Leg Shoulder Flexor Depresor Retractor
description_en: Sit on a flat surface and stretch your legs out in front of you Place the foam roll under one calf Using your hands, lift your hips off the floor Roll your calf over the foam roll, from just above your ankle to below your knee Switch legs and repeat

name_en: Roll Shoulder Back Rotation Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie flat on your back on the floor Bend your knees and position your feet flat on the ground Extend your arms out to the sides with palms facing down Slowly roll your shoulders back, pushing them into the floor Hold for 20-30 seconds, then gradually release the stretch

name_en: Roll Shoulder Back Rotation Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie down on your back on the floor Hold the roll in your hands, extend your arms out to the sides Keep your elbows slightly bent, rotate your shoulders backward Bring the roll up over your head and then back to the starting position Repeat this for a few reps

name_en: Roll Shoulder Blade Reach Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet on the floor Hold a foam roll in both hands, keeping your arms straight Breathe in, and as you exhale, moving your arms upwards towards the ceiling and then overhead, keeping the roll in contact with the floor Pause for a second and then return to the original position Repeat these movements in a controlled manner

name_en: Roll Shoulder Blade Reach Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie flat on the floor with your arms outstretched and palms facing upwards Reach your fingers out as far as possible Roll your shoulder blades down and back, pressing them into the floor Hold the position for about 30 seconds Repeat the exercise for the desired amount of repetitions

Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you and the roll by your side Bend your right knee and extend your left leg straight Place your left hand on the roll and lean to your left, feeling the stretch down your right side Hold for 15-30 seconds Switch sides and repeat

Position yourself sideways on the foam roller, supporting your upper body with your forearms Place the foam roller under your hip Slowly roll up and down over the outer side of your hip Pause at any spots of tension for 30 seconds to 1 minute Repeat on the other side

name_en: Roll Thoracic Spine Lying on Floor
description_en: Start by lying flat on the floor with your knees bent Place the roll under your mid back Interlock your fingers and place them behind your head Gently roll up and down your back, moving only from your mid back to just below your shoulders

name_en: Roll Thoracic Spine Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie down flat on your back on the floor or a mat Place your hands behind your head or cross them over your chest Keep your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Begin to roll your spine off the floor, one vertebra at a time starting from your upper back Lower your back down onto the floor in a controlled manner, starting from your lower back

Sit on the ground with your legs stretched out in front of you Place the foam roll under your shins, just below the knee Gently roll back and forth, starting from your knee to your ankle Apply self-pressure with your hands if more intense stretching is required Ensure to cover both the inner and outer parts of the shin

Sit on the ground with your legs straight in front of you Bend one of your knees and place your heel on top of your other knee Gently push down on your bent knee, creating a stretch in your calf muscle Hold this position for 15-30 seconds Switch legs and repeat the exercise

name_en: Roll Tibialis Anterior Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie down on your back on a flat surface Bend one knee and rest the foot on the ground Extend the other leg straight out in front of you Slowly roll your extended leg from side to side Hold the stretch for a few seconds

name_en: Roll Tibialis Anterior Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie down on your back on a mat or on the floor. Extend one leg straight out in front of you. Place the roll underneath your extended calf, just below the knee. Bend your other knee and place the foot on the floor for balance. Slowly roll your leg across the roll, moving it from under the knee to the ankle.

name_en: Roll Triceps Side Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie on one side of your body on the floor Place your lower arm behind your back Raise your upper arm over your head, allowing your hand to reach towards the opposite shoulder Apply gentle pressure to your elbow, pulling it further behind your head Hold the stretch for 30 seconds then switch sides

name_en: Roll Triceps Side Lying on Floor
description_en: Lie on one side on the floor, keep the roll under your tricep Extend the lower arm above your head Push your tricep onto the roll Hold the position for about 10-30 seconds Switch sides and repeat with the other arm

Sit on the floor and place the roll under your upper back With your knees bent and feet flat on the ground, lean back onto the roll Gently roll back and forth to cover the entire upper back area Roll for about 30 seconds to a minute Repeat this movement for a few sets

Sit on the roman chair with your feet under the pads Position your hands across your chest or behind your head Lower your upper body while keeping your lower back against the pad Lift your upper body until it's just short of being perpendicular to the floor Hold for a moment then lower yourself back down

Stand tall in front of a barbell with your back straight and your feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward and grab a barbell with an overhand grip while bending your knees. Raise the barbell by straightening your knees and standing upright. Return to the starting position slowly and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and your feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward while bending your knees and hold the dumbbells near your shin with an overhand grip. Raise the dumbbells by straightening your knees and leaning back into a standing position. Return to the starting position slowly and repeat.

Start with your feet hip-width apart and a slight bend in your knees Lean forward at your hips, keeping your back straight. Twist your torso to one side, hold for a second Return to the center. Repeat on the other side Stand up straight to complete one rep

Begin in a squat position with the rope in hand While maintaining a low squat, step to the side while keeping the rope tight Resist the pull of the rope as you step Repeat in the other direction Ensure a speedy yet controlled motion throughout

Stand straight with the rope in your hands Take a lateral step to the right and simultaneously pull the rope towards you Return to the original position, taking a step back to the left, and extend your arms back out Repeat the process for the other side Continue repeating on both sides for a set number of reps

Start by laying flat on your back with your hands behind your head and your legs extended straight out Bend your right knee and twist your body to bring your left elbow to meet your right knee Hold this crunch position for a moment and then return to the starting position Repeat on the opposite side, bringing your right elbow to meet your bent left knee Alternate sides for the desired number of reps

Start in a high push-up position, palms flat on the floor and hands shoulder-width apart Bend your elbows to lower your body towards the floor Push back to the start position Rotate your body to one side lifting one arm towards the ceiling Return to the starting position and repeat, alternating sides after each push-up

Stand in a comfortable position, keep your shoulders relaxed and look straight ahead Slowly tilt your head towards your right shoulder Hold the stretch for about 20-30 seconds Return to the start position Repeat the process for your left shoulder

Start in a plank position with the arms and body straight Lower your body to the ground while rotating one arm outwards Push back up to the starting position while rotating your arm back Repeat the same with the opposite arm Perform equal reps on both sides

Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart Keep your legs and hips stable Slowly rotate your upper body to one side, hold the stretch for a few seconds Return to the center Repeat the same process to the other side

Start in a traditional push-up position Complete one push-up and as you rise, rotate your body so one arm lifts off the ground and extends overhead Return to starting position Repeat the movement on the opposite side Continue alternating sides for the duration of the set

Start in a standard push-up position Lower your body towards the ground while maintaining a straight line from your head to your heels As you push back up, rotate your body to one side and tap your opposite knee with your hand Lower your hand and rotate back to the starting position Repeat on the other side for one rep

Stand straight with your arms by your sides Slowly roll your shoulders forwards 10 times, then backwards 10 times Extend one arm straight in front and make small circles firstly clockwise, then counter-clockwise Repeat the same with the other arm Finally swing both arms gently around your body, as if you were hugging yourself
Stand tall, feet hip-width apart Lean forward from your hips while keeping your back rounded Extend your hips to stand up straight again Repeat the motion for your desired number of reps

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Take a big step back with your left foot, crossing it behind your right Bend your knees and lower your body straight down until your right thigh is parallel to the floor Push back up to the starting position Repeat on the other side to complete the rotation

Sit on the rowing machine's seat with your feet fully secured on the foot pads Hold the lever's handles with both hands Pull the lever towards your torso, keeping your back straight Return the lever handles to the starting position in a controlled manner Continue this sequence for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on the rowing machine bench with your knees bent and feet securely strapped Holding the handle, push back using your legs while leaning your body back slightly Pull the handle towards your abdomen Extend your legs fully Return to starting position by bending your legs, leaning your body forward and extending your arms

Sit on the rower with your knees bent and grasp the handle with an overhand grip. Pull the handle towards your abdomen, keeping your back straight. Extend your arms fully to the front and bend your knees to move back to the start position. Repeat the movement for the desired amount of reps. End the workout slowly, return the handles to the starting position and get off the machine.

Start by standing on the platform of the machine Hold onto the handles securely Increase the speed and resistance as you warm up Maintain an upright posture as you run Slow down the speed and decrease resistance at the end of your session

Start by standing tall with your feet hip-width apart Begin running by landing on the ball of your foot, while keeping your torso upright and your back straight Swing your arms in a natural motion Gradually increase your speed as per your comfort and stamina Slow down gradually and end your run with a cool-down walk

Begin by walking at a moderate pace to warm up your body After a few minutes, transition into a slow jog for a few more minutes Once warmed up, begin running at a comfortable pace Maintain steady breathing throughout your run Slow down to a walk to cool down towards the end of the run

Start by running in place, keeping your back straight and knees high After about a minute of running, transition into half knee bends Stand straight with your feet shoulder width apart, go down halfway into a squat position Perform the half knee bends for another minute Alternate between running and doing half knee bends for your desired workout duration

Start by jogging in place for a moment to get your blood circulating Transition into a slower run, lifting your knees as high as you can Quickly push off of the ground with the balls of your feet, hopping up Land back down gently, attempting to keep your knees slightly flexed Gain momentum and continue with the hopping motion while moving forward

Begin by jogging in place for a few seconds to warm up Transition into a rapid run, lifting your knees high After five seconds, execute a jumping jack by landing with your feet wide and arms overhead Bring your arms back to your sides and feet together, then continue running in place Repeat the sequence, alternating between running and jumping for your preferred duration

Start by jogging in place for a warm up Transition into a run, keeping your torso upright Every few strides, bring your body into a semi-squat and perform a slight jump Return to your running stride after each semi-squat jump Keep this cycle continual until you finish your workout

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Step your right foot forward and bend your right knee, keeping your left leg straight behind you Lean forward slightly from hips and place your hands on right thigh for support Lean forward and hold the stretch for 30 seconds and then change your leg

Stand upright and take a step forward with one foot, keeping the other foot behind you Bend your front knee and lean forward, keeping your back leg straight and your back foot flat on the ground Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds then switch legs Make sure you keep your back straight during the stretch Repeat the exercise for 3-5 times for each leg

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward while bending your left knee, and grab your right leg while extending your arms down. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Start in a traditional plank position Run your knees in towards your chest one at a time Keep a fast pace, almost as if youre running Maintain a flat back and level hips during the exercise Engage your core and keep your upper body still throughout the move

Start the treadmill at a slow pace to warm up Gradually increase the speed to a comfortable jogging pace Run at this pace for a specified amount of time Gradually decrease the speed towards the end for a cool down Turn off the treadmill and stretch after running.

Get down on your hips with your knees bent and your feet touching the floor Lean yourself backwards and clasp your hands together in front of your chest Twist your torso towards one side by taking your arms to that side Then twist towards the other side and repeat

Sit down on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat Lean back slightly to balance your torso diagonally, keeping your back straight Clasp your hands together in front of you Twist your torso, moving your hands from right to left and back again Repeat this process for your desired number of reps

Sit on the floor with your knees bent, pull your abs to your spine, and lean back a few inches while keeping your back straight Hold your hands straight out in front of you, interlace your fingers to create tension Twist your torso to the right, then to the left to complete one rep and engage your obliques Contract your abs and twist again to the right, that's one rep

Sit on the stability ball with your feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart Roll down on the ball until your lower back is supported by the ball Raise your arms straight in front of you Twist your torso to one side, then twist back to the other side Repeat this movement for the required number of repetitions

Sit on the ground with your legs bent, pull your upper body back until you can feel your abdominal muscles engage Clasp your hands together in front of your chest Rotate your upper body to the right, then to the left to complete one rep Keep your back straight and maintain a pivoting motion from your hips

Sit on the floor with your legs bent at the knees Hold the medicine ball with both hands in front of your chest Twist your torso to the right, then to the left to complete one rep Keep your back straight while doing this Repeat this movement for your desired number of reps

Sit down on the floor with knees bent and feet flat. Lean back slightly to engage your abdominal muscles. Interlock your fingers and twist your torso on one side. Then twist your torso to the opposite side. Repeat this motion continuously.

Sit on the floor with your knees bent, pull your abs to your spine, and lean back a few inches while keeping your back straight. Hold your hands at your chest, and twist your torso to the right, then to the left to complete one rep. The movement should come from your ribs rotating, not from your arms swinging. Inhale through center and exhale on the twist. Repeat for the prescribed number of sets and reps.

Sit on the ground with your knees bent, pull your abs to your spine, and lean back a few inches while keeping your back straight. Hold your hands at your chest, and brace your abs. Twist your torso to the right, then to the left to complete one rep. Perform your desired number of repetitions. To increase the difficulty, hold a weight in your hands as you perform the twist.

Sit on the ground with your legs bent, pulling your abs to your spine Twist your torso to the right, and then to the left to complete a rep When twisting your torso, extend your arm out like a punch Rotate from your core not your shoulders Speed up the movement for a more intense workout

name_en: Russian Twist with Hands on Chest
description_en: Sit on the floor with your knees bent, pull your abs to your spine, and lean back a few inches while keeping your back straight. Hold your hands on your chest. Slowly twist your body to the right, then to the left to complete one rep. Keep your movements smooth and controlled. Repeat for desired number of reps.

Place the bar on your shoulders, keeping the elbows high Lower your body by bending the knees, keeping your back straight Pause at the bottom of the squat, then push back up to the starting position Keep your core engaged throughout the movement

Stand up straight with the barbell on your shoulders, your feet shoulder width apart Bend at your hips, lowering your torso until it is near parallel to the floor Pause at the bottom of the movement Return to the starting position by pushing your hips backward

Start by standing or siting upright, retract your shoulder blades pulling them towards each other. Engage your trapezius and rhomboids to push your shoulders down without bending your arms. Hold the position for a moment then return to the initial position. Repeat this set for the desired amount of repetitions. To increase intensity, perform this exercise while hanging from a pull-up bar.

Begin by sitting on the edge of a bench or chair with your hands placed next to your hips Slide your buttocks off the bench while keeping your legs extended out in front of you Straighten your arms, keeping a little bend in your elbows in order to always keep tension on your trapezius muscle and off your elbow joints Slowly lower your body towards the floor until you feel a stretch in your shoulders Push back up until your elbows are nearly straight but not locked

Get down on your hands and toes with your back straight. Keep your arms and legs straight and form a straight line with your body from the head to your ankles. Drop your chest by squeezing your shoulder blades while keeping your arms straight. Raise your chest to maximum by relaxing your shoulder blades, and repeat.

Start in a high plank position with your wrists directly under your shoulders Slightly bend your elbows and pinch your shoulder blades together Push your upper back up towards the ceiling while keeping your core tight to reach the starting plank position Lower back down to the pinched shoulder blades position Repeat this movement for the desired amount of repetitions

Hang from a bar with your hands shoulder-width apart Relax your body as much as possible but keep your feet off the ground Squeeze your shoulder blades together and pull them down Raise your body slightly by pulling your shoulder blades down and together Slowly lower yourself back to the start position

Stand with your back against a wall Extend your arms overhead to form a 'Y' shape Slide your arms down slowly while keeping contact with the wall Slide them back up to the starting position Repeat this motion
