Start by standing with your back to a wall Bend your elbows and point your hands towards the ceiling Touch your elbows and wrists to the wall, keeping arms as close to the body as possible Slide your hands upwards, maintaining contact with the wall Lower arms to the initial starting position in a slow, controlled manner

Lie flat on your back on a mat, extending your legs straight up towards the ceiling Keeping your head and shoulder blades off the ground, lower your right leg down towards the ground Bring it back up to meet your left leg Repeat the movement with your left leg Continue alternating legs as though youre doing a scissor motion

Lay flat on your back on a mat with your arms by your sides Lift your legs off the ground at a 45-degree angle Cross your legs alternately like a scissor movement Keep your core engaged and your lower back pressed against the mat Continue the alternating movements for the desired number of repetitions

Start in a staggered stance with one foot in front of the other Push off the ground and jump into the air, switching the position of your feet Land softly back into the staggered stance, now with the opposite foot forward Continue this pattern, alternating feet each time

Lie down on your back with your legs straight and your hands under your hips with palms down. Raise your legs slightly off the floor Alternately move your legs across each other without bending your knees

Lay down flat on your stomach with your arms spread out to your sides Raise your right leg and try to touch your left hand with your foot Return your leg to the starting position Repeat the movement with your left leg Continue to alternate between legs for the duration of the stretch

Lie face down on the floor, extending your legs straight behind you and your arms straight in front of you Push yourself up by bending your elbows, keep your legs and feet together Lower yourself back down slowly until your chest almost touches the floor As you push up, open your arms out wide to the sides, bringing your hands closer to your feet Return to the starting position in a smooth and controlled manner
Sit on the ground and lean back slightly Bend your knees and lift your feet off the floor Extend your legs while crunching your upper body forward Return to the starting position and repeat

Sit on the floor with your knees bent, feet lifted slightly off the floor and hands bracing your legs. Lean back slightly, creating a V shape with your torso and thighs and balance on your buttocks. Slowly pull your knees towards your chest. Extend your legs out straight while leaning back a bit more. Repeat the movement for your set target.

Sit on the edge of a chair, grabbing the sides for support Bend your knees and bring them to your chest Curl your upper body towards your knees Lower your legs and upper body back to the starting position Repeat this movement for a set of reps

name_en: Seated Alternate In Out Leg Raise on Floor
description_en: Sit on the ground with your hands resting behind you Extend your legs out in front of you Lift one leg from the ground while keeping it straight Lower it back down and repeat with the other leg Alternate between legs for desired reps

name_en: Seated Alternate In Out Leg Raise over Bench
description_en: Sit on the edge of a bench with your hands next to your hips for balance Extend your legs in front of you, off the edge of the bench Lift one leg, then lower it while lifting the other, alternating in a 'paddling' motion Keep your core engaged through the entire movement, and try to keep your back straight

Start by sitting on a flat surface with your legs wide apart Engage your hips and slowly bring one leg in towards the center of your body Move your leg back to the starting position Repeat with the other leg Continue to alternate between each leg

Sit on the ground with legs extended straight in front of you Keep your back straight and your palms flat on the ground Bend one leg at the knee to lift the foot off the ground, and extend the other leg's toes towards you Hold for about 30 seconds before switching to stretch the other leg Repeat this motion for desired sets

Sit in a seated position with your feet flat on the floor Hold the barbell at a shoulder-width distance Pull the barbell in towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together Pause for a moment then slowly extend your arms to the starting position

Sit on a mat or a comfortable and flat surface with legs extended in front of you Bend your right knee and cross it over the left leg Rotate your torso to the right while keeping your back straight Hold this position for 10-15 seconds Repeat the process with the opposite leg and side

Sit on the stability ball with your back straight and feet flat on the floor Lift your arms up to the sides, keeping them straight as if you were a ballerina Slowly lower your arms back down to your sides Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on the edge of a bench or chair with your feet flat on the floor Extend your arms behind your back with your palms facing each other Lean forward from the hips, keeping your back straight Raise your upper body until it's in line with your lower body Slowly return to the starting position

name_en: Seated cable row V bar machine
description_en: Sit on a bench facing a row machine with your back straight and feet placed on the footrests. Hold a V bar over your knees with your arms straight and palms facing each other. Pull the cable towards your belly by bending your arms and taking your elbows past your back. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Sit on a calf raise machine with a straight back, thighs fixed under the padded bar, and toes placed on the footrests. Rest your hands on the handles of the bar and raise the bar while lifting your heels up. Hold for a while, lower your heels, and repeat.

name_en: Seated Calf Raises Dumbbell On Knee
description_en: Sit on a bench with a straight back, knees bent, and your toes resting on a weighted plate. Hold dumbbells in your hands and place them on your thighs. Raise your thighs towards the chest by lifting your heels up. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Sit on the floor with your legs straight in front of you Lean forward from your hips and reach for your toes Hold this stretch for 20-30 seconds Release and repeat for 3-5 repetitions Make sure to not bounce during the stretch

Sit on the floor with one leg extended straight in front of you Bend your other knee and tuck the foot against the inner thigh of your extended leg Keeping your back straight, lean forward from the hips until a stretch is felt in the calf of your outstretched leg Hold the stretch for a duration of 15 to 30 seconds Repeat stretch with the other leg

Sit down on your hips with a straight back, put your hands near your hips, and extend your legs forward. Lean forward while bending your right leg, and pull your left foot towards you while extending your left arm. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Sit down on the floor with your legs extended in front of you Lean forward and reach for your toes with your hands while keeping your knees straight Pull your toes back towards your body until you feel a stretch in your calves Hold this position for 20-30 seconds Release and relax, then repeat the exercise

Sit up straight on a chair or bench Extend your arms to the sides, elbows at 90 degrees Squeeze your chest muscles, bringing your elbows together in front of you Hold for a moment, then slowly release, spreading your arms back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit tall in a comfortable position Place your hands, palms facing inwards, on your shoulders Push your elbows back as far as comfortable, squeezing your shoulder blades together Hold this stretch for the desired amount of time Slowly release and return your arms to the starting position

Sit up straight on a chair Pull your head directly backward, making sure to keep your eyes facing forward Hold this position for 3-5 seconds Relax and return to the starting position Repeat the exercise for several times

Sit comfortably on a chair keeping your feet flat on the ground Place two fingers on your chin Gently press your chin with your fingers and slide your chin back as though it were moving straight back Hold the position for a few seconds and then release Repeat for 8 to 12 repetitions

Start by sitting on the ground, legs elevated and straight Reach up and grab the bar, pulling your body up until your chin is over the bar Hold this position for a moment Lower yourself down in a controlled fashion Repeat for desired number of repetitions

Sit down on the ground with your legs extended in front of you Reach up and grasp the bar overhead with a wide overhand grip Pull your body up until your chin is over the bar Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Sit down on the floor, lean back a bit and lift your legs once you're ready Make a large circular motion with your legs, as if you're simulating pedaling Rotate your legs slowly in a clockwise direction for multiple repetitions Switch your legs and rotate them in an anti-clockwise direction for multiple repetitions Repeat this exercise for the desired amount of respiratory rounds

Sit on your hips with your knees bent and feet placed on the floor. Lean backward while extending your arms behind your back, bend one of your knees, and place your other foot over it. Lean forward against your crossed leg by placing your arms near your hips. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.
Sit on the ground with your legs crossed, one leg over the other Reach towards your feet with both hands Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds Switch the position of your legs and repeat

name_en: Seated Diagonal Knee Raise on Bench
description_en: Sit cross-wise on the bench, rest your hip on one side Place your hands at the sides for balance Raise your legs off the floor while bending your knees Move your knees towards the opposite shoulder, diagonally Lower your legs back to the initial position

Sit upright on a chair with your feet shoulder-width apart Lower your chin towards your chest gently to stretch the back of your neck Hold this position for a count of 10-15 seconds Lift your head back up and then tilt it slightly backwards to stretch the front of your neck Hold this position for the same count 10-15 seconds
Sit down on your hips and extend your legs forward. Place your hands behind your head, and crunch your chest forward. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Sit down on a bench with your back straight, lean backward and place your hands on the bench for support Raise your legs straight off the floor making a 'V' shape with your body Alternately move your legs up and down without bending your knees

Sit on your heels and place your palms on the floor in front of you Push your palms into the floor as you lean back, keeping your arms straight Hold this position for about 20-30 seconds Slowly lift your palms and place your hands back on your heels Repeat the process as necessary

Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you Inhale, sit tall and stretch out your spine Exhale as you lean forward from your hips, reaching for your toes Hold this pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute, breathing deeply To release, inhale and slowly sit back up

Sit on the floor with your legs stretched out in front of you. Keeping your back straight, reach forward with your hands trying to touch your feet. Hold onto wherever you can reach, it may be your ankles, feet, or toes. Pull your upper body closer to your legs, deepening the stretch. Hold the position for a few deep breaths.

name_en: Seated Frog Half to Full Sit-up
description_en: Start by sitting on the floor, bend your knees, and keep your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart Lean back slightly til you feel your abs engage Move your upper body forward to perform a half sit-up Then, perform a full sit-up by flexing your waist to lift your torso as high as you can Reverse the movement and return to the starting position

Sit on the floor with your legs out straight Bend one leg and cross it over the other, placing your foot flat on the floor Gently pull your knee towards your chest until you feel a stretch in your glutes Hold this stretch for 30-40 seconds Repeat this process with the other leg

Sit on the edge of a chair with both feet flat on the floor. Extend one leg straight in front of you keeping the heel on the floor. Keeping your lower back flat, lean forward until you feel a gentle stretch in the back of your thigh. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then repeat with the other leg. Remember to breathe during the stretch and try to relax.

Sit on a hip abductor machine with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the footrests. Set the padded bars against the outer sides of your knees. Open your knees apart to push the bars sideways. As you reach your maximum range, return to the initial position and repeat.

Sit with your legs spread wide apart While keeping your back straight, lean forward from the hips Hold for about 20-30 seconds Relax and return to the starting position Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions

name_en: Seated Hip External Rotator And Hip Extensor Stretch
description_en: Sit on the ground with your legs stretched out in front of you. Bend one knee and cross it over the straight leg. Twist your torso towards the bent knee, using your opposite arm for support. Hold this stretch for 20 to 30 seconds. Switch sides and repeat for the other leg.

name_en: Seated In Out Leg Raise on Floor
description_en: Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you and your hands resting at your sides Lean back slightly while keeping your back straight Bring your knees towards your chest while keeping your feet together Extend your legs back to the starting position without touching the floor Repeat the movement for the required amount of repetitions

name_en: Seated In-Out Leg Raise on Floor
description_en: Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you Lean back slightly, placing your palms flat on the floor Lift your feet off the floor while keeping your legs together Spread your legs apart as wide as possible Return your legs to the starting position

name_en: Seated In Out Leg Raise over Bench
description_en: Sit on the edge of a bench, gripping the sides with both hands for balance. Extend your legs straight out in front of you. Raise your extended legs up and bring them in towards your chest. Push your legs back out to the extended position. Lower your legs back down.

name_en: Seated Knee Flexor And Hip Adductor Stretch
description_en: Sit on the floor and extend your legs in front of you Bend one knee and place the foot against the inner area of the opposing thigh Lean forward at the hip towards the extended leg while keeping your back straight Hold this position for 20-30 seconds Switch legs and repeat

Start by sitting on the floor with your legs extended in front of you Bend one knee and slide your foot towards your buttock Hold the stretch for around 30 seconds Release and return to the starting position Repeat with the other leg

Start by sitting on the ground with your legs extended out in front of you. Pull your right knee towards your body, and hug it close. Try bringing your nose towards the pulled up knee. Hold this position for a few seconds before releasing. Repeat the same with your left knee.

Cross your right leg over your left knee while seated Motion your right knee towards your left shoulder Hold this position to feel a stretch in your hip and oblique Return to the starting position Repeat the movement with the left leg

Sit firmly on the floor, legs extended in front of you Cross your hands over your chest Gently lean back from the hips, keeping your back straight Feel the stretch in your back and hold for 15-30 seconds Return to starting position and repeat desired times

Find a flat surface and sit erect with your legs stretched out in front of you. Place your palms on the ground behind you, fingers pointing towards your back. Lean backwards and bend your elbows, allowing yourself to gently stretch the back and hips. Hold the stretch for about 20-30 seconds. Release gradually and return to the starting position.

Sit on a leg curl machine with your back supported, knees bent, and feet hanging below. Set the bar of the machine against your shins. Take the bar up by extending your legs forward. As your legs become nearly straight, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Sit on the edge of a chair and lean slightly back Place your hands on the sides of the chair for stability Raise both your legs parallel to the floor Hold for a moment, then lower your legs back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on the edge of a bench and lean back slightly With both hands gripping the sides of the bench for support, lift your feet off the ground  Start to make circular movements with your legs while keeping your core engaged Alternate between clockwise and counterclockwise circles Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Sit on the edge of a stable chair with your feet flat on the ground Cross your arms on your chest and slowly lower your upper body towards your knees Hold the stretch at the lowest point for 10 to 30 seconds Slowly rise back to the starting position Repeat this exercise about 5 times

Sit on the ground with your legs extended in front of you Place your hands on your hips Bend forward at the waist and try to touch your toes Hold this position for 15-20 seconds Return to the starting position

Sit on a hip abductor machine with your back straight, knees open wide and bent, and feet on the footrests. Set the padded bars against the inner sides of your knees. Close your knees to bring the bars together. As the bars come together, return to the initial position and repeat.

Sit on a chair with good posture. Slowly tilt your head to one side until you feel a gentle stretch. Hold the stretch for up to 30 seconds. Return your head to the center and repeat on the other side. Repeat this exercise up to 5 times on each side.

Sit upright with your feet flat on the floor Extend your right arm down and to the side Tilt your head left, aiming to touch your ear to your shoulder Hold for a count of 15-30 seconds, then switch sides

Start by sitting comfortably with your back straight Place your hands on the back of your neck Bend your head forward until your chin touches your chest Raise your head back to the start position, resist by pushing gently with your hands Repeat this motion for your desired set and rep count

Sit on a bench facing a row machine with a straight back and your feet placed on the footrests. Hold the rod above your knees with an overhand grip of your hands while keeping your arms straight. Pull the cable towards your chest by bending your arms and taking your elbows past your back. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Sit on the floor and extend your legs out in front of you. Bend your left knee and place your left foot on your right thigh so that your left knee is pointing out to the side. Keeping your spine straight and chest lifted, bend forward at your waist until you feel a stretch in your right hip and inner thigh. Hold this position for about 30 seconds, then slowly return to the starting position and switch sides.

Sit down on a flat surface, extend your legs out in front of you Bend your right leg, putting your right ankle on top of your left knee Lean forward, pushing the top of your legs into the bend Hold the position for 15-30 seconds Repeat with the other leg

Sit underneath a sturdy pull-up bar with your legs extended at a 90-degree angle and heels resting on the ground or elevated surface Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder width Pull your body up until your chest touches the bar Lower your body in a controlled manner until your arms are fully extended again Repeat to complete desired number of reps

Sit on the floor below the bar. Reach up and grasp the bar with your hands shoulder-width apart. Pull your body upwards until your chin is above the bar. To complete the rep, slowly lower yourself down until your arms are fully extended. Repeat for desired number of reps.

Sit with your legs bent, feet planted on the floor and hold the EZ barbell with overhand grip, with forearm and hands parallel to floor Keep your shoulders relaxed and start flexing at the elbow to squeeze your back muscles Hold this position for a moment before stretching your arms out again Make sure your movements are controlled throughout the motion Repeat this process for your desired number of repetitions

Sit down on a floor with your legs straight in front of you. Bend your right knee and hold your right foot with your right hand. Gently pull your right foot towards your back until you feel a stretch in your right quadricep. Hold for about 30 seconds, then switch to the left leg. Repeat each side a few times.
Wrap a resistance band around your feet and hold its ends in your hands while keeping your arms straight. Stretch the band by folding your arms and taking your elbows past your back.

Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you Reach your arms out in front of you Cross your arms with your right hand grabbing your left wrist Drop your head and round your back Pull your arms towards your knees while keeping them stretched

Sit on the ground, legs crossed, maintain a straight back Extend your arms out straight in front of your chest, fingers together and palms touching Rotate your torso to the right side, without altering your leg position Gently exhale and hold position for 15-30 seconds Repeat the same motion on the left side

Start by sitting on the ground with your legs extended straight in front of you Fold a towel lengthwise and hold it with both hands, your arms extended straight in front of you Lean back slightly, engaging your core to maintain balance Pull on the towel as though you're rowing a boat, bringing your hands towards your waist Return to the start position in a controlled manner

Sit upright with your elbow at 90 degrees, your arm positioned to the side Rotate your shoulder, moving your hand and forearm upwards Pause once your forearm is vertical, then slowly lower your hand back down Repeat on the other side

name_en: Seated Shoulder Flexor Depresor Retractor Stretch
description_en: Sit upright on a chair with your feet flat on the floor Extend your arm forward at shoulder height Gently pull your arm towards your chest using the other arm Hold this position for 20-30 seconds Switch and repeat with the other arm

name_en: Seated Shoulder Flexor Depresor Retractor Stretch Bent Knee
description_en: Sit down comfortably with your knees bent Extend your hands in front of you Slowly lean forward, lower your head, and try to reach your toes Hold the position for a few seconds before returning to a relaxed position Repeat the stretch a few times

name_en: Seated Shoulder Flexor Depresor Retractor Stretch Bent Knee
description_en: Sit on the floor with your knees bent Place your hands slightly behind you, fingers facing forward Bend your elbows and slowly lower your body backward until a stretch is felt in the shoulders and chest Hold this position for a desired number of seconds Slowly raise your body back to the starting position

Start by sitting on the floor with your legs out in front of you. Place your hands on the floor behind you, fingers pointing towards your feet. Lift your butt off the floor. Begin to tap your left shoulder with your right hand then place it back on the floor. Repeat with the other hand, tapping your right shoulder with your left hand.

Sit on the floor with your back against the wall. Bend your knees and place your feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart. Place your hands behind your head, keeping your elbows broad. Using your abs, lean to the left, then to the right, creating a 'crunching' motion. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

Sit on a bench with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Place your left hand at the side of the bench and extend your right arm straight overhead. Crunch your torso towards your left and hold for 30-60 seconds.

name_en: Seated Side to Side Leg Raise Crunch on Floor
description_en: Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you. Place your hands on the sides for support. Pull your knees towards your chest and then extend your legs to the right in a controlled manner. Pull your knees back to the chest and then extend your legs to the left. Repeat these movements while flexing your abdominal muscles each time.

Sit on the floor with your legs extended out in front of you. Bend one knee, and place the sole of that foot against the inside of the opposite thigh. Keeping your back straight, lean forward from the hips to feel a stretch in the hamstring of the extended leg. Hold this stretch for 15-30 seconds. Return to the starting position and repeat with the opposite leg.

Sit down on your hips and extend your legs forward. Lean forward, place your right hand near your knee, and pull your left toes towards you while extending your left arm. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Sit on the ground and extend one leg straight out in front of you while your other leg is bent, foot against the extended leg's inner thigh Lean forward from the hip while keeping your back straight until you feel a stretch in the hamstring of your extended leg Hold this position for 10-30 seconds before slowly returning to the start position Repeat with the other leg Perform 3-5 repetitions on each leg

Sit on the floor with your legs extended and feet together Place your hands a foot behind you with fingers pointing backwards Lean your torso back into your arms as you lift your chest towards the ceiling Allow your head to tilt back and gaze upwards Hold the stretch for 30-60 seconds

Sit down comfortably with your legs crossed Place your hands on your knees Slowly tilt your head back, looking towards the sky Hold the position for 10-30 seconds Slowly return your head to the initial position

Start by sitting on the floor with your legs stretched out in front of you Reach towards your toes with your hands without bending your knees Hold this position to feel a stretch in your calves Breathe deeply throughout the stretch and hold it for about 30 seconds Relax and repeat for a few more times

Sit down on your hips and extend your legs forward. Lean forward, place your right hand near your knee, and pull your left toes towards you while extending your left arm. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Sit on the edge of a chair with your feet flat on the floor Place the balls of your feet on the edge of a step or elevated surface Lift your heels off the floor, keeping your toes on the surface Lower your heels back down

Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you Extend your arms to the sides, keeping them straight Twist your torso to the right, keeping your arms straight and parallel to the floor Repeat the movement to the left Continue alternating sides

Sit on the stability ball with your feet flat on the ground Slowly twist your upper body to the right, keeping your hips stable Return to the center and repeat the action on the left Keep alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions

Begin by sitting on the ground with your legs straight out in front of you. Twist your torso to the right, reaching your left hand to your right foot. Return to center and then twist your torso to the left, reaching your right hand to your left foot. This completes one rep. Repeat for the recommended amount of reps. Maintain your posture throughout the exercise, keep your back straight.

Sit up straight in a chair with your feet flat on the floor Place your hands behind your head or on your waist Rotate your torso to the right while keeping your hips still Hold for a moment and then rotate to the left side Return to the neutral position

Sit down on your hips with your back straight and slightly leaned backwards, and place your hands on the floor for support Raise your legs off the floor as high as possible without bending your knees Return to the floor slowly and repeat

Sit tall on the floor, opening your legs as wide as comfortable. Place your hands in front on the floor and walk them forward, keeping your spine long and chest lifted. Hold this pose and breathe deeply, allowing your body to relax into the stretch. Slowly walk your hands back toward your body, lifting your torso. Gently bring your legs together and relax.

Start by sitting upright on the floor with your legs spread out wide apart Prop your hands behind you and flatten your lower back Lean your torso slowly forward keeping your back straight Hold this pose for 30-60 seconds Return to the starting position

Start by standing upright with your feet hip-width apart Bend your knees and lower your body, keeping your back straight, until your buttocks touches your heels Extend your legs to push back up to the starting position Repeat this process for the desired number of reps Consider using your arms for balance and stability throughout the exercise

Stand straight in front of an object you can grab for support Lift your feet off the ground, keeping your thighs and upper body parallel to the floor Keep your legs straight, and try to bring your heels towards your glutes Slowly return your legs to the starting position

Lie down on your back under a sturdy bar or table Reach up and grab the bar with both hands Using your biceps and latissimus dorsi, pull your chest to the bar Hold for a moment and then slowly lower yourself back to the starting position. Repeat for desired number of reps

Begin by grasping the parallel bars on the exercise machine Lift up your knees to chest height, creating an inverted position Extend your body in a cutting motion, reaching your legs towards the sky Contract your abdomen and lower your body back to starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the process for desired amount of reps
Stand in a semi-squat position Jump up explosively On landing, absorb the impact by bending knees Reset to the semi-squat position Repeat the jump

Stand tall and assume a punching position by folding your arms and bringing your fists near your shoulders. Keep one of your feet ahead of the other and keep your knees slightly bent. Punch forward with your left hand while turning your torso towards the right. Return to the initial position, and repeat by punching with your opposite arm.

Begin in a seated position with legs bent at a 90-degree angle, one leg in front and the other behind. Lift your hips off the floor and switch the position of your legs such that the previously back leg is now in front. Lower your hips back to the floor and sit upright with your chest out and shoulders back. Repeat the movement while alternating the front and back legs. Perform the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.
Stand or sit with a good posture Raise your arm to your side until it's level with your shoulder Lower your arm back down in a controlled fashion Repeat the movement on the other arm
Stand tall with your back straight, arms by your side, and feet shoulder-width apart. Open your arms wide to shoulder level. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand with a straight posture Extend your arm out to the side with your palm facing down Slowly bring your arm down to your side, keeping it straight Hold for a few seconds then return to the starting position Repeat on the other side

Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides Slowly reach your arms behind you and interlock your fingers Gently pull your interlocked hands upward and away from your back, feeling a stretch in your shoulders Hold this position for a few seconds Lower your arms and repeat

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms behind your back and interlock your fingers Slowly lift your hands upwards until you feel a stretch in your shoulders Hold this position for several seconds Slowly release your hands and bring them to your sides

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground Raise your hips off the ground while keeping your feet and shoulders in place Hold this position for a few seconds Lower your hips back onto the ground Repeat the process

Stand tall with your back straight, arms by your side, and feet shoulder-width apart. Open your chest out and move your shoulders forward and backward as if they are making circles. Maintain this activity for a suitable duration.

Stand tall with your feet slightly wider than shoulder width apart Extend your arms straight out, palms facing down Move your arms back and try to expand your chest Hold for a comfortable period of time Release and return to the starting position
Stand tall with your back straight, arms by your side, and feet shoulder-width apart. Raise your arms forward and extend them overhead. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand up straight with your arms relaxed at your sides Raise your arms in front of you and up over your head as far as you can reach Hold this position for 15 to 30 seconds Lower your arms back to the starting position Repeat this motion for your desired amount of reps

Grasp the pull-up bar with an overhand grip that is wider than shoulder width Pull your body up until your chin is level with the pull-up bar Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position Fully extend your arms in the downward position Repeat this movement for your desired amount of repetitions

Grab the bar with a shoulder-width grip Pull yourself up until your chin is over the bar Hold this position for a moment Lower yourself back down slowly to the starting position. Repeat the exercise as many times as comfortable

Stand straight with your arms at your sides and palms facing your body Slowly lift your shoulder in an upward and back rotation Hold at the topmost position for a few seconds Release and return your shoulder to the initial position Repeat the motion on the other shoulder

Stand straight with your arms down by your sides Bend your elbow so your hand is in front of your waist Rotate your shoulder, moving your hand away from your body to the side Hold this position for a few seconds Return to the starting position and repeat

Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart Lift your right knee towards your left shoulder, simultaneously touching it with your left hand Lower your right knee and repeat the action with your left knee to the right shoulder, touching it with your right hand Repeat this alternating pattern for the duration of the exercise Execute each movement in a brisk, controlled manner

name_en: Shoulder Rotation Twist Split Lunge Stretch
description_en: Start in a split lunge position with right leg in front Slowly rotate your upper body towards the right side Hold the stretch for around 20-30 seconds Return to the starting position Repeat the same with your left leg in front

name_en: Shoulder Rotation Twist Split Lunge Stretch
description_en: Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Step forward with your left foot into a split stance Bend your knees and lower your body into a lunge While in the lunge position, rotate your upper body towards your left leg Slowly return to the starting position and switch legs

Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms straight out at shoulder level Slowly rotate your shoulders forward in big circles Bring your arms back to the starting position Repeat the exercise, this time rotating your shoulders backwards

Start in a high plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart Keep your core engaged, lift your right hand and tap your left shoulder Place your right hand back on the floor and lift your left hand tapping your right shoulder Return to the starting position and take a step forward with your right foot, then left foot Return to the start position and repeat these steps

Stand upright comfortably Extend one arm straight out to your side at shoulder height Slowly move the arm behind your back Keep your arm as straight as possible, stretching until you feel a small tension Hold this position for about 15-20 seconds then switch arms

Start in a high plank position with your palms flat on the floor Keep your body straight and engage your core Lift your right hand and tap your left shoulder Return your right hand to the floor Repeat on the other side, with your left hand tapping your right shoulder

Begin in a high plank position with the arms straight and the body in one line from head to heels Lift your right hand off the ground and tap your left shoulder Carefully place your right hand back on the ground Then lift your left hand off the ground and tap your right shoulder Return your left hand to the ground and repeat, alternating sides

Start in a high plank position, shoulders directly over wrists Jump your feet out to the side like a jumping jack Return to your plank, then tap your right hand to your left shoulder Repeat, then tap your left hand to your right shoulder Alternate these movements in a fluid motion

Start in a high plank position, with shoulders directly above your wrists Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor Push your body up and tap your left shoulder with your right hand Lower your body back down and repeat, but this time tap your right shoulder with your left hand Keep alternating sides for a set number of reps

Begin in a high plank position Lower your body towards the floor, keeping your body in a straight line As you push back to the high plank, tap your left shoulder with your right hand Lower your body again and as you push back, tap your right shoulder with your left hand Continue alternating tapping shoulders with each rep

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms sideways at shoulder height Slowly push your arms back as if trying to touch your shoulder blades together Hold the stretch for 15 seconds Slowly return to the initial position

Stand or sit with your back straight Stretch one hand across your body to the opposite side so it's parallel to the ground Use your other hand to lightly push the elbow of your outstretched arm closer to your chest Hold for 15-30 seconds Repeat on the other side

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms straight out towards your sides and parallel to the floor Keep your palms facing downwards and your fingers extended Slowly move your arms backward in a controlled motion Hold this position for a moment then return to the initial position

Stand with your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms out to your sides at shoulder height, palms facing down Keeping your arms straight, bring them forward in front of your body Hold this position for a moment, feeling a stretch in your shoulders Slowly return your arms back to the starting position

Stand upright with your feet about shoulder width apart Bend one knee, raising the heel of the foot and hold your ankle Bend your standing leg to lower yourself down Keep your back straight and descend until your knee almost touches the ground Push back up to the starting position and switch legs

Stand straight with your hands extended in front of you Lift one leg and grab your ankle behind you Squat down on your standing leg, bringing your knee as close to the floor as possible Push through your heel to return back to the standing position Repeat the process with the other leg

Start by lying on your back on the ground, extending your arms above your head and your legs straight out Explosively, push your hips off the ground and shuffle your feet as if you were running Land softly and maintain your pace for your designated time Ensure your core is active throughout the motion Repeat the sequence for several rounds, taking minimal rest

Start in a standing position, feet shoulder-width apart Bend your knees slightly and engage your core Jump from one foot to the other, as though running on the spot Raise the opposite knee to hip height as you 'run' Continue to shuffle from one foot to the other, moving as quickly as you can for the duration of your workout

Begin standing, feet hip-width apart, knees slightly bent Jump to your right, landing on your right foot As you land, reach your left hand down towards your right foot Jump diagonally to your left, landing on your left foot Reach your right hand down towards your left foot and repeat the movement

Start in a half squat position Quickly hop forward a few inches, landing softly on your toes Immediately hop again, as soon as your feet touch the ground Continue hopping forward for a set distance or time Return to your starting position by hopping backwards in the same manner

Start by standing with your feet hip-width apart, knees slightly bent Hop to your right, landing on your right foot, and allow your left foot to cross behind your right Then, hop to your left, landing on your left foot, and allow your right foot to cross behind your left Continue shuffling back and forth for a set amount of time or repetitions Keep your body low and your center of gravity over the landing foot during each hop

Start by standing tall with your feet together Jump to the right and land on your right foot, lifting your left leg off the floor Jump to the left and land on your left foot, lifting your right leg off the floor Repeat the shuffling in a quick, controlled motion Incorporate arm movements for additional cardiovascular benefits

Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart Jump and spread your legs to the sides while touching hands at the top Return to the original stance and then jump again with feet in front of each other while clapping hands beneath legs Repeat this sequence for the desired number of repetitions

Sit sideways on the stability ball with your feet flat on the floor While keeping your back straight, slowly bend at the waist to the side, lowering your torso as far as comfortable Pause for a second when you reach the farthest point of your bend Slowly return to the starting position by pushing your torso back up Repeat the exercise on the other side
Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms above your head Bend sideways at the waist as far as possible Return to the initial position Repeat the exercise on the other side

Stand straight with your feet shoulder width apart Raise your arms above your head, interlock fingers and keep your arms stretched Lean to your right side while maintaining your balance Return to the upright position Repeat the process for the left side

Stand up straight with your feet hip width apart Slowly drop your right ear towards your right shoulder, stretching the left side of your neck Now extend your right arm out to the side, engaging your obliques Hold this position for around 15-30 seconds Slowly return to the start position and repeat on the other side

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise one arm above your head, keep the other arm at your side Bend at your waist to the side of the raised arm while keeping your body facing forward As you bend, tuck your abdomen in Return to start position and repeat on the other side

Start in a normal plank position, maintaining a straight line with your body Slowly tilt your hip to one side until you can feel your obliques contract Return to the initial position Tilt your hips to the other side Repeat the process for your desired number of reps

Start by standing upright with feet hip-width apart. Bend at your waist to one side while extending the same side leg out and up. Return to the upright position. Repeat on the opposite side. Alternate sides for the chosen amount of reps.

Stand up straight with your feet hip width apart. Take a big step to the side with your right foot, bending your right knee and pushing your hips back. As you are lunging to the side, bend at the waist towards your right. Push off with your right foot to return to the starting position. Repeat on the other side.

Stand straight with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart Extend your arms to the side at shoulder height Bend your upper body to one side as far as comfortable Hold this position for a few seconds Repeat the stretch on the other side

Lie on your side with your forearm directly under your shoulder Stack your feet and lift your hips off the ground Keep your body in a straight line through the duration of the exercise Hold this position for a specified amount of time Repeat on the other side

Lay down on your side on the floor, with your knees bent. Your elbow should be aligned directly under your shoulder. Engage your core and lift your hips till your body forms a straight line. Stay in the lifted position for the stipulated time duration. Slowly lower your hips back to the floor and repeat. Switch sides and repeat the exercise after finishing all the reps on the first side.

Lie on your side, supporting your body weight on one forearm and the feet stacked one on top of the other. While maintaining this side bridge position, raise the top leg as high as possible. Lower the leg back down in a controlled manner and repeat the movement for the desired repetitions. Switch sides and repeat the exercise with the other leg.

Start by lying on your side, supporting your body weight on your forearm and foot, the other foot stacked on top. Lift your body to create a straight line from head to heels. Raise your top leg as high as you comfortably can while keeping your body upright. Hold for a moment, then lower your leg back down. Repeat for desired number of reps before switching sides.

Lie on your side on a mat with your weight resting on your forearm and the side of your foot Lift your hips up to create a straight line from your head to your feet Raise your top leg as high as you can while maintaining your balance Lower your top leg and your hip back down to the starting position Repeat on opposite side

Start by lying on your side with your elbow under your shoulder and feet stacked. Bend your bottom leg at a 90-degree angle for support. Lift your hips up to create a straight line from head to feet. Hold for a few seconds, then slowly lower back to the starting position. Repeat the exercise on the other side.

Begin by laying down on your side Lift your body by supporting your weight on your elbow and side of your foot Try to form a straight line from your head to your toes Hold this position for a few seconds Slowly lower your body back to the starting position

Start in a squatting position, with feet close together Twist your body to the right, placing the left elbow on the outside of the right knee Place your palms flat on the ground and slowly shift your weight onto your hands Raise your feet off the ground, balancing on your hands Hold this pose for 5-10 breaths and then repeat on the other side

Lie on your side, with legs bent at a comfortable angle Place your lower arm under your head and the upper hand on your upper hip Lift your upper body and lower knee towards each other Pause for a moment and feel the contraction in your side Slowly lower your body to the starting position and repeat

Lie down on your side, with your legs together and one hand behind your head Lift your upper body towards your hip while keeping your legs stationary Hold for a few seconds Lower your upper body back to the starting position Repeat on both sides to work your obliques evenly

Lay down on your right side with your legs together and your knees bent slightly Place your left hand behind your head with your elbow pointing straight up Keeping your body in a straight line, lift your upper body towards your hip Slowly lower yourself back to the ground to complete one rep Switch sides and repeat for the left obliques

Stand with your left side facing the wall, and keep your feet hip-width apart Raise your left arm and place it on the wall for support, while your right hand touches the right side of your head Slowly bend at the waist to the right, crunching your side abs Then, slowly raise your body back to the starting position Repeat this movement for a prescribed number of repetitions, then switch sides

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Squat down and then as you stand up, balance on one leg and crunch your abs by bringing your elbow down to meet your raised knee on the same side Return to the squat position Repeat the process, standing up and crunching on the other side Keep switching sides for each rep

Stand between a pair of parallel bars, placing your hands on the bars at shoulder width apart Lift your body upward until your arms are fully extended Bend your knees and raise your legs to one side Lower your legs back down to the initial position in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise on the opposite side

Lie down on your side with your legs straight Make sure your body is aligned from head to toe Slowly raise your top leg towards the ceiling while keeping it straight Pause for a moment, then lower your leg to the initial position Repeat for desired repetitions and then switch sides

Start by lying on your side with your legs stacked one on top of the other. Keep the bottom leg straight and your top leg slightly bent. Lift the top leg towards the ceiling while keeping it straight. Lower it back down in a controlled manner without touching the other leg. Switch sides and repeat the exercise with the other leg.

Start with your legs together and arms by your side Jump sideways to the left, landing on your left foot while the right foot kicks to the side Jump to the right, doing the opposite movements Keep the jumps quick and light, alternating from side to side

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Jump up forcefully while simultaneously twisting your lower body to one side Land softly on your feet, absorbing the impact with your knees slightly bent Immediately jump again, this time twisting to the opposite side Continue to alternate sides with each jump

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hands out to the sides Jump up and while in the air, rotate your waist to the right Land gently and immediately jump again, this time rotating your waist to the left Continue this process for the desired amount of repetitions Make sure each jump is controlled and you're twisting at your waist not your hips

Start standing. Squat down and place your hands on the ground. Kick your feet back and descend into a push-up. As you rise from the push-up, bring your feet back under you, and spring up in a jump, raising your hands above your head. Upon landing, perform a side kick with your right foot, then another one with your left foot. Repeat from the beginning - that's one rep.

Start in a standing position. Jump down into a burpee and do a push-up. Jump back up and as you come up, kick out to the side with your opposite foot. Land softly, then repeat, alternating legs each time. Keep your core tight and engage your legs and glutes throughout the exercise. Continue to alternate between a burpee and a side kick for the duration of your workout.

Start in a quadruped position with your hands under shoulders and knees under your hips. Lift your knees off the ground to a hover position. Kick your right foot through to the left as you pivot on your left hand, lifting your right hand off the ground. Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Raise your right knee to your side at hip level Lower your right knee and repeat the action with your left knee Continue these steps for a set of repetitions Take a short break and repeat the set

Begin standing straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise one knee towards your chest, keeping your back straight and engaging your core Lower the raised leg back to the ground in a slow and controlled manner Repeat on the other side for one repetition Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions

Start by getting into a kneeling position, ensuring your thighs are perpendicular to the floor Place your hands on the floor under your shoulders with fingers pointed forward Lower your body by bending your elbows, until your chest almost touches the floor Push your upper body up, fully extending your arms until you're in the initial position Repeat this for the required number of repetitions

Stand tall on a resistance band with your back and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the ends of the band near your thighs with your arms straight and palms facing inward. Stretch the band by opening your arms wide to the shoulder height. Hold for a while, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides Jump out to the side and lift your right leg, while lifting your arms up over your head Return to the starting position Repeat on the other side, this time lifting your left leg Keep alternating sides for the duration of the exercise

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Take a big step to the right keeping your body facing forward Shift your weight to the right foot, bending your right knee and pushing your hips back Return to the starting position in a controlled motion Repeat for the desired repetitions before switching to the other leg

Stand upright with your hands on your hips Step out to one side while keeping your other foot stationary Lower your body by flexing at the hips and knees Push back up to start position and repeat on the other side

Stand upright with your feet hip width apart Take a big step to the side with your right foot, bending your right knee and keeping your left leg straight Lean into the right, pushing your hips back and keeping your weight on the right foot Hold the position for 15-30 seconds Return to the starting position and repeat on the left side

Stand straight with feet hip-width apart. Take a large step to the right and lower yourself into a side lunge. Push off your right foot and immediately jump up off the ground. Land softly, returning to the starting position. Repeat this on the other side.

Stand tall with your back straight, arms folded, your hands raised forward, and your feet shoulder-width apart. Take a step towards a side and lower yourself by bending your knee while keeping your other leg straight and pivoting its heel. Hold momentarily, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Take a large step to the right, bending your right knee and shifting your weight to that side Keep your left leg straight and your right knee in line with your right foot Hold for around 20-30 seconds Push off your right foot to return to standing position and repeat on the other side

Begin in a wide stance with arms extended overhead Slowly lunge to your right, bending the knee and dropping your hips back Simultaneously lower your right hand to touch your right foot Push off your right foot to return to the starting position Repeat the movement on the left side

Stand straight with feet hip-width apart Take a step to the right. As you lower your body bend your right knee and rotate your left foot outward Push off your right foot to bring yourself back to the starting position Repeat on the other side for one rep Do the required number of repetitions

Begin in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart Perform a side lunge on your right, simultaneously twist your torso to the right bringing your hands to your right foot Push off with your right foot, to return to the standing position, bringing your hands overhead Repeat this movement on your left side Continue alternating sides for desired reps

Lie on your side, with your hips, knees, and feet stacking on top of each other. Bend your knees to about a 90-degree angle. Keeping your feet together, lift your top knee as high as you can without moving your hips. Lower your knee back down to meet the other. Repeat the movement for desired repetitions, then switch sides.

name_en: Side Lying 90 Degrees Hip Clam and Kick
description_en: Lie on your side with your legs at 90 degrees and feet together. Keeping your feet together, lift the top knee like opening a clam. Extend the top leg, keeping it at the height of the open clam. Bend the knee bringing it back to the clam position. Lower the knee, closing the clam. Repeat for set reps and switch sides.

Lie on your side with your hips and knees bent at 90 degrees Keep your feet together while lifting your upper knee as high as you can without moving your hips Hold this position for a couple of seconds Slowly lower your knee back to the initial position Repeat these steps on the opposite side

Lie on your side with your knees bent and feet stacked on top of each other Keeping your feet together, lift your top knee as high as possible without moving your pelvis Kick your top leg forward while keeping it at the height of your lifted knee Bring your leg back to its initial position and close your clam Repeat the movement on the other side

Lie on your side with your hips and knees bent 45 degrees Keep your feet in contact with each other as you lift your upper knee as high as you can without moving your pelvis While keeping the upper knee constant, extend your leg, kicking forward Then return the raised leg to the starting position Repeat on the other side

name_en: Side Lying Diagonal Backward Leg Raise
description_en: Lie on your right side with your right arm straight and under your head Extend your left leg diagonally backwards until it's completely straight Raise your leg upwards while maintaining the diagonal angle Lower your leg slowly back to the starting position Repeat the exercise on your left side

Lie down on one side with your legs extended and your lower arm placed straight under your head. Your upper hand should be placed in front of your chest, on the floor. Extend your upper arm straight overhead and hold for 30-60 seconds.

name_en: Side Lying Heel and Knee Taps
description_en: Lie on your side on the floor, with your legs extended straight out Bend your top leg at the knee. Keep your back and bottom leg straight Tap your heel to the floor in front of your body then tap your knee to the floor behind your body Repeat this move for the desired number of reps Switch sides and repeat

name_en: Side Lying Heel and Knee Taps
description_en: Start by lying on your side, with your upper body supported on your elbow and your legs straight out. Bend your top leg and tap your heel in front of your bottom foot, then tap your knee behind your bottom foot. Complete the desired number of repetitions and then switch to the other side. Keep your core tight and your hips stacked to maximize the workout. Continue alternating until you complete your desired amount of sets.

Start by laying on one side with your lower arm bent and head resting on your hand. Lift top leg straight up, keeping your toes pointed forwards. Reach your top hand to the lifted leg's ankle or as far as comfortable. Lower top leg and repeat on the same side for a set of reps. Switch sides and repeat the exercise.

Lie down on your side with your legs stacked on top of each other Slowly lift your lower leg upward as far as you can Pause at the top for a couple of seconds Slowly lower your raised leg back to the starting position Turn around to your other side and repeat the movement with your other leg

Lie down on your right side, keeping your body aligned Rest your right arm under your head and extend your right leg straight Bend your left leg at the knee and move it towards your chest Raise your right leg slightly off the ground Hold the position for a few seconds and then lower your leg

Lie on your right side with your right leg extended and your left leg placed on top of the right Lift your right leg a few inches off the ground whilst keeping it straight Hold this position for a couple of seconds, then slowly lower Repeat this on your left side

Lie on your side with the leg on top bent at the knee Plant the foot that's on top in front of the knee of the bottom leg Lift the bottom leg straight upwards as high as you can comfortably manage Lower the bottom leg with control

Lie down on one side with the legs extended and stacked on top of each other. Rest your head on your lower arm, and use your top arm to steady your balance. Lift your top leg to about hip height and perform circular motions in one direction. After a set of repetitions, change the direction of the circles. Switch to your opposite side and repeat.

Lie down on your side with your upper arm lying on your side and your forearm across your belly Lift your forearm upwards while keeping your shoulders and upper arm fixed Hold for a moment at the top Slowly lower your forearm back to the starting position Repeat the exercise on the other side

Lie on your side with your legs stacked on top of each other. Bend your bottom leg for support and keep your top leg straight. Lift your top leg up to the ceiling and then lower it back down in a controlled manner. Repeat for a set amount of reps before switching sides. For added challenge, try to hold the leg at the peak of the lift for a couple of seconds before lowering.

Lie on your side with your legs straight out in line with your body Raise your top leg up to about hip height and make a small forward circle, back to the horizontal level. Next, make a backward circle the same way, back to the horizontal level. This completes one rep. Do this for your desired amount of reps then switch sides

Lie down on your side with your legs stretched out straight. Raise your top leg about 6 inches off the ground. Slowly circle your leg in one direction. After 10-15 circles, change directions. Switch sides and repeat the movement with the other leg.

Lie down on your right side with your back straight and legs extended. Support your head on your right hand and place your other hand on your waist. Raise your upper leg straight in the air to your maximum range. Hold for a while, return to the starting position, and repeat.

Lie down on your side. Flex the lower leg for stability. Slowly lift the upper leg towards the ceiling, keeping the knee straight. Lower the leg in a controlled manner. Switch sides and repeat the process with other leg.

Lie on your side with your arm extended for support Keep your legs straight, lift your top leg as high as you can and lower it down Switch to your other side and repeat with the other leg Keep your core engaged and hips steady throughout the move For more difficulty, add a resistance band around your thighs

Lie on your side with your legs straight, one on top of the other Slowly lift your top leg as high as it will go Lower it back down in a controlled manner Repeat on the other side Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise

Lie on your side with your legs together and your knees bent at a 90 degree angle Place your free hand behind your head Crunch to the side as if you were trying to bring your side towards your hip Return to the starting position and repeat this process Switch sides and repeat the exercise

Lie on your side with your bottom arm extended along your body for support Bend your top leg and place your foot on the ground behind your bottom leg Raise your bottom leg off the ground and then lower it back down Perform this motion repeatedly, keeping contraction in your thigh muscle Switch sides and repeat the exercise with the opposite leg

name_en: Side Lying Single Arm Triceps Push-up
description_en: Lie on your side with your lower arm hugging your body Place your top hand on the ground, near your waist Press your palm into the ground to raise your upper body Lower your body back down in a controlled motion Repeat the motion for your desired number of reps, then switch sides

Lie on your side with your bottom leg extended and top leg bent Place your lower hand on your hip while your other hand supports your head Raise your extended leg as high as you can Lower the extended leg back down in a controlled manner Repeat on the other side

Lie on one side with your legs stacked and fully extended Slowly raise your top leg upwards keeping it straight Hold the position for a moment, then slowly lower your leg back Repeat on the other side

name_en: Side Lying T Thigh Raise Hold
description_en: Lie on one side on a mat or the floor, with one leg extended and the other leg bent with the foot behind the extended leg Lift the top leg up as high as comfortable, keeping your foot flexed Hold the position for a few seconds Slowly lower your leg back to the rest position Repeat the exercise with your other leg after a set is done

Begin in a high plank position with your wrists directly under your shoulders Lift your right foot and bring your right knee to your left elbow Return to starting position and repeat the process with your left knee to your right elbow Keep your body straight and rigid throughout the movement Maintain a steady pace and continue to switch legs
Start in a traditional push-up position. Bring one knee up to your elbow on the same side. Return your foot to the original position. Repeat with the other side. Continue alternating sides.

Sit or stand with a nice, tall posture Slowly tilt your head to the side, trying to touch your ear to your shoulder. Keep your shoulder down Hold this position for around 20-30 seconds Slowly return to the starting position Repeat it for the other side

Lie on your right side with your legs straight and your feet stacked on each other, and place your left hand over your waist Your elbow should be bent and your  forearm should be resting on the floor with palm facing down. Lift your hips off the floor and bear your weight on your elbow and the side of your right foot Maintain this position

Lie on your side with your elbow directly under your shoulder Lift your hips off the ground to bring your body in a straight line Hold this position for as long as you can Slowly lower your hips back to the ground Repeat on the other side

Lie on your right side, with your legs straight. Prop yourself up with your right forearm so your body forms a diagonal line. Rest your left hand on your hip. Tighten your abs and hold for 30 seconds without letting your hips drop. Repeat on the other side for equal time.

Lie on your side with your feet stacked on top of each other Prop up your upper body with your elbow directly under your shoulder Lift your hips off the ground, creating a straight line from shoulder to ankles Hold this position After completing the desired duration, switch to the other side

Start in a side plank position with your elbow directly under your shoulder and your feet stacked. Bend your top leg and lift it as high as you can. Lower your leg back down with control, without letting it touch your bottom leg. Hold for a few seconds, then switch sides and repeat. To increase difficulty, raise and lower your top leg continuously without stopping.

Start by lying on your right side and supporting your body weight on your right forearm and outer right foot Place your left foot on top of your right foot for additional support Lift your hips off the ground forming a straight line with your body Hold this position for a few seconds before slowly lowering yourself back down Switch sides and repeat the exercise

Start in a side plank position, resting on one forearm and the outside edge of one foot Stack your other foot on top of the bottom foot Raise and lower your top leg as high as you can while maintaining your balance Keep your core tight and hips lifted throughout the exercise Switch sides and repeat with the other leg

Lie on your side with your feet touching and your body straight Prop your body up with your lower arm, bent at the elbow With your upper leg, perform a knee lift toward the ceiling Slowly lower the knee back down Perform the designated number of repetitions on one side, then switch to the other

Lie on your side with your body straight and legs stacked Place your weight on your elbow and outer foot, lifting your body to form a triangle with the ground Now lift the top leg and lower it without touching the bottom leg Hold the position for a few seconds Lower your hips back to the ground before repeating on the other side

Start in a side plank position on your right side, right forearm resting on the ground and right foot stacked on top of the left Engage your abs to keep a straight line from your feet to your head With your left hand on your hip, raise your left leg towards the ceiling Hold for a couple seconds and lower it back down without touching the other leg. Repeat on the other side

Begin in a side plank position with your left elbow on the ground, beneath your shoulder Maintain your body in a straight line from head to feet Bring your right knee toward your chest while maintaining the side plank Return your right leg back to its starting position Repeat for desired reps and switch sides

Lie on your left side with your legs straight and stack your feet Prop your body up on your left elbow and forearm Raise your hips until your body form a straight line from your ankles to your head Lift your right leg as high as you can without bending your knee Lower your right leg until your feet are stacked again

Start by positioning yourself into a side plank, resting on one forearm with your body in a straight line In this position, slowly raise your top leg as high as it will go Pause briefly at the top, then lower the leg back down to its starting position Make sure to keep your body in a straight line throughout the movement Switch sides and repeat the process with the other leg

Start in a side plank position, with your body aligned from head to feet Engage your core and lift your top leg as high as you can Hold for a brief pause at the top Slowly lower your leg back to the start position Repeat for the desired repetitions, then switch sides

Position your body sideways against the wall, lean on your elbow that should be under the shoulder Extend your legs and place your feet one on top of the other Lift your body, forming a straight line from head to feet Lower your body without touching the ground Repeat this motion for your desired set of reps

Start in a side plank position on your side, balancing on your forearm and the edge of your bottom foot Keep your body in a straight line with your core engaged Lift your upper leg straight up, keeping your hips steady Lower the leg down in a controlled motion Switch sides and repeat the exercise

Begin by laying on your side with your feet stacked on top of each other. Prop your body up on your forearm, ensuring your elbow is directly below your shoulder. Lift your hips off the ground, creating a straight line from your head to your feet. Hold for the duration of the prescribed time. Switch sides and repeat the exercise.

Lay on your side with your elbow directly under your shoulder Lift your hips off the ground creating a straight line from head to toe Hold the position and pull your waist towards the ceiling Lower your waist back to the starting position without letting your hips touch the floor Switch sides and repeat

Start by lying on your side with your elbow directly under your shoulder and your legs straight out Stack your feet on top of each other Lift your hips off the floor, keeping your body in a straight line Hold this position for 20-60 seconds, keeping your hips raised Slowly lower yourself back to starting position and switch sides

Lie on your side with your forearm parallel to the body under your shoulder Push into the forearm to lift your body off the floor, creating a straight line from the head to the feet Lower your body back to the floor and repeat Switch sides after a set Engage and tighten your core throughout the exercise

Lie on your right side with your right forearm supporting your body, legs stacked and straight Lift your hips to create a straight line from your head to your feet Draw your left knee and elbow together in a crunching motion Lower your left leg and arm back to starting position Repeat and then switch to other side

Start in a high plank position Turn your body to one side and lift one arm Slowly rotate your body while reaching beneath your body with your arm Return to the side plank position Repeat on the other side

name_en: Side Plank Rotation a padded stool Supported
description_en: Start in a side plank position, supporting your weight on one forearm with feet stacked. Rotating your body, reach your free arm under your body. Return to the starting position, pulling your arm back above your body. Repeat the movement for the decided number of reps. Switch sides and repeat with the other arm.

name_en: Side Plank Rotation a padded stool Supported
description_en: Start in a side plank position with your hand directly below your shoulder Keep your body in one straight line from head to feet Engage your core and rotate your body downward, bringing your hand under your body Return to the starting position and complete the desired reps before switching to the other side Keep the movement controlled and deliberate throughout

Start by positioning yourself on your side with your feet on top of each other and prop yourself up on your lower elbow. Lift your hips off the floor so that your body forms a straight line from your ankles to shoulders. Lift your top leg as high as you can without moving your hips. Lower your top leg and then lift your bottom leg. Repeat these movements for your desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.

Start in a side plank position on your right side, balancing on your right hand with your feet stacked Lift your left hand overhead, then slowly lower your body towards the floor Drive your left hip upwards, pulling your left elbow toward your left hip Keep your core tight and hips high during the movement Repeat on the same side for desired reps, then switch the side

Start by getting into a side plank position, with your weight balanced on one forearm and the side of one foot Hold your body up in this position, keeping your body in a straight line Raise the upper leg and bring it towards the chest Return the leg back to the starting position Switch sides and repeat on the other side

Stand next to a wall Lower your body into a side plank position with your forearm on the floor and lean against the wall Keep your body straight and hold this position Repeat the action on the opposite side

Start in a side plank position with your left elbow on the ground and your right arm raised Keep your body straight and balanced on the side of your left foot Slowly lower your right arm and twist your upper body to make your right arm go under your left side Slowly untwist and raise your right arm back to the original position Switch sides and repeat the steps with your right elbow on the ground and your left arm raised

Start in a side plank position resting on one elbow with feet stacked Lift your top leg as high as you can, keeping your body straight and core tight Hold this position for a few seconds Lower your leg back to the starting position Switch sides and repeat

Start on your left side with your feet together and one forearm directly below your shoulder. Raise your hips until your body is in a straight line from head to feet. Raise your right leg towards the ceiling as high as you can. Hold for as long as you can. Switch sides and repeat.

name_en: Side Punch with Opposite Leg Lift
description_en: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hands clenched in fists near your chin Rotate your torso to the right while extending your left arm out as a punch Simultaneously, lift your left leg to the side as high as comfortable Return to the starting position Repeat on the other side with your right arm punch and right leg lift

Stand or sit upright and look straight ahead Slowly turn your head to one side until you feel a stretch Gently tilt your head to your shoulder Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds Repeat on the other side

Lie down on your right side while keeping your back straight and your legs bent. Place your left hand on the floor near your right shoulder. Raise your torso off the floor while shifting weight on your left hand and straightening your arm. Hold for a while, return to the initial position and repeat.

Lie on your left side, your right hand in front of your chest and left hand on your right shoulder Push your upper body up using your right hand till your right arm is fully extended Slowly lower your body back to the starting position Repeat the exercise then switch to your right side, using your left hand for push-ups Perform the required number of reps and sets

Begin in a standing position, feet hip-width apart Raise your arms overhead, palms facing each other Reach towards one side, bending from the waist Return to the center, then reach towards the other side Continue alternating sides

Start in a squat position with your fists up in front of your face Quickly shuffle to your right for three steps, while simultaneously punching forward with your left hand Shuffle to your left for three steps while punching forward with your right hand Continue to shuffle and punch alternatively for your desired duration

Start with your feet hip width apart, bend your knees slightly and get into a half-squat position Hop a few feet to your right while driving your left knee up towards your chest Immediately inverse the motion, hopping to your left and driving your right knee up Continue performing this side shuffle and knee driving movement at a quick pace for several seconds

Start in a standing position, with your feet hip-width apart Begin to shuffle to the right, taking three quick steps to the side At the end of your shuffle, lift your left leg off the ground and out to the side Return the left foot to the ground and shuffle three steps to your left At the end of your shuffle, lift your right leg off the ground and out to the side. This completes one rep

Start by standing straight and positioning your feet hip-width apart Slightly bend your knees, engage your core, and begin shuffling side to side Each time you move to the side, lift the outside leg to the hip level Make the shuffle as quick as possible while maintaining a good form Keep alternating the legs as you shuffle side to side

Start in a standing position and raise your fists to chest level. Do a side shuffle to the right while simultaneously punching upward with your left hand. Return to the starting position and repeat the movement to the left side, now punching upward with your right hand. Keep the movement continuous and rhythmic for the full duration of the exercise.

Stand erect with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and arms hanging loosely by your sides Be ready to move in a side to side motion Start by shuffling to your right for a few steps while keeping your body low Switch your direction swiftly and shuffle to your left While doing the lateral movements, swing your arms alternatively as if you are running

Stand upright and place your feet shoulder-width apart Slightly bend your knees Lean your torso to one side, feeling a stretch in your obliques Slowly return to the upright position Repeat the process on the other side
