Stand upright with your feet together Slowly spread your legs apart until a stretch is felt Lean forward from the waist and reach down towards the floor Maintain this position for a desired duration Slowly return to the starting position

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Take a big step out to your left, squatting down by bending your left knee and pushing your hips back Keep your right leg straight during the motion Push off your left foot to return to the starting position Switch side and repeat the movement

Stand tall with your feet hip width apart Take a big step to the side with your right foot, pushing your hips back Bend your right knee and squat down while keeping your left leg straight Push back up to the starting position Repeat on the other side

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Jump into a squat position, moving to the side While squatted, bring your hands together in front of your chest Explosively jump back to the standing position Repeat the movement on the other side

Start by standing straight with your feet hip width apart Take a step to the side with your right foot, lower into a squat, and touch the ground with your right hand Push up to return to starting position and repeat on the left side Complete this movement as quickly as possible, alternating sides for the duration of the set Remember to keep your back straight and bend at the hips and knees

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Step your right foot out wide and squat down Touch your right foot with your left hand Push through your right foot to rise back up to standing Repeat on the other side

Start in an athletic stance, knees bent, hips back, and chest upright Step to the side with one foot, keeping your knees bent Bring your other foot to meet the first, never stand all the way up, continue this squat stance while traveling to the side Repeat this motion in the opposite direction

Stand upright with feet shoulder width apart, arms fully extended, and palms facing forward Step to one side and simultaneously curl your arms towards your shoulders Hold for a second, then step back to the starting position while lowering your arms Repeat on the other side for a full rep Continue alternating sides for each rep

Stand tall with the feet shoulder width apart Bring both arms paralell to the floor, start moving to the right for about three steps while pulsing your arms up and down Pause for a moment, then return to the left for the same number of steps while continuing to pulse your arms Keep your back straight and core tight throughout the exercise Continue moving side to side for desired duration

Begin in a boxer's stance Roll your hands in a circular motion Move side-to-side while continuously rolling your hands Keep your abs engaged and back straight while doing the exercise Speed up or slow down according to your fitness level

Stand in a ready stance with your fists in front of you, feet shoulder-width apart Shift your weight from side to side As you shift to one side, roll your opposite hand forward Shift back, rolling the other hand. Repeat this alternation movement Increase speed and intensity as you grow comfortable

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hold the EZ Barbell at your chest Step to the side while extending your arms and squeezing your chest Bring your feet back together and return the barbell to your chest Repeat this motion on the opposite side Continue alternating sides for your desired number of repetitions

Start with your feet shoulder-width apart Lift your right foot and step to the right while drawing your hands together in front of your chest Cross your left foot behind your right while extending your arms out to the sides Return to the starting position and repeat on the opposite side Perform this motion continuously for the duration of your workout

Start in a standing position with your feet together Step to the side with your right foot, while lifting your left knee to your right elbow for a crunch Return to the start position and repeat on the other side Continue alternating sides for your desired number of reps Keep the movements controlled and your core engaged throughout

Start in a standing position with your feet hip-width apart Take a large step to your right and lower your body into a deep squat Stand back up in a controlled manner and repeat with a step to your left Continue alternating steps to each side Maintain your posture throughout the exercise and pause with each squat

Start in a standing position with feet hip-width apart Take a large step to the right and lower into a deep squat Push off your right foot to return to the start position Repeat on the left side Continue to alternate between right and left sides

Stand with your feet together and both arms at your sides. Step to the side, simultaneously extending one arm diagonally upward in a punch. Return to start position. Repeat the exercise on the opposite side. Increase the intensity by speeding up the movement or stepping further to each side.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and bring your fists up in front of your chin Step out to the side and punch diagonally across your body with the opposite arm Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side Keep a brisk pace to maintain a cardiovascular workout Engage your core throughout the punch by contracting your abs

Start in a relaxed stance with your feet shoulder width apart and hold your arms straight out to the sides at shoulder height Step to the side keeping your arms out and your body upright Reset to starting position and repeat with the other leg Do the desired number of repetitions Keep going for the recommended duration of the exercise

Begin standing with your feet shoulder-width apart Step out to the side with one foot and bend your knee into a side lunge As you step, extend your arms out to the sides at shoulder height Push off the lunging foot to return to starting position Repeat the action on the opposite side

Start in a regular plank position with your forearms on the ground Keeping your core tight, step out to the side with one foot Bring the foot back to the center and repeat with the other side Ensure your body forms a straight line from the head to the heels Keep your body balanced throughout

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Step out to the right, keeping your left leg straight Bend your right knee and sit back, as though sitting into a chair Push back up, using your right foot to return to starting position Repeat on the other side for a complete set

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Step out to the side with your left foot, lower into a squat, and simultaneously punch forward with your right fist Come back to the starting position and repeat the movement on the right side, this time punching with your left fist Alternate sides for the duration of the exercise Ensure your movements are smooth and controlled at all times

Start with feet hip width apart, hands relaxed to your sides Take a step to the side and as you land, raise your arms out to the side, parallel to the floor After a brief pause, lower your arms and bring your feet back together Repeat the movement on the other side Repeat these steps for your desired amount of repetitions

Stand straight with feet hip width apart, keep your hands by your side Step to your right side, simultaneously lift your arms overhead Lower your arms while stepping back to the center Repeat the step on the left side Continue alternating between right and left

Start by holding your hands overhead shoulder width apart Begin to step laterally When the leading foot touches the ground, perform a squat Return to standing while maintaining your arms overhead Repeat on the other side

Stand straight with feet hip-width apart Step to the side while bending your knees and reach down to touch the ground Push off your outer foot to return to the starting position Repeat on the other side Keep alternating sides for the duration of the exercise

Begin in a boxing stance with your feet apart and hands up Step to your right while keeping your left foot stationary Deliver a straight punch with your left hand as you step Bring your right foot back in, returning to the boxing stance Repeat the movement on the other side

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and bend your knees slightly Extend your arms in front of you parallel to the floor Step to the side and pull your elbows back while pinching your shoulder blades together Return to the starting position and repeat action to the other side Perform the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Stand upright with feet hip width apart Step sideways with one foot while bending the other knee and leaning forward slightly at the waist Extend your arms straight out in front of you Pull your elbows back until they are in line with your body Return to the starting position and repeat with the other side

Start standing with feet hip-width apart Accelerate to one side by pushing off your foot and hopping sideways Land on your other foot, regain balance and then repeat the same hop to the same side After a few repetitions, switch directions and repeat on the other side Keep the repetitions going back and forth

Stand with your feet double hip-width apart Step your right foot to the side and lower your body into a squat position Push off with your right foot to return to the starting position Repeat the move with your left foot Alternate sides for your desired number of sets and reps

name_en: Side Step Squat Pick and Carry
description_en: Start in a squat position with your feet shoulder-width apart Step to the side with one foot and lower your body into a deep squat Stand up and step back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat this movement on the other side Continue alternating sides for the desired number of reps

Start in a standing position, feet shoulder-width apart Bend the knees slightly and swing your arms back to gain momentum Jump to one side and land softly, keeping the knees bent Immediately jump to the other side in a swinging motion Continue swinging and jumping from side to side

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart and arms on your sides Take a step to the right, bend your right knee while keeping your left leg straight, and swing your arms to the right side Push off from your right foot to return to standing position, while swinging your arms back Repeat this movement by stepping to the left side and swinging arms to the left Perform these movements at a rapid pace for a set period of time

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and swing your arms to one side Bend your knees and step to the side you swung your arms to, then swing your arms in the opposite direction Repeat the side step and swing to the opposite side Maintain your pace and balance throughout the routine Carry out as many repetitions as required

Start standing straight with feet together and arms by your side Jump to one side, while swinging your arms over your head to that side Quickly jump to the other side, moving your arms opposite Repeat this rapid side-to-side movement for the desired number of repetitions Keep your core engaged throughout the exercises

Stand straight, on the balls of your feet, and hands on your hips Take a big step to the right with your right foot, keeping your left foot in place Touch the floor lightly with your right tip toes, then push off from the floor and bring yourself back to the start Repeat the same movement to the left side with your left foot Continue these steps at a quick and steady pace

name_en: Side Step Top and Forward Punch
description_en: Start with feet hip-width apart, hands in fists at chest level Step your right foot wide to the right, simultaneously extend your left fist forward Return to initial position Repeat on the opposite side for one full rep Continue to alternate sides for the duration of the exercise

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Step sideward to the right while lifting your arms, elbows bent, in front of your chest Return to the starting position Repeat on the other side Keep alternating the sides

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, arms extended to your sides Make circular swimming movements forward with both arms After a set number of reps, make circular swimming movements backwards Repeat this process for as many reps and sets as you desire

Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart Raise your arms to your sides and horizontally. Bend at your waist and reach your right hand to touch your left foot Rise back to the starting position Repeat the movement with the left hand reaching towards the right foot

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise one knee up towards your chest Slowly move the raised knee to the side of your body and bring it back front Lower the knee back down Repeat on the other side

Start in a standing position, feet hip-width apart and arms hanging by your sides, with one dumbbell in each hand Keep your elbows pinned to your sides, curl one arm to lift the weight to your shoulder As you lower the weight, repeat on the other side, curling the other arm to lift the weight to your shoulder Switch from side to side, maintaining a consistent pace Keep your movements smooth and controlled throughout

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Bend your knees slightly and jump to the right as far as you can Land softly on your right foot and immediately jump to left Continue to alternate between the right and left sides

Stand with your feet slightly apart and hold each end of the exercise rope in each hand. Start to swing the rope over your head and jump over it with both feet as it comes down. On the next swing, jump to the right before the rope hits the ground. Repeat the process, this time jumping to your left. Continue to alternate sides with each swing of the rope.

Start by getting into a plank position, keeping your arms straight, shoulders above your wrists and body in a straight line from head to feet Bending your knees, move them towards your right elbow Push your knees back to the starting position Now bend your knees towards your left elbow Return to the starting position

Stand upright and hold onto a wall or a stationary object for balance Swing one leg to the side while keeping your torso still Swing the leg back across your body Ensure a full, controlled swing to feel a stretch on each side Switch legs and repeat the exercise

Start by standing straight with your hands on hip Lift your right leg and swing it to the side as far as it is comfortable Swing the leg back across your body to the left as far as you can Perform the required number of repetitions and switch legs Repeat with left leg

Stand tall with your feet a little wider than your shoulder-width Bend your knees slightly and fold your arms, making fists in front of your shoulders Turn towards your right by twisting your torso and punch forward by straightening your left arm Return to the initial position and do the same by switching sides

Begin in a standard push-up position Lower your body down towards one hand while keeping your elbow tucked in Push yourself back up and return to the original position Repeat the above step for the opposite hand Continue alternating sides for your set

Stand with feet hip-width apart Step to one side with your right foot and lower your body into a squat, pushing your hips back and down while keeping your chest up. Keep your head forward to help keep balance Push your right foot into the ground to push yourself back to the starting position Repeat on the left side

Start in a standing position with hands down at your sides Step to the right, raising your hands over your head Step back to the middle, lowering your hands down to your sides Step to the left, raising your hands over your head Step back to the middle, lowering your hands down to your sides

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Jump to the right, landing on your right foot with your left leg extended behind your right Jump to the left, landing on your left foot with your right leg extended behind your left Repeat this movement for the desired amount of repetitions or time Try to keep a continuous, fluid motion

Stand straight with your arms extended to the side at shoulder height Lift your right foot and touch it with your left hand, bending at the waist Return to the start position and repeat the movement with your left foot and right hand Alternate sides and perform the exercise for a desired set of repetitions Ensure to maintain balance throughout the exercise

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Begin the exercise by performing a regular squat As you push up, carry out a side-step to the right Perform another squat, then side-step back to the left Repeat this sequence for your desired number of repetitions

Stand with your feet hip-width apart Perform a typical squat lower with your hips back and down When you stand back up, lift one leg out to the side before placing it back on the ground Switch sides and repeat

Start in a standing position with feet hip-width apart Step to the right side, bending your knee and pushing your hips back Lift your left leg and stretch it to the right as high as possible Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side Perform these movements in a swift pattern for a set amount of time or steps

Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart Squat down and maintain this position Take a step to the right with your right foot, keeping your body low and your left foot in place Bring your left foot closer to your right foot, maintaining the squat position Repeat the steps moving to the right, then switch direction and move to the left

Standing tall, rise onto your tiptoes Take a step to your right while maintaining your tip-toe position Continue moving to the right for a specified number of steps Pause and then take steps to your left while still on your tiptoes

Lie on your side and prop your body up on your elbow Keep your body straight aligning your feet and shoulders Raise your hips off the ground creating a straight line from head to feet Hold this position for the desired amount of time Switch sides and repeat

Stand up straight with your feet slightly wider than shoulder width apart Keep your back straight and engage your core Slowly lift your right arm straight up while turning your body to the left Now repeat the process with your left arm while turning your body to the right Keep doing these alternations for the required number of reps

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart and arms by your sides Rotate your body to the right side as far as comfortable Hold the turned position for a second Return to the starting position Repeat on the left side

Stand or sit straight and extend one arm out in front of you Using the other hand, hold onto the fingers of the extended hand Gently press back on the fingers and thumb until you feel a stretch Hold for 15-30 seconds, then switch hands Repeat 3-5 times per hand

Stand tall with your back straight, arms by your sides, and feet shoulder-width apart. Bring one of your hands towards the opposite upper arm. Press your raised hand against your arm by using your other hand to stretch your wrist. Hold the stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Extend one arm in front of you with palm down With the other hand, gently pull the fingers of the outstretched hand downwards Maintain the stretch for 20-30 seconds Release and switch to the other hand Repeat this procedure 2-3 times

Start standing upright with your feet shoulder-width apart Get into a squat position and place your hands on the floor Kick your feet back into a plank position Return your feet to the squatting position Stand up straight from the squatting position without jumping

Stand straight, then lower into a squatting position Place your hands on the ground in front of you and jump your feet back into a plank position Jump your feet back in to resume a squatting position Stand from the squat position Repeat the movements in a fast-paced, fluid motion

name_en: Single arm bench bent over row
description_en: Stand tall near a bench and lean forward over it by placing one of your knees and your hand on it. Hold a dumbbell in your other hand with your arms straight and your palm facing the bench. Pull the dumbbell up by bending your arm and taking your elbow past your back.

Stand tall facing a rowing machine with your back straight, knees bent slightly, and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the cable in your left hand with an overhand grip and a straight arm. Pull the cable towards you by folding your arm, turning your forearm side up, and taking your elbow past your back. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall facing a rowing machine with your back straight, knees bent slightly, and feet shoulder-width apart Hold the cable in your right hand with a straight arm and with an overhand grip Pull the cable towards you by folding your arm, turning your forearm side up, and taking your elbow past your back

name_en: Single Arm Lat Stretch against Wall
description_en: Stand perpendicular to a wall, arms length away Extend the arm closest to the wall to shoulder height and gently press your palm against the wall Slowly rotate your hips and torso away from the wall until a comfortable stretch is felt in the lat Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds Switch sides and repeat

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell with one hand overhead Squat down by pushing your hips back and bending your knees Keep your chest up and your back straight Push through your heels to stand back up Repeat the motion with the other hand holding the dumbbell overhead

name_en: Single Arm Overhead Extension Resistance Band
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and a resistance band under your one foot. Grab the end of the band in your opposite hand with your arm extended overhead with the bent elbow. Stretch the band by straightening your arm overhead.

Sit on a preacher curl machine, press your chest against it and place one of your arms over the platform. Hold the dumbbell with your arm straight and your forearm in the mid position. Raise the dumbbell towards your shoulder by bending your arm. As you reach near the shoulder, return to the initial position and repeat.

Grab the pull-up bar with one hand, palm facing away from you Pull your body up until your chin is over the bar Hold the position for a second Lower your body back down slowly Repeat the set with the other arm

name_en: Single Arm Punch and Side Knee Raise
description_en: Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart. Raise your right arm to shoulder height Punch your right arm straight forward At the same time, raise your left knee up to touch your left elbow Return to the starting position and repeat with left arm and right knee Perform the desired number of repetitions

Begin on your knees with your hand under your shoulder and other hand held behind your back Lower your body to the ground by bending your elbow Push up off the ground until your arm is fully extended Repeat on the other side after completing the set Maintain a straight back throughout the exercise

Start in a traditional push-up position, but with one hand on the ground and the other behind your back Lower your body to the floor, keeping your back straight and your core tightened Push back up to the starting position using your chest and triceps Repeat the movement on one side before switching to the other arm Maintain control and balance throughout each rep

Stand at arm length away from the wall Extend one arm and keep the other at your back Lean forward and push your body off the wall with the extended arm Slowly return to starting position and repeat Switch arms and repeat the same steps

name_en: Single Arm Side Straight Arm Lat Pulldown
description_en: Stand next to the cable machine, feet shoulder width apart Grasp the handle with your arm fully extended Pull the handle down to your side while keeping your arm straight Pause and squeeze your lats at the bottom Slowly return the handle back to the starting position

name_en: Single arm standing low cable row
description_en: Stand tall facing a rowing machine with your back straight, knees bent slightly, and feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the cable in your hand with a straight arm and your forearm facing your body. Pull the cable towards you by folding your arm and taking your elbow past your back.

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Take a step back with your right leg, crossing it behind your left Bend your knees and lower your hips until your left thigh is nearly parallel to the floor Keep your torso upright and your hips and shoulders as square as possible Return to the start position by pushing up through your left heel

Lie flat on your back on a mat with your arms extended straight up towards the ceiling. Bend your knees at a 90 degree angle with your feet raised off the floor. Slowly extend your right leg straight out, while also lowering your left arm above your head. Return to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat the same motion on the opposite side.

Start in a plank position, with your hands under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels Exhale as you lift your hips, drawing them up and back and forming an inverted V shape Keep your feet hip-width apart, and press your heels towards the floor Keep your neck and spine long and straight, and gaze towards your feet Hold the pose for 30 seconds to 1 minute.

Stand tall near a kettlebell with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward, extend one of your arms down, and grab the kettlebell while bending your knees slightly and taking your hips back. Raise the kettlebell while extending your back, straightening your legs, and bringing your chest out. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand upright while keeping your feet hip-width apart Take your right foot in your right hand and pull towards your butt Keep your knees together and push your hips forward Hold the stretch for at least 30 seconds Switch legs and repeat

Stand upright, shift your weight onto one leg and raise the other knee so your thigh is parallel with the floor Clasp your hands together in front of your chest as if holding a boxing stance Punch your clasped hands diagonally across your body to the opposite side of the raised knee Return to the initial position and repeat Switch legs and repeat the motion on the other side

Stand on one leg behind a raised platform or step. Bend at the knee and engage your core, preparing to jump. Explosively jump onto the platform, landing on the same leg. Carefully step back off the platform and repeat. Switch legs and repeat the exercise.

name_en: Single Leg Bodyweight Deadlift with Arm and Leg Extended
description_en: Stand on one foot, extend the opposite leg out behind you, and the same arm out in front of you Lean forward while keeping your back straight and lift the extended leg in a controlled motion Return to starting position in a controlled motion Switch legs and arm after each set Repeat the set for the desired number of reps

Stand on one leg in front of a sturdy box or platform Bend your knee and hip to lower your body into a half-squat Push off your foot to jump onto the box, landing on the same foot Step back off the box to return to the starting position Repeat the exercise with the other leg

Lie on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor Extend one leg Push your hips up, keeping your one leg extended Lower your hips until they're hovering above the floor, and repeat the lifting movement Switch legs and repeat

name_en: Single Leg Bridge with Outstretched Leg
description_en: Lie on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor. Extend your left leg out straight. Push through your right heel to lift your hips off the floor, keeping your left leg extended. Hold for a few seconds and then lower your hips back down. Aim to do this move without allowing your left foot or your hips to touch the ground.

name_en: Single Leg Bridge with Outstretched Leg
description_en: Lie on your back with one knee bent, foot flat on the floor, and the other leg extended straight up Push through the heel of your bent leg to lift your hips off the floor Keep your outstretched leg in line with your torso Lower your hips back to the floor in a controlled motion Switch legs and repeat

name_en: Single Leg Calf Raise Leg Press Machine
description_en: Get on a leg press machine with a straight back, one leg extended with its toes against the platform, and the other knee bent with its foot on the floor. Push the platform up with your toes. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

name_en: Single Leg Calf Raise Off Step
description_en: Stand on one leg on the edge of a step Lower your heel below the plane of the step Raise on the ball of your foot as high as possible Switch legs and repeat

Stand arm's length away from a wall or a sturdy piece of furniture Extend one leg backward while keeping it straight and pressing the heel into the floor Bend the opposite leg in front, leaning into the wall Hold this position for 20-30 seconds, feeling a stretch in the calf of the extended leg Switch legs and repeat

Stand tall with your feet hip-distance apart. Lift one foot off the ground, keeping a slight flex in the knee of your standing leg. Bend your upper body forward while extending your lifted leg behind you until both are parallel to the floor. Push your hips forward and return to the starting position. Repeat and then switch to the other leg.

name_en: Single Leg Deadlift with Knee Lift
description_en: Stand tall and shift your weight onto one leg Slowly bend at the waist and extending your free leg behind you Lower your torso until it's parallel to the ground, keep your planted leg slightly bent Rise back up, driving your knee forward so it lifts to hip height in front of you Repeat and switch legs

name_en: Single Leg Deadlift with Knee Lift
description_en: Stand tall with hands on your hips Shift your weight to one leg and slightly bend that knee Lower your torso forward while lifting your opposite leg backwards until you're nearly parallel to the ground Pause for a moment, then bring your torso and lifted leg back to start Repeat this motion, this time bringing your knee to your chest

Begin in a seated position on the floor with your hands positioned behind you, fingers pointing towards your feet Extend one leg straight out in front of you while keeping the other bent with foot flat on the floor Press down into your hands and lift your hips off the ground, keeping your extended leg level with your hips Lower your hips back down towards the ground in a controlled manner Repeat on the other leg

Place your lower back on the stability ball and plant your feet hip-width apart on the floor Lift one foot off the floor, and extend it in front of you Raise and lower your hips by squeezing your glutes Maintain your balance by keeping your core tight and your gaze forward

Lie on your back on the floor, legs straight and together. Raise one leg off the floor, keeping it straight. Put your hands on the sides of your head. Crunch your body forward and lift your shoulder blades off the floor. At the same time, raise your lifted leg towards your torso. Lower your body back to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat the movement with the other leg.

name_en: Single Leg Glute Bridge with External Rotation
description_en: Lie flat on your back with one knee bent and one leg lifted and externally rotated Engage your core, lift your hips and squeeze your glutes at the top Slowly lower your hips back to the starting position Repeat on the other side Perform the required number of repetitions

name_en: Single Leg Glute Bridge with Knee to Chest
description_en: Begin in a lying position on your back, with one knee bent and foot flat on the floor, and the other leg extending straight up in the air Pushing through the foot on the floor, lift your hips off the ground until your body forms a straight line from shoulder to knee At the top of the bridge, perform a knee to chest movement with the extended leg Slowly lower your hips back to the starting position, keeping the leg extended Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch legs

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and extend one leg out in front of you Lower your body until your rear knee almost touches the floor and your front thigh is parallel to the floor As you descend, reach forward with your opposite arm to touch your extended heel Push back up to the starting position Repeat on the other leg

Stand on one leg, bending the other behind you Bend at the knee and hip as you lower your body down, reaching back with your free hand to touch your heel Push through the heel of your standing leg to stand up again Repeat the movement with the same leg for the desired repetitions before switching to the other leg Continue alternating between legs

Start in a seated position on the ground with a bench behind you. Bend one knee and place the foot flat on the ground while the other leg is extended straight out in front of you Lean back onto the edge of the bench so that your shoulder blades are on the edge of the bench Push through the heel of the bent leg and lift your butt and the extended leg off the ground while keeping your back in line with your extended leg Lower your butt and your extended leg back to the ground in a controlled fashion

Place one foot flat on the ground, while extending the other straight out in front of you Lower your hip to the ground Push off your grounded foot to raise your hip, while jumping off the ground Land softly on your foot and lower your hip to start another repetition Switch your leg after completing the set

name_en: Single Leg Incline 45 Degree Leg Press Machine
description_en: Get on a leg press machine with your back straight, knees bent, and place one foot against the platform and the other on the floor. Push the platform up by extending your leg. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand on one foot, keeping your opposite foot off the ground Hop laterally on your standing foot Land softly on the hopping foot, controlling your movements Repeat on the opposite leg after the desired reps Continue to alternate between legs for the set

name_en: Single Leg Lift on a Chair
description_en: Stand straight, facing the chair Lift your left leg and place it on the chair, keeping your right leg straight Bend your right knee slightly, then straighten it to lift your body up Hold then slowly lower your left leg back to the ground, keeping balance Alternate legs and repeat

Stand in front of a low box with one foot on the floor and the other foot hanging off the back of the box Lower yourself down until your thigh of the standing leg is almost parallel to the floor Push through your heel to lift your body back up to the starting position Ensure your knee does not travel past your toes during the squat Repeat set with the other leg

Stand in front of a low bench or box with your weight on one foot Extend the other foot forward for balance Slowly lower your body by bending the knee and hip of your standing leg until you lightly touch the box with your buttocks Pressing through the heel of your standing foot, return to the starting position Repeat the movement with the other leg

Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart Lift one foot off the ground keeping your balance on the other foot Bend your knee and push off with your standing foot to raise your body Land gently on the same foot and repeat before switching to the other leg

Stand tall with your back straight, feet hip-width apart, and hold a dumbbell in your right hand. Lean forward and bring your torso nearly parallel to the floor while extending your left leg backward. Maintain this position for a while and return to the initial position, and repeat.

name_en: Single Leg Romanian Deadlifts Right Cable Resistance Band
description_en: Stand tall with your back straight, feet hip-width apart, and hold a resistance band in your right hand. Lean forward and bring your torso nearly parallel to the floor while extending your right leg backward. Maintain this position for a while and return to the initial position while stretching the band, and repeat.

name_en: Single Leg Sliding Floor Bridge Curl on Towel
description_en: Lie flat on your back, bend one knee and place your foot on the towel Extend your other leg towards the sky Slide your foot on the towel towards your glutes, lift your hips off the ground to form a bridge Hold for a moment and then slowly slide back to starting position Repeat this for the recommended amount of repetitions and then switch legs

name_en: Single Leg Sliding Floor Bridge Curl on Towel
description_en: Lay on your back with your feet flat on the ground and place a towel under one foot Lift your hips and the leg not on the towel off the ground, keeping your foot flexed Using the foot on the towel, drag your heel towards your buttock as your hips continue to lift Press your heel into the towel and extend your leg, lowering your hips back down towards the ground Repeat for the desired number of reps and then switch legs

Stand on one leg with your other knee raised, foot off the ground Bend your standing knee slightly and begin to run in place Use your arms to maintain balance and increase intensity Switch legs after desired running interval Repeat this for the necessary repetitions

Stand upright and raise one leg off the floor Lower your body by bending the knee of your supporting leg Continue to lower yourself until your supporting thigh is as parallel to the floor as possible Pause for a moment, then push your body back up to the starting position Repeat the same process with the other leg

Stand on one leg with your foot flat on the floor Extend your non-standing leg forward Lower your body towards the floor while keeping your back straight Push back up to the starting position and repeat the movement with the other leg

Stand tall and extend your arms in front of you at shoulder height Raise one foot off the floor and extend it forward With the standing leg, bend at the knee and lower yourself as far as comfortable, keeping the other leg extended forward Pause for a moment at the bottom then push up the through the heel back to standing position

Stand on one leg and hold onto a support such as a chair or pole for balance Bend your knee to lower your body as if you were sitting back into a chair, your other leg stretches out in front of you Continue going down until your thigh of your balancing leg is parallel to the ground Return to the starting position in a controlled manner Switch legs and repeat

Stand on one foot, keeping the other foot off the floor Try to maintain your balance as long as possible Repeat the process while alternating between legs For an advanced version, try closing your eyes while balancing Softly bend your knee of the standing leg, ensuring it's not locked

name_en: Single Leg Stand on Bosu Ball
description_en: Stand close to the Bosu Ball, put one foot at the top of the ball Slowly lift your other foot off the ground and try to balance Try to maintain balance for as long as you can Lower your foot and then repeat with the other leg For more intensity, tighten your core as you balance
Lie on your back on a mat Bend your right knee and hold it with your hands Gently pull your knee towards your chest until a stretch is felt Hold for 15-30 seconds Repeat with the other leg

Lie down on your back and bring one knee towards your chest whilst keeping the other leg extended. Hold onto your bent knee and gently pull slightly further towards your chest. Hold this position for a few seconds before returning to the starting position. Now switch legs and repeat the process. Keep alternating legs in a smooth controlled manner.

Stand up straight with your back upright and your feet shoulder-width apart. Shift your weight on one foot. Lower your body by bending at your knee and hip on that leg until your knee is at a 90-degree angle. Push back up to the starting position by straightening your knee and hip. Repeat on the other leg.
Stand on one leg with your foot pointed forward Lower your body into a shallow squat Explode upwards into a high vertical jump Land softly and immediately transition into the next jump

Lie flat on your back and spread your arms and legs apart in a starfish shape Raise one arm and the opposite leg at the same time, while lifting your head and shoulder off the floor Try to touch your foot with your hand, engaging your abs Slowly lower your arm, leg, head and shoulder back to the floor Alternate and repeat with the other arm and leg

name_en: Single Straight Leg Glute Bridge Hold
description_en: Begin by lying flat on your back Bend your right knee to place your right foot flat on the floor Extend your left leg straight out Lift your hips off the ground by pressing your right foot into the floor Keep your left leg extended and hold this position

name_en: Single Straight Leg Glute Bridge Hold
description_en: Lie flat on your back on a mat Bend one knee and keep the foot flat on the mat, while keeping the other leg straight Push your hips up and hold the position as long as you can Slowly lower your hips back down Repeat with the other leg

name_en: Single Straight Leg Glute Bridge Hold
description_en: Lie on your back with your legs extended straight up in the air Push your hips up, creating a straight line from your shoulders to your ankles Hold for the given time Lower yourself back onto the floor Repeat for the desired number of reps

Lie down flat on your back Extend one leg into the air while keeping the other straight on the floor Gently pull the lifted leg towards your body, keeping it straight Hold the stretch for a few seconds Repeat with the other leg

Lie on your back on a comfortable, flat surface Lift one leg straight up while keeping the other flat on the ground Grab the upraised leg above your ankle and gently pull it towards you Hold for 1530 seconds then switch legs Repeat the process for 5 - 10 minutes

Stand straight with your feet shoulder width apart. Lean back, pushing your hips and glutes forward while keeping your body straight. As you lean back, bend your knees to decrease your body's angle to the floor. Try to lower yourself as much as possible without falling. Return to the starting position by pushing hips forward and straightening your knees.

Begin by standing straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Keep your back straight and slowly bend your knees forward, ensuring your backside pushes back and down like you're sitting in a chair Continue lowering until your thighs are parallel to the floor Hold this position for a moment Push yourself back up, straightening your legs to return to the starting position

Stand about two feet away from a wall, facing away Lean back and slide down the wall till your thighs are parallel to the ground Make sure your knees are above your ankles Hold this position for a period of time Slowly slide back up the wall to the standing position

Stand with your back against a wall and your feet shoulder width apart Slide your back down the wall until your thighs are parallel to the ground Keep your back against the wall and hold this position Return to the standing position by pushing off the wall with your legs Repeat the process for your desired amount of sets and repetitions

Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you. Spread your legs apart widely. Bend your knees and pull your feet toward your body. Place the soles of your feet together, and drop your knees out to the sides, forming a 'W' shape with your legs. Hold this position for a while and feel the stretch.

name_en: Sitting Air Bike on a Chair
description_en: Sit on the edge of a chair with your back straight Place your hands on your head or behind your ears Lift your right knee and touch it with your left elbow Now lift your left knee and touch it with your right elbow Continue alternating this movement for your desired rep count

name_en: Sitting Air Bike on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on a padded stool with your hands behind your head Lift your right knee towards your left elbow while twisting your upper body to meet it Return to the initial position Repeat the process with your left knee and right elbow Continue the movement by alternating knees and elbows

name_en: Sitting Air Twisting Crunch on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on a padded stool with your feet lifted off the ground and hands at your ears Rotate your torso to one side and crunch your knees to your chest at the same time Return to the initial position and repeat the motion on the other side Continue to alternate sides for your desired number of repetitions Keep your movements smooth and controlled throughout

name_en: Sitting Air Twisting Crunch on a padded stool
description_en: Sit up straight on a padded stool Cross your arms over your chest While maintaining a straight back, rotate your torso to one side Return to the center, then rotate your torso to the other side Repeat for the desired number of reps

name_en: Sitting Alternate Abduction Twist on a Chair
description_en: Sit on the edge of a chair, legs together and feet flat on the floor. Shift your weight to one side, leaning slightly in that direction and lifting the opposite buttock. Cross your arms over your chest, twist your upper body to the side where the weight is shifted. Return to the center and shift your weight to the other side, continuing to alternate for the prescribed set of reps. Maintain good posture throughout.

name_en: Sitting Alternate Knee to Elbow Twist
description_en: Sit on the floor with your knees bent and your feet flat Lean slightly back without rounding your spine Place your hands behind your head Rotate your torso as you pull your right elbow toward your left knee Return to the center and repeat this on the other side

name_en: Sitting Alternate Knee Tuck on a Chair
description_en: Sit on the edge of a chair, engage your core and lean your torso back Extend one leg fully while pulling the other knee towards you Alternate between your legs in a pedalling motion Try keeping a straight back as you pedal Continue for a desired number of reps or time

name_en: Sitting Alternate Side Leg Lift on a Chair
description_en: Sit upright on the edge of a chair with your feet flat on the floor Slowly raise one leg to the side while keeping your back straight Lower your leg back down in a controlled manner Repeat on the other side Alternate between both legs for the desired number of reps

name_en: Sitting Arms Curl StepOut on a Chair
description_en: Sit on the edge of a chair with your feet planted firmly on the ground With a straight back, extend your arms down beside your body Bend your elbow and lift your forearm to bring your hand towards your shoulder Release your arm down in a slow and controlled way until it's fully extended again Repeat the movement with the other arm

Start by sitting on the floor. Bend over your legs and reach forward with your hands, aiming to touch your toes. Hold the stretch for at least 30 seconds. Return to the starting position. Repeat the stretch 3 to 5 times.

Find a chair and sit at the edge with your legs wide apart Lower your upper body towards your lap Stretch your arms forward while bending Hold for a few seconds and repeat Ensure your back is rounded out during the stretch

Sit on your heels, keeping your knees hip-width apart and your arms at your sides. Take a deep breath as you arch your back, lifting your chest and head up towards the ceiling (Cow Pose). Exhale as you round your spine, tucking your tailbone and the crown of your head down towards the floor (Cat Pose). Repeat this movement with the breath for several rounds. Relax in a neutral position after completing

name_en: Sitting Chest Clap on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on the padded stool, keeping your back straight and feet flat on the floor. Start with your arms out to your sides at about shoulder height. Swiftly bring hands together directly in front of your chest to clap. Quickly return your hands to the starting position. Repeat the motion for desired number of reps

Sit comfortably with your back straight Extend your hands out to the sides With your palms facing forward, push your chest out and pull your shoulder blades together Hold for 10-30 seconds Relax and repeat

Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet on the ground Lean back slightly while tightening your core Rotate your torso from side to side in a controlled manner, keeping your abs engaged Return to the start position after a full rotation Keep repeating for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Sitting Crossed Legged Reach Forward Stretch
description_en: Sit on the floor and cross your legs at the knees Keep your back straight and slowly bow forward Reach forward with your arms extended as far as possible Hold this position for about 20-30 seconds Relax and repeat

Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front of you Bend your right knee and place the sole of your right foot on the inside of your left thigh Reach your left hand towards your right foot, allowing your torso to twist to the right Hold the stretch for a moment, feeling it in your abs and obliques Repeat on the opposite side

Start in a seated position with your legs extended and apart. Extend your arms out to the sides and keep your back straight. Lean to one side, considering your body's limitations, while the opposite arm reaches over your head. Return to the initial position and repeat the motion to the other side. Continue alternating sides for the entire set.

name_en: Sitting Flutter Kick on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on the edge of a padded stool with both feet on the ground Lean back slightly while keeping your back straight Start to lift one leg and then the other in a fluttering 'kicking' motion Maintain this movement for the desired amount of time or reps Rest and repeat for the desired number of sets

name_en: Sitting Flutter Kick on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on the edge of the padded stool and lean back slightly, balancing on your sits bones. Extend your legs out in front, close together and lift them up to hip height. Start alternating lifting one leg higher then the other, as if you're doing a flutter kick in water. Keep your hands on the sides or base of the stool for steadiness. Keep your core tight and continue flutter kicking for a set number of reps.

name_en: Sitting Fly on a padded stool
description_en: Sit upright on a padded stool, with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight Extend your arms out to the sides, parallel to the floor with your palms facing forward Without bending your elbows, bring your arms forward until your hands meet in front of your chest Pause, squeezing your chest muscles Return your arms to the starting position

name_en: Sitting Frog Crunch on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on the padded stool with your feet lifted off the ground Brace your abs and lean back until your torso is at a 45-degree angle Pull your knees in towards your chest while maintaining the torso angle Pause, then extend your legs back out while maintaining the balance Repeat the motion for the given number of repetitions

name_en: Sitting Incline Press Calf Raise on a Chair
description_en: Sit on the edge of a chair with your feet flat on the floor Raise your heels off the ground while keeping the balls of your feet and toes on the surface Hold for a few seconds at the top, then lower your heels back down Repeat the process for multiple repetitions

name_en: Sitting Incline Press StepOut on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on a padded stool with your back straight Extend one leg out to the side on the floor while keeping the other leg on the stool Lean towards the extended leg until you feel a stretch on your side Push back to the upright position using your shoulder and arm strength Switch sides and repeat

name_en: Sitting Incline Press StepOut on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on a padded stool with your feet firmly on the ground Leaning back slightly, press your feet into the ground and lift your body Hold this position for a few seconds Slowly lower yourself back down Repeat for desired number of reps

name_en: Sitting In Out Leg Raise on a padded stool
description_en: Begin seated on a padded stool with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Engage your core and lift your feet off the floor Extend your legs straight out in front of you Bend your knees and return your feet to the floor with control Repeat for the desired number of reps

name_en: Sitting In Out Leg Raise on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on a sturdy, padded stool, support your upper body with your arms and hold onto the edges of the stool Extend your legs and hold them together straight out in front of you Raise your legs as high as you can while keeping them straight Lower your legs to the initial position, without touching the floor

name_en: Sitting In Out Leg Raise with Chair
description_en: Sit towards the edge of the chair, grip the sides for support Raise your legs, knees bent, toward your chest Extend your legs out in front of you Then pull them back towards your chest Lower them back down to the starting position

name_en: Sitting Jack on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on the edge of the padded stool Extend your arms and legs out to the sides Return your arms and legs to the starting position Perform this movement smoothly repeating it for a set amount of time

name_en: Sitting Jack on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on a padded stool with your legs extended in front of you Place your hands at your sides Raise your hands upwards, parallel to the ground Lower your hands back down Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Sitting Jump Rope Knee Tuck on Chair
description_en: Sit on the edge of a sturdy chair with your hands gripping the sides Lean back slightly and engage your core Tuck your knees towards your chest while jumping Extend your legs out and lower them without touching the ground Repeat the movement in a fast and continuous fashion

name_en: Sitting Knee Raise Hold on a chair
description_en: Sit on the edge of a chair Place your hands next to your hips for support Raise your knees towards your chest Hold this position for 15-30 seconds Release and return to starting position

name_en: Sitting Knee Tuck on a padded stool
description_en: Start by sitting on the edge of a padded stool, feet on the floor Lean back slightly and lift your knees towards your chest Hold this position for a second and then return to the original position Repeat this movement for your desired number of repetitions

name_en: Sitting Lateral Raise StepOut on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on a padded stool with your feet flat on the floor and your back straight Slowly raise your arms laterally till they're parallel to the ground Hold this position for one to two seconds Slowly lower your arms back to the starting position Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Sitting Lateral Raise StepOut on a padded stool
description_en: Sit up straight on a padded stool with core engaged Place your hands on your thighs, elbows slightly bent Lift your arms to the sides until they are level with your shoulders Lower your arms back to the starting position Repeat this arm lifting for desired amount of sets or reps

Sit on the floor with your legs crossed in the Lotus Pose Extend your right arm above your head and slowly lean your body to the left Hold this stretch for a few seconds Return to the starting position Repeat this stretch on the other side by extending your left arm and leaning your body to the right

name_en: Sitting Lotus Pose Hip Horizontal Rotation
description_en: Start by sitting in a lotus position with your legs crossed Keep your back straight and your hands resting on your knees Slowly rotate your hips in a circular motion to one side Pause for a moment and then rotate them in the opposite direction Continue switching directions after each rotation

name_en: Sitting Lotus Pose Hip Horizontal Rotation
description_en: Start in a seated position with your legs crossed in a Lotus position Place your hands on your ankles, with your chest lifted up and shoulders down Rotate your hips towards one side, hold the posture for a few seconds Slowly rotate them back to the center Repeat this rotation to the other side, maintaining the posture throughout

name_en: Sitting Lotus Pose Hip Horizontal Rotation
description_en: Sit on the floor with your legs straight out in front of you Bend your knees and draw your heels towards your pelvis, then drop your knees out to each side Cross your shins in the center, and bring each foot underneath the opposite knee Place your hands on your knees, palms facing upwards Maintain this position and rotate your hips gently from side to side

Start by sitting in the Lotus position Keep your back straight and place your right hand on your left knee Twist your waist, shoulders, and neck towards the left Hold the position for a few seconds before releasing and repeating on the other side Continue to alternate between the two sides for several minutes

name_en: Sitting Lotus Pose Twisting Front Back Tap
description_en: Sit on the floor with your legs crossed in Lotus Pose Place your hands on your knees Twist your torso to one side, tapping the floor behind you with one hand Return to the central position, and then twist your torso in the opposite direction, tapping the floor behind you with the other hand Repeat the process for your desired number of reps

name_en: Sitting Lotus Pose Twisting Front Back Tap
description_en: Sit on the floor with your legs crossed in lotus position Place your hands on your knees, palms facing up While keeping your back straight, lightly twist your torso to the left, and then to the right Return to the starting position and repeat

Sit upright on a chair with your feet flat on the floor Lift your right knee towards your chest as high as you can Lower your right foot back to the floor in a controlled manner Repeat the movement with your left knee Alternate between both legs for the duration of the workout

Sit on the edge of the chair keeping your back straight Lift your right knee towards your chest Lower the right leg back to the starting position Repeat the motion with your left leg, alternating legs for the duration of the exercise Try to maintain a brisk pace for a cardiovascular benefit

Find a comfortable chair and sit straight up With your right hand, reach over your head and touch your left ear Gently pull your head to the right Hold this position for 20-30 seconds Repeat this process on the opposite side for a balanced workout

Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat Keep your back straight Touch your left hand to your right foot and your right hand to your left foot in a cross body pattern Repeat this motion alternating sides

name_en: Sitting Opposite Touch on a Chair
description_en: Sit on the edge of a sturdy chair with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Extend your arms out in front of you at shoulder height. Twist your torso to the right and attempt to touch your left hand to your right toe. Return to the starting position Repeat the same movement on the other side, this time reaching your right hand towards your left toe.

name_en: Sitting Pelvis Imbalance Twist on a chair Hold
description_en: Sit upright on a chair with your feet flat on the floor Place your left hand on your right knee Twist your upper body towards the right, using your hand on your knee as leverage Hold this position for a few seconds Repeat on the opposite side

name_en: Sitting Punch Knee Tap on a padded stool
description_en: Start by sitting on a padded stool with back erect and feet slightly wider than shoulder width apart Next, raise one knee towards your chest and tap it with the opposite fist Alternate your knees and fists in a quick, one-two rhythm Continue the cycle with individuals reps for each knee Perform at least 15-20 reps each session

name_en: Sitting Punch Knee Tap on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on the edge of a padded stool with your feet flat on the ground Punch forward with one arm while raising the opposite knee to tap your elbow Lower your knee while retracting your punching arm Repeat with the opposite arm and leg Continue alternating sides for the duration of the exercise

name_en: Sitting Punch on a padded stool
description_en: Sit upright on a padded stool with your feet grounded Tense your abdominal muscles and keep your back straight Reach one arm straight out in front of you, mimicing a punching action Return your arm to its starting position in a controlled manner Alternate arms and repeat

name_en: Sitting Punch on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on a padded stool with your back straight Clasp your hands together in front of your chest Extend your arms fully forward, as if punching Bring your hands back in front of your chest Repeat this movement for your desired rep count

name_en: Sitting Russian Twist on a Chair
description_en: Sit on a chair, keep your feet flat on the ground Lean back slightly, keeping your back straight Place your hands across your chest Twist your torso to the right, then to the left, maintaining good posture throughout

Sit upright with a straight spine on a bench or chair Extend your arms forward at shoulder level Keep your arms straight, pull your shoulder blades towards each other Hold the position for a few seconds Relax and return to the starting position

Sit tall in a chair with your back straight and feet flat on the floor Relax your shoulders and keep your chin parallel to the floor Draw your shoulder blades back and down as if you're trying to get them to touch Hold this contraction for a couple of seconds Slowly release and return to starting position
Start by sitting tall with a straight back Pinch your shoulder blades together Hold this position for several seconds Slowly release your shoulder blades Repeat this for several repetitions

Sit up straight with your feet flat on the ground Keep your shoulders relaxed, don't shrug Pinch your shoulder blades together as far as possible Hold for a few seconds Relax your shoulders to return to the starting position

name_en: Sitting Scissors Lift Crunch on a padded stool
description_en: Start by sitting on the edge of the padded stool, place your hands behind you for support. Lean back slightly and lift both legs off the ground. Alternate crossing your legs in a scissors motion. Raise your legs from the hips, not your knees. Repeat the movement for the desired amount of repetitions.

name_en: Sitting Shoulder Press and Hip Abduction on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on a padded stool with your back straight Raise your arms at shoulder level in a bent position Press your arms upwards until they are extended While doing so, move your knees apart performing the hip abduction Lower your arms back down while bringing your knees back together

name_en: Sitting Shoulder Press and Hip Abduction on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on the padded stool with your back straight Raise your arms shoulder width apart, bending at the elbow Press your hands upward, straightening your arms Simultaneously, move your knees apart, engaging your hip muscles Slowly return to your starting position

name_en: Sitting Shoulder Press Toe Touch on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on the stool with your feet flat on the ground Extend your arms upwards, shoulder-width apart Lower your body towards your toes, reaching as far as you can Touch your toes with your fingers, maintaining the position for a short moment Slowly raise your body back to the initial position

name_en: Sitting Shoulder Press Toe Touch on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on a padded stool keeping your back straight Extend one arm directly above your head With the other hand, reach down and touch your toe or as far as you can reach Return to the initial position Switch sides and repeat the same action with the other hand

name_en: Sitting Side Bend Elbow to Floor Tap
description_en: Sit on the floor and spread your legs comfortably apart. Reach your left hand to touch the floor on the right side, bending your torso sideways. Right arm should be raised overhead. Allow your left elbow to tap the floor beside your right knee. Slowly rise back to the initial position. Repeat on the other side for a complete set.

name_en: Sitting Side Bend on a padded stool
description_en: Sit straight on a padded stool with your feet flat on the ground Place your hands on your waist Bend to the side as far as you can without moving your hips Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side Perform equal reps on both sides

Sit on the ground with your legs in front of you slightly bent Place your hands behind your head Lean back at a 45-degree angle Rotate your torso to one side and bring your elbow toward your hip Return to the initial position and rotate to the other side

Sit on the ground with your knees bent, feet flat. Place your hands behind your head, elbows out to the sides. Lean back slightly, maintaining a straight spine. Crunch your upper body to the right, then to the left, keeping your lower body stationary. Repeat the crunching motion alternately on both sides.

name_en: Sitting Side Crunch on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on a padded stool with your feet firmly planted on the ground Place your hands behind your head, keeping your elbows wide Lean to one side, trying to touch your elbow to your hip Pause, then return to the starting position Repeat the same movement on the other side

name_en: Sitting Side Crunch on a padded stool
description_en: Sit straight on a padded stool with your feet flat on the floor. Tilt your torso slightly to one side, then contract your side abdominal muscles to crunch your rib cage toward your hip on the same side. Slowly return to the initial position and switch sides to perform the repeat. Continue alternating sides for your recommended number of repetitions. Keep the movements slow and controlled, focusing on the contraction of the abdominal muscles.

Sit up straight in a comfortable and stable chair. Gently tilt your head to your right shoulder Hold this position for 15-30 seconds Slowly raise your head back to the upright position Repeat the exercise on your left side

Sit down with your feet extended in front of you Keep your back straight and bend one knee out to the side Reach the arm of the straight leg towards the foot, ensuring to bend at the waist Hold for 15-30 seconds Swap sides and repeat

Sit on the edge of a sturdy chair Place your feet shoulder-width apart Stand up, step to one side and then sit back down Stand up again, step to the other side and sit back down Continue these steps alternating between sides

name_en: Sitting Side Step Row on Chair
description_en: Sit on the edge of a chair with your feet flat on the floor Extend your arms out in front at shoulder-height Lean slightly forward and pull your arms back, bending your elbows Return to the starting position, with hands outstretched at shoulder height Repeat for desired number of reps

name_en: Sitting Side Step Tuck on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on a padded stool, feet firmly placed on the floor Bend your knees and move your torso slightly to the right side and tuck your abdomen in Return to the center and then move slightly to the left side while tucking your abdomen in Repeat this motion for your desired number of reps

name_en: Sitting StepOut Knee Tuck on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on the edge of a padded stool with your feet on the floor Place your hands on the stool at your sides for balance Exhale as you pull both knees up towards your chest as far as comfortable Pause and hold for a moment, then slowly lower your feet back to the floor while inhaling Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Sitting StepOut Knee Tuck on a padded stool
description_en: Sit in an upright position on the stool Bring each of your knees up towards your chest alternately Extend your legs out straight to the sides alternately, simultaneously rotating your torso towards the leg that's moving Return to the starting position Repeat the exercise for desired number of repetitions

name_en: Sitting Swimming Knee Raise on a Chair
description_en: Sit on the edge of the chair with your legs extended Lean slightly back while keeping your back straight Lift your knees towards your chest in a controlled movement Lower your feet back to the ground Repeat this movement for your desired number of repetitions

Sit on the ground with your legs straight in front of you Bend forward at the waist and reach for your toes Pull your toes towards your body until you feel a stretch in your calves Hold the stretch for about 20-30 seconds Repeat this motion 3-5 times

Sit on the floor with your knees straight and feet pointed towards the ceiling Lean forward from your waist and reach towards your toes with your hands Hold for a count of 10 before slowly returning to the starting position Repeat these movements without bouncing or using jerking movements Try to go a little farther each time without straining

name_en: Sitting Twist Knee Raise on a padded stool
description_en: Sit on the edge of the padded stool, balancing on your buttocks Place your hands behind you, fingers pointing in front Bend your knees and raise your legs, keeping your feet together Twist your torso to the left while raising your right knee to your chest Repeat with the right side, twisting to your right while raising your left knee

Sit comfortably on the edge of a chair with your feet planted on the ground Keep your body straight, chin up, and eyes looking forward Start the movement by lifting your right arm in an uppercut motion Bring your hand back to the starting position Repeat the motion alternating between your right and left arm

Sit on the floor with your legs as widely spread as possible Keep your toes and knees pointed upward Slowly lean forward at your waist and extend your hands away from you Hold this stretch for about 30 seconds Slowly come back to the starting position

Sit on the floor, legs fully extended in front of you with your hands placed behind your hips Raise your legs off the floor bending knees slightly Rotate your legs to the right side, bringing your knees as close to the floor as you can without touching Repeat the motion to the left side Continue this side-to-side motion like a windshield wiper

Sit on the ground with your legs extended in front of you and your torso upright Lean back slightly and lift your legs, bending at the knees Rotate your legs to one side, then to the other side, mimicking the motion of a windshield wiper Keep your upper body stable and engage your abs during this movement Perform repetitions, then rest

Lie down on your back and fold your knees while keeping your feet shoulder-width apart on the ground Place your hands behind your head by folding your arms Raise your torso towards your chest by contracting your abdominal muscles Return to the initial position slowly and repeat

Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Place your hands behind your head, without pulling on your neck Tighten your abdominal muscles and lift your body towards your knees Lower yourself back down, returning to your starting position Repeat the exercise

Sit on the stability ball with your feet flat on the floor Lower your body onto the ball so that your lower to mid-back is resting on the ball Cross your arms over your chest Curl your upper body upwards, contracting your abs Lower your body back onto the ball in a controlled motion Repeat desired number of reps

Start by sitting down with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Have your hands at your sides like a boxer ready to punch. Contract your abs and slowly cross your right hand over to the left while pulling your body off the ground. Switch and repeat the exercise with your left hand crossing over to the right. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Lie down on your back and fold your knees while keeping your feet shoulder-width apart on the ground. Place your hands behind your head by folding your arms. Raise your torso towards your knees by contracting your abdominal muscles. Return to the initial position slowly and repeat.

Start in a seated position with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground. Place your hands on the back of your thighs. Use your abdominal muscles to lower yourself down onto your back. Again use your abdominal muscles to lift yourself up to the seated position. Stand up, using your hands for support if needed.

Start in a standing position and lower yourself into a squat Place your hands on the floor and shift your weight back Lower your rear down until it touches the ground and lie back until your back is flat Using your abdominal muscles, bring yourself back up to standing Repeat this motion without relying on arms for support

Start by lying flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Perform a sit-up by lifting your chest towards your knees, while keeping your feet on the ground From the seated position, switch to a high plank position, making sure your hands are underneath your shoulders Hop your feet forward and bring them close to your hands and immediately hop back to the high plank position Return to the starting, lying position and repeat the sequence

Start by lying flat on your back with your knees bent, feet flat on the ground, and your arms crossed over your chest Engage your core and lift your upper body up towards your knees At the peak of the movement, pause and squeeze your abdominals Lower your upper body back down to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat for desired number of reps

Lie down on your back with your legs bent at the knee and your feet on the floor. With your hands behind your head, slowly crunch up, bringing your shoulders off the ground. Hold the chair's legs to stabilize yourself if needed. Slowly lower yourself back down. Repeat this movement for the desired amount of reps.

Start in a standing position and extend your arms fully out to the sides Begin to swing your arms back and forth crossing in front of your chest Keep the movement controlled and continue to swing for the duration of your set Focus on keeping your upper body relaxed as you move your arms Return to your starting position and repeat for the determined amount of reps

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart and slightly bend your knees Begin to gently swing both arms to one side, jumping off that leg and swinging your other leg behind you Land on the opposite foot and begin to swing your arms in the other direction Repeat this pattern, jumping from side to side while swinging your arms Maintain a continuous rhythm

Start in a small squat position and jump sideways to the left, landing on your left leg only. Immediately push off in the opposite direction and jump to the right. Land on your right leg while bringing your left foot slightly off the ground. Continue to alternate sides in a fast but controlled pace. Ensure that your chest stays up and knees are always bent. Make the movement continuous for a set period of time or specified number of reps.

Begin in a small squat position and jump sideways to the right, landing on your right leg. Immediately push off in the opposite direction and land on your left leg. Keep alternating sides for your desired number of repetitions. Maintain a relaxed upper body and ensure your landings are soft and controlled. Use your non-jumping foot to balance when you land.

Start standing with feet hip-width apart Raise your right knee, then jump to the right, letting your left leg swing behind your right Tap your left foot down, then immediately hop to your left Let your right foot swing sound your left foot and tap down Repeat the process, hopping from one foot to the other

Stand straight with your feet slightly apart Move your right foot to the side and slightly behind your left foot, bending your knees and pushing your hips back Push off with your right foot and return to the starting position Repeat the same movement with your left foot Continue alternating between right and left for the duration of your set

Start by standing in front of the Ski Erg with feet hip-width apart Grasp the handles with your palms facing each other Explosively drive your arms down and slightly back, hinging at the hips Return to the starting position in a controlled manner, raising your arms back up

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Jump by pushing your toes and quickly move your wrists as if passing a rope through your feet. Land on your toes, then jump and repeat the sequence.

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Hop from side to side, landing on a slight bend in your knees Quickly jump to the opposite side, like you are skiing down a mountain Repeat this movement for the duration of your set Keep your core engaged throughout

Start in a standing position with feet shoulder-width apart Jump to the right, landing on your right foot and swinging your left foot behind you Immediately jump to the left, landing on your left foot and swinging your right foot behind you Continue to alternate sides rapidly

Start by standing upright, feet hip-width apart Jump to the right, landing on your right foot while swinging your left foot behind your right Quickly jump to the left, landing on your left foot while swinging your right foot behind your left Continue these side-to-side jumps as if you're skiing down the slope
Stand tall with your feet shoulder width apart Reach arms up above your head as if you are reaching for the sky Hold the position for a second and then lower your arms Repeat the motion

Sit on the sled machine and position your feet hip-width apart on the platform Press through your heels to push the weight away from your body until legs are fully extended but not locked Pause for a moment, then slowly lower the weight back to the starting position, allowing your knees to bend until they're just shy of 90 degrees Keep your back and hips against the padding throughout the exercise Repeat for the desired number of reps

Sit down in the sled machine and position your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform. Lower the safety bars holding the weighted platform and press upwards to extend your legs. Slowly lower the platform until your knees create 90 angles. Drive the platform back to the starting position, ensuring not to lock your knees. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions before securing the platform back into place.

Sit on the sled machine and place your feet hip-width apart on the platform in front of you Push the platform away with your heels and straighten your legs without locking your knees Slowly bend your knees and lower the platform towards you Push the platform away to return to the starting position Repeat this movement for your desired number of reps
