Position yourself on the calf press machine with your feet hip-width apart Extend your legs and push the platform away using your calves Hold at the top of the motion and squeeze your calves Slowly lower the weight back to starting position Repeat the motion for the desired number of reps

Adjust sled machine to fit your height and stance, then sit firmly but comfortably. Place feet shoulder-width apart on the sled platform. Push to straighten your legs without locking the knees, using heels not toes. Lower the weight until your legs form a 90-degree angle or as much as you're comfortable. Push the platform up again to the starting position.

name_en: Sled 45 degrees Narrow Stance Leg Press
description_en: Position your feet in the middle of the plate and shoulder-width apart With your legs fully extended (but not locked out), unlock the safety release Lower the weight towards your body by bending your knees while keeping your back flat on the seat Extend your legs to push the weight back up, without locking your knees Repeat for the desired number of reps

Position yourself on the sled machine, foot of one leg in the center of platform Keeping your other leg bent under the seat or at your chest, push the sled until your leg is almost fully extended Pause for a second, then slowly lower back to the initial position Switch leg after desired set is completed

Sit on the machine with one foot on the platform and the other foot relaxed Push the platform away with the foot on the platform until your leg is fully extended Pause for a moment, then bring the platform back towards you Repeat the exercise with your other leg

name_en: Sled 45 degrees Wide Stance Leg Press
description_en: Place your feet on the leg press platform slightly wider than shoulder-width, toes pointed slightly outward Press the platform upwards, extending your legs fully without locking your knees Lower the platform, returning to the initial position in a controlled fashion Repeat the movement for the desired amount of reps Ensure you do not let your knees drift inward during the exercise

Sit on the machine with your back firmly pressed against the pad Place your feet wide apart on the foot panel Press your feet into the panel until your legs are extended but the knees are not locked out Lower the weight back slowly using controlled motion Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Position yourself correctly on the sled machine, making sure one foot is firmly planted on the platform and the other foot is relaxed Push the platform away using primarily your heel by extending your hip and knee Lower the weight by bending your hip and knee until the leg is just short of locking out After a brief pause at the top, return the sled to the starting position Repeat the motion with the other leg

Stand in front of the sled machine, feet hip-width apart, toes on the platform Push up onto your toes, raising your heels as high as possible Slowly lower your heels back down, stretching the calf muscles Push with your toes, emphasize the peak contraction on top of the movement Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Sled Calf Press On Leg Press
description_en: Sit on the sled machine with your back flat against the padding Place your toes and balls of feet on the leg press platform, heels hanging off Push the platform away by extending your ankles as far as possible Return to the initial position by bending your ankles Repeat the motion for desired number of reps

name_en: Sled Calf Press On Leg Press
description_en: Sit on the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform Extend your legs without fully locking your knees Lower the weight by bending your knees until your calves are fully stretched Push the platform back to the starting position, focusing the force on your heels

Stand under the sled machine, with your back against the pad and your feet shoulder-width apart Bend your knees and push your hips back, lowering the platform until your thighs are parallel to the ground Push through your heels, extending your legs and returning to the starting position Repeat the movement for desired repetitions Remember to engage your core throughout the process

Sit on the sled machine with your feet positioned about shoulder width apart Lower the sled by bending your knees and hips until they form a 90 degree angle Push the sled back to the starting position by extending your knees and hips Ensure your back remains flat against the seat during the entire motion Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand in the sled machine, facing forward and position your shoulders under the pads Place your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform Lower your body by bending your knees until your thighs are around a 90-degree angle Extend your legs while ensuring that your feet are flat on the platform Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Place yourself in the sled machine with your back against the pad Place your feet shoulder width apart on the sled platform Bend your knees and lower your body as far as you can without discomfort Push your body back up until your legs are straight but don't lock your knees Repeat the process for the desired number of repetitions

Lie on the sled machine with your feet shoulder width apart Push the weights up by extending your legs fully Slowly lower the sled back to the starting position Make sure you keep your back flat on the sled pad at all times Avoid locking out your knees at the top of the movement

Sit on the machine and position feet about hip-width apart on the sled Press your feet into the sled to raise it up, releasing the safety bar Lower the sled by bending your knees until your thighs form a 90-degree angle Push the sled back up to the starting position Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions

Position yourself at the sled machine and put one foot on the footplate, the other leg behind you Lower your body by bending your standing knee, make sure your back is straight Push with your heel to return to starting position, keeping control of the motion Perform the desired number of reps, then switch legs and repeat

Start by standing in front of a sled machine, with one foot on the platform and the other hanging off Push the sled by extending your knee and hip of your working leg Lower the sled while you maintain balance with the other foot Perform your reps, then switch your legs and repeat Aim for slow and controlled movements throughout

Stand erect facing the sled machine Place your shoulders under the pads and grasp the handles Push yourself upwards to lift the weight Lower yourself down slowly until your thighs are parallel to the ground Push yourself back to the initial position, making sure not to fully lock your knees

Stand with your feet in a wide stance on the sled machine Squat down deeply while keeping your heels on the ground Push back to the starting stance using your glute and quad muscles Maintain your form and don't let your knees extend past your toes Make sure your back stays straight throughout the exercise

name_en: Sliding Floor Bridge Curl on Towel
description_en: Lie on your back with your knees bent, feet flat on the towel Lift your hips off the floor while sliding your feet away from your body Slide your feet back to the start position while lowering your hips back down

Start in a sitting position on a smooth floor with your legs extended in front of you Place your hands on the towel and begin to slide your body backwards, keeping your arms straight and your back upright Continue to slide back until your body is almost flat on the floor Pull in your abs and pull your body back up to the starting position using your back muscles Repeat the exercise for the desired amount of reps

Lay a towel on a smooth, slippery floor surface Start with your body facing upwards, holding the towel tightly over your head Slide your body forward to lift your upper body off the floor, keeping a firm grip on the towel Lower your body back down in a controlled manner Repeat the process

Start in a tabletop position with your knees under your hips and your hands under your shoulders Extend your right arm forward and left leg back, maintaining balance Slide your extended arm and leg away from each other Pull your extended arm and leg back to the initial position Repeat with the other arm and leg

name_en: Sliding Leg Curl on Floor with Towel
description_en: Lie flat on your back with your legs straight and a towel placed under your feet. With your heels on the towel, push down and slide your feet toward your glutes, bending your knees as you pull them up. Keep your hips on the ground as you curl your legs up. Slowly slide your feet away from your body, straightening your legs. Contract your glutes and hips as you pull your feet back up towards your body. Slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position, maintaining control of the movement.

name_en: Sliding Leg Curl on Floor with Towel
description_en: Lie flat on your back and place a towel under your heels Keep your arms to your sides with palms facing down Bend your knees and pull your heels towards your glutes using the towel Extend your legs back out to the start position with control

Start in a slight squat position, with your feet shoulder-width apart With straight arms, reach out to the sides, palms down Turn your arms inward so your palms are facing outwards Raise your arms until they are in line with your shoulders Lower back to the starting position in a controlled manner

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Place your right hand on the back of your head Lean to your left side, bending at the waist Hold the position for 1530 seconds Switch sides and repeat for your left side
Stand upright with feet hip-width apart Lean forward from the hips, not the waist Touch your toes, or reach as far as you can Hold this position for 10 to 30 seconds Then return to starting position

Start in a running stance with one foot in front of the other Launch into a sprint, driving your knee up and swinging opposing arms Land softly on your back foot and immediately transition into the next rep by switching leg positions Repeat this cycle in slow motion, emphasizing on the raise and landing

Stand upright and position yourself under the Smith Machine bar, bar resting on your shoulders Keep your chest up, back straight, and shrug your shoulders upwards Hold for a few seconds at the top, contracting your upper traps Lower the shoulders back down in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand upright and hold the smith machine bar behind your back at arm's length Lift your shoulders up in a shrug Hold this position for a second Lower the bar back down slowly Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand with your back to the smith machine and position the bar at neck height Hold the bar with your palms facing forward Press the bar straight up until your arms are fully extended Return the bar back to the initial position in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise for the recommended amount of repetitions

Lie on your back on the bench, positioning yourself under the Smith machine's bar Lower the bar slowly towards your middle chest Press the bar up and back towards the starting position without locking your elbows Repeat this for several reps

Lie on the bench underneath the Smith machine bar, aligning your chest with it Unrack the bar, fully extend your arms Lower the bar to your chest in a controlled manner Press the bar back up until your arms are fully extended Repeat the process for your desired number of repetitions

Position yourself under the smith machine's bar with it resting on your shoulders Bend your knees slightly and keep your back straight Lower your upper body by hinging at the hips until parallel to the floor Pause for a brief moment, then push your hips forward to return to the start position Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Position the bar at waist height and stand facing the Smith machine Bend at your hips and knees, keeping your back straight Grab the bar with a shoulder-width grip Row the bar to your belly button, while keeping your torso stationary Slowly lower the bar back down to the starting position

Position yourself face down on the Smith machine, feet shoulder-width apart Bend slightly at your knees and hinge at the hip Grasp the bar with a pronated grip, hands shoulder-width apart Pull the bar towards your belly button while keeping your shoulders back Slowly lower the bar to the starting position

Stand at the Smith machine with your feet shoulder-width apart Bend over at your waist, keeping your back straight Hold the bar with your palms facing down Pull the bar up to your stomach Slowly lower the bar back down

Stand with your chest up and back straight in front of the Smith machine, feet shoulder-width apart Lower the bar to a position where your hands hang down naturally near your thighs Keeping your elbows close to your torso, curl the bar upwards keeping your palms facing forward until they're close to your shoulders Pause for a moment, then reverse the movement to bring the bar back to the starting position Repeat for desired number of repetitions

Set the bar on the smith machine to about hip level Position the balls of your feet on a weight plate with your heels hanging off Unhook the bar from the rack and bend your hips forward slightly to ensure the tension is on your calves Raise onto your toes as high as possible Return your heels below the level of the weight plate to complete the movement

Place the barbell on your shoulders, just below the neck. Stand with your toes on an elevated surface and your heels hanging off. Raise your heels as high as possible, pulling the weight up with your calves. Pause at the top, then lower your heels below the elevated surface. Repeat the movement for the recommended number of repetitions.

Set the bar on the smith machine to chest level Stand under the bar with your feet shoulder width apart Lower your body by bending at the knees until your thighs are parallel to the floor Push through your heels to return back to the starting position Repeat the process for the desired amount of reps

Position the Smith machine bar across your shoulders Bend at the knees and hips to lower your body as if sitting in a chair Push up, straightening your legs to return to the start Make sure to keep your back straight throughout the exercise

Lie down on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Hold the bar with a narrow grip. Lower the barbell towards your chest in a slow and controlled manner. Press the barbell up until your arms are fully extended. Repeat the move as necessary.

Lay down on a flat bench with your feet firmly on the ground Grip the barbell with your hands positioned closer than shoulder width apart Lower the barbell to your chest in a controlled fashion Press the barbell back up until your arms are fully extended Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Load the Smith machine and stand facing it. Place your left foot on the ground under the bar and your right foot behind and to the left of your left foot Lower your body until your front thigh is almost parallel to the floor Pause, then push yourself back up to the starting position Finish all your reps on that side, then switch legs and repeat

Stand in front of a Smith Machine with your feet shoulder-width apart Bend at your waist and knees to grab the bar Draw your shoulders back, chest up, and thrust hips forward to lift the bar Lower the bar by bending at your waist and knees till the weights touch the floor

Position yourself under the Smith machine bar Stand up straight by extending your hips and knees Lower the bar by bending at the hips and lowering your torso Make sure to keep your back straight Repeat the process

Position yourself under the bar near the middle of the bench with your feet flat on the ground Grip the bar slightly more than shoulder width apart Unrack the bar and lower it towards your chest in a controlled manner Press the bar back in a straight line to return to starting position Repeat the motion until the set is complete

Adjust the bench to a decline angle and position it under the Smith machine Lie on the bench with your feet firmly on the ground Reach up to grip the bar with your hands shoulder-width apart Lower the bar to your chest in a slow and controlled manner Drive the bar back up to the starting position while engaging your chest muscles

Position yourself bent over on your hands and knees in front of the Smith machine Hook one foot under the bar, with your knee bent Push your foot upward against the bar, fully extending your hip and knee Slowly lower your leg back down in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise with the other leg
Position the barbell on your hips Bend your knees and lower your hips Drive through your heels to raise your hips Hold for a moment at the top, squeezing your glutes Slowly lower your hips back down

Position yourself under the bar with it resting on the front of your shoulders, using a clean grip Unrack the bar and position your feet shoulder-width apart Lower yourself into a squat, going as low as comfortable while keeping your chest up and back straight Push through your heels to return to starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand inside the smith machine with the bar resting across your front deltoids Place your feet shoulder width apart Squat down till your thighs are parallel to the floor Push through your heels to return to standing Repeat for desired reps

Stand in front of the Smith machine with feet shoulder-width apart Hold the bar in front of your body, shoulder-width apart in a clean grip Lower your body by bending your knees and hips as if you are sitting on a chair Drive your body up using your quadriceps till you are back to the starting position Avoid locking out your knees at the top position

Stand in the smith machine with the bar across your upper back Slowly lower your body by bending at the knees until your thighs are parallel to the floor Push through your heels to straighten your legs and raise your body back to the starting position Pause briefly at the top, and then repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions Ensure your knees do not move past your toes during the squat motion

Stand in position under a Smith machine with your feet slightly in front of you Lower down into a squat position as you hold onto the bar Drive through your heels to lift yourself back up to a standing position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions Ensure to maintain a straight back during the exercise

Stand in front of the Smith machine with feet shoulder-width apart Lower body to grab the bar with a shoulder-width overhand grip, keep your knees slightly bent Raise the bar by extending the hips and knees to the maximum, keeping your back straight Lower the body by bending the knees and hips Return to the upright position, controlling the weight with your leg muscles

Sit on the bench in the Smith machine, placing the barbell at approximately chest level Grasp the barbell with a shoulder-width grip, palms facing your feet Push the bar straight up until your arms are fully extended Lower the bar slowly towards your chest Push the bar back up to the starting position

Position yourself on the Smith machine with your feet shoulder width apart Leaning forward slightly, keep your arms straight and lift your hips up using your abdominal muscles Lower your body back down in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Position the bar on your hips, using a pad if necessary Bend your knees and position your feet flat on the floor in front of you Push your hips upwards until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees Pause briefly at the top Lower your hips to return to the starting position

Sit on the floor with your back against the barbell that is set in a Smith machine Place your feet flat on the floor, shoulder-width apart Push through your heels to raise your hips towards the ceiling, while keeping your back on the bar Lower your hips back to the starting position in a controlled fashion Repeat for the desired amount of reps

Position yourself on an incline bench with your feet firmly on the ground Lower the bar to your upper chest Do not let the bar touch your chest, but maintain a slight gap Press the bar back up until your arms are straight Lower the bar back down in a controlled manner to the starting position

Sit down on incline bench with the bar positioned above your upper chest area Lower the bar slowly until it's just above your chest Press the bar back up to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps Ensure your movements are smooth and controlled throughout the exercise

Set the bar on a Smith machine to a height that is just below your waist Kneel in front of the machine, and secure the back of your shoulders underneath the bar Push your hips forward and squeeze your glutes at the top of the movement Lower your body by bending at the hips Keep your spine neutral throughout the movement

Position a Smith machine to mid-thigh height and attach an ankle cuff Kneel down and attach the cuff to your ankle Kick your leg back and up, focusing on your glute Lower your leg back down in a slow, controlled manner Repeat the exercise with the other leg

Adjust the Smith machine bar at knee height Stand sideways and step one foot onto the bar Push through your heel to lift your body up Lower your body down by bending your knee and hip Switch sides and repeat with the other leg

Stand sideways to the Smith machine with the bar hovering above your shoulders. Step onto the Smith machine bar, pushing through your heel. Straighten your leg, lifting your body up until your other leg dangles beside the Smith machine. Lower your body back to the start position. Repeat for desired repetitions, then switch sides.

Sit down on the Smith machine with your back against the backrest Place your feet shoulder width apart on the platform Push the platform away from your body by extending your legs Slowly bend your legs and return the platform to the initial position Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Position yourself under the bar with the back of your shoulders against it. Plant your feet firmly on the ground shoulder-width apart. Push up to lift the bar, extending your legs but don't lock your knees. Lower the weight in a controlled manner by bending at the knees, until they form a 90 degree angle. Push back up to the starting position, fully extending the legs.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing slightly outwards, under the Smith machine bar Position the bar across your back a bit lower than your shoulder height Lower your body by bending at the knees and hips, keeping your back straight Push your glutes and heels into the ground as you slowly rise back up to starting position Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Position yourself under the bar, across the back of your shoulders slightly below the neck Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly pointed outwards Lower your body by bending at the hips and knees, keeping your chest up and back straight Pause when your thighs are parallel to the floor Press through your heels to return back to the starting position

Line up with the Smith machine and set the bar to hip height. Grasp the bar with your palms facing forward, shoulder-width apart. Curl the bar by bending your elbows and maintain the position for a moment. Slowly lower the bar until your arms are fully extended again. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold the barbell of the smith machine on your shoulders behind your neck. Extend one of your legs backward on a knee-high platform, and rest your toes on it. Lower your rear knee to the floor while bending your front knee. As your front thigh comes parallel to the floor, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and hold the barbell of the smith machine on your shoulders behind your neck. Place your toes on a 2-3 inches high bar and raise the barbell by lifting your heels off the floor. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Position yourself under a Smith machine with the bar set to upper chest level. Lie back onto an incline bench placed in the middle of the machine. Reach up and take a shoulder-width grip on the bar, arms fully extended. Bend your elbows to lower the bar towards your forehead. Push the bar back up until your arms are fully extended again.

Lie down on a decline bench with your back supported, knees bent, and legs fixed against the roller bars. Hold the barbell of the smith machine over your chest with your palms facing forward and elbows dipped under the bench. Raise the barbell over your chest by straightening your arms. Return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie down on a flat bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Hold the barbell of the smith machine over your chest with your palms facing forward and elbows dipped under the bench. Raise the barbell over your chest by straightening your arms. Return to the initial position, and repeat.

Sit on an incline bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Hold the barbell of the smith machine over your sternum with your palms facing forward and elbows bent. Raise the barbell over your shoulders by straightening your arms. As your arms become straight, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Sit on a stool with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Grab a Smith barbell in front of your chest with your arms folded, palms facing forward, and elbows making a 45-degree angle with your torso. Raise the barbell by extending your arms overhead. Hold momentarily, return back, and repeat.

Set the bar on the smith machine to a height that is around mid-thigh. Grasp the bar with an underhand grip, shoulder width apart. Pull the bar towards your lower chest, keeping your elbows close to your body. Hold for a moment, then extend your arms to return the bar back to starting position. Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions.

name_en: Smith One Leg Floor Calf Raise
description_en: Position yourself under the Smith machine bar with one foot forward and the other leg back. Push up until you're standing on the ball of your foot. Raise your heel as high as possible by pushing off the balls of your foot. Slowly lower your heel back to the floor. Switch legs and repeat.

name_en: Smith One Leg Floor Calf Raise
description_en: Position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides Place toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off Raise one foot of the ground while the other stays placed on the calf block Lower your heel by bending your ankle until your calf is fully stretched Lift your body upward by extending your ankle as high as possible

Stand upright with a Smith machine bar lowered to your shoulders Step backward with one foot and lower your body until the front knee is bent at least 90 degrees Push up to the starting position through your front heel Switch legs and repeat the movement Continue alternating legs for each set

Position the bar on your shoulders, standing with your back to the bar Step forward with one foot, keeping the other one straight Lower your body by bending the knee of your back leg until it nearly touches the ground Push back up and return to the starting position Repeat the exercise for the other leg

Place the barbell of the Smith machine at waist level. Stand underneath the barbell with your heels hanging off a step or block. Lift your body upwards by extending your ankles and raise yourself onto your toes. Hold the position for a second, then lower yourself back down. Repeat the motion for the desired number of repetitions.

Position the bar on the Smith machine at waist level Stand in front of it, facing away, and lift one leg over the bar to position your hips on it Bend forward at the hips until your torso is almost perpendicular to the floor Extend your hips and raise your torso until it forms a straight line with your legs Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Position yourself under the smith machine bar with your knees at a 90 degree angle. Place the balls of your feet on a footplate or a raised surface with your heels hanging off. Raise your heels by pushing off from the balls of your feet. Lower your heels until you feel a stretch in your calves. Repeat the process for the desired number of reps.

Sit on the bench under the Smith machine with the bar adjusted to shoulder level Lift the bar with your shoulders, fully extending your arms Lower the bar back to the starting position in a controlled fashion Keep your back straight and core engaged throughout the exercise Repeat this process as many times as set in repetition

Sit down on the bench of the Smith machine with the bar above your head and your back flat on the pad Lower the bar towards your upper chest while maintaining an upright body posture Press the bar back up until your arms are fully extended Pause at the top, then carefully lower the bar back to the starting position

Stand in the Smith machine with the bar lined up with the middle of your shoulders. Lift the bar off the rack and extend your arms fully upwards. Slowly lower the bar down to your shoulders. Pause briefly, then push the bar back up. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Stand in the Smith machine with feet shoulder width apart Keep back straight and grasp the bar at waist level Shrug shoulders up as high as possible Hold the position for a moment Slowly lower back to the starting position

Stand facing the bar of a Smith machine. The bar should be adjusted to hip level. Grasp the bar with shoulder-width apart hands. Raise your shoulders as high as possible. Hold for a moment then lower your shoulders back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name_en: Smith Single Arm Bent Over Row
description_en: Stand sideways to the Smith machine, planting your feet shoulder-width apart Bend slightly at the knees and hinge at the waist to lean forward, making sure to keep your back straight Grasp the bar with one hand and extend your arm fully Pull the bar up to your waist, bending at the elbow Slowly lower the bar back down to the starting position

Stand straight with the Smith machine barbell right in front of your hips Lift one foot off the floor and keep it there Slowly lower the bar, hinging from your hips, until your torso is parallel to the floor Push your hips forward, and raise your torso back to the starting position Switch legs and repeat the movement

Stand upright with feet shoulder width apart and position yourself in front of the Smith machine bar. Step forward with one foot and lift the other foot off the ground. Lower your body until your back knee is close to touching the ground. Push through your front foot, extending your knee and hip to return to the starting position. Switch your legs and repeat the movement.

Position the bar on your shoulders, not your neck Stand on one foot in front of the machine with your back foot resting on the bar Bend the knee of your front leg to lower your body Push through your front foot to stand up straight

Stand with your body side to the bar of the smith machine, right foot close to the bar Extend your left foot behind you, placing it on the ground or elevated platform Lower your body towards the floor by bending your right knee until it forms a 90-degree angle Push through the heel of your right foot to return to the initial position Repeat the exercise then switch legs

Adjust the bar on the Smith machine to around chest level Stand in front of the bar facing away and split your stance with one foot forward and one foot back Uncouple the bar and slowly lower yourself until your front knee is at a 90 degree angle Push back up to the starting position After completing a set, switch legs and repeat

Stand in the Smith machine with the bar resting across your upper back and shoulders Back off from the rack, positioning your feet at shoulder width with toes pointing slightly out Bend at the knees and hips to lower your body as if sitting down Continue until your thighs are parallel to the floor Return to the starting position by straightening your hips and knees

Position the Smith machine bar on the shoulder level Stand under the bar with feet shoulder-width apart Bend the knees and hips to lower the bar until you touch the bench Extend the knees to raise the bar back to starting position

Place the barbell on your shoulders, not your neck Stand on your tiptoes, lifting your heels as high as possible Hold for a moment, then lower your heels below the platform Repeat the movement for your desired number of repetitions

Position yourself under the Smith machine bar, which should be about chest level With palms facing forward, grab the bar at slightly wider than shoulder width Press the bar upwards until your arms are completely extended Lower the bar back to chest level in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand under the bar with your feet shoulder-width apart Unrack the bar with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart Push the bar up until your arms are fully extended Lower the bar down to your chest

Stand upright in the Smith machine with the bar comfortable on your shoulders  Push the bar upwards until your arms are fully extended Pause for a second at the top Lower the bar to your shoulders' height Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Position yourself in front of the Smith machine, with your feet shoulder-width apart Bend at the hips and grasp the bar Push through your heels to lift the bar, keeping your legs stiff Lower the bar back down by bending at the hips Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand in front of the Smith machine with a wide stance, toes slightly turned out Lower your body as if you were going to sit in a chair, until your thighs are parallel to the ground Push up through your heels to return to the starting position Keep your chest up and back straight throughout the movement Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Position yourself under the Smith machine bar with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes slightly pointing outwards. Lower your body by bending at your knees and hips until your thighs are parallel to the floor, while keeping your chest lifted. Begin the movement by pushing through your heels, extending your legs, hips, and back until you return to the standing position. Pause for a moment at the top, squeezing your glutes, then slowly lower yourself back to the initial position. Repeat this motion without letting the weights touch the ground until you've completed your set.

Position yourself under the bar, with a wide stance Bend your hips and knees, keeping your chest up Grasp the bar with your hands shoulder-width apart Push through your heels and lift your chest to stand Lower the bar by bending at your hips and knees

Stand under the smith machine with your feet wider than shoulder width apart. Lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the ground. Push through your heels to return to the starting position. Repeat the movement for your desired number of repetitions. Ensure to keep your back as straight as possible throughout the movement.

Position yourself standing under the Smith machine, the bar should be set to waist height. Grasp the bar with both hands, slightly wider than shoulder width apart. Pull the bar upwards towards your chin, keeping your elbows above the bar. Hold for a second at the top then slowly lower the bar back to the starting position. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

Stand at the smith machine with feet shoulder width apart Grasp the bar with a wide grip Raise your shoulders up towards your ears Pause briefly at the top Lower your shoulders back down in a controlled motion

Begin by standing with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the barbell in front of you Lower the bar by bending at the hips, keeping the bar close to your legs and back straight Swiftly rise up by extending the hips while simultaneously pulling the bar up to shoulder height Return the weight down in a controlled manner to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Start by standing with legs hip-width apart Bend your knees and transfer your weight to your hands, then tuck your knees into your chest Roll backwards over your shoulders, keeping your knees tucked When your feet touch the ground again, straighten your legs and stand up Repeat the move for your workout regimen

Stand straight with feet shoulder-width apart, holding the dumbbell with both hands in front of you Rotate your torso to the right, raising the dumbbell high above your right shoulder Bring back the dumbbell down to the middle in a controlled fashion Repeat the same with the left side Modify the exercise repetitions depending on your fitness level

Stand tall holding a dumbbell in both hands straight out in front of you Rotate your torso to the right while keeping your arms extended Rotate back to the center and then to the left Return to the center position to complete one rep Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Start lying down on your stomach Place your forearms flat on the ground, shoulder-width apart Lift your body off the ground using your forearms, keeping your legs and feet flat on the ground Hold this position for a few seconds Lower yourself back to the starting position in a controlled manner

Lie down on your stomach Align your forearms on the mat, elbows under the shoulders Lift your chest off the floor while keeping your naval still on the floor Hold this pose for 30 seconds to a minute Lower yourself with your chest touching the floor

Start in a plank position with your arms fully extended Lower your body down into a push-up while simultaneously stepping one foot out to the side Push back up, bringing your foot back to the starting position Repeat on the other side Continue alternating sides for the specified number of reps

Position yourself on all fours, perform push-ups by bending and extending your elbows Move your right hand and the corresponding foot forward while doing the push-up Switch side and do the same with your left hand and foot Keep going alternating between your hands and feet in a crawling motion Make sure your hips and spine stay stable during the movement

Stand tall facing an inclined bench, lean forward on your feet, and press your chest against it. Grab a barbell under the bench with an underhand grip, straight arms, and your hands shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell towards the shoulders by bending your arms. As you reach shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall facing an inclined bench, lean forward on your feet, and press your chest against it. Hold the dumbbells under the bench with an underhand grip, straight arms, and your hands shoulder-width apart. Raise the dumbbells towards the shoulders by bending your arms. As you reach shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall facing an inclined bench, lean forward on your feet, and press your chest against it. Grab an EZ barbell under the bench with an underhand grip, straight arms, and your hands shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell towards the shoulders by bending your arms. As you reach shoulder level, return to the initial position and repeat.

Get into a traditional plank position with your shoulders directly over your hands or elbows Bring one knee forward towards your elbow, mimicking a 'climbing' action Return to the original plank position Repeat the action with the opposite knee for a balanced workout Keep alternating sides for the duration of the set

Start in a plank position, hands directly under shoulders, body in a straight line from head to heels Pull your right knee toward your right elbow Return to the starting position Repeat with the left knee and elbow Continue alternating sides for the duration of the set

Get down on your forearms and toes, and align your body in a straight line from head to toe. Keep your legs straight and place your elbows right under your shoulders Keep your forearms facing each other, and take one of your knees outward and forward, hovering along the floor Return to the initial position and do the same with your other knee and repeat

Start in a traditional pushup position with your hands directly under your shoulders Bring one knee up towards your elbow on the same side, keeping your body stable Return your foot to the starting position Alternate this movement with your other leg Keep a steady pace and maintain balance for specified reps or time

Start in a high plank position with your wrists directly under your shoulders Keep your body straight, brace your core and don't let your lower back sag Bring one knee to the elbow of the same side Return to planking position and repeat with your other knee Alternate sides for the length of the set

Sit on the stability ball with feet planted firmly on the ground Gently roll backward over the ball, allowing your body to stretch Let your arms fall to your sides to facilitate the stretch Hold the position for about 30 seconds Carefully roll back to the starting position

Sit down on the stability ball with your feet flat on the floor Slowly roll your body down the ball letting your back curve around the contour of the ball Stretch your arms out to your sides and let them drop toward the floor to deepen the stretch Hold the position for about 15-30 seconds Slowly lift yourself back up to a sitting position

Stand with your left foot in front of your right foot, with your feet two to three feet apart. Rotate your body to the right, and as you pivot on your left foot, kick back with your right foot. Fully extend your right foot and aim to kick at waist height. Recoil the kick and return to the original stance. Repeat the move on other side.

Start by standing straight with your feet hip-width apart Place your palms on your lower back for support Arch your back gently and slowly lean backward until you feel a stretch Hold for 15-30 seconds Then, slowly return to the starting position

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Slowly bend backwards at your waist, pushing your hips forward Extend as far back as you comfortably can Hold this position for a few seconds Return to your starting position slowly

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Slowly bend forward at the waist, allowing your back to round Reach towards your toes or the floor as far as you can Hold this position for 15-30 seconds Return to starting position and repeat

name_en: Spine Imbalance and Forward Head Posture Hold
description_en: Stand straight with feet shoulder width apart Pull your shoulders back while also pushing your chest out Extend your neck upwards while keeping your head straight Hold this posture for several seconds Relax and repeat the exercise

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Drop your right shoulder towards your right hip, while keeping your hips stable Hold this position for 15-30 seconds, feeling the stretch Repeat the process with your left shoulder and left hip Alternate the sides for designated sets and repetitions
Stand tall and place your hands on your hips Slowly rotate your upper body to the right Return to the center Slowly rotate your upper body to the left Return to the center

Sit on the floor with your legs extended in front and spread wide apart Extend your arms in front of you with your palms facing down Bend forward from your hips, keeping your spine long and your chest open Reach forward as far as you can while keeping your buttocks on the floor Hold the stretch for about 20-30 seconds then return to the starting position

Sit on the floor with your legs spread wide apart Extend your arms out in front of you Slowly bend forward, reaching towards your knees or feet Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds Slowly raise back up, returning to your starting position

Sit on the floor with your legs extended and spread wide apart. Reach your arms forward and bend at the hips. Exhale while trying to extend further forward. Hold for a few seconds, then slowly return to the starting position. Repeat the stretch for desired reps.

Sit on the floor with your legs stretched out in front of you, wider than your hips Raise your arms in front of you up to shoulder height Exhale, rounding your spine and lowering your chest towards your thighs Reach your hands forward towards your toes, hold this position for a few seconds Inhale and slowly roll your spine up to the starting position

Sit down on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you. Extend your arms parallel to the floor while keeping your palms down. Slowly rotate your torso to one side, then return to the center. Repeat the motion on the other side. Continue rotating from side to side for the desired number of reps.

Stand in a fighting stance with your right foot in front Turn your body to the right and lift your left leg Swing your left leg around towards the right, extending it fully Quickly retract your left leg and pivot back to your starting position Repeat with the opposite leg

Stand in front of the box with feet shoulder width apart Dip body by bending the knees and then explode upwards onto the box Land softly on the box absorbing the impact with your legs Jump back down and immediately perform a split jump Repeat the sequence for your desired reps

Begin in a split stance with one foot in front of the other Bend your knees and hop into the air, switching the position of your feet in midair Land softly, lowering into a squat Perform a torso twist from the waist, turning towards your front leg Return to the split stance position for the next rep

Stand upright, with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides. Take a large step to the side and lower your body into the squat as you roll onto the outer edge of your squat foot. Push through your heel to stand back up, drawing your foot back to the starting position. Repeat on the other side. Perform for the desired number of reps.

Start in a high lunge position with your right foot forward and left foot extended back Lower your body, bending the right knee at a 90-degree angle Push up with your right foot to return to the standing position Repeat on the other side switching the position of your feet Continue alternating between right and left foot

Begin with jogging on the spot lightly Extend your right leg forward into a low lunge, keeping your hands at your sides Push off the ground with the right foot, returning to the jogging position Repeat the same movement with the left foot Continue the split sprinter movement, alternating between legs

Stand tall initially with feet hip-width apart Move forward with one foot and lower your body until the forward knee is bent 90 degrees Your rear knee should be just off the floor, hovering Explode up and switch legs mid-air, landing gently in the lunge position Repeat this alternation for the desired reps

Start in a lunge position with one foot in front of the other. Bend your knees and lower your body down until your back knee almost touches the ground. Push back up to the starting position using your front foot and heel. Ensure to keep your core engaged throughout the movement. Switch legs and repeat.

Stand with feet hip-width apart, take a big step forward with one leg while keeping the other leg stationary Lower your body until the front knee is bent at roughly 90 degrees or until your back knee is nearly touching the floor Push back up by straining through the heel of the front foot until the legs are straight Switch legs and repeat Try to keep your balance and maintain an upright upper body throughout the exercise

Stand facing away from a wall with your feet shoulder-width apart Take a step forward with one foot Bend both knees to lower your body towards the floor, keeping your back knee just off the ground and your front knee behind your toes Push through your front heel to return to the start position, keeping your back straight and your core engaged Repeat the movement with the other leg

name_en: Split Squat a padded stool Supported
description_en: Stand facing away from a padded stool, place the top of one foot on the stool Lower your body by bending at the hip and knee until your front thigh is parallel to the ground Pause briefly at the bottom, then push back up to the starting position Perform all repetitions on one side, then switch legs

Stand straight with your hands at your hips Move one foot forward and bend both knees to lower your body The back knee should almost touch the ground Push up through the heel of the forward foot and return to the initial position Switch legs and repeat

Position yourself in a staggered stance with one foot resting on a low box behind you Lower your body until your front thigh is parallel to the ground Push back up to the starting position, keeping your weight on your front foot Ensure your front knee is aligned with your toes during the movement Switch legs and repeat the exercise

Begin in a standing position Gradually increase your speed to a full sprint Maintain the full sprint for your predetermined distance or time Decelerate gradually to a stop Rest, then repeat the sprint

Start in a standing position Quickly accelerate and maintain a high speed Keep arms at 90-degree angles and move them in sync with your legs Land on the balls of your feet Slow down gradually to a stop

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Lift your right knee up towards your chest as you swing your left arm forward Jump off your left foot, making sure to switch your arms as you jump Land back on your left foot and repeat on the opposite side Continue alternating sides for the duration of your workout

Stand tall, with your feet hip-width apart Bend your knees and hips, sitting back and down into a squat Keep your chest and head up and make sure your thighs are parallel to the ground Drive your weight into your heels to push back up to the starting position Repeat this movement for your desired number of repetitions

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Lower your body into a squat position Lift one knee towards your chest, similar to riding a bicycle Return to the squat position and repeat the motion with the other knee Continue the cycling motion while maintaining the squat

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower into a squat position until thighs are parallel to the floor. Maintain this posture, and bounce lightly off your heels five times. Stand back up to the starting position. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

name_en: Squat and Double Knee To Elbow
description_en: Start in a high plank position with your hands under your shoulders Squat down, jumping your feet towards your hands As you rise, drive your left knee towards your right elbow, then repeat with the right knee to the left elbow Jump your feet back to the initial plank position Repeat the process for the required amount of repetitions

Start in a standing position with feet hip-width apart Bend your knees and lower your body as if you were sitting back into a chair Pause when your thighs are parallel to the floor Push your body back up to the starting position and immediately raise one knee towards your chest Alternate the knee raise with each squat

Stand up straight with feet hip-width apart. Lower your body into a deep squat. Rise back up and come onto your tiptoes simultaneously. Drop your heels back down while lowering yourself into the squat again. Perform the movement for a set number of repetitions.

Begin by standing straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Proceed to perform a squat by bending your knees and pushing your hips back Keep going down until your thighs are parallel to the ground Rise back up and push onto your tiptoes lifting your heels Lower your heels back to the ground to complete one rep

Start by standing up straight with feet hip-width apart. Engage your core and descend into a squat by bending your knees and sending your hips back. Once you reach the bottom of the squat, jump upward as powerfully as you can. Land softly and immediately drop back into another squat. Repeat this sequence for your desired number of reps.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and arms at your sides Jump up, while extending your arms overhead in a punching motion Land softly with your knees bent to absorb the impact Immediately squat down and repeat the whole process

Start in a standing position with feet hip-width apart. Bend at the hips and knees to lower as in a squat. Push off the ground and jump up. Upon landing, lower back into the squat position. Jump up again, simultaneously extending your arms above your head in a punching motion.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lower your body into a squat position. As you rise back to a standing position, lift your right leg and kick out to the side. Lower your right foot back to the floor, and repeat the action with your left leg. Continue alternating kicks with each repetition.

Start standing with your feet hip-width apart and raise one foot off the floor Bend your standing leg at the knee, keeping your foot flat on the floor Slowly straighten the standing leg, squeezing your glutes Return your body to the starting position Switch legs and repeat for desired number of reps

Start in a squat position with your feet shoulder-width apart Quickly jump up and spread your feet wide while swinging your arms overhead Immediately jump back into the squat position and repeat Continue this jumping in and out motion for a set amount of time or repetitions Remember to always land softly on your feet, absorbing the impact through your legs

Start in a standing position with your feet hip-width apart Perform a squat by bending your knees and hips and lowering your body as if sitting Push back up to standing and lift one leg out to the side Return the lifted leg to the floor and perform another squat Repeat the sequence, alternating the leg you lift

Start by standing tall with feet hip-width apart Perform a squat by bending the knees and pushing your hips back As you rise back up from the squat, simultaneously lift one leg out to the side Return to the starting position, then perform another squat and lift the other leg Alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Bend your knees and squat down as low as you can, keeping your heels down Place your left hand on the ground and twist your upper body to the right, reaching your right hand to the sky Hold for a moment and then switch sides Repeat the process for your workout set

Stand with feet shoulder-wise apart and facing forward Begin to lower your body towards the stool as if you were going to sit Once your glutes touch the stool, reverse the motion, pushing through your heels and returning to standing position Make sure to keep your chest up and back straight throughout the movement Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Place the Bosu ball flat side down, and carefully step onto it Keep your feet hip-width apart and engage your core Slowly bend your knees to lower into a squat, keeping your chest up Once your thighs are parallel to the ground, press your heels into the bosu ball to return to standing Repeat the movement

Start by standing tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Lower into a squat, pushing your hips back Push through the heels to return to standing As you stand, bring one knee up and twist your torso towards that knee Alternate each side for the desired set of repetitions

Start by standing straight, feet shoulder-width apart Lower your body into a squatting position, placing your hands on the floor Kick your feet back so you are in a push-up position Perform a push-up and then return to the squat position Stand up straight again, returning to the starting position

Start in a squat position, with your feet shoulder-width apart, and your hands on your hips. Bend your knees, lowering your body into a deep squat. Push back up to the starting position, simultaneously lifting one leg off the floor, extending it out to the side. Return the lifted leg to the ground, bringing yourself back to the squatting position. Repeat on the other side.

Stand straight with feet hip-width apart Step out to your side and bend the opposite knee to squat Push the bent leg to return to the original position Switch to the other side and repeat Maintain your movement as if you have a pendulum in the center of your body

Start in a squat position with your feet shoulder-width apart Perform a squat until your thighs are parallel to the floor As you rise up from the squat, shift your weight to one leg Kick out with the other leg to the side as powerfully as you can Return to the starting squat position and repeat with the other side

Begin in a standing position, feet hip-width apart. Perform a single squat, going as low as you can while keeping your back straight. As you come up from the squat, shift your weight to one leg and kick out to the side with the other leg. Lower your leg and return to a standing position. Repeat the exercise, alternating the kicking leg after each squat.

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart Lower into a squat position As you stand up, turn to the side and throw a hook punch with one arm Repeat this motion, alternating sides with each repetition Maintain a focused and controlled rhythm throughout the exercise

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart Lower your body into a squat position and place your hands on the floor in front of you Kick your feet back into a push-up position Quickly return your feet to the squat position Stand up from the squat position

Start in a standing position Bend at the hips and knees to lower into a squat Place hands on the ground and kick feet back into a plank position Return feet to squat position by jumping Return to standing and repeat

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Slowly lower your body into a squat position While at the bottom of the squat, raise your heels off the ground and stand on your toes Hold this position for a few seconds Slowly lower your heels and rise to starting position

Start by standing tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Perform a squat by bending your legs and lowering your body towards the ground Press back up to a standing position Raise one leg off the ground and extend it straight out in front of you Return to the starting position and alternate legs

Start by standing upright with feet shoulder-width apart Engage your core then bend at the knees and hips to lower into a squat From the squat position, explosively jump as high as you can, raising your knees to your chest in mid-air Land softly and immediately lower into a squat to prepare for the next jump Repeat this process for desired amount of repetitions

Start by standing straight, feet shoulder-width apart Bend your knees and lower your body into a squat position Use the strength of your glutes and legs to jump as high as possible, tucking your knees into your chest while you're in the air Land back into the squat position, absorbing the impact with your knees and hips Repeat the motion keeping the exercise fluid
Stand with feet hip-width apart Lower in to a squat position Twist your upper body to one side, then the other Return to upright position Repeat the process

Sit on the stability ball with feet flat on the floor Slowly roll back onto the ball while keeping your feet stable Place your hands behind your head and allow your body to stretch backwards over the ball Pull your upper body forward to perform a crunch, then slowly lower yourself back Repeat this motion for your desired number of reps

Start in a kneeling position and place your forearms on the stability ball Extend your legs behind you, balancing your weight on your toes Keep your head aligned with the spine and hold this posture Make sure your body is in a straight line from head to toe Hold the plank for a few seconds and then return to the starting position

Kneel on the floor and place your hands on a stability ball in front of you Slowly roll the ball forward while keeping your body straight Extend as far as you can without straining your back Hold the position for a second and roll the ball back to the starting position Repeat the move for the recommended amount of reps

Kneel down on the floor and position the stability ball in front of you Place your hands and forearms on the ball Slowly roll forward, keeping your back in neutral alignment, until you feel your abs begin to engage Pause, then roll the ball back toward your knees to return to the start position Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Kneel down and place your hands on a stability ball in front of you While keeping your hips fixed and arms straight, slowly roll the stability ball forward as far as you can and round your back slightly Pause briefly and then pull the ball back towards you, again rounding your back Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Place the stability ball against a wall and lean against it with the ball at your lower back Stand on one leg while extending your other leg in front of you Bend your standing knee and lower your body against the ball Push back up to the starting position Switch legs and repeat

Stand straight with your back facing a stability ball while one foot is on the ground and the other foot on top of the ball Bend your knee of the standing leg, slowly lowering your body while keeping your spine straight Push your hips back, as if you're trying to sit on a chair Push yourself back up to the starting position Repeat the movement with the other leg

Lie on the floor with knees bent and your feet flat on the ground Extend one leg straight upwards and maintain balance Push through your heel and raise your hips off the ground until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knee Hold the pose for a second, then lower your hips back down to the floor Switch legs and repeat

Stand at the bottom of a staircase or a single step Explosively jump up onto the step or the first step of the staircase Land softly and immediately jump back down Try to spend as little time on the ground and the step as possible, making your movements very quick Repeat for your desired amount of reps or time

Stand at the base of a set of stairs Step up onto the first stair with your right foot, then bring up your left foot to the same step Step back down starting with the right foot, then the left Repeat, this time stepping up with left foot first Complete the set alternating starting foot

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Exhale deeply, trying to expel as much air from your lungs as possible Pull your stomach in as much as you can Hold this position for 15-20 seconds Release and breathe normally
Stand up straight and place your hands on your hips Exhale your breath completely Suck in your stomach as much as you can Hold this position as long as you can Repeat for desired amount of sets

Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms out to the sides at shoulder height with your palms facing down Keep your hips straight and rotate your upper body to the right as far as comfortable Hold this stretch for a few seconds, then return to the center Rotate your upper body to the left and hold this stretch for a few seconds

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder width apart Extend your arms straight out to the sides at shoulder height Rotate your upper body to the right as far as comfortable, keeping your hips forward Hold this position for about 10-30 seconds Repeat the exercise on the other side

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms out straight so they are parallel with the ground Twist your torso to the right as far as you can Pause for a moment and then twist your torso back to the left as far as you can Ensure you keep your hips stable during this movement

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms out and place your hands behind your head with your elbows out to the sides Twist your torso to your right side while your lower body remains stationary Return to the center and then twist your torso to your left side Repeat for the required amount of repetitions

Stand upright and take a wide stride stance Keep your one foot stable and bend the opposite knee Lean to the side of the bent knee while keeping the other leg straight Feel a stretch in the inner thigh of your straight leg Hold for 20-30 seconds and repeat for the other side

Stand tall and place your hands behind your head Lift your right knee and lower left elbow to meet in the middle Return to the starting position Repeat with your left knee and right elbow Continue to alternate sides for the duration of your exercise

Stand upright with your hands at your sides Start to march in place while moving your arms in time with the opposite leg Bring your knee as high as possible Alternate legs in a quick but controlled manner Continue the movement for a set amount of time or repetitions

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise your right knee and simultaneously punch forward with your left hand Lower your right knee and pull back your left hand Repeat the same movement with the left knee and right hand Continue to alternate sides, increase speed for a higher intensity

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms straight out to the sides Slowly make small circles with your arms in a clockwise direction After a few seconds, change direction to counter-clockwise Rest and then repeat

Stand straight with feet hip-width apart, place your hands on the waist Lift your right leg back and up while keeping a slight bend in your knee Slowly lower your leg back down Repeat this with your left leg Continue alternating sides

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and slightly bend your knees Extend your arms in front of you, palms together Pull one arm back, as if drawing a bow, while keeping the other arm extended Slowly return your arm to the start position Repeat with the opposite arm

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms to your sides at shoulder height. Slowly circle your arms forward for a given number of repetitions. Pause briefly then repeat the exercise, but circle your arms backward. Repeat the process for your desired set count.

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms straight out to your sides at shoulder-height Rotate your arms in small, quick circles forward Reverse the direction and rotate your arms in small, quick circles backward Continue alternating directions for an allocated time

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms out to your sides at shoulder-height Rotate your upper body to the right as far as comfortably possible Hold for 15-30 seconds Repeat on the other side

Stand upright and keep your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms out to your sides so they are parallel with the floor Twist your waist to the right as far as you can while keeping your lower body still Pause for a moment, feel the stretch in your lower back and then switch to the other side Perform this movement alternately on both sides

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Extend arms out in front of you, hands interlocked Pull your arms back, while squeezing your shoulder blades together Hold this pose for a few seconds Return to the initial position and repeat

Stand straight, holding an EZ barbell behind your glutes with an overhand grip Pull your shoulders blades back and pinch them together as hard as you can Hold this position for two seconds and then relax for a second before squeezing again Remember to exhale during the squeeze and inhale while relaxing Repeat this for your desired number of reps

Stand straight with feet hip-width apart Lift one leg off the ground, keeping it bent at the knee Slowly rotate the ankle of the raised leg in a circular motion Continue for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs

Start by standing on one foot, maintain your balance Slowly lift the other leg to the side, as high as comfortable Hold for a second and then bring it back Do it for a few reps, then switch legs Keep your back and your pelvis still throughout

Stand tall, feet shoulder-width apart and hands on hips Slowly lift one knee to hip height, keeping the opposite leg straight Hold this position for as long as possible, maintaining balance Lower the lifted leg back to the ground slowly Repeat this move with the other leg

Stand tall and lift one foot off the ground, using the counterbalance of your raised foot to stabilize yourself. Rotate your hip joint as much as possible while maintaining your balance, moving your knee in a circular motion. Perform rotations both inward and outward. Keep alternating your legs after a set number of rotations. Continue alternating and maintaining balance for your chosen length of time.

Stand upright with your feet together Grab the top of your right foot behind you Pull your foot towards your buttock, keeping your body straight Hold the stretch for about 20-30 seconds Repeat on the other leg

Stand up straight and hold onto a wall or chair for balance if needed. Bend one knee and bring your heel towards your buttock. Use your hand to grasp your foot and pull it further to increase the stretch. Hold for 15-30 seconds. Repeat with the other leg.

name_en: Standing Balance Side to Front Leg Raise
description_en: Start in a standing position with feet shoulder-width apart Slowly lift your right leg to the side while maintaining balance on your left foot Next, move the lifted leg in front of your body Lower your leg, return to starting position and then repeat for the other side Keep your back straight throughout the entire motion

name_en: Standing Balance Side to Front Leg Raise
description_en: Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise your right leg to the side as high as you can Slowly lower your leg back down and then raise it to your front as high as you can Return your leg back to starting position Repeat the exercise with your left leg

name_en: Standing Balance Single Crossover Pendulum Leg
description_en: Stand on one foot with your other leg relaxed Slowly raise your relaxed leg in front of you and across your body Lower the leg back down in a controlled manner Repeat with the other leg Alternate between the two legs for the duration of your workout

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the barbell Slowly lift the barbell up and over your head until your arms are fully extended Lower the barbell down to the back of your neck Pause for a moment and then lift the barbell back up Repeat the exercise as many times as you'd like

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Interlace your fingers, extend your arms overhead and reach as high as you can While keeping your arms extended, tilt your upper body to one side Return to the center and then tilt your upper body to the other side Repeat this movement for the required number of repetitions

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Raise both your arms above your head Keeping your palms facing each other, stretch upwards as far as you can Lean to one side, aiming to feel a stretch along your side Return to center and then lean to the other side

Start by standing upright with your feet shoulder-width apart Lift your right leg and draw a large 'figure 8' motion with your knee Lower your leg back to the starting position Repeat the movement with your left leg Continue alternating sides for your desired number of repetitions

name_en: Standing Bent Knee Hip Adductor Stretch
description_en: Stand upright with your feet wide apart. Slowly bend one knee and lean over towards your bent leg while keeping your other leg straight. Feel the stretch in the inner thigh of your straight leg. Hold the stretch for about 15-30 seconds. Repeat on the other side.

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Bend your elbows and curl your palms towards your shoulders Lower your arms back down to your sides Lift one leg slightly off the ground to engage your core Repeat this process for the desired number of repetitions

Start by standing with your feet hip-width apart Lift up your right knee and touch it with your left hand Lower your right knee, then lift up your left knee and touch it with your right hand Repeat these motions quickly and continuously Engage your core as you lift your knees

Stand with your feet hip-width apart, slightly bending your knees Extend your arms in front, palms facing each other like you're holding a boat oar Pull your arms back while squeezing your shoulder blades together, emulating a rowing motion Return your arms to the extended position Repeat this movement for your desired number of reps

Stand tall with your arms extending in front of you, shoulder width apart Pull your hands towards your waist as if you're rowing a boat Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement Return to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of repetitions
Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Lean forward and grab your calved by extending your arms. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Start by standing up straight with your feet shoulder width apart. Bend one knee and lift it up towards your glutes. Simultaneously, flex the opposite arm as if you were running. Swap arms and legs. Repeat the exercise switching legs and arms. Maintain a consistent pace.

Stand tall with your back straight, and your feet placed wider than the shoulder-width Turn towards your right and clasp the handle of the cable in your hands in front of your abdomen by bending your arms Pull the cable by rotating your torso to the left Release the cable by turning to the right and repeat

Stand upright and place your feet shoulder-width apart Press down into the balls of both feet to raise your body upward Hold the position for a moment, then lower your body back to the original position Keep your abdominal muscles pulled in so encapsulate the movement in your calves

Stand on the edge of a staircase so that only your forefeet are on the steps and your heels are hanging off the edge Raise your body slowly, pushing down with your toes and flexing your calf muscle Hold your peak position for a moment Slowly lower your body back down until your calf muscle is stretched out Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and a resistance band under your feet. Grab the ends of the band in your hands near your hips and raise yourself by lifting your heels off the floor. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and extend your arms to shoulder height, holding the barbell of the smith machine in front of you. Place your toes on a 2-3 inches high bar and raise yourself by lifting your heels off the floor. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Position yourself near a wall or sturdy chair for balance support Stand straight and slowly raise your heels off the ground until you're standing on your toes Hold the position for a moment Slowly lower your heels back to the ground Repeat this movement for desired number of reps

Stand up straight, keeping your feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms straight out in front of you at shoulder height. Clasp your hands together and gently push them away from your body. Hold this stretch for about 10 to 30 seconds. Relax and then repeat for 2-3 sets.

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Keep your hands together in front of your chest, elbows out In a smooth motion, twist your body to the right as far as you comfortable can, focusing on using your core muscles Hold in this position for a moment and then slowly come back to the original position Repeat the same motion for the left side

Stand straight with feet hip-width apart, hands behind your head Lift your right knee across to your left elbow while you curl down and try to touch it Return to the starting position Repeat the movement with your left knee and right elbow Switch sides for each rep

name_en: Standing Diagonal Reach and Chest Lift
description_en: Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Lift your right arm towards the sky diagonally Simultaneously lift your left leg off the floor, keeping it straight Lower your arm and leg back to the starting position Repeat the movements with your left arm and right leg

Stand upright with feet hip-width apart Stretch your arms out to the sides parallel to the ground Bring your arms in front of you clapping your hands together Return your arms back to the side position Repeat the movement for desired reps

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms out to the sides at shoulder height Move your arms forward so that your palms and elbows meet in front of your chest Reverse the motion, opening your arms wide again Repeat this motion
Stand up with feet shoulder-width apart Extend both arms straight out to your sides at shoulder level Cross your arms in front of your chest Return your arms back to shoulder level Repeat this motion

name_en: Standing Elbows Tucked Open and Close
description_en: Start by standing straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise your arms straight in front of you at shoulder height, elbows slightly bent Slowly spread your arms out to your sides, keeping them at shoulder height Return your arms to the starting position in a controlled manner

Stand up straight with feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms out to the sides Bring your hands to the front of your chest, touching your elbows together if possible Return your arms back to the sides Repeat this move for the desired number of repetitions

Stand on one leg Bend your lifted leg at the knee and cross it over your standing leg, forming a '4' Place your hand on your raised knee and apply light pressure for a deeper stretch Hold the pose for 20-30 seconds Swap legs and repeat

Stand with your feet hip-width apart on a flat surface Slowly rise to your tiptoes, tightening your calves Hold this position for a few seconds Slowly lower your heels back to the floor Repeat this process for several reps

Stand upright holding the EZ barbell at your thighs with an overhand grip. Bend forward at the waist, keeping your back straight and your knees slightly bent. Raise the barbell towards your chest by squeezing your shoulder blades together. Hold this position briefly. Lower the barbell down in controlled manner.

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms out to the sides at shoulder height Swing your arms in front until they touch each other Swing your arms back until they touch behind your back Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Standing Front Leg Lift Cross Toe Touches
