description_en: Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Raise your right leg straight out in front of you while keeping your leg as straight as possible Touch your left hand to your right foot Lower your right leg, then repeat on the left side Continue alternating legs for the desired number of reps or time

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise your arms and hold them in front of you, shoulder height With your right hand, tap your left shoulder. Switch and do the same with your left hand Keep your arms raised throughout the whole set Repeat this for your desired amount of sets

Stand up straight near a wall, placing the balls of both feet on the ground. Lean into the wall with your hands while keeping your heels flat on the ground. Straighten the back leg and push your heel into the ground. Hold for 15-30 seconds then switch legs. Repeat for the recommended number of reps.

Stand up straight with your hands on a wall for support Move one foot back, keeping the leg straight and pressing the heel down Bend the front knee and lean forward, extending the back leg Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds Switch legs and repeat

Stand near a bench a place your right foot over it while bending your leg. Keep your left leg straight and lean forward to grab the toes of your right foot. Shift your weight backward while straightening your right leg. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Keep your spine straight and bend forward from the hips Reach for the ground without bending your knees Hold the stretch for a few seconds Slowly return to the starting position

name_en: Standing Hamstring and Calf Stretch with Starp
description_en: Stand straight, feet hip-width apart, hold one end of the strap in each hand Bend one foot up towards you and loop the strap over the ball of the foot Holding the strap taut, straighten your leg and gently pull the strap towards you Hold this position for 15-20 seconds, then relax Repeat with the other leg

name_en: Standing Hamstring and Calf Stretch with Starp
description_en: Stand up straight and extend one leg in front of you Loop the strap around the foot of your extended leg Hold onto both ends of the strap and gently pull back until you feel a stretch in your calf and hamstring Hold the stretch for about thirty seconds Repeat the process with the other leg

name_en: Standing Hamstring Calf Stretch With Resistance Band
description_en: Stand tall with a resistance band under your right foot. Lean forward while bending your left knee slightly and hold the end of the band in your hands. Stretch the band by pulling your elbows towards the body and taking your toes towards your shin. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Inhale and raise your arms overhead with palms facing inward Exhale and bend forward at the waist, allowing gravity to pull you towards the ground Keep your knees slightly bent and hang your head and neck relaxed Slowly roll back up to standing position

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart, knees slightly bent, arms by your sides. Exhale as you bend forward at the hips, lowering your head toward the floor, while keeping your head, neck and shoulders relaxed. Wrap your arms around backs of your legs and hold anywhere from 45-60 seconds. Breathe deeply and relax as you increase the stretch with each exhale. Slowly roll back up to the standing position

name_en: Standing Hand to Big Toe Yoga Pose Utthita Hasta Padangusthasana
description_en: Start by standing straight, feet together and hands at your sides Bring your right knee toward your chest and hold the outside of your right foot with right hand Slowly straighten your right leg in front of you while maintaining your balance on the left foot Hold this position for up to one minute Repeat the exercise with your left leg

Stand up straight with your feet hip width apart and your toes pointing forward. Slowly raise one leg out to the side as high as you can, keeping your back straight. Hold the position for a second before slowly lowering your leg back down. Do the same with your other leg. Repeat the process for the desired number of sets

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Slowly slide one foot to the side, close to the ground, while keeping your weight on the standing leg Briefly hold at the maximum stretch point Return your foot to the starting position Repeat on the other side

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Place your hands on your hips Move your hips in a circular motion, keeping your upper body still Continue the motion for the desired number of repetitions Switch direction and repeat

Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart Lift one knee up towards your chest Keeping your knee at a 90 angle, rotate your hip to bring your knee out to the side Continue to rotate your hip to extend your leg behind you Lower your leg back down in a controlled manner

Stand up straight, facing forward with a slight bend in your supporting leg Bend your working leg at the knee, lifting it off the ground and extend it behind you Return your leg to the floor in a controlled manner Repeat for a set amount of reps before switching legs Ensure your movements are slow and controlled

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Slowly step forward with your right foot while keeping your left foot in its original position Make sure your right knee is directly over your right ankle Put your hands on your right thigh and press your hips forward until you feel a stretch in your hip areas Hold this position for about 30 seconds, then switch sides and repeat

name_en: Standing Hip Frontal Rotation Arm Bounces
description_en: Stand straight with your legs shoulder-width apart Raise your arms on the sides, at shoulder level Rotate your torso to the right and bounce your arms backward Rotate your torso back to center, and then to the left, bouncing your arms backward Continue these rotations left and right for the duration of your workout

name_en: Standing Hip Frontal Rotation Arm Sways
description_en: Stand straight with feet hip-width apart and arms extended to your sides Start rotating your hips right and left with a little bounce in your knees Swing your arms freely side to side during the movement Maintain your upper body upright during the rotation Continue the rotation for the desired amount of time

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Rotate your hip outwards, raising your leg to the side and pulling it back towards your body Lower your leg and return to the initial position Repeat these steps with the other leg Perform the desired number of repetitions on each side

name_en: Standing Hip Frontal Rotation Side Slide Arm
description_en: Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Slowly slide one foot out to the side while keeping the other foot firm on the ground Simultaneously rotate your hips and stretch your arm on the same side you're sliding towards Return to starting position and repeat on the other side Continue alternately mirroring the movements on both sides

name_en: Standing Hip Frontal Rotation with Shoulders Adduction
description_en: Stand upright, keeping your elbows tucked in by your sides Slowly rotate your hip to the side, keeping your torso straight Rotate your hip back to its original position Adduct your shoulders or draw them towards each other Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

name_en: Standing Hip Horizontal and Saggital Rotation
description_en: Stand upright with feet hip-width apart Rotate your hip to the left and right in a smooth motion Perform the rotation in a sagittal (back and forth) movement Engage your core during each rotation Repeat the rotation for chosen reps

name_en: Standing Hip Saggital Rotation with Hands Overhead
description_en: Stand up straight with feet hip-width apart Raise both arms above your head, reach up and hold Keeping your arms raised, rotate your hips to the right and then to the left, aiming to keep your upper body stable and move just from your waist Continue the movement on each side for the required number of reps Keep your arms straight overhead during the entire exercise

name_en: Standing Hip Saggital Rotation with Shoulders Transverse Flexion
description_en: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your arms extended in front of you at shoulder height Rotate your hip as if making a circular motion while keeping your shoulders flexed at your shoulder line Make sure your core is engaged throughout the movement Alternate the rotation of your hip to the other side after a set Repeat the exercise for your desired amount of sets and reps

Start in a standing position with your feet together and arms by your sides Jump and spread your legs apart while simultaneously raising your arms above your head Jump again to bring your legs back together and lower your arms to the starting position After landing, lift your left knee and twist your upper body to meet it on your right side Repeat the steps alternately between right and left

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Raise your knees to waist level one at a time Lower your knee back to the floor in a controlled manner Repeat this for the other knee Continue alternating knees for the duration of your set

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart holding a bar with an overhand grip at shoulder level while keeping your arms straight. Lean forward a bit, move your hips back and bend your knees slightly. Pull the bar down towards your thighs without folding your arms. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight, arms by your sides, and feet shoulder-width apart. Place your right hand behind your head and crunch your torso towards the left. Hold this position for 30-60 seconds.

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Extend one arm straight over your head Lean your torso to the opposite side to feel a stretch in your latissimus dorsi Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds Return to the starting position and repeat the stretch with the other side

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend one arm above your head, reaching towards the sky Bend your body sideways in the direction opposite to the raised arm Hold the stretch for a while Repeat the process on the other side
Stand up straight with your legs together Bend your knee and lift your right foot towards your glutes Hold the position for a moment Slowly lower your foot back to the ground Repeat on the other side
Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Raise your leg to your waist height and support your foot on an incline bench. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms straight out to your sides at shoulder height Lift your right knee to hip level while maintaining a straight posture Lower your right knee and repeat the motion with your left knee Keep alternating knees while keeping your arms extended

Stand straight with your arms by your sides. Simultaneously lift your knees high and extend your arms overhead. Return to the initial position and then alternate the movement on the other side. Repeat the exercise for the prescribed amount of time. Make sure to engage your core throughout the movement.

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Curl your hands into fists and extend your arms straight out in front of you Bounce each finger off the palm of your hand whilst keeping your arms raised Continue this for a number of repetitions or until fatigue sets in Rest and repeat for desired number of sets

Stand tall with your back straight, and your feet shoulder-width apart Put your hands behind your head by folding your arms Raise one of your knees, and dip your corresponding elbow by crunching your torso towards the raised knee Return to the initial position and do the same with your other knee and elbow

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart. Place your fingers lightly touching your temples, elbows out. Rotate your torso to one side, while keeping your hips facing forward. Rotate your torso towards the opposite side. Repeat for the desired number of reps before switching to the other side.

Stand straight and keep your feet shoulder-length apart. Place your right hand on your hip, and lift your left hand towards the ceiling. Bend at your waist to the right, while sliding your right hand down your side. Push yourself back to the starting position. Repeat the exercise on the other side.

Stand tall with a straight posture Extend your arm straight and place your palm against a wall Keep your arm at shoulder height, and slowly rotate your body away from the wall until you feel a stretch Hold this position for a desired period of time Switch arms and repeat

Stall tall with a wall at your left. Place your arm on the wall while extending it past your back. Twist your torso towards the right side to stretch your chest and arm. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart Extend one arm out to your side at shoulder height Start making small circular motions with your arm Gradually increase the size of the circles After a few seconds, reverse the direction of the circles

Stand with your feet hip-width apart, arms by your sides Lift your right foot off the floor and hold it out in front of you Simultaneously twist your upper body to the right and touch your right foot with your left hand Return to the starting position Repeat on the opposite side

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms forward with your palms down. Raise one of your arms overhead while lowering the opposite arm to your side to put a stretch on your shoulders. Hold for a few seconds and repeat by switching sides.

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Raise your arms straight up Interlock your hands, palms facing upwards Stretch upwards as far as possible while pushing the chest out Hold the stretch for about 10-15 seconds

Stand tall with your arms to your sides and palms facing forward Tighten your biceps and forearms as you lift your hands upward in a slicing motion until they're shoulder height Lower your arms back to your sides in a slow and controlled manner Repeat the movement for your desired amount of repetitions

Stand straight with your hips width apart Place your hands on your hips Slowly tuck your pelvis under by drawing in your abdominal muscles and slightly rounding your lower back Hold at your deepest contraction for a moment Return to a neutral spine position

Stand up straight with your feet together Raise one foot off the floor, balancing on the opposite leg Gently roll the ankle of the raised leg, creating a clockwise and then counter-clockwise motion Aim to make a full circular motion with your ankle Repeat the stretch with the other ankle

Stand upright holding a weight plate in both hands, with arms extended straight up above your head Lower the weight plate by bending your elbows towards your chest Pause for a second and push the plate straight back up until your arms are straight again Repeat the sequence

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the medicine ball with both hands Lower your body into a semi-squat position and lean forward slightly Quickly push upwards with your legs and back while simultaneously throwing the medicine ball over your head Aim to throw the ball as far as you can behind you Retrieve the ball and repeat the movement

Stand upright and balance yourself on your right foot. Bend your left knee and bring your foot up towards your butt. Grasp your left foot with your left hand and pull it towards your butt until you feel a stretch. Hold the stretch for 30 seconds and then switch legs. Repeat the same steps for your right leg.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Fold one of your knees and take your foot towards the hip. Grab the raised foot and press its heel against the hip with your hand. Hold this stretch for 30-60 seconds.

name_en: Standing Reach Down Hamsting Crossed Legs Stretch
description_en: Stand up straight with your feet crossed Inhale, and as you exhale, bend forward from the waist Reach for the toes of your crossed foot Hold the position for about 20-30 seconds Slowly come back up and switch legs

name_en: Standing reach up back rotation stretch
description_en: Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Lift your arms overhead, interlace your fingers and turn your palms upward Lean to the left while looking to the right to get a stretch through your back and chest Hold the stretch for about 30 seconds Repeat the exercise on the other side

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Reach your hands up towards the ceiling, with palms facing inwards Slowly rotate your torso to the right, keeping your arms elevated Hold this position for a few seconds Repeat on the other side

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Cross your arms behind your back and hold onto your left elbow with your right hand Gently pull your left elbow to the right Hold this position for up to 30 seconds, then switch sides Repeat 2-3 times each side

Stand tall with your back straight, arms hanging by your sides, and feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms behind your back and clasp your hands to put a stretch on your shoulders. Maintain this stretch for some seconds, return to the starting position, and repeat.

Stand up straight while holding a barbell placed weight side down Lift the barbell to your chest height, switching the direction of the palms with each repetition Keep your torso as straight as possible while lifting the barbell Lower the barbell slowly back to the starting position Repeat the exercise as per your workout regimen

Start by standing straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Engage your core and lift your hands up to chest height Twist your torso to the right then to the left in a controlled motion Keep your hips stable throughout the exercise Return to starting position
Stand tall and extend your arms out to the sides at shoulder level Turn your thumbs to point backward until you feel a stretch Hold this position for the desired amount of time Relax and then repeat

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Slowly roll your shoulders in a circular motion, keeping your arms straight with a slight bend at the elbow Repeat the process in reverse, rolling the shoulders in the other direction Keep the rest of your body still, focusing on the rotation of the shoulders and the engagement in the back Perform this movement for the desired number of reps and sets

Stand tall with feet shoulder width apart Relax your shoulders and arms at your sides Rotate your shoulders in a circular motion Rotate your shoulders in the opposite direction Repeat this process for your desired number of repetitions

Stand up straight with your feet together Raise your right knee and touch it with your left elbow while keeping your hands behind your head Return to the starting position and repeat the movement with the opposite elbow and knee Continue alternating in a fast and controlled manner Remember to engage your core throughout the exercise

Stand tall with your back straight and feet wider than shoulder-width. Grab a barbell over your chest, just under the chin, with your arms folded, palms facing forward, and elbows making a 45-degree angle with your torso. Raise the barbell by extending your arms overhead. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet wider than shoulder-width. Grab the dumbbells over your shoulders with your arms folded, palms facing forward, and elbows making a 45-degree angle with your torso. Raise the dumbbells by straightening your arms overhead. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise your arms forward and above your head, keeping them fully extended Keep your palms facing each other while you raise your arms Hold at the top for a second, then slowly lower your arms back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms fully down to your sides. Raise your arms in a controlled manner until they are fully vertical above your head. Hold at the top of the movement for a second. Lower your arms back down in a controlled manner.

name_en: Standing Side and Front Leg Raise
description_en: Stand straight, keep your head up and eyes forward Lift your right leg to the side as high as comfortable, then slowly lower it Repeat the same movement with your left leg Next, lift your right leg in front of you, then slowly lower it Repeat the same movement with your left leg

Stand up straight with feet shoulder width apart. Bend one elbow so that your hand is near your ear. Slowly bend at the waist to the other side until you feel a contraction in your obliques. Slowly return to an upright position. Repeat for several repetitions, then switch sides.

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Place your hands on your hips Bend to one side, trying to reach the floor with your hand Return to the initial position Repeat the exercise on the other side

Stand with your feet shoulder width apart Place your right hand on your right hip Bend to your right side, allowing your right hand to slide down your right leg Return to the starting position Repeat on the left side

Stand straight with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart Place your right hand on your waist Reach your left arm over your head and bend your torso to the right Straighten up and repeat on the other side

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart. Bend one arm and place your hand on the side of your head. Bend your side towards the same side of your bent arm. Return to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat on the opposite side.

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Raise your arms to the sides, shoulder height, palms facing down Begin to make small circles with your arms Gradually make the circles bigger Revert back to small circles before lowering down your arms

Stand straight with feet hip-width apart Lift your right knee and right elbow towards each other, performing a crunch on the right side of your body Lower your arm and leg back to starting position Repeat the same movement on the left side Alternate sides for your desired amount of reps

Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart Place your left hand on your hip, and extend your right arm overhead Lift your right leg to the side as you bring your right elbow down towards your knee Return to the starting position Repeat the exercise on the other side

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Place your hands behind your head, elbows flared to the sides. Bend your right knee and simultaneously raise it to hip level as you lower your right elbow to meet it. Return to the initial position in a controlled manner. Repeat the exercise with the left knee and elbow. Alternate sides for each rep.

name_en: Standing Side Crunch Elbow to Knee
description_en: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart Bend your left arm and your right knee Try to touch your left elbow to your right knee Return to the starting position Repeat on the other side

name_en: Standing Side Crunch Elbow to Knee
description_en: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, hands behind your head Lift your left knee and simultaneously twist your torso to the left, trying to touch your right elbow to your left knee Return to the initial position Repeat the movement with the opposite side, right knee to left elbow Continue alternating sides for the desired number of reps

Stand straight and position your arms out at your sides Twist your torso to the left and right in a swinging motion Keep your arms straight and parallel to the floor throughout the exercise Continue this swinging motion for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Shift your weight to your right foot and lift your left knee up to hip height Extend your leg out to the side in a swift kicking motion Flex your foot and point your toes down while kicking Slowly return your leg back to the starting position

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Shift your weight to one foot, keeping your other foot flexed Kick out with your flexed foot, keeping your toes pointed Controlled, bring your kicking foot back to standing position Repeat this motion for your desired amount of reps before switching sides

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Slowly raise your right leg to your side Hold the position for a moment Slowly lower your leg back to starting position Repeat the exercise with your left leg

Stand straight and keep your feet hip-width apart Keep your body rigid, raise your right leg to the side as high as possible Pause at the top of the movement, then seamlessly ease your leg back down Repeat on the other side after completing all reps Keep your movements smooth, not jerky

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and place your hands at your waist. Raise one of your legs to one side unless it makes a 45-degree angle with the other leg. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Stand upright with your shoulders relaxed Slowly tilt your head to one side Gently apply additional pressure with your hand to deepen the stretch Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds Switch sides and repeat

Stand tall with a straight back, arms by your sides, and feet shoulder-width apart. Tilt towards one side and raise your opposite arm overhead for overpressure. Hold this stretch for some seconds and return to the initial position. Repeat.

Stand upright, feet hip-width apart, hands behind the head, your elbows wide open Lift your right knee to hip level while twisting your upper body to the right After contact with knee and opposite elbow, repeat action with the left knee and the right elbow Continue alternating between the left and the right side Keep your torso upright and your abs engaged throughout

Stand straight and hold onto a support for balance. Raise one foot off the ground slightly, keeping your knees close together. Slowly flex your knee, curling your heel up towards your buttocks. Hold for a moment, and then slowly lower your foot back down. Repeat for desired repetitions, then switch legs.

name_en: Standing Single Leg High Knee to Butt Kick with Support
description_en: Stand straight and raise one leg up towards your chest After reaching the highest point, lower the leg in a swift motion and kick back, reaching your glute Return to the standing position and repeat the movement with the other leg Continue alternating between both legs for a set amount of reps Use a railing or wall for balance and support if needed

name_en: Standing Spine Imbalance and Forward Head Posture
description_en: Stand erect, keep your feet hip-width apart Pull your shoulder blades back and down Align your head in such a way that your ears are over your shoulders Look straight ahead and tuck your chin in slightly Hold this position for a few moments before releasing

name_en: Standing Spine Imbalance and Pelvic Imbalance Hold
description_en: Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Raise your right arm overhead while simultaneously raising your left foot off the ground Hold the pose for a few seconds, then slowly lower your arm and foot Switch sides by raising your left arm and right foot together Repeat this alternation for your desired number of repetitions

name_en: Standing Spine Imbalance and Pelvic Imbalance Hold
description_en: Start by standing straight, with your feet hip-width apart. Lift one knee towards your chest while keeping the other foot flat on the ground Hold this position for about 30 seconds. Release and repeat on the other side. Perform for desired number of reps, alternating legs.

name_en: Standing Split Yoga Pose Urdhva Prasarita Eka Padasana
description_en: Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart and your arms by your sides Bend forward from your hips and reach your hands to the ground Shift your weight onto your left foot, lifting your right leg up behind you Reach as high as you can with your right leg while keeping your torso and left leg as straight as possible Hold the pose for a few breaths before releasing and repeating on the other leg

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent Begin to sprint in place, driving your knees up toward your chest Keep your back straight and your arms pumping in rhythm with your legs Try to land lightly on the balls of your feet and maintain the sprint for the desired length of time

Stand facing a bar with a towel looped around it, hold the ends of the towel. Pull the towel towards your face, while keeping your arms high and elbows out. Squeeze your shoulder blades together as you pull. Pause briefly when the towel is close to your face. Slowly extend your arms back to the initial position.

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Stretch your arms forward at shoulder level Make swimming motions with your arms by rotating them in circles Alternate the arm that is on top at the peak of each rotation Continue in a controlled manner for 10-15 repetitions

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Raise your right arm overhead and let your left arm by your side while keeping both the palms forward. Lower your right arm and raise your left arm while rotating your torso towards the left as if you are swimming. Return by switching sides and repeat.

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms straight out in front of you at shoulder height, palms facing down Imitate the motion of swimming, making small circular rotations with your arms Keep your core tight and your posture straight while doing the movement After doing a set of rotations one way, switch to do the same number of rotations the other way

Stand straight and hold the barbell with your palms facing upwards Squeeze the barbell as hard as you can and hold for 2-3 seconds Then quickly switch your grip so your palms are facing downwards Squeeze the barbell again as hard as you can and hold for another 2-3 seconds Repeat this switching and squeezing process for the recommended amount of reps

Stand straight with your legs a hip-width apart. Lift your toes and the ball of your foot off the floor while keeping your heel on the ground. Hold the stretch for about 30 seconds to 1 minute. Lower your foot back to the floor. Repeat with the other foot.
Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Raise your leg and tap your toe while extending the opposite arm. Return to the initial position and repeat by switching sides.
Stand up straight with feet shoulder-width apart Lift both hands up and clap above your head From the top, swing both arms wide and clap again at your back Return to the starting position and repeat

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart in a boxing stance Raise one arm diagonally above your shoulder as if punching towards the top corner Quickly switch hands and alternate punching diagonally above your shoulder Maintain core stability and keep the movement controlled Continue alternating punches at a high speed

Stand in front of a bar that is at chest height Place your hands on the bar, shoulder-width apart Pull your body up towards the bar Pause when your chest is close to the bar Lower yourself back down to the starting position

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and engage your core Raise your fists to the level of your chin Push your right fist straight out in front of you, retract it back quickly while simultaneously extend the left hand Switch between your hands with each punch Keep the movement controlled and steady

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Place your hands on your hips Rotate your torso to the right as far as you can Pause for a moment, then rotate your torso to the left as far as you can Return to the starting position and repeat

Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart Twist your torso to the left while raising your right knee to elbow Return to the starting position Twist your torso to the right while raising your left knee to elbow Return to the starting position and repeat

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Lift one knee as high as comfortable while simultaneously rotating your torso towards the lifted knee Return to starting position and repeat with the other knee Alternate sides to simulate a marching motion Keep the motion continuous for a set duration or number of repetitions

Stand up straight with your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms out to the sides at shoulder height Rotate your torso to the right, keeping your hips square and your arms extended Hold the stretch for a few seconds Repeat on the left side

Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your right hand above your head and your left hand down your side Slowly bend your waist to the left, stretching the right oblique muscles Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side Perform the exercise for the desired amount of repetitions on each side

Stand tall with feet hip-width apart. Bend your arm and place your hand on your hip. Gently bend your torso to the one side as far as comfortably possible. Hold this stretch for up to 30 seconds. Repeat the stretch on the other side.

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms down in front of your body Raise your arms straight and diagonal until they reach shoulder height while keeping your palms facing up Pause for a moment and then slowly lower your arms back down to the original position Repeat this process for your target number of reps

name_en: Standing Upper Back and Shoulder Stretch
description_en: Stand up straight and clasp your hands together behind your back Extend your arms and raise your hands upwards behind you Hold this position and feel the stretch in your shoulders and upper back Return to the initial position and repeat

Stand upright holding the EZ barbell with palms facing back Pull the barbell towards your stomach Hold this position for a few seconds squeezing your back muscles Slowly return to the starting position Repeat this for the desired number of repetitions

Stand up straight with your feet shoulder width apart Extend your arms in front of you and interlock your fingers Keep your arms fully extended, push your hands as far away from your chest as possible Feel the stretch in your shoulders and hold this position for 15-30 seconds Release and repeat

Stand upright and hold the wheel in front of you Slowly roll the wheel away from you and extend your body Stretch out as far as you can without your body touching the ground Pull yourself back up to the starting position using your abs Try to maintain a straight back while performing the exercise

Start by standing straight, hold the wheel handles with both hands Slowly roll the wheel forward while keeping your body straight Extend as far as you can without touching your body to the ground Pull back the wheel to the initial position while keeping your body straight Repeat the sequence for your desired number of repetitions

Start by standing straight with your arms relaxed Extend your arms in front of you to shoulder height, palms facing down Rotate your wrists in a circular motion After doing a number of rotations in one direction, reverse the direction

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms fully sideways at shoulder level, forming a 'T' with your body Start making small clockwise circles with your arms After a set, switch to counter-clockwise circles Ensure your arms stay elevated throughout the exercise

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Raise your arms forward while keeping your palms inward and open them a little wide. Extend your arms overhead while maintaining the gap between them. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie down on your back with your legs wide open and your arms spread wide overhead Bring your arms forward along with your chest while bringing your leg towards your arms simultaneously Try to touch your feet with your hands and return to the initial position

Lie on your back and spread your arms and legs so you look like a starfish Raise your right hand and left leg at the same time, and try to touch them over your body Lower your hand and leg back to the ground Repeat the movement with your left hand and right leg Keep alternating until you've finished your set

Lie down flat on your back and extend your arms and legs to form like a star Pull in your stomach and lift your arms and legs off the floor Try bringing your right hand towards your left foot and return back to the initial position Repeat the same on the opposite side Keep alternating between sides

Stand tall, bend your knees, close your chest and thighs, and try to touch your toes. Raise yourself and jump while extending your arms and legs wide apart. Land into the initial position while closing your thighs and chest. Repeat.

Stand with feet hip-width apart Jump up explosively spreading your legs and arms out in the air Land softly and bring your arms and sweep your legs back to the starting position Immediately spring into the next star jump Repeat for the desired number of times

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Raise your right knee to your chest while twisting your left elbow towards the knee Quickly switch sides and do the same motion on the other side Do these movements in a quick, high-intensity pace Repeat for desired number of reps or for a set amount of time

Start in a high plank position, balancing on your hands and toes Lift your right arm and left leg in the air Reach out with your right arm and left leg as far as they go, creating a star shape Hold this position for a few seconds before returning to the starting position Repeat the movement with your left arm and right leg

Stand straight with your legs together. Jump while opening your legs apart and lowering your body into a squat position. Raise your arms overhead to form a star shape. Return to the starting position by jumping your legs back together and lowering your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Start in a standing position, feet hip-width distance apart Jump out into a wide squat, keeping your weight in your heels As you jump, reach your arms out to the sides and over your head, shaping a star with your body Jump back to the starting position, lowering your arms back down Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Step one foot forward and lower your body until your front knee is at a 90-degree angle Hold the position for a few seconds Push back up and repeat with the other leg Keep alternating between legs

Assume a lunge posture with one foot forward and the other extended back Reach across your body, starting at your hip and moving your arm across your body Rotate your torso in the direction of the chop Return to the start position in a controlled manner Repeat the action and then switch sides

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent Raise your arms straight out in front of you at shoulder height Throw your arms backwards as fast as possible, focusing on squeezing your shoulder blades together Bring your arms back to the original starting position Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Adjust the bike seat to your height and ensure a comfortable position Start pedaling at a moderate speed to warm up Increase the resistance level and speed gradually Maintain a steady rhythm with your pedaling Finish your run by slowly reducing your speed and cooling down

Mount the stationary bike and set your preferred resistance Place your feet securely on the pedals Pedal at a steady pace, keeping your upper body relaxed Ensure a full range of motion, with your leg extending on each pedal stroke Continue the exercise for your desired period of time

Position yourself on the bike, adjust the height so that your knee is slightly bent at the bottom of the pedal stroke Start pedaling at a moderate pace journey Gradually increase the resistance to a level that's challenging, but maintainable for your desired time duration Keep your upper body relaxed and avoid leaning on the handles After exercising, gradually reduce the pace before stopping completely

Seat yourself comfortably on the bike with feet on the pedals Adjust the resistance to a level you can handle Start pedaling at a pace that suits you Keep your back straight while pedaling Continue cycling for your desired amount of time

Begin in a standing position with feet shoulder-width apart Take a step back with your right foot, bending both knees into a lunge position Push off your right foot, come back to standing, and immediately perform a front kick with your right leg Return your right foot to the floor and repeat the sequence on your left side for one complete rep Continue alternating between left and right for the desired amount of repetitions

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart. Step back with your right foot and lower into a lunge. As you return to standing, swing your right leg forward in a 'flap' motion. Repeat this motion, alternating legs each time. Keep your core tight to maintain balance throughout the exercise.

Start by standing upright with feet shoulder-width apart. Take a step back with your right foot and simultaneously lift your left hand towards the sky. Reverse the movements quickly, stepping forward with your right foot and lowering your left hand. Repeat the exercise with your left foot stepping back and your right hand reaching up. Keep alternating sides until the set is complete.

Stand in an upright position Extend your arms upwards and grasp the bar with a wide grip Pull the bar down towards your chest while stepping backwards Return to the initial position in a controlled manner Repeat the movement for the desired reps

Stand under a pull-up bar, jump up and grasp the bar with both hands Proceed to pull your body up until the chin reaches the bar Lower your body back to the starting position in a controlled manner Step back with one foot, then return to the starting position Switch feet and repeat the exercise

Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart Take one step back with your right foot and simultaneously bend your torso to the left Return to an upright position while bringing your right foot back to the original position Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch sides Make sure to bend your torso to the opposite direct of the foot stepping back

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Step backward with your right foot, landing on the ball of your foot and bending your knees to lower your body toward the floor While stepping back, touch the floor with your left hand Push off your right foot to return to the starting position Repeat on the other side

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart Raise your hands above your head Take a step back with your right foot while keeping your hands raised Return to the initial position and repeat the movement with your left foot Continue the exercise by alternating your feet

Start by standing upright with your feet hip-width apart Step one foot back and lower your body into a reverse lunge While doing this, raise both arms over your head Return to the starting position and repeat with the other leg Keep alternating between legs for the duration of the exercise

Stand with feet hip-width apart Step one foot backward into a reverse lunge, keeping your front knee stacked over your ankle Bring your hands together in a 'prayer' position at chest level While in lunge, extend your arms out, pushing against each other, then pulling back into 'prayer' position Return to the starting position, switch legs and repeat

Start standing with feet hips-width apart Step right foot back, bending both knees to 90 degrees as you push your arms forward Push off right foot to return to starting position as you draw your arms back in Repeat, alternating the stepping back leg after each push Maintain a pace that keeps your heart rate up throughout the workout

Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms straight out in front of you Step back with your right leg, lowering your body into a lunge Push off your right foot to return to start Then step back with left leg and repeat the motion Keep alternating legs for your desired number of reps

Stand tall with your feet together and arms by your sides Jump your feet out wide and simultaneously swing your arms out to the side and up to shoulder height Immediately reverse the motion by jumping your feet back together and swinging your arms back to your sides Repeat this in a quick, continuous motion for the duration of your workout Maintain a braced core and upright posture throughout

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding an EZ barbell in front of your thighs Jump slightly and spread your legs apart while lifting the barbell up to your chest Squeeze shoulder blades back and together Jump back to the starting position while lowering the barbell Repeat the motion for a set amount of repetitions

Start off standing upright with your feet shoulder-width apart Perform a jack by jumping and spreading your legs wide As you land, perform a front raise by lifting your arms until they're parallel to the ground Jump back to the start position while lowering your arms Repeat the sequence for your desired number of reps

Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides Perform a jumping jack but on landing, keep your knees slightly bent At the same time, lift your arms forward until they're at shoulder level Lower your arms while jumping your feet back together Repeat the process in a swift continuous motion for a set number of repetitions or time duration

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hands by your sides Jump up, spreading your legs apart while also bringing your arms in toward your chest Immediately jump back to the starting position Curl your arms upward, keeping the elbows close to the body Lower your arms back to the starting position

Stand straight with feet together, hand palms facing forward Bend your elbows and pull your palms towards your shoulder, keeping your upper arms stationary Move your left leg side to side while curling and uncurling your arms Switch leg and repeat the movements Continue alternating the movements for the desired amount of repetitions.

Begin by standing straight, feet hip-width apart Jump your legs apart as you raise your arms overhead Jump your legs back together as you lower your arms to your sides Keep your elbows slightly bent throughout the movement, don't lock them Continue this movement at a quick pace for your desired time

Start in standing position, feet together Step your right foot out to the side, bringing your arms out to the sides, elbows bent at 90 degrees As you step your right foot back in, punch your right fist forward Repeat the movement with your left foot and left fist Continue alternating sides for the duration of the workout

Start by standing tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Lift your right knee as high as possible while swinging your left arm forward Bring your lifted knee back to the ground in a swift motion as you swing your left arm back Repeat this motion with your other knee and opposite arm Alternate knees with each thrust to get the rhythm

Start by standing up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Lift one knee towards your chest as high as you can At the same time, sweep your arms forward, clapping your hands below the raised knee Return to the starting position and repeat with the other knee Continue alternating sides for the duration of your workout

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Raise one knee as high as it can go and then place the foot back down Alternate legs and start to pick up the pace Continue for 10 to 15 minutes, or as long as you can Remember to maintain proper form and not strain yourself

Stand upright, feet together and hands on your hips. Take a big step sideways with your right foot, bending your right knee and pushing your hips back. While bending, lean your upper body to the right, reaching your left hand towards your right foot. Push off your right foot to return to the starting position. Repeat on the other side.

Stand straight with feet shoulder-width apart Step out to the side and bend your knee at 90 degrees While stepping out, swing the opposite hand across your body to touch your knee Come back to the center and return to the standing position Repeat the same movement on the other side

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart. Perform a regular squat, and hold the position when you're at the lowest point. After holding the squat, jump out with your feet wider than your shoulders and then jump back to your original squat position. Stand and return to your original position. Repeat this process.

Stand in front of a step, bench or sturdy box. Step up with your right foot and press through your right heel to lift your body up. Lower your body back down until your left foot touches the ground. Repeat for the desired number of reps, then switch legs.

Stand in front of the chair Step up onto the chair with one foot Push through your heel to lift your other foot onto the chair Step back down and repeat with the other foot Keep alternating feet for the duration of the exercise

Stand facing the chair Step up onto the chair with one foot Keep your core tight and balance your body as you bring the other foot up Hold the position briefly Step down back to the start position, one foot at a time

Stand tall near a chair with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Step on the bench with your right foot, drive up through your right leg, and stand upright on the bench. Pause momentarily, step down with your right foot and follow with the left. Repeat this activity for a suitable time.

Hold a stick above your head with both hands about shoulder-width apart In a controlled motion, bend sideways to one side, keeping your back straight Hold the position for about 15-30 seconds Slowly return to the starting position Repeat on the other side for the same amount of time

Stand upright and hold a stick in both hands with your palms facing down Raise the stick above your head and widen your grip Lean your body towards one side while keeping your arms straight Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds Repeat on the other side

name_en: Stick Lunge with Overhead Raise Stretch
description_en: Stand tall holding a stick with both hands, shoulder-width apart Step forward into a lunge position with one foot, keep your torso upright Raise the stick over your head while moving into the lunge Hold the stretch for about 15 to 30 seconds Switch your legs and repeat the process

name_en: Stick Overhead Full Sumo Squat Stretch
description_en: Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointed outwards Hold a stick overhead with both hands, arms fully extended Lower your body into a squat position while keeping the stick overhead Hold this position for a few seconds Return to the starting position and repeat

Stand upright and hold the stick with both hands, wider than shoulder-width apart Fully extend your arms and begin moving the stick in a circular motion around your head Release and re-grip the stick as needed to help it pass around your body Reverse the direction of the stick after a few circles Try to keep your torso straight throughout the exercise

Hold the stick with both hands, slightly wider than shoulder width apart Lift the stick up over your head Lean to one side and hold Return to the center position then lean to the opposite side Reduce the stretch by releasing the stick

Stand upright and hold a stick with both hands behind your back at waist level Keeping your legs and hips stationary, bend your waist to the right side as far as possible Hold for a few seconds, then repeat the same move to the left side Ensure to keep your body in a straight line throughout the exercise

name_en: Stick Side to Front Bend Stretch
description_en: Hold the stick with both hands at shoulder height Keep your feet shoulder-width apart Bend Side-to-side while keeping arms straight Return to the standing position Repeat the exercise as needed

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Hold the stick parallel behind your body by grasping its ends, shoulders wide Twist your mid section to the left and hold for some seconds Return back to the initial position Repeat the same motion to your right

Stand upright and hold a stick behind your back with one hand Raise the stick upward slowly and hold it for a few seconds Lower the stick in a controlled manner Repeat the process with the other hand Perform this exercise for the recommended number of repetitions

Stand straight, holding the stick in front of you with both hands Step forward with one foot into a lunge Hold this lunge position and turn your upper body in the direction of your front leg, using the stick to guide the rotation Return to the front and repeat for the other side Alternate sides for desired reps

Start in a standing position with your feet hip-width apart As you lift your right knee, reach your arms up above your head Bring your right knee and elbows down together Return to the standing position Repeat with the left knee and continue alternating sides

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the bar with an overhand grip and arms straight overhead. Lean forward, move your hips back and bend your knees slightly. Pull the bar down towards your knees without folding your arms. Return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Straight bar cable row close grip
description_en: Sit on a bench facing a row machine, with your back straight and feet placed on the footrests. Hold the bar over your knees with an overhand grip and your hands close to each other. Raise the bar towards your chest by folding your arms and opening your elbows wide. Return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Straight bar cable row normal grip
description_en: Sit on a bench facing a row machine, with your back straight and feet placed on the footrests. Hold the bar over your knees with an overhand grip and your hands shoulder-width apart. Raise the bar towards your chest by folding your arms and opening your elbows wide. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Lie flat on your back with your feet flat on the ground Extend your legs straight out Press your heels into the ground and lift your hips up Hold the top position for a moment Lower your hips back down to the ground slowly in a controlled motion

Start on all fours on the floor with hands directly under shoulders and knees under hips Keeping your leg straight, lift it up until your thigh is in line with your body Bring your leg back down, returning to the starting position Repeat with the other leg Perform the desired number of repetitions with each leg

Start in a hands and knees position Keep your spine neutral Extend one leg straight backwards without bending the knee Avoid hinging at the lower back Return to the starting position and repeat with the other leg

Begin by lying flat on your back, legs extended straight Place your hands behind your head, elbows wide Engage your core and keep your lower back flat as you lift your upper body toward your knees Return to starting position Repeat this movement for desired amount of reps

Start by lying flat on your back with your legs straight and together Raise your upper body and try to touch your elbows to your knees Lower your upper body back to the starting position in a controlled manner Keep your legs straight and your feet on the floor throughout the movement

Lie flat on your back with your legs fully extended Raise your upper body to perform a sit-up, while lifting your leg Touch your toe with the opposite hand at the pinnacle of the exercise Lower your body and leg back to the start position in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise with the other leg and hand

Stand tall and extend your arms in front of you Make a tight fist with both hands as if you are holding a string Pull your hands towards your chest as if pulling a string Keep the 'string' tight as you extend your arms back out Repeat

Stand up straight holding a barbell at your waist, with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart Lower your body by bending your knees while keeping your back straight Pull the barbell to your chin while returning to a standing position Lower the barbell back to your waist in a controlled manner

Stand with your feet wider than hip-width apart, toes pointing out Lower your body in squat position, keeping your chest raised Place your left elbow on your left knee, and twist your upper body towards the right Return to center and repeat on the other side Keep on alternating the sides

Start by standing with your feet wider than shoulder width apart and toes slightly turned out Lower yourself into a deep squat Place your hands together in front of you and push your knees out with your elbows Gently twist your upper body to one side, trying to bring one elbow towards the ground Switch sides and repeat

name_en: Sumo Quarter Squat Alternate Tip Toe
description_en: Start by standing with your feet wider than hip width apart and toes pointed outward Lower yourself into a quarter squat position, keeping your back straight and chest lifted Rising onto your tiptoes, alternate by lifting one heel then the other off the ground Continue this alternating motion while maintaining the quarter squat position for your desired amount of reps Return to the starting position and repeat the exercise

name_en: Sumo Quarter Squat Tip Toe with Arms Curl
description_en: Stand in a wide stance with your toes pointing outward Lower into a squat while lifting onto your toes and curling your arms towards your shoulders Hold this position for a few seconds Return to the starting position lowering your arms and coming off your toes Repeat this for your chosen set of reps

Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointed out. Lower your body by bending your knees and hips, keeping your back straight and chest up. Push yourself back up to the initial position by driving through the heels. Keep your abs engaged throughout the movement to support your lower back. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.

Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing outwards Bend your knees and lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the floor Keep your back straight and your chest lifted during the movement Push through your heels to return to the starting position Repeat this movement according to your workout plan

name_en: Sumo Squat and Side Knee Raise
description_en: Stand with feet wider than hip-width apart, toes pointed out Bend your knees and lower your hips, then push up to a standing position Lift your right knee as you rotate your torso to the right Return to the starting position and repeat on the left side Continue alternating between right and left for the desired repetitions

Stand with your feet wider than hip-width apart, toes slightly turned out. Lower your body into a deep squat, keeping your chest lifted. Tap the floor between your feet with both hands. Push through your heels to return to the starting position. Repeat for desired number of reps.

Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing outwards Lower your body into a squat, keeping your chest upright Touch the floor between your feet with both hands Push back up to your starting position Repeat the exercise for the desired amount of reps

name_en: Sumo Squat In between Legs Resistance Band
description_en: Start in a squatting position with your feet pointing outward and placed wider than shoulder-width, knees bent, and a resistance band under your feet. Hold the ends of the band between your thighs with your arms straight. Stretch the band by raising your hips and shifting into a standing position.

name_en: Sumo Squat Over Shoulder Resistance Band
description_en: Start in a squatting position with your feet pointing outward and placed wider than shoulder-width, knees bent, and a resistance band under your feet. Hold the ends of the band in your hands over the shoulders. Stretch the band by raising your hips and shifting into a standing position.

Start with your feet wider than shoulder width apart with your toes turned outward Squat down until your hips are below your knees Push up to standing position then step to the side into a lunge with one foot Push back to the starting position and perform the same action on the other side Repeat these steps
Lie down on your stomach with your legs straight and arms resting on the floor overhead. Raise your arms and legs off the floor without bending them. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Lie on your stomach with your arms and legs extended Lift your arms and legs up towards the ceiling to form a curve with your body, like superman flying Hold the position for at least a few seconds Relax and lower your arms and legs back to the floor Repeat the exercise for a suitable number of repetitions

Start by lying down on your stomach on a mat or soft surface, extending your arms in front of you. Keeping your neck neutral, simultaneously lift your arms, chest, and legs off the ground. Hold this position for 2-5 seconds while squeezing your glutes. Slowly lower your arms, chest, and legs back to the start position. Repeat this movement for the desired number of reps.

Lie face down on the floor extending your arms in front of you Lift your arms, legs, and chest off the floor simultaneously Hold this position for a moment and return to the initial position Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps

Lie face down on the floor and stretch both arms out in front of your body Simultaneously raise your legs and arms off the floor as if you're flying like Superman Hold this position for a few seconds Slowly lower your arms and legs back to the ground, touching the floor lightly Repeat this process for the desired number of repetitions

Lie down on your stomach, with your arms extended in front of you and legs stretched behind you Lift your hands and feet off the ground as high as you can, keeping your core tight Hold this position for a few seconds Lower your hands and feet back to the ground Rest for a few seconds and repeat

Lie down on your stomach with your legs straight and arms resting on the floor overhead. Raise your arms and legs off the floor without bending them. Hold for a while then return to the initial position and repeat.

Lie down on your stomach with your legs straight and arms extended overhead on the floor. Raise your arms and legs off the floor without bending them. Hold this position and take your elbows towards your torso while bending your arms then straighten them again. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Lie down on your stomach with your legs straight and arms extended overhead on the floor. Raise your arms and legs off the floor without bending them. Hold the handles of a resistance band in your hands with an overhand grip and stretch the band by taking your elbows towards your torso while bending your arms. Return to the initial position by straightening your arms again.

Start in a normal plank position Lower your body and as you push up, extend one arm forward Return to starting position Repeat the movement alternating arms Make sure to keep your body straight while performing the exercise

Start in a standard push-up position, with your feet shoulder-width apart Lower yourself until your chest is just above the ground Explosively push up, while at the same time lifting off the floor with your hands and feet Land and immediately start your next rep Control the descent to avoid injury

Lay face down on the ground, extending your arms straight out in front of you Lift your arms, chest, and legs up off the ground as if youre flying Squeeze your back muscles and hold for a moment Slowly lower back down to the starting position Repeat for a series of reps

Lie down on your stomach with your arms extended and a towel in your hands Lift up your arms and legs off the floor, creating a 'bow' shape with your body Pull the towel apart as if doing a row while remaining in this 'superman' position Then, return to the initial position

Lie face down on the floor, extending your arms in front of you in the shape of a 'W' Simultaneously raise both arms and legs, arching your back Hold this 'flying' position for 5 seconds Slowly lower your arms and legs back to the starting position Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Lie down on your stomach and extend your arms straight out in front of you Lift your arms and legs off the ground, forming a 'superman' pose Move your arms to the side to form a 'W' shape, then stretch them out to form a 'Y' Return to the 'W', then lower everything back down

Set up a suspension trainer at around shoulder height Grab the handles of the suspension trainer with a supinated (palms facing up) grip Step back from the anchor point, lean back and allow the biceps to fully extend Hold the stretch for the desired period of time To release, step forward reducing the tension

Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet on the floor. Open your arms wide, and bend your elbows so that your forearms come perpendicular to the floor. Raise your back off the floor by pressing your elbows against the floor. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Lie on your back with your legs extended and arms stretched out to your sides. Bring one knee to your chest and gradually rotate it across your body. Try to touch the knee to the floor, while keeping the other leg and your shoulders flat. Turn your head in the direction opposite to the knee. Stay in this position, then switch to the other leg.

Lie down flat on your back with your arms extended outward for support Raise your legs so that they're perpendicular to the floor Slowly lower both legs to one side, while keeping your back flat on the floor Bring your legs back to the center and then lower them to the other side Repeat this motion for the desired number of reps

Stand with your feet shoulder width apart and extend your arms out in front of you Push your hips back and bend at the knees to lower your body as if sitting down Lower your body as far as comfortable making sure your knees don't go over your toes Push through your heels to bring your body back up to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with your hands touching the sides of your head and elbows pointed outward Bend through your waist to the right as far as you can, then return to the start position Repeat the movement towards the left Do not rotate your upper body Keep your movements slow and controlled

Stand facing the suspension trainer with your hands shoulder-width apart Brace your core and lean your body forward, extending your arms in front of you Hold for a moment, then reverse the motion and return to the initial position Repeat the movement while keeping your core engaged

Stand facing the suspension straps Grasp the handles and lean forwards until your body is at a slight angle Bend your elbows to lower your body towards the floor Push up until your arms are fully extended Repeat the movement for desired number of repetitions

Stand in front of the suspension trainer and face it Grab the handles with both hands and lean back Pull your body up towards the handles Lower your body back down in a controlled manner Repeat the exercise for desired repetitions

Stand up straight while holding the suspension in front of you at shoulder height Set your feet shoulder-width apart, then take a step back with your right foot and lower your body into a deep lunge Keep your front knee aligned with your ankle as you lower your body, bending your both knees Push off your front foot to return to standing position Switch sides and repeat the same process for the left leg

Stand a few steps away facing the suspension trainer and grab the handles. Extend your arms in front and enter a lunge stance with one leg forward. Lower your body until your front knee is bent to 90 degrees and pull the handles while keeping the arms extended. Push back up to the start position while allowing the handles to go back to the original position. Switch legs and repeat.

Connect the suspension straps to a sturdy anchor point Stand facing away from the anchor point, bend at your hips and hold the handles Extend your right arm and left leg backward and off the floor Slowly bring your right arm and left leg back in and then extend your left arm and right leg Repeat this movement, alternating sides each time

Stand facing the suspension straps, holding onto the handles Keep your body straight, and bend your elbows to lift your body Pause at the top for a count, then slowly lower your body back down Extend your arms fully to stretch your biceps under control Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Stand facing the suspension training straps, grab the handles with an underhand grip Bend your elbows and curl your hands towards your shoulders Pause briefly at the top of the movement Slowly extend your arms and return to the initial position Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, facing the suspension Grasp the suspension handles with your palms facing up Pull your hands towards your ears while keeping your elbows high Lower your hands back to the starting position Repeat the exercise

Sit under the suspension trainer with your knees bent. Reach up and hold the suspender handles with an overhand grip. Pull your body upwards towards the handles while keeping your feet planted and your back straight. Pause at top where your chest nearly touches the handles. Slowly lower yourself back to the initial position in a controlled manner

Move forward until there's slight tension in the suspension straps, with arms perpendicular to the ground. Bend at your elbows and pull your own body up. Lower yourself back down in a controlled manner. At the top of the motion, squeeze your biceps hard. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Adjust the strap length of the suspension equipment to chest level Stand facing the suspension with an underhand grip, keeping the body in a straight line Bend the elbows and pull your hands towards the top of your biceps Pause briefly at the top of the motion before lowering arms slowly Repeat the exercise for your desired number of repetitions

Attach straps to a secure point above head level and adjust them so the handles are at shin level Hold the handles and assume a pushup position Pull the right knee in towards the left elbow, then return to the starting position Repeat the movement with the left knee towards the right elbow Continue alternating in a bicycle pedalling motion

Adjust the straps of the suspension trainer to about knee height Place your both feet in the handles and assume a high plank position Slide your body forward and back by driving through the elbows Keep a firm core throughout the movement Repeat the movement for the desired amount of reps

Position yourself under the suspension trainer, facing upwards Grab the handles with your palms facing down Lift your body by pushing down on your toes and raising your heels Slowly lower your body back to the initial position Repeat the movement for your desired number of repetitions

Grab the suspender handles and step forward to a point where your body is leaning forward. Bend your elbows and lower down your body until your chest is parallel to the floor. Push your body upwards until your arms are fully extended again. Remember to move in a controlled manner, not dropping down hastily. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Attach suspension straps to a secure point Stand facing away from the anchor point, grab the handles in each hand Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the handles Push your body upward, extending your arms to their full length Repeat this movement for the desired number of reps

Start by setting up the suspension trainer to chest height and stand facing away from the anchor point. Hold the handles and bring them to the sides of your chest, keeping your feet stable. Press the handles forward, extending your arms without locking your elbows. Pause for a beat and then return to start position in a controlled motion. Repeat this movement for the designated number of reps.

Start by hanging from the suspension trainer, keep your body straight and core engaged Bend your knees and lift them towards your chest Pause at the height of the movement, then lower your legs back to the starting position Make sure to engage your core during the entire movement Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps

Start in a kneeling position with the suspension straps in front of you Place both elbows in the suspension straps and move into a plank position Keep your body straight from head to knees Hold this position for a desired time Carefully release and return to the starting position

Stand facing towards the anchor point of the suspension straps. Hold the handles in each hand with your palms facing each other. Lean back slightly, keeping your body straight. Rotate your arms outwards, keeping your elbows bent at 90 degrees. Slowly return to the starting position.

Grip the suspension handles and step back until there is tension Pull yourself towards the straps, your elbows flaring out at 90 degrees Pause when your hands reach your face Slowly come back to the starting position Repeat for the desired amount of repetitions

name_en: Suspender Forward Lunge with Rear Fly
description_en: Stand upright and hold the suspender with both hands Step forward with one foot, while descending towards the ground in a lunge movement Simultaneously extend your arms straight out to your sides in a flying motion Slowly rise back up to the original position Repeat the movement, alternating legs

Start in a push-up position with feet suspended in the straps Keep your body in a straight line from shoulders to ankles Hold this position for the desired amount of time Remember to keep your core engaged Relax and repeat desired amount of times

Start by gripping the handles of the suspension trainer, arms fully extended in front of you Pull yourself up, raising your arms until they are parallel to the ground Lower back down slowly, maintaining control throughout the movement Make sure to engage your core during the entire process Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Stand facing the suspension equipment and hold the handles with both hands Lift one knee towards your chest while balancing on the other foot While engaging your core, push the lifted foot back and straighten the leg Quickly bring the knee back to the chest and repeat the movement Switch legs and repeat

Stand straight and place your foot in one of the suspension straps near you. Keeping your body straight, lift the foot in the strap to the side, away from your other foot. Maintain this position for a second and then return your foot to the starting position. Repeat the movement for your desired amount of repetitions. Swap legs and complete the exercise with the other leg.
Lay on your back with your feet in the suspender handles Bend your knees and lift your hips off the floor Hold this position for a few seconds Lower your hips back down to the floor Repeat

Stand facing the suspension system and hold the handles Step back until your arms are extended and leans back slightly Now, bend at the waist as you lower your upper body Tighten your core and lift your body back to the starting position Repeat the movement as many times as you can

Set the suspension straps at hip level Stand in front of the suspension trainer with your back to the anchor, lean forward into the straps and put your palms in the handles Keep your body straight and lower it towards the floor Push your body back up to the starting position Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Attach a suspension trainer to a high anchor point. Standing with your feet together, lean back slightly while keeping your arms straight and out to your sides. Rotate your shoulders and lower your body, letting your arms pivot inward. Once your arms are pointed towards the ground, reverse the motion and rotate back to the start position. Repeat this for the desired number of repetitions.

Begin by securely anchoring the suspension trainer to a safe point above you. Stand facing the anchor point, hold the handles with both hands and lean back Your body should be in a straight line, from your heels to your head. Tighten your core to maintain this position Pull yourself up, keeping your body straight, until your chest touches the handles Lower yourself back down with control, extending your arms fully Repeat the process for the desired number of repetitions

Position yourself beneath the suspension band, grabbing it with palms facing each other Pull your body upwards, while twisting your arms so that your palms face towards the floor Hold for a moment and squeeze your shoulder blades together Lower your body back to the starting position while untwisting your arms Repeat for desired number of reps

Start by holding onto the suspension straps and positioning yourself into a plank position Keep your core tight and your body straight Pull your knees towards your chest in a controlled way Return to the initial plank position Repeat these movements for your desired number of repetitions

Attach suspension straps to a high anchor point and stand facing them Grasp the handles and walk back until your body is at a slight angle Brace your core and lift your legs, bending your knees towards your chest Extend your legs back to the starting position Repeat this exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Stand underneath the suspension trainer with feet hip-width apart Hold the handles and slightly lean back Lower yourself into a squat position Jump as high as possible while maintaining grip on the handle Land back down into the squat position and repeat

Attach the suspender straps at ankle level Lie face down and secure your ankles in the straps Contract your hamstrings and curl your legs up towards your butt Slowly extend your legs back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand straight towards the anchor point, feet shoulder-width apart, holding the straps. Step a foot back and cross it behind the front foot, lowering into a lunge. Drive through the front foot to return to standing position. Switch legs and repeat. Ensure the motion is controlled and steady through the entire exercise.

Lie down flat with your back on the floor and the suspension straps held firmly in your hands Raise both legs together until they form a 90-degree angle with your body Hold for 2-3 seconds Lower your legs back slowly to the initial position Repeat the exercise for the recommended amount of repetitions
