Attach a suspension trainer to a secure point above your head Extend your body below the trainer in a plank position, facing upwards Pull your right knee towards your chest Return your right leg to the starting position Repeat with your left leg and continue alternating legs

Attach suspension straps at a height above your head. Hold the handles of the suspension straps, extend your body into a plank position with feet grounded and arms fully extended. Bend your elbows and lower your body towards the floor while simultaneously driving one knee up towards your chest. Push up to straighten your arms while bringing your knee back to the original position. Repeat the exercise with alternating legs.

Secure your feet in the suspension straps Keep your body in a straight line from head to ankles Pull your waist up and rotate your torso to one side Return to the starting position Repeat the exercise on the other side

Stand facing the suspension trainer with your feet hip-width apart Hold one handle with your arm extended and palm facing up Draw the handle towards your shoulder by flexing your elbow Hold briefly at the top, then lower the handle in a controlled manner to the starting position Repeat and then switch to the other arm after finishing the set

Stand facing the anchor point of the cords and grab one handle with palm facing up Stretch your arm out in front and keep elbow slightly bent Pull the handle towards your shoulder, keeping your elbow stationary Slowly release to the starting position by extending your arm Repeat for desired number of repetitions and then switch sides

Attach the suspension trainer to a secure anchor point. Stand facing away from the anchor point with the trainer in one hand. Lean forward until your body is at an angle. Press your arm forward until it's fully extended. Return your arm to the starting position, and repeat.

Position yourself in a plank position with one arm holding the suspension strap Bend your elbow of the arm holding the strap to lower your body towards the floor At the same time, lift the opposite leg from the floor Push up through the hand holding the strap, straightening your arm and returning to the starting position Repeat the exercise with the other arm and leg

Attach the suspension trainer to a secure point overhead. Grasp the handles, stand facing away from the point of attachment, and lean forward on one leg. Extend your arms fully, keeping them in line with your body. Bend your elbows and lower your chest towards the handles. Push yourself back up to the starting position.

Attach a suspension system at about waist height. Stand facing the anchors, with a handle in each hand. Lean back, keeping body straight, until you are at a 45 degree angle. Swing your hips to one side and then the other, searing the pendulum movement with your waist.

Attach the suspension and position it for a pull movement Stand under the suspension with your hands at hips level Lean back with your arms extended straight in front of you and legs straight in alignment with your torso Pull your body upward by driving your hips up and forward Lower your body down in a controlled manner to the starting position

Secure your feet against the bottom straps of the suspender Bring your arms straight out to your sides at shoulder level, creating a T shape with your body Squeeze your shoulder blades together and lift your chest off the ground Lower your chest to the ground and relax your shoulders Repeat the lifting process

Start by setting the suspension trainer at knee height Lie face down on the ground with your arms extended above your head in a 'Y' shape, grabbing the handles Pull your body upward, keeping your arms straight Bend your elbows to lower yourself back down carefully Repeat the movement maintaining same form

Start in a standing position, holding the suspension straps with both hands. With your arms straight, lean back, pushing your hips forwards. Pull yourself upright using your glutes, hamstrings, and lower back, keeping your arms straight. Repeat this motion in a steady rhythm.

Start by grabbing the suspender with both hands Pull yourself up until your chest touches the suspender Hold this position for a second Slowly lower yourself until your arms are fully extended again Repeat the movement for the desired amount of repetitions

Stand below the suspension trainer and grab both handles with palms facing forwards Pull yourself up, bending your elbows and bringing your chest towards the handles Pause at the top of the lift Slowly lower yourself back to starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Hands should grasp the suspension trainer handles Lean forward until your body is at a slight angle Lower your body towards the floor by bending your elbows Push back to the starting position by straightening your arms Repeat the process for desired reps

Stand straight and hold the suspension straps, arms fully extended in front of you Step with your right foot backward into a lunge, ensuring your front knee is aligned with your ankle Lower your body until your right knee is close to the floor, keeping your chest upright Push through your front foot to return to the starting position Repeat with the left leg for one rep

Hang from the suspender with your body in a straight line Bend your knees and lift them towards your chest Pause at the top for a moment, then slowly lower your legs back down Try to keep your abs engaged and your body still throughout the movement

Stand facing the suspension trainer, grab the handles with an overhand grip Lean back, keeping your body straight and angled backwards Pull your hands apart by squeezing your shoulder blades Return to the start position in a controlled fashion Repeat the movement

Attach the suspension straps at about chest height and grab the handles Stand straight and lean forward slightly, extending your arms in front of you at chest height Pull your hands apart, keeping your elbows slightly bent Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement Slowly return to the starting position

Securely attach the suspension straps to an overhead anchor and adjust them to about knee height Stand facing away from the anchor point with a strap in each hand, arms fully extended out in front Bend at the waist and carefully roll your body out until nearly parallel to the floor Tighten your abs and roll back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat as many times as recommended

Attach the suspension straps to a secure attachment point Stand facing the attachment and hold the handles with arms extended in front of you Lean forward while keeping your body in a straight line, rolling your arms out in front of you Use your waist and core muscles to pull your arms back to the starting position Repeat for the determined number of reps

Stand facing the suspension trainer, holding the handles in front of you with arms extended Lean back, putting your weight on your heels, keeping your body straight Pull the handles toward your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together Pause, then return to the starting position Repeat the exercise as needed

Start by setting up your suspension trainer and standing a few steps away, facing the anchor point Reach out and grab the handles with both hands and lean backwards, keeping your body straight Pull your body towards the handles by pulling your shoulder blades together Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back to the starting position

Attach suspension straps on a high beam and stand facing them Grab the straps, lean back with your arms fully extended and your feet underneath the anchor point Pull your shoulder blades back and down Hold for a second, then release and return to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand in front of the suspender with your back facing it Mount the suspender with each hand, arms fully extended Lower your body while bending the elbows until a mild stretch is felt in the chest Push your body back up to the starting position Repeat this motion

Position yourself under the suspension trainer, arms extended, and feet placed out in front, in a sitting position Pull your chest up to the handles in a controlled manner, keeping your body straight Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement Lower yourself back down slowly, maintaining control

Stand sideways to the anchor point of the suspender, holding the handle in the hand closest to the anchor. Lean sideways towards the anchor, stretching the obliques on the far side of your body. Pull your body up using your core muscles, especially focusing on your obliques and transverse abdominis. Lower your body back down in a controlled way to the initial position. Repeat the movements and then switch to the other side

Attach your suspension trainer to a secure anchor point. Lie on your side with your feet secured in the suspension trainer foot cradles. On your forearm, prop your upper body up, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels. Raise your hips off the floor, into a side plank position. Hold this position for the recommended amount of time. Slowly lower your hips back towards the floor in a controlled manner.

Start by standing with feet hip width apart, facing the suspension trainer Reach out and hold the handles with arms fully extended Lean back and transfer weight onto the heels while stepping out to one side performing a lunge Push through the heel and return back to the start position Repeat on the other side for the desired amount of reps

name_en: Suspender Single Arm Rear Delt Row
description_en: Stand facing the suspension trainer and hold one of the handles with your right hand Lean back and extend your arm fully while keeping your feet flat on the floor Pull your body up by pulling the handle towards your chest while keeping your elbow close to your body Hold for a moment and then slowly lower your body back to the starting position Repeat the process with the left hand

Start by standing on one foot, with your other foot bent behind you Reach forwards with both hands and grab the suspension straps Bend at the hips while keeping your back flat and your supporting leg slightly bent Pull yourself back up using your glutes and hamstrings Switch legs and repeat

Start in a plank position with your hands on the ground and one foot in the suspension trainer Lift your free leg to hip height, keeping it in line with your body Hold this position for as long as you can while maintaining good form Switch legs and repeat Keep your spine in neutral position throughout the exercise

Start in a straight arm plank position with one foot secure in the suspension strap Engage your core and lift your free leg as high as you can towards the ceiling Hold for a few seconds keeping your back straight Lower your leg back down to complete one rep Repeat on the other side

Secure your suspension trainer at a height above your head. Stand facing away from the anchor, lift one foot and place it in both of the handles behind you. Balance on the standing leg, and lower your body until the thigh of your standing leg is parallel with the ground. Push through the heel of your standing leg to return to the start position. Repeat and switch legs after finishing the set.

Stand facing the suspension trainer with one foot slightly off the ground Squat down slowly on your grounded leg, keeping your head and chest up Reach your arms out in front while lowering yourself to maintain balance Pause at the bottom, then push yourself back up to the starting position Switch legs and repeat the exercise

Stand facing the suspension straps and hold onto the handles for support Lift one leg off the ground and extend it out in front of you Lower your body into a squat position on your standing leg while keeping your balance Push up through your heel to return to the starting position Alternate legs and repeat

Stand straight and hold the suspender straps with each hand Balance on one leg and extend the other leg forward Slowly lower your body while keeping your back straight, until the thigh of the standing leg is parallel to the ground Push through the heel of your standing leg to come back up Repeat the process with the other leg

Set up your suspension straps about 12 inches off the ground Start in a push-up position with your feet in the straps Perform a push-up, and as you come up, pull one knee to the same side elbow Lower your body back down, while returning your foot to the strap Alternate sides each rep

Anchor the suspension trainer overhead, hold the handles with arms extended in front of you Open your arms wide until they are parallel with the floor Engage your shoulders and squeeze your chest to bring the handles back together Return to the starting position with your arms extended forward Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand facing the anchor, holding the suspension straps and leaning back slightly to create tension Simultaneously pull the straps towards you and drive one knee upward until it's level with your hip Return to the start position and repeat with the other leg The movement should resemble sprinting with added resistance from the suspension straps Perform this for a set number of repetitions or time duration

Stand facing the suspension trainer, holding the straps Sink back into a squat position, keeping your heels down Push through your heels to stand up Keep your abdomen engaged throughout Repeat the motions for desired reps

Stand in front of the suspension trainer, grasp the handles with both hands and lean back to create some tension Bend your knees and lower your body into a squat position Explode upwards and off the ground while maintaining your grip on the handles Land back into the starting squat position in a controlled manner Repeat this motion for the suggested number of reps

Start in a high plank position with your hands on the ground and your feet in the suspension straps Perform a regular push-up keeping your body straight As you press up, lift one hand off the ground and stretch it out to the side, forming the shape of a star Slowly lower your body back to the ground, and then lift your other hand and stretch out into a star pose after your next push-up Repeat the exercise for the recommended number of times

Anchor the suspension trainer to a secure point and lay on your back. Place your heels in the handles of the suspension trainer. Bring your hips up off the ground, keep your body in a straight line. Bend your knees using your hamstrings to pull you up. Return to the starting position by lowering hips and straightening legs.

Lie down on your back with your hands holding the suspension handles above your head Bend your knees and lift them up towards your chest Contract your abdominal muscles and lift your hips off the floor Lower your hips and legs back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the movement for your desired number of reps

Start by positioning the suspension straps at mid-length. Lie on your back and place your heels in the foot cradles Press down into the foot cradles and lift your hips off the ground to come into a supine plank position Ensure your body forms a straight line from heels to shoulders Hold this position for as long as possible, ensuring you continue to breathe regularly Lower your hips back to the ground to rest, and repeat the exercise as many times as desired

Adjust the suspension straps to about waist height Stand facing away from the anchor point and grab the handles with both hands behind your head Extend your arms straight out in front of you, stretching the straps Bend your elbows, slowly lowering your body back and down Push up and back to the start position, using your triceps to extend your arms

Position yourself beneath the suspension straps, facing upwards. Grab the handles and stretch your body out in a plank position. Lower your body towards the ground by bending your arms at the elbow. Push back upwards until your arms are fully extended. Repeat this process for your desired amount of sets and reps

Attach the suspension straps at medium height. Stand facing the anchor, feet hip-width apart Hold the suspension straps, with your palms facing behind you, bend elbows and bring your hands next to your shoulders Hinge at your hips, lean your body forward, keep your body in a straight line from head to heels Extend your arms, move your hands away from your shoulders Pause, then bend elbows to return to the starting position

Set up the suspension equipment to hip level Hold on to the handles, feet on the ground, suspend yourself back Raise your knees towards your chest while twisting your waist Lower back down to starting position and repeat

Attach your feet to the suspender Keep your body straight and position your arms over your head Twist to one side and hold the position for a moment Return to the central position Repeat the twist for the other side

Start by securing the suspension straps at about arm height Grasp the handles and lean back slightly Twist your torso to one side, pulling your body upwards Twist back to the center and lower your body Repeat the process on the other side

Set the suspension trainer at about chest height Stand facing the suspension trainer, grab the handles with a wide grip, and lean back Keep your body straight, pull your chest up to the handles Pause for a moment, then lower yourself back down Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

name_en: Suspender Wide Grip Inverted Row on floor
description_en: Lie down on your back underneath the suspension straps. Grasp the handles with a wide grip, palms facing each other. Pull your body upwards until your chest nearly touches the handles. Pause for a brief moment, then slowly lower yourself back to the starting position. Repeat the exercise for the desired amount of repetitions.

Attach suspension straps at a high anchor point. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, facing the anchor point. Grab the handles with both hands, extend your arms, and lean back until your body is diagonal. Move your arms down and across your body in a chopping motion. Slowly raise your arms back to the starting position and repeat.

Stand facing the suspension trainer with feet shoulder-width apart Grab the handles of the suspension trainer with a neutral grip, arms fully extended in front of you Lean back slightly and simultaneously pull your arms apart and upwards, forming a 'Y' shape Lower your arms back to the initial position in a controlled motion Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand facing the suspender and hold it with your palms facing down Slowly lift the hands upwards making a 'Y' and then slowly lower it Repeat the process but for 'W', bring the elbows closer to the body while raising hands Lower the hands and then lift them wide for 'W' shape Return to the start and repeat for desired repetitions

Stand facing away from the anchor point with your feet shoulder width apart Lean forward so your body is at a slight angle Extend your arms in front of you at chest height Lower your body by bending your elbows and moving your hands out to the sides Push yourself back up to the starting position

Stand facing away from the anchor, holding the suspension handles at chest height Push your body forward, extending your arms until they are almost fully stretched Bend your elbows and lower your chest between the handles without losing your balance Push your hands back to the starting position Repeat the process based on your workout plan

Attach the suspension trainer at chest height, stand facing away from it, and grab a handle in each hand. Extend your arms out to the sides and lean forward with your feet together, keeping your body straight. Pull the handles together in front of you while keeping your body at an angle. Return to the starting position by letting your arms move back out to the sides. Repeat for your desired number of repetitions.
Grab the suspension bands with both hands Lean forward with your arms extended Pull your body up by bringing your hands together Return to the initial position in a controlled manner

Arrange the suspension trainer at about chest height. Stand facing the anchor point and hold the handles, your feet should be in front. Lean forward. Extend the arms out in front and bend at the elbows to bring your palms toward forehead Push back to the start position vigorously but under control. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Lie on a decline bench with your back supported, knees bent, and legs fixed against the roller bars. Clasp a weighted plate over your chest between your hands. Extend your arms up to raise the plate while extending your arms. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie down on a flat bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Clasp a weighted plate over your chest between your hands. Extend your arms up to raise the plate while extending your arms. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Lie on an incline bench with your back supported, knees bent, and feet on the floor. Clasp a weighted plate over your chest between your hands while keeping your arms folded. Extend your arms over your shoulders to raise the plate. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Start in a standing position with your feet hip-width apart Bend your right knee and lift it as high as comfortable and simultaneously sweep your left arm forward Put your right foot down and simultaneously lower your left arm Repeat the motion with your left knee and right arm Breathe rhythmically and continue the alternating movements for desired amount of time or repetitions
Start by floating on your back in water Extend your legs straight out Move your legs in a circular motion, from hips, keeping them together Repeat this motion consistently for a set period

In chest-deep water, stand with your feet shoulder-width apart Draw the right leg up toward the surface of the water and make a large, clockwise circle Repeat this movement for the desired number of repetitions, and then switch legs Draw the left leg up toward the surface of the water and make a large, counter-clockwise circle Repeat for equal number of repetitions as the right leg

Lie flat on your stomach with your arms extended out in front of you Raise your right arm and left leg off the ground as high as you can Lower them back to the ground and repeat on the opposite side Do equal reps for each side Remember to keep your torso as still as possible
Lie down flat on your stomach Extend your arms and legs straight out Start to lift your left arm and right leg as high as you can Lower them back down and then lift your right arm and left leg

Start by lying on your stomach with your legs straight and your arms extended in front of you Lift your head, chest, and legs off the floor Without touching the ground, kick your legs up and down Keep your core tight and your arms extended in front Relax and lower your body back to the starting position after a set

Start by floating flat on your stomach with your arms extended in front of you Kick your legs in a flutter kick motion Rotate your arms in a windmill motion, one at a time. When one arm is extended forward, the other should be at your side As you swing each arm forward, turn your head to the side and breathe in. As you swing it back, breathe out Repeat these movements in a fluid, continuous motion for multiple laps as desired

Stand in waist-deep water with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise your arms to the sides in a 'T' formation Step sideways to the right for a count of 10 steps Step sideways to the left, returning to your starting position Repeat these steps for a number of sets

Start by standing in chest-high water Take a big step to your right, pushing off with your left foot Bring your left foot to your right, balancing for a moment before stepping out again Repeat this process in the opposite direction, stepping to your left Keep repeating this back and forth movement for as many reps as desired

Stand with your feet hip-width apart Bend slightly at the knees and push off with one foot, as if you were about to swim Extend the opposite arm forward and then pull it back towards your body Repeat this motion with your other foot and arm, giving the appearance of swimming, while stepping back Continue in a controlled and rhythmic fashion

Start by standing with feet shoulder width apart Bend at the knees and hips into a squat position Leap forward as far as you can, landing softly with your knees bent to absorb impact Immediately spring back up into the next leap

Stand upright and then slightly squat down Explode upwards, swinging your arms forward and jumping as high as you can Land softly with your knees slightly bent Immediately jump again, swinging your arms back to aid your upward momentum Repeat the jump-swing motion for a set number of repetitions

Stand tall, feet shoulder-width apart Bend your knees slightly and push your hips back, swinging your arms behind Thrust your hips forwards and swing your arms up to an overhead position Control the movement back to the starting position, swinging your arms back down

Start on your feet, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart Swing one leg back and forth in a controlled motion As you swing your leg forward, drive the knee up towards your chest Return to starting position and repeat for the desired amount of reps Switch legs and repeat the process

Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart Keep your knees slightly bent Extend arms out straight to your sides keeping them level with the ground Begin to twist your upper body side to side

Stand with feet hip-width apart, keeping your knees slightly bent Extend your arms out to the sides at shoulder level Twist your upper body to the left, then pivot on your left foot while keeping your right heel on the ground Snap back to center and repeat on the other side, pivoting on your right foot Continue alternating sides and maintain a brisk, rhythmic pace

Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands at your sides Bend one knee to bring the heel towards your buttocks, perform a 'swiping' motion with your opposite hand as if trying to hit your elevated heel Quickly lower your foot back onto the ground and repeat the action with your other foot and hand Maintain high pace for an aerobic effect, switching between legs Keep your core engaged for stability throughout the exercise

Stand tall with feet hip-width apart Take a step back with one leg, bending both knees into a lunge Push off with the back foot, while kicking the same leg forward Land softly on your feet and immediately lunge backward, switching legs Repeat this sequence for desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart and raise your fists to chin height Punch downwards with one hand while keeping the other hand up, as if in a defensive position Swiftly switch hands immediately after punching downwards Continue alternating fists quickly and keeping the moves balanced Ensure you're punching with a straight wrist and avoid locking your elbows

Begin in a standing position with your knees slightly bent Jump up and while in air, turn your body around so you land facing the opposite direction Jump again immediately upon landing and repeat the movement Aim to land softly to reduce impact on your joints Continue for a set amount of reps or time

Start on your back with your knees bent, feet flat on the floor, and palms resting on the floor beside your head. Push through your palms and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from your knees to your shoulders. Hold the position for a few seconds, then lower yourself back to the starting position. Engage your core and keep your gaze towards the ceiling. Repeat for desired number of repetitions

Sit on the ground with your feet flat and knees bent Place your hands behind you, fingers pointed towards your feet Lift your body off the ground by pushing your hands and feet into the ground Hold this position for a few seconds Lower your body back down to the starting position

Begin by sitting on the ground with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Plant your hands behind you with fingers facing towards your feet Push your body up into a reverse plank position, lifting your hips as high as you can Lift and twist your right hand and arm towards the sky, rotating your torso to the right Return to the starting position and repeat on the left side

Begin in a tabletop position on your hands and knees Extend one arm out to the side at shoulder level Thread the extended arm underneath your body and reach towards the opposite side Rest your shoulder and temple on the floor Hold this position, engaging your core for stability

Start on all fours, with your hands directly under your shoulders and knees directly under your hips Engage your core, tuck your toes under, and lift your hips up and back, stretching into a downward-facing dog pose Bend your knees and lower your hips back down toward the heels for child's pose, keeping your arms extended in front Follow this motion with a scoop through motion to end in a cobra pose Repeat this continuous cycle for the desired amount of repetitions

Stand up straight with your arms by your sides Clench both fists tightly Lift your fists upward until they reach your shoulders Lower your fists back down to your sides in a controlled manner Repeat the movements for multiple reps

Stand straight with both your arms fully extended in front of you, fists clenched tightly With your fists clenched, rotate your wrists as if you were opening a doorknob, first in one direction Then rotate in the opposite direction Repeat this motion for the prescribed amount of reps Ensure that you keep your arms extended throughout the exercise

Stand straight and keep your feet shoulder-width apart Tilt your upper body to one side while keeping your hips stationary Now extend your arms on your sides to add resistance Hold this position for a few seconds Slowly come back to the initial position and repeat for the other side

Lie flat on your back on the floor with your knees bent and your feet flat. Lift your hips off the floor, coming into a bridge. At the top of the bridge, press your knees apart. Slowly bring your knees back together, maintaining the bridge position. Lower your hips back down to the floor. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps.

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise your heels off the floor and balance on your toes Start walking forward on your tiptoes for a designated distance Turn around and walk back the same distance Repeat the process for desired number of sets

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Bend your knees and lower your body into a squatting position Rapidly push off your feet jumping as high as possible Landing softly back into your initial squatting position Repeat the sequence for desired number of reps

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Jump and split your legs apart in the air while simultaneously tapping your feet Land back down into a squat position Repeat this movement for a set amount of repetitions Keep your core tight throughout the movement

Stand tall with your abs pulled in Lift your heels off the ground and balance on the balls of your feet Walk forward in this position, maintaining the balance Continue for a minute or so, then rest Repeat for 3-5 sets

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and start in a punch position Do a regular squat, and as you come up, punch forward with your left, then right hand Lower yourself back into a squat, then punch up forward with your left, then right hand Stay in the squat and punch down to the left and right side alternatively Repeat the entire sequence for your set

Start standing tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Squat down while performing a double punch forward at the bottom Immediately return to standing position, punching overhead Return to the squatting position, punching forward again Continue alternating between top and bottom punches during squats

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Bend your knees slightly and jump up, reaching your arms overhead like you're catching a football Land softly and repeat the jump immediately Continue for your desired amount of reps or time Remember to breathe, inhaling during your jump and exhaling as you land

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your hands full overhead like youre signaling a touchdown Jump up off the ground, while maintaining the Touchdown position with your hands Upon landing, bend your knees slightly to absorb impact Immediately jump again and repeat the steps

Stand tall with arms held out to your sides Walk forward while kicking your leg up to your opposite hand Keep your leg straight as you kick it up Keep alternating legs as you walk across the room Continue for desired amount of time

Perform a series of exercises including: push-ups, squats, lunges, bridges, planks, and tricep dips. Each exercise should be done for 10-15 repetitions. Rest for 1-2 minutes between each exercise. Repeat the circuit two to three times. End the workout with some stretching exercises for cooling down.

Stand inside the trap bar with feet shoulder-width apart Bend your knees slightly and lean forward, keeping your back straight Grip the handles and pull it towards your chest Release the bar and return it to the initial position Repeat the exercise as per your workout routine

Stand inside a trap bar and grab its rods by leaning forward, bending your knees, and taking your hips backward. Raise the bar by straightening your knees and leaning back into an upright position. Hold for a while then return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand inside the trap bar with your feet shoulder-width apart Squat down and grasp the handles of the bar Keep your back straight and lift the weight by pushing through your heels until your legs are fully extended Pause for a moment and then slowly lower the bar back to the floor Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Stand inside the trap bar with feet set hip-width apart Bend at your hips and knees to lower and grab the handles of the trap bar Stand up straight by using your legs to lift the weight Lower the weight carefully to the starting position Repeat the movement for the required number of repetitions

Stand inside the trap bar with feet hip-width apart Bend at your hips and knees and grab the handles Stand up straight while keeping your back flat and chest up, lifting the weight off the ground Walk forward for the desired distance keeping the weight balanced Carefully lower the weights back to the ground by bending at the hips and knees

Stand in the middle of the trap bar Bend at your knees and hips to reach the handles Lift the trap bar by straightening your hips and knees Walk forward for a determined distance while keeping your body upright Lower the trap bar back to the floor in a controlled manner

Stand tall, feet shoulder-width apart, holding the trap bar at shoulder level Press the bar overhead until your arms are fully extended Pause for a moment at the top Lower the bar back to shoulder level in a controlled manner Repeat the movement for desired number of repetitions

Stand between a trap bar with your back straight ad feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the handles of the bar while keeping your arms straight by your side. Raise the bar by lifting your shoulders toward your ears. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand inside the trap bar with your feet hip-width apart Lower your body into a squat, keeping your chest up and your back straight Push through your heels to stand up straight, lifting the bar Pause for a second at the top of the lift Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position
Stand inside the trap bar with feet shoulder width apart Hold the handles at your sides Pull the shoulders upwards towards the ears Hold for a moment at the top Lower back down in a controlled manner

name_en: Tricep Cable Kickback On Crossover Machine
description_en: Stand tall facing a crossover machine, take a step forward, and lean forward by bending your front knee. Grab the cable in one hand by folding your arm and taking your elbow past your back. Pull the cable by straightening your arm behind your back. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Sit on the triceps extension machine with back straight, knees bent, and feet resting on the floor. Place your arms on the platform and grab the handles of the machine while keeping your elbows bent at a 90-degree angle. Push the handles down by extending your arms. As your arms become fully straight, return to the initial position and repeat.

name_en: Tricep Rope Extension On Crossover Machine
description_en: Stand tall facing a crossover machine with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the rope attached to the cable with your elbows near the torso and arms bent at a 90-degree angle. Pull the rope down by straightening your arms. As your arms are fully extended, return to the initial position and repeat.

Begin by hoisting yourself up on parallel bars with your torso perpendicular to the floor. Slowly lower your body by flexing at the elbows maintaining a small forward lean Lower yourself until there is an angle slightly smaller than 90 degrees between the upper arm and the forearm Push your body upwards until your arms are fully extended again Repeat for desired amount of reps.

Stand in front of a dip bar, grab the bars with your palms facing inward. Lower your body by bending your arms, keeping your body close to the bar. Push your body upward by straightening your arms. Pause at the top then repeat.

Start by sitting on the edge of a bench or stable chair Place hands on either side of your body on the bench Maintain straight back as you move your glutes off the bench and lower your body Press back up with your arms until fully extended Repeat steps for desired reps

Sit on the floor, legs in front and hands placed on the floor behind you Push off from the ground, straightening your arms and driving your hips upwards Stop when your arms are straight and your hip is in line with your knee Slowly lower yourself down and repeat

Begin in a seated position with legs extended and hands resting on floor just behind hips Bend your elbows and lower your body until your backside nears the floor Push through your hands and straighten your arms, lifting yourself back to the start position Remember to keep your hips close to your hands while performing the dips Control your speed in both lowering and lifting phases

Start by standing straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Stretch your arms straight out in front of you at shoulder height Step back with one foot and simultaneously lower your body into a lunge while bending your elbows and drawing your hands in towards your chest Extend your arms forward again while stepping your foot forward to the initial position Alternate legs and repeat

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Raise one of your arms while keeping your elbow bent towards the shoulder and grab its elbow with your other hand. Pull the elbow towards the opposite shoulder and hold for some seconds. Return to the initial position and repeat.

Sit on the edge of the bench and position hands either side of your hips Keeping the upper arms straight, push off the bench and slowly lower your body by bending your elbows Lower your body until your upper arms are near parallel to the ground Push your body back up until your arms are straight but not locked Repeat for the desired number of reps

Sit on a bench and place hands next to your hips. Slide your hips off the bench, keeping your back close to the bench. Lower your body by bending your elbows until you feel a slight stretch in your chest or shoulders. Extend your arms, lifting your body back to the starting position. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

Stand upright with feet shoulder-width apart Keep your elbows next to your body Extend your arms down so that they are straight Raise your arms until your elbows bend to about a 90-degree angle Repeat the previous steps in a controlled manner

Stand facing the bar with your feet shoulder-width apart Reach forward and grip the bar with your hands slightly less than shoulder-width apart Lower your body until your upper arms are parallel to the ground Push your body back up until your arms are fully extended Lower your body towards the ground in a controlled manner, repeating the process

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Rotate your torso to the right, lifting your left foot off the floor and hopping on your right foot Immediately repeat the movement to the left, lifting your right foot off the floor and hopping on your left Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions Keep your arms relaxed and swing them naturally with each twist

Stand tall with your feet shoulder width apart. Raise your arms to shoulder height, palms facing down. Rotate your torso and arms to one side, while raising the corresponding knee to waist level. Return to the starting position and do the same on the other side. Repeat the exercise for desired number of reps or time.

Start by sitting on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat Lean back slightly and tuck your hands towards your chest Contract your abs and lift your knees towards your chest Pause for a second at the top of the motion, then lower your knees back down Repeat the motion for your desired amount of repetitions

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Bend your knees and jump up Try to bring your knees as close to your chest as possible while in the air Land softly with your knees slightly bent Immediately jump up again.

Start in a lunge position, left foot forward and right foot backward, with your hands clasped in front of you Quickly switch your legs, jump your right foot forward and your left foot back At the same time, lift your left knee and turn your upper body to the left Repeat this movement quickly, then switch sides and continue with the other leg

Begin standing straight with feet shoulder-width apart Turn to your right and lunge forward, touching your left hand to your right foot Push off your right foot and return to center, standing straight Repeat the movement, this time turning to the left and touching your right hand to your left foot Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions

Start by standing tall with your feet hip-width apart Twist your torso to the right while lifting your left knee to your chest Return to the initial position and repeat the movement, this time twisting to your left and lifting your right knee Continue alternating sides for your desired amount of reps Keep your movements paced to maintain a steady heart rate

Stand with your feet shoulder width apart Twist your torso to one side while lifting the knee of the opposite leg Lower your leg and torso, then repeat on the other side Engage your core throughout the movement Repeat for the desired number of reps

Stand with your feet hip-width apart and arms by your side Quickly jump up, twisting your body 180 degrees mid-air Land softly, with your knees bent slightly Immediately jump again, twisting to face the original starting direction Continue these twists and turns for the desired amount of time

Begin in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart. Twist your torso to your right and at the same time throw a punch with your left arm. Quickly twist in the opposite direction, throwing a punch with your right arm. Continue alternating sides for the duration of the exercise.

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms out to your sides at shoulder height With one quick, swift motion twist your torso to one side Return to the starting position and then twist on the other side Continue the exercise while flexing your chest muscles during the twisting motion

Lay flat on your back, with legs raised at a 90-degree angle Place your hands behind your head, elbows bent Lift your upper body off the ground and twist, bringing your right elbow towards your left knee Return to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the process, bringing your left elbow towards your right knee

Lay on your back with your hands behind your head and knees raised, keeping the lower leg parallel to the floor Lift your upper body off the floor and twist your upper body to the right while trying to touch your right elbow to your left knee Return to the start position in a controlled manner Repeat the motion, now twisting to the left Repeat the procedure for the desired number of reps switching sides for each rep

Start by standing upright with your feet hip-width apart Step your right foot forward, bending your knee to a 90-degree angle Rotate your upper body to the right, reaching your left hand forward and your right hand back Hold this position for a moment, then return to the starting position Repeat with the other leg

Lie down flat on your back with your legs extended Raise your legs and twist them to one side Lower your legs back down to the middle Repeat the process, this time twisting your legs to the opposite side Continue alternating sides for your desired number of reps

Lie down on your back with your arms by your sides Raise your legs up towards the ceiling while keeping them straight Twist your hips to one side, lifting the corresponding leg higher Slowly return to the center position Repeat the movement while twisting towards the other side

Start in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms at your sides with palms facing inward Lift your arms to shoulder height, rotating your palms to face the floor Lower your arms back to the starting position, rotate your palms back to the starting position

Lie on the floor with your shoulder blades pressed against the ground Bend your knees and keep your feet flat on the floor Lift your hips off the floor and twist your hips to the right Lower your hips back down and repeat the movement on the left side Continue alternating sides for the duration of the set

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground Place your hands loosely behind your head or on the sides of your head Lift your upper body off the ground while rotating your upper body to one side Lower back down in a controlled manner, and repeat on the other side Continue to alternate sides

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Place your hands behind your head for support but avoid pulling on your neck. Raise your upper body while twisting one elbow towards the opposite knee. Lower yourself back down and repeat, this time twisting to the opposite knee. Alternate this process for each rep.

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Extend your arms straight with palms facing down Twist your torso to one side, lifting your shoulder blades off the floor Lower back down to the starting position Repeat on the opposite side

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Extend your arms straight out, parallel to the floor. Lift your shoulders off the floor and twist your body to bring your right hand towards your left knee. Lower back down in a controlled manner. Repeat on the other side to complete a single rep.

Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise one knee and twist your torso so that the opposite elbow comes towards the raised knee Return to the starting position and repeat with the opposite knee and elbow Keep your abdominals engaged during the entire exercise Ensure each knee-elbow cross occurs in a diagonal pattern

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Raise your right knee towards your left elbow, twisting your torso Return to the starting position Repeat the movement on your left side towards your right elbow Continue alternating sides for a set amount of time.

Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart. Lift your right knee and rotate your torso towards it. Return to the original position and do the same with your left knee. Repeat the move for your desired number of reps. Maintain a steady rhythm during the exercise.

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Raise your right knee as high as you can while twisting your torso to the right Return to the starting position and repeat the movement but twist to the left with your left knee Continue alternating sides for the duration of your workout

Start in a squat position with your hands close to your right knee Bring your hands upwards in a swift motion as if you were swinging an axe Twist your torso while maintaining a slight bend in your knees End the motion over your left shoulder Slowly return to the starting position and repeat before switching sides
Stand straight, feet shoulder-width apart Lift your right knee to your chest Simultaneously twist your torso towards the right Return to the starting position Repeat the exercise on the left side

name_en: Twist Knee Raise Side Step Jack
description_en: Stand straight with feet shoulder-width apart Raise one knee towards the opposite elbow while twisting your torso Immediately shift weight to the other foot while stepping to the side Hop back to the middle with feet together Repeat with the other knee and direction

Start by standing upright with your feet shoulder-width apart With your arms bent and hands in a fist, start marching on the spot While marching, twist your torso to the right as you lift your left knee, then twist to the left as you lift your right knee Keep your motion fluid and control your breathing Maintain this for at least a minute or two then rest and repeat

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, with your hands up in a guard position Pivot on your back foot and twist your torso to the front As you twist, extend your back arm in a punching motion Immediately switch your stance and repeat the motion on the other side Keep switching sides and increasing speed

Start in a traditional push-up position As you lower your body, turn it to one side Push your body back up while returning it back to the centre Repeat the movement, this time lowering your body and turning to the other side Continue alternating sides until the set is complete

Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet on the floor. Place your hands behind your head, elbows flared out. As you sit up, twist your upper body so that your left elbow moves towards your right knee. Slowly lay back down, returning to starting position. Repeat the movement, but this time twist your upper body so your right elbow moves towards your left knee.

Start in a standing position with your legs shoulder-width apart Lower your body into a regular squat position As you come up, twist your torso to one side Repeat the squat and when you ascend, twist to the opposite side Continue to alternate sides

Start in a standing position with your feet roughly shoulder width apart Step back with one foot, landing on the ball of your foot and bending both knees into a lunge position Simultaneously twist your torso towards the front leg side Push through your front foot to return back to the starting position Alternate with your other foot and repeat for desired repetitions.

Stand tall with your feet around hip-width apart Slowly twist your hips from left to right maintaining an upright posture Extend each twist to a comfortable range of motion Pause for a moment at the end of each twist before returning to the center Repeat this sequence for your desired duration

Lie flat on your stomach with your arms and legs fully extended Raise your arm and opposite leg off the floor simultaneously, while rotating your torso Hold the position briefly, then lower your limbs back to the floor Repeat with the opposite arm and leg Ensure to keep your head and neck in neutral position throughout the movement

Stand straight with feet hip-width apart Rotate your upper body to the right, pushing against an imaginary resistance as if you're chopping wood with an axe Rotate your body in the opposite direction Engage your core and hold the position for a moment Repeat the move to the left
Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Turn your torso to one side and lift your knee towards your chest Switch sides and repeat the movement Ensure to engage your abs throughout the exercise

Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent Hold the imaginary ball in front of your chest Twist your torso to the right, turning your right foot as you do so, and pretend to toss the imaginary ball over your right shoulder Quickly rotate your torso to the left, pivoting on your right foot, and act as if catching the imaginary ball over your left shoulder Immediately twist and pretend to slam the ball down at your right foot

Stand with your feet hip-width apart Hold your arms forward, pull them back and twist your body Release your arms and slam down, turning your body in the opposite direction Bring your body back to the starting position Repeat the motion switching sides each time

Stand straight with your legs shoulder-width apart Inhale deeply and extend your arms above your head Exhale while bending forward, and try to touch your toes with your fingers Hold this position for several seconds Slowly stand back up while inhaling

name_en: Two Legs Hammer Curl with Towel
description_en: Stand upright holding a towel with both hands at the ends Flex your elbows, pulling the towel up toward your chest Lower the towel back to the starting position in a controlled manner Keep your elbows close to your body throughout the motion

name_en: Two Legs Reverse Biceps Curl with Towel
description_en: Hold the towel at both ends with extended arms in front of you Lean back slightly to balance your body weight Use the biceps to curl your body up by bending the elbows Hold the position for a moment Slowly release and return to the starting position

Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Extend your arms straight out to the sides at shoulder height Clench your fists, then rotate them in a circular motion Keep the circle draw small and controlled Perform the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Start by hanging from a pull-up bar with an underhand grip Bend your knees and raise them up towards your chest Hold for a second when your knees reach your chest Lower your legs back down in a controlled motion Repeat the movement for your desired amount of reps

Position yourself under a bar or a piece of equipment that is sturdy enough to handle your body weight Grasp the bar with your hands shoulder-width apart using an underhand grip Pull your chest towards the bar while keeping a straight back Hold the position momentarily then slowly lower yourself back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Grasp the bar with one hand in a pull-up position and the other in a chin-up position Engage your core and pull up until your chest reaches the bar Hold for a moment at the top Lower your body in a controlled manner back to the starting position Switch the positioning of your hands and repeat the exercise

Find an open area where you can move your body freely Transition between a standing position to a sitting position, then down onto your hands and knees Push your body up into a plank position, then push your hips up into a pyramid shape Reverse the movement by lowering your hips, then your chest, and finally your knees Stand back up and repeat this sequence for multiple reps

Stand up straight with your fists clenched and elbows bent Step in place while simultaneously throwing an uppercut motion with alternate hands Ensure that you're using your hips and torso to generate the punch, not just your arms Continue the activity for the set duration of time Keep your core engaged throughout to maintain balance

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab a barbell over your thighs with an overhand grip, straight arms, and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell towards your chest by folding your arms and taking your elbows over the shoulders. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall on a resistance band with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the ends of the band near your thighs with straight arms, and your palms facing downward. Stretch the band by taking your hands towards the chest while folding your arms and taking your elbows over the shoulders. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart. Grab an EZ barbell over your thighs with an overhand grip, straight arms, and hands placed shoulder-width apart. Raise the barbell towards your chest by folding your arms and opening your elbows wide over the shoulders.

Stand upright with your feet spread out wider than shoulder-width apart Bend at the knees and lower your body until your thighs are parallel with the floor Raise your arms while in the squat position Rise back to the starting position while lowering your arms Pause and then repeat the exercise

Sit on a stool facing a pull-down machine with your back straight and feet resting on the floor. Grab a V bar by raising your arms straight overhead. Pull the towards the chest by folding your arms. As your elbows meet your torso, return to the initial position and repeat.

Lie down on your back with your legs straight together in front of you and your arms straight overhead Bring your arms and legs towards each other while raising your torso off the floor Try to reach your feet with your hands and return to the initial position

Grasp the parallel bars with your hands and hold your body at arms length above them Raise your legs straight or slightly bent towards the front until hips are entirely flexed Lower your legs back down to the original position in a controlled movement Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand between parallel bars, gripping them tightly Keep your body upright and your feet together Raise your knees towards your chest Pause briefly, then lower your legs back to the starting position Repeat the motion

Lie flat on your back with legs fully extended and hands behind your head Raise your body towards your knees while keeping your legs straight Hold for a second at the top of movement Slowly lower your body back to starting position Repeat for the desired amount of reps

Sit on a mat with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor. Lean back slightly to engage your core muscles Raise your legs so your knees are at a 90 degree angle Extend your arms in front of you, parallel to the ground Hold this position for as long as you can, making sure your back is straight and your chin is neutral Return to the starting position and rest before repeating

Stand on the vibrate plate with feet shoulder-width apart. Take a step forward with one foot and lower your body into a lunge. Hold the lunge position for a few seconds, letting the vibration of the plate work your muscles. Stand up and return your foot to the original position. Repeat this lunge movement with your other foot.

Place your forearms on the vibration plate pad, keep your feet on the ground Align your body into a straight plank position Keep your abs engaged and your neck neutral Hold the position for 30-60 seconds Gradually, lower your body back to the starting position

Stand on the vibrating plate, feet shoulder-width apart Bend your knees slightly, maintaining good posture Hold your hands on your hips Keep your core engaged and maintain this position Stop and step off the plate after the designated time

Sit in front of a wall with your legs extended. Lean your upper body back while keeping it straight and try to make a 'V' shape. Hold this position while keeping your abs and hip flexors engaged. Hold it as long as you can while breathing. Slowly regain your ordinary sitting position

Start by sitting on the ground with your knees bent Lift your legs off the ground to form a V shape with your body Twist your torso and punch across your body with your right hand, repeat on the left side Continue alternating punches while in the V sit position Hold for the desired time or do the desired amount of repetitions

Sit on the floor with your knees bent Lean back slightly and lift your feet off the ground Straighten your legs while keeping your torso angled back Hold this position for as long as you can Slowly lower your feet back to the ground

Sit on the floor, with legs extended, lean back slightly, engage your core and lift your feet to bring your body into a 'V' shape. While in this position, reach your left hand towards your right foot, then return to the initial 'V' shape. Repeat the aforementioned movement with your right hand towards your left foot. Repeat this alternation for the desired number of repetitions. Make sure to keep your core engaged throughout the whole movement.

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hands on your hips. Jump forward into a V shape, landing with one foot forward. Jump back to the starting position. Repeat the same movement with the other foot forward. Continue alternating sides for the designated amount of time or repetitions.

Lie on your back with your arms and legs extended and resting on the floor Simultaneously lift your torso and legs up to touch your feet with your hands Slowly lower your body back to the starting position Repeat this movement for a set number of repetitions Try to keep your legs and arms straight throughout the exercise
Start by lying flat on your back Lift your legs and torso at the same time, keeping both straight Reach your hands towards your feet, creating a V shape Lower your body down slowly Repeat the steps

Begin by lying flat on your back with arms extended above your head Simultaneously lift your legs and upper body up, reaching your hands towards your toes Squeeze your abdominal muscles at the top position Lower your body back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the movements

Lie on your back with your legs extended and arms straight over your head Lift both your upper body and lower body simultaneously to form a V-shape Touch your hands to your toes or as near as possible Hold this position for a moment Slowly lower your body back to the starting position

Start by sitting on the stability ball, then roll down until your lower back is supported by the ball Place your hands behind your head while keeping your legs stretched out and your heels touching the floor Pull your upper body up towards your legs while bending your legs towards your chest Hold the position when your legs and torso form a V shape Lower your body and legs back down in a controlled manner, and repeat

Start by lying on your back with your legs straight and arms extended overhead, holding the stability ball Raise your legs and reach the ball towards your feet, lifting your shoulders off the ground in a 'V' shape Lower your legs and arms back down to the floor repositioning the ball overhead Repeat the motion maintaining control and balance

Lie down on your back on the floor Lift your legs and torso at the same time, to form a V shape with your body Reach your hands towards your feet Hold this position for a few seconds Slowly lower your body back to the initial position

Lie on your back with your legs fully extended and your arms stretched out above your head Lift your legs and torso off the ground and reach your hands towards your feet Keep your legs and arms straight throughout the move Hold this position for a few seconds Lower your body back down to the starting position slowly

Start lying flat on your back with your arms and legs fully extended. Simultaneously lift your torso and legs, bending at the waist to form a 'V' shape. Reach forward and clap your hands under your legs. Return back to the starting position in a slow and controlled manner. Repeat the movement for desired repetitions.

Lie down on your back with your legs and arms spread out Gather momentum and lift both your hands and legs simultaneously gathering them together above your body Attempt to clap your hands around your raised legs while keeping your legs straight Slowly lower your hands and legs back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Step onto the cross trainer and hold the handles Start moving your legs on the elliptical path Increase the resistance to a level that you're comfortable with Maintain a steady rhythm by synchronizing leg and hand movements Continue for your preferred length of time

Start by stepping onto the machine and grab the handles. Set an appropriate resistance level. Begin your exercise by pushing the pedals in a smooth elliptical motion. Keep your back straight and grip the handles, moving them back and forth in sync with your strides. Make sure to maintain a smooth and continuous movement throughout the exercise.

Begin by standing tall, with your feet hip-width apart Place your right foot forward, step down onto your right foot, moving your body weight onto this leg Move your left foot to the front, shift your body weight onto this foot Repeat with the left foot Continue the walking motion at a comfortable pace

Find a flat, open area where you can walk unhindered Stand straight, keep your eyes forward, and your shoulder relaxed Walk by moving one foot forward followed by the next, ensuring you roll your foot from heel to toe Swing your arms in unison with your steps Increase your pace gradually for more intensity

Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart Step forward with your right foot and lower your body into a lunge At the same time, lift your left knee towards your chest Return your left leg to the floor and immediately step forward with your left foot into a lunge while lifting your right knee Repeat this motion, alternating legs, for your desired number of reps

Stand upright, feet together. Take a step forward with your right leg, lowering your hips towards the floor by bending both knees to a 90-degree angle. Push up through your right heel to rise back up and bring your left foot forward so you've completed the step. Do the same move with your left leg stepping forward. Repeat this movement for the desired number of steps or time duration.

Stand upright and take a step forward with right foot Lower your body until your right knee is at 90 degrees Push off with your right foot and bring your left foot forward to starting position Repeat on the left side Continue alternating legs throughout the exercise
Place your feet on the pedals and hold the handles Start moving your legs in a gliding motion Maintain a straight posture Keep a steady pace and push through your heels for the best results

Start the treadmill and gradually increase the speed to comfortable walking pace Increase the incline level of the treadmill to a challenging but sustainable level Walk on the treadmill at this incline for a set duration Keep your back straight and your core engaged while walking After reaching your set duration, gradually decrease the incline and speed to cool down

Begin by standing on the sides of the treadmill, turn it on, and set your incline level Step onto the belt and start walking, keeping your hands on the sides or front bar for balance Maintain a brisk pace. Remember to pump your arms while you walk Keep your back straight and shoulders back, look forward rather than down at your feet After your session, gradually decrease your incline to a level surface before stopping

Stand upright on the steps of the Leverage machine Start walking, alternating your steps Maintain a steady rhythm Keep your back straight during the exercise Walk for a specified duration or until fatigue

Step onto the stepmill and hold on to the handles for balance Start at a slow pace and gradually increase as you get comfortable Keep your back straight and engage your core Align your feet on each step, putting weight onto your heels When you reach your desired number of steps, slow down the pace before stepping off the machine

Start by stepping onto the treadmill and correctly positioning your feet on the side platforms. Set the speed to a comfortable setting. Hold onto the handles or the front console for support. Walk at a steady pace keeping your back straight and your shoulders relaxed. Incrementally increase the speed or incline for more intensity as you continue the workout.

Start the treadmill at a slow pace, standing upright Increase the speed gradually to a comfortable walking pace Walk with a regular gait, keeping your back straight Gradually increase the incline for more resistance Cool down with a slow pace after exercise

Stand straight with your feet hip wide apart Lift your right leg straight up and touch your toes with your left hand Lower your leg back and repeat the process for your left leg, touching your toes with your right hand Keep alternating legs for the duration of your workout Try to keep your back straight during the entire motion
Stand tall and then place your hands on the floor in front of your toes Walk your hands forward gradually as far as you can Slowly walk them back to the starting position and repeat

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart, holding your dog's leash Start with a moderate pace walk, gradually accelerating Maintain an upright posture throughout Avoid twisting your torso too much as you walk Decelerate your walk gradually before coming to a stop

Stand on the machine with your feet shoulder width apart Push one foot down while lifting the other Keep your strides steady and rhythmic Maintain an upright stance throughout the exercise Stop the machine to dismount when finished

Step onto the wave machine and grip the handles Set your preferred resistance level Move your legs in an alternating pattern, as if you were walking Use the handles for balance, not to pull yourself up Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise

Stand facing a wall at about an arms length away Place your hands on the wall slightly wider than your shoulders Walk your feet backwards until your body is leaning towards the wall at an angle Hold this position by engaging your core muscles Return back to the standing position after holding the pose for a few seconds

Stand against a wall with your feet hip-width apart Bend your elbows to a 90-degree angle and press your palms into the wall Keeping your body against the wall, twist your waist to one side Return to the center and repeat on the other side Continue for desired amount of reps

Stand up straight against a wall, facing away Place your hands palms-down on the wall, shoulder-width apart Bend your elbows and lower your upper body towards the wall in a controlled motion Push back up until your arms are straight, taking care not to lock your elbows Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand in front of a wall with enough distance to extend your arms Stretch out one leg to the side while keeping the other straight Perform a side lunge towards your stretched out leg Reach the same arm towards the wall while rotating your torso Get back to the standing position in a controlled fashion

Stand up against a wall, with your back flat against it Walk your feet out in front of you until they're about 2 feet away from the wall Lower your body by sliding down the wall until your thighs are parallel to the floor and your knees are directly over your ankles Hold this position for the desired amount of time Push back up against the wall to return to the standing position

Stand tall 2 feet from a wall with your feet shoulder-width apart and lean backward to support your back against the wall. Place your arms against the wall and lower your hips by sliding your back on the wall. As your thighs come parallel to the floor, maintain this position for suitable time.

Stand with your back pressing against the wall Walk your feet forward leaving about a 2 feet distance Slide your back down the wall, bending your knees until they're at a 90 degree angle Hold this position for the desired time Slowly straighten your legs and slide up the wall to return to the standing position

Stand tall 2 feet from a wall with your feet shoulder-width apart and lean backward to support your back against the wall. Place your arms against the wall and lower your hips by sliding your back on the wall. As your thighs come parallel to the floor, return to the initial position, and repeat.

Stand tall 2 feet from a wall with your feet shoulder-width apart and lean backward to support your back against the wall. Place your arms against the wall and lower your hips by sliding your back on the wall. As your thighs come parallel to the floor, pause for some seconds then return to the initial position, and repeat.

Start in a high plank position with your feet against a wall Begin to walk your feet up the wall while moving your hands towards the wall Continue until you're in a handstand position against the wall Walk your hands out while lowering your feet down the wall to return to a high plank

Start by standing upright with feet hip-width apart Step forward with one foot until your leg reaches a 90-degree angle Maintain balance and keep the other leg stationary behind you, stretched out Lower your hips so that your front knee is directly over your ankle with your other knee pointing towards the floor Switch legs and repeat this for six reps each

Start in a standing position, with your feet hip-width apart Extend your arms alongside your ears Take a deep breath and lift one leg off the ground and extend it behind you Keeping your body in a straight line, tilt your torso forward until it's parallel to the ground Hold for a few breaths, then return to the starting position and repeat with the other leg

name_en: Weighted Bag Half Squat High Pull
description_en: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart Hold the weighted bag at waist height Perform a half squat then explosively come up while lifting the bag to your chest level Lower the bag back to the initial position, then repeat Maintain your back straight throughout

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the weighted bag with both hands Extend your arms in front of you, keeping a slight bend in your elbows Spin the bag in a circular motion around your waist, keeping your core engaged After a set number of spins in one direction, reverse the direction Keep your legs and hips steady throughout the movement

Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and hold the weighted bag with both hands Swing the weighted bag to your right, rotate your torso as you do so Bring the bag back to the center and immediately swing it to your left, rotating your torso again Keep your hips and legs steady as you swing and rotate Repeat for desired reps

Stand with feet shoulder width apart, holding the weighted bag with both hands Bend at the knees into a squat, keeping the bag at chest height As you stand up, twist your torso to one side lifting the bag diagonally across your body Lower yourself back into a squat while bringing the weighted bag back to your chest Repeat the movement, this time twisting on the other side

Sit on the edge of the captain's chair with your back against the backrest. Place your forearms on the armrests and grip the handles. Place a weight between your ankles and lift your knees towards your chest. Kick your legs out straight in front of you, then slowly bring them back in. Repeat the movement.

Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and the loaded chain or barbell on the ground in front of you Bend at the hips and knees, keeping your back straight, to grab the weighted chain or barbell Push with your heels and straighten your hips and knees to lift the weight up Lower the weight back down by bending at the hips and knees Repeat this process for the desired amount of reps

Secure a weight belt around your waist Stand beneath a chin-up bar and hold it with a grip that is slightly more narrow than shoulder width Raise your body upwards by bending at your elbows until your chin is above the bar Pause briefly at the top, then lower your body back to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat this movement for desired amount of reps

Stand in front of the counterweight bar, with your feet approximately shoulder-width apart. Grip the bar with both hands, palms facing forward. Slowly lower yourself into a squat as you inhale, keeping your back straight and ensuring your knees do not extend past your toes. Push up from your heels to a standing position as you exhale, squeezing your glutes. Repeat this movement for the required number of reps.

Stand tall with your feet set hip width apart holding weights in both hands Engage your core and begin to push your hips back as you bend your knees Lower yourself into a squat until your thighs are parallel to the ground Push through your heels to stand back up Repeat for a set number of reps

Lie down on your back on a mat with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor Hold a weight or a weighted plate directly above your chest with both hands Lift your upper body towards your knees with a crunch, keeping your lower back grounded Hold for a moment at the top and then lower yourself back down

While holding a weight, lie back onto a decline bench and secure your legs at the top of the pad Once in position, begin to roll your shoulders forward At the top of the lift, exhale and squeeze your abdominal muscles Lower and inhale Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Secure your feet at the end of the decline bench and lie down. With your hands holding a weight at your chest, push the small of your back down into the bench. Begin to roll your shoulders off the bench, contract your abdominal muscles and come up until your shoulders are directly over your hips. Lower back down slowly to the starting position.

Adjust the decline bench to an appropriate angle Lie down on the decline bench with the weights held at your chest Bend your waist and raise your upper body towards your knees Lower your body back to the starting position in a controlled motion Repeat the movement for the desired amount of reps

Start by lying on a decline bench with your legs secured at the top. Hold a weight to your chest with both hands. Perform a sit-up and as you reach the top, twist to one side. Lower yourself back down to the start position in a controlled manner. Repeat on the other side for the next rep.

name_en: Weighted Dumbbell Lying Flat Hip Raise
description_en: Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Keep a dumbbell in each hand at your side. Push through your heel and raise your hips off the ground while keeping your back straight. Engage your abdominals while lifting your hips to create a straight line from your knees to shoulders. Hold this position at the top for a moment before slowly lowering your hips back down. Repeat this process for the desired amount of repetitions.

name_en: Weighted Dumbbell Lying Flat Hip Raise
