description_en: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent Hold a dumbbell at arm's length above your chest Tighten your abs and raise your hips off the floor Hold for a moment, then slowly lower your hips back to the starting position Repeat for the recommended number of reps

Face a sturdy wall and place an exercise ball between your back and the wall. Keep your feet shoulder-width apart, about a foot from the wall. Bend your knees and lower yourself down until your thighs are parallel with the ground. Push your body back up to the starting position. Repeat the movement for your desired number of reps.

Start in a push-up position with your forearms on the ground. Place the weight on your lower back, ensuring it is secure and comfortable. Lift your body off the ground maintaining a straight line from your head to your heels. Keep your abs and glutes contracted as you hold the plank position for a prescribed time. Lower yourself back onto the ground in a controlled manner to release the pose.

Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended, and your palms facing your body Elevate your arms forwards until they are almost at the level of your shoulders Maintain a slight bend in your elbows to avoid any stress at the biceps tendon Lower your arms back to the starting position in controlled motion Repeat

Stand straight with feet at shoulder width and hold weights in each hand in front of your thighs Breathe out and raise the weights in front of you until they're at shoulder height Pause momentarily Breathe in and slowly lower the weights back to the initial position Repeat for desired repetitions

Stand upright with a weight in each hand, arms fully extended, and feet shoulder-width apart Raise the weights out in front of you to shoulder height Hold this position for a few seconds Lower the weights back to your sides Repeat this movement for your desired number of reps

Stand up straight with a weight in each hand, arms fully extended, and palms facing your body Keeping your arms straight, lift the weights out and up in a semi circular motion to your shoulder level At the top of the lift, your palms should be facing down Lower the weights back down to the starting position in a controlled movement Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Stand with feet hip width apart on an elevated surface holding a barbell across your upper back Squat down by pushing your knees to the sides while keeping your back straight Go as deep as you can and then push back up to the starting position Ensure your hips move straight up and down Maintain your balance and control the movement at all times

name_en: Weighted Hammer Grip Pull-up on Dip Cage
description_en: Secure the weight around your waist using a dip belt Hold the parallel bars of the dip machine with your palms facing each other Pull yourself up until your chin is over the bar Lower yourself down slowly until your arms are fully extended Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Attach the weights securely to your body Hold the bar with palms facing you, shoulder-width apart Pull yourself up until your chin is over the bar Hold for a second at the top position Lower yourself down slowly and under control

Hang from a bar with a neutral grip Keep your legs straight in front of you and hold a weight between your feet Raise your hips and rotate your pelvis to lift your legs Lower your legs down in a controlled manner

Attach a weight to your ankles and hang from a bar with your legs fully extended Contract your abs to raise your legs and hips towards your chest Hold for a moment, then slowly return to the starting position Repeat the movement for the desired amount of reps

Securely hold a dumbbell between your feet Hang from a pull-up bar with your legs fully extended Raise your legs up to a 90-degree angle while keeping them straight Lower your legs back down in a controlled movement Repeat the movement

Position the weight across your hips Lower your body by bending at the hips Push your hips upward by extending your hips Hold at the top for a moment, engaging your glutes Slowly lower back down to the starting position

Lie on your back on the floor, and hold a weight plate over your chest with both hands Bend your knees and raise your legs so your calves are parallel to the floor Tighten your abs and raise your upper body until your shoulder blades are off floor Hold this position for a few seconds Lower yourself back down

Position yourself over a stability ball, waist on the apex of the ball Anchor your feet securely, legs at a 90-degree angle Hold a weight and extend it out in front of your body Lower the torso as far as comfortably possible Return to the starting position by flexing your lower-back to raise your torso

Position yourself on the hyperextension bench with your ankles secured Hold a weight plate or dumbbell in front of you Lower your torso, bending from the hip joint Raise your torso using your lower back muscles until your body is parallel to the floor Lower yourself back to the start position in a controlled manner

Position yourself on the hyperextension bench with your waist snug against the pad Hold a weight plate to your chest or behind your head Lower your upper body down, bending at the hips, until nearly perpendicular to the floor Pull your body up using your lower back muscles until your body forms a straight line Pause at the top for a moment, then lower back down

Set up a bar in a rack at waist height and add the needed weight Stand facing the bar and grab it with an overhand grip Pull your chest up to the bar, keeping your body straight Lower your body back down in a slow, controlled motion Repeat this movement for the set number of repetitions

Sit down in front of the stability ball with your back to it Lean backward onto the ball while extending your legs in front of you Lift your torso up by contracting your abs and pulling your body upwards Lower your body back to the starting position Repeat the movement for the desired repetitions

Stand straight holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides Step forward with one leg, lowering your hips until both knees are bent at about a 90-degree angle Push off with your front foot to return to standing while simultaneously swing the weights upward to shoulder level Repeat this movement, alternating legs

Strap on the head harness and attach the desired weight Lie on your back with your head hanging off the edge of a bench Lower your head towards the floor as much as your flexibility allows Raise your head by extending your neck to return to the starting position

Start by lying down on your back, ensuring your head hangs off the edge of the bench Hold the weight plate on your forehead with both hands Lower your head as far back as comfortably possible Lift your head up until your chin touches your chest Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions

Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Place the head harness on your head and attach the weight Slowly lower your head backwards until your neck is fully extended Raise your neck upward until your chin is almost touching your chest Pause for a moment and then slowly start to lower your head back again Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Lie down on your side with your head off the edge of a bench Attach a weight to a head harness and put it on Start with your head in neutral position, then tilt it as far as comfortably possible toward your upper shoulder Slowly return your head to the starting position in a controlled manner Repeat for the desired number of reps. Switch sides and repeat the exercise

Lie on your back with your arms outstretched to the sides Hold a weight in both hands and raise it above your chest Bend your knees and lift your feet off the floor Slowly twist your waist to bring the weight to one side Return to the center and then twist to the other side

Sit on the stability ball holding a weight at your chest Walk feet forward, allowing the ball to roll under your back With hips stable, perform a crunch motion, lifting your chest towards the ceiling Pause at the top of the movement Slowly lower your body back to the starting position

Stand with feet shoulder-width apart holding a weighted plate in both hands Bend over at the hips, keeping your spine neutral and knees slightly bent Pull the plate towards your chest, retracting your shoulder blades Hold briefly, then slowly lower the plate back to the starting position Repeat for the required number of repetitions

Hold a weight plate with both hands at your chest Stand with feet wider than hip-width apart Shift your weight into one leg, bending the knee until it's over the toes as you push your hips back Return to the standing position and repeat on the other side Continue to alternate between the legs

Sit on a decline bench with a weighted plate in each hand. Lower the weights down to your chest. Push the weights up until your arms are fully extended. Lower the weights back to your chest position in a controlled manner. Repeat the motion.

Lie down on your back with knees bent, feet flat on the ground, holding the weighted plate on your chest Use your abs to crunch up, lifting your shoulder blades off the ground Hold for a second at the top then slowly lower back to the start position Make sure to keep tension on the abs throughout Do not pull your neck, make sure the strain is on the abs, not the neck

Hold a weight plate in each hand with your arms fully extended at your sides Stand lunge-length in front of a sturdy bench Place the toes of your back leg on the bench behind you Lower your body until your front leg is parallel to the floor Push upward, extending your front leg back to the starting position

name_en: Weighted Plates Bulgarian Split Squat with the Ring
description_en: Stand with your back to a sturdy bench Hold a weighted plate in each hand Extend one leg backward and rest it on the bench Lower your body by bending the knee of your front leg until your thigh is parallel to the ground Return to the standing position by pushing through the heel of your front foot

name_en: Weighted Plate Standing Around the World
description_en: Start in a standing position, arms fully extended with a weighted plate held in both hands Lift the weighted plate above your head in a controlled circular movement Keep the movement fluid, moving the plate around your head, back down to starting position Repeat this motion for a set number of times or until you reach your desired exhaustion level Ensure to do this exercise in both clockwise and counter-clockwise directions for balanced muscle development

Stand up straight with a weighted plate in each hand at arms length. This will be your starting position. Keep your elbows close to your torso at all times. Hold the upper arms stationary while curling the weights while contracting your biceps as you breathe out. Tip: Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the weights are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a brief moment as you squeeze your biceps. Slowly begin to bring the weights back to original position as you breathe in. Repeat the movement for the recommended amount of repetitions.

Hold a weighted plate in your hands with a firm grip Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart Twist your wrists to rotate the plate in one direction Pause at maximum rotation, then twist your wrists in the opposite direction to rotate the plate the other way Repeat the movement for your desired number of repetitions

Stand straight holding a weighted plate in each hand at your sides Keeping your torso stationary, lift the plates to your side with a slight bend on your elbows Continue to go up until your arms are parallel to the floor Pause at the top for a second and then begin to lower the plates back down Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart Hold the weighted plate in both hands at your chest Extend your arms to lift the plate above your head Pause at the top then lower the plate back to your chest Repeat for your desired number of repetitions

Sit on a flat bench with your feet flat on the floor and your knees at right angles. Place a weighted plate onto your feet, over the top of your laces. While keeping your feet flat, raise the plate by pointing your toes upwards. Hold this position for a moment, then slowly lower the plate back down.

Secure a weight belt around your waist and attach the desired weight Reach up and grab the pull-up bar with palms facing away from you Pull yourself upward until your chin is above the bar Lower yourself back down in a controlled motion to the start position Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps

Position yourself face down on the floor, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Have your weighted vest secure and ready. Push up from the ground, fully extending your arms, aiming to lift your body weight plus the weight of the vest. Lower yourself until your chest almost touches the floor. Push your body back up to the starting position. Repeat the movement for the desired amount of reps.

Stand straight with a weighted plate/dumbbell in both hands Raise your arms laterally until they reach shoulder height Keep your elbows slightly bent as to not strain your joints Rotate your arms in a circular motion Slowly lower your arms down

Sit on the floor with legs extended and lifted up, knees slightly bent Hold your weighted object firmly at your chest level Rotate your torso to the right, trying to bring the weight toward the ground near your body Return to the neutral position, then rotate to the left Continue to alternate sides for each rep

Sit on the ground with your knees bent, pull your abs to your spine, and lean back a few inches while keeping your back straight. Hold a weighted object with both hands at your chest, and then lean back so your torso is at a 45 degree angle. Twist your torso to the right, then to the left to complete one rep. Keep your abs engaged as you twist to the left and right. Avoid leaning too far back.

Sit on a bench and secure the head harness around your forehead. Attach the desired weight to the head harness. Bend your head forward until your chin touches your chest. Raise your head backward until your face is looking toward the ceiling. Slowly return to the starting position.

Sit straight on a bench, hold the weighted plate in both hands at chest level Slowly push the weight straight out in front of you until your arms are fully extended Hold the position for a moment and then slowly bring the weight back to your chest Repeat the movements for your desired number of reps and sets

name_en: Weighted Seated Tuck Crunch on Floor
description_en: Sit down on the floor with your legs extended in front of you Hold a weight and keep it close to your chest Bend your knees and pull them towards your chest while leaning back slightly Return to the starting position by lowering your knees and leaning forward Repeat the movement for your desired number of reps

Position yourself on the stability ball so you're sitting up straight Hold the weight to one side of your body Slowly bend towards the side where the weight is, keeping your body stable Return to the original position Repeat the process on the other side

Lie flat on your back on an exercise mat, legs extended in front of you Bend one knee and keep the other leg straight Raise the straight leg off the floor, keeping it in line with your body and with the ankle of your bent leg Slowly lower your straight leg and repeat, then switch to the other leg

Hold your weight in front of your chest with your hands at shoulder width apart Lower your body by bending your knees forward while keeping your back straight Hold this position for a moment then return to the start position Ensure that the heels of your feet remain on the ground throughout the exercise Repeat the exercise for the desired number of reps

Hold a weight plate close to your chest. Lower yourself by bending your knees while keeping your body straight. Go as low as you can while keeping your knees behind your toes. Push yourself back up by extending your knees. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Stand tall with weights in both hands, arms fully extended. Keep your elbows close to your torso at all times. Curl the weights while contracting your biceps. Continue the movement until your biceps are fully contracted and the weights are at shoulder level. Slowly begin to bring the weights back to starting position.

Stand up straight with dumbbell in each hand, arms fully extended with palms facing forward from the body. Elbows should be close to the torso Slowly curl the weights while keeping the upper arms stationary, continue to lift the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeeze your biceps Slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Attach a weight to the harness, adjust to ensure it's securely fastened around your head Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart and the weight hanging in front of your chest Lower your head forwards slowly, moving only at the neck Raise your head back up to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the weight in both hands. Extend your arms straight in front of you at chest level. Twist your torso to the right as far as you can, keeping your arms extended and parallel to the ground. Twist your torso back to the center and then to the left as far as you can. Repeat the movements in a controlled manner.

Stand with a weight in each hand at your sides Step forward with one foot until your front knee is bent 90 degrees Lower your back knee toward the floor, while keeping your front knee over your ankle Pause for a few seconds then push back up Repeat with the other leg

Lie on your back on a flat bench, holding a weighted disc or plate in both hands directly over your chest Lower the weight to your chest in a controlled manner Press the weight back up to the start position directly over your chest Maintaining control, squeeze the plate as hard as you can Repeat for the desired number of repetitions

Hold a weight plate in both hands straight out in front of your chest. Press the weight forward, squeezing your chest as you extend your arms. Hold for a moment, then slowly bring the weight back towards your chest. Keep your elbows high throughout the movement. Repeat for the desired number of reps.

Hold the weight plate with both hands against your chest Press the weight from your chest and fully extend your arms Pause for a second at the top and slowly return to the starting position Keep your arms and elbows tight throughout the exercise Breath out when pressing the weight and inhale when returning to the starting position

Sit on the edge of a bench with a weight on your lap Place your hands next to your hips on the bench Move your hips forward off the bench Bend your elbows and lower your hips towards the floor until you achieve a 90-degree angle at your elbows Push back up to the starting position by straightening your elbows

Secure a weight to your body if needed Hold onto the bars of a dip station and lift your body off the ground Slowly lower your body until your elbows are bent to about 90 degrees Push your body back up to the start position, straightening your arms Repeat for desired number of reps

Lay down flat on a bench while holding a weight plate across your upper chest. Keep your lower back pressed down on the bench, and then slowly lift your upper body and twist to the right. Reverse the movement and twist to the left while lowering your upper body back to the bench. Continue the movement, alternating sides after each crunch.

Sit on the edge of the bench, and hold the weights close to your chest Lie back onto the bench while keeping your knees bent Engage your abs and crunch up, at the same time rotate your torso to one side Slowly lower your back down to the bench and repeat the movement on the other side Perform the prescribed amount of repetitions

Begin lying flat on your back holding a weighted pad between your hands, legs extended Simultaneously lift your legs and torso up to form a V shape, passing the pad to your legs Hold this position briefly, then slowly lower your torso and legs back down Repeat the movement, this time passing the weighted pad from your legs back to your hands

Start by laying down flat on your back with a pad in your hand. Lift your upper body off the ground while keeping your lower back planted. Pass the pad from your hands to between your legs, while lifting your legs off the ground. Pass the pad back to your hands, bringing your legs and upper body back down to a flat position. Repeat this process.

Kneel down and hold the wheel roller with both hands Extend your body forward while rolling the wheel away from your body Go as far as you can without touching your body to the floor Pause for a moment then roll the wheel back to the starting position

Start on your knees with the wheel roller in front of you Lean forward and roll the wheel away from you until your body is extended Use your abs to pull the wheel back towards you, returning to the start position Keep your movements slow and controlled Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Stand facing a wall, with the wheel in your hands and your feet shoulder-width apart Bend down and place the wheel on the floor, keeping your arms extended Roll the wheel towards the wall while keeping your back and legs straight Once your chest or the wheel touch the wall, pull back to the starting position Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions

Stand tall with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointed slightly outwards Start lowering yourself by bending your knees and hips, while keeping your chest up Go as low as you can while keeping your heels on the floor Push yourself back to the starting position Repeat this for the desired number of repetitions

Grasp the bar with your hands shoulder-width apart Pull yourself up until your chin is above the bar Pause at the top and squeeze your back muscles Lower yourself down in a controlled manner Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions

Get into a plank position with your elbows directly under your shoulders Spread your feet wider than hip width apart Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels Engage your core and maintain this position Hold this position as long as you can or for a determined time

Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet hip-width apart Press your heels into the floor and lift your hips up Squeeze your glutes at the top of the exercise Hold this position for a few seconds Slowly lower your hips back to the starting position

Lie flat on your back with your feet flat on the ground and knees bent Keeping your upper body relaxed, push through your heels to lift your hips off the ground until your hips, knees and shoulders form a straight line While keeping hips elevated, open your legs as wide as comfortable Bring the legs back together Lower your hips back down to the ground

name_en: Wide Grip Chest Dip on High Parallel Bars
description_en: Mount onto the high parallel bars, keeping a wide grip Lower your body with your elbows flared out to work the chest Push yourself back up to the starting position Repeat the motion for desired amount of repetitions

Position yourself beneath a pull-up bar. Grasp the bar with a wide overhand grip. Bend your elbows and begin to pull yourself upwards until your chin clears the bar. Pause for a moment at the top with your chin over the bar. Lower your body to the start position in a controlled manner. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.

Grab a bar with a grip wider than shoulder width, palms facing away from you Pull your body upwards until your chin is above the bar level Hold the position for a second at the top Slowly lower your body back to the starting position Repeat the process for desired amount of repetitions
Grasp the bar with a wide grip with your palms facing forward Pull up until your chest touches the bar Hold for a second at the top Lower yourself down in a controlled manner Repeat the movement

Stand under a pull-up bar. Grasp the bar with a wide grip Pull your body up until your chest almost touches the bar Hold that position for a second Lower your body back down slowly Repeat the movement

Begin in a traditional push-up position, but spread your hands wider than shoulder width apart Lower your body until your chest almost touches the floor Push your body up returning to the starting position Keep your body straight throughout the exercise Repeat for the desired number of reps

Begin in a high plank position, with hands set approximately twice shoulder-width apart Lower your body until your chest is an inch from the ground Keep your elbows flared out at an angle, not straight back Push your body up and straighten your arms without locking the elbows Keep your body straight throughout the movement

Kneel on the floor with your knees hip-width apart. Slowly lean back while keeping your back straight until you feel a stretch in your quads. Pause for a few seconds at the bottom of the motion. Push your hips forward and squeeze your glutes to return to the starting position. Perform the desired number of repetitions.

Begin lying on your back on the floor with your legs wide apart Raise your torso towards your left leg, trying to touch your elbow to your knee Lower yourself back down in a smooth, controlled motion Repeat the movement for the right leg Alternate between sides for a set duration or number of repetitions

Sit on the floor with your legs wide apart Position your hands behind your head Slowly lean forward bringing your elbow towards the opposite knee Return to starting position in a controlled manner Repeat the action for the other side

Stand straight with your feet hip-width apart Bend your knees and explode into a jump, simultaneously spreading your legs out to the side Try to land back on your feet gently, bending your knees to absorb the shock Immediately go into your next jump, keeping your pace brisk Remember to use your arms for momentum and balance

Start in a plank position with your hands wider than shoulder width apart While keeping your core engaged, tap your right hand to your left shoulder Return your right hand back to its starting position Repeat by tapping your left hand to your right shoulder Continue alternating sides for the duration of the set

Stand facing a wall, extend your arms to your sides forming a 'T' shape Bend your elbows and begin to lean towards the wall Push your body back to the starting position using your chest muscles Ensure to keep your body straight throughout the exercise Repeat this motion for the desired number of repetitions

Get down on your hands and toes with your back straight. Place your hands double shoulder-width apart and keep your arms and legs straight. Lower your chest to the floor while bending your arms. Hold for a while, raise your chest by straightening your arms, and repeat.

name_en: Wide Stance Jump Squat to Narrow Stance Jump Squat
description_en: Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart. Squat down by pushing your hips back and bending your knees. Jump up explosively into the air and bring your feet together while in the air. Land in a narrow stance and immediately lower your body back into the squat position. Jump up again and spread your feet back into the wide stance in mid-air before landing. Repeat this pattern for your desired number of repetitions.

Stand with your legs spread wide, hands extended at shoulder height Turn your body to face your right hand and lift it towards the ceiling Lean down towards your left hand, lowering it towards the floor or the chair Keep your eyes on your right hand as you perform the exercise Return to the upright position and switch sides

Stand with your legs hip-width apart Twist your torso, swinging your arms right, then left As you twist, jump off the ground, turning a complete 180 degrees Land softly and immediately jump and twist in the opposite direction Your upper body and lower body should move as a whole

Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart Jump straight up, bringing your right knee around to the left side of your body When you land, immediately jump again, this time bringing your left knee around to the right side of your body Repeat these movements in a quick, fluid motion Continue for a set amount of time or number of repetitions

Lie down on your back and spread your arms to your sides at shoulder level Raise your thighs perpendicular to the floor and bend your knees at a 90 angle Twist your pelvis and take your knees to one side As you reach near the floor, twist your pelvis to the other side and repeat.

Lie down on your back extending your legs up towards the ceiling Keep your arms out to the side for support Rotate your legs to the right, lowering them towards the ground but not touching it Bring your legs back up to the starting position Rotate your legs to the left, repeating the same action

Lie down flat on your back, with your arms straight out to your sides for balance Raise your legs up towards the ceiling, keeping them bound together at the ankles and knees Start to lower your legs towards one side, maintaining control throughout the movement When you reach the limit of your range of motion, pause, then lift your legs back to the starting position Repeat the movement lowering your legs towards the opposite side

Stand with feet hip-width apart, twist your torso, and swing your arms diagonally to the right as if you're chopping wood Rotate your body to the left, allowing your feet and knees to pivot with the turn Swing your arms up to the left, reaching towards the sky Perform the movement in a smooth and controlled manner, repeating for desired repetitions before switching sides

Begin in a long lunge position with your right foot forward. Place your left hand on the ground and right elbow to right foot. Raise your right hand towards the sky while gazing upwards. Switch to put your right hand outside your foot and straighten your right leg, toes up. Twist your torso to the left, raising your left arm towards the sky. Switch sides and repeat the set.

Stand tall against a wall with your back flat Bend your arms so your elbows and backs of your palms are touching the wall and can form W-shaped pose Hold this position for a few seconds Relax and then repeat

Stand or sit upright with your arm extended out in front of you With your palm facing downwards, gently bend your wrist to your left using your opposite hand Hold for a few seconds Slowly return to the starting position Repeat the stretch for your right hand

Extend your arm in front of your body Clench your fist loosely Rotate your wrist clockwise in a slow, controlled motion Repeat for a set number of repetitions Switch direction, rotating your wrist counter-clockwise for the same number of reps

Extend your arms out in front of you, with palms facing down Slowly rotate your wrists clockwise for the determined number of repetitions Once completed, rotate your wrists counter-clockly for the same number of repetitions Keep your arms still, moving only your wrists

Start in a kneeling position and support your forearms on a bench with palms side up. Grab a barbell with an underhand grip just ahead of the bench. Raise the barbell by curling your wrists towards the forearms. Then lower the barbell by taking your wrists towards the ground, and repeat.

Start in a kneeling position and support your forearms on a bench with palms side up. Grab dumbbells in your hands with an underhand grip just ahead of the bench. Raise the dumbbells by curling your wrists towards the forearms. Then lower the dumbbells by taking your wrists towards the ground, and repeat.

Start by extending your arm in front of you with your palm facing down Bend your wrist, pointing your hand towards the floor With your other hand, gently bend your extended hand further until you feel a slight stretch in your forearm Hold this position for 15-30 seconds Switch hands and repeat

Start in a kneeling position and support your forearms on a bench with palms side down. Grab a barbell with an overhand grip just ahead of the bench. Raise the barbell by extending your wrists towards the forearms. Then lower the barbell by taking your wrists towards the ground, and repeat.

Start in a kneeling position and support your forearms on a bench with palms side down. Grab dumbbells in your hands with an overhand grip just ahead of the bench. Raise the dumbbells by extending your wrists towards the forearms. Then lower the dumbbells by taking your wrists towards the ground, and repeat.

Extend your arm in front of you with your palm down. Bend your wrist, pointing your hand toward the floor. With your other hand, gently bend your wrist further until you feel a mild to moderate stretch in your forearm. Hold your stretch for at least 15 to 30 seconds. Repeat 2 to 4 times.

Sit on a bench or chair, knees together Place your forearms on your thighs with your wrists just beyond the knees and palms facing upwards Lower your hands towards the ground, bending at the wrist You should feel a stretch, hold that for 15-30 seconds Slowly return to the starting position

Extend one arm in front of you, palm facing down Use your opposite hand to gently pull the fingers of your extended hand down towards the floor Hold for 15-30 seconds and then switch hands Repeat the exercise for 2-3 times per side

Start in a kneeling position with your palms flat on the floor, fingers pointed toward your knees Slowly lower your body by bending at the wrist Lower until your forearms touch the floor or as far as you can Push your body back up by extending at the wrist Repeat for desired number of reps

Hold the wrist roller with both hands, extending your arms straight in front of you at shoulder height Roll the weight up to the top by extending and flexing your wrists Hold this position for a second Slowly unroll the weight back to the starting position Repeat for the desired number of reps

name_en: Wrist Ulnar Deviator And Flexor Stretch
description_en: Extend your arm in front of you with your palm facing down Bend your wrist, pointing your hand towards the floor With your other hand, gently bend your wrist further until you feel a mild to moderate stretch in your forearm Hold for at least 15-30 seconds Repeat with the other hand

name_en: Wrist Ulnar Deviator And Flexor Stretch
description_en: Sit comfortably and rest your forearm on your thigh with your palm facing upwards. Bend your wrist so that your fingers are pointing downward. Gently press on the palm of your hand to increase the stretch. Hold this stretch for 20-30 seconds. Repeat the stretch 3 times on each wrist.

Lay flat on your stomach and extend your arms forward (in a Y position) Lift your arms, chest, and legs off the ground Move your arms to a W position, while keeping them lifted Return your arms back to the Y position Lower your arms, chest, and legs to the ground

Start by lying flat on your stomach with your arms outstretched in a 'W' formation. Simultaneously lift your arms, chest, and legs off the floor and hold the 'W' position. Shift arms forward into a 'Y' formation, while maintaining lift off the ground. Return to the starting position, keeping the movement slow and controlled. Repeat the exercise

Place the resistance band around your ankles Stand in a semi-squat position Walk sideways in one direction for your desired steps or distance Change direction and repeat for the other side Maintain the semi-squat position throughout

Start by standing tall with your feet hip-width apart Lift one leg as high as you can while maintaining balance Hold for a second and then slowly lower the leg to start position Now, lift the other leg and repeat Continue to alternate the legs

Sit on the edge of a sturdy chair with the EZ barbell between your ankles. Squeeze the barbell with your ankles, and curl your legs upward. Lower your legs back down slowly in a controlled fashion. Keep your upper body still throughout the movement. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Kneel down on the floor, placing your feet parallel to each other. Gently lower your body onto your heels and sit down. Place your hands on your knees, and keep your head straight. Hold the pose for 30 seconds to a minute. Slowly release and return to the starting position.

Stand up straight while holding a loaded barbell at your flexed elbow level Keep your upper arms close to torso, elbows should be beneath the barbell Begin to walk while maintaining your torso erect Take small steps while making sure you keep the barbell stabilized and your torso stationary Continue for the recommended amount of repetitions or for a certain distance

Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and a resistance band under your feet. Grab the ends of the band with arms sraight and palms facing forward. Pull the band towards the shoulders by bending your arms and as you reach near the shoulders, rotate your palms inward. Then, straighten your arms while turning the palms outward.
